RequirementText: The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (periodic refresh) — functional. Also imposes a timing/performance constraint (every 60 seconds), so Performance applies. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a history report of changes made to the Activity or Event data
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a capability (provide a history report of changes). No non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall provide charts for the Activity or Event actual versus assumed time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (providing charts of actual vs assumed time). No availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall offer the ability to pause and resume the refresh of data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (pause/resume data refresh), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall display the local and exercise time in separate clocks
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a display behavior (show local and exercise time in separate clocks), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (performance, usability, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall filter data by: Venues and Key Events.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (filtering data by Venues and Key Events). No quality/constraint (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall offer a display of all the Events in the exercise.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement to display all Events in the exercise; no quality attributes (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow modification of the display.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow modification of the display), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, or look-and-feel details.

RequirementText: The system shall link Events back to either the Sync Matrix 1.0 or the Exercise Managment Tool 1.0 applications for modifications.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (linking Events to external applications) and implies maintainability (integration for modifications) and portability/compatibility with specific external applications. It does not address availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, legal, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The system shall display data from the Sync Matrix 1.0 and Exercise Management Tool 1.0 applications
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a display function (functional). It also relates to how data is presented, so Look & Feel is implied. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall color code events according to their variance from current time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (color-coding events) and concerns presentation/look-and-feel (visual coding based on time variance). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The bottom 3/4 of the table will hold events that occur according to its relevance to current time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the table should do (place events in bottom 3/4 based on relevance) — functional. Also describes visual/layout placement of content (look & feel). No indication of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The top 1/4 of the table will hold events that are to occur sequentially.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the UI should do (place events sequentially in top quarter) and concerns the table's layout/visual partitioning, so it's functional and look & feel.

RequirementText: The table side of the display shall be split into 2 regions: sequential and temporal.
AI_Rationale: Specifies visual layout of the display (how the table side is split into regions), which is a look-and-feel / UI presentation requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall allow a user to define the time segments
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (allow user to define time segments), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The display shall have two regions: left 2/3 of the display is graphical right 1/3 of the display is a data table
AI_Rationale: Specifies visual layout of the display regions (proportion and content placement), which is a Look & Feel requirement rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The data displayed in both the nodes within the graph and the rows in the table are MSEL Summary data
AI_Rationale: Specifies what data/content must be shown in the graph nodes and table rows (functional content requirement). Does not mention availability, performance, security, UI styling, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The application shall match the color of the schema set forth by Department of Homeland Security
AI_Rationale: Specifies compliance with DHS color schema (legal/standards requirement) and directly concerns the visual appearance of the UI (look & feel). No functional, performance, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: If projected the data must be readable. On a 10x10 projection screen 90% of viewers must be able to read Event / Activity data from a viewing distance of 30
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual readability on a projection screen and refers to viewer ability to read data at a given distance and percentage of viewers. This concerns look-and-feel (visual presentation) and usability (readability/legibility for users). No indication of functional behavior, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: If projected the data must be understandable. On a 10x10 projection screen 90% of viewers must be able to determine that Events or Activities are occuring in current time from a viewing distance of 100
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns how projected data should be presented and perceived (readability/clarity at a distance), which pertains to look-and-feel and usability. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The product shall ensure that it can only be accessed by authorized users. The product will be able to distinguish between authorized and unauthorized users in all access attempts
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that only authorized users may access the product and the system must distinguish authorized vs unauthorized on all access attempts — this is primarily a security requirement (authentication/authorization). It also implies a functional behavior (enforcing access control), so both SE and F are set.

RequirementText: The product shall be available during normal business hours. As long as the user has access to the client PC the system will be available 99% of the time during the first six months of operation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system availability percentage and timeframe (99% during first six months / available during business hours), which is an Availability non-functional requirement. It does not explicitly address fault tolerance, performance, security, or other categories.

RequirementText: The product shall respond fast to keep up-to-date data in the display.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns responsiveness and keeping display data up-to-date, which is a performance (latency/response time) concern. It does not address functionality, availability, scalability, security, usability, or other listed qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall have a MDI form that allows for the viewing of the graph and the data table.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (an MDI form for viewing graph and data table). It does not state availability, performance, security, look-and-feel details, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall display Events in a vertical table by time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (display Events in a vertical table by time). It does not state availability, performance, UI aesthetics beyond basic layout, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall display the Events in a graph by time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (display events in a time-based graph), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention quality attributes like performance, usability, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall display Events or Activities.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall display Events or Activities. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory. 90% of new users shall be able to start the display of Events or Activities within 90 minutes of using the product.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies intuitiveness and a measurable usability goal (90% of new users can start Events/Activities within 90 minutes), which is a clear usability (user experience/learnability) requirement. It does not describe functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall be capable of handling the existing 1000 users. This number is expected to grow 5 times within the next year.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity for current and anticipated user growth (scalability). Also implies performance/throughput requirements to handle that load.

RequirementText: The system shall allow a real estate agent to query MLS information
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allowing a real estate agent to query MLS information), which is functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The product shall be installed by an untrained realtor without recourse to separately-printed instructions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies ease of use/installability by an untrained realtor without printed instructions, which is a usability requirement.

RequirementText: 90% of untrained realtors shall be able to install the product on their device without printed instructions
AI_Rationale: Specifies a usability target: percentage of untrained users able to install without printed instructions. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Only registered realtors shall be able to access the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains who may access the system (access control/authorization), which is a security requirement (authentication/authorization). It does not specify availability, performance, UI, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Every user of the system shall be authenticated and authorized.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates authentication and authorization, which is a security constraint (SE). It also specifies a system behavior (enforcing auth), so it can be treated as functional (F).

RequirementText: The product shall prevent its data from incorrect data being introduced.
AI_Rationale: The requirement focuses on preventing incorrect/malicious data being introduced and protecting data integrity, which is a security concern (input validation/data integrity). It does not specify availability, fault-recovery, functionality details, or usability.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to get driving directions to a selected property
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a specific user capability (getting driving directions), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The realtor shall be able to retrieve a map showing property locations for a specified area
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (realtor can retrieve a map of property locations for a specified area). No non-functional aspects (performance, availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall display clear property images in the search results
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (display property images in search results). Although it concerns image clarity (aesthetic), the example maps this text to Functional only, so labeled as F.

RequirementText: The system shall update or create new property listings in the MLS
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function (create or update property listings in the MLS). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Realtor shall be able to generate a CMA report based on property criteria
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the Realtor must be able to generate a CMA report based on property criteria. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to call the seller or buyer to schedule an appointment
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (making calls to seller or buyer to schedule appointments), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The realtor shall be notified of new client appointments after automatic synchronization with office system
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior (notification after synchronization). No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall notify the realtor when a seller or buyer responds to an appointment request
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (sending notifications to the realtor when a seller or buyer responds to an appointment request), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall allow the user to save the property search results.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (ability for user to save search results). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The product shall be able support 1000 simultaneous users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity for simultaneous users (ability to scale to 1000 users). This is a scalability requirement rather than functional or performance in terms of latency.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to download appointments and contact information for clients
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-capability (download appointments and client contact information), which is functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The product shall be able to support multiple remote users
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies a functional capability (support multiple remote users). It does not quantify concurrency, performance, availability, or other non-functional aspects, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The product is expected to run on Windows CE and Palm operating systems.
AI_Rationale: Specifies target operating systems/platforms, which is a portability requirement.

RequirementText: The product shall retain user preferences in the event of a failure.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (persisting/retaining user preferences during failures). It does not explicitly state availability targets, fault-tolerance mechanisms, recovery guarantees, or usability/security considerations, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: 100% of saved user preferences shall be restored when system comes back online.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (restoring saved user preferences) and implies fault-tolerance/resilience after downtime (restoration upon system coming back online). No explicit availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The look and feel of the system shall conform to the user interface standards of the smart device.
AI_Rationale: Specifies visual/UI conformity to device standards (look and feel). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall have a professional appearance
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly addresses the visual appearance/branding of the system ('professional appearance'), which is a Look & Feel quality attribute. It does not mention functionality, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The product shall have a consistent color scheme and fonts.
AI_Rationale: Specifies visual design elements (color scheme and fonts), which pertains to Look & Feel. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be used by realtors with no training.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that realtors must be able to use the system with no training, which is a usability/learnability requirement. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be intuitive and self explanatory.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns ease of use, learnability and user experience (intuitive, self-explanatory), which is a usability quality. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The product shall be easy for a realtor to learn.
AI_Rationale: Specifies ease of learning for realtors, which is a usability requirement. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall use symbols and words that are naturally understandable by the realtor community.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns choice of symbols/words and terminology for realtor community, addressing user interface language and usability/readability. This maps to Look & Feel and Usability; no functional, security, performance, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The product shall produce search results in an acceptable time
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (produce search results) with a time-related quality constraint indicating performance (acceptable time). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user interface shall have standard menus buttons for navigation
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual/interaction standard for the UI (standard menus/buttons for navigation), which pertains to look & feel. It does not explicitly state usability metrics or functional behavior, so only LF is set.

RequirementText: The product shall generate a CMA report in an acceptable time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies generation of a CMA report (functional) and adds a timing constraint 'in an acceptable time' indicating performance requirement.

RequirementText: The CMA report shall be returned no later 60 seconds after the user has entered the CMA report criteria.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall return a CMA report (functional) with a concrete timing constraint of 60 seconds (performance/non-functional - response time). No mention of availability, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The product shall synchronize contacts and appointments in an acceptable time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (synchronizing contacts and appointments) with a timing/response quality constraint (acceptable time) indicating a performance non-functional requirement.

RequirementText: The product shall synchronize with the office system every hour.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (synchronization) with a timing/quality constraint (every hour) implying performance/timing requirement. No indication of availability, security, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The product shall be available for use 24 hours per day 365 days per year
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies availability (24/7/365). No other quality attributes or functional behavior are stated.

RequirementText: Out of 1000 accesses to the system the system is available 999 times.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system availability rate (999 out of 1000 accesses available). This is an availability (reliability/uptime) requirement, not functional or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The product shall operate in offline mode whenever internet connection is unavailable.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system must continue functioning when internet is unavailable, i.e., graceful degradation/offline resilience — a fault-tolerance requirement. No other quality or functional details are specified.

RequirementText: The search results shall be returned no later 30 seconds after the user has entered the search criteria
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (search results returned) with a quantitative timing constraint (response time <= 30 seconds), so it is both Functional and Performance-related.

RequirementText: The product shall allow the user to view previously downloaded search results CMA reports and appointments.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — allowing users to view previously downloaded search results, CMA reports, and appointments. It does not state any non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall allow a Program Administrator or Nursing staff member to remove a student from a clinical lab section.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow specified roles to remove a student from a clinical lab section), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a student who has registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section for that class.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (who can perform what action: administrators and nursing staff can add a registered student to a clinical lab section), which is a functional requirement. It does not state any non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: A clinical lab section shall include the clinical site name the class instructor day and time of the lab.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what data a clinical lab section must include (clinical site name, instructor, day, time) — a functional requirement describing system behavior/data. No quality/constraint aspects implied.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical lab section for an existing clinical class into the System.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability/operation (Program Administrators and Nursing Staff shall be able to add a new clinical lab section). This is a functional requirement describing system behavior; no non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Clinical site information shall include (but not be limited to) the name of the site contact person and contact information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data content for Clinical site information (what the system should contain) — a functional requirement. No availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical site into the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users shall be able to add a clinical site). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Classes for a given cohort shall not conflict with regards to the time and day that they are offered.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional constraint on scheduling behavior (classes must not conflict in time/day for a cohort). It describes system functionality rather than availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to create a new Program of Study.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/action (creating a Program of Study) for specific user roles; this is a functional requirement. No non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study
AI_Rationale: Specifies user actors' ability to perform a specific action (specify required classes) — this is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) that must be completed.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies the structure/behavior of a Program of Study (its required fields: program name and list of required classes), which is a functional/data requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A clinical class shall specify the course name lecture room requirements clinical site needs lecture instructor needs and clinical lab instructor needs.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying what information a clinical class must include (course name, lecture room requirements, clinical site needs, instructor needs). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: A non-clinical class shall specify the course name lecture room requirements and instructor needs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the system/entity must include (course name, lecture room requirements, instructor needs) — a functional requirement describing data/behavior. No quality attributes like availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: A class shall be either a non-clinical class or a clinical class.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional constraint specifying that each class must be one of two types (non-clinical or clinical). It defines required system behavior/validation rather than an NFR such as performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes for the nursing department into the system.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user capability (administrators and staff can add new classes) — a functional requirement. No quality/constraint (availability, security, performance, etc.) is specified.

RequirementText: The system shall allow a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member to move a student from one clinical lab section to another clinical lab section corresponding to the same clinical class.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-action capability (moving a student between sections), which is functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new cohort to the system identified by start month and year.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (adding a cohort with start month and year), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts of all programs for Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members92 planning purposes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: displaying a report for program administrators/nursing staff. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to cancel a clinical lab section only if there are no students registered for that clinical lab section.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (who can cancel a lab section and the condition under which cancellation is allowed). This is a functional requirement; no non-functional qualities are implied.

RequirementText: The system will notify affected parties for routine communication purposes including but not limited to informing students of upcoming offered classes (timeline) and what their schedule will be/shall be.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a notification function (informing students of upcoming classes and schedules). This is a functional behavior and does not explicitly address any non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: A staff member shall have the ability to manage the progress of a part time student which includes modifying their sequence of classes and timeline of classes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a system capability (staff managing part-time student progress, modifying class sequences and timelines), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional capability (users shall be able to add classes/sections). No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Nursing Student including student ID student name phone number e-mail status (full time or part time) and program of study.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an action the system must provide (modify student information) — a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Lab Section including the clinical site name the department/section for the lab the class instructor day and time of lab and contact information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: administrators/staff can modify clinical lab section information. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Site including the clinical site name site contact person contact information and address.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that certain users shall have the ability to modify clinical site information — this describes a system function (who can do what). No non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Program of Study within the Nursing Department including the Program of study name and required classes for that Program of Study.
AI_Rationale: Specifies actions users (Program Administrators/Nursing Staff) must be able to perform (modify program name and required classes). This describes functional behavior; it does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to cohorts including cohort identifier program of study preferred sequence of classes and quarters that a cohort will be taking specific classes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (users shall be able to modify cohort information). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting specific students including but not limited to changing a student92s status from full time to part time and moving a student to a different clinical section.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (notify affected parties when student-related changes occur), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort92s program of study and changes to a given week92s schedule (lab cancelled this week due to instructor illness).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (notify affected parties when cohort-related changes occur). This is a functional requirement; it does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting classes including but not limited to class cancellations class section detail changes and changes to class offerings for a given quarter.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (notify affected parties of class-related changes). No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting clinicals including but not limited to clinical section capacity changes and clinical section cancellations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior: notifying affected parties when clinical-related changes occur. It does not state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system will use the stored e-mail addresses as a primary means of communicating information to affected parties.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (using stored e-mail addresses to communicate to affected parties), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, security, performance, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall contain contact information (e-mail and phone number) for all people relevant to the system including (but not limited to) staff members students lecture instructors clinical lab instructors and clinical site administrators.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system shall store/display contact information for relevant people. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a printable summary of the system log.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (display a printable summary of the system log), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students which will include (but not be limited to) student name student ID admission date classes credits GPA and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability to display a printable summary with specific data fields for individual students — a clear functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical labs which will include (but not be limited to) class name class number lab section listing of students enrolled instructor day(s) time and location.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: displaying a printable summary of individual clinical labs with specific content (class name, number, section, students, instructor, schedule, location). It does not state non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical sites which will include information on labs being held at that site for the given quarter (Clinical site general information on labs held at that location dates and times of all labs held there).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: displaying a printable summary with site and lab information. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual cohorts which will include the students enlisted the Program of study sequence of classes cohort progress through the program and timeline of completion.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to display a printable summary of cohorts and their details — a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member shall be able to add a new nursing student to the system.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying an action the user roles must be able to perform (adding a new nursing student). No non-functional aspects (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes to a sequence of classes
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users shall be able to add new classes). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The report of needed classes shall include (but not be limited to) classes to be offered number of sections needed number of labs needed and room types needed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies content of a report (what the system should include) — a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a given cohort.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a capability the system must provide (users can specify preferred sequence of classes), which is functional in nature; it does not specify non-functional qualities like performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall able to operate within a business office environment typical of the Nursing Department at DePaul University.
AI_Rationale: Specifies operational context/environment (business office environment for Nursing Department), which pertains to operability/administration rather than functionality or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall be expected to manage the nursing program curriculum and class/clinical scheduling for a minimum of 5 years.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (manage curriculum and scheduling) and a durability/scale timeframe (operate/manage for at least 5 years), implying scalability/lifespan concerns. It does not mention availability, security, usability, maintainability, portability, performance, legal, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of processing 100% of nursing students and their classes for the next 10 years.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies capacity over time (ability to process all students and classes for the next 10 years), which is a scalability requirement. It does not explicitly state performance metrics (latency/throughput), availability, security, or functional behavior beyond capacity.

RequirementText: The system shall cater to 10 simultaneous users from 9am to 5pm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the number of simultaneous users during a time window — relates to system availability (operational hours/uptime for users) and scalability/capacity to support concurrent users.

RequirementText: system shall be able to handle all of the user requests/usage during business hours.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies availability during business hours and ability to handle all user requests (scalability/capacity). No mention of other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall achieve 95% up time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a target uptime percentage (availability requirement).

RequirementText: The system shall be available for use between the hours of 8am and 6pm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system availability hours (uptime window), which is an availability requirement.

RequirementText: The response time of general student management tasks shall take no longer than 5 seconds and the response time of schedule generation shall take no longer than 30 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maximum allowable response times for tasks (5s and 30s), which are performance-related constraints (latency). No functional behavior, security, availability, scalability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Staff members shall be able to complete a set of tasks in a timely manner.
AI_Rationale: Specifies timely completion of tasks (performance/response time requirement) rather than a functional action or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: The verbiage used within the system shall be consistent with Standard English and the terminology of the national Nursing Community.
AI_Rationale: Specifies terminology and wording/voice for UI/content (look-and-feel) and impacts usability/readability for users (nursing community); no functional, security, or other quality requirements.

RequirementText: For each class within a sequence for a cohort Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a capability (ability for administrators and staff to specify the quarter a class is offered), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: 2 out of 3 Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall successfully be able to use the system to manage the scheduling of classes and clinicals.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that Program Administrators/Nursing Staff must be able to manage scheduling (functional) with a usability success criterion (2 of 3 users able to use the system), implying usability requirement rather than performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be intuitive to the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system should be intuitive for specific user roles, which directly pertains to usability (ease of use, learnability). It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The number of mistakes noted by the students shall be decreased by 50% in the first year.
AI_Rationale: The requirement targets reducing the number of mistakes noted by students (a reduction in user errors), which relates to usability (ease of use and error reduction). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: The system shall help the user avoid making mistakes while scheduling classes and clinicals for the nursing students.
AI_Rationale: The statement concerns preventing user errors during scheduling, which targets ease of use/error prevention and user experience (usability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: All of the users shall be able to use the system after one day of training.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies ease of use/learnability—users can use the system after one day of training, which is a usability (learnability) criterion. It does not specify functional behavior or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The system shall be easy to use by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states ease of use for administrators/nursing staff, which is a usability concern. It does not mention functionality, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be used within the specifications defined by the computers used by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
AI_Rationale: Requirement constrains the system to operate within the specifications of administrators' computers, which pertains to operability/operational environment. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall operate within the Windows XP Professional operating system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operating environment (must run under Windows XP Professional), which concerns operational/deployment constraints and manageability. This maps to Operability rather than a functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall use symbols and words that are naturally understandable by the user community.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns use of understandable symbols/words — pertains to look & feel and usability (readability, clarity for users). No availability, security, performance, or functional behavior implied.

RequirementText: The system shall interface with the faculty central server.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an interface/integration with another system (faculty central server), which pertains to system operability/administration (interfaces). It does not mention functional behavior details, performance, availability, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall interface with CampusConnect92s central server
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies an interface/integration with a central server, which concerns system operability/administration (external system interaction). No availability, performance, security, or functional behavior details are given.

RequirementText: Students added to a cohort shall be eligible for the cohort92s Program of Study.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional rule/behavior: students added to a cohort must be eligible for that cohort's Program of Study. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a single student to a cohort
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (who can perform the action and what action: add a single student to a cohort). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a listing of students to a cohort.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying actors and an action (adding student listings to a cohort). It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall use the organization92s standard virus protection software to help monitor threats to itself.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of antivirus software to monitor threats, which is a security control (confidentiality/integrity/threat protection). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be built such that it is as secure as possible from malicious interference.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns protecting the system from malicious interference, which is a security constraint. It does not specify functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall protect private information in accordance with the organization92s information policy.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates protecting private information (a functional behavior) specifically in accordance with the organization's information policy (legal/compliance). It also implies security controls to protect confidentiality, integrity (security). No mention of availability, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall have basic data integrity checking to reduce the possibility of incorrect or invalid data being introduced.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies enforcing data integrity (prevent invalid/incorrect data), which is a functional behavior and a security-related constraint (data integrity). No mention of maintenance, performance, availability, etc.

RequirementText: A cohort shall be associated to one Program of Study offered by the department.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement describing a relationship/constraint between domain entities (cohort and Program of Study). No quality, performance, security, or other NFR aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: Only authorized users shall have access to the portion of the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly restricts access to authorized users, which is an access control/security requirement. It does not state functional behavior beyond access, nor availability, performance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Dr Susan Poslusny and Dr Julie Donalek are the only people who shall have access to students92 personal information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access restriction to personal information (authorization/confidentiality). This is a security requirement about who may access data; no functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Only authorized users shall have access to students92 personal information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access restriction to students' personal information (authentication/authorization) — a security requirement. No mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members are the only people who shall have access to clinical site details.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control (who is allowed to view clinical site details) which is a security requirement (authorization). No functional behavior beyond access restriction and no other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: Only authorized users shall have access to clinical site information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies restriction of access to authorized users — an access control/security requirement. No functional behavior, availability, performance, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: We must be able to interface with any HTML browser.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns the system's ability to operate with any HTML browser — an operability/compatibility concern for administration/operation. It does not specify UI look-and-feel, performance, portability, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: Fit Criterion: Dr Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol are the only people who shall have access to the final class section scheduling for the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
AI_Rationale: Specifies restricted access for specific named individuals to scheduling data—an access control/security requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall interface with the student master server.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an interface/integration with another system (student master server), which concerns operability/administration. It does not state functional behavior details, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: All actions that modify an existing dispute case must be recorded in the case history.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (recording modifications) and implies maintainability/auditability (history for auditing) and legal/compliance concerns; it does not mention availability, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request. As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request. The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional behavior: allowing users to create/initiate a ticket retrieval request and prompting for required information, and describes the ticket retrieval document. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (initiate a single dispute case for multiple transactions of one merchant). No quality/constraint (availability, performance, security, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes specific system behavior (select disputable transactions via UI and initiate disputes), which is a functional capability. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall provide update access capability for authorized users of the application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an update access capability (functional) and restricts it to authorized users (security - access control). No mention of availability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must prevent users from accessing any dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control restricting users to only their cardholder disputes, which is a security (authorization) requirement rather than a functional or other non-functional concern.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide different levels of access with regard to disputes case initiation and follow-up actions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies provision of different access levels (authorization) for dispute initiation and follow-up — this is a security (access control) requirement rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement emphasizes real-time responses (performance/latency) and implies the system must handle load to provide real-time interaction (scalability). The statement describes data entry via UI but is framed as quality constraints rather than specific functional behavior.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies accessibility by internal and external users (availability/accessible requirement). Implies access control/authentication considerations for different user types, so security is relevant. No mention of performance, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (must allow user to create three types of ticket retrieval requests) — a clear functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall provide view access capability for authorized users of the application.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access for authorized users (authorization/access control), which is a security concern. It does not state availability, performance, UI look-and-feel, or maintenance aspects.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must prevent external users from requesting original receipts. Requests for original receipts are restricted to internal users.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a behavior the system must enforce (restrict receipt requests to internal users) which is functional, and it defines an access control constraint (who may request originals), which is a security concern (authorization). No other NFRs are implied.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (view activity history of a dispute case), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request. The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: allow user to create/initiate chargeback, prompt for info, and produce/send printed notification. No non-functional quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information; the dispute case number the type of chargeback requested (pending or immediate) and the date that the merchant response is due.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system behavior: providing a confirmation with specific fields upon creation of a chargeback request. This is a functional requirement; it does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (prevent duplicate dispute requests). The absolute '100% of the time' phrasing implies a contractual/legal constraint (L). It also impacts maintainability (MN) because ensuring and proving perfect prevention typically requires design/maintenance considerations. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, operability, look-and-feel, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (providing a list of reason codes derived from business rules) → Functional. It references business rules and industry/merchant regulations, implying legal/compliance considerations → Legal. The dependency on business rules and derivation logic suggests concerns about rule definition/maintenance and traceability → Maintainability. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, portability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide the ability to view existing dispute cases.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (ability to view existing dispute cases). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide Search functionality. The search method must include the ability to search by (1) the dispute case number (2) the merchant account number (3) the cardmember account number and (4) the issuer number. In addition to the above criteria the search functionality must further allow the user to limit the results of the search by a date range the type of dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) the case status (open closed or all) and the dispute reason code.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system behavior — search functionality and allowed search/filter criteria — which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: A list of all disputes cases that meet the entered search criteria must be provided to the user. The list of cases must differentiate the type and/or status of the case by color -coding the line item in the list. For example all open cases will be yellow and all closed cases will be gray.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (provide list of cases matching search) and a UI presentation requirement (color-coding by status), which maps to Look & Feel.

RequirementText: The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capability (follow-up actions and filtering) => Functional. Filtering by access level implies access control/authorization concerns => Security.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: record user and date for activities and maintain detailed activity history for auditing — a functional requirement (audit-trail feature). No explicit non-functional quality constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: For any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a case such as the disputes aging process a case activity will be generated. Upon the next logon the user that initiated the dispute case must be notified that a systematic action has occurred on the dispute case.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: generate case activity for system actions and notify the initiating user on next logon. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: All letter requests must be formatted according to guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a mandatory formatting behavior for letter requests (functional). It refers to adherence to specified guidelines (treated as legal/regulated constraint) and concerns the look-and-feel/format of letters, so Look & Feel is applicable.

RequirementText: Any disputes cases that have been closed for over 6 months must be purged from the online disputes database.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (purge records older than 6 months) — a functional requirement describing required behavior. No explicit availability, security, legal, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the system must provide a confirmation containing specific information upon creation of a ticket retrieval request. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The Disputes application must maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case. This ensures a complete audit trail if questions arise later on with regard to a particular dispute case.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must maintain a detailed history/audit trail (functional capability) and implies compliance/auditability concerns (legal/regulatory). No explicit non-functional attributes like availability, security, performance, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance with the Merchant Operating Regulations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates compliance with Merchant Operating Regulations, which is a legal/regulatory constraint. It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Disputes application must conform to the legal requirements as specified by Regulation E and Regulation Z that govern credit card disputes processing.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates conformance to legal regulations (Regulation E and Z). This is a legal/compliance non-functional requirement; no other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance to the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates compliance with Regulation E and Regulation Z, which are legal/regulatory constraints. It does not specify functional behavior, quality attributes like performance, security, usability, or maintainability.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall comply with the corporate standards for user interface creation for internally and externally used applications.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates compliance with corporate UI standards—this is a legal/policy compliance constraint (L) and directly concerns look-and-feel/UI presentation (LF). No functional or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: All screens created as part of the Disputes application must comply with corporate standards for interface creation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies compliance with corporate interface standards — a legal/policy constraint and concerns look-and-feel of UI; no functional behavior or other quality attributes implied.

RequirementText: The list of dispute cases that are displayed after a search is performed must be color coded for easy identification of dispute cases based upon the dispute case status.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a visual presentation (color-coding) for easy identification based on status, which is a look-and-feel/UI requirement. It does not impose functional behavior, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: 100% of the cardmember and merchant services representatives shall use the Disputes application regularly after a 2-day training course.
AI_Rationale: Specifies target user adoption/regular use after training (usability/learnability) and a 100% adoption goal which implies scalability/ability to support all users. No functional, security, performance, etc., requirements stated.

RequirementText: 100% of merchant services representatives shall be able to successfully perform a follow up action on a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
AI_Rationale: Specifies usability/learnability goal (users able to perform task after training) and relates to scalability of user onboarding/adoption; no functional, security, performance, etc., requirements specified.

RequirementText: The maximum wait time for a user navigating from one screen to another within the Disputes application shall be no more than 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum response/transition time (5 seconds) for navigating between screens, which is a performance requirement. No mention of availability, usability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall support 350 concurrent users without any degradation of performance in the application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for 350 concurrent users without performance degradation—this is a performance requirement (throughput/response) and implies scalability. No indication of security, availability, functional behavior, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall be available 24x7x365 with the exception of the following scheduled maintenance windows. Monday 96 Saturday 3:00am to 4:00am EST Sunday 1:00amd to 5:00am EST
AI_Rationale: Specifies system availability (24x7x365 with scheduled maintenance windows) — clearly an Availability requirement. Also relates to operability/administration because it defines maintenance windows and operational uptime expectations. No other quality attributes or functional behavior are stated.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall interface with the Statement Database. The Statement Database provides the transaction details to the Disputes System. All transaction details must be obtained from the Statement Database
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the Disputes application must interface with the Statement Database and obtain transaction details—a statement about system integration/operation and data sourcing. This matches Operability (O). It does not explicitly state functional behaviors beyond interfacing, nor quality attributes like performance, security, etc., so other labels are set to 0.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Information Database. The Cardmember Information Database provides detailed information with regard to a cardmember. All cardmember detail information must be obtained from the Cardmember Information Database.
AI_Rationale: Requires the Disputes application to interface with an external Cardmember Information Database and obtain all cardmember details—this is an operational/integration requirement about system interactions and data sources, so it maps to Operability.

RequirementText: The Disputes applications shall interface with the Merchant Information Database. The Merchant Information Database provides detailed information with regard to the merchant. All merchant detail information shall be obtained from the Merchant Information Database.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the Disputes application must interface with and obtain merchant details from the Merchant Information Database — an operational/integration requirement (operability). No performance, security, legal, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: 100% of cardmember services representatives shall be able to successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a usability requirement (all reps must successfully perform a task after training) and a measurable target across the representative population (100% across users), which maps to usability and scalability-related quality goals as in provided examples.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System. This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant92s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the Disputes application must interface/send adjustment requests to another system (integration/operability requirement). Matches provided examples labeled as Operability; no explicit performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes stated.

RequirementText: The Disputes application must conform to the legal requirements as specified by the Merchant Operating Regulations.
AI_Rationale: Statement explicitly requires conformance to legal requirements (Merchant Operating Regulations), which maps directly to Legal. No other quality attributes or functional behaviors are specified.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall interface with the Letters application. This will allow the Disputes application to request letters as part of the dispute initiation and dispute follow up process. All letter requests must be sent to the Print Letter Utility application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies integration and routing behavior between systems (Disputes -> Letters -> Print Letter Utility). This is an operational/administrative requirement about system interconnection and message routing, matching 'Operability'. No explicit performance, security, legal, UI, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: All updates to data files or database must be initiated from the Disputes System.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a constraint on how updates must occur (system behavior) and restricts direct access to data/files, which is a security control. No indication of availability, performance, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall manipulate and view business data. Users will not have direct access to data files or databases.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (manipulate and view business data) and explicitly restricts direct access to data files/databases, which is a security control (access control). No mention of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: If a user account is revoked it can only be re-instantiated by the System Administrator.
AI_Rationale: This requirement restricts who may re-instantiate revoked accounts (administrative permission), which is an access control/security constraint. It does not specify functional behavior beyond security, nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Only the System Administrator shall be able to reset a revoked user logon account
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an access-control constraint (only System Administrator may perform reset), which is a security property (authorization). No explicit functional behavior beyond access constraint or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall generate a User Report that details any new users that have been added and any changes to an existing user92s access level. The report will be reviewed for auditing purposes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior — generating a User Report of new users and access-level changes for auditing — which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: All authorized users once authenticated must be able to logon to the Disputes System
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control behavior (authorized users must be able to log on once authenticated), which is a security (SE) requirement concerning authentication/authorization. It does not specify functional features beyond access, nor availability, performance, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall ensure that only authorized users are allowed to logon to the application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that only authorized users may log on — an authentication/authorization requirement, i.e., a security constraint. No other quality attributes or functional behaviors are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: Only users with Update access must be able to initiate dispute requests.
AI_Rationale: Defines who can perform a functional action (initiate dispute requests) and enforces access control (authorization), so it's both functional and security-related.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (restricting initiation of dispute requests to users with appropriate access level), which is a security (authorization) concern. No functional behavior beyond access restriction or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: All additions of new users and modifications to user92s access shall be recorded on the User Report.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional behavior: recording additions and modifications of users in a report. It does not explicitly specify availability, security, performance, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The estimator shall apply selected recycled parts to the collision estimate.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the estimator applying selected recycled parts to the collision estimate. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using a list of preferred parts suppliers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the estimator shall search for recycled parts using a list of preferred suppliers. No quality/constraint aspects (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The available recycled parts information and their suppliers shall be returned to the user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (returning recycled parts information and suppliers to the user). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall retain the available recycled parts and suppliers returned from the search.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (retain the available recycled parts and suppliers returned from the search), which is functional. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The estimator shall search by zipcode with a radius of 30 miles if no parts are found for the preferred parts suppliers
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior/feature (search by zipcode within 30 miles when preferred suppliers return no parts). This is a functional requirement; no non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall search for available recycled parts for the supplied vehicle parts and suppliers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (search for available recycled parts given vehicle parts and suppliers). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using damaged vehicle parts information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the estimator shall perform a search for recycled parts using damaged vehicle parts information. No quality, security, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The search radius shall be between 1 and 30 miles
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint on the search feature (allowed range for the search radius). No availability, performance, security, usability or other non-functional aspects are implied.

RequirementText: The preferred repair facility shall be returned to the user.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional behavior: the system should return the preferred repair facility to the user. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes.
