AI_Rationale: Specifies an administrative function (functional). Includes a time constraint 'in under 1 minute' (performance). States customer will no longer access the website (access control, security).

RequirementText: System shall let customers cancel their account process shall take no longer than 2 minutes. Database will mark the account as inactive and user will not be able to log into the website.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a functional capability (account cancellation and marking inactive). It imposes a time bound (<=2 minutes) so performance. Preventing login after cancellation implies access control/security. It's user-facing with a time constraint, affecting usability.

RequirementText: System shall let existing customers log into the website with their email address and password in under 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action (login) => Functional. Includes a time constraint 'under 5 seconds' => Performance. Implies usability requirement (fast, responsive login) => Usability. No explicit security, availability, scalability, or other NFRs mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall let customers register on the website as a 93unlimited movie subscriber94 user in under 10 minutes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (user registration) and a time constraint (performance) affecting usability (learnability/speed). No other qualities (security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall let customers register on the website as a 93pay as you go94 user in under 5 minutes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (customer registration) and includes a time constraint (under 5 minutes) implying performance. The time-bound also relates to usability (ease/speed of completing registration). No indication of availability, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to check the status of their prepaid card by entering in the PIN number in under 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (customer checks prepaid card status) and includes an explicit performance constraint ('in under 5 seconds') and an implied usability goal (quick, responsive interaction). No availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, fault-tolerance, operability, or look-and-feel concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to activate a pre-paid card via the Administration section in under 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (administrator activates pre-paid card) with a quantitative time constraint (performance) and implies usability (operation should be quick/easy). No indication of security, availability, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall let the administrator add/remove categories on the website in under 5 minutes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an administrative function (add/remove categories) => Functional. Adds a time constraint ('in under 5 minutes') implying performance/usability goals, so Performance and Usability labeled. No mention of availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The product shall use symbols and words that are naturally understandable by users familiar with websites
AI_Rationale: Specifies the use of familiar symbols/words — concerns interface look & feel and usability (readability, learnability) for web-experienced users; no functional, performance, security, etc. requirements implied.

RequirementText: Users should be able to access their streaming movies in under 2 clicks after logging into the website.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (users can access streaming movies) plus UI/look-and-feel constraint (access within 2 clicks) and usability requirement (ease of access). No availability, performance (time/throughput), security, or other NFRs implied.

RequirementText: Any interface between a user and the automated system shall have a maximum response time of 5 seconds unless noted by an exception below.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum response time requirement (performance). Also labeled as fault-tolerance in similar examples, implying requirement for graceful handling/recovery when response times approach limits.

RequirementText: Movies shall be encoded and streamed via Windows Media Player 9.0.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the operational requirement to encode/stream using a particular player (Windows Media Player 9.0), which concerns system operability/compatibility rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Website must be fully operational with MSN TV2.
AI_Rationale: Specifies operability/compatibility requirement for the website to be operational with MSN TV2 (administration/operation/compatibility concern), not a functional behavior or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Website must interface with the CyberSource API to process credit card transactions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies interfacing with an external payment API (integration/operability concern). It does not state performance, security, availability, or other quality constraints, so only Operability is marked (matches provided similar example).

RequirementText: We must be able to interface with the following browsers: IE 5.X 6.0 Netscape 6.x 7.x 8.x and Firefox 1.0.
AI_Rationale: Specifies which browsers the system must interface with—concerns operability/compatibility in deployment/operation. Does not state performance, security, portability explicitly, nor UI look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The same hardware supporting the current website will be used to support the new system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies deployment on existing hardware — concerns system operation/administration (operability) and implies portability/compatibility with current hardware environment. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The website will use standard Internet conventions when interacting with the user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies using standard Internet conventions for user interaction, which pertains to look-and-feel and usability (familiar navigation and interaction patterns). No functional, performance, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The product shall be expected to operate within the maximum maintenance budget for a minimum of 2 years.
AI_Rationale: Specifies operating within a maintenance budget for a specified duration, which pertains to maintainability and operability (manageability/ongoing support). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The website shall be capable of supporting 100 000 customers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity to support 100,000 customers, which is a scalability requirement (ability to grow/handle large user base). No functional behavior, performance metrics, availability, or other quality attributes are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: The server will support a maximum of 1 000 simultaneous users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity in terms of maximum simultaneous users, which relates to scalability (system's ability to handle load). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The streaming server will support a maximum of 700 movies; new servers can be added to support more movies.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity limit and ability to add servers to increase capacity — directly concerns scalability. Also implies maintainability/operational growth (adding servers), matching provided example mapping.

RequirementText: All aspects of the website shall be accessed by a web browser over the Internet.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system is to be accessed (via web browser over the Internet), which concerns operation/administration and deployment/access modality. Does not state performance, security, portability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The website shall continue to operate if the payment gateway goes down.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies continued operation despite payment gateway failure — concerns availability and fault tolerance (graceful degradation/recovery). No functional details or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The website shall continue to operate if the streaming server goes down.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the site must continue operating despite the streaming server failing — this is about availability and graceful handling of a fault (fault tolerance). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: All movies shall be streamed on demand at any time of the day.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capability (stream movies on demand) and implies availability at any time of day (uptime/availability). No mention of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The website shall achieve 99.5% up time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required uptime percentage (availability requirement).

RequirementText: The website shall be available for use 24 hours per day 365 days per year.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required uptime/availability (24/7/365). Does not mention functionality, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: All credit card information will be secured on the server and only accessible by authorized Izogn administrators. Information will be encrypted in the database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies securing credit card information, encryption in the database, and access restricted to authorized administrators — these are security controls (confidentiality, access control, encryption). It does not state availability, fault tolerance, legal, usability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operational/functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: While streaming a movie buffering should only occur if there is latency in the user92s connection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains buffering behavior relative to network latency (latency/response time), which is a performance/quality attribute. It does not specify functional behavior, availability, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: When streaming a movie the buffering time should take no longer than 10 seconds (plus any latency on the user92s connection.)
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative bound on buffering/response time for streaming, which is a performance requirement (latency/response time). No functional behavior or other quality aspects are specified.

RequirementText: When purchasing a streaming movie or pre-paid card via credit card the processing time should have a maximum response time of 15 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum response time (15s) for credit card processing during purchase, which is a performance requirement. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: The streaming server will support 50 simultaneous streaming connections.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concurrent-connection capacity (50 simultaneous streaming connections), which is a scalability requirement about handling load; does not specify functional behavior beyond capacity or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: If the leads score falls within the medium average then it will be set for manual verification by an Enrollment Coordinator through the eleads system.
AI_Rationale: Describes a specific system behavior/processing rule: leads with medium score are routed for manual verification by an Enrollment Coordinator via the eleads system. This is a functional requirement; no non-functional qualities are specified.

RequirementText: If the leads score falls within the low average then it will be returned to the supplying vendor
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional behavior: when a lead score is in the low average range, the system returns it to the supplying vendor. No quality/constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality will compile both contact and academic scoring information for a total score.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a specific system behavior: compiling contact and academic scoring into a total score, which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality will use the parameters supplied by corporate and schools to score part of the lead.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior: leads washing uses supplied parameters to score leads. No non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality will return the lead data supplied to the vendor along with the reason of rejection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies behavior of the leads washing functionality (what it should return: lead data and reason for rejection). No quality attributes like performance, security, availability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality shall receive a period list of available reps from the enterprise system.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior: the leads washing component shall receive a periodic list of available reps from the enterprise system. No non-functional quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality will verify the users authentication and rights to make parameter updates.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a functionality ('leads washing functionality will verify...') so it's functional. It explicitly refers to verifying user authentication and rights (authentication/authorization), which is a security requirement.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality will store any potential lead duplicates returned by the enterprise system.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior: leads washing functionality will store potential lead duplicates. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: Prior to submitting the lead to the enterprise system the leads washing functionality will assign the lead to an admissions rep.
AI_Rationale: Describes a specific system behavior (assigning a lead to an admissions rep prior to submission) — a clear functional requirement; no quality/constraint aspects implied.

RequirementText: If the leads score falls within the high average score then it will be process by the ARA functionality.
AI_Rationale: Describes conditional system behavior (routing leads to ARA functionality) — a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality will have an interface in which lead data parameters can be maintained.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (an interface to maintain lead data parameters). It does not state availability, non-functional quality, UI aesthetics, security, or other NFRs explicitly.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality will insert all leads captured by the web service.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior: leads washing will insert all leads captured by the web service. No non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: No lead evaluation will complete in a time period longer than 25 seconds for 97% of all leads processed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a performance SLA: response time limit (≤25s) for 97% of leads, which indicates Performance. It also implies an availability/reliability requirement (uptime/meeting SLA), so Availability is applicable. No functional behavior, security, scalability, or other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: If a lead is scored to the high range the system will supply the lead data and score to the enterprise system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: when a lead is high-scored, the system must send lead data and score to an enterprise system. No non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Vendor will submit a credit validation record to be applied to the enterprise billing system.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies an action the system/vendor must perform (submission of a credit validation record to be applied to the billing system), i.e., functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, operability, legal, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The vendor will verify the invalid lead.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing an action the vendor must perform (verify invalid lead). It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Washing parameters will be updated during scheduled maintenance hours.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maintenance scheduling for updating washing parameters, which relates to maintainability (when updates occur). No functional behavior, availability metrics, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Defect reports will be available to technical units on a 24x7 basis.
AI_Rationale: Specifies availability of defect reports 24x7 (availability). Implies need for continuous access and likely fault-tolerance/mechanisms to ensure uptime, but no functional behavior or other quality aspects.

RequirementText: The washing process must use a non binding neutral data format such as xml when receiving and processing lead data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates use of a neutral, non-binding data format (e.g., XML) for receiving/processing lead data. This concerns interoperability/operability of the system (data exchange and integration), not a functional behavior or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The lead washing process will operate within the established physical web service structure.
AI_Rationale: Statement refers to operating within an established physical web service structure, which concerns operability/administration rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The process must fit within the processing time conditions set forth by the Auto Rep Assignment process in which a lead is assigned within 3 minutes of the total life cycle.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a time constraint (lead assigned within 3 minutes) which is a performance/response-time requirement. No functional behavior beyond timing, and no other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: For leads that process longer than 25 seconds the system will record the event and duration
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (recording events and durations when lead processing exceeds 25s), which is functional. It does not set availability, performance, security, or other quality targets.

RequirementText: Total lead cycle time must be completed in 5 minutes for 90% of lead volume between the business hours of 8AM CST to 8PM CST; then 3 minutes for 99% of lead volume during off business hours.
AI_Rationale: Specifies timing/throughput targets for lead cycle completion (performance). Also references business vs off hours window, implying availability constraints during those periods, so labeled as Availability as in similar example.

RequirementText: The leads washing functionality will validate all leads received by the web service for valid data
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (leads washing functionality validating leads for valid data). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: For each shot the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (marking shots as hit or miss on a player's defensive grid). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: For each shot the product shall notify the players whether the shot was a hit or miss.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the system shall notify players for each shot whether it was a hit or miss. No non-functional aspects (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: For each shot the product shall examine the defensive grid of the defensive player to determine whether the shot was a hit or miss.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a specific system behavior (examining the defensive grid and determining hit or miss), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: For each turn the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allowing the offensive player to define a shot each turn). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The product shall prevent the player from overlapping ships on their grid.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior constraint (prevent overlapping ships on the player's grid). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or any other non-functional aspect.

RequirementText: The product shall maintain the status of each player for a turn either offensive or defensive.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must perform (maintain each player's status as offensive or defensive per turn), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: For each turn the product shall identify one player as offensive status and one player as defensive status.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (assigning offensive/defensive status each turn). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: When both players have positioned their 5 ships on their defensive grids the product shall define the status of each player for the first turn.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (defining player status for the first turn) and does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: For each shot the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the offensive grid of the offensive player.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional behavior (marking each shot as hit or miss on the offensive grid). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The product shall allow the player to position ships diagonally on their grid
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (allow player to position ships diagonally) describing system behavior, which is a functional requirement. No non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: At the start of each turn the product shall notify each player of his or her status.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying behavior: at start of each turn the system shall notify each player of their status. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall notify the players that the ship was sunk.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior (notify players when a ship is sunk), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI appearance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: If the shot was marked as a miss the product shall change the status of the offensive player to defensive
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (change player status when a shot is marked miss), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall indicate the type of ship sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a specific system behavior (displaying the type of ship sunk on the defensive player's defensive grid) — a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, legal, UI look-and-feel beyond content, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, security, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the offensive grid of the offensive player.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (marking a ship as sunk on the offensive player's grid) with no non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: If the shot was marked as a hit the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: when a shot is marked as hit, the system shall allow the offensive player to define a shot. No quality/non-functional aspects implied.

RequirementText: If the shot was marked as a miss the product shall change the status of the defensive player to offensive
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (change player status based on shot result). This is a functional requirement; no non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall continue to assign turns until the game is ended.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the system must continue assigning turns until the game ends. No quality, performance, security, or other NFR aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall end a game when a hit by the offensive player results in sinking the last of the defensive player92s ships which had not been previously marked as sunk.
AI_Rationale: Specifies gameplay behavior (when to end the game) — a clear functional requirement. No non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall allow a player to end a game at any time during the game.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability/action the system must provide (allow a player to end a game at any time), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When a game is ended the product shall notify the players that the game is ended.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the system shall notify players when a game ends). It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The notification of the game ending will include the reason the game is ended (i.e. a player has won the game or a player has ended the game).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a behavior of the system (notification content) — a functional requirement. No quality/security/availability/etc. aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: When a game is ended the product shall allow each player to remove himself or herself from the list of players.
AI_Rationale: This describes a specific system behavior (allow players to remove themselves from the player list when a game ends), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes like performance, security, availability, etc., are specified.

RequirementText: The product shall allow the player to position ships vertically on their grid.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a game capability (allow player to position ships vertically) describing functional behavior; no quality attributes like performance, security, or usability are mentioned.

RequirementText: When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (marking a ship as sunk on a player's defensive grid) — a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The product shall allow a player to position ships horizontally on their grid.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability — allowing a player to position ships horizontally on their grid — which is a functional requirement. No non-functional aspects (performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: When a game is ended the product shall allow each player to identify himself or herself as an available player in the list of players.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (allow players to mark themselves as available in the player list). It does not mention availability metrics, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The product shall prevent a player from viewing the offensive or defensive grids of the other player.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (what the system must do): prevent a player from viewing the other player's grids. It does not explicitly state availability, security standards, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Once a game is initiated the product shall allow each player to position their 5 ships on their respective defensive grids.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (allow players to position ships) which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The product shall simulate the look of ships at sea.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual simulation of ships' appearance, which is a look-and-feel/UI aesthetic concern. No availability, performance, security, or other NFRs implied.

RequirementText: The product shall display the grids within a circle as a view from a periscope.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a visual presentation style (displaying grids within a circular periscope view), which is a look-and-feel/UI aesthetic constraint rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall display each type of ship in a grid using an image of the specific type of ship.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual presentation (display in a grid using images) focusing on UI look-and-feel rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When the offensive player takes a shot the product shall simulate the sound of a ship at sea.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (simulate sound when shot occurs) and relates to audiovisual/look-and-feel (sound simulation), so Functional and Look & Feel. No availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: When a shot is marked as a miss the product shall simulate the sound of a shot missing its target.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (simulate sound when a shot is a miss) and relates to presentation/feel (sound effect), matching Functional and Look & Feel. No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes implied.

RequirementText: When a shot is marked as a hit the product shall simulate the sound of a shot hitting its target.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (system shall simulate sound when shot is a hit) and pertains to presentation/experience (audio/look & feel). No availability, security, performance, etc. requirements implied.

RequirementText: When a ship is sunk the product shall simulate the sound of a sinking ship.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (when ship is sunk simulate sound) -> Functional. Involves audio presentation/experience (sensory/look-and-feel) -> Look & Feel. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall be available 24 hours per day seven days per week.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly specifies system availability 24 hours/day, 7 days/week — a clear availability requirement.

RequirementText: The product shall able to handle a large number of games simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns the system's ability to handle many games simultaneously, which implies scalability and performance concerns (throughput/handling load). No indication of availability, security, usability, or other categories.

RequirementText: The product shall protect the identity of the players. The product shall provide players no access to information that might reveal the identity of another player.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns protecting player identities and restricting access to identifying information, which is a security/privacy requirement. No other quality attributes or functional behaviors are specified.

RequirementText: The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory. Nine out ten users shall be able to successfully complete a game with no training.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies intuitiveness, self-explanatory UI, and a measurable usability target (90% of users complete a game with no training). This directly concerns usability (learnability and effectiveness). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The response time shall be fast enough to maintain the flow of the game. The response time shall be no more than 2 seconds for 95% of responses and no more than 4% for the remaining responses.
AI_Rationale: Specifies explicit response time limits and percentages (performance metrics). No mention of functionality, availability, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The product shall provide players no access to information that might reveal the identity of another player
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates protection of player identity and preventing access to identifying information, which is a security/privacy concern (confidentiality). It does not specify availability, performance, UI, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Once a game is initiated the product shall display an offensive grid to each player.

RequirementText: Once a game is initiated the product shall display a defensive grid to each player
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying a defensive grid to each player when a game starts), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The product shall allow a player to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list of players.

RequirementText: The product shall be available to players who understand English Spanish and French. The product shall allow the user to select the language upon accessing the product.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (language selection) and addresses usability (support for multiple languages, user selection at access). No mention of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The product shall make inactive players unavailable for selection from the list of players.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (making inactive players unavailable for selection). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall remove players who have been inactive for 24 hours from the list of players.

RequirementText: Once a game has been initiated the product shall make the players assigned to the game unavailable for selection from the list of players.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (making assigned players unavailable for selection). It does not mention availability metrics, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The product shall allow a user to identify himself or herself as a player.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow a user to identify as a player). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall maintain a list of players.

RequirementText: The product shall allow a user to remove himself or herself from the list of players at any time.
