RequirementText: The product shall be internet browser independent.The product must run using Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for multiple web browsers (Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator), which is a portability requirement (cross-platform/browser compatibility). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The interface shall be appealing to callers and supervisors. In the interface and usability survey 80% of beta testers must report that the interface is appealing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies aesthetic/look-and-feel requirement (appealing interface) with a measurable acceptance criterion (80% of beta testers), so LF applies; the presence of a quantitative performance-style acceptance metric is treated as PE per similar labeling examples.

RequirementText: The interface shall have a simple look. In the interface and usability survey 90% of beta testers must report that the interface is adequately simple.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual simplicity and measured perception from usability survey: primarily a Look & Feel quality. It does not state functional behavior, performance, availability, or other quality attributes, nor specific usability tasks or metrics beyond subjective adequacy, so only LF is marked.

RequirementText: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can view schedule of all callers.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional access/control features (who can view and access advertising slots) and implies authorization/security constraints (only supervisors allowed). No other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can enter a caller92s schedule.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
AI_Rationale: Specifies role-based access to functionality (only supervisors can perform actions), which is both a functional requirement and an access-control/security requirement.

RequirementText: The system must be available for use between 7:00AM and 11:59PM all days of the year.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required hours of operation/uptime (availability window). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can advertise empty time slots.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (supervisors can advertise/access empty time slots) and enforces access control (only supervisors allowed), which is a security (authorization) concern.

RequirementText: On a 112k connection or faster the system response time for all operations must be no more than 3 seconds 90% of the time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies response time targets over a given connection speed (performance metric). Also relates to availability/reliability over network (reachable/acceptable response), matching similar examples labeled A and PE.

RequirementText: On a 56k connection the system response time for all operations must be no more than 6 seconds 90% of the time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies response time over a 56k connection with a 90% target—this is a performance requirement and also relates to availability/operational responsiveness over that connection (matches provided examples labeled A and PE). No functional behavior or other quality attributes implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be responsive. At the DePaul TeleServices Center when a supervisor uses the system to view a callers schedule the system response time must be no more than 2 seconds 90% of the time and no more than 5 seconds the rest of the time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies response time targets (performance). Describes system being "responsive" for supervisors viewing caller schedules, which also implies usability (perceived responsiveness). No legal, security, availability, scalability, etc., constraints stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be easy to learn by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors shall learn how to use the system within 10 minutes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies learnability and time-to-learn for users (callers and supervisors), which is a usability requirement. No explicit performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be easy to use by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors must be able to accomplish any system task within 2 minutes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies ease of use and an explicit time-bound for accomplishing tasks (users must complete any task within 2 minutes). This is primarily a usability requirement (US). The explicit time/response target also represents a performance-type constraint on task completion, so PE is included. No indications of functional behavior, availability, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall have high availability every day of the year.The system must be available for use between 12:00AM and 6:00PM all days of the year.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required system availability/time windows (uptime), which maps to Availability. No other quality attributes or functional behavior are specified.

RequirementText: The product shall have audit capabilities.The product shall store messages for a minimum of one year for audit and transaction tracking purposes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies audit capabilities and storing messages for one year for audit/transaction tracking, which concerns security (audit logging and retention). No explicit legal, performance, availability, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The product shall information Security. The product shall enable privacy by encryption WS-Security and Integrity Checking.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies security features: privacy via encryption (WS-Security) and integrity checking. These are security concerns; no explicit availability, fault tolerance, usability, portability, or other NFRs are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall have security.The product shall provide authentication and authorization.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies security, authentication and authorization, which maps directly to Security (SE). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall operate with every platform.The product shall accommodate any new technology without any change in its architecture.
AI_Rationale: Specifies platform independence and ability to accommodate new technologies without architectural changes—indicates portability and maintainability/adaptability.

RequirementText: The product shall be updated on a regular basis.The product will have a new major feature introduced every six months and quarterly maintenance releases every six months.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a schedule for updates, feature releases, and maintenance—this concerns maintenance policies and frequency, which maps to Maintainability. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The product shall continue to operate during upgrade change or new resource addition.The product shall be able to continue to operate with no interruption in service due to new resource additions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies zero-downtime operation during upgrades and resource additions, which directly implies availability. Continued operation despite changes implies fault tolerance/resilience. Transparent resource addition without interruption implies scalability. No legal, UI, security, portability, or explicit maintainability/operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The product shall interface CSR and Datastream.The product shall exchange messages between CSR and EAM on a real time basis without any direct interfaces between two systems.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes how the product should interface and exchange messages between systems and operate in real time without direct system-to-system interfaces, which concerns operability and integration. No explicit availability, performance metrics, security, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The product shall be platform independent.The product shall enable access to any type of development environment and platform.
AI_Rationale: Specifies platform independence and access to any development environment, which directly concerns portability. Also implies operability/ability to operate across platforms (manageability/access), but does not state other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall be able to process all transactions.The product shall process minimum of 1 million transactions per year.
AI_Rationale: Specifies throughput/volume requirement (minimum 1 million transactions per year) and ability to handle transaction load, which are performance and scalability concerns. No indication of availability, security, UX, portability, maintainability, fault tolerance, legal, or functional behavior beyond throughput.

RequirementText: The product shall be robust.The product shall have fault avoidance based on standards adoption.
AI_Rationale: States product shall be robust and have fault avoidance based on standards adoption — explicitly a fault-tolerance/robustness requirement. Also mapped to performance in similar example, interpreted as implying reliability-related performance characteristics (hence PE). No mention of availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The product shall be robust with fault tolerance.The product shall have fault tolerance by using recovery technique compensatory transaction and routing around failures.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies fault tolerance mechanisms (recovery via compensatory transactions and routing around failures), which maps directly to Fault Tolerance.

RequirementText: The product shall provide Dynamic Change Support and Transparent resource addition.The product shall support Transparent Resource addition and Dynamic Change support to provide scalability and avoid service interruptions of more than 1 day.
AI_Rationale: Requirement demands Dynamic Change Support and Transparent resource addition to provide scalability and avoid service interruptions -> functional capability (F), fault tolerance/resilience to changes (FT), and scalability (SC). No explicit availability/other qualities mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall be available 99% of the time. Rationale: To avoid service interruption during busiest customer service response periods. The product shall be available 99.99% of the time for regular business days.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies target uptime percentages (99% and 99.99%), which directly concerns availability. It does not mention functionality, fault tolerance mechanisms, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall comply with City of Chicago Application Development Guide Framework.Application Development Framework will provide structured Graphical User Interface.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates compliance with the City of Chicago Application Development Guide (legal/standards constraint) and specifies the Application Development Framework will provide a structured Graphical User Interface (look-and-feel / UI requirement). No performance, security, availability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall provide Monitoring Services.The product shall be easy for System Administrators and DBAs to use after two weeks of usage.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (provide Monitoring Services) and a usability constraint (easy for System Administrators and DBAs to use after two weeks), so F and US apply. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, operability, maintainability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, or look-and-feel requirements.

RequirementText: The product shall provide Error Tracking Services.The product shall help the System Administrators and DBAs to resolve transaction errors 99% of the time.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies an Error Tracking Service (functional). The 99% resolution target implies fault-tolerance/resilience requirements (FT). It is aimed at helping System Administrators/DBAs resolve errors, which affects maintainability (MN) and usability for administrators (US). No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The product shall provide GUI based Monitoring Services.System Administrators shall monitor message exchanges will predict and determine problems and will also provide internal and external support.
AI_Rationale: Requirement asks the product to provide GUI-based Monitoring Services (functional). It targets System Administrators monitoring message exchanges, predicting/determining problems and providing support — implying maintainability (helps admins maintain/diagnose) and operability (administration/monitoring capabilities). No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, portability, scalability, fault-tolerance, legal, or look-and-feel constraints specified.

RequirementText: The product shall provide Asynchronous Messaging.The product shall provide asynchronous messaging to enable parallel processing and reduce the overhead in communications
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (provide asynchronous messaging). It explicitly mentions enabling parallel processing and reducing communication overhead, which are performance-related concerns, so PE is set. No explicit mention of availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, usability, etc., so those are not set.

RequirementText: The product shall provide Multi-threading and Load Balancing.The product shall provide multi-threading technology as well as load balancing to overcome data load spikes and traffic.
AI_Rationale: Specifies multi-threading and load balancing to handle data load spikes and traffic, which directly targets performance (throughput/response) and scalability (handling increased load). Usability is marked because improving concurrency and load handling typically improves responsiveness and user experience (as in similar labeled examples). No explicit mention of availability, security, portability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The product shall process messages within 2 seconds.The product shall have a maximum message processing time of 2 seconds
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement (message processing) with a quantitative timing constraint (maximum 2 seconds), indicating a performance non-functional requirement. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall poll the system for messages every second.The product shall poll the system for new messages at a maximum of every 1 second.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (polling for messages) and a timing constraint (maximum interval of 1 second), which is a performance/non-functional timing requirement.

RequirementText: The product shall provide Portals.The product shall help System Administrators to analyze the transactions with ad-hoc reporting and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional capabilities: providing Portals and reporting/KPI analysis for System Administrators (functional). It also implies usability by stating it should 'help' admins analyze transactions (making the system usable/effective for administrators), so Usability is marked. No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The WCS system shall be available at all times as long as IBM92s internal intranet W3 is accessible. The WCS system will be available 95% of the time IBM92s internal intranet W3 is available.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system availability percentage (95%) tied to intranet accessibility—this is an availability requirement; no other quality attributes or functional behavior are described.

RequirementText: The system shall only be accessed by authorized Corporate Community Grants (CCR) employees. Users must be authenticated using their IBM intranet user name and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication and restriction to authorized employees using corporate credentials—this is a security requirement (authn/authz). No availability, performance, usability, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: All changes updates and additions to the WCS system shall be updated in the WCS Developer and WCS User Guides. Every change must be reflected in WCS system documentation
AI_Rationale: Requires that all changes be reflected in developer and user guides—this is a maintainability/documentation requirement.

RequirementText: The WCS system must run queries to the WCS databases once again (on a specified day) to update the available data available to CCR users. Queries must be made to external databases for data refresh once a week.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (scheduled queries to update data) -> Functional. Implies resilience/automated refresh and recovery expectations (regular re-querying to ensure data availability) -> Fault Tolerance. Involves data update process that affects how system is maintained and updated (documentation/maintenance procedures implied) -> Maintainability. No explicit mentions of availability metrics, performance, security, portability, scalability, usability, legal, or UI aspects, so those are set to false.

RequirementText: The Brio portion of the WCS system must be able to export files in spreadsheet form (Microsoft Excel and Lotus 1-2-3 formats). Brio will provide buttons in the user interface that produce/export reports in .xls or .123 file formats.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capability to export reports in .xls/.123 (Functional). Mentions UI buttons and presentation (Look & Feel). Also implies operability/administration via provided UI controls (Operability). No mention of availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: The WCS system shall be run in a Windows environment. The WCS shall be accessed by users through the Internet on an IBM computer running a Windows 2000 or above operating system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required runtime environment and access method (Windows/Windows 2000+ on IBM via Internet). This is an operability/administration constraint and a platform portability requirement; no availability, security, performance, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: The WCS system shall not allow automatic logins by any user. Cookies containing WCS login information about a user will not be stored on a user92s computer.
AI_Rationale: The requirement prohibits automatic logins and storing login cookies on user machines, which directly relates to authentication/session security and protection of credentials/privacy. It does not specify availability, performance, maintainability, UI, portability, scalability, or operability concerns.

RequirementText: The WCS system shall have the ability to connect other designated WCS databases currently not included in the system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system ability to connect additional designated databases — this implies portability/compatibility across database environments (PO) and capability to accommodate more data sources/users (scalability, SC). It does not state functional transaction details, security, availability, or other non-functional categories explicitly, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The WCS system shall use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization. All interfaces and reports will undergo usability tests by CCR users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of organizational nomenclature (legal/standards compliance) and mandates usability testing of interfaces/reports by CCR users, indicating look-and-feel and usability requirements.

RequirementText: The WCS system shall have the ability to include data for regions outside the United States and be accessed by users outside of the United States if approved by CCR management.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns supporting additional regions/users (geographic scaling) and accessibility/use by external users; does not specify legal, security, or technical portability constraints.

RequirementText: A user shall be able to use the system without instruction after a short amount of time. After one use a user should understand and remember 90% of the system usage and navigation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies ease of use and learnability with measurable success/retention rates (90% after one use), which is a usability requirement.

RequirementText: Reports must be easy to generate. Reports must be generated within one button click and exported within one button click (after selecting the report)
AI_Rationale: The requirement prescribes ease of generating/exporting reports with one-button actions, which is a usability concern (US). It also relates to operability/administration (O) since it specifies operational simplicity for performing tasks. No explicit performance, security, portability, scalability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The interface shall be easy to use. 90% of users should be able to successfully use the system to generate a report on their first use. The interface should adhere to IBM usability standards.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies ease of use, a measurable usability success rate (90% first-use report generation), and adherence to usability standards (IBM). These are usability and look-and-feel concerns, not functional, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system must use a point and click interface. 100% of all selection and navigation functionality must be able to be activated/selected by either a mouse or a keyboard
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies user interface interaction style (point-and-click) and mandates keyboard/mouse activation for all selection/navigation — this concerns look-and-feel and usability/accessibility. No availability, performance, security, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: The interface must summarize the data in a fashion that92s appealing to CCR management. Every report type must have at least one high level summary shown in the results dashboard/interface
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement (interface must provide summaries for each report) and an aesthetic/look-and-feel requirement (appealing to CCR management). No explicit availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system interface will use CCR nomenclature. The system must use the same nomenclature used in the existing WCS system and reports
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of a particular nomenclature for the system interface and reports, which pertains to look-and-feel/terminology consistency. No explicit availability, security, maintainability, portability, scalability, legal or usability testing requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be displayable on any work computer a CCR user may have. The system interface shall be formatted to display at 800 by 600 pixel resolution.
AI_Rationale: Specifies display/layout constraints (800x600) => Look & Feel. Requirement that it be displayable on any work computer implies portability across target platforms/environments.

RequirementText: The system shall use IBM and CCR branding standards. The interface must have one IBM logo and one CCR logo.
AI_Rationale: Specifies branding and logos for the interface, which pertains to look and feel (visual appearance). No functional, performance, security, legal, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: All CCR users shall receive training before the WCS system is deployed. One training session will be held for 100% of CCR users before system deployment (based on a CCR user being available)
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates training so users can use the system before deployment, which relates to usability/learnability. It does not specify system behavior, availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: New System version releases shall be released at the beginning of each NFL season.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a release cadence/timing for system version releases (maintenance/upgrade schedule). This is a maintainability/maintenance-process requirement rather than functional or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Application updates shall occur between 3AM and 6 AM CST on Wednesday morning during the middle of the NFL season.
AI_Rationale: Specifies timing and scheduling of application updates (release/maintenance activity), which concerns maintainability/release management. No availability, performance, security, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: A secondary database will be used to store historical statistics and data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of a secondary database for historical data, which is an architectural/maintenance decision (affects maintainability) and relates to system operation/administration (operability). No functional behavior, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, or UI requirements are stated.

RequirementText: A primary database will be used to store cached data for active users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies architectural choice about using a primary database for cached active-user data which impacts maintainability (data organization, backups, schema) and operability (administration, deployment, management). It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, etc., explicitly.

RequirementText: The application shall have a downtime of at most 10 minutes per year.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maximum allowed downtime per year which directly refers to availability/uptime. Does not mention functionality, fault tolerance mechanisms, performance metrics, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The application shall be able to complete every user transaction within one fourth of a second of receiving the request over the network.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a strict response-time requirement (quality of service). This is a performance requirement; example mapping also marked Availability because timely completion implies the system must be available to respond, so Availability is included.

RequirementText: The application shall ask the user to confirm dropping a player or trading a player before performing the action.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the system shall prompt for user confirmation before performing an action). It does not specify availability, security, usability quality attributes, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The application shall run on a web application server.
AI_Rationale: Specifies deployment environment/platform requirement (must run on a web application server), which concerns operation/administration of the system rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to reach the 91add92 91drop92 and 91trade player92 pages with one click from the team owner92s page.
AI_Rationale: Specifies one-click navigation from the team owner's page to add/drop/trade player pages — this is a UI/look-and-feel constraint and affects usability (ease of navigation). No availability, security, performance, etc. are implied.

RequirementText: A new user shall be able to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a time-based navigation goal (performance) and implies UI layout/flow and ease of use (look & feel and usability). No legal, security, availability, scalability, etc. requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The message board shall contain the 5 most recently posted messages on the league page. The messages will contain up to the first 150 characters of the message.
AI_Rationale: Specifies concrete system behavior: display the 5 most recent messages and limit shown text to first 150 characters. This is a functional requirement about what the system should do, with no explicit non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Each page shall contain a similar format with action items in one location and navigation buttons in a different location.
AI_Rationale: Specifies consistent page layout and placement of action items vs navigation—a look-and-feel requirement that also improves usability (learnability and consistency). No functional, performance, security, or other NFRs implied.

RequirementText: Each page shall contain a navigation menu which shows the index into which the current page is contained.
AI_Rationale: Specifies presence and presentation of a navigation menu (page layout/look-and-feel). It concerns UI structure rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Commissioner will be the only authorized user per league to adjust league settings.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an access-control constraint limiting who may adjust league settings (security). Also tagged Legal in similar example—likely a policy/authorization rule tied to governance, so marked as Legal as well.

RequirementText: Each team owner will need to use a username and password in order to be authenticated to reach the team owner92s page
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies authentication via username and password to access a page, which is a security requirement (authentication). It does not specify functional details beyond access control nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to view at least 25 NFL player statistics and points on each page.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capability (users can view player statistics) and a quantitative presentation/performance constraint (at least 25 items per page), which is a performance/display capacity requirement.

RequirementText: The product interface should be fast. The response time of the product interface should not exceed 2 seconds 90% of the time. For 10% of the time the response time should not be more than 10 seconds.not be more than 10 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies quantitative response-time targets (performance) and uptime/availability-like percentile constraints; matches examples labeled A and PE.

RequirementText: The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation 98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies ease of use, successful task completion rate after training (98% within stipulated time). This is a usability requirement (user effectiveness/learnability). No other quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The intranet pages should display appropriately in all resolutions from 800x600 and higher. The display of all the pages will be correct in 95% of the resolutions prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected within a week of notification of the incorrect display.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual rendering across screen resolutions and percentage of correct displays and fixes—this concerns look & feel (presentation/layout). No functional behavior, legal, performance, security, or other NFRs are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: The product must comply with the intranet page standards and requirements of ENET Securities. 95% of the product look & feel will be approved by the Architecture group prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected and approved within one month of product release.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compliance with intranet page standards (legal/standards compliance) and explicit look & feel approval percentages and correction timeline, so it maps to Legal and Look & Feel.

RequirementText: User access should be limited to the permissions granted to their role(s) Each level in the PCG hierarchy will be assigned a role and users will be assigned to these roles. Access to functionality within RFS system is dependent on the privileges/permission assigned to the role..
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control based on roles and permissions (role-based access control), which is a security/authentication/authorization requirement. Does not state availability, performance, usability, legal, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: Only authorized user shall access the RFS system. ONLY users that exist in the UAS system with the RFS system assigned to their role(s) shall access the RFS system and use it.
AI_Rationale: This requirement defines access control constraints (only authorized users, membership in UAS and role assignment) which are security-related (authentication/authorization). It does not specify availability, performance, UI, maintainability, portability, scalability, operability, or legal aspects, nor describe functional behavior beyond access control.

RequirementText: Changes to revenue and expense formulae must be applied to the RFS system every year prior to the budgeting process start. Revenue and expense formulae will be updated within one week of their receipt after which 2 weeks will be allotted to testing of the budget calculations to be conducted jointly by the project development team and PCG Finance.
AI_Rationale: Specifies procedural/contractual timing for applying formula changes and testing—indicates compliance/process requirement (Legal) and concerns maintainability (updates/testing process). No availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, portability, or functional behavior specified.

RequirementText: The RFS system should be able to easily interface with the BDW environment in order to load the data. 95 7 data files shall be received from the BDW and loaded into the RFS system within 3 hours one day prior to the start of budgeting process every year. The data will be as of October month-end. Test files (7) shall be loaded up to 5 times throughout the year from the BDW.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system must interface with BDW and load specific data files on schedule (operational/integration requirement) and includes a timing constraint (files loaded within 3 hours), which is a performance requirement. No indications of availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: 98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum software requirements prior to implementation: Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0. Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1. Microsoft Internet Explorer Web Controls
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that user workstations must meet certain software prerequisites prior to implementation, which concerns deployment/operability (manageability and operational readiness). It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: 98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum hardware requirements prior to implementation. Minimum Hard Disk Space: 400MB.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that 98% of user workstations must meet hardware prerequisites prior to implementation—a deployment/operability constraint about system environment readiness rather than functionality, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The RFS system should be available 24/7 especially during the budgeting period. The RFS system shall be available 90% of the time all year and 98% during the budgeting period. 2% of the time the system will become available within 1 hour of the time that the situation is reported.
AI_Rationale: Specifies explicit availability targets (90% annually, 98% during budgeting) => Availability. Specifies recovery/uptime within 1 hour for 2% of time => Fault Tolerance (graceful recovery). Includes time-based availability metrics/timeliness of restoration which relates to performance constraints, so Performance is marked.

RequirementText: New branches/complexes/districts/regions and revenue/expense accounts added to the BDW must be reflected in the RFS system. 100% of the entities (mentioned above) available as of October month-end will be loaded into the RFS system prior to the budget start process.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates that BDW additions be reflected in RFS and that 100% of entities as of October month-end be loaded prior to the budget process. This is primarily about ensuring data availability/synchronization (mapped to Availability) and about maintaining correctness and update process (mapped to Maintainability). It does not specify performance, security, portability, scalability, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall have a help system that offers tips and explanation for each screen and each item on the screens upon demand.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a built-in help feature (functional requirement) intended to improve ease of use and user assistance (usability). No mention of other qualities such as performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system search feature should support the use of regular expressions in search.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability of the search feature (support for regular expressions). No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall allow a text search that users may use to find mail messages.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (text search for mail messages). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall display and embed in each message a date/timestamp of when the message was sent.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must display and embed a timestamp in each message. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall use a text-based interface to display a listing of available mail.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system function (display a listing of available mail) and constrains the interface type (text-based), which is a look-and-feel/user interface requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall operate on Unix and Windows operating systems.
AI_Rationale: Specifies target operating systems (Unix and Windows), which is a portability requirement. It does not describe operation/administration details, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall support the ability to perform a send only operation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/mode (send-only) the system must support, which is a functional behavior. No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be evoked by typing â€œpineâ€� into a command or shell prompt.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: how the system is invoked (command-line trigger 'pine'). It does not state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall support the ability to perform a receive only operation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability — supporting a 'receive only' operation. It specifies what the system should do, with no explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall support the ability to perform a send and receive operation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (send and receive) which is a functional requirement; no quality attributes like performance, security, availability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall use the SMTP mail protocol.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the required protocol for sending mail, which constrains functional behavior (how the system communicates). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall provide an option to withdraw money.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (withdraw money) — a clear functional requirement. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall query the user for the amount of money.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (interaction: querying the user for an amount), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall query the user for the account type.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing system behavior (querying the user for account type). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall validate the amount is a multiple of $20.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior/validation rule (functional requirement) rather than a quality attribute.

RequirementText: The system shall debit the userâ€™s account upon withdrawal of funds.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing system behavior (debit account on withdrawal). No explicit quality, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to issue a specific amount of money to the user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (issuing a specific amount of money) which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, legal, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall validate the amount is available in the userâ€™s account before releasing funds to the user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (validate account balance before releasing funds). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A meeting scheduler system will inform the â€œpotential meeting participantâ€� of the meeting.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system action (informing/p notifying a potential meeting participant), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler system may be able to include an agenda for a meeting proposal.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system can include an agenda in a meeting proposal. It does not address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: A meeting scheduler system will temporarily reserve the â€œtime slotsâ€� for the proposed meeting.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a behavior the system must perform (temporarily reserving time slots) — a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler system may be able to include a list of required equipment for a meeting proposal.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system should allow including a list of required equipment in a meeting proposal. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler system may suggest a â€œvirtual meetingâ€� for available â€œtime slotsâ€� if no location is available or feasible for the meeting.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: suggesting virtual meetings when no physical location is available. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler system may (optionally) automatically propose another meeting if current meeting is canceled by an important participant.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system behavior: automatically proposing an alternative meeting when an important participant cancels. This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional aspects (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler shall be accessed from the Web.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access method/interface (accessed from the Web), which is an operational/deployment constraint similar to the provided example labeled as Operability. No explicit functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler system shall reschedule a meeting to support conflict resolutions.
AI_Rationale: Describes a specific system behavior (rescheduling meetings to resolve conflicts), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler system shall cancel a meeting due to canceling of an important participant.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (cancel a meeting) triggered by participant cancellation — a functional requirement describing behavior, not a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler system shall be able to select a participant as an important participant.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (selecting/marking a participant as important), which is a functional behavior. It does not state any non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: The meeting scheduler system may provide the â€œmeeting initiatorâ€� a summary of the scan of â€œpotential meeting participantsâ€� showing available â€œtime slotsâ€� and schedule conflicts as a means of informing the â€œmeeting initiatorâ€� of the overall results of the system.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system capability to provide a summary of participants' availability and conflicts—this specifies functional behavior (what the system should do). No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The system must be easy to use by both managers and chefs such that they do not need to read an extensive amount of manuals.
AI_Rationale: Specifies ease of use for managers and chefs and minimizing need for manuals, which is a usability requirement. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system must be quickly accessible by both managers and chefs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must be accessible by two roles (managers and chefs) — implying access control/authorization concerns (Security) and that it must be reachable by those users (Availability). The term "quickly accessible" explicitly implies responsiveness/latency requirements (Performance). No explicit legal, portability, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, operability, or pure usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system must be intuitive and simple in the way it displays all relevant data and relationships.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on the interface being intuitive and simple in how data and relationships are displayed (usability). It also implies visual presentation aspects (look & feel), so US and LF are set to true; no other quality attributes are indicated.

RequirementText: The menus of the system must be easily navigable by the users with buttons that are easy to understand.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns menu navigability and understandable buttons—directly about usability and user interface look-and-feel. No functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: All the functions of the system must be available to the user every time the system is turned on.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that all system functions must be available to the user whenever the system is turned on, which is an availability requirement. It does not explicitly state fault tolerance, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The calculations performed by the system must comply according to the norms set by the user and should not vary unless explicitly changed by the user.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies how the system should behave (how calculations must comply with user-defined norms and remain consistent unless changed) — a functional behavioral constraint. It also implies integrity/ correctness of results relative to user settings (data/calculation integrity), which aligns with Security (SE) concerns. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, portability, scalability, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability or operability.

RequirementText: The client should agree to EULA before using our software.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the client must agree to an End User License Agreement before using the software, which is a legal/compliance constraint. It does not explicitly state functional implementation details or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Only users who have been authorized for home access to the corporate Intranet may use the COS from non-company locations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access restriction based on authorization for remote/home access to the corporate intranet, i.e., an authentication/authorization security constraint. No performance, availability, usability, or other quality concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall permit only cafeteria staff members who are on the list of authorized Menu Managers to create or edit menus.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies who is permitted to perform create/edit actions (functional behavior) and restricts access to authorized Menu Managers, which is an access control/security constraint. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Users shall be required to log in to the Cafeteria Ordering System for all operations except viewing a menu.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates authentication (users must log in) and access control for operations, which is a security concern. It also specifies system behavior (enforcing login), so Functional is applicable as well.

RequirementText: Patrons shall log in according to the restricted computer system access policy.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a login function (functional) that must follow an access policy, which is a security requirement. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall display confirmation messages to users within 4 seconds after the user submits information to the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (display confirmation messages) and a timing constraint (must occur within 4 seconds), which is a performance requirement. No explicit availability, security, usability, or other NFRs mentioned.

RequirementText: Responses to queries shall take no longer than 7 seconds to load onto the screen after the user submits the query.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a response time limit (maximum 7 seconds) for query results, which is a performance (timing/latency) constraint. It does not describe functionality, availability targets, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: All Web pages generated by the system shall be fully downloadable in no more than 10 seconds over a 40KBps modem connection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a response/download time over a specified network speed, which is a performance constraint (PE). It also constrains acceptable behavior over a network connection, matching availability/response-time labeling used in similar examples (A). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: All network transactions that involve financial information or personally identifiable information shall be encrypted.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates encryption of network transactions involving financial or PII, which is a security control addressing confidentiality and integrity. It does not specify availability, performance, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Programmers and application developers will have access to source code to address bugs or system enhancements as deemed necessary. Network Administrator and DBA support is also required to maintain a 24x7 system uptime.
AI_Rationale: Request grants developers access to source code to address bugs/enhancements (implies maintainability). Requirement for Network Administrator and DBA support to maintain 24x7 uptime explicitly describes availability; need for admin/DBA support implies operability/administration. No explicit security, portability, performance, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance statements.

RequirementText: System security and access levels are provided in the online system. There are varying levels of system access and functional authority. Each studentâ€™s access is limited to his/her own registration records. Only authorized system administrator(s) has access to all student registration records.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access control and differentiated user privileges (students limited to their records; administrators have full access), which is a security/authentication/authorization concern. No performance, availability, usability, or other quality attributes are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: The online registration system is â€œself-service styleâ€� system that shall initially address the student registration needs.
AI_Rationale: The statement defines the system type and primary functional scope (self-service online registration addressing student registration needs). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: All data entry forms for the application should match their Microsoft Excel hardcopy counterparts as closely as possible. Hardcopies of these forms were provided to the design team during the second requirements interview.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies that data entry forms should match Excel hardcopy counterparts — this is a look-and-feel / UI layout requirement. It also implies usability (familiarity/learnability) by matching existing forms, so Usability is marked. No statements about functionality, performance, availability, security, etc.

RequirementText: Changes made to the Manage My ID website can be adopted without altering the iOS application.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that website changes should be adoptable without modifying the iOS app, which is a modifiability/maintainability concern (ensuring component changes do not require changes elsewhere). It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, portability, or usability.

RequirementText: 95% of users will not need to read the user manual to be able to use the application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies usability metric (users not needing the manual), which is a usability quality goal. It does not mention functionality, look-and-feel standards, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The application should be connected to the Internet.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the application must be connected to the Internet, which pertains to deployment/operational context (accessibility and network connectivity). It does not specify uptime, security, performance, or UI aspects, so only Operability is marked.

RequirementText: The application should be connected to the GPS device.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete functional requirement: the application must connect to a GPS device. No quality attributes like availability, security, portability, or UI are implied.

RequirementText: The application should be easy to extend. The code should be written in a way that it favors implementation of new functions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies code should be structured to facilitate adding new functions—this directly concerns maintainability (ease of extension). No mention of other qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: Test environments should be built for the application to allow testing of the applications different functions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates building test environments to allow testing of application functions, which directly relates to testability and maintainability (ease of testing/modifying). It does not specify operational administration, availability, security, performance, or UI concerns, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The application should be portable with iOS and Android.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the application must be portable to iOS and Android—explicitly a portability requirement (cross-platform compatibility).

RequirementText: The system shall provide a way to return to the startup screen.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (navigation action to return to the startup screen), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state any quality attributes such as availability, usability, security, or performance.

RequirementText: The campus map shall have a pause/resume button. The pause and resume button will allow the user to scroll and select other buildings without being interrupted by the automatic search and announce feature.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI control (pause/resume) and behavior to allow user interaction without interruption by automatic features—this is functional and improves usability.

RequirementText: The campus map shall provide visual clues regarding what areas have prepared audio and therefore may be selected.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional feature (map provides visual clues) and concerns UI presentation ('visual clues') affecting look-and-feel and usability (helps users identify/select areas). No indications of security, performance, availability, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: The system shall allow the user to scroll the campus map from the campus map tab.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to scroll the campus map) — a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects such as availability, performance, usability, security, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system shall show a tabbed display (or equivalent functionality) with the campus map on one tab and info on the most recently announced building on the other.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI behavior: a tabbed display with specific content on each tab (functional) and prescribes presentation/layout (look & feel). No availability, performance, security, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: It should generate a report about registered complaint to the admin and response report to the user who has submitted his queries.
AI_Rationale: Describes a behavior the system must perform: generating a complaint report to admin and a response report to the submitting user. This is a functional requirement; no quality constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The system should maintain correct schedules of labs and the documentation of all the lab equipment.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies what the system should do—maintain schedules and equipment documentation—so it is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: A surface computer shall not require a user to log in.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior regarding authentication (no login required) — a functional requirement. It directly relates to authentication/security policy (lack of login), so marked as Security. No mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: A display shall not require a user to log in.
AI_Rationale: The statement prescribes system behavior (the display must not require user login) so it is functional. It directly concerns authentication/authorization requirements (no login), which is a security-related constraint, so SE is marked. Other non-functional categories (availability, usability, etc.) are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: A waiter that attempts to log into a second tablet while already logged into another tablet shall be rejected and notified through both tablets.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (enforce single-session login and notifications). It also implies security/session management (preventing concurrent logins) and affects usability (user notification on both tablets). Other NFRs are not implied.

RequirementText: A waiter shall only be able to log into one tablet at any given instance of time.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a constraint on login behavior (restricting concurrent sessions per waiter), which defines system functionality (session management) and enforces an access control/security policy to prevent multiple simultaneous logins. It does not reference availability, performance, usability, or other quality aspects.

RequirementText: A waiter password used for tablet login must be changed every three months.
AI_Rationale: Specifies password change interval for waiter tablet logins — a security/authentication policy (password management), so it's a Security requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall flag tablets that fail to send timely keep-alive messages as non-operational and disassociate the assigned waiter from the tablet.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (detecting failed keep-alives and disassociating waiter). It describes operational/device management actions (operability) and handling device failure by marking non-operational (fault detection/handling -> fault tolerance). No explicit performance, security, legal, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: A tablet shall require a user to log in using a username and password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies authentication using username and password, which is a security constraint (access control). It does not specify functional behavior beyond access control, nor availability/performance/usability aspects, so only SE is set.

RequirementText: The system shall utilise periodic 30-second keep-alive messages between tablets and the server to monitor tablet operational status.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (periodic keep-alive messages) -> F. The 30-second interval is a timing/performance constraint -> PE. Purpose is to monitor tablet operational status, which pertains to system operability/administration -> O. It does not explicitly require availability guarantees, fault-recovery, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, legal, or usability aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a menu at all times to facilitate manual order taking should the need arise.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (display a menu for manual order taking) and states it must be available 'at all times' which is an availability constraint. No explicit mention of other qualities (security, performance, usability, fault tolerance, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of restoring itself to its previous state in the event of failure (e.g. a system crash or power loss).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must restore itself to its previous state after failures (crash or power loss), which directly concerns fault tolerance and recovery. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, scalability, usability, maintainability, portability, legal, or look-and-feel aspects.

RequirementText: The system should use the company colors and logos.
AI_Rationale: Specifies visual branding (use of company colors and logos), which concerns look-and-feel/visual appearance. No functional, usability, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: A waiter password used for tablet login must have a bit-strength of at least 64 bits.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a minimum bit-strength for passwords used for tablet login, which is a security constraint concerning authentication/credentials. It does not describe availability, performance, UI, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The system will support mobile users in some way.
AI_Rationale: The phrase 'support mobile users' most directly implies compatibility/operation on mobile platforms (portability). It does not explicitly state UI/usability, performance, availability, security, or functional behavior, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system will fully function in major browsers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system must work in major browsers (cross-browser compatibility). This is primarily portability across environments and relates to operability/compatibility; it does not mention UI look-and-feel, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Responses to view information shall take no longer than 5 seconds to appear on the screen.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum response time for displaying information (performance/response-time requirement). No other quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall accommodate large data items without fault.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies handling large data items (capacity/throughput concerns -> Performance) and implies ability to scale to large data sizes (Scalability). The phrase 'without fault' explicitly indicates resilience/fault-tolerance.

RequirementText: System will use secured database.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of a 'secured database', which is a security-related requirement (confidentiality/integrity of data). No indication of availability, performance, portability, or functional behavior beyond security.

RequirementText: Unauthorised users can only read data without modifying anything.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access-control behavior (unauthorized users limited to read-only): this is a functional constraint on system behavior and a security requirement (authorization/permissions). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: ABS shall handle all expected and unexpected errors in ways that prevent loss in information and long downtime period.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies handling expected/unexpected errors to prevent data loss and long downtime, which directly addresses fault tolerance and system availability (reliability). It does not explicitly mention security, performance, scalability, operability, or other categories.

RequirementText: Information transmission should be securely transmitted to server without any changes in information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies secure transmission and preservation of data (confidentiality/integrity). This is a security requirement; no explicit availability, performance, portability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Enable the admin to generate reports which contains all the posts and their corresponding replies.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability for the admin to generate reports listing posts and replies. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Provide an interface for the admin to approve posts so that posts are not visible without admin approval.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function: an admin interface to approve posts and the behavior that posts remain invisible until approved. It defines functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities, and does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Enable a logged in user to up vote and down vote answers.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing a user action (upvote/downvote). The phrase 'logged in user' implies authentication/authorization concerns, so security (SE) is also applicable.

RequirementText: Enable a logged in user to post answers.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement is functional (allow logged-in users to post answers). Mention of 'logged in user' implies authentication/authorization constraint, so a security-related label is applicable.

RequirementText: Be intuitive even to first time users
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies intuitiveness for first-time users, which is a usability requirement (ease of use/learnability). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Enable a user to view questions and their corresponding answers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing a user to view questions and their corresponding answers. It does not state any non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: Enable a registered user to view his profile. Additional information viz. questions asked by him and answers posted by him are also displayed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability: allowing a registered user to view their profile and associated content (questions and answers). It does not specify non-functional qualities such as availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Enable a registered user to change his password if he forgets his password.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a password-reset capability for registered users (F). It directly concerns authentication/security (SE) because it involves changing credentials; no explicit performance, availability, usability or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Enable new users to register to the tech support system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (user registration), i.e., functional behavior. It does not state constraints about availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Authenticate and Login user to the web app.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the functional behavior of authenticating and logging a user into the web app. While authentication relates to security, no explicit non-functional security constraints (e.g., encryption, authorization policies) are stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Enable a logged in user to ask questions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allowing a logged-in user to ask questions), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Detailed documentation of the code and SRS will enable easy maintenance of the Flea Market.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states that detailed documentation will enable easy maintenance, which directly relates to maintainability. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User passwords will be stored in the database in an encrypted format.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that passwords must be stored encrypted in the database — a confidentiality/security requirement. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The IP addresses where the transaction was made from will be logged.
AI_Rationale: This is a requirement to log transaction IP addresses—an explicit functional behavior (logging). Logging IPs is also a security/audit-related concern (forensics, traceability), so Security is set. No mentions of availability, maintainability, portability, performance, scalability, UI, legal, fault tolerance, or operability.

RequirementText: Most of the system functions will be controlled using the administrative interface.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies how system functions are to be managed/controlled—via an administrative interface— which concerns system operation and administration. It does not state performance, security, usability, legal, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: All transactions at the Flea Market require a valid user ID and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that transactions must be performed only with a valid user ID and password — this is a security (authentication/authorization) requirement. It also describes system behavior (enforcing authentication for transactions), so marked as functional as well.

RequirementText: Flea Market system will interface with the web server and RDBMS software using APIs provided by the implementation language
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall interface with web server and RDBMS via language-provided APIs—this describes integration/operability with external components, matching 'Operability' in examples. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: Secure data transfer over the Internet could be provided using SSL encryption that will be configured by the host system administrator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of SSL encryption for secure data transfer (security requirement). Also mentions configuration by the host system administrator, implying an operational/administrative concern (operability). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: It must allow a user to logout.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user logout). It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Each account must have a separate identifying account number.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional requirement: each account must have a separate identifying account number (unique identifier). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Each account must securely store all of its data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that accounts must store data (functional behavior) and explicitly requires that storage be secure (security/non-functional requirement). No mention of availability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: A user must be logged on to be able to view or edit any medical information.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies access control (users must be logged on to view/edit medical info), which is a functional constraint implementing authentication/authorization and directly pertains to security (confidentiality/access control). No availability, performance, scalability, portability, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: Full data backups must be created daily.
AI_Rationale: Specifies operational requirement to create full data backups daily — this is primarily a fault-tolerance/recovery requirement. It also implies an operational/administrative procedure (operability). Does not explicitly state availability targets, security, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Logout must be automatic after 1 hour of inactivity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an automatic logout behavior (functional requirement) to expire sessions after 1 hour of inactivity; primarily a security requirement for session management (confidentiality/integrity). No indications of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: It must allow a user to download a backup of their medical information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to download their medical data), which is a functional behavior. No availability, security, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: All information must be updatable on the website.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that information on the website must be updatable, which describes a system capability (functional). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so other labels are not indicated.

RequirementText: All information must be viewable on the website.
AI_Rationale: Stipulates that information must be viewable on the website (a functional requirement to present data). It also implies a usability concern (users must be able to view content). No explicit availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: It must allow a user to login.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action (login). It does not explicitly state security, availability, performance, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: It must be able to change and update information on the server.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to change and update information on the server), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (security, availability, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user must be able to set an option to hide information based on who has tagged it.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to set an option) — a functional behavior. It also implies access/privacy control (hiding information based on who tagged it), which relates to security/privacy requirements, so SE is marked. No explicit mention of availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: It should give a drill-down view of all data in the medical record after logging in.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional UI feature (drill-down view of medical record data after login). It implies presentation/visual navigation concerns (Look & Feel) and usability, but does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: A correct combination of username and password is required for a user to login.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication requirement (username/password) which is a security constraint. Does not specify functional behavior beyond authentication nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The application must log the user out when it is exited.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (log the user out on exit), so it is functional. It also implies a security concern (session termination to prevent unauthorized access), so Security is applicable. Other quality attributes are not explicitly referenced.

RequirementText: The user must be able to add photos from his/her photo library to his/her medical record.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to add photos from photo library to medical record), which is a functional behavior. It does not state non-functional aspects such as performance, security, availability, usability, or others.

RequirementText: It must only update the parts that have changed when connecting to the server.

It also implies an efficiency constraint (minimizing data transfer/processing), so performance is applicable. No explicit mentions of availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, usability, etc.

RequirementText: It must store the most recent copy of information in its application data folder.

RequirementText: It must be able to download the most recent medical record.
