RequirementText: The system shall be easy to learn.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly states the system shall be easy to learn, which is a usability requirement. No mention of availability, performance, security, etc., so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The customer will also be able to add to or remove products from the shopping cart prior to checkout and order confirmation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (customers can add/remove products from the shopping cart before checkout), which is a functional behavior. It does not state any non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability metrics, etc.), so no other NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: The system shall adhere to the following hardware requirements: 4GB Flash ram chip, 128MB SDRAM, Intel XScale PXA270 520-MHz chipset, OS: Apache web server, Database: MySQL
AI_Rationale: Specifies concrete hardware and software platform requirements (memory, chipset, web server, database). This constrains deployment/platform compatibility (Portability) and is an operational/deployment requirement (Operability). No explicit availability, security, performance, legal, or functional behavior is stated.

RequirementText: Customers will be able to create accounts to store their customer profiles, configure contact information, view their purchase history, and confirm orders.
AI_Rationale: Describes user-facing capabilities (account creation, profile storage, viewing history, confirming orders) which are functional requirements. No quality/constraint aspects like performance, security, availability, or usability are specified.

RequirementText: Customer profiles will also include payment information, such as the ability to store credit card information, and address information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functionality: storing payment (credit card) and address information in customer profiles. It does not explicitly state security, encryption, availability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Products will be stored in multi-tiered categories; a category can contain sub categories or products.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional data/behavioral feature (how products and categories are organized: multi-tiered categories with possible subcategories or products). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The inventory management will allow for administrators to update the categories, the products placed in categories, and the specific product details.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional capability (admin updates to categories, products, and product details). No quality attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall be easy to use.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly states the system shall be easy to use, which maps to usability. No details about UI appearance, performance, availability, security, or other quality attributes are given.

RequirementText: The shopping cart will clearly display the number of items in the cart, along with the total cost.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior to display item count and total cost (functional). The term 'clearly display' implies UI presentation and usability requirements, so Look & Feel and Usability are marked.

RequirementText: Customers will be able to confirm the order after checkout. If the order is incorrect, the customer will be able to revise and update their order.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user capabilities (confirm, revise, update orders) — clearly functional requirements. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The customer will then receive a confirmation email with the specific order details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must send a confirmation email containing specific order details to the customer. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customers will be presented with an unambiguous interface to assist in browsing the categories and products.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes an unambiguous interface to assist browsing—this concerns UI appearance/clarity (Look & Feel) and overall ease of use/navigation (Usability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customers will be able to search for products matching their search criteria.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (customers can search for products). It does not mention performance, security, usability, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The interface will be compatible with all major web browsers such as Internet Explorer, Mozilla Navigator, Mozilla Firefox, Opera, and Safari.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compatibility with major web browsers, which is a portability/compatibility concern. It does not address availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The system will implement an Application Interface to allow for various plug-ins to interact with the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies implementing an application interface (a functional capability). It also concerns operability/integration (allows plug-ins to interact with the system). It implies extensibility/modularity which supports maintainability.

RequirementText: Customers will also be able to add products into the shopping cart.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability (customers can add products to the shopping cart). It does not specify availability, performance, usability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system will do periodic backups through a live internet connection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system action (perform periodic backups) so it is functional. It also implies recovery/resilience behavior (backups for fault tolerance/recovery), so Fault Tolerance applies. No explicit statements about availability targets, security, portability, operability, performance, or other qualities were given.

RequirementText: The plug-in API will be well documented and specifications will be provided to plug-in developers.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies providing documentation and specifications for plug-in developers, which supports maintainability (ease of future development, extension, and understanding). It does not specify functional behavior, availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Yoggie shall coordinate on future enhancement and features with our organization.
AI_Rationale: The statement requires the product (Yoggie) to coordinate with the organization regarding future enhancements and features — this specifies a required behavior (functional). It also implies ongoing maintenance/feature evolution responsibilities, so Maintainability is applicable. It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal compliance, UI/look-and-feel, performance, portability, scalability, or operability concerns.

RequirementText: The system hardware shall be fixed and patched via an internet connection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how hardware is to be fixed/patched (update mechanism), which is a maintenance activity and an operational/administrative requirement. It does not explicitly state security, availability, scalability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The system should be able to run test shipping orders.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/feature (ability to run test shipping orders), which is a functional requirement. It does not state non-functional aspects such as performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: The system should be able to run test credit card transactions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (running test credit card transactions) which is a functional feature. It also implies an operational/testing capability (support for running test transactions), so marked as Operability. No explicit security, performance, scalability, etc. constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system should be able to create test environment of weborder system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (ability to create a test environment), which is a functional requirement. It also relates to operational/admin functionality (creating/managing test environments), so Operability is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall validate email address existence.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (validate that an email address exists). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system will employ on demand asynchronous loading for faster execution of pages.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies use of on-demand asynchronous loading to achieve faster page execution, which is a performance-related quality concern (speed/latency). It does not state functional behavior, availability, security, scalability, or other non-functional aspects explicitly, so only Performance is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall automatically compress image files that are too large in size.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (automatic compression of oversized image files). It does not state availability, performance targets, security, portability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: For returning customers, the system shall validate existing credit card in system after each log in.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (validate stored credit card for returning customers after each login), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention security, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall perform searches via Dijkstra s shortest path algorithm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the system shall perform searches using Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm. No availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system should be able to run under debug mode.
AI_Rationale: Request specifies a system capability (ability to run in debug mode) which is a functional requirement. Running in debug mode supports maintainability (debugging, diagnosing) and operability (administration/operation). No indication of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: The Application should be available always at working hours. Any maintenance or backup operation should be conducted out of working time.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies uptime during working hours and scheduling maintenance/backups outside working time — this is an availability requirement. Specifying when maintenance occurs is an operational/administrative constraint, so operability is also applicable. No mention of performance, security, scalability, portability, UI, legal, maintainability, or fault-tolerance.

RequirementText: Authentication is made by user name and a password for all users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the authentication mechanism (username/password) which is both a functional behavior (how users log in) and a security requirement (authentication controls). No mention of availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Administrative level working on administration computer.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a role/functional requirement (administrative level working on an administration computer) describing who/what operates the system; it does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Any administrative level user can delegate another user to execute some or all his authorized actions. And this user acquires the role of inventory administrator.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (delegation of actions and role assignment) — a functional behavior. It also pertains to authorization/roles (security concern), so SE is applicable. No explicit mention of availability, performance, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: It is mandatory that learning time is between 2 to 4 hours at maximum, because many task are delegated to working students.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum learning time (2–4 hours) for users, i.e. a learnability/usability requirement. No functional, performance, security, or other quality aspects are implied.

RequirementText: Web interface should use clear and consistence terminology in such a way that user; with basic experience on internet and office; find the application easy to use.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns the user interface terminology and ease of use for typical users — directly addressing usability. Consistent terminology also impacts look & feel of the UI, so LF is applicable. No indications of other NFRs.

RequirementText: The Application should be installed in any Microsoft or Unix platform.
AI_Rationale: Specifies installation on Microsoft or Unix platforms—this is a portability requirement (platform compatibility). It also pertains to operability/installation capability, so O and PO are appropriate. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Backup operation are executed periodically.
AI_Rationale: Specifies backup operations being executed periodically — describes a system function (backup) and implies fault tolerance/recovery capability. No mention of availability, security, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: All user are authenticated by user name and a password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies authentication (username/password), which is a security concern. It does not state operational, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects, so only SE is set.

RequirementText: Permission are assigned to user according to their roles.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes role-based permission assignment (access control), which is a security-related concern. It does not specify availability, performance, UI, or other quality attributes, so only Security is marked.

RequirementText: Only IT team member can access and maintain data base servers locally.
AI_Rationale: This requirement restricts access and maintenance of database servers to IT team members only, which is an authorization/access-control/security constraint.

RequirementText: Query is killed if takes more than 1 min.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum allowed execution time (1 minute) for queries; this is a performance/time constraint. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, operability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: It is important to design system to facilitated future evolution and facilitate maintenance operations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns designing the system to support future evolution and ease maintenance operations, which maps directly to maintainability (MN). No mention of availability, security, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Inventory is updated when user receive requested asset.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: updating inventory when a user receives a requested asset. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Web application should available to run on browsers like IE, Firefox, Chrome, Opera or Safari.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the web application must run on multiple browsers (IE, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Safari). This indicates cross-platform/browser compatibility, which maps to Portability. It does not mention availability, operability, performance, security, or UI look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Request is added to the waiting for execution list.
AI_Rationale: Statement describes a system behavior (adding a request to a waiting-for-execution list), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities are specified.

RequirementText: Any faculty member can add all related departments inventory.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (faculty members can add department inventory) — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Any administration level or authorised inventory group member can display all pending requests waiting for approval from this level and approve those requests.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (displaying pending requests and approving them) and includes an authorization constraint (only administration level or authorised inventory group members), which is a security/access control concern. No other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: Within the same department: data base can be updated directly without any request.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (allowing direct database updates within the same department) which is a functional behavior. It also has clear security/authorization implications (allowing updates without requests implies access control policy), so Security is relevant. No explicit statements about availability, performance, portability, maintainability, usability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, look-and-feel, or scalability are present.

RequirementText: Inter faculties transfer: request can be made by any authorised user and approved by faculty group or higher level.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability: authorised users can request inter-faculty transfers and approval workflow by faculty group or higher (functional). Mentions 'authorised user', implying authentication/authorization constraints (security). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Transfer outside university should be approved by the university group.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates approval for transfers outside the university, which is a compliance/legal policy constraint (L) and also relates to protection and control of data/asset movement (security, SE). It does not specify functional behavior, availability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Any administrative level user or inventory user can edit an asset that belongs to its department; same thing for faculty user, or university user; in order to make modification if he is authorised to do it.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (which users/roles can edit assets belonging to their department) and explicitly references authorization, implying an access control/security concern. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: All fields of an edited asset can be modified except Ids.
AI_Rationale: Specifies editable behavior of asset fields (which fields can be modified) — describes functional behavior/requirement. No explicit availability, security, UI, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Any DA group member or authorised inventory group member asset is owned by the department.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a data/ownership constraint (that assets associated with DA group members or authorised inventory group members are owned by the department), which defines functional behavior or a data-model rule. It does not explicitly impose availability, security, legal, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Inter departments: request must be approved by a DA group member and faculty group member unless it came from a higher level group.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a workflow/functional rule for request approval (who must approve under what condition). It defines system behavior (approval process) rather than a non-functional quality such as availability, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Any university group member can add all assets in the inventory.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability: university group members can add assets (functional). Also explicitly defines an authorization rule about who may perform the action, so it implies an access control/security constraint.

RequirementText: A bulk entry can be used to add many assets.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability (a bulk entry feature) — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, scalability, security, operability, maintainability, portability, legal, or look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: Request can be made by any authorised user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies who is permitted to make requests (authorization/access control), which is a security requirement.

RequirementText: After creation a request still pending waiting to be approved by an administrative level user according to that have this authority.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional workflow requirement (requests remain pending until approved by an administrative-level user). Also implies an authorization constraint (only users with appropriate authority can approve), so security (access control) is relevant.

RequirementText: An inventory user should check returned asset and update inventory.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action to check returned asset and update inventory—describes functional behavior (inventory management). No quality constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: IT group members can create a new space and modify floor structure when they receive an exception request from any administrative level.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies actions the system must allow (create new space, modify floor structure) tied to a specific role (IT group members) and condition (upon receiving an exception request) — this is primarily functional. The mention of a specific role being permitted to perform these actions implies authorization (security) concerns, so SE is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: When request is treated user is notified by email.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a system behavior (sending an email notification when a request is treated), which is a functional specification. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Data transmission format. Data is transmitted between Gemini and home Institutes using a FITS format and contains all header information provided with the data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the data transmission format (FITS) and required headers — a constraint on interoperability/operability. It does not state performance, security, portability, or other qualities explicitly, nor a functional behavior beyond format.

RequirementText: System-wide data capacity. The data capacity of the system is limited by transfer methods and technology, as well as archiving capacity on site. The system data capacity is capable of retaining 7 days of data produced by the largest instrument, the last 3 days of which must be available interactively from hard disk or similar medium.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system data capacity and retention constraints (7 days retained, last 3 days available interactively), which are resource/performance-related (storage/throughput/latency) and imply capacity/scalability concerns. It does not specify availability windows, security, legal, UI, or maintenance/operability requirements.

RequirementText: The system must allow for fast transmission of rough images every 0.5 sec. This may be assisted through the use of data-loss compression techniques (e.g. JPEG, MPEG, etc).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (allow transmission of images every 0.5s) and a performance constraint/technique (fast transmission, use of lossy compression). No indication of availability, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: In addition, there is the need for transmission of images matching the original resolution. This high-quality transmission must require less than 20 sec, and can only be assisted with loss-less compression.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement (transmission of images at original resolution) and a performance constraint (must complete in less than 20 seconds and use loss-less compression). No explicit availability, security, scalability, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: Every command must be accepted/rejected within 2 sec and before the corresponding action occurs. (This is different than the ACK/NAK response of the communications protocol - here, the target system must have examined the command and verified its validity.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that every command must be accepted or rejected within 2 seconds and before the action occurs, which defines a functional behavior (accept/reject commands) with an explicit timing/response constraint (performance). No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, security, usability, portability, scalability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or operability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The telescope and instrument software shall contain built-in test (BIT) facilities to verify Gemini 8m Telescopes system and Gemini 8m Telescopes software performances.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the software shall include built-in test facilities (a functional feature) to verify system/software performance. This implies maintainability (facilitates testing and verification) and operability (diagnostics/monitoring capabilities). It does not directly state availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: Requests of subsystems for status information must be answered within 5 sec and be possible in maintenance level operation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a response-time requirement (must be answered within 5 sec) → Performance. Also requires ability to operate in maintenance-level mode → Operability (administration/maintenance operation). No explicit legal, security, scalability, portability, usability, or maintainability constraints; not clearly a functional action beyond QoS, so Functional not set.

RequirementText: Requirements for response times within the user interfaces are given in the User Interface requirements section.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly refers to 'response times within the user interfaces', which is a performance-related quality attribute (latency/response time). It does not state usability, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Every Gemini 8m Telescopes software module shall have corresponding test specifications to check normal operation of releases, to be used both for acceptance tests and as an on-line test procedure.
AI_Rationale: Requires that each module have test specifications for acceptance and on-line test procedures, which directly addresses testability/maintainability and supports operational procedures/operability. No performance, security, legal, UI, portability, scalability, or functional behavior is specified.

RequirementText: The Gemini 8m Telescopes control software shall also provide for execution of self-test sequences of the Gemini 8m Telescopes system and subsystems. These shall automatically exercise all subsystems present in a given operational configuration.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (execution of self-test sequences). Such built-in testing supports maintainability (diagnostics, testing) and operability (administration/monitoring of system health). No explicit security, performance, availability, scalability, portability, legal, or UI aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Storage of data. Data from all instruments and detectors is stored as compressed data, using a standard format. There is a first level of storage within IOCs, to secure data in the event of link failures.
AI_Rationale: Specifies storing data from instruments in compressed standard format — a functional requirement. The mention of a first-level storage within IOCs to secure data during link failures implies resilience/recovery behavior (fault tolerance). It does not explicitly state availability metrics, security, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Status display update must be within 4 sec at the local stations (certain functions, such as telescope position, may have tighter constraints). Remote station update response is given in the Requirements for Remote Operations section.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a timing constraint for status display updates (within 4 seconds), which is a performance (timeliness/latency) requirement. It does not explicitly state functional behavior beyond the timing nor other qualities like availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Data acquisition format. Data is normally acquired as uncompressed data, but may be compressed using a loss-less compression technique for transmission from the Gemini system or across the system LAN. The goal of compression is to minimize bandwidth impact on the LAN and WAN and to save space on removable media.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the data acquisition format and allowed use of lossless compression for transmission and storage — this is a functional constraint on how data is handled (F). It explicitly aims to minimize bandwidth impact and save space, which are performance/resource concerns (PE). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, scalability, usability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Data flow. Data from detectors must be stored in the most effective method permitted by available technology. Astronomical data is often detector readout limited so that disk access and data transfer times are not significant.
AI_Rationale: Requirement prescribes how detector data must be stored (functional). It emphasizes using the most effective method given technology and notes disk/transfer times are not significant, which relates to performance (throughput/latency) and implies scalability to handle detector-limited data rates. No explicit availability, security, legal, UI, portability, maintainability, or operability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: For mosaicked, large optical detectors, a full readout of the detector must be done in about 2 or 3 minutes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a timing constraint (full readout must complete in ~2–3 minutes) which is a performance requirement. It mentions 'mosaicked, large optical detectors', implying handling of large-scale data, so scalability is also relevant. No functional behavior, security, availability, etc., are explicitly required.

RequirementText: All software bugs should be logged and then fixed as soon as possible after detection. The goal is to have restart conditions occur only on hardware failure.
AI_Rationale: Requires that bugs be logged (functional behavior) and fixed promptly (maintainability). Aim to avoid restarts except for hardware failures implies resilience to software faults (fault tolerance) and supports system availability/reliability.

RequirementText: Concurrent data access and display. Since the Gemini system supports monitoring of operation, there must be the capability of providing multiple, simultaneous access to data. Data transfer between the virtual telescope system and attached workstations therefore imposes significant transfer requirements on the LAN. The LAN must support a transfer rate of 20-40 Mbits/second.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capability for multiple simultaneous data access (functional) and a concrete LAN transfer-rate requirement (performance/bandwidth). No explicit availability, security, or other non-functional concerns stated.

RequirementText: The syntax of control flow commands is to be consistent across the system, whether accessing workstation software or IOC software.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates consistent syntax and command wording across system components, which pertains to look-and-feel (consistency of interface language) and usability (user experience, learnability). No explicit functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: All subsystems must respond to a common set of commands to test operational status, inquiries as to version, perform self-tests.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required behavior of subsystems to accept common commands (functional). Describes operational/admin capability for testing status, version queries and self-tests (operability). Other qualities like security or performance are not implied.

RequirementText: All IOC subsystems must respond to additional common commands for such activities as start, stop, initialize, reset parameters, etc.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that subsystems must respond to specific commands (start, stop, initialize, reset parameters), which defines functional behavior. It also clearly relates to operability/administration (ability to operate and manage subsystems). No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability are given.

RequirementText: Fault recovery, exception handling, fail-safe checks, etc. should be used to improve reliability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly calls out fault recovery, exception handling, and fail-safe checks (fault tolerance). The stated goal is to improve reliability/uptime, which strongly implies availability concerns. No other quality attributes (security, usability, maintainability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Handshaking of commands between IOCs must occur within 100-200 msec, signaling acceptance of each command.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional interaction (handshaking and signaling acceptance) with an explicit timing constraint (100-200 ms), indicating a performance/latency requirement.

RequirementText: For commands allowing delayed replies, timeouts for that reply must also be supported.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior requiring support for timeouts on delayed-reply commands (functional). Also implies fault-handling capability to handle unreturned/delayed replies, so fault tolerance applies.

RequirementText: Peak control information within the system is expected to be 100 TPS. This assumes bridging between communication sections, to isolate traffic in relevant sections only.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a peak throughput requirement of 100 TPS (performance). Mention of bridging and isolating traffic between communication sections implies architectural measures to handle load and containment, i.e., scalability.

RequirementText: For focusing and related activities, maximum acceptable detector readout time is about 0.1 sec, though only a portion of the detector may be read during that time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum acceptable detector readout time (latency) of ~0.1s for focusing activities, which is a performance (timing) constraint. It does not address availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other listed categories.

RequirementText: The support structure for communicating commands must be reliable, with a uniform ACK/NAK protocol adopted across all systems. Timeouts must be supported at approximately 500 msec.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies reliable communication with a uniform ACK/NAK protocol and timeouts (~500 ms). This implies fault tolerance (reliable delivery, acknowledgment handling, timeout/retry behavior). The 500 ms timeout is a timing/latency constraint mapped to performance. It does not explicitly state availability percentages, security, portability, or other concerns, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: When the current temperature value exceeds the current temperature setting by a pre -defined amount, the THEMAS system shall activate the appropriate heating or cooling unit.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (triggering heating/cooling when temperature exceeds a threshold), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The THEMAS shall provide the ability for the supervisor to select between two different types of reports: 1) the operational history of the THEMAS system for the past twelve months and 2) a statistical summary for any selected month.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (supervisor can select and obtain two types of reports). It does not state quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall provide the supervisor a mechanism to change the temperature setting of any of the thermostats in the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior — providing a mechanism for a supervisor to change thermostat settings — which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: For each event that is generated, the THEMAS system shall identify each event and generate the appropriate event data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (identifying events and generating event data), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: There are two events that shall result in an alarm condition: 1) an invalid temperature value is reported from a thermostat, or 2) the reported temperature has exceeded the defined limits. This process shall determine which alarm event is to be generated.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: conditions that must trigger alarm and the decision process to determine which alarm to generate. This is a functional requirement; it does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Once a request to turn on or off a heating or cooling unit, the THEMAS system shall provide the necessary control signal for the unit. This control signal shall also provide an indication of the unitâ€™s status at the requesting thermostat.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: providing control signal and status indication to thermostat. This is a functional requirement; it does not specify availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall control the heating and cooling units that are designated as part of the THEMAS system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: THEMAS shall control heating and cooling units. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, scalability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall control each of the heating and cooling units that are defined for the system. The THEMAS system shall limit the number of heating or cooling units t hat may be running simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional behavior (control heating/cooling units) and explicitly states a constraint on the number that may run simultaneously, which is a scalability/capacity constraint. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall determine wh en a reported temperature or a changed temperature setting exceeds the limits set by the overtemperature values. Temperatures that exceed the overtemperature limits shall be reported as such. Temperatures that do not exceed these limits shall be output for subsequent processing.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies specific system behavior: detecting when reported/changed temperatures exceed predefined overtemperature limits, reporting those that exceed, and outputting others for further processing. It describes functional processing and outputs; it does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: When a request for a heating unit or cooling to be turned is denied, an event shall be generated and the THEMAS system shall record that event. The information in these events will be used for creating statistical reports.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: generate and record an event when a heating/cooling request is denied and use the data for statistical reports. That is a functional logging/recording requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When the THEMAS system is initialized, it shall first turn off all the heating and cooling units. Then, it shall check all the thermostats and determine if any thermostatâ€™s settings require a heating or cooling unit to be turned on back on.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies explicit system behavior (initialization sequence and control of heating/cooling units based on thermostats), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall only respond to temperatures that are within a reasonable value.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavioral constraint—system should respond only when temperatures are within a reasonable range—so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall ensure the temperature reported by a given thermostat shall not exceed a maximum deviation value of 3 degrees Fahrenheit.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional constraint on system behavior: the system shall ensure reported thermostat temperature deviations do not exceed 3°F. It defines what the system must do (control/report accuracy) rather than availability, performance (latency/throughput), security, or other listed non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The trigger value is used in combination with the current temperature to determine when a heating or cooling unit shall be turned on or off.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behavior/logic for controlling heating/cooling based on trigger value and temperature — a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints are specified.

RequirementText: There shall be a maximum number of heating or cooling units that can be on at any given time. This procedure loads the maximum number of concurrently running units allowed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a behavioral constraint (limit on concurrent heating/cooling units) so it's functional; it also defines a capacity constraint related to system scaling/capacity, so marked as scalability.

RequirementText: Each thermostat shall have a unique identifier by which that thermostat is identified in the THEMAS system. This procedure will load these definitions into the THEMAS software.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement: each thermostat must have a unique identifier and a procedure to load those definitions into THEMAS (system behavior/interface). It also implies an operational aspect (the loading procedure into software), so Operability is marked. No explicit security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or usability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The definitions of the individual heating and cooling systems reside in an initialization file. The system shall read this file and the definitions shall be derived from the initialization data in the file.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system action: read an initialization file and derive definitions from it (functional behavior). It does not state availability, performance, security, operability, or other non-functional qualities, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall control the heating and cooling units that are defined as part of the THEMAS system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must control heating and cooling units. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall only respond to temperatures from the thermostats that are within the specified valid range.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (system shall only respond to valid-range temperatures). It also implies handling/ignoring invalid sensor inputs, which is a fault-tolerance/input-validation concern. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, or legal aspects mentioned.

RequirementText: When a user wishes to join a multi player game, they must: Enter their name, Choose an icon from a predetermined list, Choose which of the available games they wish to join.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies user actions and system functions for joining a multiplayer game (enter name, choose icon, select game), which are functional behaviors. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics beyond choosing an icon, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient must send this join information to the MultiMahjongServer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must perform (client sends join information to server), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: In a multi player game, each MultiMahjongClient must retrieve the following data from the MultiMahjongServer: Whether it must support a CO, The score limit for a hand, All players names, icons and seating positions, The tiles of the human and CO (optional) player supported on the MultiMahjongClient.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data that the client must retrieve from the server (behavioral/functional requirement). No explicit non-functional constraints such as performance, security, availability, portability, or usability are stated.

RequirementText: The list of un-started games that the MultiMahjongClient fetches from the MultiMahjongServer will be displayed in such a way that users can see the following information about each game: The name and icon of the player who created the game, The score limit for winning a hand, The number of places that still need to be filled before the game can commence.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI behavior: the client shall display a list of un-started games with specific information (creator name/icon, score limit, open slots) — this is functional. It also concerns what users should be able to see, implying a usability requirement, but does not address availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient will save the user preferences in a file and read them in when the program begins.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (saving and loading user preferences). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer must be able to handle requests in multi player mode of up to 10 simultaneous games (max 40 players).
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity to handle up to 10 simultaneous games (40 players) — a scalability requirement. It also implies performance/throughput constraints (ability to handle requests at that scale). No mention of uptime, fault tolerance, security, or UI, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The CO must respond within 1 minute in both single and multi player modes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a response time requirement (must respond within 1 minute) for both single and multiplayer modes, which is a performance/response-time non-functional requirement.

RequirementText: When a user selects the option to join an existing game, the MultiMahjongClient will retrieve a list of any games that still require players from the MultiMahjongServer.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when user chooses to join a game, the client retrieves a list from the server. This is a functional requirement describing interaction and data retrieval; it does not state non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient must be able to calculate possible Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong moves within 5 seconds of being informed of the last discard.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (calculating possible Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong moves) and a quantitative timing constraint (within 5 seconds), indicating a performance non-functional requirement. No mention of availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: As the data being exchanged between machines does not contain any private information and is not capable of undermining the system integrity of the computers connected to the MultiMahjongServer, encryption and protection of data are not needed.
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly addresses the need for encryption and protection of exchanged data, asserting they are not needed because the data is non-private and harmless. This directly pertains to security concerns (confidentiality/integrity decisions), so SE=1. It does not specify functional behavior, availability, performance, scalability, or other quality attributes, so other labels are 0.

RequirementText: Any user who creates or joins a game will be able to upload their own JPEG or GIF image that they wish to have displayed above their name, if they do not wish to use a preset icon.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to upload a JPEG or GIF avatar to display above their name), which is a functional feature. It does not explicitly state non-functional constraints such as security, performance, availability, or look-and-feel beyond the functionality, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: When a user creates a new single player game, they must: Enter their name, Choose an icon from a predetermined list, Set the score limit for winning a hand of Mahjong.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies explicit user actions and system functionality for creating a single-player game (enter name, choose icon, set score limit). This describes functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: Users who create a new game will be able to change the ability level of any CO involved in the game. There will be 3 levels available: Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/feature (users can set CO ability level with three options), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When the user begins the MultiMahjongClient program, they will be able to choose to create a new multi player game, to create a new single player game, to join an existing multi player game, or to quit the program.
AI_Rationale: Describes functional behavior available to the user at program start (create/join/quit). No quality attributes like availability, performance, security, etc., are specified.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient must send this game initialisation information to the MultiMahjongServer so that the MultiMahjongServer can create a new game.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (client must send initialization information to server so server can create a new game), which is functional. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will allow connections from MultiMahjongClients and communicate with them using IP.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability: allowing client connections and communication over IP, which describes functional behavior. No explicit quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will serve as a node for MultiMahjongClients. That is, it will be able to relay data received from one MultiMahjongClient to other MultiMahjongClients that request it.
AI_Rationale: Describes core system behavior (relaying data between clients) which is a functional requirement. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will automate the game initialisation functions, such as: randomising tile order, randomising seating position and storing the "Game Info" database.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behaviors (automating initialization: randomising tiles and seating, and storing game info) which are functional requirements. No non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will contain a High Scores list with the names and scores of the top MultiMahjong players.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system feature (maintain/display a High Scores list with names and scores of top players), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will be designed to reside on a central computer (server) that is connected to a TCP/IP network and has a unique IP address.
AI_Rationale: Specifies deployment/operational requirement that the server resides on a central machine connected to TCP/IP with a unique IP address—concerns operability/administration rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will allow players on MultiMahjongClient programs to modify their own names and icons during gameplay (as opposed to only at the beginning).
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall allow players to modify their names and icons during gameplay. It describes system behavior rather than availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will support an architecture whereby all Computer Opponents (CO) required will reside on it instead of on the MultiMahjongClient programs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system architectural behaviour (where Computer Opponents run), which is a functional/architectural requirement. It also implies an operational/deployment decision (centralized hosting), so Operability is relevant. No explicit statements about availability, performance, scalability, security, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will have a graphical user interface with which the administrator of the server can get log information and change game settings.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a graphical user interface that allows the administrator to view logs and change game settings — this describes functional capabilities (admin functions) and explicitly mentions a graphical UI (look & feel). It does not mention availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability as quality attributes, so those are not set.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will be able to save preferences to a file and read from that file at start-up.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: saving preferences to a file and reading them at start-up (persistence feature). No quality constraints like performance, security, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will allow players on MultiMahjongClient programs to chat with each other in real time.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (chat between clients) and explicitly calls out real-time communication, which implies performance/latency considerations. Other quality attributes (security, availability, scalability, usability) are not mentioned.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a School Zone from a list and provide the following information: Target School Zone, Plan.
AI_Rationale: Describes user-facing capability to select a School Zone and enter information — a functional requirement. Also implies usability (ability to select from a list) similar to provided example. No availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects specified.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a DMS from a list and provide the following information: Target DMS, Message to be displayed, Beacons On/Off.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies user actions and system behavior (select a DMS and provide fields), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Remote Control GUI shall be implemented using C/C++ and ESRI Map Objects.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies implementation technologies (C/C++ and ESRI Map Objects), which is an implementation/portability constraint affecting platform/technology compatibility. It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to issue a CCTV switching command: Source (input), Destination port (output).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to perform a CCTV switching command (source to destination) — a clear functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a CCTV from a list and provide the following information: Target CCTV, Device control including: Pan, Tilt, Zoom.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user-facing functionality (select a CCTV and control pan/tilt/zoom). It describes what the system should do; it does not state non-functional qualities such as availability, performance, security, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a Ramp Meter from a list and provide the following information: Target Ramp Meter, Plan.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action and system behavior (select a Ramp Meter and provide fields), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a HAR from a list and provide the following information: Target HAR, Text to be sent to the HAR.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action and data input (selecting a HAR and providing fields), which is functional behavior. It does not state any quality attributes such as usability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a Traffic Signal from a list and provide the following information: Target Traffic Signal, Plan.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user-facing functionality to select a traffic signal and enter related information; does not specify quality attributes like availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a HOV from a list and provide the following information: Target HOV, Plan.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (select HOV from a list and provide fields), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability constraints, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a Reversible Lane from a list and provide the following information: Target Reversible Lane, Plan.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user actions (select a Center, select a Reversible Lane from a list, provide fields) — this is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, usability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: A DATEX/ASN runtime library shall be available on any computer communicating to the C2C project.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that a runtime library must be available on any computer communicating with the project, which is a portability/compatibility requirement across target environments.

RequirementText: For each device command/control status request sent by the Remote GUI, the status returned from the network identifier will be displayed in a scrollable list on the GUI.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (displaying status responses for each request in the Remote GUI), and it also prescribes a UI presentation detail (a scrollable list), which relates to look-and-feel. No availability, performance, security, or other qualities are implied.

RequirementText: The C2C shall be able to operate in normal mode. In this mode the C2C receives data from all connected systems, including the Incident GUI, and combines the data into a single data store (database).
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies what the system should do in normal mode—receiving data from connected systems and combining into a database—so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, performance, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The C2C shall be able to operate in test mode. In this mode, the C2C performs normal mode operations and also logs activities.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (test mode) and behavior (perform normal operations and log activities) — therefore functional. Logging and a dedicated test mode aid maintainability (diagnosis, debugging) and operability (administration/monitoring), but no explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: The C2C Server shall execute in a Microsoft Windows NT environment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operating environment/target platform (Windows NT). This is primarily an operability/installability constraint and also a portability/platform compatibility constraint.

RequirementText: The web server application shall use ESRI s ARC Internet Map Server (ARC IMS) product for creating of map images.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required server product/technology (ESRI ARC IMS) for creating map images—an operational/deployment constraint about the environment, matching 'Operability'.

RequirementText: The C2C shall execute in a Microsoft Windows NT environment.

RequirementText: The C2C shall be implemented in the C/C++ programming language.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the implementation technology (programming language) which is an operational/implementation constraint for deployment and administration. Does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The C2C web interface shall be implemented using C/C++ and ESRI ARC IMS.

RequirementText: The Incident GUI shall be implemented using C/C++ and ESRI Map Objects.

RequirementText: The user shall be provided with the capability to select a network identifier for a device command/control request.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a Dynamic Lane from a list and provide the following information: Target Dynamic Lane, Plan.

RequirementText: When the GUI application is initiated, the user shall be prompted for the following information: User name, Password
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior of the system (prompting the user for username and password on GUI initiation). It does not explicitly state security, usability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Once an Center is selected, the user shall be able to select a LCS from a list and provide the following information: Target LCS, Assignment of lane arrows.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (user selects a Center, chooses an LCS from a list, and provides specific information), which is functional. RequirementText: The GUI shall allow a user to delete a previously entered lane closure.

No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, legal, operability, look-and-feel, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The Data Collector shall be designed to support the storage of TMDD data elements and message set information.

RequirementText: The C2C Project shall utilize the TMDD standard (including message sets) to transmit information.

RequirementText: TCP/IP shall be used to transmit the DATEX/ASN data.

RequirementText: The map shall display interstates and state highways on the graphical map.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functionality: the map must display interstates and state highways. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics beyond content, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The basemap data shall be derived from the North Central Texas Council of Governments (NCTCOG) Geo- Data warehouse.

RequirementText: The map user shall be able to alter the current magnification (zoom level) of the map.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to change zoom level), which is a functional behavior. It does not state any non-functional constraints such as performance, security, or usability details.

RequirementText: The map user shall be able to pan the map in each of the following directions: North, South, East or West.

RequirementText: Each link displayed on the map shall be color coded to provide a graphical depiction of speeds. A configuration file shall be provided to specify specific speed values. The color coding shall be as follows: Green - speeds ) TBD MPH, Yellow - speeds between TBD and TBD MPH, Red â€“ speeds below TBD MPH.

RequirementText: The map shall display the current incidents (as icons) known to the C2C Project.

RequirementText: DATEX/ASN shall be used to transmit the TMDD message sets.

RequirementText: There shall be a UNIX-based APAF system production computer with an archival system.

AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability: the system shall process all ASPERA-3 science data into IDFS data sets. It does not state performance, availability, security, scalability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Intermediate files of cleaned-up ASPERA-3 and MEX OA telemetry shall be generated in the event that cleaned-up telemetry is not provided by ESOC.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: generate intermediate cleaned-up telemetry files when ESOC does not provide cleaned telemetry (functional). Also describes a fallback/resilience behavior for missing input, which is a fault-tolerance requirement.

RequirementText: The ASPERA-3 and MEX OA telemetry data shall be stored on a local SwRI archive.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: telemetry data shall be stored on a local SwRI archive (where to store data). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The ASPERA-3 and MEX OA IDFS data sets shall be stored on a local SwRI archive.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies where the datasets shall be stored (a local SwRI archive), which is a functional requirement about system behavior (data storage). It does not explicitly state security, availability, portability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Any APAF-generated intermediate files of ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry shall be stored on a local SwRI archive.
AI_Rationale: Specifies where generated intermediate files shall be stored — a functional requirement about system behavior (data storage). No explicit non-functional qualities like security, availability, or maintainability are stated.

RequirementText: Web-based displays of the most current ASPERA-3 data shall be provided for public view.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional capability: providing web-based displays of current data for public viewing. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The APAF system shall process the engineering and ancillary information necessary for calibration and science validation into IDFS data sets.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a processing capability (‘shall process ... into IDFS data sets’), which is a functional behavior. No quality constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The web-based displays defined by the ASPERA-3 team to be used for science analysis shall be password protected until the ASPERA-3 data is made public.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control (password protection) for web displays until data is public, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/access control). No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality aspects mentioned.

RequirementText: The APAF ground data system shall have built-in error handling.
AI_Rationale: 'Built-in error handling' directly refers to handling faults and recovering/graceful degradation, which maps to Fault Tolerance. It does not explicitly state availability, maintainability, operability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The APAF system web server shall be password protected where appropriate to allow only pertinent ASPERA-3 team members access.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control via passwords to restrict access to authorized team members, which is a security (authentication/authorization) requirement. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Web-based displays defined by the ASPERA-3 team shall be provided where any available ASPERA-3 data (as opposed to just the most current) can be used for science analysis.
AI_Rationale: Specifies provision of web-based displays allowing any available ASPERA-3 data to be used for science analysis — this describes a required system capability (functional). It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: All internal interfaces are left to the design. The Software Design Documents of each of the seven components (see section 1.2) shall contain the detailed information of the internal interfaces.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates documenting internal interfaces in design documents, which primarily supports maintainability (ease of modification, understanding) and operability (system administration/interaction via documented interfaces). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When a user selects the View/Standard Error menu option, the HATS-GUI shall display the standard error screen showing all outputs written to the standard error stream since the most recent clearing of this data. The viewing of errors is detailed in Section 3.2.3.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-triggered behavior (selecting a menu option) and the system's response (display the standard error screen showing stderr output). It describes functional UI behavior rather than availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When a user selects the View/Standard Output menu option, the HATS-GUI shall display the standard error screen showing all outputs written to the standard output stream since the most recent clearing of this data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a GUI behavior: selecting a menu option must display a specific screen with stdout contents (functional). Also describes UI elements (menu and screen) which implies look-and-feel aspects.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow the user to continue working while transformations are taking place. Thus a user shall be able to edit files, view output, and transmit other problems to HATS-SML while waiting for HATS-SML to generate output.
AI_Rationale: Specifies GUI capability to allow users to continue editing, viewing output, and submitting other tasks concurrently while transformations run. This describes a functional capability (non-blocking behavior) and addresses usability/responsiveness for the user. No explicit availability, performance metrics, security, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow the user to execute a script file. A script file shall contain a linear sequence of HATS-SML programs. The HATS-GUI shall begin with the first command and execute the commands sequentially until either an error occurs or all commands in the script file have been executed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (allow user to execute script files, sequence of commands, stop on error) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints present.

RequirementText: When both an SDT and a pretty-printed text display corresponding to a single transformed target file are open, highlighting and cursor location motion shall be mirrored in the two windows. Thus, when a displayed node is selected in the SDT display, the corresponding text in the prettyprint window is highlighted. When the user scrolls to the end of the pretty-printed text display, the display of the SDT should also scroll to the corresponding displayed nodes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies interactive UI behavior (mirrored highlighting and synchronized scrolling) — it is a functional requirement about what the system should do and also pertains to the user interface/visual behavior (look & feel). It also impacts usability (improves navigation/interaction), so US is marked. No indications of performance, security, portability, availability, scalability, fault tolerance, legal, maintainability, or operability concerns.

RequirementText: When viewing an SDT, selecting nodes shall result in the highlight of all displayed nodes in the smallest well-formed tree of the selected nodes.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional UI requirement specifying behavior when nodes are selected (highlighting nodes in a well-formed tree). It also implies a visual/look-and-feel aspect (how selection is highlighted). It does not specify availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: When the system displays a navigation window, the user shall be able to select a current SDT location by clicking the mouse cursor in the navigation window. The center of the displayed graph will be the displayed node closest to the mouse cursor when the mouse is clicked.
AI_Rationale: Specifies interactive behavior of the UI (selecting a node by mouse click and centering the graph), which is a functional requirement and also defines user interface interaction/experience, so Look & Feel and Usability apply.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to resize windows dynamically. When displayed graph windows are resized, the HATS-GUI shall respond by utilizing the space available.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to resize windows (functional). Describes GUI behavior/layout in response to resizing (look & feel). Also impacts usability by improving dynamic layout and user interaction, so marked as usability.

RequirementText: The display of an SDT shall also result in the display of text from leaf nodes in a text display area.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (when an SDT is displayed also show leaf-node text) so it is functional. It describes UI/display content placement, which is a look-and-feel/display concern, hence LF. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When a user selects the View/Text menu option, the HATS-GUI shall prompt a user to select a pretty-printed text file in the current application. The viewing of text outputs is detailed in Section 3.2.3.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action and system response (menu option triggers prompting to select a file and view text). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be implemented in the Java 1.3 programming language.
AI_Rationale: Specifies implementation technology (Java 1.3), which is an operational/implementation constraint similar to the provided example labeled as Operability (O). Does not state portability, performance, security, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: When a user selects the View/SDT menu option, the HATS-GUI shall prompt the user to select an SDT file in the current application. The file list shall include SDTs in the application. The viewing of outputs is detailed in Section 3.2.3.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user action and system behavior (menu selection, prompt to select an SDT file, file listing), which are functional behaviors. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non‑functional constraints.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Application/Delete menu item, the HATS-GUI shall prompt the user to confirm the deletion operation. If the user confirms, all files in the application directory shall be deleted and the application directory itself shall be deleted. No application is currently selected at the end of this operation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: prompt for confirmation and perform deletion of files and directory, ending with no application selected. It does not specify availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Run/Execute Transforms menu option, the HATS-GUI shall execute the ApplyTransformations HATS-SML programs as described in Appendix D. This process is further described in Section 3.2.3.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when user selects menu option, the GUI shall execute ApplyTransformations programs. This is a functional requirement; no availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Run/Parse Program menu option, the HATS-GUI shall parse the selected transformation language program by using the ParseTlp HATS-SML programs as described in Appendix D. If no target program is selected, the HATS-GUI shall first prompt the user to select a transformation language program.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior when user selects Run/Parse Program (functional). Also describes UI interaction prompting the user when no program is selected, which affects usability.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Run/Parse Target menu option, the HATS-GUI shall parse the selected target program by using the ParseTarget HATS-SML programs as described in Appendix D. If no target program is selected, the HATS-GUI shall first prompt the user to select a target program.
