AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (parsing target on menu selection and prompting if none chosen). Involves user interaction/prompt behavior, so also impacts usability.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Run/Generate Parser menu option, the HATS-GUI shall generate the parser using the MakeParser HATS-SML program as described in Appendix D.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when user selects menu option, the system shall generate the parser using a specific program. No non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Configure menu options, the HATS-GUI shall provide a list of elements in the application configuration, allow the user to select an element, then prompt the user for a value for the configuration element.
AI_Rationale: This is a user-interaction requirement describing what the system should do (functional). It specifies GUI behavior and user prompts, which also implies usability concerns (ease of selecting/configuring), so US is set. No availability, security, performance, portability, etc. are mentioned.

RequirementText: When deleting an application directory, if the application directory contains a subdirectory, the system shall confirm the deletion of the subdirectory with the user before continuing. If the user does not confirm the deletion of the subdirectory, the application director shall not be deleted.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (confirm deletion of subdirectories and prevent deletion if not confirmed), i.e., functional interaction logic. It does not explicitly impose availability, security, performance, usability, or other NFR constraints.

RequirementText: The text displayed in the text display area shall correspond to the concatenation of the node labels (separated by spaces) of the leaf nodes of the displayed graph (in-order traversal, left to right). If a leaf displayed node corresponds to a non-terminal SDT node, the label in the text window shall be surrounded by pointed brackets (()). For example, if a non-terminal TERM appears in a leaf node, its text representation shall be (TERM). Appendix G gives an example of the display of text associated with an SDT.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies how text is presented/formatted in the display (concatenation, brackets, traversal order) — a look & feel / presentation constraint rather than availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Application/Save As menu item, the HATS-GUI shall prompt the user for a new application name. The HATS-GUI shall create a new directory at the same level as the currently selected application. All files in the application directory, including all subdirectories, shall be copied to the new directory, and the new directory shall become the currently selected application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies exact system behavior (prompt user, create directory, copy files, select new application)—a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability or other NFRs.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Application/Save menu item, the HATS-GUI shall save all application configuration information to nonvolatile storage.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-invoked operation to save application configuration to nonvolatile storage—a clear functional behavior (persisting configuration). It does not specify availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Application/Close menu item, the HATS-GUI shall close the currently selected application. No application is currently selected at the end of this operation. If changes have been made to the configuration but have not been saved, the user shall be prompted to save the configuration. If the user agrees, the configuration shall be saved. If the user does not agree, the configuration shall not be saved.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies specific system behavior (closing the selected application, prompting to save, and saving based on user choice), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Application/Select menu item, the HATS-GUI shall display a list of directory names in the current working directory, allow a user to navigate the directory structure, and allow a user to select a previously created application. This application becomes the currently selected application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies GUI behavior: displaying directories, navigation, and selection of an application — this is a functional requirement describing what the system shall do.

RequirementText: When a user selects the File/Exit menu option, the HATS-GUI shall request the host operating system to kill all currently active HATS-SML processes started by the HATS-GUI and halt the HATS-GUI process. If changes have been made to the configuration but have not been saved, the user shall be prompted to save the configuration. If the user agrees, the configuration shall be saved. If the user does not agree, the configuration shall not be saved.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies specific system behaviors and user interactions (terminate child processes, halt GUI, prompt to save, save based on user response), which are functional actions. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or explicit usability/look-and-feel quality constraints.

RequirementText: When a user selects the Run/Pretty-print menu option, the HATS-GUI shall execute the Prettyprint HATS-SML programs as described in Appendix D.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: when user selects a menu option, the GUI shall execute specific programs per Appendix D. This is a functional requirement; no explicit quality/constraint (usability, performance, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall provide for the copying of text from the text display area to a system buffer available for pasting into other applications (such as an editor).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a GUI capability (copying text to system buffer) which is a functional behavior. It also addresses usability by enabling users to transfer text to other applications, improving user interaction.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to view multiple SDTs simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (ability to view multiple SDTs simultaneously), which defines system functionality. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to expand displayed nodes (provided it is possible to expand the selected nodes). The HATS-GUI shall change the graph display by adding the descendant nodes to the displayed graph (thus changing the expandable nodes to internal nodes).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability and system behavior (expanding nodes and updating the graph display), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: When a user selects the File/Edit menu item, the HATS-GUI shall request that the operating system start a process and load that process with the editor specified by the application configuration. The name of a selected file shall be passed to the editor as a command line argument. The editor started by the HATS-GUI shall be the editor associated with the file in the application configuration, or if there is no editor associated with the file, then the editor associated with the file type of the file in the application configuration. If no editor is associated with either the file or the file type, then the default editor shall be used. If no default editor has been selected, then the HATS-GUI shall present a list of the configured editors and allow the user to select an editor. If no editors have been configured, then the HATS-GUI shall inform the user that an editor must be configured before starting an editor.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system behavior for launching an editor process, passing a filename, selecting associated editors or defaults, and presenting options to the user — this is functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, maintainability, scalability, or other non-functional quality constraints.

RequirementText: The GUI shall run on Windows 2000, Sun Solaris 8, and Linux operating systems without modification of the Java code.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the GUI must run on multiple operating systems without code modification, which is a portability requirement (cross-platform compatibility).

RequirementText: The user shall not be required to log in or authenticate his/her identity when using the system.
AI_Rationale: The statement is a system behavior requirement (functional) specifying that authentication must not be required. It directly concerns authentication, which is a security-related aspect (hence SE). It also affects ease of use by removing login steps, so US applies. No indication of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: One algorithm for displaying an SDT has been implemented and found to be unacceptable:Draw SDT into large virtual window with a smaller viewing area, Zoom in on portions of the tree;
AI_Rationale: Describes a UI display algorithm/approach for presenting an SDT (virtual window, viewport, zoom) indicating look-and-feel and usability concerns. No functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes are explicitly specified.

RequirementText: The complexity of the scrolling algorithms for text and displayed graphs shall not exceed O(n2) for n displayed nodes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies algorithmic time complexity bound (O(n^2)) for scrolling algorithms — a performance requirement. Also pertains to handling increasing number of nodes, implying scalability constraints.

RequirementText: The complexity of the tree search algorithm shall not exceed O(n2) for n nodes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an upper bound on algorithmic complexity (O(n^2)), which is a performance constraint and also impacts scalability as it defines how cost grows with input size. No indications of functionality, availability, security, etc.

RequirementText: The complexity of the text search algorithm shall not exceed O(n2) for n nodes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an upper bound on algorithmic time complexity (O(n^2)), which is a performance requirement and also directly relates to scalability with respect to input size (n nodes). No functional, security, availability, or other quality aspects are implied.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow a user to navigate through the display of an SDT with 10,000 nodes so that scrolling a screen width with any portion of the SDT displayed takes less than 3 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies GUI navigation responsiveness (time <3s) for scrolling a view with 10,000 nodes — it is a performance constraint (PE) and relates to the user interface/look-and-feel and usability (LF, US). No explicit availability, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or functional behavior beyond UI navigation is specified.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow a user to request transformations while HATS-SML is performing transformations or parsing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the GUI must allow users to request transformations concurrently while backend (HATS-SML) is performing parsing/transformations. Does not explicitly state availability, performance, concurrency QoS, security, or UI look-and-feel requirements.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall display 1,000,000 node SDTs in the same amount of time, plus or minus two seconds, as it takes to display a 10,000 node SDT.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that displaying 1,000,000 nodes must occur in the same time (±2s) as displaying 10,000 nodes — this is a performance (latency/time) constraint and directly concerns scalability (handling much larger data without time increase). No legal, security, usability, or other concerns are implied.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall display and SDT with 10,000 nodes in five seconds or less.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates a functional capability (display an SDT) with a quantitative time constraint (display 10,000 nodes in ≤5 seconds), which is a performance requirement. The specified node count implies scalability concerns as well. No indication of availability, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: When searching for text patterns, search begins at the location of the keyboard cursor and continues left-to-right, top-to-bottom until the end of the text is encountered. When the end of the text is encountered, search will continue from the start of the text until arriving back at the starting location.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behavior for text search (start position, direction, wrap-around). This is a functional requirement rather than a non-functional constraint.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall provide the user the capability to search the text display for text sub-strings. The search criteria are described in Appendix F. The user shall be prompted to enter a text string describing a string pattern. The HATS-GUI shall search the text for a matching pattern. When a match is found, the HATS-GUI shall highlight the matching text and center the display on the left-most element of the matching text. The keyboard cursor shall be set to this location. If no matches are found, the HATS-GUI shall display a message stating â€œNo Match Found.â€�
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing the search capability and specific behaviors (search, prompt, highlight, cursor placement) -> F. It prescribes visual presentation/behavior (highlighting, centering display) which relates to look-and-feel -> LF. It also specifies user interaction (prompting, message when no match) affecting usability -> US. No indications of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, fault tolerance, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Windows for pretty-printed text shall allow for scrolling left, right, up, and down if the text is too large to display in the window.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a UI function (allow scrolling in four directions when content is too large), so it is a functional requirement. It also directly addresses ease of use/navigation of content, so it is a usability concern. No indications of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal/look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: Selected pretty-printed text shall be displayed in a separate window.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies visible behavior (displaying selected text in a separate window) — functional. The term 'pretty-printed' refers to presentation/formatting, implying a look-and-feel concern.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select pretty-printed text files to display.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user-facing capability (select and display files) => Functional. The term 'pretty-printed' indicates a presentation/visual formatting concern (look and feel), so LF is marked. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The formatting of the displayed pretty-printed text shall be faithful to the formatting represented in the pretty-printed text file. No additional white space shall be inserted, and a fixed width font shall be used to display the text.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system must display text (faithful formatting, no extra whitespace, use of fixed-width font). This is a functional requirement about presentation with strong look-and-feel/UI constraints, so labeled F and LF.

RequirementText: SDT displays shall provide the user with the option to refresh the display. When a display is refreshed, the current display is erased, the SDT file is read, and a new SDT display is generated. The new SDT display shall approximate the previous SDT display by expanding the SDT to the same number of nodes, if this is possible.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user-facing behavior for refreshing the SDT display (functional). Also constrains the resulting display to approximate the previous layout/appearance (look & feel). No availability, performance, security, etc. requirements are stated.

RequirementText: SDT displays shall also provide the user with a view of text associated with the leaves of the displayed sub-tree. This text shall be copy-and-pasteable in the host operating system. Thus, text displayed in a HATS-GUI window can be pasted into other applications such as text editors that may be running concurrently with the HATS-GUI.
AI_Rationale: Specifies GUI behavior (display text and enable copy-and-paste) — a functional requirement. The copy-and-pasteability affects ease of use/interoperability for end users, so also classified as usability. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall provide the function to fully expand a sub-tree regardless of the node expansion level in the application configuration.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a GUI capability to expand a subtree regardless of node expansion level. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow the user to expand the SDT by a predetermined number of node levels. The number of levels expanded is set in the application configuration.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a GUI feature allowing users to expand the SDT by a configured number of node levels — a functional requirement. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: After issuing the unhide instruction, a user shall be able to issue a rehide instruction that reverses the unhide instruction. All displayed nodes hidden before the most recent unhide instruction shall become hidden.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-invokable behavior (unhide then rehide) and the expected system state changes (which nodes become hidden). It describes functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to issue an unhide instruction that reverses the hide instruction for all displayed nodes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (issuing an 'unhide' instruction to reverse a 'hide' action) describing system behavior, which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to hide a set of selected displayed nodes. The HATS-GUI shall change the display by removing the selected nodes from the display and changing the parent and descendant nodes of the removed nodes to nodes with hidden descendants and parents, respectively.
AI_Rationale: This describes a specific user-facing capability and how the GUI should change (behavioral requirement), so it is a Functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or UI aesthetics constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to collapse displayed nodes. The HATS-GUI shall change the displayed graph by removing all descendants of the selected displayed nodes (thus changing the internal nodes to non-expandable leaf nodes).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability and the system behavior required to collapse nodes in the GUI (removing descendants and updating node expandability). It describes functional behavior of the system rather than quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to display more than one SDT at a time. Each SDT shall be displayed in a separate window.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability to display multiple SDTs concurrently in separate windows (what the system should do). Does not assert availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics beyond behavior, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: When a user selects the File/Delete menu item, the HATS-GUI shall prompt the user to confirm the deletion operation. If the user confirms, the currently selected file shall be deleted. No file shall be currently selected at the end of this operation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies explicit system behavior for a user action (prompt for confirmation, delete selected file, ensure no file remains selected). It is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Prior to starting the execution of a script file, the display screens for the standard error and the standard output shall be cleared.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (clearing the stdout/stderr displays before script execution) — a functional obligation. It also pertains to the presentation/state of the display screens, relating to user interface/display behavior, so Look & Feel is applicable. No explicit reliability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: When a user selects the File/Select menu item, the HATS-GUI shall provide the user with a list of files in the currently open application and allow the user to select a file. This file becomes the currently selected file. If no application is currently open, the HATS-GUI will prompt the user to select and open an application, then prompt the user to select a file.
AI_Rationale: Describes user-facing behavior for selecting files in the GUI (functional). Specifies user prompts and selection flow, which affects usability (ease of use), but does not address availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The Configure/File Associations menu item shall provide an interface for associating files in an application. File associations are shown in Table 6.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a menu item that provides an interface for associating files—this is a functional requirement. It explicitly references an interface (UI element), which implies look-and-feel/user interface concerns; no explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or usability metrics.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow the user to select the shapes for types of displayed nodes in a displayed graph. At a minimum, the system shall provide two shapes, rectangles and ellipses, for displayed nodes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (allow user to select node shapes), so it is functional. It also concerns visual presentation (shapes of nodes), which pertains to look-and-feel, and impacts usability by providing user choices, so US and LF are marked. No indication of availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow the user to select the colors for types of displayed nodes in a displayed graph. At a minimum, the system shall provide eight colors (red, yellow, white, black, green, blue, orange, and violet) for displayed nodes.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a GUI capability (functional) to let users select node colors and explicitly mandates color options, which concerns the visual appearance (look & feel). Allowing color selection also affects usability (customization for users), so US is included. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow the user to specify the number of levels of nodes to expand during SDT viewing.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (GUI allowing user to specify expansion levels for SDT viewing), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The Configure/Node Display menu item shall provide an interface for configuring the display of nodes.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (a menu item that provides an interface to configure node display), so it is a functional requirement. It does not impose availability, UI appearance details, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The Configure/Editors menu item shall provide an interface for the user to enter editor configuration information. This information shall be used when editors are started as processes.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system feature: a Configure/Editors menu item that provides an interface for entering editor configuration and that the information is used when editors are started. It describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, UI look-and-feel, usability, security, operability, or other non-functional aspects, so those labels are set to false.

RequirementText: The Application/Delete menu item shall provide an interface for deleting an application and all the files in the application directory. The HATS-GUI shall prompt the user to confirm deletion prior to completing this action.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional feature (delete application and files) and requires a user confirmation prompt (usability/interaction requirement). No availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The Application/Save-as menu item shall provide an interface for saving an application and its associated files under a different name.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (a Save-as menu item that provides an interface to save an application and its files under a different name). It describes what the system should do rather than availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Application/Save menu item shall provide an interface for saving application configuration information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional feature: a menu item that provides an interface to save application configuration. It does not mention availability, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The Application/Close menu item shall provide an interface for closing an application.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior (the menu item shall provide an interface to close an application). It does not state availability, security, UI aesthetics, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The Application/Select menu item shall provide an interface for selecting and opening an application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (a menu item providing an interface to select and open an application). It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, usability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The File/Exit menu item shall provide an interface for exiting the HATS-GUI.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional requirement: a menu item that provides an interface to exit the GUI. No quality attributes like availability, security, usability, or look-and-feel are implied.

RequirementText: The File/Delete menu item shall provide an interface for deleting a selected file. The HATS-GUI shall prompt the user to confirm deletion prior to completing this action.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: a File/Delete menu providing interface to delete a selected file and prompting user to confirm before completing. This is a functional requirement (includes confirmation behavior); no explicit non-functional attributes like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The File/Save-as menu item shall provide an interface for saving a previously selected file under a different name.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (a Save As menu item and interface to save a selected file under a different name). It does not state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, usability, or other non-functional quality constraints.

RequirementText: The File/Edit menu item shall provide an interface for starting an editor as an external process. The editor shall be started according to information in the application configuration.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (menu provides interface to start external editor based on configuration). No explicit non-functional constraints (security, usability, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The File/Select menu item shall provide an interface for selecting files within the currently open application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: providing an interface (menu item) for selecting files within the application. It does not state availability, security, performance, UI appearance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The View menu shall contain items related to viewing HATS-SML output.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies UI content/structure (the View menu shall contain items related to viewing output), which pertains to look-and-feel. It does not state performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes, nor an operational or maintenance concern.

RequirementText: The Run menu shall contain items related to executing the HATS-SML programs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the contents/structure of a UI menu (the Run menu) — a look-and-feel/layout requirement. It does not specify operational, performance, security, or availability constraints, nor broader usability goals.

RequirementText: The Configure menu shall contain items related to modifying the configuration of the application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies presence and placement/content of a UI menu (Configure menu contains configuration-related items). This is a look-and-feel/UI requirement similar to the provided navigation-menu example; it does not state operational, performance, security, or functional processing details.

RequirementText: The Application menu shall contain items related to manipulating entire applications.
AI_Rationale: Specifies presence/content of a UI menu (application-level menu items). This is a look-and-feel/user interface layout requirement rather than security, performance, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The File menu shall contain menu items related to manipulating individual files and for closing the HATS-GUI application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete UI feature (the File menu must contain items for file manipulation and closing the application), which is a functional behavior. It also addresses the interface content/structure (menu items), aligning with Look & Feel concerns. It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or general usability criteria.

RequirementText: Output pretty-printed text files and SDTs shall only be displayed when the user requests.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior about when outputs are displayed (display only on user request). No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability) are stated.

RequirementText: For any operation where the user is prompted to select from a list, the user shall be able to cancel the operation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (cancel selection) — a functional requirement — and relates to ease of use/interaction, so also classified as usability.

RequirementText: Any operation requiring the user to supply a file name shall allow the user either to select the files from a list derived from files in the currently open application or to key in a file name, a relative path name, or a complete path name.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability (how file-name input must behave), so it is functional. It prescribes an interaction option (select from list or type path), which is a usability/user-interface requirement, so US is set. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: When a user selects the File/Save As menu item, the HATS-GUI shall prompt the user to enter a new name. A new file shall be created in the currently open application with the newly entered file name. The contents of the selected file shall be written into the new file, and the new file shall become the currently selected file.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies specific system behavior for the File/Save As action (prompting for name, creating a new file, copying contents, selecting the new file), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability quality constraints, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: The Configure/HATS-SML menu item shall provide an interface for the user to enter implementation-dependent information for starting HATS-SML processes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system feature: a menu item that provides an interface for the user to enter information to start HATS-SML processes. It describes functional behavior (what the system should do) and does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The Run/Generate Parser menu item shall provide an interface for generating a parser program.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional capability (a menu item that provides an interface to generate a parser program). It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: When collecting generated output files from HATS-SML, the HATS-GUI shall overwrite any file whose name is generated automatically. For example, given a transformation language program X.tlp, the file X.tlp.parsed is generated when the parser is executed. If X.tlp.parsed existed prior to executing the parser, it shall be overwritten without prompting the user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior of the GUI (automatic overwrite of generated files) and explicitly requires no user prompt (usability concern). No availability, security, performance or other NFRs are implied.

RequirementText: The Run/Parse Program menu item shall provide an interface for selecting and parsing transformation language programs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (menu item providing an interface to select and parse transformation language programs). It does not state non-functional constraints such as performance, security, usability, or availability, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The Run/Parse Target menu item shall provide an interface for selecting and parsing target programs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a menu item that provides an interface to select and parse target programs — describing system functionality. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The keyboard cursor shall be set to the location of the mouse cursor when the pointing device is clicked.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a concrete UI behavior (the system must set the keyboard cursor location when clicking), so it is functional. It also defines user interface interaction/behavior affecting look-and-feel and usability (cursor behavior improves user interaction), so LF and US are marked. No availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are implied.

RequirementText: Each display window shall have a keyboard cursor to track the current location in the display.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that each display window must provide a keyboard cursor (a UI element/behavior) — this is a functional requirement about what the system must provide and also concerns the look-and-feel/presentation of the display window. No availability, performance, security, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: Each active display window shall have a mouse cursor, which indicates the location of the pointing device in the window.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user interface element (presence and behavior of mouse cursor) which is primarily a look-and-feel constraint. It also impacts usability (indicating pointer location), so Usability is marked as well. No indications of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Display windows opened by the system shall have buttons for closing the windows.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a UI element (close buttons on windows), which pertains to look-and-feel of the interface. It does not specify operational, performance, security, portability, or explicit usability constraints beyond the visual/control presence, nor is it framed as a functional behavior beyond UI appearance in similar examples.

RequirementText: The system shall open a new window when the user selects to display output.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior (opening a new window) in response to a user action, which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, look-and-feel constraints, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall display output written to the standard output and standard error streams in a tab-selectable window. Text in this window shall be cleared prior to executing individual HATSSML programs, unless the programs are contained in a program script. In the case of a script, the window contents shall be cleared prior to executing the script. Refer to section 3.2.3.2 for a discussion of the execution of script files.
AI_Rationale: Specifies GUI behavior: display of stdout/stderr in a tab-selectable window and clearing rules before execution — this is a functional requirement about UI behavior and also relates to look-and-feel/layout of the output window.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall suggest a file name for the user whenever it prompts the user to enter a file name. The HATS-GUI shall suggest the same file name for files copied to a different directory. The HATS-GUI shall suggest a file name with a sequentially numbered extension for files copied to the same directory. For example, if NatLang.txt exists, a suggested file name would be NatLang.txt.2.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies concrete behavior of the HATS-GUI (how it should suggest file names in various copy scenarios), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintenance, operability, legal, or look-and-feel concerns. Although it aids usability, the statement defines specific functionality rather than a general usability quality, so US is not set.

RequirementText: There shall be exactly one file describing the interpretation of function symbols associated with an application. This file shall be written in ML and have the file extension .lib.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required artifact (a single file) and its format/extension — this is a functional/structural requirement about what the system/application must provide. It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: There shall be exactly one file describing the grammar of inputs associated with an application. It shall have the file extension .grm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint on the system artifact (there shall be exactly one grammar file with .grm extension). It defines what must exist rather than an NFR like performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: There shall be exactly one file describing the lexical specification of inputs associated with an application. It shall have the file extension .spec.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system artifact and naming/quantity constraint (one file with .spec extension), which defines functional behavior/structure rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: The directory in which application files are stored shall be named with the application name.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a deployment/operational naming convention for application file directories, which impacts operability (deployment, administration) and also aids maintainability (consistency for developers/administrators). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The keyboard cursor shall be movable by the arrow keys.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior (keyboard cursor movement via arrow keys), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall allow a user to create an application minimally consisting of a lexical specification file, a grammar file, a user-defined functions file, and application configuration information. The user shall be able to name this application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (creating and naming an application composed of specific files) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: All files associated with a given application shall be stored in one directory.
AI_Rationale: Specifies where application files must be stored (a storage/behavioral requirement) — primarily a functional constraint about data organization. Does not explicitly state maintainability, operability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Run/Pretty-print menu item shall provide an interface for selecting SDTs and pretty-print style files and formatting the SDT according to the style.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a menu item providing an interface and behavior (selecting SDTs and style files, formatting) — this is functional. It also mandates presentation/formatting according to styles, which relates to look-and-feel, so LF is set. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The View/SDT menu item shall provide an interface for viewing, navigating through, and searching SDTs output from the execution of transformation programs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a menu item that provides an interface for viewing, navigating, and searching SDT outputs — this describes functional behavior (what the system should do). No quality attributes (usability, security, performance, etc.) are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: The View/Text menu item shall provide an interface for viewing and searching pretty-printed text.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (providing an interface for viewing and searching pretty-printed text), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state usability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The View/Standard Error menu item shall provide an interface for viewing error strings collected from HATS-SML.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: a menu item that provides an interface to view error strings (Functional). It also describes a user-facing interface/menu item, implying usability concerns (Usability). No explicit statements about security, availability, performance, scalability, portability, fault tolerance, maintainability, operability, or legal/visual styling details, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The Run/Execute Transforms menu item shall provide an interface for selecting and executing transformation language programs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability: a menu item that provides an interface to select and execute transformation programs — a functional requirement. No explicit quality attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The View/Select Text menu item shall provide an interface for selecting pretty-printed text or text strings associated with SDT displays.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability: a menu item that provides an interface for selecting text associated with SDT displays, which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, security, performance, UI aesthetics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The View/Copy Text menu item shall provide an interface for copying selected text into an operating system buffer.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: a menu item shall provide an interface to copy selected text into the OS clipboard. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The HATS-GUI shall interface with HATS-SML (version 2.0) in order to parse transformation language programs, execute transformation language programs, and create output SDTs, error messages, pretty-printed text, and parsed transformation language programs. The interface shall consist of starting HATS-SML programs and passing command line arguments and capturing data written to the standard output and standard error streams of the HATS-SML processes. The HATS-SML programs and their command line arguments are described in Appendix D.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional requirements for the HATS-GUI to interface with HATS-SML (parse, execute, create outputs, pass args, capture stdout/stderr) — clearly functional. Mentions HATS-SML version 2.0 and command-line compatibility, implying a portability/compatibility constraint. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The GUI shall allow the user to create, modify, copy, or delete applications or files regardless of the current status of HATS-SML.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies GUI functionality to create/modify/copy/delete applications or files — a clear functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, fault tolerance, usability, security, or others, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: If the HATS-GUI attempts to start a HATS-SML program and fails, the HATS-GUI shall notify the user by displaying the following message: â€œUnable to start HATS-SML.â€� The HATS-GUI shall provide any other details related to the failure that are available from the Host OS. Examples of information available from an operating system include indications that a specified file does ot exist, that a file cannot be opened due to file protection violations, or that errors occurred during I/O operations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system behavior (display a specific error message and include OS-provided failure details), which is functional. It also prescribes informative error reporting to the user, which impacts usability (clear feedback), so US is set. It does not mandate availability, recovery, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or operability concerns explicitly.

RequirementText: The View/Standard Output menu item shall provide an interface for viewing debugging information collected from HATS-SML.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system function: a menu item that provides an interface to view debugging information (functional). Also references a UI element (menu item/interface), so Look & Feel applies. No mention of security, performance, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Processing â€“ all data processing functions shall be chainable (outputs pipeable to inputs) and repeatable in the processing pipeline in cases where this makes computational sense.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies behaviour of processing functions (must be chainable and repeatable) — this is a functional requirement. It also implies a design-for-maintainability/reusability constraint (modular, composable processing), so Maintainability is marked. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, scalability, security, portability, fault tolerance, operability, legal, look & feel, or usability.

RequirementText: Error Handling â€“ the system shall be capable of flagging and marking corrupted data segments and proceeding without interruption or effect on other data. This includes, but is not limited to, partial data, zero data, underflows, overflows, infinities, and NaNâ€™s whether obtained on input or arising during processing.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies behavior (flagging corrupted data and proceeding) — functional. It explicitly requires graceful handling so processing of other data is unaffected and no interruption — this is fault tolerance. Ensuring continuation without interruption implies availability/reliability concerns, so Availability is also applicable. No explicit security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI, maintainability, or operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Management â€“ all management software functions shall take optimal advantage of all language, compiler and system features and resources to reduce overheads to the minimum practical level.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates minimizing overhead by leveraging language, compiler, and system features—this is a performance/efficiency constraint; no explicit availability, security, portability, scalability, or other concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Applications â€“ all math/science application software shall take optimal advantage of all language, compiler, and system computational features and resources to reduce run times to the minimum practical level.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates optimizing use of language, compiler, and system features to minimize run times, which is a performance-oriented quality attribute. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, scalability, usability, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Excess Storage â€“ The BE System shall have sufficient storage (memory and/or disk) with sufficient access speeds to meet short duration Correlator bursting demands (level TBD) plus a standby reserve (amount TBD) to meet reliability needs and handle outage recovery demands.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies non-functional capacity and speed characteristics: 'sufficient storage... access speeds' maps to Performance. It requires standby reserve to meet reliability and outage recovery and meet demands, which implies Availability and Fault Tolerance. It does not address legal, UI, security, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: Memory â€“ The BE System shall have sufficient (amount TBD) memory with sufficient (rate TBD) access speeds to accomplish all processing tasks while avoiding loss or delay on the input and output data streams.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies memory capacity and access speeds to prevent loss or delay of data streams — this is a performance/resource constraint (throughput/latency). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: CPU â€“ The total processor capability of the BE System shall be (combination of numbers of processors and individual processor speed) sufficient to accomplish all processing tasks while avoiding loss or delay on the input and output data streams.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies CPU capacity to prevent processing delays and data loss on input/output streams — this is a performance requirement (throughput/latency) and implies scalability/capacity to handle load. It does not address availability, fault tolerance, security, or other categories explicitly.

RequirementText: Output â€“ The BE System shall be capable of delivering an output data stream to the e2e System of a minimum of 25 MBytes/sec. This includes resends and simultaneous transfer of data stored due to a previous e2e connection outage. This must be done simultaneously with the output stream, but not necessarily over the same interconnects. This is an initial deployment specification and will be increased over time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies numeric throughput requirement (25 MBytes/sec) => Performance. States this includes resends and transfer after an e2e connection outage => implies fault-tolerance/recovery handling. Notes that this is initial and will be increased over time => scalability. No functional behavior, security, availability, portability, etc., are explicitly required.

RequirementText: Input â€“ The BE System shall be capable of accepting an aggregate data input stream from the Correlator of a minimum of 1.6 Gbytes/sec. This must be done simultaneously with the output stream, but not necessarily over the same interconnects. This is an initial deployment specification and will be increased over time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data throughput (1.6 GBytes/sec) and simultaneous input/output—this is a performance (throughput/latency) constraint and notes future increases, implying scalability. No security, availability, or usability aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: I/O â€“ all input and output, and storage and retrieval operations shall take optimal advantage of all system resources to reduce overhead and latency to the minimal practical level.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns minimizing overhead and latency of I/O and storage operations by using system resources efficiently, which is a performance-quality constraint. It does not specify functionality, availability, security, scalability, or other categories.

RequirementText: Operations Activities â€“ the system shall continue operations, although not necessarily at full capacity, on all unaffected resources during partial shutdowns for maintenance, repair and/or upgrade.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system shall continue operations (possibly degraded) on unaffected resources during partial shutdowns for maintenance/repair/upgrade. This directly concerns availability and graceful degradation/resilience (fault tolerance). It does not specify legal, performance, security, portability, scalability, usability, or maintainability metrics, nor an explicit operability/admin feature.

RequirementText: Software Coding Practicesâ€“ software system and application code shall be well documented and written in a generally familiar language or languages (preferably not more than two). Software shall be written in a style that is easily readable and using practices that allow for minimal confusion.
AI_Rationale: The requirement prescribes coding practices, documentation, choice of familiar languages, and readable style to reduce confusion—these directly target maintainability (ease of modification, understanding, and onboarding). It does not specify runtime performance, availability, security, UI look-and-feel, portability, scalability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: Hardware â€“ complete and comprehensible hardware systems specifications and configuration information shall be readily available.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that hardware specifications and configuration information be readily available — this supports operability (administration, configuration, deployment) and maintainability (ease of maintenance, understanding system configuration). It does not address availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: Replaceability â€“modular design principles shall be employed to the maximum extent possible. Maximal practical use of available â€œhot- swappableâ€� devices and components shall be made.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates modular design and hot‑swappable components, which directly target replaceability/maintainability (MN). Hot‑swappability also implies improved availability (A) and supports fault tolerance/ graceful recovery (FT). It also impacts operability/administration (O) by enabling easier component replacement without downtime.

RequirementText: Test Mode â€“ the system shall be able to handle non-real-time operations in a transparent fashion (i.e., as if real-time). Note: non-real-time refers to input data from a source other than the Correlator (defined as real-time).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (Test Mode) to handle non-real-time operations 'as if real-time' — this implies both a functional capability (ability to process non-real-time inputs) and a performance/timing quality constraint (treating them with real-time behavior). No explicit mentions of availability, scalability, security, etc.

RequirementText: Formatted Output â€“ The BE shall deliver formatted final results to the e2e System. The BE shall produce all data needed by the e2e System for archiving and further processing. The output is currently expected to be in a form compatible with AIPS++ Measurement Sets.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the backend (BE) must do: deliver formatted final results and all data for archiving/processing (functional). It also mandates compatibility with a specific data format (AIPS++ Measurement Sets), which implies interoperability/portability requirements, so Portability is set. No explicit availability, performance, security, legal, UI, scalability, maintainability, operability, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Debug/Test Messages â€“ The BE shall provide several optionally selectable levels of printed messages detailing operational parameters at critical locations in the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (providing selectable debug/test message levels). It explicitly supports operability (monitoring/diagnostics) and also contributes to maintainability (facilitates debugging and testing). No indications of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Error and Warning â€“ The BE shall provide error and warning reports to M&C as operating conditions warrant.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (provide error/warning reports). Implies fault-handling/diagnostics (FT) and supports maintainability (helps troubleshooting). Reporting to M&C is an operability/monitoring requirement (O). No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: Operational Status and Control â€“ The BE shall provide operational status data to and receive control data from the M&C System. This includes Lag Frame destination addresses and address changes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: providing operational status data and receiving control data (data exchange with M&C). It also implies operability/management aspects (monitoring and control integration), but does not mention availability, security, performance, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Meta-data â€“ The BE shall receive, via M&C, all meta-data necessary to format BE results for delivery to the E2E.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies required system behavior (the BE shall receive metadata via M&C to format results for delivery), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, operability or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: General - Operating system, message passing and other middle-ware, and programming language(s) used shall follow industry standards and be commonly available and widely used. Availability of source code for the OS will be very important.
AI_Rationale: Spec mandates use of industry-standard, widely available OS/middleware/languages which impacts operability (manageability/administration), maintainability (common tech and source availability ease maintenance), and portability/compatibility (widely used platforms). No explicit performance, security, legal, or UI requirements stated.

RequirementText: Observational Mode â€“ The BE shall receive, via M&C, data and parameters specific to the current EVLA Observational Mode needed for processing the Correlator Lag values.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the back-end (BE) shall receive specific data/parameters via M&C for processing correlator lag values. It describes what the system must do; it does not impose availability, fault-tolerance, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Data Integrity â€“ the Backend System shall maintain input data fidelity and dynamic range across all processing, manipulation and I/O functions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the backend must maintain data fidelity and dynamic range across processing and I/O — this is a functional obligation (what the system shall do) and a data integrity/security concern (ensuring data is not corrupted). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, UI, usability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Auto-correction â€“ the Backend System shall be self-monitoring. It will be capable of detecting, reporting on and automatically taking action to remedy or lessen the impact of, at a minimum, the following types of abnormal conditions: processor hardware failure, operating system hangs or crashes, computational performance below minimum specifications, computational error rates above maximum specification, internal communications failures, and external (with the Correlator and E2E) communications disruptions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a self-monitoring, self-correcting capability (functional behavior) focused on detecting/reporting and automatically remedying failures—this is primarily Fault Tolerance. It also implies operability (monitoring/reporting/manageability) and maintainability (self-diagnosis aids maintenance). Because the goal is to lessen impact of failures and communications disruptions it implicitly targets availability. No explicit statements about security, performance metrics, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: Hardware â€“ I/O, communications, and processing hardware shall be easily expandable, reconfigureable, augmentable and replaceable to meet increasing data transfer and processing demands imposed by EVLA science, Correlator changes, and availability of new hardware.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies hardware must be easily expandable, reconfigurable, augmentable and replaceable to handle increasing data/processing demands. This primarily concerns scalability (ability to grow) and implies maintainability (replaceable, reconfigurable) and operability/administrability. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, or performance metrics.

RequirementText: Hardware â€“ the hardware part of the system shall be able to perform indefinitely without complete loss of service, except in the event of total failure of primary and backup power.
AI_Rationale: Specifies continuous operation/no complete loss of service (availability) and mentions resilience except in total power failure (fault tolerance/redundancy). No functional behavior or other quality attributes implied.

RequirementText: State Counts â€“ The BE shall receive, via M&C, State Count data produced by the Correlator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the backend (BE) shall receive State Count data via M&C from the Correlator. No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to block all access to the system for all users or selectively by user. (All blocked users with active sessions shall automatically be logged off.)
AI_Rationale: This specifies an administrative capability (functional). It also describes access control and session termination behavior (security). It pertains to system administration/management functions (operability). No explicit availability, performance, portability, etc., requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to edit a userâ€™s system access properties.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability (administrator can edit a user's system access properties), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state security constraints, operability, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to remove a user from the system.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying an administrative capability (remove a user). It does not state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to create and add a new user to the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (administrator can create/add a user). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Each user shall have a set of system access properties that defines the userâ€™s privileges within the system. (e.g., the subsystems a user may control or system tools the user may access).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies per-user access properties/privileges (which subsystems/tools a user may access) — this is an access control requirement, i.e., a security concern. It does not state availability, performance, UI, portability, or maintainability constraints.

RequirementText: A system administrator shall have unrestricted access to all aspects of the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies unrestricted access for a system administrator (access control/authorization) which is a security requirement (SE) and also pertains to system operation/administration privileges (O). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: All login attempts shall be done in a secure manner. (e.g., encrypted passwords)
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies security of login attempts (e.g., encrypted passwords), which is a security concern (confidentiality/integrity). No other quality attributes or functional behaviors are implied.

RequirementText: All users of the system shall login using some form of unique identification. (e.g., username and password)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that users must authenticate using unique identification (username/password), which is an authentication/security constraint. It does not explicitly state other quality attributes (availability, performance, usability) or broader functional behavior beyond authentication.

RequirementText: Performance â€“ the Backend system shall ultimately be scaleable to an extent that it will be capable of handling up to two Gbytes per second per Correlator output channel in real-time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies throughput requirement (2 Gbytes/sec per channel in real-time) and explicitly mentions scalability; this indicates both performance (throughput/real-time) and scalability concerns.

RequirementText: Software â€“ the software part of the system shall be able to perform without total system restart due to internal failure between array maintenance windows.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the software must continue operating without a total restart after internal failures between maintenance windows, which describes fault tolerance/resilience (FT) and implies availability (A). It does not state functional behavior, maintainability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Seamlessness â€“ 3.7.1, above, shall be accomplished in a manner that is seamless, in that it does not affect hardware modules or software functionality that it meets at interfaces.
AI_Rationale: Requirement demands that changes be seamless at interfaces and not affect hardware/software modules—this concerns integration/compatibility and the system's operability/interaction with other components (operability) and cross-module/platform compatibility (portability). No explicit performance, security, availability, or maintainability demands.

RequirementText: Operating Systems â€“ operating system software shall either have source code available or come with sufficient diagnostics and customer support.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that OS software must provide source code or sufficient diagnostics and customer support. This addresses maintainability (ability to diagnose, fix, and modify) and operability (diagnostics and support for operating/administering the system). It does not explicitly require legal/licensing, portability, performance, security, availability, scalability, usability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: Software tools â€“ software tools and pre-built applications that do not have source code available shall come with a complete diagnostic package and customer support.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates delivery of a complete diagnostic package and customer support for closed-source tools, which primarily supports maintainability (easier maintenance, troubleshooting) and operability (administration, supportability). It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, availability, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability aspects.

RequirementText: Processes â€“ all software processes shall be killable, restartable, debuggable and testable without affecting normal operations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies management properties of processes (killable, restartable, debuggable, testable) which directly concern operability (O) and maintainability (MN). Being able to restart/kill without affecting normal operations and thus not impacting service implies availability/resilience (A) and also relates to fault tolerance (FT). No security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel or usability aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: Debugging â€“ all software application modules shall be debuggable.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that modules must be debuggable, which directly relates to maintainability (ease of diagnosing and fixing software). It does not specify operational/admin features, security, performance, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: Software Accessibility â€“ all systems and application source code shall be available to or on the systems that execute it.
AI_Rationale: Requires source code be available on systems that execute it, which supports maintainability (access to code for modification/bugfix) and operability/deployability (code must be present/manageable on execution systems). It also implies portability/deployability across execution environments (PO). Does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, scalability, legal, or UI.

RequirementText: Hardware Accessibility â€“ all system processing and interconnect hardware shall be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement and/or reconfiguration.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that hardware must be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement, or reconfiguration — this directly addresses maintainability and operability (administration/maintenance activities). No functional behavior, performance, security, portability, scalability, legal, or UI concerns are implied.

RequirementText: Standby Mode â€“ the system shall be able to sit at idle and resume operations with minimal (amount TBD) delay.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (standby/resume) and a quality constraint on resume delay (performance/latency). No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, security, usability, or other NFRs are mentioned.

RequirementText: Loss of M&C â€“ the system shall continue to operate during the absence of the M&C System until the first encounter of unavailable critical auxiliary data. The system will cache a predetermined amount (TBD) of correlator data after the first encounter of unavailable critical data and complete all requested operations on cached data once the unavailable critical data is obtained.
AI_Rationale: Requirement defines required behavior during loss of the M&C system (functional behavior) and specifies that the system must continue to operate despite the loss (an availability requirement). It also describes graceful degradation and use of cached data to complete operations in the face of missing auxiliary data, which is fault-tolerance/resilience. No explicit mentions of performance, security, scalability, portability, usability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or operability were given.

RequirementText: Loss of Correlator â€“ the system shall be able to complete processing of all onboard data, deliver the results to the End-to-End System and maintain availability for immediate resumption of operations once Correlator access is restored.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior ('shall be able to complete processing...deliver the results') which makes it functional. It describes behavior under a failure scenario (Loss of Correlator) and the need to continue processing and resume operations, which directly implies fault tolerance. It also explicitly states maintaining availability for immediate resumption, so Availability is applicable. No mention of security, performance metrics, portability, maintainability, UI, scalability, operability, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: Loss of e2e â€“ the system shall continue to operate in a loss-less manner in the event of a temporary (time duration TBD) loss of availability of the e2e System.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies continued operation despite temporary loss of availability of the e2e system — this is explicitly about availability and graceful handling of failures (fault tolerance). No functional behavior beyond that, and no indications of security, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: Transparency â€“ 3.7.1, above, shall be accomplished in manner that is transparent to processing, communications and I/O software functions with the possible exception of recompilation of executables.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that functionality in 3.7.1 must be accomplished in a way that is transparent to processing, communications and I/O software (with possible exception of recompilation). This implies minimal impact on existing operational/admin interfaces and integration (operability) and that the feature should work without changes across software environments (portability). It does not state performance, security, availability, legal, UI, scalability, or explicit maintainability concerns, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: Transfers â€“ The transfer shall take place in such a manner that all data needed to perform any Fourier Transform shows-up on a single processor.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains how data must be transferred to ensure all data required for a Fourier Transform resides on a single processor, which is a performance/data-locality constraint (affecting efficiency/processing latency). It does not specify legal, security, usability, availability, or maintainability aspects, nor broader functional behavior beyond the transfer quality.

RequirementText: Correlator mode changes â€“ the system shall be capable of responding in a loss-less manner to I/O and processing changes arising from Correlator mode changes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must respond to mode-related I/O and processing changes in a loss-less manner, i.e., tolerate faults/changes without data loss. This indicates fault tolerance/resilience rather than functional behavior or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: Status Report â€“ internal system component (process, processor, network) functional state.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability to report the functional state of internal components (a functional requirement) and implies monitoring/operability concerns (status/reporting for administrators). It does not specify availability, security, performance, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Integration â€“ The BE shall be able to sum the frequency domain, spectral results. The amount (time duration) of summation will be controlled by an observational mode parameter obtained via M&C. The BE shall keep track of the number of samples/dumps integrated in each spectral channel. The summation will occur after all optional frequency domain processing, or if none, after the Fourier Transform. Integration for long periods of time is what will throttle the output of the Correlator to a rate manageable by the E2E.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system behavior: summing spectral results, control via an observational-mode parameter, tracking number of samples integrated, and ordering relative to FFT—this is functional. It also imposes an output-rate constraint (integration to throttle correlator output to a rate manageable by the E2E), which is a performance/throughput requirement. No explicit availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Frequency Domain Processing â€“ The BE shall be able to apply user selected frequency domain processes. These processes should be constructed to be chainable (output of Fourier Transform and any frequency domain process can be piped to input of any frequency domain process including replica of self) and repeatable in the chain. No frequency domain processes have as yet been proposed.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional behavior: the backend shall apply user-selected frequency-domain processes and support chaining/repeatability of processing steps. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, usability, or other non-functional constraints explicitly, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Fourier Transform Processing â€“ The BE shall be able to perform Fourier Transform the lag set time series. A power-of-two complex-to-complex Fast Fourier Transform with retention of all output positive and negative frequencies will be used. This process must be able to accept as input the output of any of the time domain processes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required capability (perform FFT with specific algorithm and retention) — functional. Also requires accepting inputs from time-domain processes, implying an interface/operability requirement. No mention of performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: Time Domain Processing â€“ The BE shall be able to apply user selected time domain processes. These processes should be constructed to be chainable (output of any time domain process can be piped to input of any other, including replica of self and Fourier Transform) and repeatable in the chain. No Optional time domain processes have as yet been proposed.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system capability: applying user-selected time-domain processes and chaining/repeatability of processing steps—this is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints, so no other labels are set.
