RequirementText: Windowing â€“ The BE shall be able to perform windowing operations prior and subsequent to Fourier Transform. This will be needed for narrow band RFI mitigation. Post Fourier Transform windowing will be applied as a convolution.
AI_Rationale: This describes a required system capability (perform windowing operations before and after Fourier Transform for RFI mitigation and convolution), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance metrics, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Time Stamp Adjustment â€“ The BE shall be able to make time stamp adjustments as required by the observational mode and correlator output parameters. This may arise when recirculation is used.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the backend (BE) must provide — the ability to perform time-stamp adjustments based on observational mode and correlator output (functional behavior). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Coarse Quantization Correction - The BE shall be able to apply corrections based on state count and/or quantizer power measurement data. This is the VanVleck correction
AI_Rationale: Specifies a backend capability to apply a specific correction (VanVleck)—this is a functional requirement describing system behavior. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Normalization â€“ The BE shall be able to apply normalizations based on reported data invalid counts.
AI_Rationale: Describes a capability of the backend to apply data normalizations based on reported invalid data counts — this specifies functional behavior. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Data Invalid Count â€“ The BE shall keep track of data invalids.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a backend function: keeping track/counting invalid data items. This describes functional behavior (F). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Data Integrity Verification â€“ The BE shall ensure that time series data is correctly ordered and contains valid data values along its entire extent. Compare against tolerances and report all out of tolerance conditions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system behavior ('shall ensure... compare... and report'), so it is Functional. It concerns data integrity (valid values, correct ordering), which maps to Security (integrity). The requirement also mandates reporting out-of-tolerance conditions, implying monitoring/operational alerting, so Operability is applicable. It does not mention availability, fault recovery, maintainability, performance, portability, scalability, UI, usability or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Output Formatting â€“ The BE shall combine the finished spectra with meta- and auxiliary data to form suitably formatted output data sets. AIPS++ Measurement Sets are the expected entities.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior: combining spectra with metadata into formatted output (AIPS++ Measurement Sets). No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Time Series Assembly â€“ The BE shall assemble the received input data into continuous time series (lag sets).
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional behavior: the back-end shall assemble input data into continuous time series (lag sets). It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Input Data Management - The BE shall store input data records in a memory buffer and track buffer locations of all input data until data processing is complete. Report any buffer overflow conditions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies concrete system behavior (store input records, track buffer locations) -> Functional. It requires detection/reporting of buffer overflows and tracking for correct processing, which addresses error handling and resilience -> Fault Tolerance. The explicit demand to report overflow conditions supports operational monitoring/administration -> Operability.

RequirementText: Verify Receive â€“ The BE shall verify the successful receipt of incoming data from the Correlator. This includes checking for receive errors and determining that all expected data was received, accumulation of error statistics and comparison against tolerances, and reporting of all out of tolerance conditions.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (the BE shall verify receipt). It explicitly requires error checking, accumulation of error statistics and reporting out-of-tolerance conditions, which implies fault detection/handling concerns (FT). The requirement also concerns operational monitoring and reporting useful for operators/admins, so Operability is applicable. It does not mention availability targets, security, maintainability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Data Receive â€“ The BE shall receive incoming data packets from the Correlator to Backend network interface. This network is a part of the BE System.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional behavior (the backend shall receive incoming data packets over a named network interface). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Lag Sets - The BE shall be able to handle lag sets up to a maximum size of 262,144 values.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maximum capacity (size of lag sets the backend must handle), which is a scalability/capacity requirement rather than functional, performance, or other categories.

RequirementText: Lag Frames â€“ The BE shall be able to handle lag frames of less than 128 values.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity constraint on handling 'lag frames' size (<128 values), which is a performance and scalability requirement about workload/throughput. No legal, security, availability, or UI aspects implied.

RequirementText: Internal Data â€“ The BE shall guarantee safe delivery of all internal messages.
AI_Rationale: "Guarantee safe delivery of all internal messages" implies reliability/resilience (fault tolerance/reliable delivery) and security (safety of messages — confidentiality/integrity). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, portability, or other categories.

RequirementText: e2e â€“ The BE shall verify successful delivery of output to the e2e.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies backend behavior: verify successful delivery of output to end-to-end system — primary is a functional requirement. It also implies an operational/monitoring concern (verifying delivery), so Operability is marked. No explicit availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, or other qualities stated.

RequirementText: Correlator System â€“ The BE shall notify M&C of any detected interruptions of data delivery from the Correlator.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: the BE shall notify M&C when interruptions are detected. This is a functional notification requirement; it does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, operability, security, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: Monitor and Control System â€“ The BE shall acknowledge receipt of all data received from M&C.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the backend (BE) must acknowledge receipt of all data from the Monitor & Control system. It defines what the system should do rather than an availability, performance, security, or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: Lag Frames â€“ The BE shall receive LTA or Speed Dump Lag Frames from the Correlator. For a detailed description of the two dump formats see Reference 8, pages 69 to 71. This will most likely be in the form of one or more frames per UDP/IP packet
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the backend (BE) shall receive specific lag frame formats from the Correlator, including transport via UDP/IP. This describes what the system must do rather than an NFR.

RequirementText: Processing Management â€“ The BE shall respond to incoming correlator mode changes, user optional processing sequence and/or parameter changes, and other external inputs that affect the data processing pipeline. Update internal parameter tables and synchronize data processing pipeline with new operational conditions.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies required system behavior: respond to mode changes and parameter updates and synchronize the processing pipeline (functional). It also describes operational/manageability actions (updating internal tables, synchronizing pipeline) related to operating/administering the system, so Operability is applicable. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legality, UI, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Output Data Management â€“ The BE shall store formatted output data records in a memory buffer with backup disk buffering. Store data ready for transmission to the e2e System until successful transfer has occurred. Report any errors and buffer overflow conditions that occur.
AI_Rationale: Requires the system to store and manage output data and report errors (functional). Specifies backup disk buffering and retention until successful transfer (fault tolerance/resilience). Requires error and overflow reporting useful for operation/monitoring (operability). No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: Data Invalid â€“ The BE shall replace all invalid data with zero values.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete backend behavior for handling invalid data (replace with zeros) — this is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address security, availability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Send Verify â€“ The BE shall verify that all sent data was successfully received. Report all errors.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a backend behavior: verifying that sent data was successfully received and reporting errors — a clear functional requirement (F). The instruction to report errors implies operational/monitoring concerns (O). It does not explicitly mention availability, fault-tolerance mechanisms (retries/recovery), security, maintainability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI/look-and-feel, or usability, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: Recovery Report â€“ internal system component (process, processor, network) recovery action result.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a recovery report feature (functional) describing results of recovery actions for internal components, which pertains to fault tolerance. Also supports operations/administration by providing recovery action results, so operability applies. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Data Send â€“ The BE shall send output data to the e2e System.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the backend shall send output data to the end-to-end system). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Failure Report â€“ internal system component (e.g., disk drive, processors, processes, and networks) failure number (translatable into text error message) and time stamp.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to report internal component failures with an error number (translatable to text) and timestamp — this is a functional requirement. The requirement describes logging/diagnostic information useful for maintenance and administration, implying maintainability and operability.

RequirementText: Warning Report â€“ warning number (translatable into text warning message), warning source, warning rates (as applicable), and time stamp.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the content/fields of a warning report (what the system should produce); no non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Error Report â€“ error number (translatable into text error message), error source, error rates (as applicable), and time stamp.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to produce error reports with particular fields (functional). Such reporting supports system maintainability and operational monitoring/admin tasks, so Maintainability and Operability are also applicable. No explicit requirements about availability, fault recovery, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Metadata â€“ All internally and externally generated data about the processed time series and spectra including invalid data flags, processes applied, coordinates, etc.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies the content and presence of metadata to be recorded for processed time series and spectra (invalid data flags, processes applied, coordinates, etc.), which is a functional data requirement rather than a quality/constraint like security, performance, or usability.

RequirementText: Processing flags â€“ a table of flags needed to identify various internal conditions relating to error response and processing state.
AI_Rationale: Describes a data structure (table of processing flags) to identify internal conditions and error responses—this specifies what the system should provide (functional). No explicit non-functional aspects (availability, security, operability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Processing Parameters â€“ names, position(s) in sequence, and adjustable parameters for all fixed and user selectable processing pipeline applications.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to provide processing parameters (names, positions, adjustable parameters) for pipeline applications, which describes functional behavior/feature. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, maintainability, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Input Data Queue â€“ a memory buffer of lag frames. Data entry status queue to track each record in the buffer. The lag frames will contain all information necessary to properly assemble complete lag sets.
AI_Rationale: Describes data structures and behavior (memory buffer, status queue, contents for assembling lag sets) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints like performance, availability, security, scalability, or portability are stated.

RequirementText: General â€“ BE processes shall not violate archive data requirements. All processes shall be reversible; the raw unconverted input always being recoverable from the output.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates BE processes be reversible and preserve raw input recoverability (functional behavior) and ensures data integrity/recoverability (security) and resilience/recoverability (fault tolerance). No explicit availability, legal, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Offload â€“ The BE shall be able to redistribute internal workload among its processors. This may involve change of destination IP address(es) for the Correlator network.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability to redistribute internal workload (functional). It implies fault-tolerance/resilience (FT) and scalability (SC) by enabling load redistribution across processors. It also affects operability (O) since it involves changing destination IPs and managing runtime redistribution. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Reboot network â€“ The BE shall be able to initiate a reboot of any internal network.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a backend capability to initiate a reboot of internal networks — this is a functional behavior. It also relates to system operation/administration (manageability/operability), so Operability is set. No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, performance, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: Output Data Queue â€“ a memory buffer plus backup disk storage of all processed spectra. These will be converted to output AIPS++ Measurement Set entities prior to transfer to the e2e. Data entry status queue to track each record in the buffer.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an Output Data Queue (memory buffer + backup disk) and conversion/transfer behavior — a clear functional requirement. Backup disk storage implies resilience to failures (fault tolerance). A data entry status queue for tracking records pertains to operability/management. No explicit mentions of availability metrics, performance, security, scalability, portability, UI, maintainability, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: Monitor I/O Performance â€“ The BE shall monitor data transfer rates from the Correlator and to the e2e. Accumulate data transfer statistics and compare against tolerances. Report all out of tolerance conditions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior to monitor and report data transfer rates (functional). It is clearly a monitoring/operational requirement (operability) and concerns performance metrics and tolerances (performance). No explicit mention of maintainability, availability targets, security, scalability, or other categories.

RequirementText: Alter Priority â€“ The BE shall be able to alter the priority of any of the BE tasks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability/behavior of the backend (ability to alter task priority), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, operability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Stop Process â€“ The BE shall be able to signal a kill for any Backend process.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (BE shall be able to signal kill) — functional. Also describes an administrative/manageability operation for backend processes — operability.

RequirementText: Start Process â€“ The BE shall be able to initiate a processing task on any Backend processor.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (initiate a processing task) — functional. Phrase 'on any Backend processor' indicates platform/environment compatibility, implying portability.

RequirementText: Monitor Networks â€“ The BE shall periodically or upon request check all Backend internal networks and assure that all communication connections are intact and functioning. Report all non-functioning components.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (periodically or on request check networks and report failures) so it's Functional. It explicitly concerns ensuring communication connections are intact — implying availability concerns. It describes monitoring/reporting which supports operability (administration/monitoring) and maintainability (detecting faults for maintenance). It does not require fault-tolerance, security, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, or usability aspects.

RequirementText: Monitor Processors â€“ The BE shall periodically or upon request check Backend physical processors and assure that all needed processors are alive and responding. Report all crashed, stopped, or unresponsive processors.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (periodically or on request check processors and report status) — functional. It describes monitoring/admin capability for operating and managing backend processors — operability. It does not specify recovery, uptime guarantees, security, performance, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Monitor Processes â€“ The BE shall periodically or upon request check PIDâ€™s and assure that all started tasks are alive and running. Report missing, stopped, defunct and other damaged processes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (periodically/on-request checking PIDs and reporting process states) so it is Functional. It describes monitoring capabilities which support system operability (administration/monitoring) and also aids maintainability (detecting broken processes for maintenance). It does not specify availability metrics, fault-tolerance recovery actions, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: Monitor Compute Errors â€“ The BE shall trap, flag and repair infâ€™s, NaNâ€™s, underflows, overflows and other computation errors. Accumulate computation error statistics and compare against tolerances. Report all out of tolerance conditions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (monitor, trap, flag, repair computation errors, accumulate statistics, compare to tolerances, report out-of-tolerance) => Functional. Explicit error handling and recovery imply Fault Tolerance. Accumulating error statistics and reporting supports maintenance/diagnosis => Maintainability. Monitoring and reporting are operational concerns for administrators => Operability. No explicit statements about availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, usability, look-and-feel, or legal compliance.

RequirementText: Monitor Compute Performance â€“ The BE shall monitor the overall data processing rate. Compare against tolerances and report all out of tolerance conditions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a behavior (monitor data processing rate and report out-of-tolerance conditions) → Functional. It concerns measuring processing rate and tolerances → Performance. It describes monitoring/reporting for operations/administration → Operability. No mention of availability percentages, fault recovery, security, portability, scalability, UI, legal, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Reboot Processor â€“ The BE shall be able to initiate a reboot of any Backend a physical processor.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (ability to initiate reboot of a backend/physical processor). It also relates to operability/admin functions (administration/management capability). No explicit mention of security, availability, fault-tolerance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Form Factor â€“ The MCCC shall be a high availability type generalpurpose computer capable of supporting multiple Ethernet interfaces, COTS operating systems, and support server/host services for the CMIB operating system. This computer may exist as a hot swappable or redundant CPU device capable of self-healing where possible.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the MCCC shall be/capable of (functional). Explicitly requires high-availability, hot-swappable/redundant CPU and self-healing (availability and fault tolerance). Requires support for COTS operating systems (portability/OS compatibility). Hot-swappable/redundant capability implies operability (ease of administration/maintenance). No explicit performance, security, legal, usability, scalability, or maintainability requirements.

RequirementText: Operating System â€“ The operating system/module combination shall be capable of supporting the real-time requirements of the correlator hardware, hardware monitor/control/diagnostics with support for standalone â€œtest benchâ€� operation with simulated control data generation, and the ability to access and upgrade correlator hardware PLD/FPGA personalities through its network connection.
AI_Rationale: Req states OS/module must support real-time requirements (performance) and support test-bench operation and network-based access/upgrades (functional capabilities). Specifying support for platform features and network-based management implies operability. Ability to access/upgrade hardware personalities implies maintainability. No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, security, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Module Features â€“ The CMIB shall contain 64 Mbytes or greater of SDRAM, IDE hard disk interface, minimum of one serial and one parallel interface, PCI/ISA buses, 100BaseT network interface, capacity to boot and run a generic COTS operating system in a near real-time environment from local non-volatile storage.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies hardware and interface/deployment constraints (memory, buses, I/O, network, ability to boot a COTS OS) which are deployment/operability concerns -> Operability. The 'near real-time environment' and boot/run performance imply performance constraints -> Performance. The need to run a generic COTS OS from local storage implies compatibility/portability considerations -> Portability. It does not state functional behavior, security, availability, scalability, or UI/look-and-feel, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: Form Factorâ€“ The CMIB shall conform to both electrical and physical PC104+ standards.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies conformance to electrical and physical PC104+ standards (hardware form factor/compatibility). This is a technical standards compliance about platform/physical compatibility (portability). It is not a legal/regulatory mandate nor a functional behavior, so only Portability is set.

RequirementText: Hardware Booting â€“ The CMIB shall have control of hardware â€œwarm bootsâ€� such that an external command from the MCCC to reboot the CMIB shall have an option to force a hardware warm boot.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (control of hardware warm boots and an external reboot command option) and describes an operational/administrative feature (ability for external command to force reboot). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Accessibility â€“ All computers within the CMCS system shall have the ability for authorized users to directly access individual systems for maintenance and monitoring through remote logins.
AI_Rationale: Specifies ability for authorized users to remotely access systems (functional capability). Emphasizes access restricted to authorized users (security). Describes maintenance and monitoring via remote logins, which pertains to system operability/administration.

RequirementText: Hardware addressing â€“ The CMIB shall be able to read back the contents of all writeable hardware control registers where meaningful. It is desired that the state of the correlator hardware be available through interrogation across the CMIB bus for monitoring and fault tolerance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the CMIB shall be able to read back hardware control registers (functional behavior) and explicitly mentions providing state for monitoring and fault tolerance (fault tolerance). The ability to interrogate hardware across the CMIB bus for monitoring implies operability/management concerns. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Hardware Visual Health Monitoring â€“ The carrier board for the CMIB shall have an externally visible indicator (LED or other) that will provide a user with a physical indication of CMIB operational status (red = fault, green = ok).
AI_Rationale: This is a concrete functional requirement for hardware to include an externally visible status indicator (so F=1). It explicitly provides user-facing status information, which affects usability (US=1). It also supports operating/administration/monitoring of the device (O=1). No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, legal, performance, portability, scalability, security, maintainability, or look-and-feel standards are stated.

RequirementText: System Isolation â€“ The MCCC shall have all required disk and file system facilities installed locally such that the system can boot and run in a stand-alone configuration. This should allow the correlator CMIBs to boot, configure, and run without any communication outside of the correlator M&C network.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates local disk/file system installation so system can boot and run standalone without external communication. This primarily addresses availability/reliability and fault tolerance (ability to operate offline) and affects operability (ability to boot/configure/run administratively without external dependencies). It does not specify security, performance, scalability, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: Self-Monitoring â€“ Each computer system in the CMCS shall have a hardware based watchdog timer configured to reboot the system in the case of a system hang. Reboots should result in minimal system interruptions with the offending CPU reconfiguring and returning to service autonomously.
AI_Rationale: Specifies hardware watchdog timers to reboot on hangs and minimize interruptions and autonomous recovery of CPU—this addresses availability and fault tolerance. Autonomous reconfiguration implies operability/management automation. No legal, security, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, maintainability, usability, or functional behavior specified.

RequirementText: Form Factor â€“ The CPCC shall be a high availability type generalpurpose computer capable of supporting a COTS operating system and have the ability to accept a large number of external hardware status signals (power, temp, etc) either directly or through external interface hardware. This computer may exist as a hot swappable or redundant CPU device capable of self-healing where possible.
AI_Rationale: Requires high-availability hardware and mentions hot-swappable/redundant CPU and self-healing (Availability, Fault Tolerance). Accepting many external hardware status signals and hot-swap capability implies operability (monitoring/serviceability) and maintainability (ease of maintenance/service). No explicit security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Debugging â€“ all software application modules shall be debuggable. They should be organized such that all inputs and outputs can be simulated if necessary.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that modules be debuggable and organized to allow simulation of inputs/outputs — this addresses maintainability/testability of the software. It does not specify security, performance, availability, portability, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Processing Software Performance â€“ The CMCS processors shall be capable of meeting all data processing deadlines and anticipated future requirements
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies meeting data processing deadlines (performance) and supporting anticipated future requirements (scalability). No mention of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Processor Hardware Performance â€“ The CMCS processors shall be capable of responding to correlator hardware inputs (interrupts) in a deterministic fashion with sufficient performance to avoid data loss, corruption or overflows.
AI_Rationale: Specifies deterministic, timely processor response to interrupts to avoid data loss/overflows (performance/real-time requirement). Also implies fault-tolerance/resilience to prevent data corruption/loss.

RequirementText: Errors â€“ All lower system error and debug messages shall be present at the MCCC layer. Aside from a networking or CPU failure, It should never be necessary to directly access a CPU to display error messages.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that lower-level error and debug messages be present at the MCCC layer (a functional capability to expose/aggregate errors). It also implies fault-tolerance/resilience goals (errors must be centrally available except in networking/CPU failure) and supports operability (administration/monitoring of errors). Providing centralized error visibility aids maintainability/debugging, so Maintainability is set. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, or UI/look-and-feel requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Error Message Access â€“ All system error and debug messages shall be categorized in a logical fashion such that message traffic can be filtered as to content, detail, and message rate. Personnel interested in error messages should be able to easily filter the error message stream.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a feature: categorizing error/debug messages and allowing personnel to filter message streams (functional). It emphasizes ease of filtering and access for personnel (operability/administrability) and ease of use of the filtering capability (usability). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Time Stamps â€“ All messages passed between CMCS system layers shall have both UTC and wall clock time stamp information appropriate for the message type. Error messages will be stamped with their discovery time, control messages will be stamped with their generation time. Other message internal time stamps can be used as monitor/control parameters as deemed necessary.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (messages must include UTC and wall-clock timestamps and rules for which timestamp to use), and it also supports system monitoring/control (operability) by enabling internal timestamps to be used as monitor/control parameters. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Test Software. - Software shall be provided that allows an authorized user full access to all messaging, monitor, and control traffic throughout the CMCS. This software will provide full system access for testing, debugging, and control while the correlator is off line or under the control of the EVLA M&C system.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (provides software enabling full access for testing/debugging/control). It explicitly requires access for an "authorized user," implying security (authentication/authorization) concerns. It also describes administrative/testing capability, which relates to operability. Other NFRs (performance, scalability, maintainability, etc.) are not stated.

RequirementText: Test Software GUI. A Graphical User Interface shall be provided as an interface to the CMCS test software that allows for a convenient and configurable tool to access the CMCS remotely through the VCI.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates providing a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to the CMCS test software and describes it as a convenient and configurable tool for remote access via the VCI — this specifies a functional capability (provision of a GUI). The terms 'convenient' and 'configurable' relate to ease of use and user interaction, so Usability is marked. No explicit performance, security, availability, look-and-feel specifics, maintainability, portability, scalability, fault tolerance, operability, or legal constraints are stated, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: Hardware Accessibility â€“ all system processing and interconnect hardware shall be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement and/or reconfiguration. This excludes items that due to their physical location, are not practical to configure for ready access (i.e. backplanes)
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that hardware must be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement and reconfiguration. This directly concerns operability (ease of administering/maintaining hardware) and maintainability (ease of repair and replacement). It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: Hardware identification â€“ The CMIB shall be capable of reading a 16-bit identifier from the host correlator board. This identifier will be used to form a unique IP address for CMIB network addressing and allow carry over IP addressing for hot swap modules.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system shall provide (reading a 16-bit identifier and using it to form IP addresses) — functional. It also concerns operational/manageability aspects (network addressing for hot-swap modules) and supports maintainability (carrying over IP addressing during hot swap simplifies replacement/maintenance). It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: Processes â€“ all software processes shall be killable, restartable, debuggable and testable with minimal impact on normal system operations.
AI_Rationale: Requires processes to be killable/restartable (operability/administration) and debuggable/testable (maintainability). Does not specify availability, fault tolerance, security, or performance explicitly.

RequirementText: System Isolationâ€“ The CPCC shall have all required disk and file system facilities installed locally such that the system can boot and run in a stand-alone configuration. This requirement is to allow correlator power monitoring and control to continue in the event of an M&C network failure.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates the system be able to boot and run stand-alone and continue correlator power monitoring/control during an M&C network failure. This directly addresses availability (continue operation despite network outage), fault tolerance/resilience to network faults, and operability (ability to operate/administer in isolation). It does not specify functional features beyond this quality, nor other qualities like security, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: Hardware communications â€“ The CMIB daughter board shall communicate with the correlator carrier boards via either the PCI or ISA busses. Alternative communication paths may be through a serial or parallel connection as required.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the CMIB daughter board shall communicate (functional interface requirement). It also defines supported communication buses/paths (compatibility across hardware interfaces), indicating portability/compatibility concerns. It relates to system operation/interaction with other boards, so operability is applicable. No explicit non-functional attributes like performance, security, availability, or maintainability are stated.

RequirementText: Power Suppliesâ€“ Where applicable, all computers and peripherals shall be powered though UPS type devices with sufficient capacity for the computers to safely coordinate a system wide shutdown of the correlator hardware in the event of a prolonged power outage. The UPS devices need the ability to signal the CMCS when a power outage has occurred and keep the CMCS apprised of time remaining on backup power.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UPS-based power and signaling for coordinated shutdown: this is primarily an availability requirement (ensure uptime/graceful shutdown) and fault tolerance (resilience during power outage). It also requires UPS devices to signal the CMCS (an operational/management function), which is a functional behavior of the power/monitoring subsystem, so F and O apply. Other quality attributes (security, scalability, etc.) are not implied.

RequirementText: Network Topology â€“ Pathways penetrating the correlator shielded room shall be fiber optic or other low RFI material to meet RFI specifications.
AI_Rationale: Specifies material and construction to meet RFI specifications — a compliance/standards requirement (electromagnetic interference regulations). Does not describe functional behavior, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Auto-correction â€“ the CMCS shall be self-monitoring. It will be capable of detecting, reporting on and automatically taking action to remedy or lessen the impact of, at a minimum, the following types of abnormal conditions: processor hardware failure, operating system hangs or crashes, temperature or voltage deviations, computational performance below minimum specifications, computational error rates above maximum specification, internal communications failures, and external (with the EVLA M&C) communications disruptions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall be self-monitoring and automatically detect/report/remediate abnormal conditions — this is a functional capability that primarily addresses fault tolerance. It also supports availability (maintaining uptime) and operability (monitoring/reporting/admin actions). No explicit performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Software â€“ the software part of the system shall be able to perform without total system restart due to internal failure between system maintenance windows.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the software must continue to perform without a total system restart between maintenance windows (resilience to internal failures) — this is primarily fault tolerance and also implies availability/uptime guarantees. No functional behavior, performance, security, etc., are specified.

RequirementText: Hardware â€“ I/O, communications, and processing hardware shall be easily expandable, reconfigurable, augmentable and replaceable to meet increasing data traffic and processing demands imposed by EVLA science, Correlator changes, and availability of new hardware.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies hardware must be easily expandable, reconfigurable, augmentable and replaceable to handle increasing data/processing demands—this primarily indicates scalability (SC). The emphasis on reconfigurable/replaceable hardware implies operability (O) and maintainability (MN). It does not state uptime, fault tolerance, security, portability or UI concerns.

RequirementText: Loss of Control Dataâ€“ the system shall be able to continue processing of all correlator configuration/control events until the queues of parameters are exhausted and external communications are restored.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must continue processing queued control/configuration events during loss of external communications until queues are exhausted—this describes functional behavior (what it must do) and a fault-tolerance/resilience constraint. No explicit availability metric or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: Network Protocol â€“ The interface between the MCCC and external networks (EVLA M&C) shall be Ethernet (IEEE 802.3 compliant) of 100 Mbits/sec or better data rate.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required network protocol and minimum data rate: this is a performance constraint (throughput) and mandates a specific interface standard for interoperability/compatibility (portability). It does not specify availability, security, functional behavior, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Redundant Communication - There shall be a redundant communication path (serial RS-232c or equivalent) between the MCCC and CPCC to provide for remote reboot in the event of a networking or computing failure.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a redundant communication path to allow remote reboot in case of networking/computing failure — primarily a fault-tolerance/resilience requirement. It also pertains to operability (administration/remote management). Does not explicitly state availability metrics, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Network Isolation â€“ The MCCC-CMIB, MCCC-CPCC, and MCCC-EVLA M&C networks shall be on separate physical interfaces.
AI_Rationale: Specifies physical network isolation for management networks, which is a security control (isolation) and also affects system operation/administration (separate physical interfaces for manageability). Does not mention availability, performance, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Network Distribution - Network switches shall be employed to distribute traffic within a correlator rack and where their use will significantly reduce overall network wiring complexity.
AI_Rationale: The requirement prescribes use of network switches to distribute traffic and reduce wiring complexity, which is primarily about system deployment/operation and manageability (operability). It also implies improved maintainability by reducing wiring complexity for upkeep. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, fault tolerance, portability, security, scalability, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Security - Network routers/switches shall be employed at the MCCCEVLA M&C interface level (or higher) to protect the MCCC from unauthorized access and irrelevant network traffic.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of network routers/switches to protect against unauthorized access and irrelevant traffic — a security requirement (access control and network filtering). No mention of availability, performance, scalability, operability, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: Network Protocol â€“ The interface between the CMIB, MCCC, and CPCC shall be Ethernet (IEEE 802.3 compliant) of 100 Mbits/sec or better data rate.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the required network interface/protocol and minimum data rate (100 Mbits/sec) between components — this defines a functional interface requirement and imposes a performance constraint (bandwidth). No explicit availability, security, scalability, or other non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: Network Topology â€“ The interface shall be transformer coupled copper twisted pair unless other materials are required for noise (RFI), ground isolation, or physical layout constraints (long distances).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the physical network medium and exceptions for handling noise, ground isolation, and long distances, which relates to resilience and reliable operation (fault tolerance) of the network. It does not state functional behavior, availability targets, performance metrics, portability, or usability concerns explicitly.

RequirementText: This is no longer the case since everybody agrees upon having a single point of contact per Member State (even though the Member State is organized with several Card Issuing Authorities â€“ up to the Member State to manage its own organisation).
AI_Rationale: The statement imposes a functional constraint/organization: there should be a single point of contact per Member State (a role/data model requirement). It does not specify availability, security, performance, scalability, UI, legal, or other non-functional aspects, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: There will be no restriction in time or place for the use of the software built from the specifications produced under this contract.
AI_Rationale: Requirement states 'no restriction in time or place' for use, which implies universal availability (anytime) and use across locations/environments (portability). It does not specify fault tolerance, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system must be able to establish and keep the dialog with the Members systems despite the various technical environments and technologies used on their sites.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies maintaining dialog/communication across diverse technical environments — implies operability (interface/management) and portability (support multiple platforms). Also implies availability/reliability of the connection (keep the dialog), but does not explicitly state fault-tolerance, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system will be designed so that background tasks can continue while the user performs foreground tasks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system should allow background tasks to run concurrently without blocking user foreground tasks, which is a responsiveness/performance concern (PE) and directly affects user experience/usability (US). It does not state legal, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: The system will be used 24x7 by operators under pressure to produce results rapidly. The system must respond rapidly to user requests irrespective of any background tasks. Such highavailability (24x7) is also required from the Member States systems to ensure acceptable response time (less than 1 minute) to enforcement authorities requests.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies 24x7 high availability for operators and Member States and explicit response-time constraint (<1 minute) and rapid responses irrespective of background tasks. These indicate Availability, Fault Tolerance (to maintain service continuously), and Performance (response time). No explicit mention of scalability, usability, security, legal, portability, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The system should be able to support other types of message structure to cover f.i. a future driving licence network and correlated activities.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (support different message structures/future networks). It describes functional behavior (support for additional message types) and does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system must be maintainable and extensible. SUP-03 The system must be designed so that it can migrate to upgraded hardware or new versions of the operating systems involved.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states maintainable and extensible (Maintainability). Specifies design for migration to upgraded hardware or new OS versions, which indicates portability/portability across platforms (Portability). No mention of availability, security, performance, scalability, operability, legal, or UI.

RequirementText: The system must be able to migrate to other type of network than the one proposed by TESTA-II.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must support migration to other network types — this indicates portability across network environments (PO) and an operational/deployment capability (O). No explicit performance, security, availability, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: Each Member of this network will organise its data about smart card holders with no constraints or recommendations on operating system and/or technology used. The system will be able to dialog with these environments or specify a generic interface to dialog with the Memberâ€™s applications.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates the system can dialog with diverse member environments or provide a generic interface (functional behavior) and implies cross-platform compatibility/interop (portability). It also concerns interfacing/operability with member applications (operability). No mention of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system must be designed and documented with the expectation that its operational lifetime will be many years.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies design and documentation aimed at long operational lifetime, which primarily concerns maintainability (ease of future maintenance, evolution and support). It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system must use the network facilities supplied by the TESTA-II network.]
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains the deployment/operational environment to use the TESTA-II network facilities, which is a portability/compatibility constraint (must run within a specific network). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or UI/functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: The algorithms in the software will be based on existing techniques and no research will be required to develop new algorithms under this contract.
AI_Rationale: The statement is a contractual/development constraint specifying that no new research is required and algorithms must be based on existing techniques — this is a requirement on the contract/development approach (legal/contractual). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system is to be designed as a robust and dependable operational system which is tolerant to operator errors and which will recover cleanly from power cuts or other disasters.
AI_Rationale: Text specifies tolerance to operator errors (usability/error-tolerance), recovery from power cuts/disasters and being dependable/robust, which implies fault tolerance and availability. No functional behavior, legal, performance, portability, security, scalability, maintainability or look-and-feel requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system must function reliably, with few or no interruptions in its first operational year and fewer still thereafter.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies reliability and minimal interruptions over time, which pertains to availability/uptime. It does not explicitly state fault-tolerance mechanisms or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system must give stable and reproducible results.
AI_Rationale: "Stable and reproducible results" describes reliability/deterministic behavior and resilience to faults (fault tolerance). It also implies testability and consistency which supports maintainability. It does not specify availability, security, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: The system must make it easy to correct mistakes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns ease of correcting mistakes, which is a usability concern (user experience, error recovery). It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system must provide solutions/rules regarding data encoding problems such as supporting different character sets, name truncation rules, name matching in case of misspelling.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must provide rules/solutions for data encoding, character set support, truncation and name-matching — these are functional capabilities. Supporting different character sets implies cross-platform/internationalization concerns (portability). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Most of the functionality of the new software shall depend on pre-existing or commercially available software.
AI_Rationale: The requirement states that most functionality shall depend on pre-existing or commercially available software. This primarily raises legal/licensing implications (compliance with third-party licenses), so Legal is set. Other qualities (maintainability, portability, operability, security) might be affected but are not explicitly stated, so they are conservatively left false.

RequirementText: The system must be easy to learn and does not obstruct the thematic understanding of the users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns ease of learning and not obstructing users' understanding, which are usability concerns (learnability/clarity). No explicit functional, performance, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system must allow enforcement authorities (through its Card Issuing Authority) to ask for workshop card status (based on workshop card number + issuing Member State code) to the corresponding Card Issuing Authority of the Member State having issued the card.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow enforcement authorities, via Card Issuing Authority, to request workshop card status using card number and issuing Member State code). It describes functional behavior (a query/interaction) and contains no explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system must guide users through an interface based on end user concepts.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior: it must guide users through an interface, which is a functional behavior (F). It also prescribes user-centered interface design—guiding based on end-user concepts—indicating usability (US) concerns and aspects of the interface presentation/interaction (look & feel, LF). No mention of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: The system must allow a member of the network to send requests to a particular or all the other members about possible delivery of a driverâ€™s smart card to a similar person.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system capability to allow a network member to send requests to other members (functional behavior). No availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional qualities are specified.

RequirementText: The system must allow a member of the network to send a bulk request on all or a large part of its driverâ€™s smart card holders to a particular or all members of the network.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to send bulk requests to driver smart card holders), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state constraints about availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects, so those labels are set to false.

RequirementText: The system must track the workflow between senders and related replies.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability: tracking workflow relationships between senders and replies. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system must be able, in accordance with the rules on delays for each transaction, to automatically transmit alert messages to senders/replier/administrator when, f.i. a constraint on delay for reply is not fulfilled.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (automatically transmit alert messages when delay constraints are violated) which is a functional behavior. It also implies operational/administrative functionality (alerting administrators and stakeholders), so Operability is applicable. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: The system must allow the administrator to extract statistics of use, standard delay of reply by member/period, percentage of unsuccessful transaction,...
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (allow administrator to extract usage statistics and metrics). It also implies administrative/operational monitoring functionality, so Operability is marked. It does not explicitly state maintainability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system must provide the management of user rights and permissions.
AI_Rationale: Managing user rights and permissions is an access control requirement, directly related to security (authentication/authorization). It does not explicitly specify operational, performance, availability, UI, or maintainability concerns, so only Security is marked.

RequirementText: The system must allow a member to do statistics on messages issued and received from/to his system. FUN-04 The system must provide automatic reply to the sender of the request through the use of a standard interface to the Members systems.
AI_Rationale: The sentences describe functional capabilities: providing statistics on messages and sending automatic replies via a standard interface. No explicit non-functional quality (availability, security, performance, portability, etc.) is stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The system must be able to include new members in the network through simple administrative tasks.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (adding new members to the network) so Functional is set. It also states this must be done 'through simple administrative tasks', which implies ease of administration (operability) and ease of use for administrators (usability). No statements about availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or maintainability are made, so those are set to false.

RequirementText: The system must be highly automatic to relieve the users of as many repetitive and tedious tasks as possible.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system should be highly automatic to relieve users of repetitive/tedious tasks, which is a user-experience/usability quality (ease of use, reducing user effort). It does not mention availability, security, performance, maintainability, portability, scalability, or specific functional behavior.

RequirementText: The system must provide at application level a full security and encryption policy compatible with the level of security required in such situation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates a security and encryption policy at application level, which maps to Security (SE). It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, legal, usability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The system must be such that none of the Member States of the network, including the administrator, re-construct a consolidated European database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies preventing reconstruction of a consolidated database by member states (including admin), which is a confidentiality/security constraint. It does not describe availability, performance, legal, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: The system must allow a Member State (through its Card Issuing Authority) to ask for the status of card (lost, stolen,â€¦) to the corresponding Card Issuing Authority of the Member State having issued the card.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (allow a Member State to query card status from the issuing authority), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, interoperability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The system must allow a Member State (through its Card Issuing Authority) to send card status modification requests (lost, stolen,â€¦) to the corresponding Card Issuing Authority of the Member State having issued the card.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional capability: enabling one authority to send card status modification requests to another. No explicit quality, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system must be able to define and manage various type of messages already in the driverâ€™s smart card holder like predelivery check, stolen/lost cards, renewals, exchanges and duplicates.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: defining and managing message types in the driver's smart card holder (e.g., predelivery check, stolen/lost, renewals). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system must allow enforcement authorities (through its Card Issuing Authority) to ask for driverâ€™s card status (based on either card number + issuing Member State code or driverâ€™s surname, first names, date of birth and issuing Member State code) to the corresponding Card Issuing Authority of the Member State having issued the card.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (allow enforcement authorities to request card status using given identifiers). No explicit quality attributes such as security, performance, availability, or portability are stated.

RequirementText: Customer log notes shall store the date and comments regarding any correspondence with a parent.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: storing date and comments for correspondence in customer log notes. It does not specify availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The software shall support the ability to enter, store, and update parent, child and billing information.
AI_Rationale: Describes core functional capabilities (enter, store, update specific data). No non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The Child s record shall contain the following information: Name, Date of birth, Gender, Classroom name, Special needs, Photo, Teacher s comments, Immunization dates.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data fields that the Child record must contain — a functional requirement defining system behavior/data. No quality constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The Parent s record shall contain the following information:Name, Address, Home phone, Work phone, Email address, Emergency contact, Name of an authorized pick up.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data fields for a Parent record (what the system must store) — a clear functional requirement. No quality/constraint aspects (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The Child Notes & Comments Report shall list the children alphabetically by last name and include any notes that are attached to their records.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required behavior and content/ordering of a report (what the system shall do), i.e., a functional requirement. No explicit quality, performance, security, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The Account Activity Report shall list a selected customer s account activity by date.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: generating an Account Activity Report listing a selected customer's activity by date. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The Child Enrollment/Withdrawal Report shall list the children alphabetically by last name and whether or not they are registered or withdrawn from the Child Care Center.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the behavior and content/ordering of a report (which children to list, alphabetical by last name, and status registered/withdrawn). This defines functional output rather than non-functional quality attributes.

RequirementText: An Immunization Due & History Report shall list the children alphabetically by last name and include any remaining immunizations that are required and the dates of previous immunizations.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a report the system shall produce with specific content (remaining and previous immunizations) and ordering (alphabetical by last name). This describes functional behavior rather than non-functional quality attributes.

RequirementText: Each classroom shall only accept a maximum of 20 children.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a behavioral constraint (functional) limiting the number of children per classroom. Analogous to maximum simultaneous users capacity, so it also represents a scalability/capacity requirement. No indication of security, performance, availability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: When a user edits an account their user ID along with the date, time and a description of the change shall be recorded in the database.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that edits must be recorded (user ID, timestamp, description) in the database. It does not explicitly state legal, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Each student shall only belong to one class.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional/business rule specifying an association constraint (each student belongs to exactly one class). It describes system behavior/data model rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: A password shall be assigned to each user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that each user must be assigned a password (functional action) and primarily addresses authentication/security requirements (access control), so labeled as Functional and Security.

RequirementText: A waiting list shall store the names and phone numbers of up to 100 potential customers waiting for a classroom opening to enroll their child.
AI_Rationale: Specifies storing customer names and phone numbers (functional). Includes a capacity limit of up to 100 entries, which is a scalability/size constraint.

RequirementText: If there is no activity for 10 minutes the user shall be logged off of the system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior (automatic logout after 10 minutes inactivity) — a functional requirement — and is primarily a security control (session timeout to protect confidentiality/integrity). No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The system shall have a Web based interface that works with Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies browser compatibility (Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator) for a web-based interface, which is a portability/compatibility requirement. Does not specify availability, performance, security, or UI look-and-feel in detail, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The background color of all windows shall be blue.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the visual appearance (background color) of windows, which is a look-and-feel/user interface aesthetic requirement rather than functional or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall respond to all user requests within 20 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a response-time bound (maximum 20 seconds) which is a performance (timing/latency) quality attribute. It does not explicitly mention availability, scalability, security, usability, or other categories, so only Performance is marked.

RequirementText: Each user shall be required to log on with a unique user name and password before using the system. The password does not need to be unique.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies authentication (unique username and password login). This is a security requirement about access control. It does not state performance, availability, usability, or other quality attributes, nor an explicit functional behavior beyond access control that would warrant marking as functional per conservative labeling.

RequirementText: The user name shall be the first four charters of the employee s last name followed by the first three characters of their first name.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior for constructing user names (composition of characters from last and first names), which is a functional specification. It does not mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The password shall contain 6 to 8 alphanumeric characters.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a password format constraint (system behavior) and is primarily a security requirement (password policy). No availability, performance, etc. implied.

RequirementText: After three unsuccessful attempts to enter a password the user shall be locked out of the system until their password is reset.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (lockout after three failed password attempts) — functional — and is a security control to prevent unauthorized access, so security is applicable.

RequirementText: A new password shall be assigned if a user forgets.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (assigning a new password when a user forgets) — functional. Also concerns authentication/password issuance, i.e., security requirements for account recovery, so labeled SE. Does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A Family Registration Information Report shall list the customer names alphabetically and include their address and home telephone number.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional report requirement (fields to include and ordering). The alphabetical ordering affects readability/usability, so marked as Usability as well. No availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: One teacher and one assistant shall be assigned to each class.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional constraint: the system must assign one teacher and one assistant to each class. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: A Parent/Child Cross Reference Report shall list the parents alphabetically by last name and include their children s first names.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying the content and ordering of a Parent/Child Cross Reference Report (what the system should do). It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI style, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: When the user logs onto the system on the date of their reminder, they shall receive a popup window displaying their reminder message.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (when user logs in on reminder date, show a popup with the reminder message). It describes functional behavior (notification delivery) and does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: A Daily Classroom & Center Enrollment Report shall alphabetically list the names of children by classroom and indicate if they are present or absent.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a report output and its content/ordering (alphabetical listing by classroom and present/absent indication), which is a functional requirement about system behavior/presentation of data rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: A Birthday Lists & Child Age Report shall list the children alphabetically by last name and include their birthday and age.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior of a report: what fields to include (birthday, age) and ordering (alphabetically by last name). No non-functional quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: There shall be two levels of access; one for teachers and assistants and one for administrators.
AI_Rationale: Specifies distinct access levels (authorization) for user roles (teachers/assistants vs administrators), which is a security requirement about access control; not describing functional behavior beyond access policy.

RequirementText: The teachers and assistants shall only be allowed to enter or edit child comments and child arrival or departure times.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an access control constraint limiting who may enter or edit certain data (teachers and assistants). This is primarily a security requirement (authorization). It also describes functional behavior (who can perform actions), so F is included.

RequirementText: The administrators shall be allowed to enter or edit all data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that administrators are permitted to enter or edit all data — this defines a system capability (functional) and an access control/authorization constraint (security). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Only the administrators shall be allowed to view or print reports.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access restriction (authorization) that only administrators may view/print reports, which is a security requirement (access control). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: All employees shall be allowed to use the Daily Reminders.
AI_Rationale: States that all employees shall be allowed to use a feature (Daily Reminders) — this specifies a functional capability and also implies an access/authorization constraint (who is permitted), so mark Functional and Security (authorization). No other quality attributes are indicated.

RequirementText: Users shall only be allowed to set daily reminders for themselves.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an access/authorization constraint restricting who may set reminders (users can only set reminders for themselves), which is a security (SE) concern.

RequirementText: The date of the reminder shall be selected from a calendar.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (how the reminder date is chosen) and implies a user-interface interaction method, affecting usability. It does not address security, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be allowed to enter up to a 50 character message for their reminder.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: users may enter a reminder message and limits its length to 50 characters. This is a behavioral/functional requirement rather than a quality (non-functional) attribute.

RequirementText: A child s record shall contain the dates that their required immunizations were received.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional data requirement for a child record to include dates of required immunizations. No availability, security, performance, legal, usability or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: When a child is within two weeks of a required immunization a message shall be displayed when their teacher logs onto the system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior: detect when a child is within two weeks of immunization and display a message when the teacher logs in. It describes a functional notification requirement rather than availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Only the administrators shall be allowed to view or print invoices.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (authorization) restricting viewing/printing invoices to administrators, which is a security concern. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The Administrators shall be able to enter the type and schedule of required immunizations.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user role (Administrators) capability to enter immunization type and schedule — a functional requirement. No non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: A child s record shall contain the date of their last physical examination.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a data field that the system shall store in a child record — a clear functional requirement about system behavior/data. No quality/constraint aspects (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: All invoices shall be available for printing at the end of each month.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (invoices available for printing) and a timing/availability constraint (available at the end of each month), so label as Functional and Availability.

RequirementText: Customers shall be billed $10 an hour (per child) for late pick ups.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a concrete system behavior/rule (billing customers $10 per hour per child for late pickups), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Itemized customer invoices showing amount due shall be available for printing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability ('itemized customer invoices showing amount due') and that they shall be available for printing. This is primarily a functional requirement (produce printable invoices) and also concerns operability (availability of printing/distribution functionality). No explicit non-functional qualities like performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: An account history for each customer shall contain all activity by date.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: providing an account history containing all activity organized by date. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.
