RequirementText: A Customer Directory Report shall list the customers alphabetically by last name and include their address and phone number.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a report's content and ordering (functional behavior): list customers alphabetically by last name and include address and phone number. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: If more than two children are enrolled a parent shall be billed $157.50 for the first two children plus $45 for each additional child at the end of each month.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a billing calculation and schedule (functional behavior): charge $157.50 for first two children plus $45 per additional child, billed monthly. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: If only two children are enrolled a parent shall be billed $157.50 at the end of each month.
AI_Rationale: Explicit functional behavior specifying billing logic (what the system shall do and when). No quality attributes like availability, security, or performance are mentioned.

RequirementText: If only a single child is enrolled a parent shall be billed $90 at the end of the each month.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (billing parents $90 monthly when only a single child is enrolled), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, legal, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A notification for required immunizations shall be printed on the monthly invoice.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior — printing a notification on the monthly invoice — which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Each investigation subject may be associated with exposure contacts, including unambiguous links to contacts in other jurisdictions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability: investigation subjects can be associated with exposure contacts and include unambiguous links to contacts in other jurisdictions. This describes functional behavior (data relationships/associations). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, legal, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Contacts of exposed entities (e.g., people, animals, places) may be traced, investigated, and monitored.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies system behavior/capabilities (tracing, investigating, monitoring contacts of exposed entities), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal or UI concerns.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should be able to create new contacts from existing case records, and should also identify the contact type.
AI_Rationale: Describes a specific system capability: creating new contacts from case records and identifying contact type — a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must support contact exposure tracing by allowing one contact to be linked to multiple cases, and allowing multiple contacts to be linked to a single case.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system functionality: support contact exposure tracing with many-to-many relationships between contacts and cases (data/model behavior). No non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should be able to produce contact work lists for each investigator to use, and should allow sorting by priority or geography.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capabilities: producing contact work lists and allowing sorting by priority or geography. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should have the ability to produce charts, maps, and graphs that illustrate OM data, such as epi-curves and the effect of vaccination or prophylaxis on the number of new cases (demonstrating the effectiveness in containing the health event) or maps that illustrate the number of cases by zip code.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must provide the capability to produce charts, maps, and graphs (e.g., epi-curves, case-by-zip-code maps) — a clear functional capability. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: If the specimen/sample was created from another specimen/sample (e.g., aliquots, and new specimen types created from a source sample), laboratory results for the child specimens/samples must be linked to the corresponding parent specimen/sample.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: linking laboratory results of child specimens to their parent specimen (data linkage/traceability). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, maintainability, scalability, portability, fault tolerance, legal, or operability concerns.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should generate electronic data dictionaries for dynamic data (or other user-defined data descriptions to assist with effective data exchange), line lists, activity logs, aggregate data, and call-back lists to assist the emergency response group and investigators in responding to and containing a health event.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies concrete system behavior (generation of electronic data dictionaries, line lists, logs, aggregate data, call-back lists) to support emergency response—i.e., a functional capability. It does not explicitly state quality attributes like availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Reports generated by systems supporting OM should clearly indicate the number of cases, the number of contacts per case, the number of cases with no known epi-link at the time of diagnosis, the laboratory results, and the number of vaccinations and/or treatments administered.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the content that reports must include (what the system should do), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should have the ability to produce pre-formatted queries and reports to allow faster and more accurate reporting, while still allowing the flexibility of ad-hoc reporting.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability of the system to produce pre-formatted and ad-hoc queries/reports (functional). The emphasis on faster and more accurate reporting and flexibility implies improved usability (ease and efficiency of reporting), but no explicit non-functional constraints like performance, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should have the ability to produce individual reports for each emergency team member or investigator.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (produce individual reports for each emergency team member or investigator), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should allow for analytical searches based upon multiple criteria.
AI_Rationale: This specifies that the system must provide analytical search functionality based on multiple criteria — a functional capability. It does not explicitly state usability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Laboratory results must be linked to corresponding specimens/samples including multiple results from one specimen/sample), and subjects when the participating laboratory returns the results. These linkages must unambiguously associate multiple laboratory results to case and contact identifiers.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: the system must link laboratory results to specimens/samples and subjects and associate results to case/contact identifiers unambiguously. It defines data linkage/association behavior rather than availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Electronic questionnaires must be developed and validated. They will be designed by investigators to collect common data elements (e.g., patient demographics, test results, exposure contacts), agent-specific data elements (e.g., specific laboratory test), and other customized data elements.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must provide (develop and validate) electronic questionnaires and allow investigators to design them to collect various data elements — this describes functional capability (what the system should do). It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: Each new case must be able to link an assigned Entity ID to an Event ID within the scope of the investigation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must allow linking an assigned Entity ID to an Event ID for each new case. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Entity-to-epi data links must match the entity to their symptoms, survey questions, specimens/samples collected, laboratory results, and prophylaxis and treatment data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: the system must correctly link an entity to related epidemiological data (symptoms, surveys, specimens, lab results, treatments). It also implies data integrity/validation to prevent incorrect/mismatched data, so Security (data integrity) is marked true. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, UI, portability, maintainability, or operability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must support dynamically defined associations between entities for the purpose of defining relationships. For example, person-to-person (e.g., family relationship, exposure relationship), person-to- place (e.g., household, common place), animal-to-person, object-to-place, person-to-travel.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must support dynamically defined associations between entities to define relationships. It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should track the changes made to the status of case records as a result of changes in the case definition.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system should track (record) changes to case record status—this is a functional behavior. Recording change history also supports maintainability (auditability, traceability), so MN is marked. No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, security, performance, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, or usability are given.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should provide a manual or automatic means of updating the status of case records as the case definition changes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (manual or automatic means to update case-record status), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, legal, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, security, or usability constraints, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: Case investigation should be supported by reusable questionnaire libraries that use common terminology (where available) to maximize the efficiency of data exchange.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system feature (support case investigation via reusable questionnaire libraries) => Functional. Reusable libraries imply reusability/maintainability considerations => Maintainability. Using common terminology to maximize efficiency of data exchange implies improved data-exchange performance (efficiency/throughput/latency) => Performance. Use of common terminology promotes interoperability/compatibility across systems/environments => Portability. Other NFRs (security, availability, usability, etc.) are not explicitly stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must provide the ability to publish investigation- specific questionnaires and implementation guides.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — publishing investigation-specific questionnaires and implementation guides. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must provide the ability to control the configuration of and revisions to investigation-specific questionnaires.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (managing configuration and revisions of investigation-specific questionnaires), which is a functional feature. It also implies administrative/operational control (manageability/operability) rather than other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Electronic questionnaires should provide the capability to accept digital signatures.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (accept digital signatures). Digital signatures are a security-related feature (authenticity/integrity), so Security is also applicable. No explicit availability, performance, legal, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should have the ability to compare characteristics of exposed and non-exposed (i.e., controls) persons.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (ability to compare characteristics between exposed and non-exposed persons), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: Activity logs may also provide information needed to support communication with various jurisdictions in the event that the investigation crosses jurisdictional boundaries. For example, if a person becomes ill during travel in one jurisdiction but is the resident of another, the illness will be reported by the state (jurisdiction) of residence, rather than by the jurisdiction visited.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes activity logs used to support communication with jurisdictions and investigations crossing legal boundaries, which implies legal/compliance concerns (L). It also implies audit/logging for investigative/forensic purposes, a security-related capability (SE). Providing logs for cross-jurisdictional communication and investigation also supports operational/admin tasks (O). No explicit availability, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Activity logs, which are tools for investigators to track their actions during a case, should be supported. For example, investigators may log calls made to monitor symptoms or calls made to schedule follow-up visits.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to support activity logs and logging actions by investigators, which is a functional feature. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should capture information such as the date and time of an activity, activity type, who initiated the activity, and contact information to generate activity logs for management purposes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system must capture and record specific information (date/time, activity type, initiator, contact info) to generate activity logs — a clear functional behavior (logging/auditing). It does not explicitly state availability, security controls, performance, scalability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM require the ability to capture information about possible cases and potential contacts from the identification process through the treatment and follow-up process, as supported by linkages among entities, events, and actions.
AI_Rationale: Describes a capability requirement to capture and link information across identification, treatment, and follow-up processes (what the system should do). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should have the ability to produce lists of action items (e.g., to do lists).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (produce lists of action items/to-do lists), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI appearance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to exchange messages for confirmed, probable and suspect cases, and the other case classifications that are noted in the PHIN message implementation guide, with systems supporting surveillance, early event detection (EED), and other preparedness areas. This requirement is identified as a key performance measure for assessing preparedness as described in PHIN Preparedness Key Performance Measures, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to exchange messages with other systems (functional behavior). It describes interoperability/interaction between systems (operability/administering interfaces), matching the Operability label. It does not state availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to aggregate data. Examples of aggregated data to be supported are: number of cases, number of contacts per case, and number of vaccinations and/or treatments administered.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must be able to aggregate data and produce counts (number of cases, contacts per case, vaccinations/treatments). It does not mention non-functional concerns such as performance, availability, security, scalability, or usability.

RequirementText: Privacy requirements ensure that sensitive information is not accessibly to unauthorized uses. Privacy requirements are broadly defined because they span all PHIN functional areas. These requirements should be reviewed in â€œPHIN Preparedness Cross Functional Components Requirementsâ€�, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes privacy constraints to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information, which is a security/privacy concern. It does not specify functional behaviors or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Systems and data supporting OM must be protected from sabotage, corruption and unauthorized access, and must be available subsequent to a catastrophic event.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies protection from sabotage, corruption and unauthorized access (security). It also requires availability after a catastrophic event, implying disaster recovery/resilience and fault tolerance as well as uptime/availability concerns. No mention of legal, UI, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: Policies and procedures should be in place for determining when follow up and isolation and quarantine monitoring should be done as a part of a focused countermeasure administration and response effort, rather than as a function of contact exposure tracing.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that policies and procedures be established for operational decision-making about follow-up, isolation, and quarantine monitoring as part of a response effort. It concerns how the system/organization should be operated and administered (procedures/processes), so Operability is applicable. It does not prescribe functional system behavior, legal compliance, performance, security, or other listed quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Processes and personnel should be identified to support agent-specific deployment packages, including syndromic grouping libraries and vocabulary sub-sets, which will be used to efficiently collect data specific to the particular health event being investigated.
AI_Rationale: Requirement calls for identifying processes and personnel to support deployment packages—this concerns operability (deployment, administration, support) and maintainability (supporting and updating components like libraries and vocabularies). It does not specify availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, usability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Protocols and personnel should be identified to support the set-up and configuration of laptops and other field devices used in OM investigations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies identification of protocols and personnel to support setup and configuration of field devices—this is about operational support, manageability and administration (operability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, portability, scalability, legal, usability, look-and-feel, or maintainability explicitly.

RequirementText: Configuration management protocols and personnel should be identified to support multiple deployment options.
AI_Rationale: Specifies identification of configuration management protocols and personnel—this concerns system operability/administration and supports multiple deployment options (portability). It also relates to maintainability since configuration management practices and staffing affect maintenance. No functional behavior, security, performance, etc., are specified.

RequirementText: Polices regarding data synchronization should be defined to support multiple deployment options as discussed in section 2.1 System Architecture of this document.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies defining data synchronization policies to support multiple deployment options — this concerns deployment/operational support (operability) and cross-environment compatibility (portability). It does not explicitly state functional behavior, performance, scalability, security, or legal aspects, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: Policies and procedures for communicating information to appropriate stakeholders (e.g., state and federal emergency management organizations, FEMA, hazmat teams, public works facilities, intelligence organizations, the media, and the public) should be clearly defined.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that policies and procedures for communicating with stakeholders should be clearly defined—this pertains to operations/administration (manageability and communication processes). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, legal compliance, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: Data exchange should support analysis and information sharing of possible health events at all levels of public health (e.g., national, state, local).
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability — supporting data exchange for analysis and information sharing across public health levels, which is a functional requirement. It also implies interoperability/operability concerns (supporting sharing/analysis across national, state, local levels), so Operability is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, security, scalability, portability, legal, usability, fault tolerance, look-and-feel, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should support multiple file formats for import and export, such as databases, spreadsheets, messages, and text files, among others.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (support import/export of multiple file formats). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Message components should be grouped by observation type (e.g., laboratory, symptom, exposure, risk, treatment) by systems supporting OM.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system should organize message components by observation type—a functional requirement about system behavior/structure. No explicit non-functional aspects (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Mapping interfaces and data dictionaries must be clearly defined and included in data exchanges to indicate and describe both standard and customized fields because systems supporting OM are configurable to meet the individual needs of each event and therefore collect data specific to each event.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates clear definition of mapping interfaces and data dictionaries for data exchanges—this is primarily about operability (manage/configure data exchanges), maintainability (clarifies data for modification and reuse), and portability/interoperability across configurable systems. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or UI.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should be able to provide the aggregate data necessary for health event monitoring to systems that support response tracking, such as the number of suspect cases, number of persons under isolation or quarantine, and the number of patients receiving countermeasures.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability: systems must provide aggregate data (counts) to other systems for response tracking — a functional integration/reporting requirement. It implies operability/interoperability (ability to provide data to other systems) but does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to exchange aggregated data. Examples of aggregated data to be supported are: number of cases, number of contacts per case, and number of vaccinations and/or treatments administered.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to exchange aggregated data and examples). This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional qualities (performance, availability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to create and send messages for countermeasure administration requests. This requirement is identified as a key performance measure for assessing preparedness as described in PHIN Preparedness Key Performance Measures, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability: creating and sending messages for countermeasure administration requests, which is a functional behavior. Although it references a 'key performance measure', no concrete non-functional constraints (e.g., performance, availability, security) are stated, so no NFR labels are applied.

RequirementText: Countermeasures that have been administered must be linked to the entity that was administered the countermeasures.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system behavior/data relationship: administered countermeasures must be linked to the entity receiving them. This is a functional requirement about data association/recording; it does not explicitly state non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to receive, parse and process messages for countermeasures that have been administered. This requirement is identified as a key performance measure for assessing preparedness as described in PHIN Preparedness Key Performance Measures, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that systems must receive, parse and process messages (functional behavior). Although called a key performance measure, no explicit performance metrics (latency/throughput) are given, so Performance not marked.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must exchange messages for investigations and for exposure contacts. This requirement is identified as a key performance measure for assessing preparedness as described in PHIN Preparedness Key Performance Measures, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: The statement requires systems to exchange messages for investigations and exposure contacts — this is a functional requirement (specific system behavior). It also concerns interoperability/operability (message exchange capability as an operational requirement and is likened to a key performance measure), so Operability is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are specified.

RequirementText: If an affected person suffers a negative reaction to a vaccine or prophylaxis that was administered, adverse event data may be collected and used to determine the need for additional interventions or to determine if there is a problem with the pharmaceutical, batch, or the administering facility or person. For specific data requirements regarding adverse event data, please reference PHIN Preparedness Countermeasure/Response Administration Functional Requirements and Process Flows, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that adverse event data may be collected and used to determine interventions or investigate issues with pharmaceuticals, batches, or administering entities — this describes functional behavior of the system (data collection and use). It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, scalability, legal compliance, or usability, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should be able to exchange messages for laboratory results with systems supporting surveillance, early event detection (EED), and other preparedness areas.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that systems must be able to exchange messages (functional interoperability) and concerns interfacing/integration with other systems (operability). No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Laboratory results should be linked to laboratory test requests, which are linked to subjects.
AI_Rationale: This describes a required data/linking behavior (how laboratory results relate to test requests and subjects), which is a functional requirement about system behavior/data model. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to receive, parse and process messages for laboratory results. This requirement is identified as a key performance measure for assessing preparedness as described in PHIN Preparedness Key Performance Measures, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (receive, parse, process laboratory result messages). No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, scalability, maintainability, or usability are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should be able to receive, parse and process messages for laboratory test request responses, in accordance with PHIN Laboratory Test Order Response Message Implementation Guide, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies what the system must do (receive, parse, process messages) — functional. It also mandates conformance to the PHIN Implementation Guide (a standards/compliance constraint), which maps to Legal/compliance rather than other quality attributes. No explicit availability, performance, security, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to create and send messages for laboratory test requests. This requirement is identified as a key performance measure for assessing preparedness as described in PHIN Preparedness Key Performance Measures, available at www.cdc.gov/phin.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability — creating and sending messages for laboratory test requests — which is a functional behavior. No explicit non-functional aspects (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated, only that it is a key performance measure reference.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to accept data from other partner systems supporting OM.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that systems must accept data from partner systems—this is a functional interoperability capability (what the system should do). It also implies cross-system compatibility/portability (ability to interoperate with other OM-supporting systems), so Portability is marked. No explicit mention of availability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, UI, legal, fault tolerance, or operability.

RequirementText: Contact information for key response partner organizations should be stored in a local instance of a public health directory for associating to a health event, as described in section 2.2.2 Health event Data of this document.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability the system must provide—storing contact information in a local directory and associating it with a health event—so it is a functional requirement. No quality/constraint (availability, security, performance, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: Health event data should be aggregated into a centralized data store (i.e., data warehouse) designed specifically to support analysis of events over time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: aggregate health event data into a centralized data warehouse to support time-series analysis. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, scalability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the ability to print questionnaires for multiple uses, including taking to the field, use during phone interviews, etc.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (ability to print questionnaires for various uses), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Contraindication information should be collected to indicate why vaccinations, treatments, or antidotes may not have been administered or why the patient may not have complied with prescribed interventions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a data-collection behavior (collect contraindication information) describing what the system should do — a functional requirement. No explicit quality, security, legal, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Data should be accessible for use with commonly available analytical tools (e.g., SAS, SPSS, EPI-INFO, MS Access, MS Excel, Crystal Reports).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies interoperability/compatibility of data with commonly available analytical tools—this is a portability concern and also relates to operability/integration. It does not specify availability, security, performance, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: All levels of granularity of results (e.g., specimen/sample level, assay level) must be supported.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to support multiple result granularities (specimen/sample, assay), which is a functional requirement. No explicit quality/operational/security attributes are stated.

RequirementText: Case data about the entity should include: a case identifier (i.e., Case ID) that is unique within the jurisdiction being reported, the suspected agent, case diagnosis, health status (e.g., no symptoms, acute illness), case status (e.g., confirmed, probable, suspect), investigation dates, clinical history, symptom onset date and time, epidemiological links to other cases, and priority (e.g., high, medium, low).
AI_Rationale: Specifies what case data fields the system must store (Case ID uniqueness within jurisdiction, suspected agent, diagnosis, status, dates, links, priority). This defines functional data requirements rather than quality attributes.

RequirementText: Because attributes of both case and exposure data may describe the same entity, systems supporting OM must have the ability to avoid capturing redundant entity demographic information.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (avoid capturing redundant demographic information) — this is a functional requirement about data capture/validation. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, scalability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Detailed conveyance data must be collected when relevant to the investigation, including the carrier identifier, the type of conveyance (such as airplane, bus, or train, among countless others), as well as the make, model, year, and identification number (e.g., VIN) of each vehicle with which the entity was in contact (if this information is relevant to the investigation).
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: which conveyance/vehicle data must be collected when relevant. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, legal, or UI/maintainability constraints.

RequirementText: Travel history data to be collected for an animal or object should include shipping invoices, animal shelter delivery and adoption receipts, and delivery schedules (including delivery vehicle and driver information).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what data elements the system should collect for travel history (shipping invoices, shelter delivery/adoption receipts, delivery schedules and vehicle/driver info), which is a functional requirement describing system behavior/data.

RequirementText: Information about each leg of a trip, as well as the parent information about the trip, should be captured. For example, if a person who lives in Georgia travels to Seattle and becomes exposed to monkey pox, then visits a friend in Santa Fe, travel history and conveyance data should be noted accordingly for each place the exposed person traveled.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must capture specific data (information about each leg of a trip and parent trip information), which is a functional behavior (data capture/storage). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Travel history data should include information such as the method of transportation (e.g. bus, plane, boat, car), flight number, departure and arrival dates and times, and the origination and destination locations (city, state, and country).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the exact data elements that travel history must include (fields such as transportation method, flight number, dates/times, origin/destination). This is a functional requirement about system behavior/data content; it does not specify availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should have the ability to capture changes to the case definition that occur as the health event evolves.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability — the ability to capture changes to case definitions as health events evolve — which describes what the system should do (functional). It does not explicitly state quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should have the ability to record the case definition for a health event.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to record case definitions), which is a functional requirement. No quality/constraint aspects (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Data describing the health event should be captured, including the reason for the investigation, the category of event (e.g. environmental, infectious), the date the event began, the suspected agent (if known) or investigation focus, the geographic area impacted by the event, as well as the event status (e.g., open, closed).
AI_Rationale: Specifies what data the system must capture for a health event (fields such as reason, category, dates, agent, geographic area, status). This is a functional data-capture requirement rather than a quality/constraint.

RequirementText: When a health event is investigated, it must be assigned an event identifier (i.e., Event ID) that is unique within the jurisdiction.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: when investigating a health event the system must assign a unique Event ID scoped to the jurisdiction. It defines what the system must do and a uniqueness constraint; it does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture an entityâ€™s travel history to support investigations of entities infected, exposed or potentially exposed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide — capturing an entity's travel history to support investigations — which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as security, performance, availability, or scalability.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture data about any living things other than persons or animals that are involved in an OM investigation, including: type of living thing, and other customizable data collection questions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability to capture and store data about non-person/animal living things and customizable data collection questions — this describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not address availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture data about any public or private gathering of people (e.g., church social, ball game) involved in an OM investigation, including: time, location, nature of the event, etc.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (capturing specific data about gatherings), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture data about any conveyance involved in an OM investigation, including: type of conveyance, route taken (e.g., flight number), etc.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (capture data about conveyances). No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, usability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture data for any object involved in an OM investigation, such as a letter, invoice, food item, or any object that cannot be classified as a â€œperson, organization, place, or animal.â€� Collected data may include: name of the object, type, physical descriptors, address, identification number (e.g. serial number, package slip number), and relevant dates and times (e.g., invoice date, shipping date, packaging date).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide—capturing and storing data fields for objects involved in investigations—so it is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture data about any animals involved in an OM investigation, including: type (dog, monkey, etc), age, gender, ownerâ€™s name and address, color, weight, and species. A Subject ID should also be collected for animals in an OM investigation. It may be a challenge to ensure unambiguous identification because demographic details of an animal are not easily identified; therefore, animals involved in investigations may need to be tagged.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide — capturing specific animal data fields and Subject ID, and support for tagging. This is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly constrain availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture data about locations involved in an OM investigation, including: name (if applicable), type (e.g., floor, building, room, store), street address, city, state, zip code, country, GPS coordinates, and other specific details (e.g., a specific building on a campus, a business branch location, a local chapterâ€™s meeting hall)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must capture specific location data fields for OM investigations (name, type, address, GPS, etc.). It does not state non-functional qualities like performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture data about organizations (e.g., a local health department, a university, a professional association) involved in an OM investigation, including: organization name, location, and contact information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability to capture specific data fields about organizations (name, location, contact information), which defines functional behavior (data capture). It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Other descriptive details may be captured, such as occupation and work history.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability of the system to capture additional descriptive details (occupation, work history). It does not state any quality constraints such as performance, security, portability, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must have the capability to capture demographic data about persons involved in an OM investigation, including: Subject ID, name, address, date of birth, gender, phone number, race, ethnicity, and country of citizenship.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability to capture specific demographic data fields—i.e., a functional data-capture/storage feature. It does not mention availability, performance, security, privacy, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should be able to electronically record and store data from remote devices that may be uploaded to an aggregating system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability: electronically record and store data from remote devices and upload to an aggregating system, which describes functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: OM data should be synchronized so that all instances of OM applications working from the same server are able to share and use the same data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that OM data must be synchronized across application instances (a behavioral/functional requirement) and concerns how the system instances operate/manage shared data (operability). It does not explicitly mention availability, fault-tolerance, security, scalability, portability, UI, maintainability, or performance.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should provide the ability for computers in disconnected mode to reconnect to a server to share OM data among other computers that operate in disconnected mode.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (reconnect and share data) — a functional behavior — and addresses operation under disconnection/restore, which is fault-tolerance/resilience to connectivity loss.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should support multiple deployment options (e.g., client server, disconnected, and potentially web based).
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for multiple deployment options/environments (client-server, disconnected, web). This relates to operability (deployment/manageability) and portability/compatibility across environments. No mention of performance, availability, security, or UI.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must support structured data entry for common forms and fields to ensure data integrity, validity, and standardization. A standardized data structure ensures that data mapping of common elements will only be necessary one time, rather than for each event.
AI_Rationale: The statement prescribes that the system must support structured data entry (a clear functional requirement). It emphasizes data integrity and validity, which maps to security (data integrity/confidentiality/integrity concerns). The note about standardized data structure reducing repeated mapping implies improved maintainability (ease of integration and reduced repetitive work). Other quality attributes (performance, availability, usability, etc.) are not explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: Systems designed to support OM must offer configuration flexibility so that new data fields, entities, entity types and relationship types may be added to capture information unique to each particular health event.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must provide configuration flexibility to add new data fields, entities and relationship types — this is a functional capability (F) and describes extensibility/changeability, which maps to Maintainability (MN). ‘Configuration flexibility’ also implies manageability/administration concerns (O). It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, usability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should capture or be linked to data regarding the prophylaxis or treatment to cases, exposed individuals, or at risk persons, including the person who ordered the prophylaxis or treatment, and the name, date, type, duration, and dosage of the treatment or prophylaxis given. For specific data requirements regarding the administration of prophylaxis and treatment.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system shall capture or link specific data elements (who ordered, name, date, type, duration, dosage) for prophylaxis/treatment — this is a functional data-recording requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, performance, scalability, usability, etc., so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: There must be a means to update the case diagnosis either manually or automatically if the case definition changes during an event.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior (a means to update case diagnosis manually or automatically when case definition changes), so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, maintainability, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Epidemiological (epi) data must be collected to assist in the case investigation of events. Standard epi data to be collected includes: onset date and time of symptoms, type of symptoms, risk factors, medical history data, laboratory data, procedure data, and questionnaire responses.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system function—collecting specific epidemiological data fields—so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should be capable of using configurable, domain-specific vocabulary.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability/feature (ability to use configurable, domain-specific vocabulary), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly constrain availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: In the context of a case, all entities exposed to a case must be recorded and linked to the case.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (recording and linking entities to a case). It also implies audit/compliance concerns (legal) and supports maintainability (traceability/history), similar to provided example that was labeled F, L, MN.

RequirementText: If the specimen/sample collection record does not exist, the laboratory result must be linked to the subject by the Subject ID.
AI_Rationale: This specifies functional behavior (conditional logic for linking a lab result to a subject by Subject ID when specimen record is absent). No quality attributes (availability, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must allow for dynamic, event-specific case investigation data to be captured.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies system behavior: the system must allow capturing dynamic, event-specific case investigation data — a functional capability. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: If the specimen/sample collection record exists, the laboratory result must be linked to the specimen collection record by the Specimen ID.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: linking a laboratory result to a specimen collection record by Specimen ID when the specimen record exists. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must store data about laboratory results. Examples of this data include the Specimen ID, Subject ID, test date and time, test type (LOINC), data for each organization involved in the testing of the specimen/sample (e.g., testing or reference laboratory name, location, contact information), laboratory results and result values (SNOMED), other data such as unit of measure for result value, overall interpretation, and any relevant notes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system must store particular laboratory result data fields (Specimen ID, Subject ID, test date/time, test type, organization info, results, units, interpretation, notes). That is a functional requirement describing what the system should do. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, portability, operability, maintainability, usability, legal, look-and-feel, or performance constraints, so those labels are set to false.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to store laboratory result(s) and link the result(s) to the original laboratory test request. More information about receiving and linking laboratory test requests is found in section 2.5 System Integration and Data Exchange of this document.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide: storing laboratory results and linking them to original test requests — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional concerns (availability, security, operability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Information about batch shipments of specimens/samples that are transferred to test laboratories or other facilities must be collected, including the shipper (e.g., UPS, FedEx), shipment tracking number, and the sending organizationâ€™s contact information.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that certain shipment information must be collected (data fields and recording behavior), which describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to create a laboratory test request for a specimen/sample or group of specimens/samples. More information about creating laboratory test requests is found in section 2.5 System Integration and Data Exchange of this document.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability: the system must create laboratory test requests for specimens. No quality/non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Chain of custody information for forensic and select agent samples must be captured, including the person who collected the sample, the location of collection, all people who came into contact with the sample during the preparation for shipment to the laboratory, and the acceptance of the package by the shipper.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must capture chain-of-custody data (who collected, location, contacts, shipper acceptance) — this is a functional data-capture/auditing requirement. It does not explicitly impose availability, security, legal, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Chain of custody information for all specimens/samples should be captured.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability: the system must capture chain-of-custody information for specimens/samples. It does not explicitly state availability, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Bar-coding should be supported for the capture of detailed specimen/sample data to improve the quality and efficiency of data collection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies supporting bar-coding functionality (functional requirement). Mentions improving quality and efficiency of data collection, implying usability/efficiency concerns, but no availability, security, performance, or other NFRs explicitly.

RequirementText: Food sample data should include information about the lot number, batch number, manufacturer name, shipping invoice, temperature, sample type (e.g., dairy â€“ milk, red meat, spice), and product storage condition.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data fields that the system must include for food sample records—a functional data/content requirement. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Environmental sample data should include information about the collection method, location (geocoded if possible) from which the sample was taken, source (e.g., rain or well for water, radiation release, asbestos, chair or desk in a specified location), nature of the sample (e.g., soil, water, air), quality control data, collection begin and end date and time for air samples, and original volume and volume of concentrate tested for water samples.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the data elements and fields that environmental sample records must contain (collection method, location, source, sample nature, QC data, timestamps, volumes), which is functional in nature. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Clinical specimen data should include information about the specimen source/site from which the specimen was taken, symptom date of onset, and whether the sample is acute or convalescent.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what clinical specimen data must include (fields: source/site, symptom onset date, acute/convalescent) — a functional/data requirement. No quality/constraint aspects (availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should be able to support the inclusion of labeling, packaging and shipping instructions (e.g., container type, storage condition, preservative), and the shipping manifest with batch shipments of specimens/samples.
AI_Rationale: Describes a capability the system must provide (support inclusion of labeling, packaging/shipping instructions and shipping manifests for batch shipments) — a functional requirement. Does not explicitly specify availability, performance, security, operability, scalability, portability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The subject of a specimen/sample collected for laboratory testing must be linked to the specimen/sample by an identifier (i.e., Subject ID) that is unique within the jurisdiction.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that a specimen must be linked to a subject via a unique Subject ID within a jurisdiction (data/behavior constraint). It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must be able to store data about the specimens/samples that are collected for laboratory testing. Examples of this data are: Specimen ID, Subject ID, purpose for test, collection date and time, subject type (e.g., human, plant, animal, food), specimen category, specimen type, suspected agent, risk indicator (e.g., infectious, radioactive, corrosive), person performing specimen/sample collection (including contact information), location of collection, and volume and quantity details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete capability the system must provide: storing specimen/sample data and specific data fields. It is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Demographic information should be collected about the investigator, including their name, address, and contact information, so that the investigator may be contacted to answer questions or to provide additional information.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional requirement to collect specific investigator demographic/contact data so they can be contacted; it does not state non-functional qualities like availability, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should have the ability to classify entities associated with the investigation as investigation controls. For example, controls share demographic characteristics with the subject of the case, but are not infected with the agent that is the focus of the investigation.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability: classifying entities as investigation controls (functional behavior). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Both the jurisdiction investigating the event and the jurisdiction reporting the cases and associated investigations must be captured. For example, if a person becomes ill during travel in one jurisdiction but is the resident of another, the illness will be reported by the state (jurisdiction) of residence and investigated by the jurisdiction visited.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must capture both reporting and investigating jurisdictions for cases. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Detailed data must be collected about the source of exposure as well as the exposed entity to support contact exposure tracing. Exposure data related to both the potential source and the potential spread include the entityâ€™s type, Subject ID, Contact ID, contactâ€™s name and address, exposure dates and times, health status, and priority code.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what data must be collected (types, IDs, names, addresses, dates/times, health status, priority code) to support contact exposure tracing — a functional behavior of the system. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Epi data must be collected to assist in the exposure investigation of health events. Standard epi data to be collected for exposure investigation parallels the data to be collected for case investigation and includes: onset date and time of symptoms, type of symptoms, risk factors, laboratory data, procedure data, and questionnaire responses.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: what epidemiological data fields must be collected for exposure investigations. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Exposure investigation data to be captured must include information related to exposure levels, type of exposure (e.g., intimate, social, household, common conveyance), place of exposure, length of time the entity was exposed, frequency of exposure, and the entityâ€™s proximity to the source of exposure.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional requirement about which exposure investigation data fields must be captured (what the system should record). No non-functional qualities like performance, security, usability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM should support the monitoring and follow-up activities required when tracking the status of cases and exposed individuals.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies that systems should provide monitoring and follow-up activities for tracking case/status and exposed individuals — this describes a functional capability (what the system should do) rather than a quality constraint.

RequirementText: Monitoring data should be collected about cases and exposed individuals who are isolated or quarantined because of a health event.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: collecting and exposing monitoring data about cases and exposed individuals. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security/privacy, usability, scalability, or other quality constraints, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: Follow-up data should be collected from subjects or their proxies to track symptoms and compliance with recommended treatment plans or prophylaxis.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an action the system must perform (collect follow-up data from subjects or proxies to track symptoms and treatment compliance), which is functional in nature. It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Follow-up data may be received from take response exams of persons who received a countermeasure that requires such an exam (i.e., smallpox vaccination).
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a system capability/behavior — receiving follow-up data from take-response exams for vaccinated persons — which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Specimens/samples collected for laboratory testing must be assigned an identifier (i.e., Specimen ID) that is unique within the jurisdiction.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior/data constraint (assigning a unique Specimen ID within a jurisdiction), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: Systems supporting OM must support capturing dynamic, event- specific data that describes contact between two subjects.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: capture dynamic, event-specific data describing contact between two subjects. No availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to remove users from the system or disable access as appropriate.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (administrator capability to remove or disable users). It also implies a security control related to access management (revoking/ disabling access), so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, portability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of validating user name and password during log-in process.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the system must validate username/password during login — a functional behavior (F) implementing authentication — and it explicitly relates to security (SE). No availability, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of authorizing access to Pontis functionalities depending on the userâ€™s privileges during log-in process.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access authorization tied to user privileges during login — this defines a functional capability (access control) and is primarily a security requirement (authentication/authorization). No indication of availability, performance, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of tracking login and logout activity.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (tracking login/logout activity), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security/auditing, performance, scalability, operability, or other non-functional aspects, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of running concurrent sessions for a user.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies ability to handle multiple concurrent sessions (capacity/scale concern). This relates to scalability rather than other qualities; no explicit performance, security, availability, or functional details provided.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of supporting Windows Authentication mechanism for database access.
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for Windows Authentication for database access, which is an authentication/authorization requirement (security). It also defines a capability the system must provide (functional).

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of initiating a session without a login prompt. This capability will provide support for an independent launch shell for Pontis and will be configured by the system administrator.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (initiate a session without a login prompt / independent launch shell) which is a functional behavior. It also indicates configuration by the system administrator, implying operational/administrative concern (operability). It does not explicitly state security, performance, availability, scalability, portability, usability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or fault-tolerance constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of integrating authentication and permissions with BRIDGEWare22.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies integrating authentication and permissions with an external system (BRIDGEWare22), which directly concerns security (authN/authZ). It also implies interoperability/compatibility with another platform, so portability is applicable. It does not specify availability, performance, scalability, UI, maintainability, legal, or fault-tolerance aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of operating with a single-sign-on authentication mechanism based on Active Directory Services or the LDAP standard.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies support for single-sign-on authentication using Active Directory or LDAP, which is a security-related requirement (authentication) and also describes a functional capability of the system to operate with that mechanism. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to add and configure pre-populated new structure templates.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an administrator capability (adding and configuring templates), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state any quality attributes (performance, availability, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of storing the INI file configuration information in the database or workstation registry as appropriate, eliminating dependency on INI files for program operation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (how configuration is stored and eliminating dependency on INI files), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system will accommodate XP directory security and file permissions when storing any configuration or session parameters.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly addresses respecting directory security and file permissions (access control) when storing configuration/session data, which is a security concern (confidentiality/integrity/authorization). It does not state availability, fault tolerance, portability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to edit the DATADICT table or its successor(s) through a GUI window.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (administrator can edit DATADICT or successors) and explicitly requires a GUI window, which implies a user-interface requirement (usability/UI). No availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure field-level security.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an administrator capability (functional) to configure field-level security, which directly pertains to security controls; no mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure some fields as mandatory for user input.
AI_Rationale: This specifies an administrator capability (functional). It also concerns system administration/configurability (operability). It does not specify availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure different levels of permission to control editing of checked-out bridges.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies configuring permission levels to control editing (authorization/access control), which is a security concern. It does not state performance, availability, UI, maintainability, or other non-functional qualities, nor an explicit functional behavior beyond security configuration, so only Security is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall adhere to a .NET logging standard.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates adherence to a specific corporate/technical standard (.NET logging standard), which is a compliance/standards constraint similar to an architecture guideline. It does not explicitly state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to assign bridge-level filters for each user.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying an administrative capability (assigning bridge-level filters per user). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall adhere to a .NET exception handling standard.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates adherence to a .NET exception handling standard (a compliance/conformance constraint). It is primarily a governance/legal/standards requirement rather than a functional feature. Other quality aspects (fault tolerance, maintainability) are not explicitly required, so they are not set.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure the system units of measure in either English or metric mode. This will be a permanent setting for the application and database.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (administrator must be able to configure units of measure). It also pertains to system operation/administration (administrator configuration, persistent setting stored in application and database), so Operability applies. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, usability, legal, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or maintainability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to create bridge-level access filters.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (administrator capability to create bridge-level access filters). It also implies a security concern (access control/filtering), so Security is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, usability, portability, scalability, fault tolerance, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or operability.

RequirementText: The system shall strictly separate transient or volatile batch operation control records â€“ e.g. bridge records to be included in a report â€“ from more static control record â€“ e.g. currently checked-out bridges.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior/constraint on how the system must manage and separate types of control records (transient vs static), which is a functional data-management requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, performance, legal, look-and-feel, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to add new users to the system.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability/action the system must provide (administrator can add new users), which is a functional requirement. No quality/constraint (availability, security, performance, UI, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure the values in the dropdown lists in the system.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability (administrator can configure dropdown values), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security/access control, usability, operability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall guarantee atomic database transactions to ensure maximum data integrity, using standard .NET transaction management capabilities.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall guarantee atomic database transactions (functional behavior) to ensure data integrity. This implies security (integrity) concerns and fault-tolerance/recovery semantics (atomicity guarantees), but does not mention availability, performance, portability, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall maximize multi-user concurrency and conflict resolution in the application using standard .NET session and transaction management capabilities.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior to maximize multi-user concurrency and conflict resolution (functional). It explicitly concerns concurrency and handling load which impact performance and scalability. It does not state availability, security, portability, or other NFRs, nor explicit fault-tolerance or operability requirements.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to exchange data in NBI format.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (exchange data in a specific NBI format), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly refer to availability, performance, security, portability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to exchange data in PDI format as specified in the Pontis Technical Manual.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to exchange data in a specific PDI format (functional). Requiring conformance to Pontis Technical Manual implies interoperability/compatibility with an external format, mapped to portability.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to exchange data in XML format. The emerging TransXML schema specification17 shall be utilized once established and accepted.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to exchange data in XML (functional). Mandates using the TransXML schema once available, implying standard-based interoperability/portability and operational data-format requirements (operability). No explicit availability, performance, security, legal, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to exchange bridge inspection data in PDI format.
