AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to exchange inspection data). Specifying PDI format implies interoperability/compatibility with that data format, so portability is also applicable.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to designate a recipient for checked-out bridges.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (designate a recipient) — a functional behavior. No availability, performance, security, usability or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall store all export/import control information within the database for central administration, eliminating any dependency on workstation control files to manage export/import behavior.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: storing export/import control information centrally in the database (functional). It explicitly addresses central administration and removal of workstation-level control files, which relates to system operability/manageability. No explicit statements about performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, or UI/look-and-feel, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to modify his or her basic account profile.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability (user can modify account profile). It does not specify availability, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to archive data for existing and removed structures.
AI_Rationale: This describes a user action/capability (ability to archive data) and thus is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, maintainability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall provide reporting mechanism for viewing archived data.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a feature the system must provide (a reporting mechanism to view archived data), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as security, performance, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to restore the archived data.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (user action to restore data). It also implies fault-tolerance/back-up-and-restore capability, so FT is set. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall use timestamps in the database to log when rows were last changed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (log timestamps for row changes) — a functional requirement. Also implies auditability/accountability of changes, which is a security-related requirement (logging/audit trail). No explicit availability, performance, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall continue to provide existing application integration capabilities with BRIDGEWare products.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that the system continue to provide integration capabilities (functional behavior) and implies continuity/resilience of that service (availability). 'Continue to provide' also implies tolerance to faults or disruptions affecting integration, so fault tolerance is applicable. No explicit mention of portability, maintainability, security, performance, etc., so those are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall support concurrent storage in the database of planned, active, and inactive structures, and potentially other status/lifecycle phase indicators, to facilitate BRIDGEWare integration.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (storing planned/active/inactive structures and status indicators) — this is functional. It also explicitly mentions facilitating BRIDGEWare integration, implying an operational/integration concern (manageability/operability). It does not specify availability, performance, scalability, security, portability, look-and-feel, or maintainability constraints explicitly, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to create and edit new application roles.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (administrators creating and editing application roles). It does not state availability, security constraints, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to assign users to application roles.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (administrator capability to assign users to roles). It also concerns security (role/authorization management), so SE is marked. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall provide user interface for managing application roles.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability — providing a user interface for managing application roles. It does not explicitly state security/authorization, usability, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to assign application permissions to each user roles.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (administrator capability to assign permissions). It also concerns access control/authorization, so it relates to security (SE). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: A selection/filter capability shall be provided to restrict operations on active, inactive, or all structures during any data archiving activity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (selection/filter) to restrict which structures are targeted during data archiving—this is a functional requirement describing system behavior. No explicit non-functional quality (performance, security, usability, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to create agency-specific elements, including element definitions, condition states, actions, models and other related information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an action the administrator shall be able to perform (create agency-specific elements). No quality/constraint (performance, security, availability, usability, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: The Pontis 5.0 repository must be able to store the following quantities of bridges, work recommendations, scenarios, projects, and users at a minimum:
AI_Rationale: Specifies the repository's capability to store minimum quantities (functional storage requirement) and implies capacity/size scaling constraints (scalability). No availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to add custom structure lists.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (administrator can add custom structure lists), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: A standalone database engine will continue to be necessary. Performance objectives for the standalone database should be comparable.
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly constrains performance (“Performance objectives ... should be comparable”), so Performance is set. It also mandates continuing support for a standalone database engine, which implies a portability/compatibility constraint to retain standalone operation, so Portability is set. No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, security, usability, maintainability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, operability, or functional behavior is stated.

RequirementText: Some of these factors may make it impossible to achieve the performance requirements for Pontis 5.0 outlined in this section. However, based on our assessment of the existing condition of most agency systems and infrastructure, we think this outcome is unlikely.
AI_Rationale: Text discusses potential inability to meet performance requirements for Pontis 5.0 and assesses likelihood; this directly concerns performance characteristics. It does not explicitly mention scalability, availability, security, or other qualities, so only Performance is marked.

RequirementText: There are selected licensees, typically smaller agencies, who may have much lower powered computer resources, and their performance must be acceptable as well, although not necessarily comparable to larger installations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies acceptable performance on lower-powered client computers (performance constraint). It also implies support/compatibility with less-capable platforms/environments, so portability is relevant. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: This section presents speed targets for specific system functions. The apparent speed of many operations will be affected by network latency (delays due to transmission of text and images from the Pontis application server to the client desktop machine and web browser, or for standalone operations). The times indicated in the table represent user-experienced response times.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies user-experienced response time targets and references network latency affecting operation speed—this is a performance (speed/latency) non-functional requirement. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The target times indicated in the table represent 90% thresholds â€“ that is, the performance requirement specified here means that the indicated functions will take less than the indicated length of time an average of 9 out of 10 times.
AI_Rationale: Specifies timing thresholds for function execution (90% of the time), which is a performance requirement (latency/response time). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Pontis 5.0 is not strictly a transactional application or mission-critical for most capabilities. In light of this, the application shall be available for use 18 hours per day, 353 days per year, reserving 6 hours per day and one day per month for routine agency network and infrastructure maintenance. During normal times of operation, Pontis shall achieve 98 percent up time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required availability (hours per day, days per year, and 98% uptime). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are requested.

RequirementText: Because Pontis 5.0 is not a mission-critical application, there will be no attempt to design or construct the system for uninterrupted operation. Agencies may choose to implement database transaction logging, mirroring, or switchover to backup servers in the event of a hardware or network failure, but support for these decisions or implementation are beyond the scope of Pontis 5.0 effort. Procedures and equipment for backups (database and software) and disaster recovery are also outside the scope of this effort.
AI_Rationale: The text explicitly discusses lack of design for uninterrupted operation and excludes backup/disaster recovery and mirroring support—these concern availability and fault tolerance. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Pontis application server (ASP.NET) software will run on a server located within a (presumably) secure facility at each agency. Because it is an ASP.NET application, the end users can vary in location depending on the network accessibility of the server. The Pontis database, and any other databases to be accessed from Pontis may be co-located on the same server machine, but at a minimum must be accessible from the Pontis application server via standard database communication and connection protocols.
AI_Rationale: Specifies deployment/operational details (server location, application server) and how databases must be accessible, which relates to operability. Also allows databases to be co-located or accessed over standard protocols, implying portability/compatibility across deployment environments. Does not explicitly state availability, security controls, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The server machine will run Windows Server 2003 or, given technology evolution, a descendant target server environment identified in the implementation plan. The server machine must have all necessary software to run an ASP.NET application. This specifically includes, but may not be limited to, IIS30, the .NET Framework and ASP.NET. Other web servers, appliances, and add-in technologies may also be necessary depending on the final application design.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the runtime/server environment and required server software (Windows Server, IIS, .NET/ASP.NET), which concerns deployment/operation of the system. This matches Operability. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The effective speed and congestion levels on the network that connects the servers and client machines running the application; and
AI_Rationale: The phrase refers to network speed and congestion levels, which are performance-related characteristics (latency/throughput). It does not explicitly address availability, scalability, security, or other qualities, so only Performance is marked.

RequirementText: Back-end server stored procedures and server-side functions will be supported and may be assumed to be usable in the technical design of Pontis 5.0. This will require implementation of the triggers in native DBMS procedural code. This implies that it is very likely that the server-side code will vary for each target DBMS, even if the interfaces remain identical, increasing the development and testing effort with the significant benefit of assigning processing to the appropriate application tier(s).
AI_Rationale: The requirement states that server-side code (triggers/procedures) will be implemented in native DBMS procedural code and will likely vary per target DBMS — this directly implies portability concerns (different DBMS targets). It also explicitly notes increased development and testing effort, indicating maintainability implications. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, operability, scalability, usability, legal, or look-and-feel requirements.

RequirementText: Standalone capabilities will require a workstation running the latest .NET Framework, presumably Windows XP Professional (SP2) or its successor. Some capabilities may require a network connection. The workstationâ€™s hardware requirements will be similar to those of the existing Pontis 4.4 application. There will continue to be a standalone/runtime database engine provided with the application for offline work. The offline database is assumed to be Sybase Adaptive Server Anywhere release 9 or above.
AI_Rationale: Specifies runtime/installation requirements (OS, .NET, hardware) and that a standalone/runtime DB engine will be provided for offline work (functional). These are operability concerns (environment, deployment) and platform/DB compatibility implications (portability). No explicit security, performance, availability, scalability, or other NFRs mentioned.

RequirementText: Pontis 5.0 security is a mix of database security and application security. Overall security is provided by the database and the Pontis 5.0 user authentication mechanisms with more refined security over program capabilities - e.g. create a bridge - being addressed by the application.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes authentication, application and database security responsibilities and fine-grained capability controls—explicitly about security concerns (authn/authz), so label SE applies. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: It is assumed that authentication will utilize a single sign-on (SSO) approach and application security will be declaratively managed through database or directory entries, rather than hard-wired into the application. This mechanism may have implications for BRIDGEWare/AASHTOWare generally and will need to be coordinated with the other AASHTO products31.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies use of single sign-on and declarative management of application security via database/directory entries, which directly concerns authentication and security architecture (SE). It also implies operational/integration concerns (O) because security management approach must be coordinated with other AASHTO products and affects system administration and integration. Other labels are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: Database security will need to be insured for the Pontis data stored in the RDBMS; most likely this will be done by using a specific username/password combination and running as particular database roles for each database connection. This security structure should be similar to the existing security approach in Pontis 4.x. For web clients, care will be taken to insure that connection information is not accessible from application pages (e.g., userid/password embedded in HTML form variables).
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns protecting database connection credentials, using specific usernames/passwords, roles, and preventing exposure of connection info in web pages — all security-related controls (authentication/authorization and confidentiality). No other quality attributes or functional behaviors are specified.

RequirementText: The application level security controls will be consistent with current Pontis 4.x procedures, except more comprehensive; no exceptional controls are required. A specific requirement addresses field-level data security.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly refers to application level security controls and field-level data security; this is clearly a security (SE) non-functional requirement. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: For normal users, the configurability of the system via the interface will be limited to changing the parameters used to perform the various analyses and modeling functions. Access to all other configuration parameters, such as module access, will be restricted to Pontis super users or application administrators.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies role-based restriction of configuration capabilities (normal users vs super users/administrators), which is an access control/security constraint. It does not specify availability, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: There are no specific privacy or immunity (antivirus) requirements for Pontis 5.0 identified at this time.
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly addresses privacy and antivirus (security-related) requirements, indicating none were identified. This concerns security topics, so SE=1. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes, so other labels are 0.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of exporting the NBI data in the specified NBI format as outlined in the NBI guideline. The system shall be capable supporting the future NBI coding guide changes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (export NBI data in specified format) — functional. The clause about supporting future NBI coding guide changes implies adaptability/extensibility and ease of modification, which maps to maintainability. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, UI, or operability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall provide data review wizard for comparing incoming bridge data with existing data. The errors will be highlighted for easy review.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (providing a data review wizard that compares incoming and existing data). The mention that errors will be highlighted for easy review indicates a usability concern (making review easier), so US is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints are specified.

RequirementText: Pontis 5.0 will be designed to be used with Internet Explorer; it may work correctly with other browsers but this cannot be guaranteed. Given the predominance of IE in the browser market, it does not appear to be necessary to consider support for other browsers, although this may need to be reconsidered if external customers are running the application(s) and need to employ different browser technology such as Netscape or Mozilla FireFox.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies which browsers the product is intended to support (designed for Internet Explorer and not guaranteeing other browsers), which is a portability/compatibility constraint across environments (browsers). It does not specify operational, performance, security, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure definitions of element types, environments, materials, and categories.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that an administrator must be able to configure definitions (element types, environments, materials, categories). It does not state availability, performance, security constraints, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The speed of the servers on which Pontis, the RDBMS, the analytical and other processing engines, and other information resources are installed;
AI_Rationale: The statement refers to 'speed of the servers' hosting database and processing engines, which is a performance-related quality attribute (latency/throughput). It does not specify functionality, availability, security, scalability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: Integrating DataWindow .NET is likely a short-term strategy to ease migration of user forms and reports to Pontis 5.0. A stated objective for Pontis 5.0 is eliminating dependency on PowerBuilder. Ideally, the application should not require any particular vendor technology for report or form generation, such as InfoMaker/PowerBuilder, so a sunset plan must be developed to outline a strategy to meet this objective. However, the application shall continue to provide a plug-in capability to integrate third-party .NET data displays and reports in the user workspace.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states the application shall continue to provide a plug-in capability to integrate third-party .NET displays (functional). It also explicitly expresses the objective to eliminate dependency on specific vendor technology and avoid requiring particular vendor tech for report/form generation, which maps to portability. The need for a sunset plan to outline strategy to remove the dependency implies maintainability concerns (migration/ongoing architecture/technical-debt remediation). No explicit statements about security, performance, availability, scalability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability were made.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to add custom project lists.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that an administrator must be able to perform an action (add custom project lists). No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure default values for various scenario parameters.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement giving an administrator capability (configure default values). It pertains to system administration/manageability, so Operability is also applicable. No explicit non-functional quality constraints like security, performance, or usability are stated.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure customizable options that affect system operations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (administrator can configure options) — a functional requirement (F). It concerns administrative configuration functionality, which relates to operability/administration (O). Stating that only the administrator can perform the action implies an authorization/access-control constraint, so security (SE) is applicable. Other quality attributes (availability, performance, etc.) are not explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall validate all configuration options to verify proper program operation, including explicit identification of any potentially conflicting program options.
AI_Rationale: This specifies system behavior (validating configuration options and identifying conflicts), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Configuration option validation shall be supported by a built-in diagnostic report.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (built-in diagnostic report to validate configuration options) — a functional feature. It also implies operability/administration support (diagnostics for operators), so Operability is applicable. No explicit references to availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, maintainability, or usability.

RequirementText: The administrator shall be able to configure the labels of user interface items and screen displays.
AI_Rationale: This specifies an administrator capability (functional requirement) to configure UI labels and screen displays. It also concerns the appearance/presentation of the UI (look & feel). It does not mention availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or explicit usability metrics, so those are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of supporting internationalization using the standard Windows/.NET internationalization support.
AI_Rationale: The requirement states a capability the system must provide (support internationalization) so it's a functional requirement. It explicitly mandates use of standard Windows/.NET internationalization support, which ties the implementation to a particular platform/runtime (portability concern). Supporting internationalization impacts user experience for different locales/languages, so it also relates to usability. No explicit mention of performance, availability, security, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of showing all screens, menus, user interface controls, prompts, error messages and information notices in native language, with some of these elements customizable.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (functional) to present UI elements in the user's native language and allow some customization (function). It pertains to user interface presentation and customization, so Look & Feel is applicable, and it impacts usability (ease of use/localization). No explicit availability, security, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, or performance concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall provide an interface to communicate with an external service or third-party software. A set of standard interfaces25 will be defined for this capability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies the system shall provide an interface to communicate with external/third-party software (functional). Defining standard interfaces implies interoperability/compatibility concerns, mapped to portability. No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, scalability, operability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The capacity and speed of the commercial RDBMS product used for the data repository;
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly refers to 'capacity and speed' of the RDBMS, which map to performance characteristics; capacity also implies scalability concerns for handling data volumes.

RequirementText: The system shall provide application administrators with a secured tool for overriding bridge/project check-out status.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a provided tool (functional requirement) and explicitly requires it to be secured for administrators, implying security/authorization concerns. No mention of availability, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a fixed set of predefined, secured, administration reports to document users, user roles, application privileges, user login sessions, checked-out bridges, and other key information necessary to manage application operation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (provide predefined admin reports) — F. Reports are described as "secured", implying access control/security concerns — SE. The reports are for managing application operation and documenting operational data, which supports operability/administration — O. No explicit statements about availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, legal, fault tolerance, or usability.

RequirementText: The EIM&DSS design will be informed by World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) design guidelines26 and conform to common industry practices for user interaction behavior and user interface design. For the thin-client portion of Pontis, the AASHTO standards for thin-client web-based applications software will be followed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies conformance to W3C and AASHTO standards for UI and user interaction—this is primarily about look-and-feel requirements and compliance with external standards (legal/standards).

RequirementText: The software, through its user interface, will clearly identify the product name (Pontis 5.0.x), the licensee, the connected user, and the organization that developed the system (AASHTO). Additional session identification information will be available on demand.27 The overall look and feel of the product will be that of a professional and conservative application.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies UI behavior to display product name, licensee, user, organization and session info (functional). It also prescribes the overall look and feel be professional and conservative (look & feel). No explicit availability, security, performance, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: Pontis 5.0 will, at AASHTOâ€™s direction, adopt any elements of the look and feel of other existing AASHTOWare/BRIDGEWare applications where appropriate. In particular, UI conventions from Virtis/Opis will be reviewed to ensure that the Pontis 5.0 does not differ markedly in appearance. AASHTO may designate such model applications and must provide the development team with access to fully-documented style sheets/UI layouts or demonstration software to support this requirement.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates adopting look and feel/UI conventions from other applications; this is a user interface appearance requirement (Look & Feel). No explicit functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: There will be no support for individual personalization of the user interface (skins) other than the availability of certain features that are tied to a user role (e.g. not all users will have the ability to edit bridge data and thus will not see an â€œEdit Onâ€� button on the corresponding screen).
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior regarding UI personalization and role-based feature visibility (functional). It constrains look-and-feel customization (no skins) and enforces role-based visibility/authorization, implying security/authorization controls.

RequirementText: Pontis 5.0 will be designed to be as straightforward and intuitive as possible, and familiar to existing users. The user interface will provide effective navigation, visual referencing, and task sequencing. Users will have access to on-line help throughout the UI.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes UI intuitiveness, navigation, visual referencing, task sequencing and online help—these are usability concerns (US) and also relate to look & feel/visual aspects (LF). No availability, security, performance, etc. requested.

RequirementText: The application should look and feel consistent in the web and standalone operating environments, therefore it will conform to standard .NET standalone and web application conventions with necessary accommodations for the deployment environment only where these prove necessary and appropriate.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly addresses look and feel consistency and conformance to .NET UI conventions (Look & Feel). It also mentions deployment environments and conforming to application conventions, which relates to operability/deployment considerations, so Operability is marked. No explicit performance, security, portability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: As a general goal, Pontis users should be comfortable operating and using the software after two full days of training. Users who only wish to access and display bridge information should be comfortable operating and using the software after two hours of training. System administrators should be comfortable operating and maintaining the software after user training and one full day of system administration training.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies user comfort after specific training durations — this is about usability (learnability). The administrator clause explicitly concerns being comfortable operating and maintaining the software, which implies operability and maintainability.

RequirementText: The system developer shall consider supporting existing custom forms and reports developed in PowerBuilder 9. It shall decide on a development tool for users so that they can continue to customize Pontis and extend its capability. For example, custom forms and reports created with PowerBuilder 9 may be migrated to a .NET application by using the Sybase DataWindow .NET technology which is available in PowerBuilder 10.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns supporting/migrating existing custom forms/reports and choosing a development tool so users can continue to customize and extend the system. This relates to maintainability/extendability (MN) and portability/compatibility across technologies (PO). It does not specify functional behavior, availability, security, performance, UI look-and-feel, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall provide application administrators with a secured tool for clearing batch processing tables used by the system for deadlock/lockout resolution.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies providing a tool (functional). It is explicitly described as "secured" (security). It is intended for application administrators to clear batch tables for deadlock/lockout resolution, which is an operational/admin function (operability) and supports recovery/resilience (fault tolerance). No explicit statements about availability, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, usability, look-and-feel, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to configure data validation rules. This shall be a privileged operation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can configure data validation rules) and explicitly notes it is a privileged operation, implying an authorization/security constraint. No availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or usability aspects are specified.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create and edit work recommendations. The system shall be capable of estimating quantity for bridge type work recommendations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies user actions ('create and edit work recommendations') and system capability ('estimating quantity for bridge type work recommendations'), both describing functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of performing configurable input range checks using the DATADICT table upon entering data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to perform configurable input range checks using a DATADICT table upon data entry, which describes functional behavior (input validation). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit and remove existing structures.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user capabilities (editing and removing structures), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, security, performance, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall provide the ability to mark a bridge with any of several status values (e.g. inactive/closed) and automatically filter displays to recognize the status value (e.g. to automatically suppress inactive/closed structures).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capabilities: marking bridges with status values and automatic filtering/suppression of displays. No explicit non-functional quality (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: The system shall support storage and management of information for bridges in a design or preconstruction state (functional requirement is related to 4.5 above)
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system shall provide (storage and management of bridge information) which is a functional requirement; no quality attributes or constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to renumber the bridge key identifier and have the change made globally. This functionality shall be restricted depending on the user privilege.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability to renumber a bridge key identifier (functional) and restricts the functionality based on user privilege, implying access control/authorization concerns (security). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create a new inspection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing the user to create a new inspection. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create a new inspection by copying a previous inspection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (creating a new inspection by copying an existing one), which is functional in nature. It does not mention any non-functional qualities such as performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to identify and select any previous inspection as the source for the copy action. The selection can be made by combination of date, inspection type, inspector, or inspection control group.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (identify and select a previous inspection using filter criteria) describing functional behavior. No non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall have a short-form interface (display only NBI and element data, similar to SI&A sheet) for inspection data entry with specifics of design and functionality to be determined as part of the technical design.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a particular user interface for inspection data entry (functional requirement). It also concerns the interface presentation/display (short-form, display only certain data), which relates to look-and-feel. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall have the option to copy the notes from previous inspection when creating a new inspection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (an option to copy notes when creating a new inspection), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create new inspection(s) by importing an PDI file.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (creating inspections by importing a PDI file), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to add new elements to the structure.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user can add new elements). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit all the NBI data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to edit NBI data), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Changes to calculated results such as Sufficiency Rating or NBI Appraisal Ratings will be prohibited except for secured, privileged users.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (only secured, privileged users may modify calculated results), which is a security/authorization constraint rather than a functional feature or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit element inspection data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a user capability (editing inspection data), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify non-functional qualities such as availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit the bridge inventory items excluding the dependent/derived values (i.e., the appraisal ratings that are calculated automatically).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to edit bridge inventory items with a constraint excluding derived/appraisal ratings—this is a functional requirement (behavioral). No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit inspection and structure notes.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that a user must be able to edit inspection and structure notes. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of storing notes in plain text and XML, and shall maximize the notes field size. The user shall be capable of setting the size of the notes field.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities (store notes in plain text and XML; user can set field size) — hence Functional. Also imposes a capacity-related requirement (maximize notes field size / adjustable size), which relates to scalability/capacity constraints, so Scalability is marked. Other quality attributes are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of performing data validation tasks including cross field validation upon saving data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (data validation, including cross-field checks on save). It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to enter and update inspection planning information (i.e., frequency of regular and special inspections and estimated resource requirements).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability to enter and update inspection planning information (CRUD-like behavior), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create new structure(s) by importing from a supported file type. The supported file types are to be determined, but will include at least PDI, NBI, and XML.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that users can create structures by importing supported file types (PDI, NBI, XML). No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, portability, etc.) are stated, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create a new structure by copying all data of an existing structure.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (creating a new structure by copying data from an existing one), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create a new structure with a user-defined bridge key.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability: creating a new structure and providing a user-defined bridge key — this describes functional behavior (what the system should do). No non-functional attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall provide the ability to create or refresh a map display from a set of bridge or project records selected within the Pontis desktop.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (creating/refreshing a map display from selected records). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to view the data stored in the Physical Inventory tables through the Pontis graphical user interface (GUI).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (viewing data through the GUI), which is a functional requirement. It does not state non-functional qualities like performance, availability, security, usability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to switch between predefined structure lists.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (ability to switch between predefined lists), i.e., a functional requirement; no non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to find structures based on the structure ID, structure name, feature intersected, facility carried, route number, LRS Inventory Route, KM/mile posts, structure types, design types and materials, and by searching the notes fields. The query shall be restricted depending on the user privilege.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement describes a user-facing capability to search/find structures by various attributes — this is functional. The statement that the query shall be restricted depending on user privilege implies access control/authorization, so it also maps to security. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, usability, or other non-functional concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to enter a WHERE clause of the SQL query in the Find and the Filter window and run a query against the bridges in the database. The query will be verified by the application and SQL errors will be reported to the user for correction. This capability shall be an application privilege. Bridge-level security of the user shall be applied automatically.
AI_Rationale: Requirement primarily specifies a functional capability (enter WHERE clause, run query, verification, error reporting). It also explicitly references access control: 'This capability shall be an application privilege' and 'Bridge-level security of the user shall be applied automatically', which maps to security (SE). No explicit non-functional attributes such as availability, performance, portability, scalability, usability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select a structure by directly typing in the structure ID in GUI, with the display scrolling to that structure. Bridge-level security of the user shall be applied automatically.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a user-facing capability (typing structure ID and auto-scrolling) which is functional. The statement 'Bridge-level security of the user shall be applied automatically' explicitly specifies a security constraint, so mark Security. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel/usability quality requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall display the data in the appropriate unit of measurement as configured for the application. This will be a permanent modal setting for the application. This setting shall be configurable (as stipulated in Requirement 22.1).
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall display data in configured units (functional behavior) and that this setting shall be configurable (administrative/operational capability). No performance, security, portability, etc., concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select bridges on a supported map display and generate a bridge list for use within Pontis, for example, to perform a simulation analysis or to generate an inspection roster.The user shall be able to view the data stored in the Project Planning tables through the GUI.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes user-facing capabilities: selecting bridges on a map, generating a bridge list for use in Pontis, and viewing project planning table data through the GUI. These are functional behaviors; it does not specify quality attributes like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to switch between predefined project lists.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (switching between predefined project lists), which is functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to filter and select projects by structure ID, project ID, program, action type, project status, review status, treatment, program year, and project end date.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (filter and select projects by various attributes), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to link and manage multimedia files.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (link and manage multimedia files), which is a functional behavior. It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, security, usability, or portability, so no other labels apply.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to find projects by project ID, project name, project status, structure ID, and program.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (search/filter projects by various attributes), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to enter a WHERE clause of the SQL query in the Find and the Filter window and run a query against the projects in the database. The query will be verified by the application and SQL errors will be reported to the user for correction. This capability shall be an application privilege. Bridge-level security of the user shall be applied automatically.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability to enter and run WHERE clauses and have queries verified and errors reported — this is functional (F). It also mandates that the capability be an application privilege and that bridge-level security is applied, which are security concerns (SE). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, usability, legal, or other quality requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select a project by directly typing in the project ID in the GUI, with the display scrolling to that structure. Bridge or project level security of the user shall be applied automatically.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action in the GUI (functional). Requires automatic application of bridge/project-level security (authorization) — security. The GUI typing and auto-scrolling implies usability considerations (ease of selection), so Usability is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select projects (work) on a supported map display and generate a project/bridge list for use within Pontis, for example, to display results of a simulation analysis or to generate a STIP display.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user capability: selecting projects on a map and generating a project/bridge list for use within Pontis (functional behavior). No non-functional attributes (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select and execute predefined reports to view bridge data, project data, preservation model data, program simulation results, and configuration data. The existing Pontis reports shall form the basis for the predefined reports to be provided in Pontis 5.0.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability to select and execute predefined reports to view various data types — this describes functional behavior (what the system should do). No explicit quality/constraint (performance, security, usability, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create reports in a .NET compliant report generator other than InfoMaker and review these reports from within the Pontis GUI.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (create and review reports within the GUI); no explicit non-functional constraints like availability, performance, security, portability, or usability are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall provide the ability to integrate current selections with a .NET compliant report generator other than InfoMaker. AASHTO may provide users with a list of suggested report generators to replace PowerBuilder/InfoMaker.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall provide ability to integrate selections with a .NET-compliant report generator (functional integration capability). It also explicitly requires compatibility with .NET report generators and replacing InfoMaker, implying portability/compatibility concerns, so Portability is marked. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, etc., requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall provide the ability to incorporate PDF files into standard Pontis reports.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (incorporating PDF files into reports). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall provide the ability to save reports in PDF, HTML, and XML formats.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — saving/exporting reports in specified formats (PDF, HTML, XML). It does not state availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall provide the ability to create any report that is bridge or project based by selecting the relevant â€œdriverâ€� records from a map display.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (creating reports based on selected driver records from a map display), so it is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to filter and select work candidates by structure ID, project ID, program, action type, project status, review status, treatment, program year, and project end date.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (filtering and selecting work candidates by various attributes), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall provide an inspection scheduling tool.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability ('provide an inspection scheduling tool') describing what the system should do—purely functional with no explicit quality/constraint attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select structures by structure ID, district, county, administrative area (geographic group), ownership, custodianship, functional class, NHS status, on/off system, inspector, bridge group, inspection due dates, and all or some environment and elements. The query shall be restricted depending on the user privilege.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing selection/filtering capabilities (F). It also explicitly states queries shall be restricted depending on user privilege, which implies access control/authorization concerns (security, SE). No other quality attributes (availability, performance, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Privileged users shall be able to delete an existing inspection unless it is â€œlocked downâ€�.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to delete an inspection). It also explicitly refers to 'privileged users' and a 'locked down' state, which implies access control/authorization concerns (security). No other quality attributes are indicated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to specify the characteristics of the simulation, including the simulation timeframe, various thresholds for the simulation, the project types included in the simulation, the needs addressed, and the annual budget for the simulation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to specify simulation characteristics), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to update the unit costs and the policy standards governing the improvement model.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability (update unit costs and policy standards), which is a functional behavior. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, maintainability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to modify the technical parameters governing the simulation, including the parameters of the improvement model and the simulation rules.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to modify simulation parameters), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, operability, or other non-functional aspects, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to dynamically determine bridge subsets as part of the scenario settings.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (ability to dynamically determine bridge subsets within scenario settings), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of running a program simulation for a selected set of structures and storing the simulation results in the Pontis database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (run simulation for selected structures and store results) describing system behavior—this is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to choose from Pontis-generated work recommendations, inspector work candidates, and user-defined work items to include in the bridge simulation for a structure.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (selecting items to include in a bridge simulation), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of running bridge analysis for a single structure and storing the simulation results in the Pontis database.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies what the system shall do: run bridge analysis for a single structure and store simulation results in the Pontis database. This describes functional behavior (capabilities and data storage). It does not specify availability, performance, scalability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a Bridge Analysis Dashboard that will allow the user to choose work items for a structure and the timing of the work, view the impact of the work on the condition of the structure, assign the work candidates to a project, and perform life-cycle cost analysis for the structure. The exact functionality of the dashboard will be informed by review of the results of NCHRP Project 12-67, Multiple-Objective Optimization for Bridge Management Systems.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific dashboard capabilities (choose work items, timing, view impacts, assign to projects, perform cost analysis) — these are functional requirements. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create new programs by manually entering program information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (creating new programs by entering information), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a preservation model dashboard integrating the capabilities described above. The exact functionality of the dashboard will be informed by review of the results of NCHRP Project 12-67, Multiple-Objective Optimization for Bridge Management Systems.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: provide a preservation model dashboard integrating described capabilities. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints; only that detailed functionality will be informed by an external review.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit or delete existing programs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (editing or deleting programs), which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit or delete existing projects.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user capabilities (edit/delete projects) which describe system behavior — a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able assign Pontis-generated work recommendations, inspector work candidates, and user-specified work items to a project, or remove work items from a project.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes user capability (assign/remove work items to/from a project) — a functional behavior. No mentions of availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to split a project into multiple projects and combine multiple projects into a master project.
AI_Rationale: Describes user capabilities (split and combine projects) — a functional requirement specifying system behavior. No availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit the characteristics of multiple projects simultaneously (batch update).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (batch editing of multiple projects), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state constraints about availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit the data stored in the Project Planning tables through the GUI.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: users must be able to edit Project Planning table data via the GUI. It does not state availability, security, performance, UI aesthetics, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of tracking and linking funding levels and project budgets. The system shall warn users if the project budget exceeds funding.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities: tracking/linking funding and budgets and warning users when budget exceeds funding. No quality attributes (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of grouping work candidates by different action types â€“ bridge-level, element-level, and flexible-level actions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability of the system to group work candidates by action types, which is a functional behavior/feature. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of performing single-field and cross-field validation on NBI data items in batch mode.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (validation of data items, single-field and cross-field, in batch mode). It does not state availability, performance, scalability, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall provide the capability to â€œlock downâ€� an inspection record once signed and sealed to prevent deletion or modification.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (provide lockdown of a record) => Functional. It also imposes protection against deletion/modification (access control/immutability), which is a security/integrity concern => Security. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, usability, maintainability, operability, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create new projects by manually entering the project information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users creating new projects via manual data entry. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of determining the long-term cost of achieving an average health index target for one or more structure(s), broken down by elements, element categories, for the entire structure.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (determine long-term cost broken down by elements for structures), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, scalability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select the structural elements to be included in the simulation.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to select structural elements for simulation), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of incorporating Health Index targets in a preservation (short-term) model.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (to incorporate Health Index targets into a preservation model), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to sort the element data by unit number, environment, and quantity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (sorting data by fields), which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to view all data from any two inspections, for a single bridge, in a tiled14 presentation for easy comparison. The presentation (view/report) shall clearly highlight the difference between two inspections.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability to view data from two inspections in a tiled presentation and to highlight differences — this is a functional requirement. It also prescribes presentation/layout and highlighting for comparison, which are look-and-feel (UI presentation) concerns and imply usability (easy comparison). No indications of availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a configurable tracking mechanism to ensure that a set of screens and data fields have been reviewed and approved during the course of an inspection.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (a configurable tracking mechanism to ensure screens and data fields are reviewed and approved), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects, so no additional NFR labels are assigned.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of calculating NBI condition ratings using the FHWA NBI Translator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to perform a specific calculation using the FHWA NBI Translator, which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, availability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of calculating and storing bridge Sufficiency Rating.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (calculate and store bridge Sufficiency Rating), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall streamline the model generation process (i.e. remove any unnecessary prompts as currently implemented in version 4.x).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies changing system behavior to streamline the model generation process (functional). It also aims to improve the user interaction by removing unnecessary prompts, which impacts usability. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance or operability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of calculating Structurally Deficient/Functionally Obsolete (SD/FO) status.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (calculate SD/FO status), which is a functional behaviour. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The ability of the user to update the calculated ratings and status in the database shall be a controlled privilege. Agencies may optionally exclude/prohibit direct edits to the calculated inspection results such as the NBI translator output. The agency shall therefore be able to enforce strict use of calculated translator results for calculating NBI condition ratings.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that updating calculated ratings is a controlled privilege and agencies can prohibit direct edits and enforce use of calculated results — this describes functional capability (ability to control updates) and access control/authorization (security). It also implies administrative/manageability capability for agencies to enforce policies (operability). No explicit mentions of availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of prompting users when the dependent fields for ratings are changed and offer the user option to recalculate the ratings.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior to prompt users and offer recalculation option (functional). It also concerns user interaction/experience (usability), so US is set. No indications of availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: The system administrator shall be able to configure the recalculation behavior of the derived data. The options shall include 1) do nothing, 2) alert user that recalculation is required and give option to recalculate before update/save, and 3) recalculate silently with no confirmation prompt when user saves the inspection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a configurable capability (admin can configure recalculation behavior) which is functional (defines what the system should provide). It also concerns system administration/configuration, so it relates to operability (manageability). The statement names the system administrator role having the ability to configure, which implies role-based control/privilege (security/authorization concern), so SE is marked. No explicit statements about availability, performance, fault tolerance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, maintainability, legal or usability requirements are present.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of calculating appraisal ratings.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (calculating appraisal ratings), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of creating cost and deterioration elicitation records for Pontis users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability of the system to create specific records for users — describes functional behavior (what the system should do). No quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, scalability, or UI are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of updating the transition probabilities for preservation actions based on expert elicitations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to update transition probabilities based on expert elicitations, which describes a functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of updating preservation action costs based on expert elicitations.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies a capability the system must provide (updating preservation action costs from expert elicitations), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of updating transition probabilities for donothing actions based on historical inspection data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior—updating transition probabilities from historical inspection data—which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, maintenance, portability, fault tolerance, legal, or UI/look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit the cost and deterioration models through the GUI and immediately see the impact on model recommendations.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (editing models via the GUI). It also implies usability (immediate feedback for the user) and performance ("immediately" implies a responsiveness/latency constraint). No indications of security, scalability, portability, legal, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of using the transition probabilities and preservation action costs to develop an optimal preservation policy as detailed in the Pontis Technical Manual.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability/behavior the system must perform—using inputs (transition probabilities and costs) to produce an optimal preservation policy per the Pontis manual—so it is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of recovering the model if the elicitation process fails.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system must be capable of recovering the model when the elicitation process fails — this describes a recovery behavior (functional) and a resilience/fault-recovery quality, i.e., fault tolerance. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of restoring the previous action costs, transition probabilities, and preservation policy.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system capability to restore previous parameters (action costs, transition probabilities, preservation policy) — this is a functional capability (F) and primarily a fault-recovery/restore capability (FT). It also implies an operational/admin feature (O) for managing/restoring state. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI, maintainability, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall eliminate any and all dependencies on workstation (user) control/parameter files for program operation. For example, parameter information required by the NBI Translator (including information currently stored in ELEMENTS.PRN and ERRORS.LST) will be stored strictly within the Pontis database rather than on individual user workstations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement prescribes a system behavior to eliminate workstation-specific control/parameter files and instead store parameters in the central Pontis database—this is a functional requirement (F). Centralizing configuration implies improved operability/manageability (O) and easier maintenance/administration of parameters (MN). It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, performance, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability, so those are set to false.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of supporting multiple cost and deterioration models.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (supporting multiple cost and deterioration models), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, scalability, security, or maintainability constraints.

RequirementText: The system has an embedded help file that contains basic solutions and hints for problematic situations
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system feature (embedded help file) — functional. It also addresses usability by aiding users with solutions and hints, improving ease of use. No indications of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: PR-1: The system should be executed without problems in a machine that fulfills the requirements of the Java runtime environment [2].
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must run on machines meeting the Java runtime environment requirements — a platform/compatibility constraint (portability). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: PR-2: The basic artificial intelligence must operate fast enough. The next move should be calculated within 10 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the AI must calculate the next move within 10 seconds — a clear performance (timing) constraint. It also implies a functional behavior (compute next move), so both Functional and Performance are set to true. No indication of availability, security, scalability, etc.
