RequirementText: The system does not use or receive network connections and is used locally. This means that no network safety requirements exist. Overwriting an existing file on the file system has to be confirmed from the user to prevent accidental loss of data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (must confirm overwriting files) which is functional. It also addresses user interaction to prevent accidental data loss, which is a usability concern. Other non-functional categories (network availability/security, portability, performance, etc.) are not explicitly required.

RequirementText: No personal information is stored by the system so no specific security requirements need to be defined.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly addresses personal information and security considerations, asserting no security requirements are necessary; this directly concerns security/privacy. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, legal compliance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system functions on a computer that has a screen for output and keyboard or mouse or both for input.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required user interface devices (screen output and keyboard/mouse input). This is a UI/look-and-feel constraint and affects usability (interaction methods), not functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: SQA-1: The system shall run well on both Linux and Windows and should be playable with the mouse or the keyboard or both.
AI_Rationale: Specifies supported platforms (Linux and Windows) => Portability. Requires interaction via mouse and/or keyboard => UI look & feel and usability constraints (matches example labeling LF and US). No explicit availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The user interface uses one main window for the actual game playing and dialog windows for changing the general settings of the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user interface layout (main window and dialog windows) which is a look-and-feel/UI presentation requirement. Does not state functional behavior, usability metrics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system requires a working Java-environment [2] and a graphical user interface supported by the Java Swing library [4].
AI_Rationale: Specifies required runtime environment (Java) which is a platform/portability constraint (PO). Also mandates a GUI implemented with Java Swing, which constrains the user interface technology/appearance (LF). No availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The system loads the game from a file
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (loading a game from a file), which is a functional requirement; no quality attributes or constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system is playable with the minimum setup defined earlier in Hardware Requirements.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system must be playable given the minimum hardware setup—i.e., it must operate correctly on the defined environment. This is an operability/installation constraint similar to provided examples labeled O. It does not state performance, portability across platforms, security, or other non-functional concerns explicitly.

RequirementText: The system saves the game in a file
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a system capability (saving the game to a file). It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: All the user interfaces will be designed following common guidelines in the usability document.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that user interfaces must follow usability guidelines. This is a usability requirement (US) and also affects look-and-feel/UI design (LF). No functional, security, performance, or other qualities are implied.

RequirementText: The system searches an external source for games on startup and loads them
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behavior (search external source for games at startup and load them). No explicit non-functional constraints like performance, availability, security, or portability are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system uses a graphical user interface to display data to the user
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies functional behavior (the system shall use a graphical user interface to display data). It does not specify visual style, usability, performance, or other non-functional qualities, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: All the games end on a pre-defined condition
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior/functional rule that games must end when a predefined condition is met; does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system can be used fully with a mouse
AI_Rationale: Specifies how users interact with the system (input device support), which is a usability/UX constraint (learnability/accessibility), not functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system supports multiple games, and can load additional games from an external source
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system functionality: supporting multiple games and loading additional games from external sources. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, scalability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system has support for multiple opening positions that can be applied to all the games
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/feature (support for multiple opening positions applicable to all games), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system can be used fully with a keyboard
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must be fully usable via keyboard-only interaction, which is an accessibility/usability requirement (ease of use for keyboard users). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system has an artificial intelligence that the player may play against. The artificial intelligence supports every two player game
AI_Rationale: Specifies a feature: the system provides an AI opponent that can play any two-player game. This describes functional behavior; no non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall support two player turn-based gaming
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability/feature (support two-player turn-based gaming), which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system has an embedded AI that takes over from a player when asked to do so
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: an embedded AI that takes control from a player on request. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system supports defining new games without modifying the source code
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (ability to define new games) — a functional aspect. The phrase 'without modifying the source code' indicates configurability/extensibility, which relates to maintainability. It also implies administrative/manageability (operators can add games), so operability is marked. No explicit mention of performance, security, scalability, portability, UI look-and-feel, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: The Framework API should expose at least the following functionality to client processes: Create, delete and modify Entities and Entity groups; Create, delete and modify relationships between Entities; List and access Entities with an API similar to that of a standard file system API; Execute queries for the retrieval of Entities using different criteria.
AI_Rationale: The text specifies concrete API operations the framework must provide (create/delete/modify entities and relationships, list/access, execute queries) — this is functional behavior. It also specifies an exposed API interface to client processes, which relates to system operability/integration (how other components operate with it), so Operability is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, or UI/look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: GUIs associated with the Framework SHOULD be designed such that an user with basic understanding of the Windows 2000/XP operating systems would instinctively be able to interact with them. Therefore, most GUIs MAY need to closely mimic popular Windows applications.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies GUI design to mimic Windows applications and be instinctive to Windows users — this is about look-and-feel and usability. It does not mandate OS runtime, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: At this stage of the development, the Framework MAY only operate in single user mode, with no networking capabilities.
AI_Rationale: The statement prescribes an operational mode (single-user, no networking), which is a behavioral constraint (functional). It explicitly restricts multi-user/networked operation, directly impacting scalability (cannot scale to multiple users) and relates to how the system is operated/deployed (operability). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, portability, legal, performance, look-and-feel, or maintainability.

RequirementText: The Framework Shell SHOULD NOT utilize more than 40 megabytes of RAM.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a resource usage limit (memory <= 40 MB), which is a performance/resource constraint, so it maps to Performance. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The Framework MUST guard against malicious scripts on remote websites from accessing its information. The Framework MUST guard against unintended corruption of information by the user himself.
AI_Rationale: Requirement demands protection against malicious scripts (prevention of unauthorized access and integrity protection) which maps to Security (SE). The need to guard against unintended corruption by users implies mechanisms for resilience/recovery or protective controls (e.g., validation, undo, transaction safety), which aligns with Fault Tolerance (FT). No explicit availability, legal, usability, or functional behavior beyond security was stated.

RequirementText: All proprietary trademarks, product names and/or logos used on this document are trademarks of their respective owners.
AI_Rationale: This statement is a legal/trademark attribution covering ownership and rights; it addresses legal compliance/attribution rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: All components associated with Project ZNIX should conform to the following standards: Windows 2000 Logo Requirements [WWW05].
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates conformance to an external standard (Windows 2000 Logo Requirements), which is a compliance/legal constraint. It does not explicitly state functional behavior, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: At this stage of development Project ZNIX requires no communication interfaces.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint: the system shall have no communication interfaces at this stage. Does not explicitly address availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The online help system should be compiled utilizing as much of non-technical terms as possible. Care SHOULD be taken not to produce an exhaustive user documentation as that would defeat the main purpose of the system as expressed in the introduction to section 2. A comprehensive Developerâ€™s Guide MAY be compiled to facilitate 3rd party ZNIX-aware applications.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the online help use non-technical terms and avoid exhaustive documentation to serve users—this is a usability/UX concern (clarity, learnability). No explicit constraints about performance, availability, security, portability, maintainability, or look-and-feel are stated, and the optional developer guide does not explicitly imply other NFRs.

RequirementText: A GUI capable of browsing the information managed by the Framework, similar to that of the Windows Explorer SHOULD be available to the user. The GUI MUST also be capable of allowing the user to specify relationships between disparate Entities as he see fit.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional capabilities: a GUI that can browse framework-managed information and allow users to specify relationships between Entities (Functional = true). It also explicitly constrains the GUI to be similar to Windows Explorer, which pertains to look-and-feel/layout requirements (LF = true). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, performance, scalability, security, portability, maintainability, operability, or explicit usability/accessibility concerns, so those labels are set to false. Usability is only implied indirectly by the Explorer-like requirement, but not stated explicitly, so it was conservatively set to false.

RequirementText: Provisions SHOULD be made so that at least the following 3rd party applications can take advantage of the Framework for the specified types of information.
AI_Rationale: The statement requires provisions for third-party applications to take advantage of the Framework (integration/compatibility/interoperability). This is a portability/compatibility requirement rather than a specific functional behavior or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: Therefore, some residue MUST be left on the data store to indicate that a portion of data has been archived. For example, assume all information relating to a â€œPersonâ€� Entity named John is archived to a CD-ROM. When the user subsequently looks for John, the Framework SHOULD NOT declare that such an Entity was not found. Rather, it SHOULD inform the user that the Entity has been archived (and OPTIONALLY, if he wishes to proceed, to remount the relevant storage device).
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior of the system when entities are archived (how lookups should respond), so is Functional. It also concerns informing the user and optional remount action, which impacts usability (user feedback/interaction), hence Usability. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Any coding conventions to be used during implementation MUST be documented before the beginning of the phase, and strictly adhered to during the phase.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates documenting and strictly following coding conventions, which primarily targets maintainability (code consistency, readability, and ease of future changes). No availability, performance, security, or UI aspects are implied.

RequirementText: Project ZNIX SHOULD be available to its potential users in source and binary from, and free of charge. The project MAY be hosted on a popular Open Source distribution website such that the Open Source community is aware of (and contribute to) its existence. The website for distributing the project SHALL include provisions for the users to make comments on the product as well as to compile a wish-list of features.
AI_Rationale: Specifies distribution & website features (functional requirements) and distribution/hosting (operability). Stating it must be free and likely open-source implies licensing/legal constraint. Provision for user comments/wish-list impacts usability.

RequirementText: ZNIX Framework will be licensed under GNU Library General Public License (LGPL) [WWW03]. The browser and any other tool released alongside the Framework will be licensed under GNU Public License (GPL) [WWW04].
AI_Rationale: Specifies licensing under LGPL and GPL, which are legal/compliance constraints; no functional or other quality attributes implied.

RequirementText: The system SHALL conform to ISO 10646 (Unicode UTF-8) and OPTIONALLY ISO 10646-1 (Unicode UTF-16) standards for character set encoding. [WWW06] Additionally, design of the system MAY yield a new set of standards that ZNIXaware client processes MAY need to conform to.
AI_Rationale: Specifies conformance to character encoding standards (Unicode UTF-8/UTF-16), which is primarily about portability/interoperability across platforms and clients. Does not impose legal/regulatory constraints, performance, security, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: Often, the user may want to archive portions of the information-store to removable storage media (the term storage media covers only CD-ROMs and USB Pen Drives at this point). However, this SHOULD not mean that such portions would be â€œforgottenâ€� by the Framework.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (ability to archive to removable media while retaining knowledge of archived items) — functional. It also implies resilience when data is moved to removable storage (framework must not forget or lose references), which is a fault-tolerance/recovery concern. Other quality categories are not explicitly indicated.

RequirementText: Mean Time between Failure (MTBF): The mean time between failures (MTBF) SHALL exceed 3 months.
AI_Rationale: MTBF is a reliability metric specifying time between failures, which directly relates to availability and implies fault tolerance/reliability requirements. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The document is automatically saved to disk in a manner that reflects the relationships it has to other Entities. The user may in the future fetch this document by following the relationship paths that he had created.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a system capability: automatically saving documents with relationships and allowing users to fetch documents by following relationship paths. This is a functional behavior (storage and retrieval). It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user MUST be able to view the information in the central store in a hierarchical manner that makes sense to him. Section 3.1.1 describes how this hierarchy is built up. The Framework SHOULD include a browser that is capable of displaying this hierarchy in a UI similar to that of the Windows Explorer. The browser MAY OPTIONALLY be integrated directly in to Windows Explorer, rather than being a standalone application. This browser MAY integrate the GUI described in section 3.1.1.5 as well.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (view hierarchical information) -> Functional. Describes UI presentation similar to Windows Explorer and GUI integration -> Look & Feel. Emphasis on user-facing presentation/usability -> Usability. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, or fault-tolerance requirements.

RequirementText: The Framework MUST be capable of capturing information form the software tools specified in Table 3.9.3-A. The data captured SHOULD be stored in a centralized data store. The Framework MAY decide whether the information should be stored as Entities or Associates. The data capturing and archiving mechanisms MAY resemble the following.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functionality: capturing information from specified tools and storing it (centralized store, choice of entity/associate). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, operability, maintainability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: User SHOULD be able to modify, add, delete or group these Entities by navigating to a virtual folder (e.g. /People/).
AI_Rationale: Specifies user capabilities to modify/add/delete/group entities via navigation—describes functional behavior (CRUD). No quality attributes like usability, performance, security, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: The email is intercepted before it is dispatched to the SMTP server.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a processing behavior (emails must be intercepted prior to being sent to SMTP), which is a functional requirement. No explicit quality concerns (security, performance, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: An Associate is created to contain the message body.
AI_Rationale: Specifies creation of an entity ('Associate') to contain the message body — a functional behavior/data requirement. No quality/constraint aspects indicated.

RequirementText: The recipient name(s) are used to create (if required) Entities under the â€œPeopleâ€� category. The Associate is then linked to each Entity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: creating People entities from recipient names and linking an Associate—this is a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The email is fetched from the POP3 server.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a behavior the system must perform (fetch email from a POP3 server), so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Address Book is used to create Entities under the category â€œPeopleâ€� (Category names are user definable. However, a certain set of categories like People, Email etc. MAY need to always be present).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior: the Address Book shall create Entities under categories (with user-definable category names and some mandatory categories). It describes what the system must do rather than performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The senderâ€™s name is used to create Entities, under the category â€œPeopleâ€�. The Associate is then linked to this Entity.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior: creating an Entity of category 'People' from the sender's name and linking an Associate to that Entity. No availability, performance, security, UI, or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: User SHOULD be able to specify when he is to start a research project; i.e. when the web sites he visits subsequently are to be permanently stored.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to specify when to start a research project and trigger permanent storage of visited websites), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The project name specified by the user spawns a new Entity in the Framework.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a functional behavior: when a user specifies a project name, the system creates (spawns) a new Entity in the Framework. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: An associate is created as an archive and is linked to this Entity.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior/data model operation (creating an associate as an archive and linking it to an entity). No non-functional qualities (availability, security, UI, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The user after editing a document in a word-processor invokes a special GUI supplied by the Framework.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action and system behavior (invoking a special GUI) — functional. Also references a GUI supplied by the Framework, implying interface/visual aspect (Look & Feel). No explicit non-functional attributes like performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The GUI allows him to draw arrows to and from (a symbol representing) the current document to any Entity creating relationships between the document and the relevant Entities.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a GUI feature/behavior (ability to draw arrows to create relationships) — a functional requirement describing what the system should do. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.).

RequirementText: The user may optionally specify a descriptive name for the document.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allowing the user to optionally provide a descriptive document name), which is a functional behavior. It does not impose availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall use the current corporate standard Microsoft SQL Server database engine.
AI_Rationale: Specifies mandatory use of a particular database engine (Microsoft SQL Server). This is a portability/platform constraint (PO) and also affects operation/administration since using the corporate standard influences deployment and operational practices (O). It does not explicitly state performance, security, availability, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Data uploading and management will likely be done as infrequently as once a year. This fact greatly limits the complexity of the user interface and the learning curve needed for completing this task.
AI_Rationale: Requirement restricts UI complexity and learning curve for an infrequent task, which pertains to look & feel and usability characteristics rather than functional behavior or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Database Design: The database structure should be as complete as possible during the design stage but there should be a room for modification without a large overhaul during later phases.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies the database should allow modification without large overhaul, which directly concerns maintainability (ease of modification/extensibility). It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Public users: Eventual release of the database system to the general public will add university and agency researchers who would appear similar in training to the primary users, but also would add clients with the entire range of training and interests. These users would have access to the public data without need for authentication.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access policy allowing public access without authentication, which is a security/authentication requirement. No performance, availability, usability, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Research users: Non-ARS scientists, engineers, and support staff who require ARS watershed data for research purposes. These would have similar characteristics and needs as ARS users, but because of the agency-level confidentiality issues, could not access the password-protected sensitive data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement defines a user category and explicitly states they must not access password-protected sensitive data due to agency-level confidentiality. This is an access control/confidentiality constraint, i.e., a security requirement. It does not specify functional behavior beyond access restriction nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Data operations manager: Staff, probably at OCIO, responsible for data archiving and maintenance, requiring read/write/modify privileges to all data in the system. This includes the role commonly thought of as a Database Administrator (DBA).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user role and explicit read/write/modify privileges to all data—this concerns access control/authorization and therefore security. No mention of availability, performance, portability, UI, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Watershed uploaders: Staff in the watersheds who have responsibility to upload local data requiring write access to space allocated to their specific watershed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that only staff in watersheds with responsibility should have write access to allocated space — an access control/authorization requirement (security).

RequirementText: System operator: Staff at OCIO responsible for maintaining executable code, requiring full access to all aspects of the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system operator role that must have full access to the system — this is an access-control/security requirement (SE) and relates to system administration/operability (O). It also explicitly ties to maintaining executable code, implying maintainability concerns (MN). No explicit statements about availability, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, fault-tolerance, or usability.

RequirementText: The system will use, where appropriate, the standard hardware and data communications resources provided by the ARS OCIO at the ARS George Washington Carver Center in Beltsville, MD. This includes, but is not limited to, the general Ethernet network/T1 connection at the server/hosting site, network servers, and network management tools.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies use of standard hardware, network connections, servers, and management tools at a specific operations/hosting center, which concerns system operation, deployment and manageability. It does not state uptime targets, performance, portability, security, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Private Network - The system requires a â€œback-endâ€� private network environment in order to ensure that end-user operations (on the front-end) are not impeded by database backups, index propagations, or other large back-end data transfers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a dedicated back-end private network to prevent back-end data transfers from impeding front-end operations — this addresses availability/reliability of service and performance (latency/throughput) concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be in compliance with all Accessibility, Web Design, and Security policies applicable.
AI_Rationale: This is a compliance requirement referring to applicable policies (Legal). It explicitly mentions Security policies (SE), Accessibility (affects Usability), and Web Design (affects Look & Feel), so L, SE, US, and LF are marked.

RequirementText: ARS users: ARS scientists, engineers, and support staff who require ARS watershed data for research purposes. These would likely be conversant with the general characteristics of the data content, and to a lesser extent have abilities manipulating views of the data using database tools such as envisioned for this database system. These users will need user/password authentication to enable user settings management and to have access to data protected through the confidentiality agreements among agencies participating in CEAP.
AI_Rationale: The text specifies that ARS users require user/password authentication and access control for data protected by confidentiality agreements — this implies a functional requirement (authentication and user settings) and security (access control/confidentiality). Mention of data protected by agreements suggests legal/compliance constraints. No explicit references to availability, performance, scalability, portability, fault tolerance, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, or usability are present.

RequirementText: As part of standard operating procedures, a testing plan will be documented during the Design phase. The testing plan will be based on user roles, modules or use cases, required tasks and expected outcomes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a development/process artifact (documenting a testing plan during the Design phase) and how testing will be structured. It is a maintainability/process-related requirement about assuring correct testing and future verification, not a functional feature or other quality attribute, so Maintainability is applicable.

RequirementText: Relational Database Management System - As the primary data storage mechanism for the corporate standard relational database management system, Microsoft SQL Server will be required to support system functionality.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required use/integration with Microsoft SQL Server as the corporate standard primary data storage mechanism—this is about system operation/administration and integration with an external DBMS (operability). It does not state performance, portability, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: An online hierarchical and cross-linked help system in HTML will describe and illustrate all system functions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies provision of an online help system that describes and illustrates all system functions — this is a functional requirement (F). It also targets user assistance/experience (hierarchical, cross-linked help in HTML), which impacts usability (US). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, maintainability, operability, scalability, fault-tolerance, or legal constraints, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: An online form will enable users to request help. Frequently asked questions will be screened for the FAQ pages.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes specific system capabilities: an online form for users to request help and screening FAQs for the FAQ pages. These are functional features (what the system should do). No quality/constraints such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others are specified.

RequirementText: The user s guide (or user manual) will contain sufficient information and instructions required to access and use the data system. It will include: Overview of the system features and architecture, Instructions for accessing the system, Samples of screens, where appropriate.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user guide/manual with instructions, system overview, and sample screens—aimed at helping users understand and use the system (usability). Inclusion of sample screens and overview of features implies concerns about presentation/appearance consistent with Look & Feel. It does not specify availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Backup Software â€“ Data and application backups will be managed through fully supported backup software solutions.
AI_Rationale: The statement defines a system function — managing data and application backups via supported backup software (functional). It also implies resilience/recovery capability (fault tolerance). No explicit mention of availability metrics, operability/support processes, security, maintainability, scalability, portability, or UI aspects, so those are not set.

RequirementText: HTTP and GIS Server Applications â€“ As the Web will be the primary delivery protocol for the application, HTTP and related GIS server applications will be required to support system functionality.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required server technology (HTTP and GIS server applications) as infrastructure for delivering the application, which pertains to operability/administration. Does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: Web Browsers and Browser Plug-ins â€“ In support of External Interface requirements, commonly supported web browsers will be used to implement a thin-client architecture. The use of Browser plug-ins will be judiciously restricted on an as-needed basis.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of commonly supported web browsers for a thin-client (portability/compatibility across browsers) and relates to how the system is accessed/implemented (operability). It does not explicitly state security, usability, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Email Servicesâ€“ As a secondary delivery protocol for alerts, data, and other information from the system, email server applications will be required to support system functionality.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that email server applications must be supported as a secondary delivery protocol, which concerns the system's ability to operate with/against external email services (operability). It also implies compatibility with various email server applications/environments (portability). It does not specify functional behaviors in detail, availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes explicitly, so those are not set.

RequirementText: The system will use, where appropriate, the standard software resources provided by the ARS OCIO. This includes, but is not limited to, MS ASP/Java Scripts, C++/C# , MS SQL server and IIS, or the use of PHP/Perl, JB scripts, C++/C#, MySQL server, and Apache server.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required use of standard software resources and supported platforms/servers (e.g., MS SQL/IIS, Apache/MySQL), which impacts operability (deployment/administration) and portability/compatibility across supported environments. No explicit performance, security, availability, or other quality requirements stated.

RequirementText: The system will make data available in standardized data formats such as tab-delimited text for use on usersâ€™ client systems including local installations of ARC GIS software or other off-line software applications.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system function: making data available in standardized formats (functional). It emphasizes interoperability with client/off-line applications (portability). Requiring standard formats for use by client systems also relates to operability/manageability (ease of integrating with client tools), so O is marked. No indications of availability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: The user interface will be simple and consistent, using terminology commonly understood by the intended users of the system. The system will have a simple interface, consistent with industry standard interfaces, to eliminate the need for user training of infrequent users. The STEWARDS team will evaluate the user interface of similar systems and apply appropriately. For additional details see Appendix E. User testing will be used to ensure the user interface is clear (simple, commonly understood vocabulary, intuitive to use without training), complete (users can perform all functions from the interface), and consistent (buttons and wording are the same throughout the system).
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes the user interface’s appearance/consistency and use of standard terminology (Look & Feel) and emphasizes ease of use, intuitiveness, elimination of training, and user testing to ensure clarity and completeness (Usability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, portability, scalability, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: No extra hardware interfaces are needed. The system will use the standard hardware and data communications resources provided by the ARS OCIO at the ARS George Washington Carver Center in Beltsville, MD. This includes, but is not limited to, the general Ethernet network/T1 connection at the server/hosting site, network servers, and network management tools. This system will include a warning message when a low transmission speed is detected, and a non-graphical interface option will be available.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional behavior (warning on low transmission speed, non-graphical interface) so F=1. It constrains deployment to standard hardware/resources provided by the hosting site, which is a portability/deployment constraint (PO=1). It addresses operational/deployment environment and use of network resources, implying operability/management concerns (O=1). Offering a non-graphical interface relates to usability/accessibility (US=1). Other quality categories are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The system will use the communications resources provided by the ARS OCIO. This includes, but is not limited to, HTTP protocol for communication with the web browser and the web server and TCP/IP network protocol with HTTP protocol.
AI_Rationale: Specifies which communications resources/protocols and operational environment (use of ARS OCIO, HTTP/TCP-IP) rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes; aligns with operability/operation requirements.

RequirementText: Load Balancing - Application Servers and Database servers must be load balanced at the application level to ensure maximum stability and availability. Specific scenarios, such as fail-over versus session-managed load balancing need to be addressed in the functional requirements specification.
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly requires load balancing to ensure maximum stability and availability (Availability=A) and mentions fail-over scenarios (Fault Tolerance=FT). Load balancing implies handling increased load and throughput, and supports scaling (Scalability=SC) and performance (PE). It does not state functional behavior beyond NFRs, nor legal, UI, maintainability, portability, security, or usability concerns, so those are set to false.

RequirementText: A tutorial will provide a quick start, a walk-thru of major system features, and further reference source for the complete system features.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system will provide a tutorial (a functional capability). It also strongly implies an emphasis on user assistance and learnability, so usability is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Near-line Storage â€“ All User and Application data as well as software installation and configuration files must be fully backed up week-nightly. Further, secure, off-site storage will be performed on a weekly basis with 24-hour retrieval times.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies regular backups and off-site secure storage with a 24-hour retrieval time. This implies fault tolerance/recovery (FT), specifies an availability/retrieval time objective (A), and requires secure handling of data (SE). It does not state functional behavior, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability aspects explicitly.

RequirementText: The system will use the standard software resources provided by the ARS OCIO. This includes, but is not limited to, MS ASP/Java Scripts, C++/C# , MS SQL server and IIS, or the use of PHP/Perl, JB scripts, C++/C#, MySQL server, and Apache server.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required/standard software platforms and servers to be used (databases, web servers, languages) which affects operability/administration and compatibility across environments. Does not state performance, security, availability, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: Implement a database of STEWARDS metadata elements. The database will provide browse and query functionality.
AI_Rationale: Specifies implementation of a database and browse/query functionality (functional). Similar database-related requirements in examples were labeled Maintainability and Operability, as it concerns data storage and system operation/administration; no explicit mentions of performance, security, availability, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: Online Storage - The system needs to be able to store hundreds of megabytes of data on demand. The potential for needing Gigabytes of data storage capacity is also in the realm of possibilities. Further requirements gathering is needed to get real-world estimates of such data storage needs.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must store hundreds of MB (potentially GB) on demand—this indicates a functional capability (storage) and implies capacity/performance constraints and need to scale to larger storage. No explicit availability, security, fault-tolerance, portability, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Establish a database in support of CEAP that will house the collective data assembled or generated during research activities. The database will support a variety of data types and formats, including but not limited to: spatial data - vector, raster, imagery, and tabular; tabular data â€“ static and time-series; spreadsheets; documents; reports; photographs; and URL links.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (establish a database to house research data), so it is Functional. It describes storage of collective and varied data types which relates to data management concerns and long-term storage—aligning with Maintainability. Setting up and supporting a database implies operational/administrative responsibilities (operability). No explicit statements about availability, performance, scalability, security, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability are given.

RequirementText: The use of agricultural models (SWAT, AnnAGNPS) is a core element of the CEAP effort. Several modeling-related database topics will need to be addressed: 1. Maintenance and reporting of uncertainty or error in measured data, in spatial components of GIS data, and in modeling output. Reporting of uncertainty may take place on an individual sample basis, on a method or procedural basis, or on an entire database. 2. Models will require specific input data and will generate output data during the calibration and validation phases, sensitivity analyses, and exploratory scenarios. The current scope of the STEWARDS system is to provide measured data for input to the model and for comparison to output.
AI_Rationale: The text specifies core system behaviors: providing measured data as model inputs and comparison to outputs, and reporting/maintenance of uncertainty information — these are functional requirements. The mention of 'maintenance and reporting' implies processes for maintaining data and its metadata, which aligns with maintainability. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, operability, look-and-feel, legal, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: View entire universe of watersheds from top-level screen for selection and Design tools to navigate the individual watershed sites and their data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes functional capability (view/select watersheds and navigation tools). It references a top-level screen and navigation/design tools, implying UI layout/appearance and usability concerns (ease of navigation), but not availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: View watershed descriptive data and Summary descriptions of research watersheds, stations, and instruments that are useful in describing the research activities should be accessible. This information would not be considered â€˜formalâ€™ metadata.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that users should be able to view/access descriptive and summary information (a clear functional need). The phrasing 'should be accessible' refers to user access/usability of the information rather than system uptime or security, so Usability is also applicable. No explicit availability SLAs, security, or other non-functional concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Provide access to the data via browsing of sites, stations, and instruments; allow for simple queries to individual datasets; provide a metadata search tool to query dataset parameters; and allow for downloading of datasets (full or partial).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system capabilities (browsing, querying, metadata search, downloading) — functional. It also emphasizes simple queries and user-facing access methods (browsing, search tools), implying usability concerns, so US is set. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Users may wish to examine time-series data, e.g. stream discharge data, over a user-specified time frame in order to select only those data desired for download. Charting tools in association with the query engine are desirable.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (examining time-series data and selecting for download) and mentions charting tools (presentation/UI), implying look-and-feel and usability concerns. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or fault-tolerance constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Provide access to CEAP-related reports, tables, and project documents.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (providing access to reports, tables, and documents), i.e. a functional requirement. It does not mention authorization, availability, performance, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Agricultural research data are inherently spatial in nature. STEWARDS will provide web-based geographic information tools to allow site-specific data to be viewed within their spatial context. These tools will provide browse and query functionality and support links to download spatial data and their associated tabular data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities: web-based GIS tools, browse/query features, and download links for spatial and tabular data. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Develop and maintain a metadata database that provides browse and query access to formal descriptions of the database elements. Provide tools for database contributors to create and upload metadata compatible with the STEWARDS metadata database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies building (functional behavior) a metadata database and tools to provide browse/query access and upload capabilities — clearly functional. It also implies operational/management capabilities (tools for contributors, maintenance of the database), so Operability is set. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or maintainability qualities, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: Develop search tools that query watershed, station, and instrument metadata across the STEWARDS database. Metadata query tools will support query by location, theme, and keyword.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: search/query tools for metadata with specific query types (location, theme, keyword). It describes what the system should do, not availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall operate with the following Web browsers: Microsoft Internet Explorer versions 5.0 and 6.0, Netscape Communicator version 4.7, Netscape versions 6 and 7, and FireFox.
AI_Rationale: Specifies which web browsers the system must operate with, focusing on operational compatibility/administration. Matches examples labeling similar browser-support requirements as Operability. Does not explicitly state portability or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall operate on Certified and Accredited servers running the current corporate approved versions of operating systems as appropriate.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operational environment (certified/accredited servers and corporate-approved OS versions) which affects operability (deployment/administration) and portability/compatibility across platforms; no explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: The Data Management portion of the system shall permit user access from the corporate Intranet and, if a user is authorized for outside access through the corporate firewall, from an Internet connection at the userâ€™s home.
AI_Rationale: Specifies allowed access locations (intranet and authorized Internet access through firewall) — this is a functional requirement about permitting access and explicitly involves authorization/network access control, i.e., a security constraint.

RequirementText: Much of the initial effort in CEAP will focus on the use of agricultural models (e.g. SWAT, AnnAGNPS) in the CEAP watersheds. Users will be able to examine the data used in the modeling effort, visualize the results in their spatial context, and download the model input data and results.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies user capabilities (examine data, visualize spatial results, download inputs/results), which are functional features. It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The application codes generated during prototyping may not run properly when re-hosting the data system to a non-Windows OS or transferring the data system to another location.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes that code generated during prototyping may not run on a non-Windows OS or when moved to another location, which is a portability concern (compatibility across platforms/environments). No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: Implement a web-based browse-and-query tool for searching STEWARDS metadata. Queries by location, theme, and keyword will be supported. A likely scenario involves a web-based wizard which allows users to specify particular querying parameters and then save them for reference later such that time-based comparisons are facilitated with minimal user training.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional feature (web-based browse-and-query tool, supported query types, wizard, saving queries). Also specifies ease-of-use/minimal training and a wizard interface, which implies usability requirements. No explicit performance, security, availability, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: Implement a metadata input tool that supports creating and editing of metadata in the chosen format. The metadata tool will allow for local and web-based input and editing. A likely scenario involves a web-based wizard which allows users to specify particulars of a data set, and then save those answers and relate them to a particular project, so that these selections can be re-used in future uploading operations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability to create/edit metadata, save and reuse selections and a web-based wizard—these are functional requirements. The mention of a wizard and user-oriented input implies usability concerns (ease of use), so US is set. No explicit non-functional attributes like availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, or maintainability are stated.

RequirementText: The Data Research and Reporting portion of the system shall provide public access to reviewed and approved data sets.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (providing public access to reviewed and approved data sets), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Adopt a metadata standard that is compliant with Federal regulations. The current Federal standards for spatial data are the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata (version 2.0), (http://www.fgdc.gov/metadata/contstan.html), FGDC-STD-001-1998. There are some indications that the Federal government may implement the ISO 19115 geographic information/metadata standard in the future. If this occurs, the CEAP database team will evaluate conversion of metadata.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates compliance with Federal metadata standards (FGDC/ISO), which is a legal/regulatory compliance constraint. It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The fourth consideration for security requirements is availability. The system must be available to the intended audience 24 hours per day, 7 days a week with, 99% availability and a tolerance of -5% (not less than 50% of working hours in any week). For this system, availability will be concerned with the reliability of the software and network components. Intentional â€œdenial of service attacksâ€� is not foreseen as a significant concern.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly specifies 24/7 availability and 99% target (availability requirement). Also discusses reliability of software/network components and tolerance, implying fault-tolerance/resilience requirements.

RequirementText: Confidentiality security requirements describe the need to protect the data appropriately. STEWARDS will use the user classes described in section 2.3 above to define boundaries of information sharing to ensure confidentiality as appropriate. Any data that should be viewed by a restricted audience must be protected with appropriate security features.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly addresses confidentiality and protecting data, specifying user classes and restricted access and 'appropriate security features'—this maps directly to security concerns (access control, confidentiality). No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The integrity of STEWARDS data will be critical to its success as a product. Scientific research and publications will be based on the data obtained through the system. Therefore, extensive data validation and review will be performed both before data are uploaded to the system and as part of the upload process. The system will need policy and procedures protecting the data from intentional or unintentional modifications, and to ensure accurate data are made available.
AI_Rationale: The requirement focuses on ensuring data integrity via validation, review, and policies/procedures to prevent intentional or unintentional modification. This primarily maps to Security (data integrity controls) and Maintainability (ongoing validation/review processes and procedures that support correct data management). Other NFRs are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: STEWARDS will have reasonable controls consistent with ARS OCIO practices, in compliance with agency, Dept and Govt regulations. STEWARDS security requirements will have four primary components. They are authentication, confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates compliance with agency/Dept/Govt regulations and ARS OCIO practices (legal/compliance). It explicitly enumerates security components—authentication, confidentiality, integrity, and availability—so security is applicable, and availability is explicitly mentioned as a primary component. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: Data on the server should be protected from power loss but data in transit from server to requester could be lost. Given that these data will also remain on the watershed site system, rather than expend resources to prevent this loss, such failures will be monitored and the uploading process will be repeated.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies protecting server data against power loss (durability/availability) and describes monitoring and retrying uploads on failure (fault tolerance/resilience and operational monitoring). It does not specify security, portability, performance, or functional behavior beyond these quality aspects.

RequirementText: Loading speed: The data system shall load as quickly as comparable productivity tools on whatever environment it is running in.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies load speed relative to comparable productivity tools across environments, which is a performance (speed/latency) requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, portability, usability, scalability, or other categories.

RequirementText: Response time: The data system shall show no visible deterioration in response time as the number of persons increases. Response times seen by end users for querying metadata should be on the order of a few seconds or less. Response times seen by end users for retrieving the actual images may take much longer, anywhere from a few minutes to several hours. If the user requests a large image with a short response time, it is acceptable for the ARS data system to advise the user that the target response time cannot be met. In that case, the person would be referred to an alternate method of getting the data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies response time targets and behavior as load (number of persons) increases — primary performance requirement. The clause about no visible deterioration with increasing users implies scalability.

RequirementText: This database will be built for a particular system and may not be portable but results to queries will be portable between many environments.
AI_Rationale: Specifies portability characteristics: database itself may not be portable but query results will be portable across environments. This directly concerns portability; no explicit functional, performance, security, or other quality requirements are stated.

RequirementText: STEWARDS will follow industry best practices for authentication, using single-sign-on systems like Microsoft Active Directory to perform authentication. Authentication addresses security requirements to ensure those using system are who they say they are. This is of greatest concern when data are being changed or updated. This is primarily done through userids and passwords.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system will perform authentication (functional behavior) and emphasizes security best practices and authentication mechanisms (single-sign-on, Active Directory) to ensure users are who they claim to be, so Security is clearly applicable. No explicit availability, performance, maintainability, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall provide RAID V Disk Stripping on all database storage disks.
AI_Rationale: Specifying RAID5 disk striping for database storage is a storage-availability and resilience requirement (RAID provides fault tolerance and improves uptime) and also impacts performance (throughput/IO). It does not specify functional behavior, security, legal, UI, portability, scalability, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall provide for replication of databases to off-site storage locations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates database replication to off-site locations which is a provided system capability (functional) aimed at improving availability and enabling fault tolerance/disaster recovery. No mention of security, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall provide storage of all databases on redundant computers with automatic switchover.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies redundant storage and automatic switchover, which directly addresses availability and fault tolerance (redundancy and automatic failover). It does not state functional behavior, security, performance, scalability, or other attributes.

RequirementText: The user interface for the software shall be compatible to any browser such as Internet Explorer, Mozilla or Netscape Navigator by which user can access to the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies browser compatibility (Internet Explorer, Mozilla, Netscape), which is portability across client environments. It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The source code developed for this system shall be maintained in configuration management tool.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that source code must be maintained in a configuration management tool, which is a maintainability/process requirement (version control/configuration management). Does not describe functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall use the HTTP protocol for communication over the internet and for the intranet communication will be through TCP/IP protocol suite.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required communication protocols for operation (HTTP for internet, TCP/IP for intranet), which is an operational/deployment constraint. Does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, or portability explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be verisign like software which shall allow the users to complete secured transaction. This usually shall be the third party software system which is widely used for internet transaction.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functionality: enable users to complete transactions (functional). It emphasizes 'secured transaction' and likening to Verisign/third-party security software, which implies security requirements (confidentiality/integrity/authentication). No explicit mentions of availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall communicate with export regulation system to validate export regulations.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (the system shall communicate with an external export-regulation system). It also implies legal/compliance concerns because it exists to validate export regulations, and it involves integration/operability with an external system, so Operability is applicable. No explicit statements about availability, performance, portability, security, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, or usability.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall communicate with external Tax system to calculate tax.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying integration with an external Tax system (what the system should do). It also implies operability/interoperability concerns (ability to communicate with external systems), but does not mention availability, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall communicate with shipping system for tracking orders and updating of shipping methods.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (system must communicate with shipping system). It also implies operability/ integration concerns (managing interfaces), but does not explicitly state availability, portability, security, or performance constraints.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall communicate with Sales system for order management.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (communication with Sales system) — therefore Functional. It describes an integration/interaction concern relevant to system operations/administration (interfacing with another system), so Operability is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, portability, security, scalability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall communicate with CRM system to provide support.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional integration requirement (system shall communicate with CRM). It also implies operability/integ­rability concerns (manage/operate interfaces), but no explicit availability, security, scalability, portability, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall communicate to credit management system for handling financing options.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (communicate with credit management system) — functional. It also implies integration/operability concerns (interfacing with an external system), but does not state availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall communicate with billPay system to identify available payment methods , validate the payments and process payment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies operational behavior: communicating with billPay to identify payment methods, validate and process payments — a functional integration requirement. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: The e-store shall communicate with the content manager to get the product specifications, offerings and promotions.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies a system behavior/interface (the e-store shall communicate with the content manager to retrieve product data), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The e-store system shall communicate with the Configurator to identify all the available components to configure the product.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior (system shall communicate with Configurator to identify components). It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Since the application must run over the internet, all the hardware shall require to connect internet will be hardware interface for the system. As for e.g. Modem, WAN â€“ LAN, Ethernet Cross-Cable.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies required hardware interfaces for internet connectivity (modem, WAN/LAN, Ethernet), which concerns deployment/operational environment and manageability. This aligns with Operability. It does not state functional behavior or portability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The user interface shall be implemented using any tool or software package like Java Applet, MS Front Page, EJB etc.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains implementation technologies/platforms for the user interface (mentions Java Applet, MS FrontPage, EJB), which is primarily a portability/implementation constraint. It does not specify functional behavior, usability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: There shall be logical address of the system in IPv4 format.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall have a logical address in IPv4 format — a functional requirement describing what the system must provide. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The Port number used will be 80.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a deployment/configuration detail (network port) relevant to system operation and environment compatibility. This affects operability and may impact portability (firewall/hosting constraints). No explicit performance, security, or functional behavior stated.

RequirementText: The protocol used shall be HTTP.
AI_Rationale: Specifying the communication protocol (HTTP) is an operational/deployment constraint about how the system is accessed and operated, not a functional behavior or other quality attribute. It does not explicitly address availability, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: There are many types of interfaces as such supported by the E-Store software system namely; User Interface, Software Interface and Hardware Interface.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies what the system should support (types of interfaces: user, software, hardware), which is a functional capability. It does not specify quality attributes like availability, security, usability, portability, or look-and-feel, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: To implement online user help, link and search fields shall be provided.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that the system provide online user help via links and search fields — this is a functional provision (F). It also specifies UI elements (links/search) which affects look-and-feel (LF) and supports usability (US) by enabling users to find help.

RequirementText: It shall provide specific guidelines to a user for using the E-Store system and within the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies providing user guidance/help within the system, which affects usability and aspects of look-and-feel (how instructions are presented). It does not describe availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: As the product is E-store, On-line help system becomes a critical component of the system which shall provide â€“
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies that an online help system shall be provided (functional requirement). It also implies a usability concern since online help is intended to assist users and improve usability. No explicit references to availability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, portability, operability, or fault tolerance are present.

RequirementText: A general knowledge of basic computer skills is required to use the product
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user prerequisite about needed skills to use the product, which pertains to usability and user competence. It does not describe functionality, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Response time for loading the product should take no longer than five minutes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum allowable response time (loading the product within five minutes), which is a performance requirement/quality-of-service metric.

RequirementText: The computers must be equipped with web browsers such as Internet explorer.
AI_Rationale: The statement mandates that computers be equipped with web browsers (deployment/environment requirement) which relates to operability (installed software on workstations). It also implies a platform/browser dependency/compatibility requirement (portability). No security, performance, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be built using a standard web page development tool that conforms to either IBMâ€™s CUA standards or Microsoftâ€™s GUI standards.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates conformance to IBM CUA or Microsoft GUI standards for the web UI—this explicitly concerns the user interface look-and-feel. It does not explicitly state availability, security, portability, maintainability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: E-store should display the disclaimers, copyright, word mark, trademark and product warranties of the Marvel electronics and home entertainment.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior — it must display specific notices — so it is functional. It also explicitly concerns legal/copyright/trademark and warranties, implying legal/compliance constraints. It does not specify availability, performance, UI style, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability or usability aspects.

RequirementText: The product must be stored in such a way that allows the client easy access to it.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that storage must enable the client to easily access the product, which is a usability/accessibility quality. It does not specify functional behavior, availability, performance, security, or other NFRs explicitly, so only Usability is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall provide online help, FAQâ€™s customer support, and sitemap options for customer support.
AI_Rationale: Specifies features to provide online help, FAQs, customer support and sitemap—this is a functional requirement. It also implies usability concerns (help/FAQ improve user experience). No mention of availability, security, performance, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall display all the matching products based on the search
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior: displaying matching products in search results. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall allow user to confirm the completion of current configuration
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—allowing a user to confirm completion of a configuration. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow user to update the configuration to resolve conflict in the current configuration.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (allow user to update configuration to resolve conflicts), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall display all the available components of the product to configure
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: displaying all available product components for configuration. It is a functional requirement and does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall display the reviews and ratings of each product, when it is selected.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (display reviews and ratings when a product is selected). It does not state any non-functional qualities such as performance, security, availability, usability, or appearance.

RequirementText: The system shall allow user to change shipping, payment method.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (allow user to change shipping and payment method), i.e., a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall allow user to cancel the order
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow user to cancel an order). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: If supervised by an RBC it shall be possible to command an emergency stop to all trains in a particular area or to a specific train
AI_Rationale: Describes a specific capability (command emergency stop for all trains in an area or a specific train) — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security/authorization, fault-tolerance, scalability, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Operation of the train trip shall be indicated on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This specifies that the system shall indicate the train trip operation on the Driver-Machine Interface (DMI), which is a functional requirement about what the system must do. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or UI aesthetics/usability details.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to command an immediate train stop.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability: the system must allow commanding an immediate train stop. It does not explicitly mention availability, safety, fault tolerance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to command a conditional emergency stop. If the train has already passed the location for the emergency stop the command shall be ignored
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: ability to command a conditional emergency stop and the condition under which the command is ignored (train passed location). This describes functional requirements (what the system should do) rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: When a train has received an emergency stop ETCS shall command the emergency brake.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a required system behavior: upon receiving an emergency stop signal, ETCS must command the emergency brake. It is a functional requirement describing what the system shall do; it does not state non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The emergency stop shall be indicated to the driver on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system shall indicate the emergency stop to the driver via the DMI (display). It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as usability, performance, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Route unsuitability shall be indicated on the DMI.
