AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system must indicate route unsuitability on the DMI (display). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, UI look-and-feel, usability metrics, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The driver shall be able to override the function when the train is stationary.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an actor capability (driver can override a function under a condition) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, safety, operability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: After overriding this function the movement authority shall be re-established.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies required system behavior (re-establish movement authority after overriding a function) — functional. It also implies recovery/resilience after an intervention, i.e. fault-tolerance/recovery, so FT is set. No explicit availability, security, portability, etc. requirements are stated.

RequirementText: When a traction unit passes a stop-signal the emergency brake shall be triggered.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a required system behavior in response to an event (functional). It also describes a safety/fault-handling action (trigger emergency brake) implying fault-tolerance/resilience, so FT is marked. No indications of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall transmit its own train identification to the RBC.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: the trainborne equipment must transmit its train identification to the RBC. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: When the traction unit is stationary the driver shall be required to acknowledge the train trip condition. This acknowledgement will release the emergency brake.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when stationary, driver must acknowledge trip condition and that acknowledgement releases the emergency brake. This describes functional behavior/requirement rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: After the acknowledgement the driver shall be able to continue the movement
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system behavior (after acknowledgement, driver can continue movement), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: After the acknowledgement the train shall be able to be driven backwards for a certain distance defined by national value
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (train can be driven backwards a defined distance after acknowledgement) — this is a functional behavior. Although it references a 'national value', it does not explicitly state legal/regulatory compliance or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The train running number shall consist of a maximum of 8 numeric digits.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the format/structure of a data field (train running number) — a functional constraint on what the system should accept/store. It does not address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Geographical position of the train n demand, the position of the front end of the train at the time of the demand shall be indicated on the DMI. This shall be possible while the train is moving or stationary.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system shall indicate the train's front-end geographical position on the DMI on demand, and that it must work whether the train is moving or stationary. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving information about pantograph and power supply from the trackside.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the on-board ETCS shall provide (receiving pantograph and power supply info from trackside) — a functional requirement. No quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, scalability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall indicate on the DMI the information regarding pantograph and power supply.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior: the equipment shall indicate (display) pantograph and power supply information on the DMI. It is a functional requirement about what the system should do. It does not state availability, performance, UI look-and-feel details, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The information regarding lowering and raising of the pantograph and opening/closing of the circuit breaker shall be provided separately and in combinations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that information about pantograph and circuit breaker events must be provided (functional). It also prescribes how the information should be presented (separately and in combinations), which affects presentation/look-and-feel, so LF applies. No indications of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving information regarding air tightness from the trackside.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (receiving air tightness information from trackside), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The emergency brake shall be applied until the traction unit is stationary.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (apply emergency brake until traction unit is stationary). This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional qualities (availability, fault tolerance, safety standards, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The train shall be capable of receiving any track-to-train information intended and relevant for this train including movement authority.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system (train) must provide: receiving track-to-train information (including movement authority). This describes functional behavior (what the system should do) rather than non-functional qualities like performance, availability, security, or scalability.

RequirementText: Information received shall not influence the traction unit(s) with in-operative cabs.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that received information must not affect traction units when cabs are inoperative — this is a behavioral constraint (functional). It also addresses system behavior in a fault/failed condition (in-operative cabs), implying fault-tolerance/resilience. Finally it constrains operational behavior/controls of the system (operability). No explicit availability, security, legal, UI, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, or usability aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: A special indication shall be shown on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that a particular indication must be shown on the DMI (a UI/display requirement) — a functional requirement with a user interface presentation aspect; no availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to send plain text messages from track to train.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (sending plain text messages from track to train), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality constraints, so no NFR labels are warranted.

RequirementText: The roll away/reverse movement intervention shall be indicated on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a behavior: the system shall indicate roll away/reverse movement intervention on the DMI (display). This is a functional requirement about what must be shown. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, usability, look-and-feel) are explicitly required.

RequirementText: When the traction unit has come to a standstill, the driver shall be able to release the emergency brake.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior: when the traction unit is stationary, the driver must be able to release the emergency brake. This is a functional requirement describing what the system shall allow the user to do.

RequirementText: After releasing the emergency brake ETCS will provide the supervision appertaining when roll away protection was initiated
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: after emergency brake release the ETCS must provide the supervision related to the roll-away protection. No non-functional aspects (availability, performance, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: When using more than one traction unit this function shall be disabled in all but the leading traction unit.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: when multiple traction units are used, the function must be disabled on all but the leading unit. No availability, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: All data entered, received or indicated to the driver shall be recorded onboard. All data shall be related to UTC (Universal Time Corrected) and a reference point.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates that all data entered/received/indicated to the driver be recorded onboard and timestamped relative to UTC/reference point — this specifies a required system function (logging/recording). It does not explicitly state security, availability, maintainability, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Information shall be recorded to an accuracy which enables a clear view of the functioning of ETCS and way the traction unit has been driven.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that information shall be recorded (functional behavior). The emphasis on accuracy to enable a clear view of system functioning and traction unit driving implies an operational/monitoring concern (operability). It does not explicitly state legal, performance, security, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, or maintainability attributes.

RequirementText: Standardised output interfaces shall enable transmission of information recorded to other media for investigation
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (standardised output interfaces to transmit recorded information) which is a functional behavior. It also implies portability/interoperability with other media (compatibility), so Portability is set. No explicit indications of availability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or operability/administration concerns.

RequirementText: The retention period for the recorded data will be different and two levels are foreseen: Data to enable investigation of accidents need only be stored for at least 24 hours, and shall be very detailed, Operational data to enable assessment of driver performance shall be stored for at least one week.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies operational data management (data retention periods and storage duration), which is an operability/administration concern. It does not invoke legal compliance, security, performance, or UI aspects, nor a functional feature beyond storage durations.

RequirementText: The following information shall be recorded: any transition of Level and of operational status, The driverâ€™s confirmation of transition to shunting shall be recorded, train supervision data and information received from national train control systems, actual speed, full service brake intervention, emergency brake intervention, applying the train trip function, selection of the override control, override of the route suitability function, isolation of on board ETCS equipment, Data entered, recieved or indicated to the driver
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that various events and data must be recorded—this is a functional requirement (F) describing system behavior. Recording/auditing of actions also supports maintainability (MN) by providing trace/history for diagnosis and change tracking. It also supports operability (O) because captured operational events and supervision data are used for monitoring and operating the system. No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, security controls, legal compliance, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or usability are present.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to use multiple traction units without isolating the ETCS trainborne equipment on traction unit(s) with an in-operative cab.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability/behavior: allowing use of multiple traction units without isolating ETCS equipment when a cab is inoperative — this is a functional requirement. It also addresses resilience to a fault condition (in-operative cab) by requiring continued operation, which implies fault tolerance. No explicit statements about availability metrics, security, usability, maintainability, portability, scalability, look & feel, or operability/administration are given.

RequirementText: The train trip function (4.6.12.) shall be suppressed in traction unit(s) with in-operative cabs.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior: the 'train trip function' must be suppressed when traction unit cabs are inoperative. It is a functional constraint/condition rather than an availability, safety, or other non-functional requirement.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to use tandem traction units without isolating the ETCS trainborne equipment on the tandem traction unit.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability the system must provide (use tandem traction units without isolating ETCS equipment), which is a functional requirement. It also pertains to the operational use of the equipment (how units are operated/managed), so Operability is relevant. It does not mention availability, performance, security, safety, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The train trip function (4.6.12.) shall be suppressed on the tandem traction unit.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that a particular function (train trip function 4.6.12) shall be suppressed on a specific unit (tandem traction unit), which is a functional behavior constraint. It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The driver shall enter the driver ID
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional action the system/user must perform (driver enters driver ID). No quality constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to drive the train backwards in a supervised way (speed and distance) according to information received from trackside
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability/function: enabling supervised backward driving with control of speed and distance based on trackside information. No explicit non-functional quality (availability, security, performance, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: The train speed shall be at or below a speed specified by a national value.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required system behavior (limit train speed) — functional. Refers to a national-specified value, implying regulatory/legal compliance.

RequirementText: The driver shall select an override control according to the permission received.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing what the system/driver shall do (select an override control based on received permission). It does not explicitly state availability, security mechanisms, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The override control shall be protected against inadvertent operation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that an override control must be protected from inadvertent operation — this is a usability requirement (preventing accidental actions) and also addresses fault tolerance/safety by guarding against operator error. It does not specify availability, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: When the train passes the stop signal, the train trip function shall be suppressed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: when a train passes a stop signal, the system shall suppress the train trip function. It describes what the system must do; it does not state any non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: Actual speed shall still be shown on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system must display the actual speed on the DMI (a functional behavior involving the user interface). It concerns the UI content/presentation, so Look & Feel is also applicable. No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The supervised speed shall not be shown on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains what is displayed on the DMI (a user interface content/design restriction). It pertains to presentation/appearance of the interface rather than performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When the plain text message appears on the DMI, the driver shall be alerted.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when a plain text message appears on the DMI, the system shall alert the driver. This is a functional requirement describing what the system must do (notification).

RequirementText: The following definitions shall apply for the ETCS application levels:Level 0 - ETCS active for limited train control function; trackside not fitted with any train control system or fitted with a train control system for which no STM is available onboard, Level 1 - Basic track to train information via intermittent transmission media, e.g. balises. This information can be supported by infill, transmitted via balise, loop or radio. Level 2 - Basic track to train and train to track information via continuous transmission media, i.e. radio. The train detection is provided by trackside, Level 3: Same as level 2 except that train integrity is provided by onboard and therefore trackside. train detection is optional, Level STM (Specific Transmission Module): Track to train information provided by national system. Onboard functions provided by national system (STM) in co-operation with onboard ETCS.
AI_Rationale: The text defines operational levels and behaviors of the ETCS application (Level 0,1,2,3, STM), specifying what the system does in each mode. This is a functional requirement; it does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The character set used shall support different languages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement constrains character encoding to support multiple languages (internationalization). This is primarily a usability/internationalization concern and relates to portability across language environments/platforms. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to implement one or more of the ETCS application levels on a line.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (support implementing one or more ETCS application levels on a line) — a functional requirement. It also implies an operational/configurational concern (ability to deploy/configure application levels on a line), so operability is marked. No explicit reliability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Trains equipped for ERTMS/ETCS application level 3 shall be able to run on lines equipped with ERTMS/ETCS application level 3, 2, 1 and 0, trains equipped for ERTMS/ETCS application level 2 shall be able to run on lines equipped with ERTMS/ETCS application level 2, 1 and 0 and trains equipped for ERTMS/ETCS application level 1 shall be able to run on lines equipped with ERTMS/ETCS application level 1 and 0.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that trains (system) must be able to operate on lines with different ERTMS/ETCS application levels — a functional capability combined with platform/environment compatibility (portability/interoperability). No availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The current application level shall be indicated on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system shall indicate (display) the current application level on the DMI, which is a functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not state availability, fault tolerance, UI aesthetics, or other non-functional qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: The driver shall acknowledge the level transitions, if requested from trackside. If the driver does not acknowledge after the transition the brake shall be applied. If the driver acknowledges afterwards, the brake can be released.
AI_Rationale: This specifies required system behavior (control logic for driver acknowledgements and braking) — functional. It also defines behavior in presence of a failure/unresponsive driver (apply brake, allow release later), i.e., fault-handling/resilience, so Fault Tolerance applies.

RequirementText: ETCS shall be compatible with existing national systems listed in the CCS TSI such that it does not interfere with the national systems and is not interfered with by the national systems.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compatibility/interoperability with existing national systems to avoid mutual interference. This primarily concerns portability/compatibility across systems (PO) and operational interoperability/handling in the target environment (O). It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, maintainability, or other categories.

RequirementText: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall be capable of supervising the following operational states: Full Supervision operation, Partial Supervision operation, National operation (STM), Tandem operation, Multiple operation, Shunting operation, Stand By operation, Reversing operation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system capability to supervise listed operational states (functional behavior/capability). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Any transition which occurs while the train is moving shall in principle occur automatically.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a behavior: transitions that occur while the train is moving shall occur automatically. This describes what the system should do (functional). It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as availability, performance, safety, or fault tolerance, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: Transitions which occur while the train is stationary, shall be initiated automatically or manually as appropriate.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: how transitions are initiated (automatic or manual) when the train is stationary, which is a functional requirement. Does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: If, as a result of an automatic transition, except for transitions to and from National Operation (STM), the responsibility for the driver increases, the ETCS shall seek an acknowledgement from the driver, whether the train is stationary or not.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: when an automatic transition increases driver responsibility, the ETCS must seek driver acknowledgement. This is a functional behavior (user interaction/response). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: For transitions to and from National Operation (STM) the ETCS shall request, an acknowledgement by the driver.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action: ETCS shall request an acknowledgement by the driver during specific transitions. This is a functional requirement; it does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: In case the transition has to be acknowledged and the driver fails to acknowledge as required, the ETCS shall initiate a brake application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: if driver fails to acknowledge a transition, ETCS shall apply brakes. This is a functional safety action; no explicit availability, performance, security, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: During the transition period between two operational states (including two different national operations) the supervision provided shall at least ensure the same protection provided by the least restrictive state.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies ensuring 'the same protection' during transitions between operational states/nations, which pertains to security/protection measures (confidentiality/integrity/authorization). It does not explicitly address availability, fault-tolerance, operability, or other non-functional categories, so only Security is marked.

RequirementText: If an ETCS equipped train passes a level transition to a line fitted with more than one level, the onboard shall switch to the highest level, according to the priority given by trackside, for which it is equipped.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior: when a train passes to a line with multiple levels, the onboard shall switch to the highest applicable level according to trackside priority. This is a functional requirement describing what the system must do; it does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: If an ETCS equipped train passes a level transition to one or more levels for which it is not equipped, ETCS shall initiate a brake application.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a required system behavior (initiate braking) when encountering an unsupported level — primarily a functional requirement. It also describes handling an abnormal condition by moving to a safe state, which is a fault-tolerance/resilience behavior.

RequirementText: The current operational status shall be indicated to the driver on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior: displaying current operational status to the driver on the DMI (Functional requirement). It does not specify availability, UI appearance details, usability metrics, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving National values from the trackside to adapt to National requirements.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability of the ETCS on-board system (receiving national values from trackside to adapt to national requirements), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: National values shall be applicable to a defined area.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability/behavior — that national values are to be applicable to a defined area — which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, legal compliance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Once received onboard the national values shall remain valid even if the onboard equipment is switched off.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that onboard national values must remain valid despite the onboard equipment being switched off — this describes resilience/durability to power loss (graceful retention/recovery), which is fault-tolerance. It does not state uptime, security, UI, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: If the on-board has no valid national values for the current location, default values shall be used by the onboard equipment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (use default values when no valid national values exist) — functional. It also describes a resilience/backup behavior for missing data, implying fault tolerance/graceful degradation. No explicit availability, security, usability, portability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: Default values shall be harmonised values, permanently stored in all ERTMS/ETCS on board equipment.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional requirement: default values shall be harmonised and permanently stored in all on-board equipment (i.e., what the system must do). It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, portability, performance, scalability, usability, legal, look-and-feel or maintainability concerns, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The trainborne equipment shall apply the emergency brake after a distance, defined by a national value, is travelled by the train.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing system behavior (apply emergency brake after a specified distance). It references a 'national value' (regulatory/normative parameter), which implies legal/regulatory constraint, so Legal is marked. No explicit statements about availability, performance, safety (beyond function), usability, maintainability, etc., are given.

RequirementText: ETCS is required to be functional to a maximum train speed of 500 km/h.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability requirement (functional) that the system must operate up to a specified maximum train speed (500 km/h), which is also a performance constraint on operational envelope.

RequirementText: The onboard equipment shall display plain text messages as received.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies behavior: the equipment shall display plain text messages as received. This is a functional display requirement; it does not impose availability, security, look-and-feel specifics beyond plaintext, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: If the supervision is performed by a RBC it shall be possible to prevent movements of a traction unit in its area if not authorised by the RBC.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior: the RBC-supervised system must be able to prevent traction unit movements when not authorized (functional behavior). It also enforces authorization control (access/authorization restriction), which is a security requirement. No explicit mention of availability, fault tolerance, usability, portability, scalability, legal, maintainability, operability, performance, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: ETCS shall provide the driver with information to allow him to drive the train safely.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement: the system shall provide information to the driver. It implies safety as a goal but does not state non-functional qualities (availability, performance, usability, security, etc.), so no other NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to send fixed text messages from track to train
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (sending fixed text messages from track to train), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Fixed text messages shall be provided in the language selected by the driver.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (system must provide fixed text messages in the language selected) and impacts usability (language selection affects user experience). No explicit availability, performance, security, legal, or other quality concerns mentioned.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to send information regarding the inhibition of the following different types of brake(M): Regenerative brake, Eddy current brake, Magnetic shoe brake.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability to send information about inhibition for specific brake types, which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Information shall be shown on the DMI
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior (displaying information on the DMI). It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of sending to the trackside train integrity information detected by a system outside ETCS .
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (ETCS on-board shall be capable of sending train integrity information to trackside), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects such as availability, performance, security, scalability, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: The driver shall be able to confirm the train integrity to the RBC manually. The confirmation requires the train to be stationary.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (driver manually confirming train integrity to the RBC) and a precondition (train must be stationary). It describes functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities such as availability, performance, security, or usability, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The on board shall be capable of sending train data to the trackside after confirmation by the driver, or when entering the RBC area
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/behavior: sending train data under specified conditions (after driver confirmation or when entering RBC area). No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The following train data shall be sent from the on board to the trackside: Train running number, STM ready for use, train gauge, Max. axle load, status of air tight system, type of el. power accepted, international train category, max. train speed, train length.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what data items must be transmitted from onboard to trackside — a clear functional requirement. No availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to revoke a Movement Authority that has already been issued to a train in a co-operative way between RBC and train.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete capability/behavior: the system must support revocation of an issued Movement Authority cooperatively between RBC and train — a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: The co-operative revocation of the MA shall be possible to a new target location, proposed from RBC.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability/behavior ('co-operative revocation of the MA shall be possible to a new target location, proposed from RBC'), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state reliability/availability, fault-tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: The new target location shall be checked for acceptance by the on board.
AI_Rationale: This is a statement of system behavior: the system must perform a check that a new target location is accepted by the onboard component. It specifies a functional action (validation/acceptance check). No explicit quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: If a train cannot stop at the proposed new target location it shall reject the request and keep the old target location.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (functional): how to handle a request when the train cannot stop at the new target (reject and retain old target). It also describes error-handling/failure behavior (fault tolerance) by defining graceful handling of an unfulfillable action. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The Reversing function shall only be possible in one active cab which is not closed at any time during the procedure.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint on where the Reversing function can be executed (only in one active cab that remains open during the procedure). This defines system behavior rather than availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Reversing shall be possible as defined by a value given with the MA
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability ('Reversing shall be possible') and ties it to a parameter ('value given with the MA'). No mention of availability, performance, security, usability, maintainability, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The driver shall be able to use the Reversing function without needing to re-confirm the train data.
AI_Rationale: This specifies that the driver must be able to use a specific feature (Reversing) without an extra confirmation step—so it defines functional capability. It also implies a usability requirement (reducing required steps/improving ease of use), but does not address availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Reversing shall be supervised to a distance and speed set as National Values
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (reversing must be supervised to specified distance/speed) and references 'National Values' implying regulatory/legal compliance. No indication of availability, performance, security, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: The distance supervised can be extended from the trackside.
AI_Rationale: The statement defines a capability of the system ('distance supervised can be extended from the trackside') so is a functional requirement. The phrase 'can be extended' implies scalability/extendability of supervision range, so Scalability is applicable. No explicit mention of availability, performance, security, usability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Once the train starts reversing the MA shall be cancelled.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (cancel the MA) triggered by a condition (train starts reversing). This is a functional behavioral requirement; it does not explicitly state availability, safety/fault-tolerance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The train shall be able to automatically pass from one RBC area to another without driver intervention.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/behavior of the train system (automatic handover between RBC areas without driver intervention), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: If the train is equipped with two operational radios there shall be no performance penalty as a result of a transition from one RBC to another (train spacing and train speed).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that there shall be no performance penalty (train spacing and speed) during a transition between RBCs when two radios are available — this is a performance constraint (PE). It also implies resilience during handover (maintaining performance despite change), which is a fault-tolerance/resilience concern (FT). No legal, usability, security, availability, or other qualities are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: If the train is equipped with only one operational radio, passing from one RBC to another shall still be possible but might result in a performance penalty.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes graceful degradation when only one radio is operational (fault tolerance) and explicitly notes a possible performance penalty (performance).

RequirementText: ETCS shall be able to supervise train and shunting movements.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (supervise train and shunting movements), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: To protect a traction unit from roll away and unwanted reverse movements the trainborne equipment shall monitor the direction of movement in relation to the permitted direction.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability: trainborne equipment shall monitor movement direction relative to permitted direction to prevent roll away/unwanted reverse movement — this is a functional behavior requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to prevent a train from entering a route for which it does not meet the required criteria.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability to prevent trains from entering routes when criteria are not met (functional behavior) and implies access/control or safety enforcement (security/authorization). It does not mention availability, performance, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: The driver shall be able to release an ETCS emergency brake application when stationary.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (driver can release emergency brake) which is a functional requirement. It also pertains to system operability (operator action/interaction) rather than non-functional concerns like performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: When the ETCS trainborne equipment is isolated, the system shall not show any ETCS information other than the fact that the system is isolated.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies observable system behavior about what information may be displayed when ETCS equipment is isolated, which is a functional specification. It also explicitly restricts disclosure of ETCS information, which is a confidentiality/security constraint, so Security is marked. Other quality attributes are not implied.

RequirementText: Isolation of the ETCS trainborne equipment shall disconnect the ETCS trainborne equipment from the vehicle braking system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (isolation shall disconnect ETCS from braking system), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall be capable of receiving information from the national train control systems by means of the STM.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide — receiving information from national train control systems via STM — which is a functional (behavioral) requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The DMI shall display or be compatible with information from national train control systems. This may mean displaying the information shown by the national system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system function: displaying or being compatible with national train control system information (functional). It also describes interfacing/compatibility with an external system, matching operability/interfacing concerns (O). It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, UI aesthetics, or maintainability constraints.

RequirementText: Unfitted operation shall be possible if ordered by trackside
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a capability (allow unfitted operation when ordered by trackside). It does not state non-functional qualities like availability, security, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: Unfitted operation shall be possible if selected by the driver at start up
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the system must allow 'Unfitted operation' when the driver selects it at startup. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The on board shall supervise the train against a ceiling speed
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function: the onboard system must supervise/enforce a maximum (ceiling) speed for the train. It describes expected behavior rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The ceiling speed value for the unfitted operation is determined by the lower value out of Maximum train speed and National value for unfitted operation.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional rule/behavior for computing the ceiling speed for unfitted operation (take the lower of two values). It describes what the system should do rather than a quality attribute, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The onboard shall be capable to switch to another ETCS status when transmitted from trackside
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the onboard system must switch ETCS status when instructed by trackside. No explicit quality constraints (performance, availability, security, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving track description from the trackside.
AI_Rationale: States a functional capability of the ETCS on-board system (receiving track description from trackside). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to send information on adhesion conditions from trackside.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability of the system — sending adhesion-condition information from trackside — which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, operability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: It shall also be possible, to allow the driver to change the adhesion conditions; in this case information from trackside has priority.
AI_Rationale: Defines system behavior: permit driver to change adhesion conditions and specify priority of trackside information — a functional requirement describing actions and rules.

RequirementText: The trackside shall be able to send information for the calculation of speed profiles.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (sending information) — a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, interoperability, or other quality attributes, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: If track data at least to the location where the relevant movement authority ends are not available on-board, the movement authority shall be rejected.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (reject movement authority) based on absence of onboard track data—this is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Track to train transmission shall provide the capability to send different speed profiles for specific train categories.
AI_Rationale: Describes a capability the system must provide (sending different speed profiles for train categories) which is a functional requirement. No constraints about availability, security, performance, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall supervise the end of movement authority, if this information is available on-board.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior of the ETCS trainborne equipment (to supervise the end of movement authority when that information is present on-board). It does not state constraints about availability, performance, security, scalability, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The target distance to be displayed on the DMI shall be based on the most restrictive braking curve.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the system shall display on the DMI (target distance) and the rule for deriving it (based on the most restrictive braking curve) — a functional behavior requirement rather than a quality/constraint like performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Together with the movement authority, the on board shall be able to receive one or more time-out(s) for certain sections of the movement authority, and shorten the movement authority accordingly when a time out expires.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: receiving time-outs associated with movement authority and shortening the movement authority when timeout expires. No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Using train data and infrastructure data, braking curves shall be calculated taking into account the target information but not the location of vehicles occupying the track.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system calculation behavior (compute braking curves from train and infrastructure data with specific inputs/exclusions). This is a functional requirement; it does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The ceiling speed level for the movement authority shall be defined as data National Value.
AI_Rationale: This is a data/functional requirement specifying that the ceiling speed level (movement authority) must be defined as a National Value. It primarily describes what data definition/behavior is required rather than availability, performance, security, or UI/operational concerns.

RequirementText: Before entering an occupied track, a driver acknowledgement shall be requested .
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a required system action (request driver acknowledgement before entering an occupied track), which describes functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall be capable of being isolated.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the equipment must be capable of being isolated—this implies operability/manageability (ability to isolate for maintenance/operation) and fault tolerance (isolation for faults/degraded operation). It does not mention availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: The train shall be supervised according to train speed data available.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: supervising the train based on available speed data. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, fault-tolerance, safety, UI, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The trainborne equipment shall remain in Full Supervision until the trainborne equipment is not active any longer, when Shunting is selected or when Partial Supervision information is received.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior/state-transition of the trainborne equipment (remain in Full Supervision until specific conditions occur). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: It shall be possible for the trackside to ask a driver for confirmation about the occupancy of the track ahead before sending a Full Supervision movement authority.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability: trackside must be able to request driver confirmation before issuing a movement authority (functional behavior). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: If decided by a national value, the driver may release the ETCS emergency brake when the actual speed is below the permitted speed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (allowing the driver to release the ETCS emergency brake under a conditional rule), which is functional. It does not state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: An ETCS equipped traction unit shall be capable of being moved in Shunting without train data, track data or movement authority.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/behavior of the ETCS-equipped traction unit (ability to be moved in Shunting without train/track data or movement authority), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, operability or usability constraints.

RequirementText: Transfer to Shunting on driverâ€™s selection shall only be possible when stationary.
AI_Rationale: The requirement constrains when a specific system function (transfer to shunting) may be performed (only when stationary), so it is a functional constraint. It also pertains to safe/operational control of the system (restricting operation based on state), fitting operability. It does not address availability, security, performance, portability, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: To prevent unauthorised use of the function permission shall be obtained from the RBC if the train is operating under the control of the RBC.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an authorization control to prevent unauthorized use when under RBC control, which is a security (access control) constraint rather than a functional or other NFR.

RequirementText: Permission received shall be indicated to the driver.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system action/behavior (indicate to the driver that permission was received), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state quality attributes such as usability, security, performance, etc., so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to manually select Shunting from Stand By operation, Full Supervision operation or Partial Supervision operation
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: ability to manually select between operation modes (Shunting, Stand By, Full or Partial Supervision). No quality constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Automatic transfer to Shunting may be from Full Supervision operation and Partial Supervision operation status at any speed lower than or equal to the supervised shunting speed based on trackside information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: automatic transfer to Shunting from particular operation statuses under speed condition derived from trackside information. This is a functional requirement describing what the system must do; it does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Before authomatic transition to Shunting, ETCS shall request confirmation from the driver.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system action (ETCS must request driver confirmation before automatic transition to Shunting). This is a functional behavior requirement; it does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: ETCS shall supervise Shunting operation to a permitted national speed value.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement: it specifies a system behavior (ETCS shall supervise shunting operations to a permitted national speed). It also implies compliance with national permitted speed regulations, so a legal/compliance aspect is indicated. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to apply the train trip function, if the shunting movement passes a signal showing "danger for shunting".
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior/feature: allowing application of the 'train trip function' under a specific condition (shunting movement passing a signal showing 'danger for shunting'). It describes functional behavior rather than availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Exit from Shunting shall only be possible when the train is stationary.
AI_Rationale: This is a behavioral constraint specifying when the 'Exit from Shunting' function is allowed (only when train is stationary). It defines functional system behavior rather than availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Exit from Shunting shall take place when the driver selects exit from shunting.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: system must perform exit from shunting when driver selects that option. No non-functional qualities (performance, availability, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Partial Supervision shall be selected either by the Driver, or by information received from track-to-train transmission.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability/behavior: how Partial Supervision is selected (by driver or via track-to-train transmission). This is a functional requirement; it does not specify availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: If acknowledgement is specifiedthe driver shall acknowledge transfer from Full Supervision to Partial Supervision within 5 seconds .
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required acknowledgement action (functional behavior) and a strict time bound of 5 seconds for that acknowledgement (performance/timeliness). No indications of availability, security, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Partial Supervision shall be indicated on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior: that 'Partial Supervision' must be indicated on the DMI (a display/UI). That is a functional requirement related to the user interface; it also constrains the UI (look-and-feel) by requiring an indication on the display. No availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are implied.

RequirementText: In Partial Supervision the train shall be supervised according to train speed and distance data available.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: under Partial Supervision the train shall be supervised based on available speed and distance data. This describes functionality (how supervision is performed) and does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The train shall have the capability of being supervised to a ceiling speed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/behavior of the train system (to be supervised to a ceiling speed), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: This ceiling speed shall not be shown continually on the DMI but may be shown momentarily when selected by the driver.
AI_Rationale: Specifies behavior of information shown on the Driver-Machine Interface (functional), and constrains its presentation and interaction (look-and-feel and usability requirement about when/how the value is displayed).

RequirementText: The train shall leave Partial Supervision when the trainborne equipment is not operative any longer, when Shunting is selected or when Full Supervision is available.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: the train shall leave Partial Supervision under listed conditions (trainborne equipment failure, Shunting selected, or Full Supervision available). This is a functional requirement describing mode-switching; no non-functional qualities are stated.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to order a train trip when passing a stop signal.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability/behavior the system must provide (ability to order a train trip under the condition of passing a stop signal). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Transferring to Full Supervision shall occur automatically when a movement authority and all other necessary information is received through track-to-train transmission.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: automatically transferring to Full Supervision upon receipt of movement authority and necessary information via track-to-train transmission. It describes functional logic/triggering; it does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Full Supervision shall provide supervision of speed and distance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (supervision of speed and distance). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The train shall, as a minimum, be supervised to a ceiling speed; the supervised speed shall not be shown on the DMI unless selected by the driver.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (train supervised to ceiling speed) and UI/display requirement (supervised speed hidden on DMI unless driver selects it). This is primarily functional plus look-and-feel; it also affects usability by requiring user selection to view the speed.

RequirementText: The supervised Shunting speed shall be indicated to the driver on request
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function: indicating the supervised shunting speed to the driver upon request. It describes behavior (what the system should do) and does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: On request of the RBC, the driver shall have the possibility to confirm that the track ahead of him until the end of the on sight section is clear
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability: on request of the RBC, the driver can confirm that the track ahead is clear—i.e., a functional requirement describing system/user behavior. It does not explicitly impose availability, security, usability, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to define certain locations (e.g. tunnels) where speed increase is related to the front of the train.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability to define locations with behavior (configuring speed increase tied to train front) — this is a functional requirement about system behavior/configuration, no explicit non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The braking curves shall ensure that the train complies with its speed requirements.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: braking curves must ensure train speed compliance. No explicit non-functional concerns (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Where failure to apply the full service brake is detected the emergency brake shall stop the train in rear of the danger point.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior in response to a detected failure (apply emergency brake to stop train)—a functional requirement. It also explicitly addresses handling of a failure condition (graceful/resilient action), so it implies fault tolerance.

RequirementText: The release speed shall be calculated on board, based on either: safety distance and overlap, accuracy of odometry, deceleration performance of the train, etc or given from the trackside.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system function: how the release speed is to be determined (calculated onboard from sensors/parameters or provided from trackside). No quality constraints like availability, performance, security, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: The release speed given from the trackside shall take priority over the release speed calculated on board
AI_Rationale: Specifies a behavioral rule about which speed source takes precedence (trackside over onboard). This describes functional behavior/requirement rather than availability, performance, security, or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: The release speed shall be indicated on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that release speed must be shown on the DMI (display). It also impacts usability since it directly affects what information is available to the user, but does not specify visual style, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: If the release speed is calculated on board it shall ensure that the train will stop before reaching the danger point
AI_Rationale: This is a behavioral requirement specifying what the system must do (ensure train stops before danger point when release speed is calculated onboard). It does not mention availability, security, performance metrics, fault tolerance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: When the train is stationary or after a certain time (e.g. the time for "route releasing" of the overlap, the release speed calculation shall be based on the distance to the danger point (if calculated on-board). The condition for this change shall be defined for each target as infrastructure data.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies how the system shall compute release speed under particular conditions (functional behavior). It also prescribes that the condition shall be defined as infrastructure data for each target, which relates to configuration/administration aspects (operability). No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, usability, or maintainability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Each railway shall have the possibility of allowing a different release speed for every signal.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: ability to allow/configure different release speeds per signal. No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall be able to determine the location of the entire train.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (determine train location), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: On lines fitted with RBC, the ETCS trainborne equipment shall be able to transmit the location of the entire train to the RBC.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability: the trainborne equipment shall transmit the train's location to the RBC on lines fitted with RBC. This describes functional behavior (what the system must do). No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The train location calculation shall take into account error of odometry.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies behavior of the train location calculation (functional). It also implies handling/compensating for sensor error (robustness/resilience), which maps to fault tolerance. No indications of availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Actual speed shall be indicated on the DMI
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: the DMI (display) must show actual speed. It is a functional display requirement; it does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or look-and-feel details.

RequirementText: There shall be no discrepancy between the speed shown to the driver and the speed used for supervision of movement authorities and speed limits, function (4.3.7.).
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates functional behavior (system must ensure no discrepancy between displayed speed and speed used for supervision). It also implies data integrity (security concern) because the internal and displayed values must be consistent; other quality categories (performance, availability, usability, etc.) are not explicitly referenced.

RequirementText: The indication provided shall enable the driver to drive at the permitted speed without receiving a warning and without intervention of ETCS.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: providing an indication that allows the driver to maintain permitted speed without warnings or ETCS intervention — this is a functional capability. It also implies a usability/ergonomic quality (enabling the driver to act correctly and avoid warnings), so Usability is marked. No explicit statements about availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or legal concerns are present.

RequirementText: The driver shall know the distance to the next point defining the indicated braking curve and the permitted speed allowed. This shall be shown to the driver in a way that is understandable and logical.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (informing driver of distance and permitted speed) and mandates presentation that is "understandable and logical," which is a usability requirement and also implies look-and-feel/visual presentation requirements. No indications of performance, security, scalability, portability, availability, fault tolerance, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: Visual and acoustic warnings to the driver about possible intervention from ETCS shall be given to enable the driver to react and avoid intervention.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system function (provide visual and acoustic warnings) — therefore Functional. It also concerns driver interaction and enabling reaction/avoidance, which pertains to usability (user notification effectiveness). No explicit requirements about availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault tolerance are stated.

RequirementText: A train shall be supervised to its static and dynamic train speed profiles.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system function: supervising a train against its static and dynamic speed profiles (monitoring/control behavior). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Within the braking curve area, a warning shall be given to the driver to enable him to react and avoid intervention from ETCS equipment at least 5 sec. before the intervention.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates a specific system behavior (provide a warning to the driver) so it is functional. It also includes a timing constraint (warning at least 5 seconds before intervention), which is a performance/timeliness quality attribute. No explicit indications of availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other categories are given.

RequirementText: The target distance shall not be shown on the DMI unless selected by the driver.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing behavior (whether the target distance is shown and conditional display based on driver selection) — a functional requirement. It also concerns user control and interface behavior affecting usability, so label US=1. It does not specify availability, security, legal, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or visual styling details that would justify other labels.

RequirementText: If the train or the shunting movement exceeds the permitted ceiling speed by a certain harmonised margin, the trainborne equipment shall execute a brake intervention until the actual speed does not exceed permitted speed; then the driver shall be able to release the brake
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behavior (automatic brake intervention and subsequent driver action) — a functional requirement. Does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: When changing to a higher speed level the rear end of the train shall respect the static train speed profile.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required system behavior: when increasing speed, the train's rear end must comply with the static train speed profile. This is a functional constraint/behavior; no explicit availability, performance, safety, or other non-functional quality is stated.

RequirementText: When changing to a lower speed level, the front end of the train shall respect the dynamic train speed profile.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an operational behavior: when reducing speed, the train front end must follow the dynamic speed profile. It defines what the system should do (behavioral constraint) and does not explicitly address availability, performance metrics, security, maintainability, or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: The driver shall have the possibility to select the language, this does not concern non pre-defined texts sent from the trackside.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability to select language (functional) and relates to usability/user preference; no mention of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Based on all relevant data, the ETCS shall calculate an emergency braking curve and a service braking curve
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior: calculating emergency and service braking curves based on data. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns (availability, performance, safety, etc.), so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: This static train speed profile shall also respect maximum line speed and track speed and special speed levels for special classes of trains.
AI_Rationale: Describes functional behavior requirement for the static train speed profile to enforce/observe maximum line/track speeds and special speed levels for certain train classes. No non-functional quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The ETCS trainborne equipment calculates the static train speed profile on the basis of infrastructure data and train data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (calculating static train speed profile based on inputs), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to permit/inhibit the service brake intervention by trackside
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (allowing or inhibiting service brake intervention from trackside), which is a functional behavior. It also implies an operational/admin control (ability to operate/enable/disable from trackside), so Operability is relevant. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, maintenance, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: At Start Up, the on board equipment shall perform an automatic self-test.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a startup behavior requirement (the equipment shall perform an automatic self-test) which is a functional requirement. It also implies fault detection/recovery capability (self-test supports fault tolerance), so FT is set. Other quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are not explicitly referenced.

RequirementText: The test shall require no action on the part of the driver.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required behavior of the test (functional). It also constrains user interaction by stating no driver action is required, which affects usability/interaction, so US is set. No explicit indications of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The DMI shall indicate the result of the self-test.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (the DMI shall indicate the result of the self-test), which is functional. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Train data shall be entered before the on-board ETCS equipment allows train movement.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior constraint ('shall be entered before ... allows train movement'), i.e., a functional control enforcing precondition. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The driver shall be able to select Train Data Entry on the DMI.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability: the driver must be able to select 'Train Data Entry' on the DMI (user interface action). It does not state quality attributes like availability, performance, usability, security, etc.

RequirementText: ETCS shall calculate the permitted speed for the train for all locations of the authorised movement.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall compute the permitted speed for the train at every location within the authorised movement. It describes system behavior/functionality rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Train data may be entered automatically from a railway management system or from train memory.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability: automatic entry of train data from specified sources (railway management system or train memory). No quality attributes like availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: Entering or overwriting data manually by the driver shall be possible but only when stationary.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow manual data entry/overwrite) with a constraint on when it may occur (only when stationary). That makes it a functional requirement with an operational constraint relevant to system operation/administration (operability). It does not explicitly address security, performance, usability, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: Current train data shall be stored (except at transition to shunting) in the ETCS equipment until the traction unit is not operative.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that current train data shall be stored in ETCS equipment until a condition — this describes system behavior (data retention) and thus is a functional requirement. No explicit quality attributes (availability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Stored train data shall be offered to the driver to be confirmed when Data Entry starts.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior (offer stored train data to driver for confirmation at data entry start). It also impacts usability by supporting user interaction/confirmation, but does not mention availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system for Train Data Entry shall provide for the input of other data required by STMs connected to ETCS. This may require additional items, not required for ETCS, to be entered.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability — providing input of additional data for STMs connected to ETCS — which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly address availability, security, usability, performance, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The entry of driver identification and the selection of the language shall be possible.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capabilities: entering driver identification and selecting language (functional). Language selection also affects user experience/usability, so US=1. No requirements about availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: ETCS shall collect all relevant information concerning train and line speed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/action (collect relevant information about train and line speed), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The change of driver identification during a journey or a Train Running Number shall be possible
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (allow changing driver identification or Train Running Number during a journey), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Following successful completion of Train Data Entry, the driver shall be able to perform shunting movements or train movements.
