AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: after Train Data Entry, the driver can perform shunting or train movements. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The following data may be entered manually by the driver or from train memory (M), or provided by external sources (O): Driver identification, Train identification (train number) STM ready for use, Data required for brake calculation, Maximum train speed, Train length, Status of air tight system, Type of electric power accepted, Data additional required for STM (if any), International train category, Train gauge, Maximum axle load of the train with a resolution of 0,5 t.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies what data may be entered and sources (manual, train memory, external) — this describes functional behavior (data inputs). It does not specify availability, security, usability, performance, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: If the onboard fails to contact the RBC when awakening the driver shall be asked to enter the RBC contact details.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: when onboard fails to contact RBC upon awakening, the driver is prompted to enter RBC contact details (functional). This is also a fault-handling recovery action, so fault tolerance applies. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: The driver shall be able to consult train data when the train is stationary or moving.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability for the driver to consult train data). It also concerns operation in different operational states (stationary or moving), which relates to operability/operational use, so O is set. No explicit mention of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Communications Interfaces There are no special communication interface requirements
AI_Rationale: The statement simply declares there are no special communication interface requirements. It does not specify any functional behavior or quality attribute (availability, security, portability, operability, etc.). Therefore no specific NFR label is clearly implied; conservative classification sets all labels to false.

RequirementText: Software Quality Attributes Web design conventions should be consistent with the standards and conventions used on the OUS site.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates consistency of web design conventions with an existing site, which directly concerns look-and-feel (visual/design standards) and implies usability (consistent conventions support user comprehension). It does not specify availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: There is a need to track and evaluate the â€œhitsâ€� and time spent on the student-focused website over time; and make content, design, and navigation changes as needed based on evaluation of hits.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies tracking and evaluating website hits and time and making content/design/navigation changes based on that evaluation—this defines system functionality (analytics and update actions) and is aimed at improving user experience/usability. It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, performance, or legal/look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: Software Interfaces There are no special software interface requirements
AI_Rationale: The statement merely declares that there are no special software interface requirements. It does not specify any functional behavior or any non-functional quality (availability, security, performance, etc.), so no labels apply.

RequirementText: The Get Real site should be hosted on a server that can provide adequate response time. High school students tend to have short attentions spans, so a slow server would not be satisfactory for this application. The current OUS (www.ous.edu) site is a good example of rapid response time.
AI_Rationale: The requirement focuses on ensuring the site is hosted so as to provide adequate/rapid response time (performance). It also implies a hosting/availability concern (choosing a server that can deliver acceptable responsiveness), so Availability is marked. No explicit statements about security, scalability, fault-tolerance, usability features, or other categories are present.

RequirementText: User Interfaces The Get Real site should work and be tested against IE, Firefox and Netscape.
AI_Rationale: Specifies browser support/compatibility (IE, Firefox, Netscape) for the user interface, which is a portability requirement across platforms/browsers. It does not address availability, performance, security, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: Copyright and other security measures for Get Real should be the same as the OUS site.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly refers to "copyright" (a legal/compliance concern) and "security measures" (information security). Therefore Legal and Security labels apply. It does not describe availability, performance, scalability, portability, UI, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or usability.

RequirementText: Hardware Interfaces There are no special hardware interface requirements
AI_Rationale: Statement indicates no special hardware interface requirements, which pertains to portability/compatibility across hardware platforms. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic data in the Synchro traffic analysis tool Synchro interface format.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (publishing traffic data in a specific Synchro interface format), which is functional. It also describes an interfacing/operability requirement for output services, so Operability is applicable. It does not specify availability, performance, portability across platforms, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic data in the Paramics traffic analysis tool Paramics interface format.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (publishing traffic data)—a functional requirement. It explicitly requires producing data in the Paramics interface format, which implies compatibility/portability with an external tool. It also implies operability/manageability regarding interfacing with external systems (similar to examples that label interoperability as Operability). No performance, security, scalability, legal, usability, look-and-feel, maintainability or fault-tolerance aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic data in the SimTraffic traffic analysis tool SimTraffic interface format.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability to publish traffic data in a specific SimTraffic interface format (functional). Implies compatibility/interoperability with that external tool (portability). Does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic management data in TMS/H interface format.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (publish traffic data in a specific TMS/H interface format) — this is functional. It also implies interoperability/portability to that interface format and relates to operating/integration concerns (operability). No explicit availability, performance, security, or UI qualities are stated.

RequirementText: The DUAP Presentation Services shall present data published by Output Services.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (Presentation Services shall present data published by Output Services). No quality constraints (performance, availability, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall log Output Services data transactions.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (to log Output Services data transactions), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security/audit, operability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish weather data elements as enumerated in APPENDIX D - Weather Data Elements from Clarus output format.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide — publishing specific weather data elements in the Clarus output format — which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, operability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish asset condition data using the asset condition data interface format.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (publish asset condition data) — functional. It requires using a specified interface format, implying interoperability/operability and compatibility across interfaces (portability). No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic condition alerts using the traffic condition alert interface format.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (ability to publish traffic condition alerts). It also specifies interfacing using a particular interface format, implying interoperability/operability concerns and cross-system compatibility (operability and portability), similar to the provided example.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish weather condition alerts using the weather condition alert interface format.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the capability to publish weather alerts (functional behavior). It also mandates using a specific interface format, implying interoperability/operability and portability concerns for integration with other systems.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall publish information for the MDOT MI Drive presentation.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (publish information for a specific presentation), which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, UI, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish asset condition alerts using the asset condition alert interface format.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to publish asset condition alerts). It also implies operability/interoperability concerns (must interface/publish using a specified interface format) and portability/compatibility across that interface, similar to example mapping of interfacing requirements to O and PO.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish alerts using the threshold exceeded alert interface format when thresholds have been exceeded.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (publishing alerts in a specific interface format) — a functional behavior. It also implies integration/interfacing with external consumers via a defined format, matching operability/interop and portability concerns (as in similar examples), so O and PO are marked. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic data in the VISSIM traffic analysis tool VISSIM interface format.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (publish traffic data in VISSIM interface format) — thus Functional. It also implies interoperability/integration with an external tool, which relates to Operability and Portability (support for a specific external format/platform). No explicit performance, security, scalability, legal, UI, maintainability, or fault-tolerance constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall publish alerts.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (publishing alerts), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish data to SEMSIM using the SEMSIM interface format.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an interface capability to publish data using a specific interface format (interoperability/portability) and concerns system operability (ability to connect/publish). It does not state performance, security, availability, or other quality constraints, nor is it expressed as an internal functional detail per the provided examples.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall log Computational Services data transactions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system shall perform logging of Computational Services data transactions — a concrete system behavior (functional). Logging is primarily an operational feature aiding monitoring and administration, so Operability is also applicable. No explicit statements about availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, UI, maintainability, or legal concerns are present.

RequirementText: The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish roadway traffic information in Traffic Management Data Dictionary (TMDD) format
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (publish roadway traffic info) — functional. Requires output in a specific standard format (TMDD), implying interoperability/portability and operational interfacing with other systems, hence Operability and Portability. No availability, security, performance, or other quality concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The DUAP Computational Services shall be able to derive pothole severity from probe vehicle data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability of the system: deriving pothole severity from probe vehicle data. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall be able to identify high risk locations.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (identify high risk locations), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The DUAP Presentation Services shall include a user interface for browsing traffic information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall include a user interface for browsing traffic information — this is a functional requirement. It does not specify UI appearance, usability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall be able to calculate measures of effectiveness.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (calculate measures of effectiveness), which is a functional behavior. No non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall be able to perform data quality checking.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying the system shall perform data quality checking (F). Data quality checking implies enforcement of data integrity/validation which relates to security/integrity concerns (SE). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, usability, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, look-and-feel, or legal aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall store geo-references for Michigan roadways.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall cache (both raw and derived) probe vehicle data.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall cache (both raw and derived) traffic data.

It does not explicitly mention availability, scalability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall cache (both raw and derived) road weather data.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall cache (both raw and derived) road condition data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement prescribes a system behavior (to cache raw and derived road condition data), which is a functional concern. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall be able to log system operations.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (ability to log system operations), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, maintainability, operability, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The DUAP System shall cache data only if the data record associates the data with its source, a georeferenced location, and a timestamp.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a concrete system behavior/constraint governing when data may be cached (requirement about checking source, georeference, and timestamp), which is a functional requirement. RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability for operators to update a summary log for the purposes of tracking the occurrence of significant events or activities.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (operators can update a summary log), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security/authorization, fault tolerance, usability, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of storing product quality information in the metadata of products created.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a capability the system must provide—storing product quality information in product metadata—which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of retaining Data Products for a configurable period of time not to exceed 96 hours.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability: retaining Data Products for a configurable period (functional behavior). It defines a constraint on the retention duration (<=96 hours) but does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, legal compliance, or operability concerns explicitly.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of accepting technology updates without System downtime.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly requires no downtime during technology updates (availability). This implies fault tolerance/resilience to allow updates without service interruption, and is strongly related to maintainability (ability to apply updates) and operability (administering updates without downtime). No mention of performance, security, portability, scalability, legal, UI, or functional behavior beyond the quality constraint.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of adding additional capacity without redesign of it s infrastructure.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the ability to add capacity without redesign, which directly concerns scalability (ability to grow/scale). No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The System shall be constructed using COTS and Open Source software where it is possible, practical, and approved by the Government.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates use of COTS and Open Source software subject to Government approval — this implies compliance/governance/legal constraints (L) and constrains technology choices/operation of the system (operability/management concerns) (O). It does not explicitly state performance, availability, security, portability, or maintainability requirements.

RequirementText: The System shall be constructed using existing software where it is possible, practical, and approved by the Government. Inventory will be provided to the Contractor by OSDPD IT Lead.
AI_Rationale: This is a contractual/standards constraint requiring use of existing software when approved by the Government and inventory provision—a compliance/legal restriction rather than a functional behavior or performance/quality attribute. It does not explicitly specify security, portability, performance, scalability, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: The NDE System shall be designed so that Scientific Algorithms are invoked as objects.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a design approach (invoking algorithms as objects), which targets modularity, extensibility and ease of maintenance. It is a maintainability/design constraint rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability for operators to log and track events (i.e., MMC Service Requests, MMC Service Request Responses).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (functional) for operators to log and track events. This is also an operational/administrative feature (operability). It does not explicitly state security, availability, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall be constructed using existing hardware where it is possible, practical, and approved by the Government. Inventory will be provided to the Contractor by OSDPD IT Lead.
AI_Rationale: Requirement constrains construction/deployment to use existing hardware (portability/compatibility constraint). The need for Government approval implies a contractual/compliance/legal constraint.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of reporting on all ingested, generated, and distributed data according to the (Federal Geographic Data Committee (FGDC) Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata (CSDGM), Vers. 2 (FGDC-STD-001-1998 ) and the CSDGM Remote Sensing Extensions (FGDC-STD-012-2002).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall be capable of reporting data according to specific FGDC metadata standards — this is a functional capability. It also mandates compliance with external standards, so it implies legal/regulatory/standards compliance. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall provide an operator console capable of interfacing with the ESPC trouble ticketing system.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of adjusting the priorities of scheduled and event-driven tasks.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability/behavior (adjusting task priorities), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, scalability, security, operability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of executing 99% of its event driven tasks in any consecutive 30 day period.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a reliability/availability target (executing 99% of tasks over any 30-day period), analogous to uptime/availability requirements. Does not explicitly state fault-tolerance, performance, scalability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of executing 99% of its scheduled tasks in any consecutive 30 day period.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an availability/reliability metric (99% of scheduled tasks executed over any 30-day period), matching availability concerns. It does not explicitly state fault tolerance, performance, scalability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of executing tasks initiated by events.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of executing tasks according to a schedule.

RequirementText: The System shall provide an operator console capable of interfacing with the NPOESS trouble ticketing system.

RequirementText: ESPC Operations shall provide an interface between NDE and the NPOESS Mission Management Center (MMC) such that 100% of the NDE inquiries to the MMC and NDE replies to MMC requests are received by the MMC in a time not to exceed that specified in the ICD, and that 100% of the notifications and inquiries from the MMC to NDE are received by NDE in a time not to exceed that specified by the ICD.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that ESPC Operations shall provide an interface (functional requirement) and requires 100% of messages to be received within time limits in the ICD — this implies availability/reliability and performance (timing/latency) requirements. No explicit statements about fault tolerance, security, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of sending a Data Receipt to CLASS for each Data Product received from CLASS.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of receiving Data Products delivered from CLASS.

RequirementText: The System shall provide an operator console capable of requesting Data Products from the Comprehensive Large Array-data Stewardship System (CLASS).

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability for operators to sort and search on summary log events for the purposes of identifying, troubleshooting, and reporting on significant activities.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of ingesting and processing archived data.

RequirementText: The System shall have the capacity to store 4 Terabytes (TBs) of data for testing purposes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of reporting on summary log events.

RequirementText: The System shall deliver A-DCS Data Products from IDPS to the US Global Processing Center within 1 minute of their receipt.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement to deliver A-DCS Data Products between components (IDPS to US Global Processing Center) and includes a quantitative timing constraint (within 1 minute) indicating a performance/latency requirement. RequirementText: The System shall implement operational quality monitoring procedures that will detect and report to operators and management the acceptability of xDR metadata according to configurable thresholds.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of receiving Ancillary Data Products from the Environmental Satellite Processing Center (ESPC).

RequirementText: The NDE System can be accessed only with the authorization of the Government.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of protecting the integrity of NDE data in the event of a natural disaster.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies protecting data integrity during a natural disaster, which implies resilience/recovery capabilities (fault tolerance). It also concerns integrity, a security property. It does not specify availability, performance, scalability, or other categories.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of protecting the integrity of NDE data in the event of a hardware malfunction such as a disk crash.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system capability to protect data integrity during hardware failures (e.g., disk crash) — this is a functional provision of fault tolerance/resilience (FT) and directly concerns data integrity, a security property (SE). It is not about availability, scalability, performance, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of protecting the integrity of NDE data from software bugs.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies protecting data integrity against software bugs which implies integrity/security concerns (SE) and resilience/recovery from faults/bugs (FT). Does not specify availability, performance, portability, usability, maintainability, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of protecting the integrity of NDE data in the event of computer to computer transmission errors.
AI_Rationale: Requirement addresses protecting data integrity during transmission errors (integrity/confidentiality/accuracy) — a security concern — and implies resilience/recovery in face of transmission faults, i.e., fault tolerance.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of protecting the integrity of NDE data in the event of human errors.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies protecting data integrity against human errors, which implies resilience/fault-tolerance to operator mistakes (FT) and addresses data integrity/security concerns (SE). It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of returning to nominal operations following a restoration from system backups.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies recovery capability after backup restoration, i.e., resilience/graceful recovery from faults; this maps to Fault Tolerance rather than functional or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of implementing automated backup procedures.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies capability to perform automated backup procedures (functional) and implies resilience/recovery behavior (fault tolerance). No explicit availability, performance, security, or other qualities mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of generating backups for all NDE data, procedures, and software.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to generate backups (a functional behavior) and implies recoverability/resilience to data loss (fault tolerance). Backup generation is also an operational/admin function (operability). It does not mention availability metrics, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, UI, or legal constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The System shall comply with ESPC (DoC/NOAA/NESDIS) procedures and policies as stated in the NOAA IT Security Manual 212-1300, Version 3.3, dated May 15, 2007.
AI_Rationale: Specifies compliance with NOAA IT Security Manual procedures and policies — this is a legal/regulatory requirement (L) and directly concerns security controls and practices (SE). No functional or other quality aspects are implied.

RequirementText: The System shall deliver A-DCS Telemetry data from IDPS to the US Global Processing Center within 1 minute of their receipt.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (deliver telemetry from IDPS to processing center) and a quantitative timing constraint (within 1 minute) which is a performance/latency requirement. No explicit mention of availability, security, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability for operators to quiesce and restart the System. This capability should be designed to minimize interruptions of service.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (operators can quiesce and restart) — functional. It targets operator control/administration, so operability. Designed to minimize service interruptions implies availability concerns and graceful handling/recovery, so fault tolerance and availability are applicable. No mention of security, portability, scalability, UI, or legal constraints; maintainability not explicitly stated.

RequirementText: The System shall deliver SARSAT Telemetry data from IDPS to US Mission Control Center (USMCC) within 1 minute of their receipt.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (deliver SARSAT telemetry from IDPS to USMCC) with a quantitative timing constraint (within 1 minute) indicating a performance/latency requirement. No explicit availability, security, scalability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The Development and Maintenance Environment shall be available to at least 25 developers 85% of the time during normal business hours over any consecutive twelve month period. Normal business hours are 8am to 4pm Eastern Time, Monday through Friday.
AI_Rationale: Specifies availability metric (at least 25 developers 85% of time during defined business hours over 12 months). This is an availability requirement; it does not specify fault tolerance, performance, scalability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The NDE Operations Monitoring capability shall not be interrupted for more than 2 hours in any consecutive 24 hour period and no more than 4 hours in any consecutive 30 day period.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maximum allowed interruption/downtime within time windows (uptime requirements), which is an Availability requirement.

RequirementText: The NDE Distribution capability shall not be interrupted for more than 2 hours in any consecutive 24 hour period and no more than 4 hours in any consecutive 30 day period.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maximum permissible interruption durations (uptime/outage SLA) for the NDE Distribution capability, which is an availability requirement.

RequirementText: The NDE Product Generation capability shall not be interrupted for more than 2 hours in any consecutive 24 hour period and no more than 4 hours in any consecutive 30 day period.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maximum allowable interruption/downtime over time windows (uptime/availability requirements). Does not mention fault tolerance, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The NDE Ingest capability shall not be interrupted for more than 2 hours in any consecutive 24 hour period and no more than 4 hours in any consecutive 30 day period.
AI_Rationale: This specifies maximum allowed interruption durations over time windows (uptime/availability requirement). It does not mention performance metrics, fault-recovery mechanisms, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall be compliant with the OMB Federal Enterprise Architecture (FEA) according to the documents dated December 2006, and available from http://www.whitehouse.gov/omb/egov/a-2- EAModelsNEW2.html .
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates compliance with the OMB Federal Enterprise Architecture (a regulatory/standards mandate), which is a legal/regulatory constraint. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: During the NPOESS-C2 mission, the System shall be capable of supporting product volumes of 8 Terabytes per day of input and 16 Terabytes per day of output.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data throughput/capacity (8 TB/day input, 16 TB/day output), which directly relates to scalability and performance (throughput). No mention of availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: During the NPOESS-C1 mission, the System shall be capable of supporting product volumes of 8 Terabytes per day of input and 16 Terrabytes per day of output.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required daily input/output data volumes (capacity/throughput), which is a scalability requirement. Does not mention availability, security, performance metrics beyond capacity, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: During the NPP mission, the System shall be capable of supporting product volumes of 4 Terrabytes per day of input and 8 Terabytes per day of output.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required daily input/output data volumes (throughput/capacity), which relates to performance (throughput) and scalability. Does not address availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability for operators to forward NDE System Elements to CLASS for permanent archive.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (forwarding system elements to a permanent archive), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state security, availability, operability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of changing system status to reflect the condition of NPOESS (i.e., Degraded Operations, Restricted Access).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system capability to change its status to reflect operational conditions — this is a functional behavior. It also pertains to operational/administrative visibility (operability). It does not explicitly require fault-tolerance, availability metrics, security, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall implement operational quality monitoring procedures that will detect and report to operators and management the acceptability of output product metadata according to configurable thresholds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (implement monitoring procedures to detect and report metadata acceptability), so it is functional. It explicitly targets operational monitoring and reporting to operators/management with configurable thresholds, which is an operability/administration concern. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of accessing data delivered by IDPS within no more than ten seconds of notification from IDPS.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a timing/response requirement (access data within 10 seconds of notification) which is a performance-related quality constraint. No explicit availability, security, scalability, usability, or functional behavior beyond performance is stated.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of receiving Data Delivery Reports (DDRs) from the IDPS.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (ability to receive Data Delivery Reports from the IDPS), which is a functional requirement describing what the system should do. It does not state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The NDE System Elements shall be designed to be reused in other Satellite Data Processing applications.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that system elements be designed to be reused in other applications, which implies design for reusability/modularity and ease of maintenance (Maintainability) and ability to operate in different application environments (Portability). No explicit availability, performance, security, or UI constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The System shall provide an operator console capable of utilizing IDPS client software for submitting subscriptions for Data Products to the IDPS.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (provide an operator console that can use IDPS client software to submit subscriptions), which is functional in nature. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, or portability.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of compressing Data Products with the ZIP algorithm.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system capability (compressing data using ZIP), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of compressing Data Products with the GZIP algorithm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system capability (compress Data Products using GZIP), which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, scalability or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of reformatting Data Products into netCDF.
AI_Rationale: This is a statement of a system capability (reformatting data into netCDF), which is a functional requirement describing what the system should do. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of reformatting Data Products into HDF5.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (reformatting Data Products into HDF5), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, scalability, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of reformatting Data Products into GeoTIFF.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (reformat data products into GeoTIFF), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, portability, security, scalability, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of reformatting Data Products into GRIB2.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to reformat Data Products into GRIB2), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of reformatting Data Products into BUFR.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability/operation the system must perform (reformatting data into BUFR), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of generating NOAA-Unique and Tailored Data Products with Government-specified grid spacing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (generate NOAA-unique and tailored data products with government-specified grid spacing) — a functional requirement. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, security, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of producing time-averaged Data Products.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability — producing time-averaged data products — which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of aggregating Data Products up to and including one orbit.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies capacity limit (ability to aggregate data up to one orbit), which is a scalability constraint. It does not explicitly state performance, security, availability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of rendering Polar Stereographic projections.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (rendering Polar Stereographic projections). It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of rendering Mercator projections.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (to render Mercator projections), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, look-and-feel constraints, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of automatically submitting Ad Hoc Requests to the IDPS for retransmission of Data Products.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability of the system — automatically submitting ad hoc requests to IDPS for retransmission of data products. It describes behavior (what the system should do) and does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, performance, scalability, usability, portability, legal, maintainability, or operability constraints.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability for an authorized user to adjust Product Generation priorities.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (providing the ability to adjust Product Generation priorities) which is functional. It also explicitly restricts the action to an "authorized user", implying access control concerns (security). No mention of availability, performance, scalability, portability, fault tolerance, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of generating Data Products.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (generate Data Products). It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to control the execution of Scientific Algorithms.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability ('provide the capability to control the execution') which is a functional requirement. It does not mention authorization, availability, performance, operability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of maintaining records of at least 30 days (configurable) worth of Ingest history.
AI_Rationale: This is a non-functional storage/retention requirement specifying the system must retain at least 30 days of ingest history (configurable). It implies scalability (capacity to store historical data) and operability because retention period is configurable/administrable. It does not specify performance, security, legal, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to support functional and performance tests of system elements without impacting operational product generation.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (functional) to support testing. It explicitly requires testability/maintainability and operational support (operability). Requiring tests not to impact production implies resilience/isolation (fault tolerance). It does not explicitly state availability metrics, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of integrating System Elements including Scientific Algorithms, Product Tailoring Tools, Data Format Translation Tools, and other pre-defined transformation utilities.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability of the system to integrate various system elements (algorithms, tools, translators), which describes a functional capability. It primarily concerns the system's operability/interoperability (ability to integrate and work with other components), so Operability is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, fault tolerance, performance, scalability, security, portability, maintainability, legal, look & feel, or usability are present.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of defining Data Products for Ingest. 3.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (defining Data Products for ingest). It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to send an electronic notification to authorized users when they receive restricted access data.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (system must send electronic notifications). The mention of 'authorized users' implies an access-control/security concern (authorization), so SE is set. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, usability, legal, portability, maintainability, fault tolerance, look-and-feel, or operability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to operate in a Restricted Access Mode, within which only users meeting certain criteria will be authorized access to the data. Criteria will be defined in the TBD Data Denial Plan.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (operate in Restricted Access Mode) which is a functional requirement and restricts access to data based on user criteria, which is an access control/security requirement. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to notify customers upon the NPOESS Ground System entering and leaving a Degraded Operations Mode.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (notifying customers when entering/leaving Degraded Operations Mode), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability metrics, fault-tolerance mechanisms, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to operate in a Degraded System Mode, within which the system generates a subset of products based upon priority and availability of system resources.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (provide capability to operate in Degraded System Mode) — functional. Describes graceful degradation and operation under limited resources by producing a subset of products based on priority and resource availability — fault tolerance. Does not explicitly mention availability metrics, performance, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to operate in an Open Mode, within which authorized customers shall be allowed read-only access to requested Data Products. This is the nominal system mode.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability/mode (functional requirement) to allow read-only access. Explicitly restricts access to authorized customers, implying security (authorization) concerns. No mention of availability, performance, portability, scalability, UI look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or usability.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of compressing Data Products with the RICE algorithm.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system capability (compress data products using the RICE algorithm), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, portability, operability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of compressing images of Data Products with the JPEG algorithm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (compress images using JPEG), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes like performance, scalability, security, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of rendering Platte Carre projections.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the system must render a particular map projection (Platte Carré). No quality attributes (availability, performance, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of generating Data Products within a time frame not to exceed the maximum user-specified shelf-life of the Data Product.
AI_Rationale: The requirement states the system shall be capable of generating Data Products (functional behavior) and adds a strict timing constraint—generation must not exceed a user-specified shelf-life—indicating a performance/timeliness quality. No indications of availability, scalability, security, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look & feel, or usability concerns are present.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of compressing animated images of Data Products with the MPEG algorithm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (compressing animated images using MPEG). This is a functional requirement describing what the system should do; it does not specify performance, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of receiving A-DCS data and telemetry from the IDPS.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (receiving A-DCS data and telemetry from the IDPS), which describes functional behavior (an interface/operation). No explicit non-functional aspects (availability, performance, security, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of receiving SARSAT Telemetry from the IDPS.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (receiving SARSAT telemetry from IDPS) — a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (performance, availability, security, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of requesting and accepting all xDRs generated by the IDPS.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability of the system to request and accept xDRs (what the system should do), which is a functional behavior. It does not quantify volume, performance, availability, fault tolerance, security, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of receiving data and products from IDPS.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the system must receive data/products from an IDPS (integration requirement). Does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to generate custom reports from data collected during data receipt, processing, and distribution.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (generating custom reports from collected data). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: The System shall have the capability to monitor, record statistics, and deliver reports on its performance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (monitoring, recording statistics, delivering reports) — this is functional. It explicitly relates to system monitoring/administration, so operability is applicable. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, maintainability, performance constraints, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of making products available for distribution according to customer specified latencies.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies capability to make products available for distribution (operability/availability of distribution mechanisms) with customer-specified latencies—a performance/timing constraint. No legal, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, or usability aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of executing and recording the results of data input integrity checks, and initiate actions based on those results.
AI_Rationale: This specifies behavior the system must perform (execute and record integrity checks and initiate actions) — i.e., functional requirements. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability for an authorized user to define data input integrity checks.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (functional). It limits the actors to an "authorized user," implying access control/authorization concerns (security). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, usability, or other NFRs are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of monitoring the integrity of all data received from external sources.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies monitoring data integrity of incoming external data, which directly concerns security (data integrity). It also explicitly mentions monitoring, which maps to operability/manageability. It does not specify availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or look-and-feel, nor maintenance activities.

RequirementText: In the event of a failure of the Operational Environment during the NPOESS missions, the System Test Environment shall be capable of delivering products to the operational community within the same throughput and latency parameters as the operational system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the System Test Environment must deliver products in event of operational environment failure (functional behavior) and requires resilience/recovery capabilities (fault tolerance). It also mandates matching throughput and latency, which are performance requirements. Does not explicitly address availability, scalability, security, etc.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of retaining logs of all performance data for no less than 90 consecutive calendar days.
AI_Rationale: This is a capability requirement to retain logs for a specified minimum period (functional behavior). It specifies a durability/availability constraint of log data (availability) and is an operational/manageability requirement concerning log retention and storage (operability). No mention of performance, scalability, security, legal, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: The System shall provide a mechanism for reporting performance related to resource utilization, communications, product latencies, and hardware.
AI_Rationale: Requirement requests a mechanism (functional) to report on performance metrics (resource utilization, communications, latencies, hardware), which is a performance-related capability (PE) and supports system monitoring/operability (O). No explicit availability, security, scalability, portability, or UI/maintainability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of making Data Products available to registered users.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies what the system should do (make Data Products available to registered users) — a functional requirement. It also implies access restriction to registered users, which strongly suggests authentication/authorization concerns (security). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, or other quality metrics are stated.

RequirementText: The System shall provide an automatic failover capability that will re-create a fully functioning configuration from a failed configuration.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies automatic failover and recreation of a functioning configuration after failure — this is primarily fault tolerance (FT) and directly supports system availability (A). It does not describe functional behavior, security, performance, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall provide an online capability for registered users to request subscriptions to xDRs, Ancillary, NOAA-Unique, and Tailored Data Products.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (online request subscriptions) for registered users, implying authentication/authorization requirements (security). No explicit requirements about availability, performance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The System shall provide an online capability for the Government to approve subscription requests for xDRs, Ancillary, NOAA-Unique, and Tailored Data Products.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (an online approval feature for Government actors to approve subscription requests). It does not explicitly state security, availability, performance, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is set to true.

RequirementText: The System shall provide a list of files distributed to CLASS.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the system shall provide (display/produce) a list of files distributed to CLASS. No non-functional attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System shall provide the capability to receive an electronic delivery acknowledgement message from CLASS.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — receiving an electronic delivery acknowledgement message from CLASS. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of distributing NOAA-Unique Data Products to the CLASS Long-Term Archive (LTA).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — the system must distribute NOAA-Unique Data Products to the CLASS Long-Term Archive. It does not state availability, performance, scalability, security, portability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of delivering NDE Data Products to registered user s computer systems.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (delivering NDE Data Products to registered users' computer systems), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, scalability, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of notifying registered users of the status of their orders.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior — notifying registered users about order status — which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of notifying registered users of the status of the System.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — notifying registered users about system status. It does not specify availability metrics, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System shall ensure that NDE information is accessible only to those authorized to have access.
AI_Rationale: Specifies restricting access to authorized users only—explicitly a security requirement (access control/confidentiality). No mention of availability, performance, UI, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The System shall be capable of registering Users for the purpose of controlling their access to System Elements and Data Products.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user registration to control access) and implies security concerns (access control). It does not specify availability, performance, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: A freely available wiki should provide a simple markup language that actors can use to style their input, as well as link to other pages in the wiki. More importantly, having the wiki inside Moodle reduces confusion and allows for the integration of notifications and logins.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional features (a wiki with markup, linking, and integration with Moodle for notifications/logins). Also emphasizes ease-of-use ('simple markup', 'reduces confusion'), so usability is applicable. No explicit performance, security, availability, or other non-functional constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: Currently, there is no system that allows actors to receive SMS or email notifications of changes to Moodle pages (such as assignments or announcements).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability to send SMS/email notifications of changes to Moodle pages — this is a functional behavior (notification feature). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: A freely available blog engine should provide all modern blog functionality, such as tagging, drafting, and comments. These blogs should share authentication and notification with Moodle.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional features (modern blog functionality: tagging, drafting, comments) and explicitly requires shared authentication with Moodle, which pertains to security (authentication/integration). Other non-functional categories are not mentioned.

RequirementText: The system must provide a blog engine.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying that the system must provide a blog engine; no non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system must provide both e-mail and SMS notifications for pages.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must offer (providing e-mail and SMS notifications), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system must provide a wiki where actors can collaboratively create networks of documents.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — providing a wiki for collaborative creation of document networks. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system should display grade information to the appropriate actor.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system function (display grade information) — functional. The phrase 'to the appropriate actor' implies access control/authorization, so security concerns are also indicated.

RequirementText: The system should maintain a history of grades for a particular assignment if the course administrator changes them. This way, another actor can review the grade information if their score on an assignment has changed and they wish to dispute it. Course administrators can also track how they have changed a score over time using the timestamps associated with each change to the gradebook.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a feature to maintain a history of grade changes and timestamps (functional). It also implies an audit trail for review/dispute, which maps to legal/compliance concerns (auditability), so Legal is marked. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The system should maintain a grade history.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functionality the system must provide — maintaining a grade history (data retention/history feature). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system should display grade information such as the grade for each assignment, averages, and overall grade to the actor to whom the grades belong. No other actor should be able to view anotherâ€™s grades except an actor in the role of course administrator for the course to which the grades belong.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (displaying grades to the grade owner) and access control constraint restricting who may view grades (authorization/privacy), which is a security requirement.

RequirementText: Course administrators should be able to post grades for an assignment based on the ratio of points earned to points possible. The course administrator should also be able to attach feedback in the form of text or an attachment (as described above). Time stamps should be attached to the last time the grade was modified so that actors may examine when particular grades were submitted and how an actor in the role of student has improved or lessened his performance in the course.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies capabilities (posting grades by ratio, attaching feedback, timestamps) — functional. It also states these features enable actors to examine grades and improvement, which relates to usability (supporting user examination/navigation), so US is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints are given.

RequirementText: For this requirement, page refers to any distinct page (e.g., an assignment, a wiki page, a forum post, etc.). When a page is created, the actor in the role of course administrator should be able to toggle whether notifications are turned on. By default, they should be turned on for announcements. If notifications are turned off, actors in the capacity of student should be able to subscribe to notifications.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior for notification toggling, defaults, and subscription—functional requirements about what the system must do; no explicit quality constraints like security, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The social, collaborative components of Moodle are not very robust. There are better, freelyavailable solutions which should be integrated into Moodle to provide the best functionality possible for all actors without having to use 3rd party services.
AI_Rationale: The requirement calls for integrating better collaborative solutions into Moodle to provide improved functionality for users, which specifies what the system should do (functional). It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, portability, or other quality attributes, so those labels were not set.

RequirementText: Students should be able to select in their preferences whether notifications are sent to their mobile telephone (via SMS) or e-mail account. They should also be able to manage their notification subscriptions (for example, remove themselves from notifications).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user-facing capabilities (select notification channel and manage subscriptions), which are functional requirements. It does not impose availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: A system will be considered to meet this requirement if it has a single administrative interface rather than individual links for editing each page. Furthermore, this interface must allow administrators to easily change themes and other setting that affect page layout across the entire courseware system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a single administrative interface and ability to change themes/layout system-wide (functional feature) and concerns look & feel (theme/layout) as well as operability/administration (ease of managing settings). No mention of performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Back-up requirements will need to be determined, based on individual components of the system. The system should be backed up with a frequency that ensures system and course data is protected. Since assignments will be submitted via the system, it should be backed up on a nightly basis, with options for weekly, off-site backup when necessary.
AI_Rationale: Specifies backup frequency to protect system and course data (availability) and to enable recovery from failures (fault tolerance). Mentions backup options/management (nightly, weekly, off-site), implying operational/administrative concerns. Does not specify legal, security, usability, portability, scalability, performance, or maintainability explicitly.

RequirementText: The system must have the ability and capacity to restore back-up data within six hours so that the system is never offline for an inordinate period of time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies recovery time for restoring backup data within six hours to avoid prolonged downtime — this is directly about availability and fault tolerance (recovery). No functional behavior, security, performance, or other qualities are explicitly required.

RequirementText: The system should be available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly specifies 24/7 availability, which is an Availability requirement. No mention of fault tolerance, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: This statement provides a general sense of system availability. It is not intended to demand the system maintain reliability, or to require the system to be highly available. It should not exclude maintenance windows, or scheduled downtime. It is only intended to convey the expectation that our customers should have access to the system during off-hours as well as business hours. 99% up-time should be considered sufficient to meet this requirement.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly defines expected system uptime (99% availability) and access during off-hours; this is an availability requirement and does not specify other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users must have easy access to help while interacting with the system. Adequate user documentation should be provided to minimize the number of calls to the Help Desk about problems with the system. Modifications should be reported via the main page to inform actors of unexpected changes. This electronic documentation should be supplemented with phone and on-site support provided by the Office of Information Services.
AI_Rationale: Requires system behavior to provide access to help and to report modifications (functional) and focuses on minimizing user support calls and ease of access to documentation/support (usability). No explicit availability, security, performance, maintainability, or other NFRs mentioned.

RequirementText: System administrators must have access to comprehensive, searchable documentation.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that system administrators must have access—this is an access control/authorization constraint (security). Requiring comprehensive, searchable documentation for administrators implies support for operation and administration (operability) and aids maintenance tasks (maintainability). It does not specify availability/uptime, fault tolerance, performance, portability, legal, UI look-and-feel, scalability, or general usability for end users.

RequirementText: A comprehensive database of maintenance tasks and help files should be compiled to make the courseware system easier to maintain from an IT staff point-of-view. Search results should be displayed based on relevance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement requests compiling a maintenance/help database to make the system easier to maintain (explicitly about maintainability) and mentions IT staff perspective (operability/administration). The search-results relevance requirement describes a system behavior (search feature), so it is treated as a functional requirement. No explicit mentions of availability, security, portability, scalability, fault tolerance, look-and-feel, or usability metrics.

RequirementText: This documentation must cover all procedures necessary for regular maintenance with links to additional information, all common errors, and links or documentation for advanced troubleshooting.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies documentation for regular maintenance, common errors, and troubleshooting—directly addressing maintainability. It also supports operability by aiding administrators/operators in diagnosing and resolving issues.

RequirementText: The system must be maintainable without substantial modification.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies maintainability (ease of maintenance/modification) without substantial modifications, which maps directly to Maintainability. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Due to limited staff in the Office of Information Services, it is important that the system be mostly self-sustaining. This will reduce the number of FTE hours spent maintaining the system and simplify maintenance tasks.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns reducing maintenance effort and simplifying maintenance tasks due to limited staff, which directly maps to maintainability. It also implies ease of operating/administering the system (operability). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: Although any courseware solution may be composed of diverse systems, applications, and processes, the underlying architecture should be transparent to the administrators. The system should be configurable from a single source at a central administrative position, and should provide a central, easy-to-use interface that will allow administrators to configure the user interface and features in a way that reduces page clutter.
AI_Rationale: Specifies central configurability and a central administrative interface (operability, functional). Requires an easy-to-use interface and reduced page clutter (usability, look-and-feel). No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system should support at least 1000 concurrent users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies support for a number of concurrent users, which is a scalability concern. It does not mention performance metrics, availability, security, or functional behavior beyond capacity.

RequirementText: This statement provides a general sense of reliability when the system is under load. It is important that a substantial number of actors be able to access the system at the same time, since a courseware system is important to the courses that employ it. The times when the system will be under the most stress are likely during midterm and finals weeks. Therefore, it must be able to handle at least 1,000 concurrent users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies capacity for concurrent users (ability to handle load/scale to 1,000 simultaneous users), which is a scalability concern. It does not explicitly state performance metrics like latency/throughput or availability targets.

RequirementText: The system must be backed up on a configurable schedule.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must perform backups on a configurable schedule. This is primarily about fault tolerance/recovery (FT). The requirement also implies operability/administration concerns because the backup schedule must be configurable (O). It does not explicitly state availability, security, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system must allow actors in the capacity of course administrator to post grades associated with assignments for a particular actor in the capacity of student. Actors in the role of professor may want to optionally grade assignments online since they are being submitted electronically by actors in the role of student.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior (allow course administrators and professors to post/grade assignments), so it's Functional. It also implies role-based permissions (which users in certain roles may perform grading), so it carries an access control/security aspect. No explicit non-functional constraints like availability, performance, scalability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: A course administrator must be able to grade an assignment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability/action the system must provide (grading an assignment) — a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system must display a search box on every page after an actor has logged in.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must display a search box on every page after login. It does not impose availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: Actors should be able to search from any page. If the actor is hierarchically outside of a particular course, each of his or her courses should be searched and results should be grouped by course. If the actor is hierarchically inside of a course, that course should be searched with an option to search all courses.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies what the system should do (search behavior and result grouping based on actor's hierarchical relation). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: One of the fundamental tasks of the system is to allow actors to upload and manage files on certain pages of the system. These might include assignment submission pages, forum pages, wiki pages, and announcement pages. An actor in the role of course administrator should be able to optionally upload multiple files where he or she finds that such as feature would be usefulâ€”such as on a devoted project page.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (upload and manage files) — functional. It also specifies role-based capability (course administrator), implying access control/authorization concerns -> security.

RequirementText: For this requirement, page refers to any distinct upload point (e.g., an assignment, a wiki page, a forum post, etc.).
AI_Rationale: This sentence is a terminology/definition clarification (defines what 'page' means). It does not specify functional behavior or any non-functional quality such as performance, security, usability, etc., so no NFR labels apply.

RequirementText: The system must allow for multiple file upload to be configured on a per-page basis.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (configurable multiple file upload per page), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Actors in the capacity of course administrator or professor should be able to enable multiple file uploads on a page of his or her choosing. For collaborative projects, it becomes important for actors to be able to upload more than one file to a given page, especially in the case of an assignment submission where the assignment might include multiple parts.
