Such a construct should be offered to the actor during a pageâ€™s creation and editing stages.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (enable multiple file uploads and offer it during page creation/editing), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes like availability, performance, security, or usability are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: The system must be able to capture and organize voice clips that can be used where appropriate.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (capture and organize voice clips) — this describes functional behavior. No explicit quality attributes (availability, performance, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: One of the shortcomings of the current courseware system is that the foreign language department is unable to capture and track voice clipsâ€”recorded by studentsâ€”for oral homework over the course of a studentâ€™s education.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes missing capability to capture and track student-recorded voice clips for oral homework across a student's education — this specifies a functional feature to be added. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system must allow actors to organize their voice clips into a portfolio.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow actors to organize voice clips into a portfolio), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Equal and finite drive space needs to be allotted to each actor in the role of professor or administrator to allow for the storing of voice clips recorded and submitted by all actors in the roles of students. Actors in the role of professor or system administrator should be allowed to partition this space for actors in the roles of students. This can be done one of two ways: 1) the actor can be allowed to preview the voice clip before it is archived and determine whether or not he or she would like that clip to be archived, or 2) a newly created voice clip can be automatically archived. The first option would allow the actor to throw out an audio clip that is deemed to be unsuitable or inappropriate for an assignment without having to take it out of an archive of voice clips. The actor should have the option to have the voice clip be archived after a preview has taken place. The second option would automatically archive a voice clip once submitted but would require that the actor interact with the archived file. Thus, if the actor chooses to delete the file, it would need to be deleted from the archive of voice clips.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: allocation of finite drive space, archiving options, preview/delete workflows (Functional). Also describes administrative capability to partition/assign space, which concerns system operation/administration (Operability). No explicit requirements about availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, usability, legal, fault tolerance, look-and-feel, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Maintaining an archive of voice clips makes it possible for comparisons to be made between clips to determine whether an actor is improving his or her language skills over multiple courses. The actor should be able to optionally attach one of his or her archived items to any page where uploads are permitted.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system functionality: maintaining an archive of voice clips, enabling comparisons, and allowing an actor to optionally attach archived items to pages where uploads are permitted. It describes what the system should do rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: The term archive used above may also be referred to as a portfolio.
AI_Rationale: This sentence is a terminology/definition (clarifying that 'archive' may be called 'portfolio'). It does not specify functional behavior or any non-functional quality (availability, performance, security, portability, etc.), so no NFR labels apply.

RequirementText: The system must allow actors to download their voice clips in a flexible format.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing system capability to allow actors to download voice clips and choose flexible formats. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, performance, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Voice clips should be optionally downloadable in a format such as MPEG Audio (mp3) format, since it is widely supported across different web browsers and operating systems. Voice clips should be downloadable for archival purposes or for the purpose of presenting them to other actors.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a feature: enabling optional downloading of voice clips (functional). It also explicitly references support across different web browsers and operating systems (compatibility/portability), implying the need to provide formats like MP3 that work across platforms. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, etc., requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system must store audio clips in a format conducive to speech.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability: storing audio clips in a specific (speech-friendly) format. This is a functional storage/behavioral requirement; it does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system must be able to capture and manage files where appropriate.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability of the system (capturing and managing files), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system must allow actors to delete recorded clips.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying a capability of the system (allow actors to delete recorded clips). No availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: In addition, the search page described above might allow for the possibility of searching the world wide web using a standard search engine such as Google.
AI_Rationale: This statement describes a feature/behavior of the system (ability to search the web via a standard search engine) — a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Second, a single page should be dedicated specifically to the task of searching the course management system. In addition to the basic search field, this page should allow an actor to filter out certain results (such as forum posts or grades, etc.) and search specific sections (or components) of the course management system. Results should appear in categories (e.g., Assignments, Wiki Pages, Forum Posts, etc.) based on relevance. In this case, relevance is determined by results that having the highest number terms matching the search terms. When the actor clicks a search result link, they should be taken to the page corresponding to the search result.
AI_Rationale: The requirement primarily specifies search functionality (dedicated search page, filtering, categorized results, navigation to result pages) — clearly Functional. It also defines how results are presented (a single page, categorized display), which pertains to look-and-feel, and the inclusion of filters and organized, relevance-based results impacts usability. No explicit statements about performance, security, scalability, availability, portability, maintainability, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: First, it should be present in the form of a search box and a â€œSearchâ€� button on the top or bottom of every page. More information on this topic is given in sub-section 3.4.2 below.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI element (search box and button) and its placement on every page — this is a functional requirement that also concerns look-and-feel/layout. It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: Actors should be able to search for pages at the course level, since most actors will be searching for material in a given course. The search feature should be present in two ways.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (search pages at course level and presence of two search methods). No explicit quality constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Voice clips should be stored in a format optimized for speech since this feature is meant to catalog voice recordings. Recordings should only be converted to MPEG Audio (mp3) format when they are being downloaded; a separate viewer should be provided in a cross-platform language for listening to clips in Moodle.
AI_Rationale: Req specifies functional behaviors: storage in speech-optimized format, conversion to MP3 on download, and providing a viewer — these are functional requirements. It explicitly calls for a cross-platform viewer, which implies portability. No explicit availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, usability, or maintainability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Moodle can be difficult to navigate and requires too many clicks to be efficiently used. Too many steps to complete basic actionsâ€”such as submitting an assignmentâ€”lead to frustration on the part of the actor. A search utility enables actors to find what they are looking for quickly in addition to having a hierarchical approach to finding functions of the course management system. For this requirement, page refers to any distinct page, such as an assignment, a wiki page, or a forum post.
AI_Rationale: The text explicitly calls for a search utility and hierarchical navigation (a functional feature) and focuses on reducing clicks and improving findability and user frustration, which are usability concerns. It does not mention availability, performance, security, legal, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: An actor must be able to search through pages in a course.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (search pages in a course) describing what the system must do — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Actors in the course administrator role may not feel the need to provide web feeds for every page in their course. During the creation and editing of a page, that actor should be able to toggle web feed availability.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: course administrators must be able to toggle web feed availability when creating/editing a page. It does not state quality attributes such as availability, security, usability, performance, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system must allow web feeds to be turned on or off on a per-page basis.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to enable/disable web feeds per page), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, UI look-and-feel, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: If actors are unable to be notified in some way of new content in Moodle, they are unable to efficiently keep track of a courseâ€™s current affairs. For this requirement, page refers to any distinct block (e.g., assignments, wikis, forum threads, etc.).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that actors should be notified of new content (notifications for pages such as assignments, wikis, forums), which describes a system behavior/feature — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system must be able to display web feeds, such as RSS 2.0 feeds, for all pages of the course management system where elements such as forum posts, assignment postings, announcements, wiki alterations and other blocks of information that an actor may view are added. Actors in the role of course administrators should have the ability to determine which of these components have feeds and to whom these feeds should pertain.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system capabilities: displaying RSS/web feeds for various page elements and allowing course administrators to configure which components have feeds and their recipients. These are functional behaviors (features) rather than quality attributes.

RequirementText: Since voice clips should be stored in a portfolio for each actor during his or her existence in the course management system, he or she should be able to examine his or her portfolio to select and delete clips if he or she chooses to. This allows him or her to manage archived voice clips and to create a cohesive portfolio that actors in the role of professor can use to judge improvement over time.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system behaviors: storing voice clips in a portfolio and allowing actors to examine, select, and delete clips—these are functional capabilities. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability criteria, or other non-functional constraints, so no additional NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: The system must be able to use search functionality as a way to navigate Moodle pages instead of using hierarchical links.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional feature (search-based navigation) and affects user interface/navigation style, impacting usability and look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The external users need to be able to click on an area and obtain data for the surrounding area, such as lapsed quantities, historical use, and adjacent permits. Need to support decision-making on the applicant s part, especially when their request does not meet the MFL requirements.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that external users must be able to click an area and obtain data (functional behavior: retrieval of map/area data). It also implies a user-facing interaction ('click') and support for decision-making, which relates to usability. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or legal/look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Make the following property appraiser data available so you can improve the ability to project service area populations in inter-Census years in several ways: Provide a more discreet and up-to-date count of housing units in a utility service area, Help determine when a DRI is completed, Match commercial properties by the connection data provided by utilities, Use lot sizes, where available, to determine its role in household water use compared to other variables in research projects, There may be other data of use as well (wells, pools, etc).
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly asks to make specific property appraiser data available and lists uses for that data (projecting populations, matching properties, using lot sizes). This describes a functional capability (providing data). It does not specify availability/uptime, fault tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, usability, or legal/maintenance concerns.

RequirementText: Update interval protocols for updating different data types.
AI_Rationale: Specifies protocols and intervals for updating data types—this defines system behavior (functional). Because it concerns timing/frequency of updates, it implies a performance/quality constraint related to update latency/throughput, so Performance is also marked.

RequirementText: Populate missing data in the database, especially permits and pumpage reports.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an action the system shall perform (populate missing data in the database), which is functional in nature. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A web application is preferred. If ArcMap, has to be able to run in Citrix ArcView.
AI_Rationale: Specifies preferred deployment as a web application and requires compatibility with Citrix ArcView if using ArcMap—these are deployment/environment constraints (operability and portability). No performance, security, or other qualities stated.

RequirementText: The tools the system will use to access the data need to be better than what is available now.
AI_Rationale: The requirement refers to the tools the system will use to access data needing to be improved relative to current solutions. This primarily concerns the selection and operability/management of system components (integration, tooling). No explicit mention of performance, security, usability, maintainability, or other quality attributes is made, so only Operability is marked.

RequirementText: The data has to be accurate.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a data quality constraint (accuracy), which most directly maps to data integrity/security concerns. It does not describe specific functionality, performance, availability, usability, or other non-functional categories, so only Security (integrity) is marked.

RequirementText: Data to support requirements must exist in the database, and be readily available.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that required data must exist in the database (functional) and be readily available (availability requirement). No explicit security, performance, scalability, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: Get compilable versions of code stored in SourceSafe.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to retrieve compilable versions of code from SourceSafe — this describes a functional action. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, maintainability, etc.) are stated, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: Be consistent in naming and terminology conventions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies consistency of naming and terminology—a presentation/interaction quality affecting look-and-feel and usability. Does not address functional behavior, legal, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The results from queries need to be consistent and reliable over time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement states that query results must be consistent and reliable over time, which expresses reliability/availability concerns and implies resilience to faults; it does not specify security, performance, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: Need to establish response rates if it will be on a web page.
AI_Rationale: The requirement refers to 'establish response rates' for a web page, which concerns performance (response time/throughput). It does not mention availability, scalability, security, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: Create a consistent grid to analyze data through time, including population, water use, etc).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies creating a (UI) grid feature for analyzing time-series data — this is a functional capability (F) and refers to consistency/visual layout of the grid, implying look-and-feel concerns (LF). It does not explicitly state performance, security, availability, scalability, or usability metrics.

RequirementText: Provide the ability to obtain data necessary to determine and access the population estimates for an area or on a permit-by-permit basis. Needs to accommodate how it is determined now and how it will be determined under the SWUCA 2 rules. This would include: Seasonal residential report based on AHCA hospital report (determine seasonal populations).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability to obtain data and generate population estimates and reports (functional). It also explicitly references accommodating determinations under 'SWUCA 2 rules', implying regulatory/standards compliance concerns, so Legal is applicable. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, scalability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Report compliance on a permit (not wells). Crop reports on permits (not wells) (I think this was a requirement to report this data some how at a well level).
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes generating/reporting compliance and crop reports tied to permits (reporting functionality). No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are specified, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Capture crop report data and link it with the corresponding use quantities, so you can observe changing crop patterns, see where land has shifted out of crops, and track water use per planted acre per crop to see patterns in water use by geography. The accumulation (or depletion) of credits by geographic area could point out potential problems in permitting in specific geographic areas. It may point to soil type or local cultural practice problems. Link to requirement JY4/SR7, the report of water credits used and earned.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies data capture, linking, and reporting capabilities (observing crop patterns, linking water use and credits) which are functional behaviors. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns like availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Need tool to be able to estimate water use (now being done in SAS). To do this estimate, you need to be able to query the water use data with various variables, such as time period, use types, withdrawal type (groundwater or surfacewater), and geographic areas. Once the initial query is complete, you need to be able to refine the resulting data set. An example is when you select active permits in a time period. If a permit expired inside of the time period, the refine tool would help determine if that permit would or would not be a part of the result set, perhaps by determining at what point in the time line it expired.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes functional capabilities: querying water use data by variables, refining result sets, and handling temporal conditions for permits. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel constraints, nor explicitly state usability requirements beyond functional refinement behavior.

RequirementText: Use GIS layers to analyze how salt-water intrusion is affecting water quality, etc. Layer would need to be updated either quarterly or annually.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functionality: using GIS layers to analyze salt-water intrusion (functional). Also mandates update frequency for GIS layers (quarterly or annually), which is a maintenance/operation scheduling concern—matches Maintainability as in examples.

RequirementText: Ability to provide external customers a means to query and view application information and locations by entering spatial, temporal, or data specific information. Current applications satisfying the criteria would be viewed immediately; future applications would be e-mailed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the capability to allow external customers to query and view application information and the workflow for current vs. future results; this is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, performance, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Compare the population reported to the Bureau of Economic and Business Research (BEBR) report.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies an action the system must perform (compare reported population to BEBR report), which is a functional behavior. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, legal, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Calculate water quality trends by geographic area.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying that the system shall calculate/analyze water quality trends filtered by geographic area. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: Link between Water Use Permits (WUP), Environmental Resource Permits (ERP), and Well Construction Permits. One use would be as a means of notifying appropriate District staff when pertinent land use changes. (i.e. want to know if an ERP is issued or applied for a subdivision where permit has been issued for a farm.)
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes system functionality: linking permit records and notifying district staff of related land-use permit events. No explicit non-functional concerns (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The ability to access crop report information spatially and temporally.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (access crop report information with spatial and temporal aspects), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: Provide access to population data in system that are aggregated to appropriate geographic areas (services areas, counties, etc.).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — providing access to population data aggregated by geographic areas. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Ability to add estimated quantities for unmetered permits, which is found in the Water Estimates Database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/feature — the ability to add estimated quantities for unmetered permits (data entry/functionality), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: If toolbars are written, must be in .dll format.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an implementation/platform packaging requirement (.dll format) which constrains compatibility/portability of toolbars across environments; does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Access well construction data for domestic wells using locational data, such as GPS or section, township, and range.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—accessing well construction data via locational inputs (GPS or section/township/range). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Consider the ease of deployment of application.
AI_Rationale: The requirement focuses on ease of deployment, which pertains to operability/administration (deployment and operational concerns). It does not explicitly mention performance, portability, maintainability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Ability to customize queries.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (customizing queries), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state any quality constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.), so no non-functional labels are set.

RequirementText: Need technical documentation for maintainability.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly requests technical documentation to support maintainability, which directly maps to the Maintainability (MN) label. It does not specify availability, operability, performance, security, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: Use system to publish a chart or graph that compares the MFL to a running average of AFL s. This should reflect how the AFL s are moving along the MFL line and indicate how different resources impact the MFL. The resources to include are pumpage, new projects, and rainfall. It will probably be run on a monthly basis.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system function to publish a chart comparing MFL and AFL running averages and include specific resources; this is clearly functional. The note that it will probably be run on a monthly basis implies an operational/scheduling concern (operate/run periodically), so Operability is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, legal, portability, scalability, maintainability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Reasonable refresh rates.
AI_Rationale: This is a non-functional constraint on update/refresh frequency (timing/latency), which is a performance requirement. No explicit mention of functionality, availability, fault tolerance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Application must fit into statutory time frames for evaluating permitting applications, so there must be a quick turn-around time.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly references statutory time frames (legal/regulatory compliance) and demands a quick turn-around time, which is a performance-related constraint. It does not address availability, fault tolerance, scalability, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Has to manage the metadata, and metadata has to be FGDC compliant.
AI_Rationale: The requirement includes a functional obligation to manage metadata (functional). Requiring FGDC compliance is a standards/regulatory compliance constraint, mapped to Legal (compliance) rather than other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Need training material for in-house training. TW35 Need to be able to save (or download) the results of queries into an outside system.
AI_Rationale: The first sentence requests training material (implies learnability/usability requirement). The second sentence specifies the ability to save/download query results to an external system, which is a functional capability. No explicit non-functional qualities like security, performance, scalability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: Need on-line help and training.
AI_Rationale: Specifies need for on-line help and training for users, which is a usability/user experience requirement (improves learnability and ease of use). No explicit functional, security, performance, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: System has to have the flexibility to handle different scenarios, or "what-if" questions, or 1-10,2-10, and 5-10 drought events.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability to handle different scenarios and specific 'what-if' drought event configurations, which describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not explicitly state performance, scalability, availability, security, or other quality attributes, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: Clear hours of availability need to be established.
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly refers to establishing hours of availability, which is an availability-related requirement. It does not specify fault tolerance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Have a decision tree for the help desk personnel that will receive questions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies providing a decision tree for help desk personnel — this describes a system feature (functional). It also implies improved usability/support for help desk users in handling questions, so Usability is applicable. No explicit statements about availability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: Could have wizards to help users perform tasks.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies providing wizards as a feature (functional capability) to help users perform tasks and primarily addresses usability/user assistance. It does not imply availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Clear documentation that lends to the defensibility of system for when permits are denied or modified.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies documentation to support defensibility when permits are denied or modified, which is primarily a legal/compliance concern. It does not explicitly state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The data has to be available in real time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies real-time availability of data, which is a performance (latency) requirement and implies scalability to support timely responses; does not explicitly state availability metrics or other concerns.

RequirementText: Need to receive job-specific training and support.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies providing job-specific training and support, which affects system operability/administration and end-user usability. It does not specify security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The same datasets need to be used by all departments or sections of the District.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that all departments must use the same datasets—a constraint about system deployment/operation and cross-environment compatibility. This implies operability (manageability/administration of shared data) and portability/compatibility across departments, but does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A process needs to be established so corrections to the source data sets can be initiated, i.e. when errors are discovered when running models.
AI_Rationale: The requirement requests establishment of a process for initiating corrections to source data sets when errors are found—this describes operational procedures/administration (operability) and relates to ease of maintaining/correcting data (maintainability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: System has to be user-friendly.
AI_Rationale: Statement 'System has to be user-friendly' explicitly addresses usability/UX. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or explicit look-and-feel details, so only Usability is marked.

RequirementText: Develop and make readily accessible metadata for the data (i.e. need to know the time frames when the data is considered to be good)
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies creating and exposing metadata (a system behavior/function), so Functional applies. It also emphasizes that the metadata must be 'readily accessible' (usability/accessibility concern), so Usability applies. No explicit mention of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, fault tolerance, legal, or look-and-feel requirements.

RequirementText: Have consistent way to report on permit status and withdrawal status.
AI_Rationale: Specifies consistency in how status is reported—a presentation/UI quality requirement (look and feel). Does not describe functionality, usability metrics, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The value you enter should be the actual data value, not any code number associated with it.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying input validation/business rule (enter actual data value, not a code). It also relates to usability as it constrains what the user must enter and affects the user input experience.

RequirementText: Hire a metadata librarian to manage data associated with the Water Use Tracking project.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies hiring a personnel resource to manage project data—an operational/administrative staffing requirement. It implies operability (O) because it concerns managing and administering the system's data. It also relates to maintainability (MN) since a metadata librarian's role supports ongoing data maintenance and quality. It does not state functional behavior of the system nor specify availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Support consistency in decision-making among various users.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a capability to support consistent decision-making across users, which implies a functional feature (mechanism/policy/workflow) and also concerns usability (helping users make consistent decisions, alignment, guidance). It does not specify availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: Replicate the DB2 data daily in Oracle.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system action (daily replication of DB2 data into Oracle) — a functional requirement. It also implies integration/operational concern (database interoperability and scheduled data movement), so Operability is set. No explicit non-functional constraints like availability, security, scalability, portability, or maintainability are mentioned.

RequirementText: Need quick access to currently published information to base decisions on.
AI_Rationale: The requirement emphasizes quick access and up-to-date published information, which implies performance (low latency/timeliness) and usability (ease of accessing information). It does not explicitly state availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Follow District programming standards.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates compliance with an organizational coding standard. It is primarily a compliance/legal constraint (L) and implies practices that improve maintainability (MN). It also affects development/operational practices (O). It does not specify functional behavior or other specific quality attributes.

RequirementText: System should be written in map.net â€“ either VB or C#.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the implementation platform/language (.NET using VB or C#), which is an implementation/portability constraint. It does not describe functional behavior, performance, security, availability, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: Do not join features based on the shape column.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a data-processing behavior constraint (an action the system must not perform) — a functional requirement about joins; no non-functional aspects are implied.

RequirementText: Follow District change management standards.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates adherence to 'District change management standards', which is a compliance/standards constraint—mapped to Legal. It does not explicitly state functional behavior or other quality attributes (availability, security, maintainability, operability), so those are not marked.

RequirementText: Can extend the current District architecture, i.e. Oracle Spatial, if needed.
AI_Rationale: The statement requires the system be extendable to the current District architecture (Oracle Spatial). This implies extensibility/maintainability (MN) and compatibility/ability to integrate with an existing platform (PO). It does not state availability, security, performance, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: Minimum lake levels - The proposed MFL is achieved when the long-term P50 is at or above the MFL and the long-term P10 is at or above the High Minimum Lake Level for five consecutive years. Once in compliance, MFL is not met when the long-term P50 is below the MFL for two or more consecutive years or the long-term P10 is below the High Minimum Lake Levels for two or more consecutive years.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies precise conditions and rules (P50/P10 thresholds over consecutive years) for determining compliance with Minimum Lake Levels — this defines system behavior (functional). It also encodes regulatory/compliance criteria (legal/standards) for MFL attainment, so Legal applies. No explicit non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: Need to know what aquifer is being pumped from. There are permitting constraints in ETB MIA that no additional water from the Floridan Aquifer can be pumped, but it is allowed from Intermediate aquifer.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must know which aquifer is being pumped from and enforce permitting constraints (disallow Floridan, allow Intermediate). This describes required functionality and regulatory/legal compliance.

RequirementText: Minimum aquifer level - The saltwater intrusion MFL is met when the moving 10-year AFL is at or above the MFL for five consecutive years. The MFL is not met when the 10-year moving AFL in the reference wells is below the MFL for two consecutive years.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior/criterion for determining when the minimum aquifer level (MFL) is met or not based on moving 10-year AFL measurements over consecutive years — this is a functional requirement (decision logic). No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Track ownership of wells or permits over the life of the withdrawal point so the relocated quantities can be traced from owner to owner. Quantities that are relocated will have certain restrictions placed on them, as well as any quantities that remain on the original permit. For permits that have multiple withdrawal points, we need the ability to track ownership of specific withdrawal points over time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: tracking ownership of wells/permits and tracing relocated quantities over time, including per-withdrawal-point ownership tracking and restrictions. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Report the Reservation from use amounts allocated to certain participants.
AI_Rationale: This sentence describes a reporting function: generating/reporting reservation usage amounts allocated to participants. It specifies a functional behavior (produce a report). It does not state quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Be able to determine the availability of alternative use supplies, such as reclaimed water and desalination.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide—determining the availability of alternative supplies (reclaimed water, desalination)—which is a functional behavior. It does not refer to system uptime, performance, security, legal compliance, UI, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Supply the Regulatory requirements of MFL data: What water levels are in relationship to MFL so you know who has to mitigate or how much excess flow there is, Need the historic and current levels so applicant knows how much to mitigate or what is available.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must supply regulatory MFL-related data (current and historical water levels and their relation to MFL to determine mitigation/excess flow). This describes functional behavior (data provision and mapping). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional concerns, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Report on competing applications (including ones that are in modification or expiring).
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a reporting capability (report on competing applications including those being modified or expiring). It does not specify non-functional qualities like performance, availability, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Report compliance on a permit (not wells). Crop reports on permits (not wells).
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional features: generate/report compliance and crop reports for permits (explicitly about functionality). No non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: Should allow comparison to adjacent districts GIS layers to permit GIS layer to access adjacent data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability: allowing comparison/access of GIS layers (functional behavior). Does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Report on the permit duration (To track expiration dates for those looking for someone to compete with).
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional requirement to generate a report on permit duration/expiration dates to support users seeking competitors. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Report on how much water was made available through the District s water resource development projects. Elements of the report should be: Source of benefit (aquifer or surface water), The locations of the alternative sources, What permits are using the quantities generated by the projects, and what project they are getting the water from.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a report and the data elements it must contain (sources, locations, permits, originating project), which defines functional behavior (information/reporting). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: For mitigation of MFL impacts, report on the improvement percentage amount, where it was located, the cost, how the decrease was obtained and what impacts it had.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the system must report (fields and content of a mitigation report), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Report on any water use amounts sold or given from one permit to another permit, especially reclaimed water (reclaimed water can be taken away, depending on the contract. It is kind-of-like â€œleasingâ€� the water, but can be taken away).
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a capability the system must provide: reporting water amounts sold or transferred between permits (including reclaimed water transfers). While it references contractual/legal context, it does not impose legal/compliance constraints or non-functional qualities like performance, security, or usability, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Create layer that includes "cones of depression" for the MFL information, which will indicate the area of influence to an MFL.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a feature to create a map/visual layer that displays 'cones of depression' for MFL information — a functional behavior (display/visualization). It does not explicitly state quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, or look-and-feel beyond the functional capability.

RequirementText: Identify when a standby permit is reactivated due to the loss of alternative quantities.
AI_Rationale: Describes a behavior the system must perform — detecting/identifying reactivation of a standby permit when alternative quantities are lost. No explicit non-functional quality (availability, security, scalability, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: Mark those permits that have a land use change so the quantities can be relocated to the public supply utility.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional behavior (marking permits with land use change to enable relocation of quantities to a public supply utility). It specifies what the system should do, not non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Report on the permits that have been relocated by a permit holder.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement requesting a report about permits relocated by a permit holder. It specifies what the system should provide (a report). No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Heat map for water quality. Add the District WUPnet sentinel wells on this map - those are the District wells that have been in existence the longest time and we have the best data with. So if we bring them up in an area we know we have reliable data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional feature: display a water-quality heat map and include District WUPnet sentinel wells on the map. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: Create heat map indicating who was over-pumping, who was not over-pumping, or who was using their water credits.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: creating a heat map that indicates users' over-pumping status or use of water credits. No non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: View the spatial impact of a person s application with other active applications on-line so the applicant or evaluator has a visual of who else is available to compete for quantities with. Also include application and permit data on-line, either with scanned documents or access to database. The historical data should also be available, but viewing restrictions for certain legal documents has to be followed. Be able to query by geographic area or permit number.
AI_Rationale: Requirement primarily specifies functionality (visualize spatial impact, include application/permit data, historical data, query capabilities). It explicitly requires viewing restrictions for certain legal documents (legal/compliance) and access controls (security). The need for a visual representation implies UI/look-and-feel concerns. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability metrics.

RequirementText: Conservation (defined as a beneficial reduction of water use resulting in: modification of water use practices, reduction of unaccounted-for losses, or installation and maintenance of low volume water use systems, processes, fixtures, or devices.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a conservation objective and actions (modifying practices, reducing losses, installing/maintaining low-volume water systems). It does not specify software functional behavior, availability, fault tolerance, legal/compliance, UI look-and-feel, software maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, security, or usability requirements. Therefore no PROMISE NFR labels apply.

RequirementText: Track and measure alternative source projects: Surface water or stormwater projects, Reclaimed water (reuse water), Augmented surface water (reservoirs, harvesting of high flows (floodwaters), ASR (Aquifer storage recovery), Desalination.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functionality: tracking and measuring alternative source projects (types listed). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Track and report on the history of permitted data, such as use type, irrigated acres, and pumpage (one use would be to know whether expired permits have had quantities reallocated).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability to track and report history of permitted data (a functional behavior). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns, so only Functional is set to true.

RequirementText: Report on the history of irrigation water conserving credits, including the balance, how much earned, and how much used, and drought quantities. Know who uses them and who has accumulated them, and be able to report on an individual basis, by a geographic area, or aggregate the data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies reporting capabilities (history, balances, earned/used, drought quantities, and reporting by individual, geographic area, or aggregate), which are functional behaviors. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: Track the movement of lapsed quantities in an area, including: Which permit and well obtained the lapsed quantities, Where the lapsed quantities are located, Why the quantities are lapsed (i.e. expired, cancelled, retired), What MFL zone the lapsed quantities are in.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional behavior: tracking/mapping lapsed quantities and associated attributes (which permit/well, location, reason, MFL zone). It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal compliance, or UI/look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: Track the relocation of active water use within the SWUCA.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (tracking relocation of active water use within the SWUCA), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Minimum flows on the upper Peace River - The MFL is met when the MFL s are at or above the established MFL for three consecutive years. Once the MFL has been considered met, if it is followed by two years where the MFL is not met within a rolling ten-year period, then the AFL shall be considered below the MFL. A determination of whether AFL s are meeting the established MFL is made at each one of the established minimums (Bartow, Ft. Meade and Zolfo Springs).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies regulatory/compliance criteria for minimum flows (how compliance is determined over time and at specific monitoring locations), so it is primarily a legal/regulatory requirement. It also implies operational procedures for monitoring and determining compliance at defined sites (operability). It does not specify software functionality, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Track the impact that water use has to the set MFL levels. In particular, compare the affects of the new or modified use to the actual flow and level of the water body or aquifer to make sure the actual level will not go below the MFL level. Types of things to check are: New applications, renewals, or modifications, Relocated uses, Change of use type, Lapsed quantities, Retired permits (some are lapsed - some are not).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system function: tracking and comparing proposed/modified water uses against Minimum Flow Level (MFL) thresholds and checking specific types of permit actions. It describes behavior, not a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: Have a heat map that shows permit information for specific time periods. You should be able to input a geographic area (whether by county, department, or entire District area), select the time period(s) you want, and select one of two views: permits issued or active permits in that time period, and produce the map show the locations. On a high-level view, you need to be able to see the locations with the predominate use type reflected on the map itself, and include a graph or chart showing the total number of permits, predominate use shown by %, and the time period involved. If you click on it, bring up the permit details, such as name, permit number, issue date, expire date, use type, wuca, and average quantities.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (map, filters, views, clickable details, charts) and includes UI presentation requirements (high-level view, predominant use displayed, graph/chart), implying Look & Feel. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: Be able to look at permitted quantities, actual quantities (pumpage), and the resources it uses (Water Management DB)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability to view specific data (permitted quantities, actual pumpage, and resource usage) from the Water Management DB — a functional need. It also implies interfacing/operating with the database to access those views, so operability is relevant. No explicit constraints about availability, security, portability, performance, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: Ability for public utilities and internal staff to find existing permits in or near their service area so they can spatially see what water is available, or may become available, when they plan for their future growth and water resources. They will need to view the use type (interested mainly in agricultural and mining), owned acres, and the current permittee s contact information.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies what the system must do: allow public utilities/internal staff to find permits spatially and view associated attributes (use type, acres, permittee contact). This is a clear functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Need a protocol to assess how the actual flow and levels (AFL) compare to the established minimum flows and levels (MFL), including general trending information and whether waterbody-specific criteria are being met. There are 3 major provisions to track:
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability/protocol to assess and report on actual flows vs minimum flows, trending, and criteria compliance — this describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not mention availability, performance, security, maintainability, usability, scalability, portability, legal, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: Obtain report of those out of compliance of permit conditions by over-pumping their allowable quantities. Show how much over pumping is done, and have option to select by time period or by area. Need to break down to a permit-by-permit basis, but also show the whole thing on a map.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies specific system behaviors: generating a report of permits out of compliance, calculating over-pumping amounts, filtering by time period or area, breaking down by permit, and displaying results on a map — all are functional requirements. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetic, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Track permittees not submitting conditional/pumpage reports, and generate a map showing their locations.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behaviors: tracking permittees who fail to submit reports and generating a map of their locations. This is functional requirement; no explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Track pumpage oddities. Two examples are: A. Permittees that have consistent pumpage readings even when some of the data is missing. Use this information to predict whether they are in compliance in spite of the missing data. B. Permittees that enter zero on their pumpage reports.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional behavior: track anomalous pumpage patterns and predict compliance despite missing or zero data. It does not prescribe availability, fault-tolerance mechanisms, security, legal constraints, UI look-and-feel, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Identify what lakes are stressed, when they became stressed, and if/when they came off stressed list.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a data retrieval/identification capability (which lakes are stressed, timestamps for when stressed and when removed) — this describes functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Create layer that shows the Developments of Regional Impacts (DRI) and their status. This layer will be plugged into the new model for population projections and water supply demand projections.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability: create a layer that displays Developments of Regional Impacts and their status and integrate it into projection models. It does not state non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.), so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Track aquifer level changes, lake level changes, rainfall level changes, and stream flow changes by area over time (i.e. monthly).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functionality: tracking various environmental metrics by area over time (monthly). It does not state non-functional constraints such as performance, availability, security, scalability, or usability.

RequirementText: Support extraction or reporting of data for ad-hoc geographic areas by using spatial queries such as graphics or polygon buffering. The ability to aggregate the data must be there and any type of polygon should be able to be used.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability: support extraction/reporting for ad-hoc geographic areas using spatial queries and polygon aggregation. It describes what the system should do rather than availability, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Know how much water has been permitted and how much has been used based on land use over time.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must provide information/reports on permitted water and used water by land use over time. It does not state non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: Identify different types of water use, such as groundwater, surface water, and re-use.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system should identify different types of water use (groundwater, surface water, re-use). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Show the intensity of water use in a geographic area on a color-coded map.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying water-use intensity on a map) — functional. It also mandates color-coding (visual presentation), which is a look-and-feel/UI requirement. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Automate some of the requests that Jim Whalen receives. The majority of request are related to permitted and pumpage quantities, both at the permit level and well level. They are usually sorted temporally or geographically.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies automating requests and handling sorting by time/geography, which describes a functional capability the system must provide. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: Generate monthly reports for Board Packet that shows the difference in quantities permitted every month for specified geographic areas (i.e., counties, MIA, etc.).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function—generating monthly Board Packet reports showing monthly quantity differences for specified geographic areas. No quality attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: Select water use based on predominant use, use types, and regions they fall in. The predominant use would be agricultural, industrial, mining & dewatering, public supply, and recreational. Each predominate use is further broken down into more detailed categories, such as melons or citrus for the agricultural predominate use. This needs historical data for trend analysis.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (selecting/categorizing water use, breakdowns, and requiring historical data for trend analysis). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Establish relationships between inputs (i.e. rainfall) and pumpage data. (Note: In response to one of Kurt s comments regarding the amount of pumping in areas in relationship to amount of rainfall and irrigation system efficiency.)
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system function: establish/analyze relationships between inputs (rainfall) and pumpage data (including irrigation efficiency). No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Provide the ability for applicants or District staff to compare the percentage a permit is over-pumping, based on use type, against the regional average for the same use type. The region would be the area that fell within the buffer distance entered, and the time of interest would also be entered.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability to compare permit over-pumping percentages against regional averages with user-input parameters (buffer distance and time), which describes functional behavior/feature rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: Analyze permits using a soils type GIS layer. Have a second soils layer based on the soil types indicated on the permittees compliance to conditions.
AI_Rationale: Describes system behavior: analyzing permits with a soils-type GIS layer and creating a second soils layer based on permittees' compliance—this specifies functionality rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Identify when the District or another governmental agency purchases land, a link should be available to show if there is a permit on that area so it can be retired.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: when land is purchased, the system should provide a link to show permit status so it can be retired. This is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Select water use data temporally or with geographic overlays, which can be from another layer or graphics on the page. Also be able to place it in an Excel spreadsheet.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes functional capabilities: selecting water use data by time or geographic overlays and exporting/placing it into an Excel spreadsheet. No explicit quality constraints (performance, availability, security, UI look-and-feel, operability) are stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Ability to pull a well package that provides a view of water use at a particular time that is then plugged into models used to generate water use amounts. The data would include wells, land elevation, aquifer, and total and cased depths.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to pull a well package and provide a view of water use data (wells, elevation, aquifer, depths) to feed models — this describes a functional data-retrieval/processing feature. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The ability to associate permitted quantities, pumpage quantities, and use code data at the well level.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (ability to associate specific data types at the well level), which describes functional behavior/feature. It does not state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Need to know how water use changes when land use changes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide — to determine or report how water use changes in response to land use changes. It describes functionality (analysis/reporting), not non-functional concerns such as performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Need historical data for Water Use Permits including their spatial representations (polygons)
AI_Rationale: Specifies storing historical data (including spatial polygons), which implies data retention/maintenance and use of a database/back-end capability for operation/administration rather than a functional feature or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Must be able to track trends in land use and water use changes. These include several means by which a proposed new withdrawal that impacts an MFL waterbody can achieve a "Net Benefit," including the provisions for relocated, lapsed, and water withdrawal credits
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system capability: tracking trends in land and water use changes and representing mechanisms for achieving a 'Net Benefit' (relocated, lapsed, withdrawal credits). This describes functional behavior (what the system should do), with no explicit non-functional qualities mentioned.

RequirementText: Ability to track water use over time and negotiate reasonable new water use based on water use pumpage trends.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system capabilities: tracking water use over time and negotiating new water use based on trends—these are functional behaviors. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Track by withdrawal source â€“ what aquifer or USGS water body are general and Individual permits pumping from.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the system must provide—tracking permits by withdrawal source (aquifer or USGS water body). This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: Have map be able to show quantity of pumpage. Hover over or click a point in the map and see the average rolling 12, peak month, and max month compared to the pumpage of the well. Also get the cumulative quantities for an area you enter manually.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (map display and interactive data retrieval) and includes UI interaction details (hover/click and presentation of specific metrics), which imply usability and look-and-feel concerns. No indications of performance, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: Track changes in land use and how it affects water availability.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior/feature—tracking land use changes and their impact on water availability—so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Submit a CAISO market schedule for any test energy.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional action the system must perform (submitting a CAISO market schedule for test energy). No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Black Start units may be tested and/or assessed for the ability to Complete such number of successive starts within such period of time as may be specified in the Black Start section of the unitâ€™s RMR or Interim Black Start contract. Its ability to produce the range of reactive power resources required by its voltage support section of the unitâ€™s RMR or Interim Black Start contract.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies capabilities of Black Start units (ability to complete a number of successive starts and produce required reactive power) — a functional behavior (F). The time-bound 'within such period of time' implies performance/temporal constraints (PE). The context of Black Start capability pertains to resilience/recovery from outages, implying fault-tolerance/resilience requirements (FT). Other non-functional categories (security, portability, etc.) are not explicitly indicated.

RequirementText: Black Start units may be tested and/or assessed for the ability to selfprovide start-up power for the period of time it takes to complete the startup process at the generating station and to switch to the applicable transmission path and synchronize to the grid.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability to test/assess Black Start units (functional). It concerns the units' ability to provide start-up power for the required period — a reliability/availability concern and a resilience/fault‑tolerance characteristic (ability to recover from blackout and synchronize to grid). No explicit performance, security, scalability, usability, portability, maintainability, legal or UI requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The CAISO annually requests Black Start tests from at least one third of all RMR and Interim Black Start units.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an annual procedural mandate to request Black Start tests for a fraction of units (an operational action), so it implies a functional/operational requirement. It also reflects a regulatory/standards constraint from CAISO, so classified as Legal. Other quality categories (performance, security, etc.) are not implied.

RequirementText: The CAISO shall have the sole right to determine when the operation of Black Start Generating Unit is required to respond to conditions on the CAISO Controlled Grid.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies that CAISO has the sole right to determine when a Black Start Generating Unit must operate—this prescribes a required system/organizational behavior (functional). The phrase 'sole right' indicates an authoritative/legal allocation of decision-making power, so it also implies a legal/policy constraint. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The CAISO shall from time to time undertake performance tests, with or without prior notification.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that CAISO will perform performance tests periodically (with or without notice). It describes an operational/administrative activity (operability) and relates to system maintenance and verification practices (maintainability). It does not specify performance metrics, availability, security, scalability, or UI concerns, so those labels were not set.

RequirementText: The minimum run time duration (the generation time after being synchronized to the grid) of a Black Start test is 10 minutes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a timing constraint (minimum run time duration of 10 minutes) which is a performance-related requirement (timing/temporal metric). It does not state availability, fault tolerance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: All Black Start Generating Units must satisfy technical requirements specified by the CAISO.
AI_Rationale: This statement requires compliance with technical requirements specified by CAISO (a regulatory/standards body). It is a legal/regulatory compliance constraint rather than a functional feature or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: The Black Start Test should include key operating aids used in Black Starts such as telephone communications and SCADA, if applicable.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the Black Start Test should include (telephone communications, SCADA) — a functional requirement describing behavior/content of the test. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like availability, fault tolerance, security, operability, etc.

RequirementText: The Black Start unit must be capable of starting and energizing the applicable transmission path without assistance from the electrical system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the Black Start unit must have (functional). It requires operation autonomously when the electrical system is unavailable, implying fault-tolerance/resilience to system failure, but does not mention availability metrics, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The following start-up/synchronizing time limits shall apply to the Black Start testing units: Hydroelectric generating units or combustion gas turbines - within 30 minutes of the initiation of the Black Start process, Industrial gas turbines - within 60 minutes of the initiation of the Black Start process, Hot, steam-driven turbines, within 2.5 hours of the initiation of the Black Start process. If the certified Black Start facility is in another reliability coordinator area or is comprised of an unspecified technology then specific start time limits are negotiated. These times include ICU start-up, normal start-up of the unit, plus switching time for the actual synchronizing of the unit.
AI_Rationale: Specifies explicit time limits for start-up/synchronization of generating units after a Black Start—this is a recovery/resilience requirement (fault tolerance) and a timing/performance constraint. It does not specify functional behavior, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Adequate transmission capacity shall be available to connect the Black Start facility to the source providing station services to other specified generating stations.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that adequate transmission capacity must be available (availability) and implies a bandwidth/throughput requirement (performance). It does not state fault recovery, portability, security, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: The Black Start unit must be equipped with governors that are capable of operating in an isochronous mode.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required capability/behavior of the Black Start unit (governors must operate in isochronous mode), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The Black Start unit must have the ability to maintain voltage within emergency voltage limits over a range of loading from no external load to full external load in accordance with NERC reliability standards.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required capability of the Black Start unit to maintain voltage limits (functional). References NERC reliability standards (legal/compliance). Requirement demands resilience across loading conditions (fault tolerance) and a performance constraint on voltage maintenance (performance). Other non-implied qualities not set.

RequirementText: Testing records shall include the dates of the tests, the duration of the tests, and an indication of whether the tests met the requirements of this Black Start Testing section.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the testing records must contain (dates, duration, pass/fail indication) — a clear functional requirement about record contents. No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The owner or operator of any Voluntary Black Start unit that desires a Black Start generating unit status with the CAISO Balancing Authority shall: Demonstrate at least every five years, through simulation or testing, that the unit can perform its intended functions as required by the WECC BCP (if any) and of this testing section. Submit documentation of the test results and analysis to the CAISO, WECC, or NERC upon any request. Submit any past reports for Black Start tests with the CAISO and WECC. o Those Participants who do not currently test their Black Start capability, will be required to test their Black Start capability. Within 24 hours of conducting a Black Start test, all Participants will notify the CAISO RT Dispatcher by phone indicating the success or failure of the test. Within 14 days of performing a Black Start test, all Participants will file a letter with the CAISO regarding the success or failure of the test.
AI_Rationale: The requirement prescribes periodic demonstration/testing of Black Start capability, notifications, and submission of test results to CAISO/WECC/NERC. This is about ensuring system availability and resilience (A, FT) and defines operational procedures and reporting (O). It is also regulatory/compliance-driven (L). It does not specify UI, performance, portability, security, usability, or maintainability concerns explicitly, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: There is procedure to perform short-term negotiation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that a procedure exists to perform short-term negotiation, which describes a system capability/behavior (functional). No explicit quality attributes like performance, security, or availability are mentioned.

RequirementText: Negotiation is established between selected CDN peers.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a behavior: establishing negotiation between selected CDN peers — this describes a functional interaction/feature. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.
