RequirementText: Malicious requests are identified and acted upon.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes detection and handling of malicious requests, which is a security control (threat detection/mitigation). It does not specify availability, performance, UI, portability, scalability, maintainability, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: Functional policies are identified and deployed.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies an action the system/process must perform (identify and deploy functional policies), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, maintainability, operability, etc.

RequirementText: Effective content delivery is ensured through SLA satisfaction.
AI_Rationale: Statement refers to meeting SLAs to ensure effective content delivery, which implies availability/reliability and performance (timeliness/throughput). It does not specify functional behavior, security, scalability, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: This section describes the logical characteristics of each interface between the intended software product and the users. For user interface design, common GUI standards will be followed along with the presence of keyboard shortcuts, error message display standards etc., and standard buttons and functions (i.e. help) will appear on every screen. Details of the user interface design are intended to be documented in a separate user interface specification.
AI_Rationale: Describes GUI standards, look-and-feel elements (standard buttons, error message display) — primary Look & Feel. Mentions keyboard shortcuts, help and error display which are usability concerns, so US also set.

RequirementText: Policies are in place to perform renegotiation for problem resolution.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies organizational policies/procedures for handling problem resolution (renegotiation), which relates to maintainability (processes to resolve issues) and operability (administration/management practices). It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Administrative policies are deployed for operations in a peering arrangement.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies deployment of administrative policies for operations in a peering arrangement, which implies governance/operational controls (operability) and concerns about policy-based security/control (security). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, portability, legal/compliance, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, scalability, or general functional behavior.

RequirementText: There are existing policies for long-term peering arrangement.
AI_Rationale: The statement refers to existing policies governing long-term peering arrangements, which indicates governance/compliance constraints rather than functional behavior or quality attributes. No explicit operational, performance, security, or portability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: As mentioned earlier, the intended product to exploit existing Web service technologies to leverage existing infrastructures through building an overlay. The communication among software component would be performed through message passing over the IP network. From a technical point of view, TCP/IP will be used as the transport protocol, where each CDN server establishes a TCP connection to the network elements using a well-known port number. Messages can then be sent bi-directionally between the server and network elements. All messages consist of a fixed length-header containing the total data length and a request followed by a reply or an acknowledgement. Interaction among surrogates will be performed using HTTP or FTP.
AI_Rationale: The text specifies how the system should communicate (use TCP/IP, well-known port, fixed-length headers, message formats, use of HTTP/FTP) — these are functional/behavioral requirements. It does not state availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: Policies identifying the consequences of SLA violation are defined.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies defining policies about consequences for SLA violations, which is a contractual/compliance/legal governance requirement. It does not describe functional behavior, operational procedures, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Primary CDN has already acquired sufficient external resources.
AI_Rationale: Statement indicates the primary CDN has been provisioned with sufficient external resources, which primarily affects availability and the system's ability to scale and be operated/managed. It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance metrics, or legal/UI concerns.

RequirementText: Mediator works in conjunction with the PA to establish negotiation.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies an interaction/integration between components (Mediator and PA) to establish negotiation, which is an operability/interface requirement. It does not specify functional details, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Interaction protocols between PAs are identified.
AI_Rationale: Stating that interaction protocols between PAs are identified pertains to defining interfaces and operational interaction patterns (manageability/operation). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, portability, scalability, UI, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: The format for service information description is defined
AI_Rationale: Specifies a data/description format (what the system shall define), which is a functional requirement about information representation; no explicit quality attribute like availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The interaction protocol between Web Server-SR, SR-mediator is defined.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the interaction protocol / interface between components (Web Server-SR and SR-mediator), which is an operability/integration requirement rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: There is an established norm that any resource failure will be reported
AI_Rationale: Statement mandates that resource failures be reported—this concerns fault handling and operational monitoring/administration. It does not specify functional behavior, availability metrics, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Malicious requests are detected and rejected.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies detecting and rejecting malicious requests, which directly concerns security (threat prevention/input validation). It does not mention availability, performance, UI, portability, maintainability, operability, scalability, legal, or usability concerns, nor does it include broader functional behavior beyond the security control.

RequirementText: Resource provisioning, delegation and reservation policies are in place.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that operational policies for provisioning, delegation and reservation are established — primarily an operability/administration concern. 'Delegation' implies access/control policies, so security is also implicated. It does not state functional behavior, availability, scalability, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: Both anticipated and unanticipated user requests (traffic) are considered.
AI_Rationale: Requirement addresses the system's ability to handle both expected and unexpected user traffic, implying availability/responsiveness and scalability to cope with variable load. It does not mention security, performance metrics, fault tolerance, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The format of the initiation request is defined.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the required structure/format of an initiation request, which is a functional specification of what the system must produce/accept. No explicit non-functional quality (availability, security, performance, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: The format of service requirements is defined.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies how service requirements should be formatted (a documentation/standards concern), which primarily impacts maintainability (consistency, readability, modifiability). It does not describe system behavior, availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Mediator-SR, mediator-PR, mediator-PA interaction protocols are defined.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies that interaction protocols between mediators are defined, which is a description of system behavior/interfaces (functional requirement). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Web servers have already replicated necessary content.
AI_Rationale: The statement indicates content is replicated across web servers, which primarily addresses availability (redundancy/uptime) and fault tolerance (resilience to server failure). It does not explicitly mention performance, scalability, operability, security, or other attributes.

RequirementText: Enables the user to select the pertinent class, each class is highlighted for ease of use.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (user can select a class) and mentions visual highlighting to aid users, implying both look-and-feel (visual presentation) and usability (ease of use). No other quality attributes are indicated.

RequirementText: In the event, inflammatory/derogatory content has been identified, the content will be immediately removed and the appropriate authorities with be notified resulting in possible disciplinary action.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system actions (remove content, notify authorities) — clearly functional. Mentions notifying authorities and possible disciplinary action, implying legal/compliance requirements, so Legal is also set. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes stated.

RequirementText: News Feature: The administrator has the capability to post current news on this section as needed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: administrator can post news. No non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Contact Us Feature: Will enable the user to look up a list of pertinent e-mail addresses/phone numbers within the institution.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow users to look up contact email addresses/phone numbers), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Help Feature: Feature is linked with the help desk staff of the particular institution; anyone who has difficulty in logging on can choose this feature to contact the system administrator.
AI_Rationale: This describes a user-facing help feature (functional requirement) that aids users who cannot log on. It also clearly targets usability by providing help/contact mechanism. It does not specify availability, security, maintainability, look-and-feel, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The initial entry (Welcome Screen 1) has three separate quadrants; each quadrant has a specific function.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies UI layout (three quadrants) and that each quadrant has a specific function. This defines both the functional behavior tied to each quadrant and the look-and-feel/layout of the welcome screen. No mention of performance, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user interface of the Virtual-ED system is designed with increased emphasis on the user Human-Machine interface. The interface is compartmentalized by competency to ensure that the user can easily navigate within the portal. Each compartment has a distinctive focus with a minimalist approach. The user has the capability to alter the interface as suited.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on the user interface design (minimalist, compartmentalized) which maps to Look & Feel (LF). It explicitly states ease of navigation and emphasis on the human-machine interface, indicating usability concerns (US). The statement 'The user has the capability to alter the interface' specifies a user-facing capability/function, so Functional (F) is also set. No explicit mentions of availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Users may not use the system to upload or post data which is discriminatory in regards to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, handicap, marital status, or national origin. Users may not upload or post data which is inflammatory or derogatory.
AI_Rationale: This requirement prohibits certain user actions (enforced behavior), so it has a functional enforcement aspect (F). It also represents legal/policy compliance regarding discriminatory content (L) and an access/control/security constraint to prevent misuse of the system (SE). Other quality attributes are not implied.

RequirementText: User passwords should be between 8 and 12 characters including letters and numbers but excluding spaces.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a password policy (length and character constraints), which is a security-related requirement (authentication/password rules). It does not describe availability, performance, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: All users are responsible for securing a backup of any uploaded data/content to the system in the event of an outage.
AI_Rationale: The statement assigns operational responsibility to users to secure backups in case of outage. It does not specify system functionality, performance, security mechanisms, availability targets, or legal requirements. This is an operational/administrative requirement, so Operability is applicable.

RequirementText: The systems should adhere to the privacy policy set forth by NJIT and its administration and also state and federal guidelines.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates adherence to institutional, state, and federal privacy policies, which is a legal/compliance constraint (L). It also implies protection of privacy/confidentiality, so security (SE) applies. It does not specify functional behavior, availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: In the event your account has been compromised, notify the NJIT help desk immediately. Refrain from using the infected account to communicate with anyone else.
AI_Rationale: This is a security incident-handling instruction (report compromised account and avoid using it). It specifies a security policy/requirement, not functional system behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: All archived chats, e-mail, file share, and IM Messages are governed by the NJIT E-mail use policy. The user is encouraged to view the content at the NJIT homepage for detailed use of the policy and restrictions and limitations of the policy.
AI_Rationale: Requirement states that archived communications are governed by NJIT E-mail use policy and directs users to view it—this is a legal/compliance constraint rather than functional or other non-functional quality.

RequirementText: The information within the system is regarded private, however in the event of an investigation by a legal authority, including by not limited to a subpoena or audit, the information will be released to the proper authorities for the purpose intended.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies handling of private information and an explicit exception for release to legal authorities (functional behavior), and it addresses legal compliance (legal). It also concerns confidentiality/privacy, implying security considerations. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, UI, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: The user should periodically change the password; currently the user policy requires a mandatory password change every three months.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a mandatory password-change policy (enforced periodic password changes every three months), which is a security control. It does not describe availability, performance, maintainability, or other non-security quality attributes, nor general functional behavior beyond the security policy.

RequirementText: Enables the user to choose a specific application to be used. To launch an application click on the application icon, the application will open up on a separate screen
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user-facing behavior (selecting and launching an application, opening on a separate screen), so it is functional. It defines a user interaction/interaction flow impacting usability, so Usability is marked. It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal/compliance concerns, nor does it describe visual aesthetics specifically, so those labels are set to false.

RequirementText: The user is responsible for content uploaded. NJIT policy prohibits the use NJIT facilities/assets for personal use.
AI_Rationale: This statement defines policy and acceptable use regarding user responsibility and prohibition of personal use of institutional assets, which is a legal/compliance requirement. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Web conferencing feature enables the user to interact with multiple users within a given class. Each user can chat with one another while the session is open.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (web conferencing allowing multiple users to interact and chat during a session). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The portal will be periodically unavailable due to necessary maintenance upgrades. In the event of scheduled maintenance, the students/staff will be notified at least 24 hours in-advance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies planned downtime (availability constraint) and scheduled maintenance practices/notification—this relates to maintainability and operational procedures. No functional behavior, security, performance, or other qualities are implied.

RequirementText: This screen is an extension of the web conferencing feature; this screen enables the users to view all available chat sessions available at any given time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional screen capability (view all available chat sessions). Phrase 'at any given time' implies availability requirement (accessibility whenever needed), similar to provided example that combined functional and availability.

RequirementText: The user ID and the password should not be shared with anyone (students/staff/or anyone else).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that user IDs and passwords must not be shared, which is a confidentiality/authentication security constraint on credentials; it clearly maps to Security (SE). No other non-functional categories are implied.

RequirementText: Appropriate funding must be acquired to make required upgrades to existing systems, buy additional hardware and software, and acquire skilled personnel to develop project.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns acquiring funding, hardware/software, and skilled personnel to enable development/upgrades. This primarily impacts the ability to maintain and develop the system (maintainability). It does not specify functional behavior, availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, usability, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or legal constraints, nor does it explicitly address operability/administration.

RequirementText: The system must be completed within the timeframe allotted for development.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a project schedule/development timeline (completion within allotted timeframe), not a system functional behavior or one of the listed quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.). It is a project management constraint, so none of the PROMISE NFR labels apply.

RequirementText: The content is the responsibility of the users of the system; NJIT is neither responsible nor liable for the accuracy or the correctness of the content.
AI_Rationale: This statement is a legal disclaimer assigning content responsibility and denying liability; it does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Web-Conferencing featuresâ€™ performance depends on the availability of the bandwidth. The minimum of a broadband connection is recommended to fully utilize Web-Conferencing feature.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that web-conferencing performance depends on bandwidth and recommends a minimum broadband connection—this directly relates to performance (bandwidth/latency) and to operational/environmental prerequisites (operability). No legal, security, scalability, or functional behavior is stated.

RequirementText: The system has an estimated 99% up time, though in an event of an outage data loss can occur.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an uptime percentage (availability). Mentions data loss during outages, which relates to fault tolerance/resilience characteristics.

RequirementText: Security: Users must have antivirus software installed so they can scan the incoming files from other users of the system, any commercially available Antivirus is can be used scanning files.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates antivirus installation to protect incoming files, which is a security control addressing confidentiality/integrity/malware protection. It does not specify functionality, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Data Transfer Rates: Recommended 1.5 MBPS Download speed (for any download activities) and upload speed of minimum 128 Kbps.
AI_Rationale: Specifies minimum download and upload speeds, which are performance-related metrics (network throughput/latency characteristics). Does not describe functionality, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Communication Standards: SSH client, FTP client, VPN client are used for connection between two computing endpoints.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required communication protocols/clients (SSH, FTP, VPN) — this is a functional requirement about how connections are made. It also implies security-related constraints (use of SSH/VPN) so security is applicable. Other quality categories are not explicitly stated.

RequirementText: The users must have pop-up windows enabled on their systems and must enable java scripts on their systems to be able to install Instant-Edu messaging software.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user-facing installation prerequisites (enabling pop-ups and JavaScript), which affect ease of installation/use. It is a usability/installation constraint rather than a functional, security, or performance requirement.

RequirementText: Web Browser: The system requires the use of IE or Fire fox, Safari as the native web browser. It is recommended that current system performs optimally with the suggested browsers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required/native web browsers and that the system performs optimally with them—this pertains to operability/administration and compatibility across platforms/browsers (portability). It does not specify UI aesthetics, performance metrics, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: When using â€œTest administeringâ€� feature (applicable to Administrators only), XL and PDF must be installed in the native machine to view the downloadable reports. By default the reports will be saved to the â€œC: Program files/Virtual-ED/Bin/My reports folderâ€�, (Requires XL-2002 or higher and Adobe Acrobat Reader 8 or higher)
AI_Rationale: Specifies required client-side software (Excel, Acrobat) and default installation folder for the admin 'Test administering' feature. This describes deployment/operational prerequisites (operability) and compatibility/requirements with external platforms/software (portability), not functional behavior or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The Virtual-ED software has a seamless integration with the local operating/hardware system. Once the user logs on to the Virtual-ED system (screen.1), the interface will seamlessly manage the local input/output/operating system, devices as needed
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies behavior (interface will manage local I/O/devices) -> Functional. It describes integration with the local OS/hardware and operation once user logs on -> Operability. The term 'seamless' implies user experience quality -> Usability. No explicit statements about availability, security, portability, performance, scalability, maintainability, legal, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Visual Input: The conferencing feature requires a high resolution video input device. The device needs to be configured in accordance to manufacturer recommended settings and should be in operation before enabling the conferencing feature.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a requirement/precondition for the conferencing feature (need for a high-resolution video input device configured and operational), which is a functional constraint on the system. It also prescribes setup/operational configuration steps (device must be configured and running before enabling conferencing), implying operability/administration concerns. It does not address availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or explicit usability metrics.

RequirementText: Input devices: All hardware interfaces will be provided by the operating system, the system will require a keyboard and a mouse. In addition a properly configured sound card and a voice input device will be needed to utilize the conferencing feature.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the system must do/require in terms of hardware/input devices (keyboard, mouse, sound card, voice input) and that hardware interfaces are provided by the OS—this is a functional interface/hardware requirement. It does not specify availability, security, portability, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Display Monitor: It is recommended that a high resolution LCD or CRT monitor be used for best results.
AI_Rationale: Specifies recommended operating environment/hardware (monitor) — matches Operability. Also affects user experience/readability ('for best results'), so Usability is applicable. No indication of performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: File transfer feature enables the user to have the ability to manage a private temporary hosting space. Tools such as file uploading, directory creator, move, delete and rename will be accessible
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a feature set and user capabilities (file upload, directory creation, move, delete, rename) — this describes functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Instant messaging feature will allow users to interact with faculty and follow classmates over a text based one-to-one or one-to-many connection.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system capability/feature (instant messaging one-to-one and one-to-many interactions), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The user is responsible for maintaining the user account. Action must be taken by the user to prevent the user account from being compromised.
AI_Rationale: The requirement places responsibility on the user to prevent account compromise, which is a security-related constraint about protecting account confidentiality/integrity. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, availability, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The students overall login should allow them access to the appropriate folder, and their account should only have Write privileges.
AI_Rationale: Specifies behavior of login granting access to a folder (functional) and restricts account privileges to Write only (access control requirement), which is a security concern. No indications of availability, performance, UI, portability, etc.

RequirementText: System may require users to download program updates to become compatible and compliant with system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior (it may require users to download updates) so Functional applies. It concerns distribution of program updates and ensuring compatibility/compliance, which relates to Maintainability (system update process) and Operability (administering/forcing updates). It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The students overall login should allow them access to the appropriate folder, and their account should only have Read, Write, and Delete privileges
AI_Rationale: Specifies access behavior (login grants access to appropriate folder) which is functional, and restricts account privileges (Read/Write/Delete) which is an access-control/security requirement. No mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: For the first release, each student needs a quota space of 2GB. Files causing the quota to be exceeded should not be allowed to upload.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior: assign a 2GB quota per student and prevent uploads that would exceed the quota. That is a functional constraint (enforcement of quota). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: FTP management software on the server setup with quota space, user authentication, and appropriate user rights.
AI_Rationale: Specifies installing FTP management software with quota, user authentication and rights — identifies functional setup plus security aspects (authentication/authorization) and administrative/operational management; no explicit availability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Firewall ports may need to be unblocked on both sides to accommodate file transfers.
AI_Rationale: This statement describes a network/configuration prerequisite (opening firewall ports) necessary to operate/file transfers—an operability/administration concern rather than a functional feature or explicit security/availability requirement.

RequirementText: The professorâ€™s username should allow them access to the appropriate folder and have Read, Write, and Delete privileges.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access rights/permissions (authorization) for a professor's account—controlling Read/Write/Delete access to a folder—so it is a security (access control) requirement.

RequirementText: Files causing the quota to be exceeded should not be allowed to upload.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (prevent uploading files that would exceed quota). It defines what the system should do rather than a quality attribute such as performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: For the first release, each class needs a quota space of at least 1GB per student in that class. If the upload will cause the account to go over disk space quota, the file should be still be allowed to upload and an email sent to the administrator and professor.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional behavior: allocating at least 1GB quota per student and the behavior when uploads would exceed quota (still allow upload and send email notifications) — this is clearly functional. The instruction to allow uploads beyond quota and notify administrators/professors is a form of graceful degradation/handling of a fault/limit, so FT is marked. The requirement also explicitly addresses administrative notification (email to administrator and professor), which impacts operability/administration, so O is marked. Other non-functional categories (security, performance, scalability, etc.) are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: Users must have web cam and microphone if they want to be able to create an introducing video of themselves on their profile page
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional requirement/precondition for the profile video feature (users must have a webcam and microphone to create an introduction video). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Users must be connected on a high speed internet (DSL, Cable)
AI_Rationale: Specifies required network bandwidth/type (DSL/Cable) for users — a performance/throughput constraint on the environment rather than functionality, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Users must have antivirus software installed so they can scan the incoming files from other users of the system
AI_Rationale: Requires users to have antivirus to scan incoming files—this is a security control addressing malware protection. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users must enable java scripts on their systems to be able to install Instant-Edu messaging software
AI_Rationale: The statement is an environment/precondition requirement (users must enable JavaScript) indicating a dependency on client platform configuration—this is a portability/compatibility concern. It also affects installation usability for end users, so it relates to usability. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users must have pop-up windows enabled on their systems

AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (admin capability to move data). It explicitly requires maintained accessibility of moved data, implying availability concerns. It also describes an administrative operation, so operability/administrability is relevant. Other NFRs are not explicitly stated.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to support litigation requests by production of responsive e-mail in to a specified location, for read and redaction purposes.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability (admin can produce responsive emails to a specified location for reading and redaction), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, scalability, maintainability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to perform a "full text" search including the header, body and any attachments to the e-mail.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (agency admin can perform full-text search across header, body, and attachments), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to search the "body" of the e-mail including the header and all text contained within the e-mail itself.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capability: admin can search email content (body and header). No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to search using Boolean fields.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (admin search using Boolean fields). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to select the e-mail retention period for a specific e-mail (e.g. 1 year, 3 year, or 5 year).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (agency admin can select email retention period), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, scalability, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to capture all sent and received emails into the organization.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability (admin can capture all sent/received emails) which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, legal compliance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to satisfy legal requests for e-mail discovery and provide printed or digital results.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (ability for admin to perform e-mail discovery and produce printed/digital results) which is functional. It also explicitly relates to satisfying legal requests, indicating legal/compliance concerns. No explicit statements about availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, look-and-feel, or usability are present.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to meet Federal regulations for retention (i.e. Sarbanes Oxley, Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB), HIPAA, etc.)
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compliance with federal retention regulations (Sarbanes-Oxley, GLB, HIPAA), which is a legal/regulatory constraint. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, availability, security) or functional behaviors are specified.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to search the e-mail "header" including Date: From, Subject, To, and CC.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing an agency admin to search email headers by fields (Date/From/Subject/To/CC). It does not state non-functional concerns such as performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to provide long term retention separate from active e-mail system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (admin can provide long-term retention separate from active email), which is a functional feature. It also implies an administrative/operational control (manage retention separate from active system), so Operability applies. No explicit mentions of availability, security, legal compliance, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to filter archive by sender, recipient, date, subject, content, attachments, keyword, etc.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (filter/search functionality for an admin over archive fields). It describes what the system should do rather than quality attributes like performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to search archive and forward, print and restore in bulk items from archive.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system capabilities (search, forward, print, bulk restore) — functional. The ability to restore items from archive implies recovery capability (fault tolerance), similar to backup/restore examples. No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, usability, legal, look&feel, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to archive at various regularly defined intervals.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (admin can archive on scheduled intervals) which is a functional feature. It also pertains to administrative operation (ability for agency admin to configure/manage archiving intervals), so Operability is applicable. No explicit quality attributes like availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, or usability are stated.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to provide a server based archiving solution.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a feature/capability (admin can provide a server-based archiving solution), so it is functional. It also pertains to an administrative/operational capability (manageability/operation), so Operability is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, legal, UI, portability, maintainability, or fault-tolerance requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Ability for the user to archive at the desktop.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability (ability to archive from the desktop), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Ability for the user to customize their view in the client application (such as adding fields, arranging fields, and ordering emails by fields).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing feature (customizable client view: add/arrange fields, order emails) — therefore functional. It also concerns the user interface and directly impacts ease of use (customization improves usability), so Usability is marked. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal/look-and-feel requirements.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to create generic email accounts/addresses to be accessed by multiple users.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability for admin to create generic/shared email accounts). It also concerns system administration/operability (admin capability to manage accounts accessible by multiple users). It does not explicitly state security, availability, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Ability for the data center admin to control message size limits for e-mail (inbound and outbound).
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (admin control over email message size limits) — a functional requirement — and relates to administrative/operational control, so operability also applies.

RequirementText: Ability for the agency admin to provide individual users the ability to search their portion of the archive repository.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (admin can grant users search access to their portion of the archive) — functional. It also implies access control/authorization (users can search only their portion), so security is applicable.

RequirementText: Determine the epoch data photometry (with instrumental and reduction errors): G mag (for each CCD and average for the transit), GRP, GBP, GRVS . Gate activation and signal loss due to window cutoff must be taken into account.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a processing capability: compute epoch photometry and associated instrumental/reduction errors for specified bands, accounting for gate activation and window cutoff. This describes functional behavior (what the system shall do) and does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Compute the astrometric combined data using all previous transits: Compute parallax and proper motion errors, Determine de covariance matrix, Determine estimated errors for the astrometric parameters at the mean epoch.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies computations the system must perform (compute combined astrometric data, errors, covariance, estimated errors) — this is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: GOG must provide a way to be run from a command line or a shell script.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system must provide a means to be executed from a command line or shell script — this is a functional capability (F) and relates to operability/administration (O). It does not explicitly mention availability, portability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: GOG should be able to run in a cluster or grid environtments
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must be able to run in cluster or grid environments, which is primarily a portability/deployment constraint (support for different execution environments). It also implies scalability support (ability to operate in distributed/clustered setups). No explicit statements about functionality, performance, availability, security, or other categories.

RequirementText: GOG must be able to process one complete source processing on 2 CPU seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a processing capability with a time limit (2 CPU seconds) — a performance requirement. Also describes the functional capability to process a complete source, so labeled as Functional and Performance.

RequirementText: GOG is designed to run on either in a single thread mode on grid environments.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the target execution environment (single-thread mode on grid environments), indicating platform/environment compatibility (portability). No explicit operational, performance, or other quality constraints given.

RequirementText: GOG runs on LINUX , UNIX and MAC computers (minimum).GOG results are platform independent
AI_Rationale: Specifies supported operating systems and platform independence — indicates portability (PO). Also relates to operability/manageability across environments (O), as in similar examples that labeled both O and PO.

RequirementText: GOG will have to generate data of a considerable amount of astrosources whose number could be a significant part of the expected final catalogue (20%).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must generate a large volume of astrosource data (functional behavior). The mention that this is a considerable portion of the final catalogue (20%) implies concerns about handling volume/scale, so scalability is relevant. No explicit statements about availability, performance metrics, security, UI, legal, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: GOG initialisation module will define the output specification output parameters (spectrum RPBP/RVS, astrometry, Vr, physical parameters and flags) epoch and/or combined number of epochs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the GOG initialization module will define output specification and parameters (types of outputs, epoch/number of epochs). No availability, performance, security, or other NFRs are implied.

RequirementText: GOG is built as a standalone java aplication that could be invoked from a command line and deployed as a jar file.
AI_Rationale: Specifies deployment and invocation as a standalone Java JAR and command-line tool—concerns operability (deployment/administration) and portability across environments (Java/JAR format). Does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The GOG catalogue module must include information on the reduction model: Instrument effects substraction node bias substraction noises PPE residuals noise, Scientific content extraction noise substraction of close sources second FoV contamination noise backgound substraction.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the catalogue module must include certain information fields (details of the reduction model and various noise/subtraction items). This describes required functional content/data of the system rather than availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Determine for epoch data the astrometric parameter (with instrumental and reduction errors): transit times and field angles in each CCD mean transit time and field angle for the transit.Gate activation and signal loss due to window cutoff must be taken into account.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete computational task: determining astrometric parameters (transit times and field angles) and accounting for instrumental/reduction errors and gate/window effects. It describes what the system must do, so it is Functional. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, maintainability, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, operability, fault-tolerance, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: The GOG catalogue module must include information on the universe model: Galaxy model, SkyBackGroung model, Extinction Law model, DMS model.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the catalogue module must include specific information items (universe model components). This describes functional content/data the system must provide, with no explicit non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: GOG initialisation Module should be able to read information of the input sources. Options are to use the Universe Model or a provided user sources.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability: the GOG initialization module must read input source information, with options (Universe Model or provided user sources). This describes functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: GOG must give the same result for identical input configuration parameters .
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies required system behavior (deterministic/reproducible outputs for identical input configuration parameters), which is a functional constraint. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, portability, scalability, usability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: GOG I/O Catalogue format is driven by [AD3] . Main Data base format is defined in [AD1].
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies which documents define the I/O catalogue and main database data formats, i.e. mandates data format standards. This is primarily about system operability/administration (data format specification/interoperability), matching examples that label data-format constraints as Operability. No explicit performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Instrumental noises: noises that come from observation process such as:on board detection and tracking or observation dead-time reduction noise: noise added to the data when removing instrumental noise.
AI_Rationale: The text describes types of observational/instrumental noise and how noise is added during processing. It is informational/definitional rather than stating a system function or quality requirement, so no PROMISE NFR labels explicitly apply.

RequirementText: GOG must consider noise effects. For noise generation those effects should be userselectable (they can be added or not and the values should be given by users).We classify noises in two groups:
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability: users can select/add noise effects and provide values (functional requirement). No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: GOG has a source by source processing mechanism
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies a capability ('has a ... processing mechanism'), which describes what the system should do (functional). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: For source generation GOG has 2 main options available: Universe Model from GaiaSimu or a Object Input Catalogue
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior/options of the system (source generation offers two main options). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: GOG will be fully integrated in the Gaia Simulator project. That is, it will use as other the other simulators the Gaia Simu library and the Gaia Tools library.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates integration with the Gaia Simulator project and use of specific libraries (Gaia Simu and Gaia Tools). This is an interoperability/compatibility constraint affecting how the system is operated and integrated (Operability) and its compatibility/portability with the target simulator environment (Portability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: CU2 will be responsible for the design and developing of GOG that will provide Catalogue, Main Database (MDB) and final data.(in the sense of statistically equivalent to the final mission data) data without the use GASS telemetry, GIBIS or the main ESAC database
AI_Rationale: Specifies that CU2 shall design and develop GOG to provide Catalogue, Main Database and final (statistically equivalent) mission data — this describes what the system/component must do (functional). No explicit non-functional constraints like availability, security, performance, scalability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: GOG initialisation module must include information on the instrument model: The selected scanning law, Dead time, Noise models (including detection noise)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional content that the GOG initialization module must include particular instrument model information (scanning law, dead time, noise models). It defines what the system/module must provide, not availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system should allow the Construction Junction Staff to create new reports whenever required to satisfy their changing operational and business needs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability — allowing staff to create new reports on demand — which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The application is expected to operate via touch screen user interfaces, and take advantage of that technology to be as fast, efficient, intuitive, and flexible as possible while also minimizing the potential for errors and duplications. It should minimize the use of keyboard and mouse when processing acquisitions, and should allow acquisitions to be completed with few clicks and page switches.
AI_Rationale: Specifies touch-screen UI, minimizing keyboard/mouse, few clicks/page switches, and being intuitive and efficient — these are look-and-feel and usability requirements rather than functional, security, performance, or others.

RequirementText: Donation/acquisition processing - The system must be available during normal Construction Junction operating hours.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system availability during normal Construction Junction operating hours, which is an availability requirement. No functional behavior, fault-tolerance, performance, security, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: Sales processing - The system must be available during normal Construction Junction operating hours.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system availability during normal operating hours (availability requirement). Does not mention fault tolerance, performance, security, or functional behavior beyond availability.

RequirementText: Inventory management - The system must be available beyond normal operating hours to accommodate inventory management operations.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required system availability beyond normal operating hours to support inventory management, which is an availability requirement.

RequirementText: The system must be written using industry best practices, and must be built using only Construction Junction approved products and technologies. The system must also be written in such a way that it can be supported by planned Construction Junction staffing levels.
AI_Rationale: Requires use of industry best practices and maintainability by planned staffing => Maintainability. Requirement to use only approved products/technologies and be supportable by planned staffing implies operational/manageability constraints => Operability. Does not explicitly state performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: The system should record changes to application entities in the form of â€žcreated user/timeâ€Ÿ, â€žmodified user/timeâ€Ÿ fields. The system should also record information about various sensitive inventory management operations such as deleting items and changing the price of items.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (recording created/modified user/time and logging sensitive operations) — a functional requirement. It also implies security-related audit/accountability controls (audit logging of sensitive actions), so Security is applicable. No indication of availability, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, operability, legal, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: The functionality provided by the Inventory Management System will be critical to the normal operation of the Construction Junction business. As such, the system should perform with consistently and predictably low response times in order not to impact the performance or the timely execution of the various tasks that need to be conducted by the Construction Junction staff.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies consistently and predictably low response times to avoid impacting task execution—this is a performance (timing/latency) quality requirement.

RequirementText: The system should be able to generate reports based on the following entities, including reports that correlate them: Inventory items, Inventory departments, Inventory categories, Acquisitions Donors.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to generate reports for specific entities and correlated reports, which describes functional behavior. It does not state non-functional constraints (availability, performance, usability, security, etc.), so only Functional is set to true.

RequirementText: The following copyright notice must be displayed in all user interfaces: Â© 2009 - Construction Junction
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that a specific notice must be displayed in all user interfaces — a functional behavior (display requirement). It also reflects a legal/compliance obligation (copyright notice must be present), so Legal is marked. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Access to the application by the Construction Junction staff must require user login. Access to application screens and functions is granted or denied based on the profile and role of the currently logged in user, as detailed in the preceding use-case requirements.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required user login and role/profile-based access control—this is security (authentication/authorization). It also describes functional behavior (enforce login and grant/deny access), so marked as Functional as well.

RequirementText: The application will provide a reporting mechanism that, at a minimum, allows Construction Junction to review and report by inventory, inventory type, donor contact information, and the ability to link inventory to individual that donated it.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability — a reporting mechanism with specific report types (by inventory, inventory type, donor contact info, and linking inventory to donors). It describes functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The system must be available beyond normal operating hours to accommodate website use â€“ Inventory listing, wish list management and online purchases.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must be available beyond normal operating hours for website use (inventory listing, wish list, purchases). This explicitly concerns availability (uptime) and matches examples labeled A. No other quality attributes or functional specifications are strongly implied.

RequirementText: Pick Up and Decon crews may also initiate the receiving process, entering as much detailed information about the donated items as desired, and generating a donation receipt. They cannot, however, add items to the inventory or complete the acquisition process. A Receiving Associate is required to review all the acquisition information before those actions can take place.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: who may initiate receiving, what they can do, and that a Receiving Associate must complete review — this is functional. It also defines role-based permissions/authorization (who cannot add inventory or complete acquisition), which pertains to security (access control). No availability, performance, scalability, UI, legal, or other NFRs are implied.

RequirementText: The system should provide a categorized view of the entire inventory to the Construction Junction staff. Starting at the department level, users can navigate into the inventory item categories and subcategories, all the way down to an individual inventory item.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system capability to provide a categorized, navigable view of inventory items (functional behavior). It does not specify availability, performance, UI aesthetics, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the inventory departments (not to be confused actual retail floor departments known later in this document as stocking locations).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability: allowing inventory administrators to customize inventory structure by defining inventory departments — this is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the inventory departments and categories.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (allow administrators to customize inventory structure and define departments/categories), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Any item in the inventory may be purchased by a Construction Junction customer. The sale of the item is processed by QuickBooks POS and the inventory must be updated accordingly.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: customers may purchase inventory items and sales are processed by QuickBooks POS with corresponding inventory updates. This is a functional requirement about processing sales and updating inventory. It does not explicitly state non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.), nor maintenance/operability concerns beyond integration, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Items are typically added to the inventory as part of the donation processes. This is called adding an item in donation processing. Alternatively, items can be added during routine inventory maintenance. This is called adding an item in inventory management mode.
AI_Rationale: Describes system functionality for adding items to inventory in two modes (donation processing and inventory management). No quality constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the attributes and details available for each inventory item. Attributes can be defined for each department, and details can be defined for each department and/or category
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability—allowing inventory administrators to customize attributes and details by department/category—which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system should assist in the task of pricing a new inventory item by making pricing suggestions to the user when adding to or modifying an item in the inventory. The suggested prices should be calculated based on the original and sale prices of similar items that currently exist or existed in the inventory in the past.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability: automatically generate pricing suggestions based on similar items' original and sale prices when adding/modifying inventory items. This describes functional behavior; it does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Acquisition records for Drop-Off, Pickup and Decon donations are created in the CRM system. Inventory Management users should be able to view all past and current acquisitions. Receiving Associates use this function to locate an expected acquisition when receiving a donation at the loading dock. Pickup and Decon crews may also use this function to initiate the process of receiving items while in the truck, on their way to the receiving dock.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behaviors: creation of acquisition records and users (Inventory, Receiving, Pickup/Decon) being able to view and initiate receipt—these are functional requirements about what the system should do. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Drop Off acquisitions are not typically pre-scheduled as Pick Up and Decon acquisitions except for those submitted through the organizational website. As such, when a donor arrives with an unexpected drop off donation, a new acquisition needs to be able to be created in the CRM system first, at either the customer service desk or at the dock, before it can be viewed in the acquisitions screen.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability: creating a new acquisition in the CRM at the customer service desk or dock so it can be viewed in the acquisitions screen. This is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability or look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: A donor in possession of a valid acquisition number can proceed to the receiving dock where the items to be donated will be received and processed, and a donation receipt will be generated. Alternatively, a donor may go directly to the receiving dock, in which case a new acquisition is created by the Receiving Associate before items can be received and processed.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behavior/workflow for handling donors, acquisitions, receiving and receipt generation — a functional requirement. Does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The screens used for the acquisition process should simplify and expedite the data entry process, allowing the Receiving Associate to enter only the information needed to generate the donation receipt. Additional attributes needed to complete the item information and effectively add the item to the inventory can be added at a second step, after the receipt has been printed and the donor has been served. The Receiving Associate can print temporary acquisition labels for items that require further processing.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (what screens must do and ability to print labels) -> Functional. Emphasis on simplifying and expediting data entry, minimizing required fields for initial receipt, and workflow for later attributes indicates usability concerns -> Usability. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal/readability/look-and-feel specifics.

RequirementText: The system should allow various management actions to be performed on items existing in the inventory. These include modifying, deleting and splitting an item, and viewing the itemâ€Ÿs details and item history. These actions are only available for Unique and Stock items.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies what the system should do (allow modifying, deleting, splitting, viewing details/history for certain item types). It describes functional capabilities and constraints on applicable item types; it does not state availability, performance, security, legal, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system generates a list of items that have been in-transit for more than X days (X configurable), per branch and per system. The report would merge the transit to and transit from into one report for ease of front-line staff use.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: generating a merged report of items in-transit over a configurable threshold (functional). The phrase 'for ease of front-line staff use' indicates a usability concern (US). No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or look-and-feel requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system provides reports of missing and damaged items per branch.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must provide reports of missing and damaged items per branch. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System provides a utility for transferring batches of items between branches, used for example to move books into a mobile library, an outreach program collection, or a "just-in-time" warehouse. Utility includes ability to query for candidate materials; ability to save queries for repeated use; ability to manually select titles from query results; and ability to change records of all or selected items to move to new location. Mechanisms for moving items include changing location field, generating pull lists, etc. In addition, utility provides means to revert items to original location after a set period of time, and/or based on other criteria.
AI_Rationale: The text describes specific functional capabilities (querying, saving queries, selecting items, changing records, generating pull lists, reverting items) — these are system behaviors/features. It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: Ability to control inventory of uncataloged material, such as paperback books and children s board books. Support for quick distribution; minimal branch labor; and ability to identify how the material is being used. Ability to count transactions and include in circulation statistics and reports.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies capabilities to control inventory, track usage, count transactions and include in reports — these are functional. It also explicitly calls for quick distribution and minimal branch labor, which relate to operability/administration (ease of operating and managing processes). No explicit availability, security, performance metrics, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: System must be able to support the fine-grained reports requirements as described in Appendix B.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system must support fine-grained reporting functionality (per Appendix B). It describes what the system should do (functional). No explicit non-functional quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system provides an interface showing capacity of all branches
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system interface that displays capacity of all branches, which describes a functional feature (what the system should do). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Ability to report on the volume of material in a given library at any point in time, based on new acquisitions, items on the shelf, and items out in circulation, with the ability to break down volume in categories (e.g. total items in library, number of holds, number of adult fiction, number of board books, etc).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a reporting capability (what the system should do) to provide volumes and category breakdowns. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system produces useful demographic statistics, including transactions by geographical regions, age ranges, etc. The data used to produce these statistics must be anonymized, i.e. information that could be used to identify a patron is deleted.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (produce demographic statistics) and includes a privacy/anonymization constraint (removal of identifying information), which is a security/privacy non-functional requirement. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, or other concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The system produces statistics that can be used to understand and predict patron behavior and use of materials. For example, how quickly is a particular book returned, on average? How likely is a particular book to be renewed? What percent of check-outs at a particular branch are renewals?
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability of the system to produce statistics for understanding and predicting patron behavior, which is a functional feature (analytics/reporting). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, storage/maintainability, security, usability, scalability, or other non-functional constraints, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system provides a utility and reports for identifying item records to purge, based on customizable criteria such as: an item has been in status "missing" for more than X months; an item has status "discard/weed". The system has a report to assist in the conversion of items from one status to another. The system provides a last copy report that would single out a library system s last copies, to assist catalogers who need to edit WorldCat entries. The system provides a quick effective method of deleting volume entries along with copy entries, as well as records with no items attached.
AI_Rationale: The text specifies system features: utilities and reports for identifying/purging items, status conversion report, last-copy report, and deletion functions — these are functional requirements. They are administrative/operational tools (operability). The phrase “quick effective method” implies a concern for ease of use, so usability is also indicated. No explicit constraints about performance metrics, security, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel were given.

RequirementText: For each genre and format of material, ability to compare the percentage of total circulations, the percentage of the collection, and the percentage of total shelf space that genre/format comprises. Ability to report per library and per system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional reporting capabilities (compare percentages of circulations, collection, shelf space by genre/format and ability to report per library/system). No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Ability to count and track record deletions (e.g. item records, patron records) per location and per system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system must be able to count and track record deletions (per location and per system), which describes functional behavior (capability) and supports operability/monitoring for administrators. It does not explicitly mention availability, security/audit compliance, performance, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system counts all types of check-out individually and cumulatively: staff check-out, self check-out, staff renewal, self checkout renewal, online renewal, OPAC renewal.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (counting/reporting different types of check-outs individually and cumulatively). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system generates a list of patrons with no circulation or electronic activity in the last X days (X configurable). List should be configurable to System, Home Library, County, etc.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system function to generate a configurable list of patrons based on inactivity and scope (functional). The mention of configurability (X configurable, scope selection) implies administrative/manageability aspects (operability). No explicit performance, security, usability, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: Transaction history is maintained for X days (X is configurable); monthly and annual aggregate information is maintained indefinitely.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must maintain transaction history and configurable retention (functional behavior). The note that retention period is configurable implies operational/admin capability (operability). No explicit statements about availability, security, scalability, legal compliance, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Transactions can be grouped by hour, terminal, branch, and system. Transactions include check-ins, check-outs, fines collected, patron registrations, etc., and can be queried by all transactions or by type of transaction.
AI_Rationale: Describes functional capabilities for grouping and querying transactions by various attributes and types. No quality constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The system counts all types of check-in individually and cumulatively: book-drop, by terminal, by user or self-service.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional behavior: the system must count check-ins by different categories (book-drop, terminal, user, self-service) both individually and cumulatively. It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system counts all hold requests, including how the hold was placed: at a staff desk, at a public computer inside the library, or remotely.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: counting hold requests and recording the origin of each hold (staff desk, public computer, remote). It does not state non-functional concerns like availability, security, performance, or usability.

RequirementText: The system can generate a report of transactions (holds placed, holds filled, and check-outs) per patron, per library, per selected group o libraries, per system, per county. The system displays the number of check-outs and placed holds per patron. Holds are subtotaled by type, e.g. active, frozen, and frozen-until holds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior to generate and display transaction reports and counts/subtotals by various scopes and types—this is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system can generate a report of the value of items (based on data in item record) in the entire collection or a portion. Example: staff can obtain value of all items with status of longoverdue, or value of all dvds in children s collection, or value of entire collection.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: generating reports of item values for the entire collection or filtered subsets. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: All reports and data archiving must comply with standard accounting practice and state, county, and municipal auditing requirements.
