AI_Rationale: Specifies compliance with accounting practice and governmental auditing requirements — a legal/regulatory constraint. No explicit availability, performance, UI, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Fines, charges, waivers, and ecommerce transactions are attached to patron and item records. System tracks fines waived and payments made per library. Financial information can be updated easily. As an example, a staff user can easily query patron accounts with balances greater than X dollars.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior (attaching/tracking fines, waivers, payments, querying accounts) — clearly functional. The wording 'easily updated' and 'staff user can easily query' indicates concern for ease-of-use for staff, so Usability is applicable. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The system provides financial reports including: patron account balances by patron, home library, and system; fines and charges accrued per time period (e.g. last twelve months, YTD, last month) and per type of charge (overdue fines, damaged item charges, lost item charges, etc.); fines waived per time period and per branch; payments made per time period and per payment method (e.g. staff desk, self-check station, OPAC).
AI_Rationale: Describes required system functionality (generation of specific financial reports and breakdowns). No explicit non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, security, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: System must be able to support the reporting definitions as described in Appendix A.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies functionality the system must provide (support reporting definitions from Appendix A). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: The system maintains a ledger of patron payments, including which charges payments are applied to, to facilitate reconciliation.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system capability (maintaining a payments ledger and mapping payments to charges to support reconciliation) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Ability to see where your report is in the queue of reports waiting to run.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-visible capability (seeing report position in queue), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Queries and reports can be limited or grouped by various patron characteristics, including: age range, zip code, county of residence, home branch, patron type, and preferred language.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability of the system — ability to filter/group queries and reports by patron attributes (age range, zip, county, branch, type, language). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Examples of periodic reports: bibliographic records with holds; items that have not been checked out in X days; item-level holds; items with invalid item type; in-transit items with outstanding hold; items that have been in-transit for more than X days; items that are the last copy in the system; items with a long call number; missing items; bibliographic records with no item records; patrons with invalid home library.
AI_Rationale: The text describes examples of periodic reports the system should produce (contents of reports such as items not checked out, missing items, patrons with invalid home library). This specifies functional behavior (report generation and content). It does not state availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, scalability, portability, fault tolerance, or operability requirements explicitly.

RequirementText: Management Processes support the needs of a large, multiple-system library consortium and its individual component systems and branches. Specifically, the system must support a library consortium with 286 locations, 17 million annual circulations, purchasing and processing over 900,000 items per year. It is highly desirable that searches and reports can be processed during open hours without disrupting other system functions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must support a very large consortium and high annual volumes (286 locations, 17M circulations, 900K items/year) — this implies functional capability and scalability. The desire that searches/reports run during open hours without disrupting other functions indicates performance/concurrency requirements. No explicit availability, security, portability, maintainability, or UI constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Management Processes shall operate on a Linux or Solaris server.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the operating environment/platform the management processes must run on (Linux or Solaris), which is an operability/administration deployment constraint. This matches the provided example that labeled an OS-specific requirement as Operability.

RequirementText: Management Processes shall be accessible through a web-browser or a Windows-compatible client.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system shall be accessed (via web browser or Windows-compatible client), which is an operability/administration requirement. Also constrains supported platforms (Windows client), implying portability/platform compatibility.

RequirementText: If web-browser based, Management Processes shall be accessible through Microsoft Internet Explorer (v.6.0 and later) and Mozilla Firefox (v.2.0 and later).
AI_Rationale: Specifies supported web browsers (IE 6+ and Firefox 2+), which is a portability/compatibility requirement across client environments. Does not specify availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Management Processes shall be accessible with screen-reading software, screen-magnification software, and other software programs designed to increase accessibility.
AI_Rationale: Specifies accessibility for assistive technologies (screen readers, magnifiers), which is an accessibility/usability requirement. It does not mention availability, security, legal compliance, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Management Processes shall use a fully relational database back-end.
AI_Rationale: The requirement constrains the implementation to use a fully relational database back-end, which is primarily a portability/platform/technology constraint (PO). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, maintainability, operability, or usability concerns, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: Management Processes shall produce standards-compliant HTML.
AI_Rationale: This is a requirement that the system (Management Processes) produce HTML — a functional obligation. Requiring standards-compliant HTML implies portability/compatibility across user agents/platforms, so Portability is applicable. No explicit mention of availability, performance, security, look-and-feel, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Management Processes shall provide a development and training environment with the ability to migrate configurations to a production environment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (provide development/training environment and migrate configurations) — a functional requirement. The migration capability relates to operational/manageability of the system, so Operability is also applicable. No explicit statements about availability, security, portability, maintainability, performance, scalability, legal, or UI.

RequirementText: User rights and privileges will be controlled through security groups and/or â€œrolesâ€� that allow access control for individuals, workgroups, and arbitrary staff groups.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control via security groups/roles for users, workgroups, and staff groups, which is a security (authorization) requirement.

RequirementText: These requirements shall not constrain functionality or features of the Online Public Access Catalog (OPAC) module.
AI_Rationale: The statement concerns not constraining functionality/features of the OPAC module, which relates to functional scope/behavior. It does not specify availability, security, performance, UI, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The software developer shall provide complete data specifications for authority records, bibliographic records, order records, item records, hold/request records, and other records maintained or accessed by Management Processes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the developer shall provide complete data specifications for various record types — a statement of required system/product behavior/deliverable, i.e. a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, maintainability, operability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The software developer shall provide a thorough high-level description of major processes, including bibliographic record import and export, validation of bibliographic records against internal and external authority sources, and standard reports.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates providing high-level documentation of major processes (import/export, validation, reports). This is primarily a maintainability/documentation requirement rather than a functional behavior or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: The system shall provide an online, hierarchical, and cross-linked help system in HTML that describes and illustrates all system functions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional feature (online help system) and details about presentation (HTML, hierarchical, cross-linked) impacting look-and-feel. It also targets usability by describing/illustrating all system functions, so Usability applies. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall provide thorough high-level error reporting and feedback and shall allow low-level query-specific feedback for Local and Global System Administrators from the front-end interface.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a feature (error reporting/feedback) for system administrators (functional). It targets admin-facing capabilities delivered via the front-end, which directly supports operability/administration. Because it describes UI-facing feedback, usability is also implicated. It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, maintainability, scalability, portability, legal, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Management Processes are part of an enterprise-level Library Automation System.
AI_Rationale: Statement indicates that management processes are included as part of the system — this specifies a functional component. It does not explicitly state availability, security, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Management Processes are consolidated at a central location, and accept input and provide services to multiple locations.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes consolidation of management processes at a central location and providing services/accepting input for multiple locations, which pertains to system operation/administration and manageability. It does not explicitly state availability, scalability, functional behavior, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Management Processes rely on the data structures and functionality of an enterprise-level Library Automation System, including Acquisitions and Cataloging modules.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies dependence on another system's data structures and functionality (integration/interoperability/operability concern). It implies compatibility with an enterprise Library Automation System (portability/interoperability), but does not state functional behavior, performance, security, availability, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: Management Processes interface with a variety of vendor websites, via published APIs and/or automated transfer of standard-format data files (e.g. USMARC21, EDIFACT).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that Management Processes shall interface with vendor websites via APIs or standard-format file transfers—this is a functional interoperability requirement (F). It implies compatibility with standard formats/vendors (portability/interoperability across systems), so PO is set. No explicit availability, performance, security, operability, maintainability, legal, scalability, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Management Processes interact with a patron interface, also known as an Online Public Access Catalog (OPAC).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavioral interaction (Management Processes must interact with an OPAC), so it is functional. It also implies integration/operation with an external system, so operability applies. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, portability across platforms, usability, performance, security, maintainability, scalability, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: The system supports (but does not require) streamlined staff login methods, for example staff member swipes a card to log into a terminal or the staff member logs into a terminal by using his/her individual login and password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (staff login via card swipe or username/password), which is functional. It also emphasizes 'streamlined' login methods (convenience/usability), so Usability is applicable. It does not explicitly state security, performance, availability, or other quality attributes, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: System administrators can create reliable report templates that are available to staff, and can be run as is or modified to the staff person s particular needs. Changes in the templates could be done without comprising the results. The administrator can limit the filters and display fields that can be altered to certify a dependable output. For example, front-line staff could set the call number range for a weeding report or add or remove designated display fields from a pick list, but couldnâ€™t alter the template to display deleted items.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional capabilities (creating, providing, running, and modifying report templates) -> F. It also mandates controls on who can change template elements to ensure dependable outputs (restricting alterations like displaying deleted items), which implies authorization/integrity concerns -> SE. It describes administrative management of templates and limiting configurable options, indicating operability/administration requirements -> O. Other quality attributes (availability, performance, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, maintainability, usability, fault tolerance, legal) are not explicitly required.

RequirementText: System provides distinct, fine-grained permission levels limiting who can create and clone reports. All permissions should be easy to administer. System administrators can create shared folders to allow or disallow staff to run specific reports, and/or to run ad hoc reports on specific sets of data.
AI_Rationale: Defines functional behavior (permissions, folder management) and access-control requirements (who can run/create/clone reports) -> Security. 'All permissions should be easy to administer' implies manageability/operability for administrators -> Operability.

RequirementText: System provides a user-friendly interface for designing queries against all record types. Staff can select fields to query; select values from picklist of possible values; select regular expressions from drop-down menu, and use a full range of Boolean operators. Administrators control staff access to tables and fields.
AI_Rationale: Describes functional capabilities (query designer, field/value selection, regex, Boolean ops) -> Functional. Calls out a "user-friendly interface" -> Usability. "Administrators control staff access to tables and fields" implies access control (authorization) -> Security. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel (beyond usability), fault tolerance, or operability requirements.

RequirementText: The system provides pre-defined reports for consumption by library boards or other consumers. There will be reports providing basic statistics like those required by the Georgia Annual Report and Application for State Aid and activity reports that indicate traffic and volume of use that display statistics on check-outs, check-ins, holds placed, and holds filled. It should be possible cross-tabulated per terminal, per branch, per library system, per hour, per patron age range, per patron type, and per patron location.
AI_Rationale: The text specifies that the system shall provide pre-defined reports and the ability to cross-tabulate statistics by various dimensions, which describes system functionality (reporting features). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Transactions are archived in a form that protects patron privacy as defined by State Law, while providing useful demographic statistics.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that transactions must be archived (a functional behavior) in a manner that protects patron privacy as defined by State Law (legal compliance) and implies confidentiality/privacy controls (security). It also requires that archived data still provide useful demographic statistics, which is part of the functional archiving/reporting behavior. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, or usability are present.

RequirementText: System provides the query selections along with the results.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes system behavior (providing query selections and results), which is a functional capability. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: This application should function even in cases of wrong data insertion or wrong settings. In case of error it should provide users with appropriate help messages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the application must continue functioning despite incorrect data/settings (fault tolerance/robustness) and must present appropriate help/error messages to users (usability). No legal, performance, security, or other NFRs are implied.

RequirementText: Extraction (this feature is described in previous chapters)of the content of encrypted(locked) archives through PeaZip, shouldnâ€™t be allowed without inserting the correct password and (if existing) keyfile for authentication. Moreover, recovering the password and the keyfile that one PeaZip user has inserted or set to an archive(this feature is described in previous chapters)by any other user of the computer system or the application, through the application itself or in general the computer system. Finally, no data remains from data that have been selected to be securely deleted should be left in the storing area of the computer system after the end of the procedure of secure deletion (described in previous chapter), in case of selection of this feature.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates access control (cannot extract encrypted archives without correct password/keyfile), prevention of credential recovery by other users, and secure deletion leaving no remnants — all are security (confidentiality/authentication) requirements. It also specifies system behavior, so marked as Functional as well.

RequirementText: Operating system on the computer system, for dragging and dropping objects from computer system to the application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operating system environment to support drag-and-drop between the computer system and the application (environment/operability constraint). Also implies platform compatibility (portability). Does not state functional behavior, performance, security, or usability details explicitly.

RequirementText: MS Windows (any version) operating system on the computer system for dragging and dropping objects from the application to the computer system. Other operating systems (with which PeaZip is compatible), do not support this function of this feature.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operating system (Windows) for a feature — indicates platform compatibility (Portability) and that the system must run/operate on Windows for this function (Operability). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Re-compiling a VCD simple package into a VCD advanced package MUST be possible
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system capability — the ability to re-compile a VCD simple package into a VCD advanced package — which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Re-compiling a VCD advanced package into a VCD advanced package MUST be possible
AI_Rationale: The statement expresses a required capability of the system (ability to re-compile a VCD advanced package) — a functional requirement. It also implies a maintainability concern (supporting recompilation of packages is a developer/maintenance capability). No indication of availability, security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: A VCD service provider SHOULD be trusted to correctly process unstructured evidences into (structured) context specific data by manual means in order to create context specific data using the semi-automated approach.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the VCD provider should perform the processing of unstructured evidence into structured context-specific data (functional behavior). It also expresses a trust/integrity expectation about correct processing, implying security-related concerns (data integrity/trustworthiness). No explicit availability, performance, legal, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, operability, or fault-tolerance requirements are stated.

RequirementText: There MUST be an access policy that is issued by the economic operator that mandates a contracting authority to request attestation from the national VCD service provider on demand.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: an access policy must be issued that mandates requesting attestation on demand (functional). It also concerns access control and attestation, which are security-related requirements. It does not specify availability, performance, legal, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A general reference structure and syntax MUST be defined. This may include creating contracting authority specific or VCD specific references in order to identify a mandate that has been given by the economic operator to this contracting authority for retrieving attestation or even updates on it.
AI_Rationale: Specifies defining a reference structure and syntax to identify mandates — a functional requirement about system behavior/data format. Does not explicitly state availability, security, legal, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: National and local political commitments and service-level agreements MUST ensure that consensuses on roles and responsibilities are built with regard to this solution and in particular the National Service Providers who delivers attestations on demand.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates political commitments and SLAs to establish consensuses on roles/responsibilities and obligations of National Service Providers—this is primarily a legal/compliance/policy requirement. It also concerns operational arrangements and manageability (who performs attestations, SLAs), so Operability is applicable. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security mechanisms, or availability metrics.

RequirementText: There MUST be a service-level agreement between the parties involved (Economic Operators, Contracting authorities, National Service Providers, and Trusted Attestation Service) about the response time of a delivery of attestations and data availability.
AI_Rationale: Specifies service-level agreement addressing response time (performance) and data availability (availability). No other quality attributes (security, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: There MUST be a service-level agreement between the parties involved (Economic Operators, Contracting authorities, National Service Providers, and Trusted Attestation Service) about conflict resolution that describe what to do when errors occur or when attestation or translations cannot be delivered â€œon demandâ€�.
AI_Rationale: Requires a service-level agreement addressing conflict resolution for errors and when attestation/translations cannot be delivered on demand. This signals Availability concerns (service delivery) and Fault Tolerance (handling errors/unavailable service), and is contractual/legal in nature (SLA) so Legal applies. No explicit functional, security, performance, or other quality requirements stated.

RequirementText: The attestations where an agreement on context specific formats can be reached most easily SHOULD be included first into the network.
AI_Rationale: Specifies behavior/policy about which attestations to include first in the network (ordering/inclusion), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: WP2 SHOULD provide easy solutions for displaying context specific data and should enable their validation through validation values
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies providing solutions to display context-specific data and enabling validation — these describe functional capabilities. The wording 'easy solutions' implies a usability requirement (ease of use), not visual design or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Legal systems MUST ensure that context specific data and validation values have an equivalent value to the provision of conventional / traditional attestations. (Scope of mutual recognition).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies legal/mutual-recognition equivalence between context-specific data/validation and traditional attestations, which is a compliance/legal constraint rather than a functional, security, or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: The National Service Providers SHOULD establish validation points in order to approve an economic operator in accordance with Article 52 (1) of Directive 2004/18/EC.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that National Service Providers establish validation points to approve economic operators — this specifies an action (functional). It also explicitly references compliance with Article 52(1) of Directive 2004/18/EC, making it a legal/regulatory requirement. No explicit quality attributes like availability, security, or performance are stated.

RequirementText: The national procurement law MUST ensure that National Service Provider can act as national validation points in accordance with Article 52 (1) of Directive 2004/18/EC for economic operators.
AI_Rationale: This requirement references compliance with a specific EU directive and mandates legal/regulatory authority (national procurement law) to ensure a role; it is a legal/regulatory constraint. It does not specify system functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: National procedures with regard to Article 52 (1) of Directive 2004/18/EC MUST be mutually recognized and trusted in across borders.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates mutual recognition and trust of national procedures with regard to a specific EU directive, which is a legal/regulatory compliance requirement. It does not explicitly specify security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The main subject of the VCD is the final submission of evidence to the contracting authority
AI_Rationale: This statement defines what the VCD should contain (the main subject is the final submission of evidence), which is a functional requirement about system/content behavior. It does not specify availability, security, legal compliance, UI, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: A list of recognized public authorities that are able to issue certain attestations in a particular Member State MUST be established.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies establishing a list (data/functionality) of recognized public authorities — this is a functional requirement about what the system must provide. It does not specify non-functional qualities like availability, security, legal compliance, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: A list of recognized private entities that are able to issue certain attestations in a particular Member State SHOULD be established.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies establishing/maintaining a list of entities — this describes a functional behavior (data/list to be created). It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal compliance, or other non-functional qualities, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Widely accepted national procedures and infrastructures SHOULD be utilized wherever possible.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates using widely accepted national procedures and infrastructures, which indicates compliance with national standards/regulations (legal/standards constraint). It does not explicitly specify functional behavior, performance, availability, security, or usability aspects.

RequirementText: A national authority MUST support critical processes in order to increase the trust between the entities involved.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies that the national authority must support critical processes—this describes a required system capability (functional). The goal to "increase the trust between the entities involved" implies a security/assurance concern, so Security is marked. Other quality attributes (availability, scalability, fault tolerance, etc.) are not explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: Any national pilot solution that will be developed in the context of PEPPOL WP2 has to follow the preVCD mapping defined in stage 1. Conformance between the processing of different national VCD services has to be ensured, monitored and surveyed by a European VCD service provider that needs to be set up with defined responsibilities and procedures. The European VCD service provider will maintain the common descriptions and monitor the development of the national solutions and assess their conformance to a common European interface (i.e. the pre-VCD mapping tool).
AI_Rationale: The text mandates that national pilot solutions must follow a specific mapping (functional requirement). It also requires establishment of a European VCD service provider to maintain common descriptions, monitor development, and assess conformance—activities related to maintainability (keeping descriptions, ensuring conformance) and operability/manageability (monitoring, defined responsibilities and procedures). It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, look&feel, or explicit legal constraints.

RequirementText: National implementations of VCD systems and their functions are no subject to discussions and agreements between WP partners as long as they follow common interoperability guidelines that will be monitored by the European VCD Service Provider.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates adherence to common interoperability guidelines and monitoring by a central service provider, which concerns cross-system compatibility (portability/interoperability) and governance/operability (monitoring/management). It does not specify functional behavior, availability, security, performance, scalability, or UI/maintainability, so those labels are set to false.

RequirementText: A national pilot solution may implement attestation validation feature but proof of conformance and checking is not a mandatory feature that has to be fulfilled by a national service provider.
AI_Rationale: This statement describes an optional feature (attestation validation) and clarifies that proof of conformance/checking is not mandatory for providers — it specifies what the system may implement, i.e., a functional feature. It does not impose availability, security, legal, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Any of the proposed stages SHOULD be applicable within a Member State who wishes to apply Article 52 and EFTA EEA Committee decision 68/2006.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies applicability within Member States in relation to Article 52 and a specific EFTA EEA Committee decision, which is a legal/regulatory requirement. It does not describe functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A Member State MUST formally define an authority that is able to provide a proof of conformance to certain criteria if the Member State wishes to implement Article 52 or if Article 52 is already implemented.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that a Member State formally define an authority and pertains to regulatory/organizational compliance with Article 52. This is a legal/standards/governance requirement rather than a software functional or quality attribute.

RequirementText: The contracting authority has to specify a subset of the superset of criteria that is relevant to a specific Call for Tender so that any VCD application can perform the mapping later on
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability: the contracting authority must specify a subset of criteria for a Call for Tender (functional). The clause ‘so that any VCD application can perform the mapping later on’ implies interoperability/compatibility across applications, which aligns with portability. No explicit availability, performance, security, legal, usability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Any VCD system must have an interface to provide tender-specific data and (in particular the relevant criteria subset) in order to perform the mapping.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must provide an interface to supply tender-specific data (including criteria subset) to perform mapping — this is a functional requirement describing required system behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, legal, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Liability issues of the National Service Providers MUST be clarified when they act as national validation points in accordance with Article 52 (1) of Directive 2004/18/EC for economic operators.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns clarification of liability in accordance with a legal directive (Article 52(1) of Directive 2004/18/EC), which is a legal/compliance constraint. It does not specify system functionality, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Merging of VCD simple packages and VCD advanced packages into a VCD advanced package SHOULD be possible
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (the system should allow merging simple and advanced VCD packages into an advanced package), which is a functional requirement. It does not state non-functional qualities such as performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Member State of this work package SHOULD follow a common standard representation of the different types of data
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of a common standard for data representation (format/interoperability across Member States). This is a portability/interoperability constraint rather than a functional behavior.

RequirementText: Every pilot partner MUST follow the common standard schema of context specific data by defining a national version of it.
AI_Rationale: Requires pilot partners to adhere to a common standard schema and define a national version — this is a compliance/standards requirement (Legal). It also impacts maintainability/interoperability of data definitions over time (Maintainability). No explicit functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: It has MUST be clearly defined which economic operator data are not-sensitive and belong to VCD system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates defining which economic operator data are non-sensitive and belong to the VCD system. This pertains to data classification, confidentiality and compliance: therefore Security (data protection) applies. It also touches on legal/compliance aspects (data ownership/sensitivity policies), so Legal is marked. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are explicitly required.

RequirementText: User rights for the VCD system MUST be defined.
AI_Rationale: Specifying user rights is an access-control requirement, i.e., security (authentication/authorization). It does not state availability, performance, UI, or maintainability aspects, so only SE is set.

RequirementText: Structural data of evidence MUST be defined.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the structural data of evidence must be defined—this is a requirement about what the system/data must provide (a data/schema definition), i.e., functional. No explicit reliability, security, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Semantic interoperability of structural data of evidence SHOULD be ensured through an agreement procedure among the WP partners.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies ensuring semantic interoperability of structural data via agreement among partners—this concerns compatibility and data portability/interop across systems rather than functional behavior or other qualities. No explicit references to availability, performance, security, usability, maintainability, or legal compliance are made.

RequirementText: The evidence submitted to the VCD system MUST be eligible for the requirements mentioned by Â§Â§45â€“ 46 of European Directive 2004/18/EC.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates conformance to specific sections of a European Directive, which is a legal/compliance constraint. It does not specify functionality, performance, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Both parties involved, contracting authorities and economic operators, MUST have an electronic address for receiving/sending VCD packages.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required capability/attribute (that both parties must have an electronic address for sending/receiving VCD packages). This is a functional requirement about system behavior/communication prerequisites, not about availability, security, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The transport of a VCD package MUST be initiated by the economic operator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint on system behavior: who must initiate the transport of a VCD package (the economic operator). No explicit non-functional quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The choice of how to submit the VCD package to the contracting authority MUST be the one that is preferred by the economic operator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: submission method must match the economic operator's preference (functional). Also relates to user-centric requirement about accommodating user preference/experience (usability). No indication of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Beside the transportation system (WP8) the economic operator SHOULD be able to use other electronic channels for submitting a VCD package to the contracting authority.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability: economic operators should be able to use alternative electronic channels to submit a VCD package. This describes functional behavior (allowed actions). It does not specify availability, security, usability, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It MUST be clarified which possibilities exist to utilize the infrastructure for submitting a VCD package directly to procurement platforms (e.g. via VPN).
AI_Rationale: The requirement asks to clarify how to utilize infrastructure for submitting packages (e.g., via VPN) which concerns how the system is operated/used and integrated with procurement platforms—an operability/administration concern. It does not specify functional behavior, security, portability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The transportation system MUST ensure that the VCD package is being delivered to the contracting authority.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the system must ensure delivery of a package to the contracting authority). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The transport of a VCD package MUST ensure that the package has not been altered or modified during transportation or validation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies integrity of the package during transport/validation (protection against alteration), which is a security property. It does not state functionality beyond enforcing integrity nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Non-repudiation of origin of a VCD package MUST be supported.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies non-repudiation of origin, which is a security property (authentication/assurance that origin cannot be denied). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A VCD will carry a unique identifier and information about security and quality enhancing policies used by the certified VCD Service Provider when compiling the file.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that a VCD shall carry a unique identifier and metadata about security and quality-enhancing policies — this is a functional requirement (data the system must include). Because it explicitly references security policies and security-related information, the Security label is also applicable. Other NFR categories are not implied.

RequirementText: If there are multiple ways to provide evidence the choice of selecting a specific issuing service is left to the requester.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies system behavior/decision logic about who may select an issuing service when multiple evidence provision methods exist — a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Member State of this work package SHOULD define a national version of the common standard representation of the different types of data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that a Member State define a national version of the common standard representation of data types — this describes an action/functional obligation (F). It primarily concerns data representation/interoperability across environments, implying portability/compatibility considerations (PO). No explicit availability, security, legal, usability, performance, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, or operability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Any standard representation of the different types of data MUST be agreed upon the pilot partners.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates agreement on a standard representation (data formats) among pilot partners, which is primarily about compatibility/interoperability across environments—i.e., portability. It does not specify functional behavior, availability, security, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A method (e.g. reverse engineering) to develop a standard representation of the different types of data SHOULD be defined.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies defining a method/process to create a standard data representation, which primarily supports maintainability (consistent models ease future changes) and portability/interoperability (standard representations aid data exchange). It does not describe system functionality, performance, security, or UI.

RequirementText: A method for the versioning of the development of this common standard schema SHOULD be found.
AI_Rationale: The requirement asks for a versioning method for the schema development, which is primarily a maintainability concern (practices to manage changes and evolution). It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, usability, legal, scalability, portability, or operability.

RequirementText: Any VCD advanced package MUST follow a common standard schema of context specific data that summarize and structure major information contained within context specific evidences.
AI_Rationale: Requires adherence to a common standard schema for data, which is primarily a portability/interoperability constraint (compatibility of data formats). No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, UI, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Evidences that have a simple structure and limited variety of contents MUST be included into the common standard schema first.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a processing rule/behavior: evidences with simple structure and limited content must be included in the common standard schema first — a functional inclusion/prioritization requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: WP2 SHOULD provide easy solutions for transforming the contents of context specific evidence into simple context specific representations (e.g. a Balance sheet can have several values but an easy representation could be the fulfilment of certain ranges for example below 1 Million / from 1 Million to 10 / â€¦).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that WP2 should provide solutions (functional behavior) and emphasizes 'easy' solutions and simple representations, implying usability concerns. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: A semantic definition of each element/class of the common standard schema of context specific data MUST be created and has to ensure a common understanding.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates creating semantic definitions for schema elements — this is a functional obligation (F). It explicitly aims to ensure a common understanding, which relates to understandability/usability (US). Other quality attributes (e.g., maintainability, interoperability) are not explicitly stated, so they are not marked.

RequirementText: A semantic definition of each element/class of the common standard schema of context specific data MUST ensure that these data is mutually recognized as replacement of the official translation of an evidences included.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a semantic definition and a guarantee that context-specific data are recognized as replacements for official translations—this describes required system behavior (interoperability/semantic processing), so it's primarily functional. It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal compliance, portability, usability, performance, or other quality attributes, so those labels were not set.

RequirementText: A method and agreement procedure to develop a common standard schema of context specific data MUST be defined. This procedure must cover the technical aspects of data analysis (e.g. reverse engineering) as well as the organizational aspects (e.g. which context specific data is required from contracting authorities or under which circumstances would they would replace certified translation of evidence by context specific data).
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that a method and procedure be defined (a functional/requirements statement). It focuses on establishing standard schemas and organizational procedures for data exchange, which relates to maintainability (consistent schemas ease maintenance) and operability/administration (procedures for authorities and handling translations). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, legal compliance, usability, performance, scalability, portability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Any common standard schema of context specific data classes MUST be agreed upon the pilot partners.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates agreeing on a common standard schema for data classes among pilot partners, which primarily addresses interoperability/compatibility (portability) and the ability to operate/integrate across partners (operability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, legal compliance, UI, or maintainability explicitly.

RequirementText: Representation of context specific data SHOULD be available in multiple languages
AI_Rationale: Requires the system to provide content in multiple languages (a functional capability/localization). This also implies portability/internationalization across language environments and affects usability for multilingual users. No mention of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: A method for versioning the development of common standard schema of context specific data SHOULD be found.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies establishing a method for versioning schema development, which primarily concerns maintainability (managing changes, evolution, and traceability). It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, portability, or usability.

RequirementText: An economic operator MUST be able to act as an issuing body for candidate statements or other evidence that cannot be directly or electronically retrieved by the VCD system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system/user must provide: an economic operator must be able to act as an issuing body for statements/evidence. This describes functional behavior (what must be possible). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The pre-VCD mapping tool (Stage 1) MUST be filled with instances (defined) by every Member State since Stage 1 is a precondition for any other stage.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a mandatory functional action/constraint: the pre-VCD mapping tool (Stage 1) must be completed by every Member State and is a precondition for other stages. It describes required system/process behavior rather than availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The VCD solutions MUST be tested in specific cases by re-processing historical tenders. The testing SHOULD be repeated regularly and especially after up-dating of software. A national solution will only be authorized to operate cross-border when all tests are passed; the testing has to be maintained and monitored by the European VCD Service Provider. Stakeholder MUST be found in order to re-process historical tenders.
AI_Rationale: The requirement prescribes mandatory testing, authorization conditions for cross-border operation, and that testing must be maintained and monitored by a specified provider. This imposes regulatory/compliance constraints (Legal). It specifies testing after updates and ongoing testing processes, indicating maintainability concerns. It also mandates monitoring and operational responsibility by the European VCD Service Provider, which is an operability/administration requirement. Other categories (performance, security, usability, etc.) are not implied.

RequirementText: Relevant regulations of national data protection acts MUST be analysed and considered.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates analysis and consideration of national data protection regulations, which is a legal/compliance requirement (L). It also implies security/privacy concerns (SE) around handling protected data, so security is applicable. No other quality attributes are indicated.

RequirementText: Additional requirements for cross-border data exchange MUST be analysed and considered.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns cross-border data exchange, which strongly implies legal/compliance considerations (data protection, jurisdictional regulations). It also implies security/privacy concerns for data transferred across borders, so Security is set. No explicit mention of functionality, portability, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: It MUST be clarified which prospects and limitations exists within a Member State to separate a VCD package from the tender itself.
AI_Rationale: The requirement asks to clarify legal prospects and limitations within a Member State regarding separation of a VCD package from a tender, which pertains to regulatory/legal constraints and compliance. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A trust model and trust system MUST be defined from a legal point of view for every process which includes the roles and responsibilities of the entities involved.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates defining a trust model/system 'from a legal point of view' and specifies roles and responsibilities—this is a legal/compliance requirement. It does not explicitly state functional behavior, security controls, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Electronic signature, with the same legal meaning of handwritten signature, SHOULD be encouraged in cross-border scenario.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns legal equivalence and encouragement of electronic signatures in cross-border scenarios, which is a legal/compliance constraint. It does not explicitly specify functional behavior, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The regulations concerning the use of electronic documents, the exchange or download of electronic documents (e.g. mandatory usage of an e-signature) MUST be considered (especially regulations from national procurement act and directive 2004/18/EC).
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly cites regulations and legal directives (national procurement act, directive 2004/18/EC) and mandates consideration of legal rules for electronic documents and e-signatures, which is a legal/compliance requirement. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A process for document handling compliant with the relevant legal regulations MUST be defined (especially with respect to the data protection acts).
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates compliance with legal regulations (legal/regulatory requirement). It specifically mentions data protection acts, which implies security/privacy concerns, so Security is also applicable. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: It MUST be clarified how the governance model of WP2 fits into the overall governance model of WP8.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns clarifying how governance of one work package integrates with overall governance—an administrative/management concern related to operation and administration of the project/system. It does not specify functionality, performance, security, legal compliance, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: WP2 stakeholders MUST be authenticated to the VCD system and for the PEPPOL infrastructure.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates authentication of stakeholders to specific systems, which is a security (access control) requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects, nor detailed functional behavior beyond authentication.

RequirementText: The identity and access management procedures for creating a VCD account SHOULD be harmonized with the registration procedure of the overall infrastructure provided by WP 8.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates harmonization of identity and access management procedures with the overall infrastructure registration: this directly concerns security (IAM alignment, authn/authz) and operational integration/administration. It does not specify availability, performance, portability, scalability, UI, legal, maintainability, or fault-tolerance aspects explicitly.

RequirementText: A single-sign-on SHOULD be implemented in order to allow identity and access management across different systems.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies implementing single-sign-on as a system capability (functional) to provide identity and access management across systems, which is primarily a security concern (authentication/authorization). No explicit availability, portability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: A method MUST be found how to allocate identifiers to the participants that use the infrastructure for transportation of VCDs and related services
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates finding a method to allocate identifiers to participants — this describes a functional need (mechanism for identifier allocation). It also implies security concerns (identity/participant identification and likely authentication/authorization), and has an operational/administrative aspect (managing participant identifiers within the infrastructure). Other quality attributes (availability, performance, portability, etc.) are not explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: Every party participating MUST be uniquely identifiable.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that each participating party be uniquely identifiable, which is a functional constraint on system behavior (assign/maintain unique identities). It also implies a security concern (authentication/accountability/identity management). No mention of availability, performance, usability, legal, etc., so those are not set.

RequirementText: Every party participating SHOULD have a secure and verifiable electronic address.
AI_Rationale: Requires participants to have a secure and verifiable electronic address—this is a security requirement (confidentiality/authenticity/verifiability). It does not specify availability, performance, UI, legal, or other qualities.

RequirementText: In stage 4 it MUST be possible to discover the verified electronic address for an identified party.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (ability to discover a verified electronic address in stage 4), which is functional. It does not explicitly state security, availability, performance, or other quality attributes, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: It MUST be clarified which are the best access points for economic operators to use the infrastructure for transportation of a VCD package.
AI_Rationale: The statement requests clarification of best access points for operators to use the infrastructure—this is about operational use/administration (operability). It does not specify functional behavior, usability metrics, security, performance or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: It MUST be clarified whether the possibility exist to have access to web clients via the infrastructure in order to have access to specific web services which depend upon functionalities provided by the infrastructure.
AI_Rationale: The statement asks whether it is possible to access web clients via the infrastructure to reach specific web services — this is a capability/functional concern (what the system should allow). It does not explicitly specify security, availability, performance, or other quality attributes, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: It MUST be clarified whether tendering platforms enable a separated submission of a VCD and the bid itself.
AI_Rationale: The statement asks whether the platform provides the capability to submit a VCD separately from the bid—this concerns system functionality/capability. It does not specify availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The PEPPOL infrastructure MUST have the capability to submit a VCD to a contracting authority or tendering platform.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (submit a VCD) — a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The PEPPOL infrastructure SHOULD have the capability to submit a bid which contains a VCD.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system should provide — submitting a bid containing a VCD — which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It MUST be possible to guarantee confidentiality for specific documents.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates guaranteeing confidentiality for specific documents, which is a security property (confidentiality/access control). It does not mention functionality, availability, legal compliance, performance, maintainability, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It MUST be possible to apply the validation service provided by WP1 to a VCD in order to enable economic operators to guarantee data integrity and confidentiality of a VCD.
AI_Rationale: The requirement states a capability must exist to apply a validation service to a VCD (functional). It explicitly aims to guarantee data integrity and confidentiality, which are security concerns, so SE is set. No other quality attributes (availability, scalability, maintainability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: It MUST be clarified whether the VCD can use the validation service of WP1 if the transportation infrastructure is not used by an economic operator
AI_Rationale: The statement requests clarification about whether VCD may use a validation service under a specific condition (use by an economic operator). This pertains to policy/eligibility/legal constraints rather than specifying functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It MUST be assured that business document instances are consistent and correct during transportation, validation or transformation operations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement focuses on ensuring document consistency and correctness (integrity) during transport, validation, or transformation—this maps to security concerns (data integrity). It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, functionality, performance, or other quality attributes, so only Security is marked.

RequirementText: Authentication of origin for business document instances MUST be supported.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies supporting authentication of origin for business documents, which is a security concern (authenticity/provenance). It does not mention availability, performance, UI, legal, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Time stamping SHOULD be applied in some processes to certify relevant date and time.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates applying time stamping in processes (a functional behavior) and implies security properties (certifying date/time, supporting integrity/non-repudiation). It does not explicitly address availability, performance, legal compliance, or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: The compilation suggestion that is given to the economic operator by the VCD system MUST be reliable with regard to fulfilment of tender-specific requirements.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system's compilation suggestion must be reliable (dependable/correct) with regard to fulfilling tender-specific requirements. This is a non-functional quality about dependability/resilience of output rather than uptime, security, or usability. Of the available labels, fault-tolerance/dependability is the closest match. No explicit functional behavior, legal, performance, or other qualities are stated.

RequirementText: Regulations for handling the non-existence of selected evidence requested in a MS MUST be defined and made operational.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates defining and operationalizing procedures for handling cases when requested evidence is missing. This implies fault-tolerance/resilience (handling failures or missing inputs) and relates to operability/administration (making processes operational). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, legal compliance, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: The electronic procurement framework MUST support organizations of any size and industry.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies support for organizations of any size and industry—implies portability/adaptability across environments (PO) and capacity to scale to different sizes (SC). No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, legal, or other NFRs mentioned.

RequirementText: Special legal regulations for evidences MUST be considered (e.g. for extract from the register of conviction).
AI_Rationale: Specifies compliance with legal regulations regarding evidence (e.g., extracts from conviction register). This is a legal/regulatory requirement, not functional or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A suitable way to establish the relevant regulations for the National Service Provider MUST be defined (e.g. special legal regulations concerning VCD service provision).
AI_Rationale: Specifies defining relevant legal regulations for the National Service Provider (examples cite special legal regulations). This is a legal/compliance requirement; no explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Evidential documents exchanged between parties MUST be semantically harmonized in order to be processed electronically.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates semantic harmonization of exchanged documents to enable electronic processing — this is an interoperability/compatibility constraint (portability) and pertains to the system's ability to operate/process exchanged data (operability). It does not specify security, performance, scalability, legal, UI, or maintainability aspects.

RequirementText: The electronic procurement process MUST have an audit trailing to ensure transparency for both parties.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must provide an audit trail (a specific functional capability) to ensure transparency/accountability, which relates to security (auditability/non-repudiation). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: National criteria for qualitative selection and exclusion MUST correspond to European criteria which are derived from Article 45-50 and which are partially described in the Eligibility of Tenders.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies compliance with European legal criteria (Article 45-50 / Eligibility of Tenders), which is a regulatory/legal constraint rather than a functional behavior or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: National criteria SHOULD be consistent among themselves and with European criteria.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates consistency with European criteria, which indicates standards/regulatory alignment (legal/compliance concern). It does not specify functional behavior, usability, performance, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Any VCD instance MUST be specific with regards to a certain economic operator.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a required behavior/constraint of the system data model (each VCD instance must be specific to an economic operator), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Any VCD instance SHOULD be specific with regards to a certain tender.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional constraint on VCD instances (they must be specific to a particular tender). It describes what the system/data should be, not a quality attribute like performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: When implementing any tool, system or service WP2 MUST focus on mandatory requirements and evidences mentioned in Articles 45 and 46 first since theses Articles are not tender-specific and therewith relevant for nearly all tenders.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates focusing on mandatory requirements and evidences from Articles 45 and 46, which indicates legal/compliance obligations applicable across tenders. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes, so only Legal is set.

RequirementText: The mapping between evidences via requirements MUST have set a primary focus on the mandatory requirements and evidences of a VCD.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a required behavior of the system/process (how mapping between evidences must prioritize mandatory requirements/evidences). It does not mention availability, legal, security, performance, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Articles 47 to 50 open a wide range of different criteria which are tender- and country-specific thus they MUST be added stepwise to the pre-VCD mapping tool (which may require a higher-level mapping).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability of the pre-VCD mapping tool (that country- and tender-specific criteria from Articles 47–50 must be added stepwise and may require higher-level mapping) — a functional requirement. It also implies maintainability/modularity concerns (stepwise addition and higher-level mapping architecture) rather than availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Any VCD system SHOULD provide the opportunity to the economic operator to produce a complete VCD even if there are several issuing services that are not under control of a national service provider, do not have specific mapping to other documents defined in the pre-VCD mapping tool and have to be provided by the economic operator manually.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the VCD system should provide (allow an economic operator to manually include issuing services to produce a complete VCD). This is a functional behavior request; it does not specify availability, security, UI/look-and-feel, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability constraints.

RequirementText: Any VCD system provides the functionality to add additional documents through placeholders.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (ability to add documents via placeholders), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes like performance, security, usability, or legal constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: Interfaces to submit evidence to the VCD system have to be defined along with common semantics in order to allow issuing bodies to further specify evidence with regard to structural data, context specific data and validation values.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that interfaces and common semantics for submitting evidence must be defined — this describes system functionality (providing interfaces) and implies interoperability/compatibility across issuing bodies (portability). It does not mention availability, security, performance, scalability, legal, or UI/look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: Develop a format that allows the presentation and displaying of the contents of a VCD package.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies developing a format to present/display contents of a VCD package, which describes a functional capability. No explicit non-functional aspects (performance, security, UI standards, portability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The scope of mutual recognition needs to be further clarified with regard to the provision of official scans.
AI_Rationale: The statement refers to 'scope of mutual recognition' and 'provision of official scans', which implies legal/regulatory clarification about recognition and acceptance of documents. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The scope of mutual recognition needs to be further clarified with regard to the role of candidate statements.
AI_Rationale: The sentence requests clarification of the scope and role of 'mutual recognition' and 'candidate statements', which pertains to defining system behavior/requirements (functional). The term 'mutual recognition' implies regulatory or legal meaning, so a legal label is also applicable. No explicit mentions of security, performance, availability, usability, portability, scalability, operability, fault tolerance or maintainability.

RequirementText: It has to be defined which method and concept should be applied if there are missing attestations.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies that a method/concept must be defined for handling missing attestations — this describes required system behavior (how to handle a condition), so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It has to be guaranteed whether the directive is correctly implemented in national procurement law with regard to VCD relevant articles 45-52.

RequirementText: Centralized or decentralized infrastructure?
