RequirementText: By which technical means will the mapping be provided? The technical means to provide the mapping service has to be defined in dependence on the choice of the pilot solution. The simplest form without any technical support could for example consist in the one-time distribution of mapping tables in paper-based form. Another solution could consist of a web-based access to a system providing the mapping by querying an underlying database which contains the mapping table. A more advanced solution would be an automated processing of the mapping according to the relevant criteria that therefore have to be specified by the contracting authority in a dedicated electronic format. Also the higher maturity levels defined in this vision (stage 2-4) can use the mapping service in order to retrieve the mapping information. It MUST be defined by which technical means the mapping service will be provided.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates defining the technical means/implementation and delivery method for the mapping service (paper, web-based, automated), which concerns how the system is operated, deployed and administered. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Which entity will host the mapping facility? In dependence of the choice of infrastructures (centralised â€“ decentralized) and the organisation that governs the infrastructure and mapping facility it has to be defined who will be responsible to host the mapping facility. An entity that hosts the mapping facility MUST be defined in dependence of the type of infrastructure and the dedicated governing model.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies which entity is responsible for hosting the mapping facility depending on infrastructure and governance choices—this concerns operational/administrative responsibility (who will operate/host/manage the system). It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, availability, legal compliance, or UI concerns, so only Operability is set.

RequirementText: Liability: In law a legal liability is a situation in which a person or organisation is financially and legally responsible. The liability of the organisation that governs infrastructure and mapping facility has to be defined in order to ensure trust into the system and particular mapping results? â€¢ The Liability of organisation that governs the infrastructure and mapping facility MUST be defined
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates definition of organisational liability — a legal/compliance constraint. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Sustainability: Sustainability is the capacity to maintain a certain process or state into the future. The governing model must ensure that the state of the mapping system will be kept over time. Therefore the mapping system has to be based on the commonly agreed mapping and no changes are allowed without a common agreement. â€¢ The mapping facility MUST ensure sustainability of the system over time based on commonly agreed mapping schemes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates maintaining the system state over time and restricting changes to a commonly agreed scheme. This addresses maintainability/sustainability (MN). The need for changes only by common agreement implies governance/compliance constraints, mapped to Legal (L). It does not specify availability, security, performance, scalability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The mapping facility MUST be accessible to all relevant key stakeholders such as economic operators, contracting authorities, certifiers and national service providers.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the facility must be accessible to multiple stakeholder groups — implying availability/reachability and controlled access for those groups (authorization). It does not mention UI/usability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The interaction between mapping facility and Publication Body / Contracting Authority SHOULD be defined in order to simplify the procedure to retrieve the relevant criteria for a particular Call for Tender.
AI_Rationale: The requirement requests that the interaction/interface between the mapping facility and external bodies be defined to simplify retrieval of criteria — this specifies a system capability (functional) and concerns defining interfaces/procedures for integration/operation (operability). It does not explicitly state performance, security, legal, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance constraints.

RequirementText: It MUST be clearly defined which economic operator data are sensitive and belong to identity and access management.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies identifying which operator data are sensitive and belong to identity and access management, which is a security/privacy classification. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A single-sign on SHOULD be implemented in order to allow identity and access management across different systems.
AI_Rationale: The requirement requests implementing single sign-on (a functional capability) to enable identity and access management, which is primarily a security concern (authentication/authorization). The phrase 'across different systems' implies cross-system interoperability/portability.

RequirementText: The identity and access management procedures for creating a VCD account SHOULD be harmonized with the registration procedure of the overall infrastructure provided by WP8.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns harmonizing identity and access management (IAM) procedures with overall infrastructure registration, which directly relates to security (authentication/authorization processes). It also implies administrative/operational alignment (manageability/operability) of account creation procedures, so Operability is set. Other quality attributes are not explicitly indicated.

RequirementText: The rule set derived from legal requirements concerning â€œevidence checkingâ€� MUST be defined.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly refers to legal requirements and mandates defining a rule set derived from them, so Legal applies. It also implies a requirement about defining/maintaining rule definitions (structure/management), so Maintainability is relevant. No explicit functional behavior, performance, security, availability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST have the status of a trusted system.
AI_Rationale: Stating the system must have the status of a 'trusted system' refers to trustworthiness, integrity and assurance properties—i.e., security-related requirements. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Superset of evidences: The formal representation will become necessary as a reference data set for the mapping operations showing the relationship between all attestations.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies that a formal representation (a reference data set) is required for mapping operations showing relationships between attestations—this describes a needed system artifact/functional capability. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The right granularity and consistency of criteria MUST be found through testing and iterative redefinition in order to ensure legitimacy and to retrieve adequate mapping results.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates finding appropriate granularity/consistency of criteria through testing and iteration to ensure legitimacy and to retrieve adequate mapping results. It includes a functional aspect (retrieving adequate mapping results) and concerns the process of refining criteria through testing—an aspect of maintainability/evolution of the system. No explicit statements about availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, operability, or usability are made.

RequirementText: VCD system MUST be operated by at least one national VCD service provider
AI_Rationale: Specifies who must operate the system (operation/administration constraint). This is an operability/administration requirement rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Transport mechanisms between partyâ€™s addresses MUST be secure.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that transport mechanisms must be secure, which directly addresses security (confidentiality/integrity of communications). It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A functionality to display context specific data SHOULD/MUST be included within any VCD.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a required capability ('functionality to display... must be included'), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, UI appearance, usability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide a user-interface to the economic operator to initiate the creation of a VCD advanced package.
AI_Rationale: This statement explicitly requires the system to provide a user-interface for initiating creation of a VCD advanced package, which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide a user-interface to the economic operator to provide existing VCD packages of other economic operators when specific disclosure options have been activated.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability: providing a user-interface that allows an economic operator to provide existing VCD packages when disclosure options are activated. This describes functional behavior (what the system must do). It does not specify quality attributes like usability, security, availability, or performance.

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide a functionality to check, whether the structural VCD package data of existing VCD packages of other economic operators are consistent with the VCD advanced package schema of other economic operators, or not
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (provide functionality to check consistency of VCD package data against a schema), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide a functionality to check, whether the tender specific data of existing VCD packages are consistent with the tender specific data of other VCD packages.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (providing a functionality to check consistency of tender-specific data across VCD packages), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects such as performance, security, availability, usability, or others.

RequirementText: A standard representation of common criteria of qualitative selection and exclusion MUST be defined according to Articles 45-50 of Directive 2004/18/EC.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates conformity with specific articles of Directive 2004/18/EC, indicating legal/compliance intent (L=1). It also specifies that the system must define a standard representation (a functional behavior/feature), so F=1. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are mentioned or strongly implied.

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide functionality to compile the data which result from the evidence collection process and the data provided by the economic operator in the VCD advanced package creation. The types of data which have to be compiled into a VCD advanced package are therefore: - Structural VCD package data - Structural data of evidence - Tender specific data - Economic operator data - Context specific data - Evidence - Authorized translation of evidence
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must provide functionality to compile various specified data types into a VCD advanced package — this describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: VCD system MUST provide a user-interface to the economic operator to initiate the recompilation of an existing VCD package into a VCD advanced package.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must provide a user interface allowing an operator to initiate recompilation of a VCD package. No non-functional quality (availability, performance, security, etc.) is specified.

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide a user-interface to the economic operator for uploading an existing VCD package
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (provide a user-interface for uploading a VCD package), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide a functionality to decompose an existing VCD package
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system capability (ability to decompose an existing VCD package), which is a functional requirement; no quality/constraints (availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide a functionality to identify outdated or obsolete evidences
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (functionality to identify outdated/obsolete evidence), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: A VCD system must provide a functionality to retrieve actual instances of outdated evidences
AI_Rationale: This is a statement of required functionality — the system must provide a feature to retrieve instances of outdated evidence. It specifies what the system should do, not a quality attribute.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST provide functionality and an interface to the economic operator that enables him to mandate a certain contracting authority to request attestations on demand.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (functionality and an interface to allow an operator to mandate a contracting authority to request attestations on demand). It describes what the system should do, with no explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: A VCD system MUST provide functionality to merge the following data from several existing VCD packages of other economic operators: - Structural VCD package data - Structural data of evidence - Tender specific data - Economic operator data - Context specific data - Evidence - Authorized translation of evidence
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies a functional capability: the VCD system must provide functionality to merge various categories of data from existing VCD packages. It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, etc., so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST provide a functionality that enables National VCD Service Providers to store attestations.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system functionality (ability to store attestations) and does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes; therefore it is a Functional requirement only.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST detect which attestations can be used by this feature (e.g. they have to be sufficiently described through context specific data and structural data of evidence).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must perform — detecting which attestations are usable based on contextual and structural evidence. It describes functional validation logic, not availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The rule set derived from legal requirements concerning subcontracting and other consortium constellations MUST be defined
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly references legal requirements and mandates defining a rule set derived from those legal requirements (subcontracting/consortium). This is a legal/compliance requirement; no operational, performance, or usability aspects are implied.

RequirementText: A formal procedure to make changes to the system MUST be defined.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates a formal change-management procedure, which primarily concerns maintainability (processes for modifying and evolving the system) and operability/administration (how changes are managed and applied). It does not specify functional behavior, availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The VCD system SHOULD provide a functionality to approve attestations through validation data and to make this approval visible within a VCD networked package when a National VCD Service provider takes the role of a national validation point in accordance with Article 52 (1) of Directive 2004/18/EC and EFTA EEA Committee decision 68/2006.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system functionality (approve attestations and display approval) and explicitly references compliance with a legal directive, implying legal constraint. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST provide a functionality that initiates a conflict resolution process between economic operator and contracting authority if errors occur or when certain attestation or a translation cannot be delivered on demand.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (initiate a conflict resolution process under specific conditions), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, legal, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST ensure that the attestation that is requested by the contracting authority is still valid at the time of awarding or when the Call for Tender is closed.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability — checking that an attestation remains valid at the time of award/closure (functional behavior). It also implies a security/integrity concern (ensuring validity of attestations), so Security is applicable. Other NFR categories are not clearly implied.

RequirementText: The mapping has to be easily maintainable which could be of interest in the case of changes of the legal basis on national or European level. A formal procedure has to be found how changes are applied to the system. Moreover an organisation or institution that governs the process of change management has to be defined.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly demands the mapping be easily maintainable and a formal procedure for applying changes, which maps to Maintainability. It also references changes due to national/European legal bases, implying Legal considerations. Defining an organisation to govern change management indicates Operability (administration/governance). No performance, security, scalability, portability, fault-tolerance, or functional behavior is specified.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST provide a functionally to check whether a contracting authority has sufficient rights and has been mandated by the economic operator to retrieve attestations.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a capability (to check rights/mandate) and it implies access-control/authorization concerns, so mark Functional and Security.

RequirementText: VCD-specific or contracting authority-specific reference to attestations MUST be stored within the VCD system (processing instructions).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system behavior: storing VCD- or authority-specific references to attestations in the VCD system (processing instructions). This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional aspects (security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The functionality for referencing to attestations within the VCD MUST be implemented, either VCD-specific or contracting authority-specific, in order to approve whether the contracting authority has sufficient rights for requesting the attestations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies implementing functionality to reference attestations to determine if a contracting authority has sufficient rights — this is a functional requirement. It also implies authorization/rights checking (access control), which is a security concern. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST ensure that a contracting authority is able to request attestations via the provided reference (including time-restrictions).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (contracting authority can request attestations via reference with time-restrictions) — a functional requirement. No explicit security, performance, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: A functionality for referencing to attestations MUST be implemented within the VCD system.
AI_Rationale: The statement requires implementing a functionality (referencing attestations) in the VCD system — this is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The VCD system MUST provide a functionality and an interface that enables contracting authorities to retrieve the attestation from the storage.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability and interface to retrieve attestations from storage — a clear functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Any torrent result with a rating of less than 1 will not be displayed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (filtering/display rule) — which torrent results are shown. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Sending the hyperlink to the default browser will take less than 1 second.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a timing/response constraint (latency) for sending a hyperlink to the browser, which is a performance requirement. No explicit functional, security, availability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: Loading the program will take less than 10 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear time-bound performance requirement specifying load time; it concerns response/performance metrics rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Any torrent result with 0 seeds will not be displayed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (filtering/hiding torrent results with 0 seeds). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Sorting results should take less than 0.1 seconds.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a time bound for an operation (sorting results < 0.1s), which is a performance (response-time/latency) constraint. No functional details beyond the performance, nor other quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: A results page will display 100 results.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior of the system (what to display and how many results). No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, usability, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Any torrent with 0 seeds cannot guarantee to be fully downloaded.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes that a torrent with zero seeds cannot be guaranteed to be fully downloaded, which concerns availability/reliability of content delivery. It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The software will use hyperlinks to allow the user to open websites in their default web browser.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: providing hyperlinks that open websites in the user's default browser. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: Our development team must thoroughly investigate each website within our database each month, to ensure that no illegal or harmful content is exposed to our users.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies an action to be performed each month (investigate websites), which denotes functional behavior. It explicitly references preventing illegal content (legal compliance) and preventing exposure of harmful content to users, which relates to security (content safety). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or maintainability/operability concerns explicitly.

RequirementText: While all safety measures resulting from the site may not be fully identified, a recommendation of a full legal review of the software should be undertaken before the site is available to the public. In doing so, the site will be subject to full indemnification of liability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates a legal review and indemnification prior to public availability, which is a legal/compliance constraint. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system we produce will stay within all the legal requirements on our behalf, as our software is only listing links for video streams and video download, and this is not illegal. Our system will not host any videos.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states compliance with legal requirements and asserts the system will not host videos; this is a legal/compliance constraint. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user Interface will consist of one main screen, allowing all the functionally to come from this one screen. This allows the user to use the software with ease by not flicking through a number of different screens. In addition to this the user can always see the videos they are looking for. The main screen will be laid out as in Appendix: B Diagram along with the description of the diagram. We decided on this type of interface because we felt that it would be very simple for the user to navigate. From our reports we found that the simpler the interface was, the more people liked it.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI behavior (all functionality accessible from one main screen) → Functional. Describes layout and visual simplicity (main screen, Appendix B) → Look & Feel. Emphasizes ease of navigation and simplicity for users → Usability. No mention of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: With all these features complied into one screen it will give the software more flexibility and allows for easy and simple usage. This will appeal to both naÃ¯ve computer users and experienced computer users with a higher selling market.
AI_Rationale: The requirement emphasizes combining features into one screen to provide easy and simple usage and to appeal to users. This pertains to usability (ease of use, appeal to naive and experienced users) and look & feel (presentation/layout of features on a single screen). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Communication standards that will be used through the software will be PHP or other such languages. These will be used to query the different servers that the websites use and will give us back
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the mechanism/behavior (using PHP or similar languages to query servers and return responses) which is a functional behavior (F). It also constrains the implementation technology, affecting operability/administration (O) and likely maintainability (MN) due to choice of language and codebase implications. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: Any torrent with a rating of less than 1 should not be fully trusted; this was one of the main complaints from users in William Josephys ethnographic study.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: torrents with rating <1 should not be fully trusted (functional requirement). It pertains to trust/security handling of content, so also classified as Security. No mention of availability, performance, UI, portability, etc.

RequirementText: Query times will take no longer than 5 seconds to any website.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum response/query time (<=5 seconds), which is a performance requirement (response time/latency). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Results will be arranged in length/date/alphabetical order by clicking on the column headers.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing feature: clicking column headers sorts results by length/date/alphabetical (functional behavior). It also implies a usability requirement (user interaction/expectation). No performance, security, legal, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: If no results are found on a search it will display a message â€œNo results were found for this search.â€�
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (displaying a specific message when no search results are found), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: There will be page button for the user to navigate the results.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI control (page button) to enable navigation through results — primarily a functional requirement with a look-and-feel/UI aspect. Does not explicitly state usability, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Database of torrent sites can be updated via the internet.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability of the system (allowing the database to be updated via the Internet) which is a functional requirement, and it also concerns how the system is operated/managed remotely, so it implies operability. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: There will be a tick box to allow the user to choose to include torrent searching in the search.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI control (tick box) enabling the user to include torrent searching—this is a functional requirement describing behavior and also implies a usability/interaction concern (user choice). No performance, security, availability, or other NFRs implied.

RequirementText: Query will retrieve the no. of seed and peers, size of the file, date posted and a link to the webpage itself.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what data the query should retrieve (number of seeds/peers, file size, date posted, and a link), which is a functional behavior. It does not state quality attributes like performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Results will be arranged in size/date/alphabetical order by clicking on the column headers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (sorting results by clicking column headers), which is a functional behavior. It also implies a usability concern (interactive sorting improves user interaction/UX). No explicit constraints about performance, availability, security, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: Torrent search will share the same search bar with the streaming search.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional design decision: torrent search shall use the same search bar as streaming search (behavior/UI requirement). This is a UI/look-and-feel/layout requirement, not about performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Streaming search will share the same search bar with the torrent search.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional design decision (how search should behave/which UI control to use) — therefore Functional. It also prescribes the UI element sharing the search bar, which is a look-and-feel/layout requirement, so LF is set. No performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Database of video hosting and video linking sites can be updated via the internet.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the database can be updated via the Internet (distribution/administration capability). This concerns operating/administrative capability rather than functionality, performance, security, or maintainability.

RequirementText: There will be a tick box to allow the user to choose to include video host searching in the search.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing feature (a tick box to include video host searching) describing system functionality/behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintenance, operability, legal, or explicit usability/look-and-feel non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: There will be a tick box to allow the user to choose to include video link searching in the search.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI control (tick box) that enables inclusion of video link searching — this defines functional behavior (search option) and a UI/layout element (look & feel). It does not state availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Query to video hosting sites will retrieve full video name, length, date posted and a link to the video itself.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the system should retrieve (full video name, length, date posted, link) when querying video hosting sites — a functional requirement. No quality/constraint aspects (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Query to video link sites will retrieve the showâ€™s name, episode name and a link to the webpage itself.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: querying video link sites to retrieve specific data fields (show name, episode name, and webpage link). This is a functional requirement; it does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The tools shall be able to scale to process large collections using distributed processing and data transport
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies the ability to scale to process large collections using distributed processing and data transport, which directly concerns scalability (SC). It also implies performance concerns (throughput/processing capacity), so PE is marked. No explicit mention of availability, fault tolerance, security, maintainability, usability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or operability.

RequirementText: The tools shall be able to process a set of multiple WARC files at the same time. For this purpose, the tools will allow you to choose/group them by: explicit naming, wildcard name matching, size limitation, number of items
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities (process multiple WARC files, selection/grouping methods) and implies scalability/concurrency requirements (handle multiple files at same time). No explicit performance, security, availability, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: Integrate the full-text search (search-tools project) module with the WARC browser to provide users with WARC indexing/searching capabilities.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability: integrating a search module with the WARC browser to provide indexing/searching features to users. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, maintainability, etc.), so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Integrate a proxy mode inside the WARC browser
AI_Rationale: Specifies adding a feature (proxy mode) to the WARC browser — a functional requirement. It also concerns how the system operates/configured (operability), so O is set. No explicit performance, security, portability, or other quality constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: Provide a tool to draw difference graphs between WARC collections
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (a tool to draw difference graphs between WARC collections), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to export summaries in various formats (e.g., XML, CSV)
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (export summaries in various formats), which is functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, portability, scalability, operability, or usability constraints, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: Provide a â€˜â€˜diffâ€˜â€˜ tool to compare WARC sets based on defined criteria (e.g., timestamp, hostname, etc.)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete feature (a 'diff' tool to compare WARC sets by criteria), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Enhance the WARC browser to display a manifest of WARC files and their locations
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the WARC browser must display a manifest of WARC files and their locations. It does not specify availability, performance, security, scalability, UI appearance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Enhance the WARC browser to display aggregated WARCs summaries in its UI
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a new/changed system behavior: the WARC browser should display aggregated WARC summaries in its UI, which is a functional feature. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, performance, security, portability, or look-and-feel details.

RequirementText: The tools shall offer best possible performance to correctly process large collections (I/O bound)
AI_Rationale: Specifies performance expectations for processing large (I/O-bound) collections — directly concerns performance and the ability to handle increasing load/scale. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Implement WARC browser server side rewriting
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies an implementation task (server-side rewriting of WARC content for browser use), which is a functional requirement describing what the system should do. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The tools shall be able to run on multiple machines but will not provide functionality for dealing with hardware failures (out of scope)
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the tools shall run on multiple machines (platform/deployment portability). It explicitly excludes handling hardware failures, so fault-tolerance is out of scope and not marked.

RequirementText: The migration workflow system will be driven by command line tools and scripts
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system will be operated via command-line tools and scripts, which concerns how the system is administered/operated (operability). It does not state functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The tools shall be compliant with Java development environments, by using web services, RESTful APIâ€™s, etc.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compliance with Java development environments and use of web services/RESTful APIs, which implies platform compatibility/portability/interoperability rather than functionality, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The tools shall provide logging facilities, for example, to follow command progression, i.e. process duration, output levels, etc.
AI_Rationale: Requirement asks the tools to provide logging facilities (a capability = functional). Logging supports operability (monitoring, following command progression) and aids maintainability/debugging, so MN and O are applicable. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability requirements mentioned.

RequirementText: The tools shall provide enhanced usability by providing easy to adapt shell script wrappers for the major commands
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly targets 'enhanced usability' by providing easy-to-adapt shell script wrappers to simplify use of major commands. This is a usability/user-experience concern; it does not specify availability, security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to operate the tools in modes that restrict their effects to selected collection subsets. For example, select by name, random sampling, etc
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: tools must support modes to restrict effects to selected subsets (selection by name, sampling). It describes what the system should do, not non-functional qualities such as availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The workflow system shall have a configurable management strategy for migration from ARCs to WARCs.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (must provide a configurable management strategy) so is functional. The emphasis on configurability implies maintainability (ease of configuration/adjustment) and operability (managing/administering migration). No explicit availability, security, portability, performance, scalability, UI, or legal concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Migration configurations can be built with a Web User Interface
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (ability to build migration configurations) delivered via a Web UI — this is a functional requirement. It does not specify usability, look-and-feel, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Active migrations can be monitored, paused, and restarted (a console application) with a Web User Interface
AI_Rationale: Specifies capabilities (monitor, pause, restart) accessible via a Web UI — this is functional. It describes administrative/operational controls (managing migrations via console/Web UI), implying operability. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, availability, usability, look-and-feel, etc.).

RequirementText: Pre and post conversion actions will be provided for at each level of the migration, e.g. record, WARC, job
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall provide pre- and post-conversion actions at various migration levels (record, WARC, job), which defines required functionality. No explicit quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: IIPC members should provide us with the default METADATA they want to be included for migration.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that IIPC members must provide default metadata for migration. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Deduplication may be run before migration, inside a batch process.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability/process (deduplication run before migration) — functional. Describes an operational batch process, implying operability concerns. Also relates to maintenance/preparation of data (maintainability). No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, UI, legal, or fault-tolerance requirements.

RequirementText: Repackaging filters can be used by the summary module
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/behavior of the system (the summary module can use repackaging filters), which is a functional requirement rather than a quality/constraint.

RequirementText: Implementation of the tools shall avoid unnecessary technology dependencies and shall not include development of partner-specific integration technologies
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates avoiding technology/partner-specific dependencies, which is primarily about maintainability (reducing coupling, easing future changes) and portability (ability to run across environments without vendor/partner-specific integrations). No explicit availability, security, performance, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: The migration framework shall provide tools to build reports from WARC files
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall provide tools to build reports (a functional capability). No explicit quality attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Provide a way to view crawls deltas for quality assurance
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a capability to view crawl deltas for quality assurance, which is a functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: Pre operation can prevent a file or record being processed by returning value
AI_Rationale: Describes a behavior (a pre-operation that can stop processing by returning a value), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state security, fault-tolerance, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The migration workflow shall provide a clear Application Programming Interface (API) to handle the migration process and default configuration.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall provide an API to perform migration and configure defaults — this is a functional capability. It also concerns providing an interface for operating/administrating the migration workflow, so it maps to Operability. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The migration API will require inclusion of only one header file.
AI_Rationale: This is a constraint on the API interface (a functional/design requirement) specifying inclusion of a single header file. It also impacts developer usability (simpler usage/integration). No explicit availability, security, portability, scalability, or maintainability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: A configuration must be provided explicitly, errors should be generated in the absence of a configuration.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required system behavior (must accept an explicit configuration and emit errors if missing) — a functional behavior. Also concerns operation/administration (configuration management and error reporting), so operability applies. No indication of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to provide metadata related to the conversion that will be stored in the converted files (e.g., institution, context, crawler, collection name, ...)
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the user can provide metadata and that it will be stored in converted files. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to request that automatically generated migration metadata be stored in the converted files (e.g., OS/Kernel type, original ARC name, ARC size, ARC digests, conversion timestamp, ARC record offset, ...)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (the ability to request embedding of migration metadata into converted files), which is functional behavior. It does not state availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The migration workflow shall be able to call external tools and services (e.g., database queries, shell commands, web service).
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability of the system (the migration workflow must call external tools/services). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, operability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The migration process shall use persistent, opaque, unique, and global identifiers for records access.
AI_Rationale: The requirement prescribes how the migration process must handle record identifiers (a functional constraint on the process) and mandates opaque/persistent unique global IDs which is a security/design constraint to prevent information leakage and ensure safe access; it does not mention availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: A (default) external tool (e.g., ClamAV) will be used to scan files before conversion (pre-conversion step).
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of an external scanning tool (operational/administrative concern) and implies maintainability (integration/management of external component). The file-scanning (ClamAV) is a security control, so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, UI, or fault-tolerance requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The API should be flexible enough to allow external tools such as JHOVE, DROID to be used for file format identification.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the API must be flexible to allow integration with external file-identification tools (JHOVE, DROID). This concerns operability/integration capabilities (manageability and ability to interoperate with other tools), matching the 'Operability' label. It does not specify performance, security, scalability, portability, or UI aspects, nor is it a purely functional behavior in the sense used by examples, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The ARC to WARC migration should be able to run on multiple machines that will be easy to deploy. This may be achieved by using a simple messaging infrastructure.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the migration should run on multiple machines and be easy to deploy (implies scalability and deployability/operability). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Logging during the migration may be turned on/off at any time
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system shall allow logging to be turned on/off during migration — this describes a functional capability (F). It also describes an operational/administrative control (ability to manage logging at any time), so Operability (O) applies. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Software checkpoints (such as start-trans, end-trans) may be added during processing for managing atomic transactions (e.g., operations on a file, these must start and complete to be accepted in the migration), except where operating system limitations would prohibit it.
AI_Rationale: Specifies behavior for adding software checkpoints to manage atomic transactions (functional behavior) and addresses transactional integrity/resilience (fault tolerance). The OS caveat does not strongly imply portability, availability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Each repackaged WARC file shall include a user-defined METADATA record which will describe the extraction context (e.g., filter used, involved WARC files)
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required feature/behavior (each repackaged WARC must include a user-defined METADATA record describing extraction context). This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional quality (availability, security, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: Duplicate detection shall find and report WARC records with the same checksums. A centralised database will be used to store previously processed records, against which new ones will be compared.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability: detecting and reporting duplicate WARC records (F). It also prescribes use of a centralized database to store previously processed records, which pertains to system operation/administration and data storage approach (O) and has implications for maintainability (MN) similar to the provided examples. No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, or usability are present.

RequirementText: Repackaging will allow pre and post record, file and job operations
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability of the repackaging component to allow pre- and post- operations on records, files, and jobs — a functional behavior. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to repackage WARC files by filtering on any field in the WARC specification.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability: the system must allow repackaging WARC files by filtering on any WARC field. This describes functional behavior (what the system should do) rather than availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to repackage WARC files by filtering records based on timestamp (e.g., dates interval).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide—repackaging WARC files with record filtering by timestamp—i.e., a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to perform a â€œdry-run migrationâ€�. That is, a blank conversion to generate useful reports (performance issues, bad ARCs, time estimation ...) without writing real WARC data (i.e. simulating only). Dry run is defined entirely by the configuration.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system capability — a dry-run migration mode that simulates conversion and generates reports, which is a functional feature. It also relates to operability/administration because it is an operational mode used for testing/estimation and managing migrations. No explicit security, performance, scalability, portability, etc., constraints are stated.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to repackage WARC files by filtering records based on MIME-Types.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies a capability the system must provide (repackage WARC files by filtering records based on MIME types), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to repackage WARC files by filtering records based on size.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (repackage WARC files by filtering records by size) — a functional behavior. No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to perform a round trip validation: migrate the newly created WARC file back to ARC and compare both checksums
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (round-trip migration and checksum comparison), which is a functional behavior. The checksum comparison implies ensuring data integrity, which maps to security (SE). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Validation shall use Heritrixâ€™s arcreader to double check that the original ARC record was correctly converted to WARC.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must perform (using Heritrix's arcreader to validate ARC-to-WARC conversion), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Sampling will be provided where applicable to quickly validate the conversions
AI_Rationale: Specifies a feature: providing sampling to validate conversions (functional). The word 'quickly' implies a performance/response-time concern, so a performance label is included. No mention of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Core validation shall use payload checksum comparisons.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how core validation must operate (functional requirement) and implies ensuring payload integrity via checksum comparisons (a security/integrity concern). No mention of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: To validate that the migration succeeded, arc_warc_verify will use the METADATA included in the newly generated WARC files to match records with their corresponding ARC files
AI_Rationale: The statement describes specific system behavior: arc_warc_verify will use metadata to match WARC and ARC records to validate migration. This is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: It shall be possible to repackage WARC files by filtering records based on URL (regular expressions)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (repackaging WARC files with record filtering by URL regular expressions). It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall provide searching ability to the users to quickly find specific topic material through the online help tool.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: providing search functionality in the online help tool. While it mentions 'quickly', which touches on performance/usability, the primary and explicit intent is a functional feature (search). No explicit availability, security, scalability, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: The system must exhibit each of the help pages using the same color scheme and background as specified.

RequirementText: The QA/QC Team must perform regression testing against all scheduled builds.

RequirementText: The Project Team must permit reasonable adjustment to the user interfaces of new functionality by project stakeholders when project schedule permits those adjustments.

RequirementText: The Development Team shall label every scheduled [SYSTEM NAME] build in the source control system.

RequirementText: The system shall retain existing HIPAA compliance capabilities.

RequirementText: The Development Team shall perform weekly integrations of the [SYSTEM NAME] system and deploy these system updates to the Staging environment.

RequirementText: The Development Team shall utilize established open source frameworks instead of proprietary custom components wherever appropriate.

RequirementText: The system shall continue to depend upon and use a single SQL Server 2008 database.

RequirementText: System shall display the hyperlinks and descriptions for the user to perform the desired functions as specified in the related UIS.

RequirementText: The Technical Owner/Lead shall provide signoff before any [SYSTEM NAME] build can be deployed to the production environment.

RequirementText: The system shall generate a standard error/warning message after the user attempts to save data without associating one of each of the following criteriaâ€”xxxâ€”and/or without filling in the required fields in the User Information section.
