RequirementText: The user must fill in the required fieldsâ€”User Name and Display Nameâ€”in the User Information section at the time of creating/adding a new user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data entry behavior during user creation (validation/enforcement of mandatory fields), which is a functional requirement. Does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like usability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The user must associate at least one role, division, designator code, and lab location at the time of creating/adding a new user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior/constraint for the user-creation workflow (mandatory fields to be associated when adding a new user). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall direct the user to the xxx Page if the user chooses to click the close button without entering any data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a specific system behavior (navigating the user to a particular page when they click close without entering data), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, usability metrics, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The Development Team shall develop functionalities using the xx language and on the supported .NET 3.5 Platform.
AI_Rationale: The requirement constrains development to a specific programming language and the .NET 3.5 platform. This is a platform/environment constraint, relating to portability and operability (development/target environment). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to save data after creating/adding a new user or cancel data to abort the process.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capabilities (save or cancel user creation). It describes what the system should do, with no explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: All required fields as specified in the UIS must be marked with a red asterisk alerting the user to fill the required fields in.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a visual indicator (red asterisk) for required fields in the UI, which is primarily a Look & Feel concern and directly impacts Usability by alerting users. It does not impose availability, security, legal, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability constraints, nor is it a broader functional business operation.

RequirementText: The user must have the flexibility to click any tab to commence the adding process, although the xxx Tab shall display as the default tab.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior for tab interaction (functional) and which tab is displayed by default (UI/layout concern -> Look & Feel). No availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall generate a standard confirmation message after saving data and warning/caution messages after the cancel or close button is clicked.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior to generate confirmation and warning messages (functional). It also concerns user feedback and interaction design, improving usability, so labeled as Usability. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall clear up data if the user chooses to click the Cancel button in the midst of creating/adding a new user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a specific system behavior (when user clicks Cancel during user creation, the system shall clear entered data), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: Generation and transmission under the control of the Master of the vessel before entering into port at the time of inspection at sea at the request of the UK fisheries administrations.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an action (generation and transmission under the control of the Master before entering port upon request) which describes required system behavior => Functional. References UK fisheries administrations and inspection requirements, indicating a regulatory/legal compliance constraint => Legal. No explicit performance, availability, security, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, fault-tolerance, or operability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The subject header must consist of a character string containing â€˜ERS â€“ â€˜ prefixed to the contents of the GBRRN attribute of the Electronic Logbook data being transmitted. The GBRRN attribute is defined in the UK XML/XSD. The GBRRN attribute is defined uniquely as the vesselsâ€™ RSS Number appended to the current date (in YYYYMMDD format) and a 6 digit sequence number, e.g. RSSNumber+YYYYMMDD+999999. An example of the contents of an email subject could be ERS â€“ A1234520090623000001.
AI_Rationale: Specifies exact functional requirement for constructing the email subject header (format and contents derived from GBRRN attribute). This is a behavior specification, not a non-functional quality constraint.

RequirementText: The xml document file name should be based upon the GBRRN attribute defined in the UK XML/XSD. An example of this format could be A1234520090623000001. The RSS Number will require to be padded with trailing Xâ€™s to ensure that it is always 6 characters in length.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies how the XML document file name must be formed (based on GBRRN attribute and padding RSS Number), which describes functional behavior/processing rules for the system. It does not specify availability, security, UI look-and-feel, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: Each file should have the suffix of .xml, e.g. A1234520090623000001.xml.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains file naming/format (files must end with .xml). This is an operational/manageability constraint about how files are produced/processed, so it is classified as Operability. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, portability, or UI aspects explicitly.

RequirementText: All xml documents attached to emails to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system must be encrypted using PGP.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that XML documents attached to emails must be encrypted using PGP — a confidentiality/security control. This is a security requirement rather than availability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: ELSS must only be supplied for use at sea and loaded onto an onboard system and is not to be provided for onshore use by agents or representatives. . Onshore entry is to be made through the ERS website or by use of the offline submission methods to be promulgated by the UK fisheries administrations, e.g. an emailed spreadsheet CSV formatted file. To this end the UK administrations will provide the Owner with the means for his agent(s) to logon to the ERS website to view the vessel trip record to date and the logbook numbers used, to aid their completion of the reports they wish to submit from their offices.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional constraints and behaviors: ELSS usage restrictions, onshore entry methods, and provision of agent logon access to ERS — primarily functional. It also explicitly mentions agents will be able to logon to the ERS website, which implies authentication/access control concerns (security). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, usability, maintainability, fault-tolerance or operability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: It is recognised that communications methods, other than email, are available for data transmission. If an alternative is proposed, this should be advised to the Validation Authority and if feasible and practicable the UK Fisheries Administrations will endeavour to extend their ERS system to accommodate alternative methods.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies behavior of the ERS system to accommodate alternative data transmission methods (functional). It also implies the system should be extensible/maintainable to allow such extensions (maintainability). The instruction to advise the Validation Authority and the administrative process of accommodating alternatives implies operational/administrative concerns (operability). No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, scalability, performance, look-and-feel, legal, or usability.

RequirementText: The ELSS must permit the Master of the vessel to generate formatted data for transmission to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system. There are 2 categories of transmission, those that must be generated automatically by the ELSS and those that can be generated and transmitted under the control of the Master of the vessel. The data transmission categories are specified below:
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide—generation of formatted data and transmission control—so it is primarily functional. It also describes interfacing/transmission behavior (automatic vs. master-controlled), which aligns with operability/administration concerns (similar to example about interfacing with a server). No explicit mention of security, performance, availability, maintainability, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: Automatically by the ELSS (subject to be overridden by the vessel master): at least on a daily basis not later than 24:00 even when there is no catch data with the proviso that if the vessel is in port, has no fish on board and has submitted a landing declaration, transmission may be suspended subject to prior notification to the Fisheries Monitoring Centre of the flag Member State. Transmission must be resumed when the vessel leaves port.
AI_Rationale: Specifies automated transmission behavior and exception/override rules (functional). It mandates periodic transmission (at least daily/not later than 24:00) which pertains to availability of data transmissions, so Availability is also applicable. No explicit performance, security, maintainability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The ELSS must provide facilities to capture and deliver for transmission corrections to previously successfully transmitted data. Data corrections must not be transmitted piecemeal; the entire report containing one or more corrected items must be transmitted. There is no requirement to identify the data items that have been corrected in the generated corrected report.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies required system behavior for capturing and transmitting corrected data and transmission rules (whole-report transmission), which are functional requirements. It does not impose availability, security, performance, UI, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The ELSS must be able to receive acknowledgement (RET) messages transmitted from the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system. The ELSS must match each acknowledgement message with the appropriate transmitted data operation, deletion or correction report. The ELSS must be able to confirm that a transmission has been successfully acknowledged or display any error message should the ELSS receive a negative acknowledgement message.
AI_Rationale: The text specifies what the system must do: receive acknowledgement messages, match them to transmitted operations, confirm successful acknowledgements or display errors — this is primary functional behavior (F). It also involves interfacing with an external administration system and handling/monitoring of transmissions, which relates to operability (O). The requirement explicitly covers handling negative acknowledgements and confirmation of success, which implies error handling/fault response behavior (FT). Other non-functional areas (security, performance, etc.) are not explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: The ELSS must only permit correction messages to be generated and sent for reports sent during a current trip up to the submission of the End of Fishing report for that voyage
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior constraint (business rule) about when correction messages may be generated/sent — classification as Functional. It also imposes an authorization/permission rule (only permit generation/sending under certain conditions), which relates to security (access control), so SE is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, portability, usability, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: The ELSS must provide facilities to transmit deletions to previously transmitted data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to transmit deletions of previously transmitted data), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional quality (performance, security, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: The ELSS must only permit deletion messages to be generated and sent for reports sent during a current trip up to the End of Fishing report for that voyage.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a constraint on system behavior about permitting deletion messages only for reports within a specific voyage/time window — this is a functional requirement (permission/behavior). It also implies an access/control policy (authorization), so it is classified as security (SE). No indication of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: All deletions must be easily identifiable within the ELSS user interface.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user-interface presentation quality—deletions must be easily identifiable—so it concerns look & feel and usability (clarity, discoverability). No explicit functional behavior or other non-functional categories are implied.

RequirementText: Prior to registering a product for approval, a test address for all test email transmissions and test logon details to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system will be provided on request. All requests should be made by contacting the Validation Authority by email in the first instance. The email address is ERS-Logbook-Approvals@NCCGroup.com.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies an operational process for obtaining test email addresses and test logon details and instructs contacting the Validation Authority by email. This is about how the system/administration is to be operated and administered (operability). It does not specify system behavior, performance, security, portability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: Once operational the UK XML/XSD allows for a test message to be sent to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system. This test facility must be used to send test transmissions to establish that the communications between the vessel and the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system are fully operational. The UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system will acknowledge any test messages but will not store any data that has been transmitted.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to send and acknowledge test messages and behavior (no storage) — a functional requirement. It also describes a test facility used to verify communications and operational readiness, which relates to operability/administration. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal or UI constraints.

RequirementText: ELSS must retain all logbook reports and any corrections on the system at least until the end of each trip, i.e. on submission of the electronic landing declaration or of a transhipment report.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must retain logbook reports and corrections until the end of each trip — this is a system behavior (functional) and implies data must be kept available/reliable until that point (availability). The retention until submission may also reflect a legal/regulatory retention obligation, so Legal is marked. Other concerns (performance, security, portability, etc.) are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: Any ELSS software updates must not impact upon the ELSSâ€™s ability to meet the requirements set out in this document and other test documentation . If it does then the product must be submitted for re-approval, and can not be deployed by fishing vessels until this is granted and the new version id is published on the UKFA web site lists
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates regulatory approval and publication on UKFA lists before deployment, which is legal/compliance. It also governs software update/change management (re-approval process), implicating maintainability. The restriction on deployment and administrative approval process implies operational/manageability concerns.

RequirementText: The ELSS should at least be able to transmit data via email, either by being included in a packaged solution with an email system or by linking with an existing on-board email service. Data is required to be emailed as an xml document attached to an email with a standard Subject header and sent to the email address of the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (must transmit data via email, format and destination). It also implies operability (must interface/ integrate with an email system) and portability/compatibility concerns (linking with existing on-board email services or packaged solution), but does not specify security, performance, availability, scalability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: All corrections must be easily identifiable within the ELSS user interface.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns how corrections are presented in the user interface (visual distinguishability) which relates to Look & Feel and also impacts Usability (ease of identifying). No legal, performance, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The ELSS must provide Electronic Logbook data for transmission to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system in accordance with the frequency requirements defined below (Section 5.1).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (provide Electronic Logbook data for transmission) — this is functional. It also mandates conformity with frequency requirements for transmission to a governmental ERS system, which is a compliance/regulatory constraint, so labelled as Legal. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The ELSS may also provide the means for recording additional data but this must not interfere with the data capture and submission functions as set out below.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (recording additional data) and constrains that this must not interfere with core data capture/submission operations, which is an operability/manageability concern. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: Additionally a formatted electronic print file may be generated out of the ELSS. This print file can be made available to a masterâ€™s representative on-shore, e.g. by email over the onboard communications system(s). The ELSS must provide a means so that electronic print files are protected so that they cannot be modified in any way once generated and distributed.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies generating and distributing a formatted electronic print file (functional behavior) and that it be protected against any modification once generated and distributed (security/integrity). The mention of a 'formatted' print file implies presentation/format constraints (look & feel). No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, or usability are given.

RequirementText: The ELSS may provide features to facilitate other print requirements including: Generation of hard copies of the Electronic Logbook required when fishing in 3rd country or Regional Fisheries waters, e.g. NAFO, Faroese and Norwegian waters, Generation of a hard copy logsheet or landing declaration to act as a transport or takeover document, Generation of a hard copy for providing regulatory returns for Cod and Hake effort reporting.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system capability to generate hard-copy documents (electronic logbook, logsheet, landing declaration) — a functional behavior. No explicit quality, performance, security, legal, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The ELSS must capture all data necessary for recording the fishing activities undertaken by a UK fishing vessel.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability to capture (record) all data about fishing activities — a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal, performance, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The ELSS must output the data as an XML file for transmission to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: produce output as an XML file for transmission (functional). Also prescribes a specific data format for interoperability/transmission, which aligns with operability (manageability/interfacing). No mention of availability, security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The ELSS data must be validated against the UK XML/XSD before transmission from the fishing vessel.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system action (validate ELSS data against the UK XML/XSD before transmission) — a functional behavior. It specifies use of a particular data format/schema before sending, which is an operational/interoperability constraint, so labeled as Operability. No explicit availability, security, legal, performance, portability, scalability, usability, maintainability, or fault-tolerance aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The ELSS data must be transmitted at the required times.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies timeliness of data transmission (a performance/real-time constraint). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Each ELSS data transmission will be acknowledged by a return message from the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies required behavior of the system interaction (each ELSS transmission must be acknowledged), which is a functional communication requirement and relates to operability/administration (ensuring message acknowledgement/receipt). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal or UI aspects.

RequirementText: The owner is then able to set up subsidiary users such as the master of the vessel with their own username and password.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must allow the owner to create subsidiary users with usernames and passwords — this is a functional feature (F). It implies authentication/credential handling, so security (SE) applies. It also describes an administrative capability (owner managing users), which relates to operability/manageability (O). No explicit constraints about performance, availability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The username is required to be recorded in each report completed and in each transmission made; the person who has entered the data is required to â€œsignâ€� the Electronic Logbook data stating that they are aware of the responsibilities/liabilities they are committing to in completing and / or transmitting a report.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must record the username and capture a signed acknowledgement for each report/transmission (functional). Requires user accountability/non-repudiation and authentication/integrity controls (security). Mentions responsibilities/liabilities, implying legal/compliance requirements.

RequirementText: Each copy of the ELSS installed must be provided with a unique (internal?) number that is automatically entered into each transmission to identify the instance of the ELSS from which the report has been transmitted.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior: assign and transmit a unique identifier for each installed instance. It does not explicitly state availability, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Data operation to capture and deliver formatted ELSS data for transmission by a vesselâ€™s communications system(s) to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system (DAT)
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a data operation to capture and deliver formatted ELSS data for transmission to an external system, which describes a functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, operability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: One username/password must be provided for the owner of each vessel
AI_Rationale: Specifies that each vessel owner must have a username/password—an authentication/credential requirement, i.e., security-related. Does not specify availability, performance, usability, or functional behavior beyond authentication.

RequirementText: Correction operation to capture and deliver a formatted correction request for transmission by a vesselâ€™s communications system(s) to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system to correct previously send data (COR)
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a specific correction operation to capture and deliver a formatted correction request for transmission to an external ERS system — this specifies system behavior (functional). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Delete operation to capture and deliver a formatted deletion request for transmission by a vesselâ€™s communications system(s) to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system to delete previously send data (DEL)
AI_Rationale: Specifies a delete operation and the behavior of capturing and delivering a formatted deletion request for transmission to an external system — this is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The Electronic Logbook data may be populated from other, existing, onboard electronic systems, e.g. a GPS for inserting the date, time and location of transmission, or for inserting the same items at the time of capture, onboard weighing systems, existing onboard database(s) to avoid duplication of data entry.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the logbook can be populated from other onboard systems (GPS, weighing systems, existing DB) which defines functional behavior (data import). It implies integration/operability concerns (interfaces, administration) and portability/compatibility with other onboard systems. Mention of avoiding duplicate data entry indicates improved usability.

RequirementText: All dates and times must be UTC.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior/constraint (representation of dates and times must be in UTC). It is a functional/data-format requirement rather than an availability, security, usability, or other non-functional quality.

RequirementText: The ELSS must use English (UK) localizations for all UK Electronic Logbook features.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the localization/language for UI features (English UK) which pertains to look-and-feel; it does not state functional behavior, portability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The ELSS must provide the ability to print out the ELSS logbook data (including landing declarations) using an onboard printer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system capability (printing ELSS logbook data via an onboard printer), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The data definitions also provide for the capture of data items required for the submission of ELSS data to meet 3rd country requirements, e.g. Norwayâ€™s requirements that include haul by haul reporting.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must capture specific data items for submission (functional requirement). Mentions meeting 3rd country requirements/regulatory submission (legal/compliance concern). No explicit performance, security, scalability, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: The data definitions for each report type that are required to be transmitted from the ELSS of a UK fishing vessel are to be found in the annex to this specification. The data definitions and associated lists of valid codes are incorporated in the UK XML/XSD definitions. These are available to all ELSS suppliers from the UK FMC.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the data definitions and formats that must be transmitted (what data/report structure is required) — a functional specification. It also mandates XML/XSD definitions available to suppliers, implying interoperability/compatibility across platforms, so Portability applies. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Receipt of acknowledgment operation to match acknowledgement with original message and provide a record/report of acknowledged and un-acknowledged transmissions
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies an operation to match acknowledgements with original messages and produce a record/report of acknowledged and unacknowledged transmissions — this describes functionality (what the system should do). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, portability, scalability, usability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or operability concerns.

RequirementText: The ELSS must provide data capture screens for the entry of the logbook, transhipment and landing declaration data that is required to be transmitted to the UK fisheries administrationsâ€™ ERS system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: providing data capture screens for specific data entry to be transmitted to ERS. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: As it has already been mentioned, GParted is not a resource hog and will run on almost every computer. Its functions and features are not computationally intensive. It does not require a powerful processor or graphics card, much RAM, or disk space, for both the install and Live version, and the program loads and runs fairly quick. The only real requirement is a CD/DVD drive or a USB port that is working properly.
AI_Rationale: Specifies low resource usage and that the program runs on almost every computer (minimal CPU, RAM, disk, quick load) — this is a performance/resource requirement (PE) and indicates portability across hardware/environments (PO). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: GParted Live does not deal with any security or privacy issues, as it does not run from within an operating system. Every user has administrator rights and full access which are given from the start of the program, as you are logged in as root.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes the system's operational behavior (runs as root with administrative rights for all users) which is functional in nature, and it explicitly addresses security/privacy (saying none are handled and all users have full access), so Security is applicable. No other quality attributes are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: As it is stated with many warnings in the program, data loss is a serious possibility, if you are not careful, backup your data and/or use the program with extreme caution. It is obvious that when you deal with partition changes, you could lose all your data by human or application error. GParted comes with absolute no warranty and cannot be made responsible for any loss of data.
AI_Rationale: The text is a legal disclaimer about data loss, warranty and liability (no responsibility for loss of data). It does not specify functional behavior or technical quality attributes like security, availability, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: Sensor (temperature, humidity, contact sensor, power state) shall have a minimum data acquisition rate of 10 Hz.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a minimum data acquisition rate (sampling frequency) which is a performance/throughput requirement for sensors; does not describe functionality beyond quality, nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Although there are no specific safety requirements, high system reliability is important to insure there are no system failures in carrying out user requests. Such failures might affect the safety of home dwellers (e.g., security breaches, inadequate lighting in dark spaces, inappropriate temperature and humidity for people who are in ill-health, or powering certain appliances when young children are present).
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly emphasizes high system reliability to ensure no system failures in carrying out user requests. This maps to availability (uptime/reliability). It also implies resilience and prevention of failures affecting users, which corresponds to fault tolerance. It does not specify functional behavior, legal, security-specific controls, performance metrics, scalability, portability, usability, maintainability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Log in to an account shall require entry of an account name and a password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (login must require account name and password) and implies an authentication/security requirement. No mention of availability, performance, usability, portability, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: Upon installation, a DigitalHome user account shall be established. The DigitalHome web system shall provide for authentication and information encryption through a recognized reliable and effective security technology, such as Transport Layer Security.
AI_Rationale: Requires creation of a user account on installation (functional). Specifies authentication and encryption via TLS, which are security requirements.

RequirementText: An environmental sensor or controller device shall have to be within 1000 feet of the master control device, in order to be in communication with the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an operational constraint on device placement for communication (functional requirement about device interaction) and relates to system operability/deployment (distance for operation). No security, performance, scalability, portability, or UI aspects implied.

RequirementText: Displays of environmental conditions (temperature, humidity, contact sensors and power switches) shall be updated at least every two seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that displays of environmental conditions must be updated at least every two seconds — this defines a functional requirement (the display update behavior) with a performance/timeliness constraint (update frequency). No implication of availability, security, scalability, maintainability, portability, or look-and-feel beyond update timing.

RequirementText: Each DigitalHome shall contain a master control device (the DH Gateway Device) that connects to the homeâ€™s broadband Internet connection, and uses wireless communication to send and receive communication between the DigitalHome system and the home devices and systems.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system component (DH Gateway Device) and its communication behavior (connect to broadband and use wireless to communicate with home devices). This describes functional behavior, not a quality/non-functional constraint.

RequirementText: Using wireless communication, sensor values can be read and saved in the home database.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies a system capability (read sensor values via wireless and save to home database) — a functional requirement. It does not state availability, security, performance, UI, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The DigitalHome shall be equipped with various environmental controllers and sensors (temperature controller-sensors: thermostats, humidity controller-sensors: humidistats, contact sensors, security sound and light alarms, and power switches).
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall be equipped with particular controllers and sensors — describes required functionality/capabilities (hardware/features). No explicit non-functional constraints like availability, security, performance, portability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The communication center of the DH system shall be a DH home web server, through which a user shall be able to monitor and control home devices and systems.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies what the system shall provide (a web-server-based communication center enabling users to monitor and control devices) which is functional. It also prescribes the use of a home web server as the communication center (a deployment/operability constraint similar to the provided example), so Operability is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability non-functional requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The DigitalHome System shall allow a web-ready computer, cell phone or PDA to control a home s temperature, humidity, lights, security, and the state of small appliances.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing system behavior: allowing various client devices (web-ready computer, cell phone, PDA) to control home features (temperature, humidity, lights, security, appliances). It does not explicitly state availability, security mechanisms, portability constraints, performance, scalability, usability, or other NFRs, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Controller values can be sent to controllers to change the DH environment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/behavior: sending controller values to change the DH environment. This describes functional behavior (what the system should do). No explicit quality constraints (availability, security, performance, operability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: A campaign has the following components: Name, Pieces of content, Schedule, User/Group Permissions
AI_Rationale: This statement defines the components/fields of a Campaign (Name, content pieces, Schedule, User/Group Permissions), which is a functional/data requirement. Inclusion of User/Group Permissions indicates access control aspects, implying a security requirement (authorization).

RequirementText: A schedule is a mapping of times to publishing actions. It may contain any actions a publisher can perform, and these actions are performed at the associated time.
AI_Rationale: Defines a functional concept and behavior: a schedule maps times to publishing actions and executes them. No constraints about availability, performance, security, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: A piece of content may take the following forms: Text, Image, Audio, Video
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies what the system must support (the allowed content types: Text, Image, Audio, Video), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Mashbot will allow for the association of Mashbot accounts with external service accounts.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (feature) to associate Mashbot accounts with external service accounts — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (security, availability, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Mashbot will provide an interface for authenticating a user account to an external service account
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (providing an interface to authenticate a user account to an external service), which is functional. Because it involves authentication to an external service, it implicates security concerns (authn), so SE is marked. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: Mashbot will provide a standardized method of interacting with external service accounts
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (providing a standardized method to interact with external service accounts), which is a functional feature. It does not explicitly state availability, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system encrypts data over a direct connection between the web client and the server.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that data is encrypted between client and server, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). No availability, performance, scalability, or UI concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system allows for the backup of the data system to local or remote non-volatile storage systems. Incremental backups should not create outages and full backups do not interfere with user interaction for more than 10 minutes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a backup capability (functional). Requires backups not cause outages and limits user-impact duration for full backups — this is primarily an availability requirement; also implies fault tolerance/graceful operation during backups, so FT is set. No explicit performance, security, portability, or other concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The system allows only valid users to log into the system. A valid user is one which has not been disabled or deleted and exists on the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies authentication behavior (only valid users may log in) which is functional. It also enforces access control/security constraints (valid user, not disabled/deleted), so Security applies. No mention of availability, performance, usability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The format uses SMTP protocol. The actual messages are provided by Mashbot.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the system will use/produce (use SMTP protocol and Mashbot as message source), which is a functional/behavioral requirement. Does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: To log onto the system, a user provides their valid username and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication via username/password, which is a security requirement. It does not state functional behavior beyond login nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system uses the configured authentication module. The authentication method is configurable by the System Administrator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication mechanism and configurability by System Administrator — directly a security requirement (authentication) and implies an administrative/configuration capability (operability). No explicit performance, availability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system allows the System Administrator to configure a timeout after which a user is automatically logged out of Mashbot.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (admin can configure automatic logout timeout) which is functional. It also relates to session management and access control, a security concern (automatic logout helps confidentiality/session security). Because configuration is performed by the System Administrator, it implies an administrative/operability concern (manageability of system settings). Other non-functional categories are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The external email system is to provide a messaging service from Mashbot to the Mashbot users.
AI_Rationale: This statement describes a capability the system must provide (messaging service from Mashbot to users), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, interoperability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The input is generated automatically by the Mashbot system using settings configurable by the System Administrator.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a system behavior: inputs are generated automatically by Mashbot (functional). It also states that settings are configurable by the System Administrator, which relates to administration/operability (manageability). No explicit reliability, security, performance, portability, or UI/maintainability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The output is in the form of an e-mail to an e-mail account, but it does not return any sort of message to Mashbot.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior/output channel (send email and not return a message to Mashbot), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system only allows users to change their own passwords.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (users can change passwords) which is a functional requirement, and it constrains that capability with an access-control rule (users may only change their own passwords), which is a security/authorization requirement. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system is configurable to e-mail warnings about multiple failed login attempts from the same user. These warnings are sent to the System Administrator. Other security risks of this type are the responsibility of the System Administrator.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (configurable emailing of warnings on multiple failed logins) — a functional behavior — and describes a security control/alerting measure and assignment of security responsibility to the System Administrator, so Security applies. No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, performance, portability, scalability, legal, usability, maintainability, or operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Individual passwords can be reset.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (ability to reset individual passwords), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state security/authorization, availability, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: New user accounts can be created.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (ability to create new user accounts), which is a functional requirement. No quality/constraint (availability, performance, security, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: It is possible to disable all accounts except for the System Administrator account.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an access-control capability (only System Administrator account remains enabled), which is a security-related constraint on account management. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, portability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system categorizes users on the basis of roles and privileges. Within these roles, the system also categorizes users based on the roles that they have within individual products. These are referred to as user account roles. Mashbot Campaigns supports the following account roles: Contributor, Approver, Publisher
AI_Rationale: The requirement defines role- and privilege-based user categorization and specific account roles (Contributor, Approver, Publisher), which pertains to access control and authorization—a security concern. It does not specify availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes, nor does it explicitly state a functional behavior beyond the security context, so only SE is marked.

RequirementText: The system gives users the ability to reset their password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can reset their password). It does not mention availability, security controls, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Roles reflect actions that can be performed by a user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that system roles correspond to actions users can perform—this is a functional requirement describing behavior (role-action mapping) and implies access control/authorization concerns (security). No explicit availability, performance, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: Roles can be assigned to a user account for individual products.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capability to assign roles to user accounts (functional requirement) and implies authorization/permission control for security (access control), so both Functional and Security apply. No mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Contributors may create new content, import existing content into the system, edit content, and delete it. They may also submit these actions for approval.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system capabilities/actions (create, import, edit, delete content, submit for approval) — clearly functional requirements. No explicit non-functional constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: Approvers can approve actions performed by contributors
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a capability: approvers can approve contributors' actions. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns (availability, security mechanisms, usability, etc.), so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Publishers may schedule or immediately initiate actions put forth by contributors and those approved by approvers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior/feature allowing publishers to schedule or initiate actions proposed by contributors and approved by approvers — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system may contain any number of user accounts.
AI_Rationale: Specifying that the system may contain any number of user accounts implies capacity/handling of growth and load (scalability) and the related performance implications (ability to handle many accounts). No functional behavior, security, availability, or other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: A user may possess more than one role
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: the system must allow a user to have multiple roles. No explicit non-functional attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User Account Modification The system allows users to modify their accounts once created.
AI_Rationale: States a system capability: users can modify their accounts after creation. This describes functional behavior (what the system should do) and contains no explicit non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system requires that a user have logged in before modifications can be made. The following user account information is modifiable by all user types: Password, Email Address Priority, Name
AI_Rationale: Specifies required behavior (must be logged in and which account fields are modifiable) -> Functional. The login requirement and access restriction pertain to authentication/authorization -> Security.

RequirementText: User Account Deactivation The system allows user accounts to be deactivated.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (ability to deactivate user accounts), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention security, authorization, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system denies user who have been deactivated from accessing the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (deny access for deactivated users) which is functional, and it enforces access control/account status so it's a security requirement (authentication/authorization).

RequirementText: If an account has any history associated with it, it can only be deactivated and not deleted.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains the allowed operations on accounts (functional behavior) and enforces preservation of account data/history, which is primarily an integrity/security constraint preventing deletion—thus security. No explicit availability, legal, performance, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: If an account has no history associated with it, it can be deleted from the system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior/constraint (when an account can be deleted). It does not explicitly address availability, security, legal, UI, maintainability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A disable account can be undisabled
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (ability to re-enable a disabled account), which describes functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Certain pieces of information are required to create new accounts. The following information is required for any new user account: Username, Password, Name, Email Address, Group Membership, User Account Type
AI_Rationale: Specifies what information is required to create new user accounts (fields: Username, Password, Name, Email, Group, Account Type). This is a functional requirement describing system behavior/data; it does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: PDFsam does not introduce any security level, since the data it manages is not critical. The users in the application are all equal so there is not the need of any identity management level.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly discusses security/identity management (stating none is needed). This directly concerns security aspects, so SE is applicable. No other quality attributes (performance, availability, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Furthermore, the system can check for updates whenever is requested by the user, or automatically when opening the application. In this way PDFsam will be always up-to-date with all new supported features and bug fixes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (checking for and applying updates on user request or automatically at startup) — a functional requirement about behavior. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: PDFsam is an application that needs a few system resources to work. This is designed not to delay the system from other key processes. The response time of the program is direct and the application is considered real-time.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns resource usage and response time, emphasizing real-time behavior and not delaying other processes, which are performance-related aspects. It does not state availability/uptime, scalability, security, or functional behavior, so only Performance is marked.

RequirementText: Restart PDFsam application to be the changes applied.
AI_Rationale: This statement is an operational instruction about restarting the application so changes take effect, which relates to system operation/administration (operability). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Log level must not be OFF (in the Settings panel) in order to work this function
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates an operational configuration (log level in Settings) required for the function to work, which is an operability/manageability constraint. It does not describe performance, security, legal, UI look & feel, scalability, portability, or a functional behavior itself.

RequirementText: Operation system on the computer system
AI_Rationale: The phrase refers to the operating system/environment of the computer system, implying a constraint about the execution environment (operability) and likely compatibility with specific OSes (portability). No indications of performance, security, availability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Pages number in the page selection must be comprehended.
AI_Rationale: Requirement pertains to comprehension/presentation of page numbers in page selection, relating to UI look-and-feel and usability (readability/understandability). No functional, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects implied.

RequirementText: The number of digits that can be used for the unique [FILENUMBER] prefix must be 10 or less.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional constraint on the format/length of the FILENUMBER prefix (a functional data requirement). It does not address availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The user can mix only 2 documents at a time (not more or less).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint on user action (system shall allow mixing exactly two documents). No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The compression of the output files requires pdf version 1.5 or above.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required PDF file version compatibility (supports PDF 1.5+). This is a portability/compatibility constraint rather than availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: The user can split only once document at a time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavioral constraint on what the system allows the user to do (restricting splitting to one document at a time), which is a functional constraint about system behavior/concurrency. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, scalability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The application must ensure that it leaves untouched the input pdf files. No modification is allowed to these files.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required behavior (must not modify input PDF files) — a functional constraint. Also implies data integrity/security requirement (prevent unauthorized or accidental modification).

RequirementText: The user can manipulate only 1 document at a time (not more).
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional constraint on system behavior (only one document may be manipulated at a time). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Moreover, the application should function even in cases of wrong data insertion or wrong settings. In case of error it should provide users with appropriate help messages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must continue functioning despite wrong data/settings (fault tolerance/resilience) and provide appropriate help messages to users (usability/helpfulness). No mention of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall allow patients to book appointments online.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (patients can book appointments online). It does not mention quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The application should load the patient dashboard within 3 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the application should load the patient dashboard (functional behavior) and gives a timing constraint of 3 seconds (performance requirement). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The software shall store patient medical records securely.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional behavior (store patient medical records) so F = true. The term 'securely' explicitly imposes a security constraint (confidentiality/integrity/access control), so SE = true. No explicit availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, usability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel requirements are stated, so those labels are false.

RequirementText: The system must comply with HIPAA regulations.
AI_Rationale: HIPAA is a legal/regulatory requirement (Legal). It also strongly implies security/privacy controls (confidentiality, data protection), so Security is marked. No other quality attributes are explicitly required.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to update their personal information.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (users can update personal information), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The platform should be available 99.9% of the time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an explicit uptime requirement (99.9%), which is an availability/non-functional requirement. No mention of fault tolerance, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall provide medication reminders to patients.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (providing medication reminders to patients). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The application should support encryption of data at rest and in transit.
AI_Rationale: Specifies encryption for data at rest and in transit, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). Does not mention availability, performance, portability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: Doctors shall access patient histories through the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (doctors accessing patient histories), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The interface should be user-friendly and intuitive.
AI_Rationale: Statement addresses the user interface being user-friendly and intuitive, which pertains to look-and-feel and usability. No functional, performance, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall generate billing invoices automatically.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (automatic generation of billing invoices). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The application should handle up to 10,000 concurrent users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity for concurrent users (system scalability). No explicit performance metrics, availability, security, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The software shall integrate with existing EHR systems.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies integration/interoperability with existing EHR systems, indicating operability/manageability and portability across external systems. It does not state behavioral functional details, performance, security, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The response time for any request should not exceed 2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a quantitative limit on response time, which is a performance non-functional requirement (latency). It does not address availability, security, usability, or other concerns.

RequirementText: Patients shall be able to view their test results online.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (patients viewing test results online), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system should be compatible with major web browsers.
AI_Rationale: Browser compatibility is a constraint about which environments the system must run in (portability). It also relates to operability/ability to interface with user agents, matching the provided similar example labeled as Operability.

RequirementText: The application shall support multi-factor authentication.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates multi-factor authentication, which is a security control (authentication/authorization). It does not specify availability, performance, UI, portability, or maintainability.

RequirementText: Users shall receive notifications for upcoming appointments.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability/feature: delivering notifications to users about upcoming appointments. No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The platform should ensure data redundancy and backups.
AI_Rationale: Data redundancy and backups are measures to ensure availability and resilience to data loss/failures, which correspond to Availability and Fault Tolerance requirements. No explicit mention of security, performance, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall allow healthcare providers to prescribe medications electronically.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (electronic prescribing) and does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The application should adhere to WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards.
AI_Rationale: WCAG 2.1 is an accessibility standard, so the requirement is about usability/accessibility (US). It also specifies compliance with a recognized standard, which maps to legal/compliance requirements (L). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Patients shall be able to communicate with their doctors via secure messaging.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (patients communicating with doctors via messaging). The phrase 'secure messaging' explicitly implies security concerns (confidentiality/integrity/authentication), so set SE. No other quality attributes (performance, availability, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The system should support mobile and desktop devices.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies support for mobile and desktop devices (platform compatibility). This is primarily a portability requirement rather than a UI, performance, or availability constraint.

RequirementText: The software shall log all user activities for auditing purposes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability to record/log user activities (functional). The purpose is auditing, which implies a security/audit trail concern, so Security is applicable. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, usability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability constraints.

RequirementText: The platform shall provide analytics dashboards for administrators.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability — providing analytics dashboards for administrators. It does not mention availability, security, usability, operability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The application should minimize downtime during updates.
AI_Rationale: Requirement addresses reducing system downtime during updates, which is an availability requirement. It does not explicitly mention fault tolerance, maintainability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to reset their passwords securely.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-visible capability (ability to reset passwords) — functional. The adjective 'securely' indicates security-related constraints (confidentiality/integrity of reset process), so classify as Security. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: The system should implement role-based access control.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an access control mechanism (role-based access control) which is a security requirement governing authentication/authorization; does not specify other qualities.

RequirementText: The software shall allow for customization of user profiles.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (allow customization of user profiles). It also implies a usability concern (personalization/customization improves user experience). No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The platform should support multilingual interfaces.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies support for multilingual interfaces, which is primarily a usability/localization concern (improves user experience for speakers of different languages). It does not explicitly state functional behavior, portability, look-and-feel, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Patients shall be able to upload and share medical documents.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (patients uploading and sharing medical documents). It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, privacy, performance, or usability, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The application should integrate with third-party payment gateways securely.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (integration with third-party payment gateways) and explicitly mandates that this integration be secure, implying security constraints (authentication, encryption, safe handling of payment data). It does not explicitly mention availability, portability, performance, operability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall provide real-time chat support.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (provide chat support). The term 'real-time' implies performance constraints (low latency) and likely scalability to handle concurrent users, so PE and SC are marked. No explicit availability, security, usability, or other concerns stated.

RequirementText: The interface should be designed for scalability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states scalability of the interface; does not mention other qualities (performance, availability, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: Healthcare providers shall be able to schedule surgeries through the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (scheduling surgeries). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The application should have a disaster recovery plan in place.
AI_Rationale: A disaster recovery plan addresses the system's ability to recover from major failures and maintain availability (A) and resilience/recovery behavior (FT). It is also an operational concern (O) as it pertains to procedures and administration. It does not specify functional behavior or other NFRs explicitly.

RequirementText: Users shall receive confirmation emails upon successful actions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (system must send confirmation emails to users after successful actions). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system should optimize database queries for performance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly targets optimizing database queries for performance, which is a performance (PE) concern. It does not mention functionality, availability, fault tolerance, scalability, security, usability, maintainability, portability, operability, look-and-feel, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: The software shall support biometric authentication methods.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (support for biometric authentication), which is functional. It also clearly concerns authentication, a security concern, so Security is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, usability, portability, etc., so those are not marked.

RequirementText: Patients shall have access to their vaccination records.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (patients can access their vaccination records) — a functional requirement. It also defines an access right (who may view records), which implies an access-control/security constraint, so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, usability, legal, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The platform should ensure compatibility with wearable health devices.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies ensuring compatibility with wearable health devices, which is primarily a portability concern (support across device platforms). It also implies operational considerations for integrating and operating with such devices (operability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall facilitate telemedicine consultations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a provided capability (support telemedicine consultations), which is functional. It does not specify non-functional qualities such as performance, availability, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: The application should enforce strong password policies.
AI_Rationale: Enforcing strong password policies is a security requirement related to authentication and credential strength. It does not explicitly address functionality, performance, availability, usability, or other non-security quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to download their medical history.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to download medical history), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system should support data migration from legacy systems.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying that the system must provide data migration capability from legacy systems. It also implies an operational/admin capability (supporting migration processes), so Operability is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, UI, legal, or maintainability requirements.

RequirementText: Healthcare administrators shall manage user roles and permissions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (administrators shall manage user roles and permissions) — a functional requirement. It directly concerns access control and privileges, which is a security concern (authentication/authorization/permissions), so SE is also set. No explicit mentions of availability, fault tolerance, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, or operability features were given.

RequirementText: The application should have a consistent design language.
AI_Rationale: This requirement concerns the visual and aesthetic consistency of the application (design language), which maps directly to Look & Feel. It does not explicitly state functional behavior, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Patients shall receive automated follow-up reminders.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (sending automated follow-up reminders to patients), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state quality attributes such as availability, security, performance, usability, or others.

RequirementText: The system should utilize cloud infrastructure for scalability.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states cloud infrastructure is to be used for scalability, directly indicating scalability (SC). It also specifies the target deployment/operational environment (cloud), which relates to operability/administration/deployment concerns (O). No explicit statements about availability, performance, security, portability, or functional behavior are given.

RequirementText: The software shall provide audit trails for all transactions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must provide audit trails (logging of transactions) — this is a functional requirement. It also implies security-related accountability/forensics, so Security is applicable. No explicit mention of availability, legal compliance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Doctors shall access patient data through secure portals.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (doctors accessing patient data) and explicitly requires secure portals, indicating a security constraint. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, usability, or other non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The application should ensure high availability and uptime.
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly targets availability/uptime (high availability). It does not mention fault tolerance mechanisms, performance, security, or other quality attributes, so only Availability is marked.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to search for specialists within the network.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (search for specialists), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system should implement load balancing mechanisms.
AI_Rationale: Specifying implementation of load balancing primarily addresses system performance (throughput/response under load) and scalability (handling increased load across resources). It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, or operational/maintenance concerns, so those were not set.

RequirementText: Patients shall access educational resources through the platform.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (patients can access educational resources), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, usability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The application should undergo regular security assessments.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the application must undergo regular security assessments, which directly relates to security practices (confidentiality/integrity assurance). It does not specify availability, performance, usability, legal compliance, or other quality attributes, so only SE is set.

RequirementText: Healthcare providers shall update patient records in real-time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (updating patient records). The phrase "in real-time" imposes a performance/latency requirement, so PE is set. No explicit availability, security, scalability, or other non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system should support data analytics and reporting.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (support for data analytics and reporting). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall have the ability to customize dashboard views.
