AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability/permission (healthcare providers shall access patient behavioral health data) — a functional requirement. Also implies access control/authorization concerns, so security is applicable.

RequirementText: The system should implement intrusion prevention systems.
AI_Rationale: Implementing intrusion prevention systems is a security control requirement (confidentiality/integrity protection). It does not explicitly specify availability, fault tolerance, performance, usability, portability, maintainability, operability, scalability, legal, or look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: Users shall receive customized exercise plans based on their health data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (providing customized exercise plans based on users' health data), which is functional. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The application should support high-throughput data ingestion for large datasets.
AI_Rationale: Specifies high-throughput ingestion (throughput/latency/resource concerns) and ability to handle large datasets (scalability). No functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: Patients shall access personalized stress management resources through the application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (patients accessing personalized stress management resources), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system should utilize automated certificate management for secure communications.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates automated certificate management to enable secure communications — explicitly a security requirement (certificates, secure comms). It also implies operational/admin concern (automation of certificate lifecycle), so Operability is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: Doctors shall access patient diagnostic imaging directly within the system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (doctors must be able to access patient diagnostic imaging) — a functional requirement. It also implies access control/authorization (role-based access for doctors), so security is applicable.

RequirementText: The application should ensure compliance with local healthcare regulations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly mandates regulatory compliance with local healthcare regulations, which is a legal/standards constraint. It does not specify availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall have the ability to set health-related goals and track progress.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (setting goals and tracking progress), which is functional. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as performance, security, availability, usability, or scalability.

RequirementText: The system should implement automated failover to backup systems.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system shall implement automated failover to backup systems — this is a functional capability (F) and directly addresses fault tolerance/resilience (FT). It does not explicitly state availability metrics, operability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Patients shall engage in virtual nutritional counseling via the platform.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—patients using the platform to receive virtual nutritional counseling. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The application should support integration with national health information networks.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (support integration), which is a functional requirement. It also explicitly implies interoperability/compatibility with external national health information networks, so Portability is applicable. No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability are present.

RequirementText: Healthcare providers shall manage patient immunization schedules within the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (managing patient immunization schedules). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system should employ secure application development lifecycle practices.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates secure application development lifecycle practices, which is a security-related process constraint focused on reducing vulnerabilities and ensuring secure coding/SDLC; it does not specify availability, performance, portability, UI, or other non-security quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall access a personalized health dashboard with real-time data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (access a personalized health dashboard) and a real-time data constraint. Real-time implies performance concerns (latency/throughput). Meeting real-time updates often impacts scalability, so SC is marked. No explicit mention of security, availability, UI look-and-feel, maintenance, portability, or operability, so those are not set.

RequirementText: The application should support automated data cleansing processes.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (support automated data cleansing). It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like availability, performance, security, or operability.

RequirementText: Patients shall receive personalized medication adherence support through the application.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a feature the system must provide (personalized medication adherence support), so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly constrain availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system should utilize secure microservices for different functionalities.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates 'secure' microservices, so Security (SE) applies. Specifying microservices for different functionalities implies an architectural modularization that strongly supports Maintainability (MN) and also affects Operability (O) (deployment/management of services). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, scalability, portability, or functional behavior, so those are not set.

RequirementText: Doctors shall access patient lab test results directly within the system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (doctors accessing patient lab test results within the system), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The application should ensure data residency compliance based on user location.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies compliance with data residency based on user location, which is a legal/regulatory constraint. It does not explicitly state functional behavior, security mechanisms, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall have access to a comprehensive symptom tracking tool.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (providing users access to a symptom tracking tool). It does not state quality attributes like availability, security, usability, performance, or others, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The system should implement automated monitoring for performance metrics.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies providing automated monitoring capability (a system function) focused on performance metrics; this is primarily a functional requirement and relates to operability/administration (monitoring/manageability). It does not state availability, performance targets, security, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: Patients shall access personalized exercise regimens through the platform.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: patients must be able to access personalized exercise regimens via the platform. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The application should support secure integration with external health services.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the application must support integration (a functional capability) and that this integration must be secure (a security concern). It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, portability, performance, scalability, operability, maintainability, legal, look & feel, or usability aspects.

RequirementText: The app shall run on a smart phone with Android OS least version 2.3 .
AI_Rationale: Specifies target platform/operating system and minimum OS version, i.e., platform compatibility/portability requirement. No mention of availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: All layout shall be according to the TU/e corporate identity, unless in conflict with the guidelines of requirements UCOR003-UCOR006.
AI_Rationale: Specifies compliance with TU/e corporate identity and references other guideline requirements — this is a legal/compliance constraint and directly concerns layout/look-and-feel (UI appearance). No functional, performance, security, or other quality aspects are implied.

RequirementText: The icons shall be according to the Android Icon Guidelines.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates adherence to the Android Icon Guidelines, which is a compliance constraint (L) and directly concerns visual appearance/branding of the UI (LF). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user interfaces shall be according to the Android User Interface Guidelines.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates conformance to the Android User Interface Guidelines, which is a directive to follow specified UI standards (Look & Feel). It is also a compliance-type constraint with an external standard, treated similarly to a legal/policy requirement, so L is set. It does not explicitly state functional behavior, usability metrics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Twitter "tweet" interface shall be according to the Twitter Guidelines.
AI_Rationale: Requires conformance to Twitter Guidelines, which is a compliance requirement and specifically concerns the user interface appearance/behavior (look & feel). No explicit functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The Facebook "like" interface shall be according to the Facebook Guidelines.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates compliance with Facebook Guidelines for the 'like' interface, which is a conformance/legal/policy constraint (L) and directly concerns the user interface appearance/behavior (Look & Feel, LF). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The campus map shall cover the campus of the TU/e.
AI_Rationale: This specifies functional behavior/content of the system (what the campus map must cover). It does not state non-functional qualities like performance, security, or UI.

RequirementText: The campus map shall cover the central train station of Eindhoven.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional requirement about the map's geographic coverage (include Eindhoven central train station). No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: A new stylistic map must have the right dimensions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies visual/presentation requirement for a 'stylistic map' (dimensions), which pertains to look & feel rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A new stylistic map must be geographically correct.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that a newly created stylistic map must be geographically correct, which is a functional constraint on what the system must deliver (correctness of map data). The term 'stylistic' also implies an appearance aspect (look and feel), so LF is marked. There is no explicit mention of availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: News will be restricted to what is available in the feeds on the list of news RSS-feeds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint on what news content is shown: restricted to items from the listed RSS feeds. This describes required behavior (source restriction) rather than availability, performance, security, or UI qualities.

RequirementText: Agenda will be restricted to what is available in the feeds on the list of agenda RSS-feeds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional constraint on system behavior: the agenda content must be limited to items present in the listed RSS feeds. It describes what the system should do (source restriction) rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Information about a certain person will be restricted to what is available on the employee pages of the TU/e Encyclopedia.
AI_Rationale: The requirement constrains which personal information the system may display (restricting to employee pages), which is a security/privacy access-control constraint (SE). It also specifies expected system behavior about what information is shown, so it can be interpreted as a functional constraint (F). No indications of availability, performance, legal, UI, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: The information and the search methods of the Encyclopedia-app will be restricted to the services provided by the MediaWiki of the TU/e Encyclopedia.
AI_Rationale: This statement constrains what the app shall provide (information and search methods) to only those services offered by the TU/e MediaWiki — a functional requirement describing allowed functionality. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The information and the search methods of the Student Handbook-app will be restricted depending on file format of the handbook-information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies behavior: the app must restrict displayed information and available search methods based on handbook file format (functional). The word 'restricted' implies access control/authorization concerns (security). No indication of performance, availability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The search response time for the system must consistently be within two seconds, with an ideal goal of one second, based on measurments from 1000 searches during testing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies explicit response-time performance requirements for search (target 2s, ideal 1s measured over 1000 searches). This is a performance NFR; no availability or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: System dependability ensures users are informed of any issues for trusted system performance , measured during testing and prioritized highly.
AI_Rationale: The requirement focuses on system dependability and informing users of issues (operability/notification). Dependability implies availability/reliability and fault tolerance; it does not specify security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or UI look-and-feel, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The application should ideally use less than 10 MB of storage space, with a hard limit of 20 MB.
AI_Rationale: Specifies storage space constraints (resource/size limits), which is a performance/resource non-functional requirement.

RequirementText: The applications memory usage on the mobile operating system should ideally be below 10 MB, with a strict limit of 20 MB during operation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies memory usage limits (ideal and strict) for the application on a mobile OS, which is a performance/resource constraint.

RequirementText: The system should reliably deliver accurate search results in over 98% of cases, aiming for 99% or even perfect accuracy during operation
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies delivering search results (a functional capability) with a quantitative accuracy target (>98%). It is primarily a functional requirement with a quality constraint on accuracy; no explicit references to availability, performance (latency/throughput), security, or other NFR categories are made.

RequirementText: The system should be accessible to users more than 98% of the time, ideally aiming for 99% or even continuous uptime.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system uptime/availability targets (>98%, ideally 99% or continuous). It explicitly concerns availability. It does not explicitly mention fault tolerance, recovery, performance, security, or other quality attributes, so only Availability is set.

RequirementText: The application requires an internet connection to function."
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a dependency on network connectivity (system must be reachable via the internet to function), which pertains to availability requirements and an operational/environmental constraint. It does not specify security, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The application requires a GPS connection for functionality.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a dependency on GPS hardware/environment required for operation. It is an operability/operational environment constraint and implies portability limitations (won't run on platforms without GPS). It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Login communication must be 100% encrypted to prevent usernames and passwords from being intercepted during data exchange between the application and server.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates encryption of login communication to protect usernames and passwords from interception, which is a clear security (confidentiality/integrity) requirement.

RequirementText: The restaurant owner login system must always prevent unauthorized access by notifying users of failed login attempts with non-existent accounts.
AI_Rationale: Specifies login system behavior to prevent unauthorized access (functional) and explicitly concerns preventing unauthorized access/handling failed logins (security). No mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The admin login system must always block unauthorized access and notify admins of failed login attempts with non-existent accounts.
AI_Rationale: Requirement prescribes specific system behavior (block unauthorized access and send notifications) => Functional. It explicitly addresses access control and alerting for failed logins, which are security concerns => Security. Notification to admins about failed attempts aligns with maintenance/operational monitoring practices and mirrors provided example that labeled similar text as MN => Maintainability.

RequirementText: To prevent unauthorized access, restaurant owner accounts will be locked for 30 minutes after three failed login attempts, disabling login functionality during that period.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a security control (account lockout after failed logins) to prevent unauthorized access, which is a security concern (SE). It also describes a specific system behavior (locking accounts and disabling login), so it has a functional aspect (F). No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: Admin accounts will be secured by a 30-minute lockout following three failed login attempts, preventing access from that IP address during the lockout period.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a security control (account lockout after failed logins and IP blocking) — clearly a security (SE) requirement. It also defines specific system behavior (locking admin accounts), which qualifies as a functional (F) aspect. No indications of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system will enforce unique usernames during user account creation, prompting users to choose a different username if their desired one is already taken.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (enforce unique usernames and prompt when taken) which is functional. The prompting aspect implies a usability concern (user feedback) so US is set. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Restaurant owner account creation prioritizes security by enforcing unique usernames, requiring them to choose a different option if their desired name is unavailable.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior for account creation (enforcing unique usernames) — a functional requirement — and explicitly frames it as a security measure, implying authentication/identity-related security constraints.

RequirementText: The application's code structure should be designed for easy extension, facilitating the addition of new features.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns code design to facilitate addition of new features, which is a classic maintainability concern (ease of extension). No mention of availability, performance, security, or UI.

RequirementText: The application will require well-defined test environments to ensure thorough testing of its various functionalities.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies need for well-defined test environments to ensure thorough testing — this directly concerns testability and ease of maintenance (maintainability). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, usability, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The application should be designed for easy porting between iOS and Android platforms.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns designing the application to be easily ported between iOS and Android, which directly maps to portability. It does not explicitly address other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system must support 10,000 concurrent users with a maximum response time of 2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity (10,000 concurrent users) which is a scalability requirement and a performance constraint (maximum response time of 2 seconds). No mention of availability, security, or other concerns.

RequirementText: The system will be developed using Waterfall methodology, Object-Oriented Programming in Java, targeting Android devices 2.3 onwards with a mandatory internet connection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies development methodology and implementation technology (Java/OOP) which are operability/implementation constraints, and targets a specific platform (Android 2.3+) which is a portability/platform constraint. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: ​ The system will be designed in such a way that the algorithms for the four main units will be able to be easily swapped out.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that algorithms should be easily swapped out, which is a maintainability/modularity concern (ease of modification and replacement). It does not specify functionality, availability, performance, portability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The overall accuracy of the Web API’s response will be measured using a developer-made testing set.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies measuring the API's response accuracy using a developer-made test set, which implies a quality measurement (performance/accuracy) and indicates testability practices (maintainability). It does not describe functional behavior, availability, security, or other explicit NFRs.

RequirementText: The overall accuracy is calculated by dividing total number of correct answers by the number of questions asked.
AI_Rationale: Defines a specific calculation/behavior (how overall accuracy is computed), which is a functional requirement specifying system behavior or reporting logic.

RequirementText: The accuracy of the Generic Question Construction​ part will be close to 80%
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative accuracy target (~80%) for a system component, which is a performance/quality metric rather than a functional behavior or other NFR category.

RequirementText: The system will be designed in such a way that the algorithms for the four main units will be easily swapped out.
AI_Rationale: Specifies design for easy swapping of algorithms (modularity/replaceability), which is a maintainability/extensibility requirement. Does not mention availability, security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: A Drexel University Web API is being designed to answer questions about campus facilities, staff, policies, dining, and food trucks, with accuracy ranging from 40% for food trucks to 80% for generic question construction.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a Web API that answers questions (functional behavior) and gives explicit accuracy targets (quality metric about correctness/accuracy), which maps to performance/quality. No mention of availability, security, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The average time for the server to respond, over the question testing set, will be less than or equal to 2 seconds
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete response-time performance requirement (average server response ≤ 2s). Does not address availability, scalability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The connection between the Web API and the programs will use HTTPS, for security.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of HTTPS to secure connections, which is a security requirement (encryption/confidentiality). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: A new user will make less than 3 mistakes in 5 minutes after 5 minutes of use.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user performance/error-rate metric after brief use, which is a usability requirement (learnability/error tolerance). No indication of performance, security, legal, etc.

RequirementText: The search feature should be prominent and easy to find for the user.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns the user interface presentation and ease of finding the search feature—this is a look-and-feel and usability requirement rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The different search options should be evident, simple and easy to understand.
AI_Rationale: Requirement targets the user interface's discoverability and simplicity of search options (usability). It also implies visual/presentation aspects (look & feel). No indication of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Users should be able to easily understand and select results from the list with just a single click.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI interaction (single-click selection) and ease of understanding—these are look & feel and usability concerns rather than availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Map results should be clear and user-friendly, allowing selection of any pin with a single click.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies UI presentation ('clear and user-friendly') and interaction style ('selection... with a single click'), which are look-and-feel and usability concerns. It does not state backend functionality, performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The information link for each result should be clear, easy to identify, and open with just a single click.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns the appearance and recognizability of links and ease of interaction (single-click). This relates to look & feel and usability rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user interface should be GUI based.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the user interface type (graphical UI) which is a look-and-feel/layout requirement. It does not state performance, usability metrics, functionality, or other non-functional aspects explicitly.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to enter data using a cell phone keypad layout.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (enter data) — functional. Also constrains the user interface/input method (cell phone keypad layout), affecting look-and-feel and usability.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to configure settings both locally on the device and remotely.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability: users can configure settings locally and remotely — this is a functional requirement. It also implies aspects of operability/administration (ability to manage/configure the system in different environments), but it does not state performance, security, usability, availability, portability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall provide selection menus to minimize the need for manual typing of options.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI feature (selection menus) — a functional requirement — intended to reduce manual typing, which primarily targets usability; also relates to UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Application prioritizes fast network response as it relies heavily on data retrieval rather than phone processing power.
AI_Rationale: Specifies prioritizing fast network response due to reliance on data retrieval—this is a performance (response time/latency) requirement. No explicit availability, security, scalability, or functional behavior is stated.

RequirementText: The application itself will only have minimal logic and so there should be little to no issues with the computation required by the phone itself.
AI_Rationale: The requirement addresses the amount of computation and processing load on the phone (minimal logic, little to no issues with computation), which is a performance/resource usage concern. It does not state functional behavior or other quality aspects explicitly.

RequirementText: The only hazard is a user using the device when they should not be, such as while driving.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a user misuse/hazard scenario (using device when they should not, e.g., while driving), which pertains to safe/easy use and preventing unsafe interaction—aligns with usability. It does not explicitly state legal, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: Secure connection to an internal system shall be required for user login and identification.
AI_Rationale: Specifies requirement for a secure connection for user login/identification, which is a security (confidentiality/integrity/authentication) constraint. Does not describe functionality beyond security, nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The primary attribute of this application will be usability given the large amounts of data and information that will be presented on such a small screen, as well as the user’s ability to input data into the device in a reasonable manner that should not be that much more difficult than if they were at an actual computer.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states usability as the primary attribute and focuses on presentation on a small screen and ease of data input; this is a usability (UX) requirement rather than functional or other NFRs.

RequirementText: With regards to the intended number of users in the Amsterdam pilot, and the projected load scenarios, the intention is for the system to be able to serve 20.000 queries / day (in large part during the 4 peak traffic hours).
AI_Rationale: Specifies throughput requirement (20,000 queries/day with peak load concentrated in 4 hours), which is a performance concern and implies scalability to handle peak load. No mention of availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to trust and understand the system through its simplicity and transparency.
AI_Rationale: The requirement focuses on users being able to trust and understand the system through simplicity and transparency, which directly concerns usability (learnability, understandability) and the system's look & feel/clarity. It does not specify availability, security, performance, or other non-functional categories explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall anonymize and aggregate route information to enable safe sharing without compromising user privacy.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (anonymize and aggregate route data) — functional. Primary intent is protecting user privacy when sharing data, which is a security/privacy requirement (SE). No explicit availability, performance, legal, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall employ encryption for all privacy-sensitive data at rest to ensure both security and basic functionality.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates encryption of privacy-sensitive data at rest, which is a security control (confidentiality). It does not specify availability, performance, portability, UI, or maintenance concerns, nor a functional workflow beyond the security measure.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create unverified (anonymous) avatars or aliases.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (allow users to create anonymous avatars/aliases), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, privacy, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall empower end-users to manage their private data, including the option to delete their personal repository.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: end-users can manage and delete their personal data repository. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, legal/compliance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be multilingual, supporting English, Turkish, Finnish, and Italian for international deployment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required capability (support multiple languages) — a functional requirement. It also impacts user interface text and presentation (Look & Feel) and user experience/accessibility for international users (Usability). No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall support the display of all user interface text elements in both English and Dutch.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states a system capability ('shall support') so it's functional. It concerns the wording/display of UI text (look & feel) and affects usability (language accessibility/localization).

RequirementText: The system shall allow qualified programmers to extend functionality through adding sub-apps and launchers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow qualified programmers to add sub-apps and launchers), so it is functional. It also implies extensibility/maintainability (support for extending functionality by developers), hence Maintainability. No explicit mention of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI look-and-feel, fault tolerance, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall allow authorized users to delete sub-apps and their launchers within the main application.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (deleting sub-apps and launchers). The phrase 'authorized users' explicitly indicates an access-control/authorization constraint, so security is applicable. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall allow application maintainers to configure information sources for sub-applications like agenda, news, Facebook, and Twitter.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functionality: maintainers must be able to configure information sources for sub-apps. It describes an action/capability (functional). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: For non-programmers, the system shall allow customization of the application's visual style (colors and icons) for easy maintenance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (system shall allow customization) => Functional. It concerns visual style (colors, icons) => Look & Feel. Targeting non-programmers and easing maintenance implies usability and improves maintainability. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, operability, or fault-tolerance constraints.

RequirementText: The application shall be extensible, allowing skilled Java Android programmers to add new sub-applications with launchers to the main interface.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability of the system (it shall be extensible so programmers can add sub-applications), which can be treated as a functional capability and it explicitly concerns extensibility/ability to modify/extend the system, so Maintainability is applicable. No explicit statements about availability, performance, security, portability, UI look-and-feel, scalability, operability, or fault tolerance are present.

RequirementText: Radford University students shall use their RU credentials to access automatic class schedule and assignment sharing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that access requires Radford University (RU) credentials — an authentication/authorization constraint. This is an access control/security requirement rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall operate primarily offline, with networked authentication components functioning only when Radford University's systems are available.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies offline operation and graceful handling of networked authentication when external systems are unavailable, which describes resilience to network faults and continued operation without the network (fault tolerance). It does not specify uptime metrics, administrative concerns, security controls, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The development team will follow best practices for clean code and software modularity in order to make the application as maintainable as possible.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates following clean code and modularity best practices to maximize maintainability, which maps directly to Maintainability (MN). It does not specify availability, security, performance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Users will be able to access this application on or off campus anytime on their mobile device without the need of an internet connection.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (users can access the app on mobile devices without internet) so it's functional. It also explicitly demands offline operation (ability to operate without network), which aligns with fault tolerance/resilience to lack of connectivity. It does not explicitly state availability metrics, usability, security, portability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall offer extensive customization for course and calendar details while maintaining a more static design for other functionalities.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to offer extensive customization (a functional capability). The customization of course and calendar details and the distinction between customizable vs static design concerns the user interface/look-and-feel and user experience, so LF and US are applicable. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or legal issues are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall function as a reusable semester-to-semester application for returning students, offering automatic class schedule updates and integration with the Radford University mobile app.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (reusable semester-to-semester, automatic schedule updates, integration) → Functional. 'Reusable' implies maintainability/reusability concerns (MN). Integration with the mobile app implies operability/interfacing requirements (O). No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, usability, look-and-feel, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system will be designed in such a way that the algorithms for the four main units will be able to be easily swapped out.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies ease of swapping algorithms (modularity, replaceability), which is a maintainability/modifiability concern. It does not specify availability, performance, portability, security, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The overall accuracy shall be calculated by dividing total number of correct answers by the number of questions asked.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional computation/metric (how to calculate overall accuracy). No quality/ non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The accuracy of the Generic Question Construction​ part will be close to 80%.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a quantitative accuracy target (~80%) for a component, which is a measurable quality/performance metric rather than a functional behavior or other non-functional category.

RequirementText: The accuracy of the Generic Answer Construction​ unit will be close to 70%.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a quantitative accuracy target (quality/performance metric) for a unit. It is a non-functional performance-related measure rather than a functional capability or other NFR category.

RequirementText: The accuracy of the Generic Answer Population​ unit will be close to 70%.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a quantitative accuracy target (≈70%) for a system unit, which is a performance/quality metric rather than a functional behavior or other NFR categories. It does not address availability, security, usability, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The average time for the server to respond, over the question testing set, will be less than or equal to 2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative response-time constraint (average <= 2s) which is a performance requirement. It does not address availability, functionality, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The FAU class ensures security-relevant events are logged and identifies what information should be included in those logs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the FAU class shall log security-relevant events (functional behavior) and defines the content of security logs, which is a security-related requirement (audit/logging for security). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed for high performance with optimized server queries, instantaneous screen transitions, and sub-second cost-division computation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies performance-related requirements: optimized queries, instantaneous screen transitions, and sub-second computation, which are clearly performance non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: SplitPay will prioritize user safety by ensuring it doesn't interfere with other apps or data, and in the future, the application will warn users against using it when focus is critical.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies behavioral constraints (must not interfere with other apps/data) — a functional constraint — and addresses protection of other apps/data (security/integrity). The planned user warnings relate to usability/safety (user-facing alerts), so mark US. Other quality categories are not implied.

RequirementText: The system shall prioritize convenience over robust user authentication by relying solely on Google email verification in the future.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (rely solely on Google email verification) => functional. It concerns authentication approach and security posture (authentication mechanism) => security. States prioritizing convenience over robust authentication => implies usability focus (convenience) rather than stronger security; therefore classify as usability as well. No explicit mention of availability, fault tolerance, portability, legal, maintainability, operability, performance, or scalability.

RequirementText: SplitPay's user interface will prioritize usability and clarity, featuring a visually-appealing design and leveraging informative notifications and pop-ups to guide users in the future.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on user interface aesthetics (visually-appealing design) and ease of use (usability, clarity, informative notifications/pop-ups to guide users). No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system will prioritize error-free expense splitting calculations while offering full app functionality offline, caching financial data until reconnected.
AI_Rationale: Specifies correct expense-splitting behavior (functional). Requires full offline operation/caching until reconnection — implies availability when offline and graceful degradation/resilience (fault tolerance). No explicit security, performance, scalability, legal, or UI requirements.

AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a display behavior (show events matching search criteria by date or subject), which is a functional behavior. No non-functional aspects (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to like a certain event.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user action (ability to like an event). No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to tweet a certain event.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (tweet an event), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall extract only events available in the agenda app from the agenda RSS feeds in the selected language.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior: extracting events from RSS feeds, filtering to those available in the agenda app and matching the selected language. This is a functional requirement; no non-functional qualities are implied.

RequirementText: Administrators shall be able to modify the list of agenda RSS feeds available in English.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: administrators must be able to modify a list of agenda RSS feeds (available in English). It describes what the system should do rather than a quality attribute such as performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: Administrators shall be able to modify the list of agenda RSS feeds available in Dutch.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: administrators must be able to modify a list of agenda RSS feeds (with the constraint that the feeds are available in Dutch). It describes what the system should do, and does not state availability, performance, security, legal, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, portability, scalability, or usability non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for a person by name.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing a user capability (search for a person by name). No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for a person by department.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (search for a person by department), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display a set of employees that match the search input when a user performs a search by name (as described in requirements UCAR501 and UCAR502).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: displaying employees matching a name search (references UCAR501/502). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to allow users to view all personal information available through the employee pages for a selected person from the search results obtained through requirement UCAR503.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow users to view personal information from search results), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention authorization, privacy, performance, availability, UI appearance, or other non-functional aspects, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall be able to show the location of a selected employee's office on the map view.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a system capability (displaying the selected employee's office location on a map), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to plan a route to the location of a selected employee's office.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying route-planning behavior (what the system should do). It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display the most searched items on the title screen when the Encyclopedia app is launched.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (displaying most searched items on title screen at app launch) — a functional requirement describing what the system should do; no explicit non-functional constraints implied.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display the most recent items on the title screen when the Encyclopedia app is launched.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete functional behavior: showing the most recent items on the title screen at app launch. No non-functional constraints (performance, availability, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search the book by a certain word or phrase.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (search by word or phrase), which is a functional requirement; no non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to see a displayed set of topics when performing a search as described in requirement UCAR602.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability—seeing a displayed set of topics during a search—which describes functional behavior of the system. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to select a topic from the search result list.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action (selecting a topic from search results). It does not specify quality attributes such as performance, usability, security, etc., so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view the full text regarding a topic by clicking on it.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action/feature: ability to view the full text by clicking. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to like a certain topic.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (ability to like a topic), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to tweet a certain topic.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (ability to tweet about a topic), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to see the most searched items on the title screen when starting the student handbook app.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (displaying most-searched items at app startup) which is a functional behavior. It also constrains the UI location (title screen), implying a look-and-feel/user interface requirement. No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to select a topic from the search results obtained through a search described in requirement UCAR702.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (select a topic from search results), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (performance, usability, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to like a certain topic.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user action (ability to like a topic). No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to tweet a certain topic.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function (allowing a user to tweet a topic). It describes what the system should do (functional behavior) and does not mention any quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to see the TU/e Facebook page on the title screen when starting the Facebook app.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (the app must display the TU/e Facebook page on the title screen). It does not state availability, performance, security, UI styling, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to select other TU/e related Facebook sites from a list.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to select Facebook sites from a list (functional). Involves user interaction/choice from UI, so usability is relevant. No indications of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: System shall show the TU/e Facebook page on the title screen when the Facebook app is started.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a concrete system behavior (display the TU/e Facebook page on the title screen when the Facebook app starts), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall allow users to select other TU/e related Facebook sites from a list upon starting the Facebook app.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (provides a feature to select TU/e Facebook sites). It also specifies a user-facing selection at startup (UI interaction), which relates to usability/UX, so US is included. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Administrators shall be able to modify the list of TU/e related Facebook sites.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (administrators can modify a list), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, UI look-and-feel, maintainability, performance, scalability, portability, fault tolerance, operability, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: System shall show the TU/e Twitter page on the title screen when the Twitter app is started.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (display the TU/e Twitter page on the title screen when the app starts), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, UI style constraints, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall allow users to select other TU/e related Twitter sites from a list upon starting the Twitter app (content of the list is defined in requirement UCAR903).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (allow users to select Twitter sites) — a functional requirement. It involves a user selection UI at startup, which implies usability concerns (presentation and ease of selection), so Usability is also marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Administrators shall be able to modify the list of TU/e related Twitter sites.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability (administrators can modify a list), which is a functional requirement. It does not state non-functional qualities such as availability, security, performance, or UI/operability constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to download the mobile application for free through an application store or similar service on the mobile phone.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (ability to download the mobile app for free via an app store), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non‑functional aspects like availability, security, portability, or usability.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to check for new software releases and download them manually through the mobile phone.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user-facing capability (checking for and downloading software releases on a mobile phone), which is a functional feature. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to register on the mobile application by providing a username, password, and email address, with the option to provide a phone number.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability—registration with username, password, email, and optional phone number—which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so no other non-functional labels are set.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to log in to the mobile application with credentials stored on the phone for automatic future login.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a login feature that uses credentials stored on the device for automatic future login — this is primarily a functional requirement. Because it mandates storing credentials on the phone (security-sensitive behavior), it also implies security concerns (authentication/storage of credentials). It also impacts usability by enabling automatic login, so usability is marked. Other quality categories are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to retrieve their password by email if they forget it.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (password recovery via email). It also has clear security implications (handling credentials, secure reset), so SE is marked. No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to search for restaurants on the mobile application using various options including price, destination, restaurant type, specific dish, and free text with the ability to combine multiple options in a single search.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user-facing capability (search functionality with various filters and combinable options), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to view search results on a map with a maximum of 100 restaurants displayed, including pins with information links, a default zoom level, and a button to access filtering options.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (view search results on a map with pins, info links, zoom level, and filter button). The explicit cap of 100 displayed items is a performance/display constraint, so PE is marked. The specification of map presentation details (pins, default zoom, button) affects UI layout/appearance, so Look & Feel is marked. No explicit mentions of security, availability, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or usability-specific metrics, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to view search results in a list containing details like restaurant name, contact information, distance, price, description, links, and sort/filter the results by various criteria.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: viewing search results with specific fields and the ability to sort/filter. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to select a restaurant from the map or list and navigate there using the phone's GPS, then return to the search page upon arrival.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user-facing functionality (select restaurant, navigate via GPS, return to search) so is Functional. It also concerns user interaction and flow (ease of selecting and returning), implying Usability. It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, legal, or fault-tolerance constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to switch between a map view and a list view for all search options.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (switch between map and list views) — a functional requirement. It also implies a UI interaction affecting usability (ease of viewing information), so flagged as Usability. No explicit performance, security, availability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to view a detailed restaurant information page including picture, name, contact details, food type, price range, description, and menu by selecting the information link on search results.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-visible capability (view detailed restaurant information including picture, name, contact, etc.) which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for restaurants by price range (minimum and maximum) with results displayed in a list view by default.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (search by price range). It also specifies the default presentation (list view), which pertains to UI/layout (Look & Feel). No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for restaurants by entering a desired distance range (minimum and maximum) from their current location.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a search capability (search by distance range from current location). It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like performance, usability, security, etc., so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to search by price and destination, entering integers for their desired values, and be informed if they enter an invalid input.
AI_Rationale: This describes functional capabilities: search by price and destination and input validation behavior (what the system should do) — therefore Functional. The requirement also specifies informing the user on invalid input, which pertains to usability (user feedback/error handling), so Usability is marked. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to choose a restaurant type from a list and see the results on a map.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (select restaurant type and view results on a map), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to choose a dish from a list and see results on a map.
AI_Rationale: Describes user-facing functionality: selecting a dish from a list and viewing results on a map. No non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to search for restaurants by any criteria (name, description, address, type, or menu) in a free-text field, with results shown on a map.
AI_Rationale: This describes a system capability (search by free-text across multiple attributes and display results on a map), i.e. functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to refine their search directly on the same page if their initial search yields no results.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (refine search on the same page) — functional. It also implies an improved user interaction/UX (usability) by enabling in-place refinement when no results are returned. No explicit performance, security, availability, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to sort search results by various criteria with ascending or descending order.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to sort search results and order), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention performance, UI/look-and-feel standards, usability metrics, availability, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to filter search results by distance, price, restaurant type, and specific dish.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functionality the system must provide (ability to filter search results by various criteria). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit their profile information and choose the app language (Swedish, English, Spanish, French) on the profile page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (editing profile and selecting app language) which is functional. It also impacts usability (language selection and profile editing improve user experience). No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintenance, fault-tolerance, operability, or look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to register and apply for verification on the web portal by providing username, password, address, email address, and phone number.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability—registering and applying for verification with specific fields—so it is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: User (restaurant owner) shall be able to apply for verification after registering on the web portal.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: restaurant owners must be able to apply for verification after registering. It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, security, usability, performance, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to log in only after receiving a confirmation email following verification of their restaurant owner application.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior (login allowed only after email confirmation following application verification). It also constrains authentication/access control, so it implies a security requirement.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in as a restaurant owner upon successful authentication.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (login as restaurant owner after authentication). No explicit non-functional requirements (availability, security constraints beyond mentioning authentication, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to reset their password by entering their email address and receiving a password reset link.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a password-reset capability (user enters email and receives a reset link). It does not specify availability, security controls (e.g., token expiry, verification), performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to manage information through a web form.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (managing information via a web form), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes such as usability, performance, security, availability, or others are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to complete mandatory registration by providing restaurant name, address, phone number, email address, and average price.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability—completing mandatory registration by providing specific data fields—so it is functional. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A user shall be able to optionally provide a restaurant description, menu, type, picture, and mobile number to enhance their listing.
AI_Rationale: This describes a user capability (ability to provide optional fields for a restaurant listing), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI appearance, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create a menu entry by providing a dish name, description, and price.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action to create a menu entry with dish name, description, and price — a functional requirement. No quality/constraint characteristics are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add restaurant information upon submitting the form, provided all mandatory fields are completed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (adding restaurant information via form with mandatory-field validation). No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional requirements are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add restaurant information by completing mandatory fields and optionally adding additional details.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to add restaurant information (functional behavior). No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to delete information from their restaurant listing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action (delete information from their restaurant listing) — a functional requirement. No quality, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow authenticated restaurant owners to edit existing restaurant information.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (allows owners to edit restaurant info). It explicitly requires authenticated restaurant owners, implying security concerns (authentication/authorization). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display content in the user's preferred language, allowing the restaurant owner to switch to English and view all text in English.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (display content in user's preferred language) — functional. It also concerns usability (user language selection, readability) so US is applicable. No indications of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display content in the user's preferred language upon selection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (display content in selected language) and impacts usability (user language preference and selection). No explicit non-functional constraints like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall allow the restaurant owner to select French as the preferred language for the web portal interface.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow selecting French as preferred language) and concerns usability (language selection improves user experience). It does not mention availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to log in with their accounts and grant them administrative privileges.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (administrator login and granting administrative privileges). It also implies security concerns (authentication/authorization) so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, fault-tolerance, look-and-feel, or operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to verify restaurant owners, granting them login access and sending confirmation emails.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing admin capabilities: verifying owners, granting login access, and sending confirmation emails (F). Because it describes granting login access/verification (access control), it also implicates security concerns (SE). Other non-functional categories are not explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to reject restaurant owners, disabling their login and sending a rejection email.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies what the system must do: allow administrators to reject owners, disable their login, and send a rejection email — this is functional behavior. It does not state availability, fault tolerance, security constraints, operability/platform, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to add new restaurant types.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (administrators can add new restaurant types), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to edit restaurant types, updating the list accordingly.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that administrators can edit restaurant types and update the list. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, availability, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to delete restaurant types, removing them from the list.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (administrators can delete restaurant types). It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to add a new dish to the list upon creation by an administrator.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (adding a new dish by an administrator). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to update an existing dish in the list upon edit by an administrator.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability to update an existing dish by an administrator, which is a functional behavior. The phrase 'by an administrator' implies role-based access (authorization), so a security concern is indicated. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to permanently remove dishes from the list.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functionality: administrators can permanently remove dishes from the list. It describes a system capability (functional) and does not explicitly state availability, security policies, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to add restaurant information upon administrator login.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system must allow adding restaurant information when an administrator is logged in. It does not explicitly state security, performance, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to delete restaurant information upon administrator confirmation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (delete restaurant information) with an administrator confirmation precondition. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to edit existing restaurant information.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a capability (administrators can edit restaurant information). No non-functional aspects (security, availability, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to update user information when an administrator edits an existing user profile.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: system updates user information when an administrator edits a profile. It does not state availability, security controls, performance, UI, or other non-functional qualities, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to delete existing user accounts.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to delete user accounts). The mention of 'administrators' implies role-based access control (authorization), so a security aspect is present.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to add a new restaurant owner upon creation by an administrator.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability (administrator adds a new restaurant owner). No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to update restaurant owner information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (administrators can update restaurant owner information), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to delete a restaurant owner upon administrator confirmation, also removing all associated restaurant information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability—deleting a restaurant owner and associated data upon administrator confirmation—which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like availability, security mechanisms, performance, etc., so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: The system shall display all text in English when the administrator selects English as the preferred language.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (display text in English when administrator selects English). Also impacts usability by providing language selection for users/administrators, improving user experience.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display the web-portal in Swedish upon administrator selection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (display portal in Swedish on administrator selection). It also implies a usability/localization concern (language support) but does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select French as their preferred language for the web portal.
