AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability to select a preferred language (functional). Also impacts user experience/usability by enabling language preference, matching similar examples labeled F and US. No mention of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to change the web-portals language to Spanish.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability (ability to change the portal language) which is a functional requirement. It also concerns localization/usability (user experience in preferred language), so US is set. No indication of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall display a search bar prominently to enable users to easily find the information they need.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (display a search bar). The terms 'prominently' and 'enable users to easily find' imply concerns about visual presentation and usability, so Look & Feel and Usability are also relevant. No availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall present search options in a clear, understandable way.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies presentation and clarity of the search options, which concerns look-and-feel and usability (understandability). It does not state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or functional details beyond UI quality, so only LF and US are set.

RequirementText: The system shall display user-friendly, one-click selectable results in the list view.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a display and interaction behavior (show results and enable one-click selection) — functional. The phrase 'user-friendly, one-click' indicates usability/user experience concerns, so Usability is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints are stated. Look & Feel not strongly implied beyond usability.

RequirementText: The system shall display user-friendly map view results requiring a single click to select a pin.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (display map and select pin) and includes interaction/usability constraints ('user-friendly', 'single click') implying usability requirements rather than other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure the information link is clearly visible, clickable in one action, and functions as a link.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies UI visibility and clickability (look & feel and usability) and that the element must function as a link (functional behavior).

RequirementText: The user shall be able to create an account by providing credentials and activating it via email.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (account creation with credential input and email activation), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security controls, usability constraints, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to log in to the system by entering their username or email and password.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (user authentication via username or email and password). It does not state availability, performance, security controls, usability metrics, or other quality attributes, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log out of the system.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (ability for a user to log out), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, usability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to search for items by filtering by price, location, and category.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying search/filter capabilities (by price, location, category). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to browse profiles of other users, including usernames, profile photos, and their items.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (browse other users' profiles and view usernames, photos, and items), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as availability, security, usability, performance, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to browse categories and see the item count for each.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (browse categories and view item counts) which is functional behavior; no quality/constraint aspects implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to browse items including pictures, prices, and other features.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (browse items showing pictures, prices, features), which is a functional requirement. No quality/constraint aspects (performance, availability, UI look-and-feel, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to change profile information including username, email address, profile picture, and password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (changing profile information), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, security measures, performance, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to confirm username and password changes through email notification.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (confirming username/password changes via email), so it is functional. The confirmation via email is a security control to verify identity and protect account changes, so Security is applicable. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, portability, scalability, usability, legal, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: User shall be able to purchase credits using credit card or PayPal account.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to purchase credits via credit card or PayPal), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to purchase items in their cart using credits, if allowed by the item.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability (users can purchase items using credits, subject to item allowance). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to request an exchange for an item they want, if the item they have is eligible for exchange.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (request an exchange) with a conditional rule (item eligibility). It describes functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to approve an exchange offer from another user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action (approving an exchange offer), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to decline an exchange offer from another user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (decline an exchange offer), which is functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to notify the recipient that their item has been shipped.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to notify a recipient of shipment), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to freely add items with details, price, amount, and pictures.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to add items with details, price, amount, and pictures), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, usability, or UI appearance.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to edit their existing items, including adding/removing pictures and changing price and details.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies a user-facing capability (editing items, managing pictures, changing price/details), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to remove an item they no longer wish to sell/exchange by tapping the Remove the item button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action and system capability (removing an item via a button), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Users can permanently delete their accounts and access to the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — users being able to permanently delete their accounts (and thereby their access). It does not explicitly state security, availability, legal (e.g., GDPR), or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to mark an item as a favorite for change notifications.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (mark item as favorite to receive change notifications), which is a functional behavior. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to provide ratings and comments about their trading partners.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to provide ratings and comments), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall accept GET requests with a question in a single URL parameter and a Content-Type header of application/json.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system should behave (accept GET requests with a specific URL parameter and Content-Type). This is an API functional/behavior requirement, not a quality/constraints requirement.

RequirementText: System shall be able to respond to API queries with either JSON data or error messages, using appropriate response codes and headers.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies what the system should do for API responses (return JSON or error messages, with appropriate response codes and headers). This is a functional behavior requirement; it does not explicitly state non-functional concerns like performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall return a JSON response containing either successful data or error messages, but not both.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the required behavior and structure of the system's API response (what the system shall return: either data or errors, but not both). This is a functional requirement about response content; it does not address performance, security, availability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to anonymize text by replacing identified keywords with generic terms and provide a mapping between them.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system capability (anonymize text by replacing keywords and provide mapping), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, performance, scalability, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to maintain a list of generic words associated with potential user queries.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing maintaining a list (data management). It does not specify availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall return a user-friendly message like Sorry, I didn't understand that when it encounters an error parsing the input.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior (returning a message when parsing fails) which is functional. It also explicitly requires the message to be "user-friendly," which relates to usability. No indications of availability, security, performance, maintainability, portability, scalability, operability, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to condense the output sentence from the Generic Question Construction unit (R4.2.1.3) into a single, concise sentence.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (condense output sentence into a single concise sentence), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: This system will convert an input question about a specific entity and property (e.g., building closing time) into a generic answer sentence (e.g., building closes at specific time).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a processing behavior (convert an input question into a generic answer sentence) — this is a functional requirement. No quality constraints (performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to handle generic sentence failures by falling back to error handling in R4.4.2.1.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system should behave when sentence failures occur (fallback to error handling), which is functional behavior focused on fault handling/resilience (fault tolerance). Does not mention availability, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to process a mapping received from the Generic Question Construction unit.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must process a mapping received from another unit. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to condense a generic answer from the Generic Answer Construction unit into a single, concise sentence.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (to condense a generic answer into a single concise sentence), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to retrieve data about mapped elements from the database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (retrieving data about mapped elements from the database). It does not state any availability, performance, security, portability, usability, or other non-functional constraints, so no additional NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to personalize generic responses by inserting specific data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (personalizing responses by inserting specific data). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: If the database has no closing time for Rush Building, the system will inform the user and provide the Drexel University website for further information.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior: detect missing closing time in database and inform the user with a link to Drexel University website. This is a functional requirement describing what the system should do; it does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like security, performance, availability, usability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to provide a generic error message when no relevant website is found.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying a generic error message) which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly constrain UI aesthetics, usability, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A MySQL database will be used to store all information required to answer questions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of a specific database technology for storage (architectural/maintenance and operational concern). Matches similar examples labeled MN and O; no explicit performance, portability, security, or functional behavior required.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to populate the database with extracted information prior to full system initialization.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (populate the database with extracted information before full initialization), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, portability, scalability, operability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: The database will use the generic representations from R4.2.2.1 as table names or column headers for easier retrieval of data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies database naming convention (use generic representations as table/column names) to facilitate easier retrieval—this is a design/maintenance and operability constraint about data representation and management. It does not specify performance, security, portability, or UI.

RequirementText: The database will be updated periodically and the API will be unavailable during the update.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes periodic database updates (a maintenance activity) => Maintainability. It explicitly states the API will be unavailable during updates, which impacts system uptime/availability => Availability. No security, performance, scalability, portability, operability, or UI aspects are specified.

RequirementText: Structural data sources will have their data stored in our database
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement to store data from structural data sources in the database. No quality attributes like performance, security, availability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: For data with enough structuring, web scraping will be used to programmatically extract all the data needed and store it in our database.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional mechanism (use web scraping to extract and store data) — so Functional = true. It also implies use of a database for storing extracted data, which relates to maintainability and system operation/administration (similar examples mapped to MN and O). No explicit statements about availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, fault tolerance, or usability, so those are set to false.

RequirementText: For totally unstructured information, AI libraries will be used to programmatically extract and store any information possible
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a behavior (use AI libraries to extract and store information) — functional. It also implies implementation/operational choices about storage and tooling that affect maintainability and operation/administration (similar to examples where storage choices were labeled MN and O). No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or UI concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Data that is especially hard to extract, for whatever reason, will be manually extracted and added to the database by a developer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior/process (manual extraction and insertion of hard-to-extract data by a developer), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The GUI will have a textbox that will accept inputs from a keyboard.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a GUI element (textbox) and its behavior (accept keyboard input), which is a functional requirement about the system's behavior; no non-functional quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Text box will originally contain a suggestive text question, to guide the user to the format of an appropriate question.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that a text box should contain suggestive placeholder text — a functional UI behavior. It pertains to look-and-feel (visual/UI content) and usability (guiding the user), not to availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The GUI will have a “Send” button which sends text from the textbox to the API when clicked
AI_Rationale: Specifies a GUI element and its behavior (clicking Send transmits textbox text to API), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes like performance, security, usability, etc., are specified.

RequirementText: The GUI will have a chat window displaying questions sent to the system and responses from the API.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a GUI feature (a chat window that displays questions and API responses), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, legal, look-and-feel details, usability metrics, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The chat window will contain all questions and answers from the current session, with a scroll bar if all messages can’t fit on the screen.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (display all Q&A of current session) and UI presentation detail (scroll bar if content exceeds screen) — therefore Functional and Look & Feel. No explicit availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: If there is a network issue, the chat window will display an error message.
AI_Rationale: Specifies observable system behavior (display an error message) in response to a network issue; this is a functional requirement rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: There will be a designated phone number that users can send texts to. ​
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (providing a designated phone number for text messages), which is a functional requirement. Does not mention availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Texts sent to that number will be sent to the API, then the system will reply to the user with the answer as another text message.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes functional behavior: routing incoming texts to an API and replying with a text message (system behavior/feature). It does not state availability, security, performance, operability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: If a question is not understood by our API, the system will send a text containing an example question after the text with the API response.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a specific system behavior (sending an example question in the API response when a question is not understood), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns like availability, security, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The feature of the application shall provide the optimized route for the given addresses
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability — generating an optimized route for given addresses. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to find the best route for multiple addresses, including fixing any gaps between them.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: computing the best route for multiple addresses and correcting gaps between them. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: While a fast internet connection is optional, the system shall be designed to perform optimally with a fast connection.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system should perform optimally with a fast internet connection — this is a performance-related constraint (latency/throughput). It does not address availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other categories.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to dynamically load new maps in response to each user request.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (dynamically load new maps on each user request), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly constrain availability, performance, scalability, security, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure compliance with Google Maps API terms of use by adhering to Google's policies.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly mandates compliance with Google Maps API terms/policies, which is a legal/compliance constraint. It does not explicitly address security, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: After installing the Application from iTunes or the App store the user will be asked to login.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (prompt user to login after installation) which is functional, and it also implies an authentication/security control (ensuring users log in), so SE is applicable. No other non-functional categories are implied.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select a catalogue from Spring 2013 or Winter 2013.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability (select a catalogue) so it's functional. It also implies a user-facing choice/interaction, so it has a usability aspect (ability to select), similar to the provided language-selection example. No indication of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The user will be able to browse a variety of clothing categories, including outerwear, activewear, and eco-friendly options.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user capability (browsing clothing categories), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to select product thumbnail images after choosing a category.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-visible capability (ability to select product thumbnail images after choosing a category), which is a functional behavior. It does not state any non-functional quality (availability, performance, usability, security, etc.), so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select a product and view its details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user selects a product and views its details). It does not mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional aspects, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The system shall display a detailed product page with all the information and features found on the main website.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: displaying a detailed product page with information and features. It describes functionality (what the system should do) and does not state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to choose between contacting a representative for an order or completing the checkout process online.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (choice of contacting a representative or completing checkout online), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to browse the catalogue or use the search function upon successful login.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (user can browse catalogue or use search after login). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to search for a product by product ID/SKU or by keyword after selecting the search icon.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing search capability (what the system should do): searching by product ID/SKU or keyword triggered via the search icon. It does not specify performance, security, portability, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The search feature will display either search results or a no matches found message depending on the query's success.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior of the search feature (what to display based on query success). It does not specify availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select a product from the search results and proceed to the product details page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user selects a product and navigates to its details). It does not state any quality constraints such as performance, usability, security, availability, or others.

RequirementText: Upon successful login, the user shall be able to browse the catalogue, search for items, or navigate to the Videos and Contact Us sections.
AI_Rationale: Describes user capabilities (browse catalogue, search, navigate sections) which are functional requirements. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to download the catalogue PDF for viewing on their mobile device.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to download the catalogue PDF) which is a functional behavior. It also explicitly mentions use on a mobile device, implying compatibility/portability to mobile platforms, so Portability is applicable. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view a list of 360° videos after selecting the "Videos" option.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to view a list of 360° videos after selecting the Videos option), which is a functional behavior. No quality/constraint (performance, security, usability, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to play a selected 360° video on their device.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the user can play a selected 360° video on their device. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, portability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to zoom in on images using standard mobile gestures.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (zoom images with mobile gestures) — a functional requirement. It also concerns the user interaction and ease of use (touch gestures), so it implies usability. No availability, performance, security, etc., are indicated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to navigate to the next product by swiping left to right.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user interaction (swipe gesture) to navigate to next product — this is a functional requirement with UI/look-and-feel implications and impacts usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to return to the product category page using the back button in the top corner.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action/behavior (functional). Mentions a UI control and its position ('back button in the top corner') which is a look-and-feel/layout requirement. It also impacts usability (navigation/learnability), so US is included. No indication of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for products by keyword or product ID.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a user-facing capability (search by keyword or product ID), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify non-functional aspects like performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the Catalogue PDF, 360° videos, and contact a representative using the sub navigation icons.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability (access Catalogue PDF, 360° videos, and contact a representative) — this is functional. It also prescribes the interaction method ('using the sub navigation icons'), which relates to usability/UX, so US is set. No explicit constraints about security, performance, availability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are stated, so those are not set.

RequirementText: Users are not able to safely operate the device under certain conditions, such as while driving.
AI_Rationale: The statement concerns users being unable to safely operate the device in certain conditions (e.g., while driving), which is a usability/safety-related constraint on how the system is used. It does not explicitly specify functional behavior, performance, security, legal compliance, or other NFR categories, so only Usability is marked.

RequirementText: System shall be able to integrate with the internal system for user login and identification.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must integrate with an internal user login/identification system—this is a functional capability (F). It also implies operational/manageability concerns related to integration and interoperability with internal systems (O). Because it concerns authentication/identification, security considerations are implied (SE). No explicit availability, fault tolerance, legal, UI, maintainability, portability, performance, scalability, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: System shall be able to maintain data security.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns maintaining data security, which maps directly to the Security (SE) non-functional category. It does not specify functionality, availability, fault tolerance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall provide a data entry experience comparable to a desktop computer.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the quality of the data-entry user experience (comparable to a desktop), which pertains to Look & Feel (visual/interaction parity) and Usability. It also implies performance/responsiveness characteristics (real-time responsiveness expected), so Performance is marked. No explicit availability, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or functional behavior is stated.

RequirementText: System shall be designed for mobile portability with minimal storage requirements and efficient performance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly demands mobile portability (portability) and minimal storage/efficient performance (resource usage and performance). It does not mention availability, security, usability, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to receive an activation email upon filling all necessary registration fields.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system must send/enable receipt of an activation email after user registration. It does not state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in and start using the system after activating their account.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement specifies functional behavior (login and use after account activation). It also implies user onboarding/usability (ability to start using the system immediately), but does not specify security, performance, availability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in to the system by entering their username/email and password.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (user authentication). It also implies security concerns (authentication using credentials), but no explicit performance, usability, availability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log out of the system by using the logout button.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (ability for a user to log out via a logout button), which is a functional behavior. It does not state quality attributes like availability, security, usability metrics, or UI aesthetics.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for items by price, location, or category.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing users to search items by price, location, or category. It does not state any non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to browse other users profiles, including usernames, profile photos, and listed items.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability (browsing other users' profiles and viewing specific profile data), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to browse product categories and see the number of items in each category.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (browsing categories and displaying item counts), which is functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to browse items and see their pictures, prices, and other features.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users must browse items and view pictures, prices, and features. It describes system behavior/functionality rather than an availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional concern.

RequirementText: Users can enable email confirmation for username or password changes, requiring a click to finalize the update.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to enable email confirmation for username/password changes). It also enforces a security control (confirmation via email click to prevent unauthorized changes), so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to purchase credits using a credit card or PayPal account.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users can purchase credits via credit card or PayPal. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add items to their cart by selecting the Add to Cart button.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (adding items to cart via an Add to Cart button), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify non-functional concerns like availability, performance, security, or look-and-feel beyond the basic action.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add items to their cart by tapping the Add to Cart button.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action (adding items to cart). It does not specify quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, or UI appearance.

RequirementText: User shall be able to request an exchange for an available item by offering items they already have.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability: allowing a user to request an exchange by offering items they already have. No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to approve an exchange offer from another user by clicking Approve.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing a user action (approving an exchange offer via an 'Approve' click). It does not specify non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to decline an exchange offer from another user by clicking Decline.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user capability (decline an exchange offer via a click). No non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be notified when they initiate shipment of an item.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (sending a notification when user initiates shipment) — a functional requirement. No quality constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add an unlimited number of items.
AI_Rationale: Primary statement is a functional capability (users can add items). The phrase "unlimited number of items" implies a scalability/capacity non-functional requirement, so mark Scalability as well. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other qualities mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to set the price, quantity, upload pictures, and add details when listing an item.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific functionality the user must be able to perform when listing an item (set price, quantity, upload pictures, add details). No non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to edit their listed items by adding/removing pictures, changing price, and modifying details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability for users to edit listed items (add/remove pictures, change price, modify details). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to remove items from their listings by tapping Remove Item.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying system behavior—allowing a user to remove items via a 'Remove Item' action. It does not state availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to permanently delete their profile and associated account details by clicking Delete Profile.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user can permanently delete their profile/account). It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to mark an item as a favorite to receive notifications about changes to that item.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability: marking an item as a favorite and receiving notifications about changes. It describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to rate and comment on users they have traded with.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a capability: users can rate and comment on trading partners. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, usability, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to support 10,000 concurrent users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capacity requirement for number of concurrent users, which is a scalability concern. It does not state performance metrics (e.g., response time), availability, security, or functional details beyond capacity.

RequirementText: System shall respond to user interactions within 2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum response time for user interactions (response within 2 seconds), which is a performance/response-time requirement.

RequirementText: System shall display a search form on the home page.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior (the system must display a search form on the home page). It does not state quality attributes like availability, look-and-feel, usability, or others.

RequirementText: System shall include all relevant sites in its search engine index.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability: the system must include all relevant sites in its search engine index. It does not explicitly specify non-functional qualities such as performance, availability, security, scalability, portability, or maintainability.

RequirementText: System shall utilize the search form and indexed sites to deliver search results.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior: using the search form and indexed sites to deliver search results — a functional requirement. It does not state performance, usability, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to search for websites using the site name or description.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users must be able to search for websites by name or description. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to provide auto-suggestions for search queries.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a specific system capability (auto-suggestions for search queries), which is a functional feature. It also implies an improvement to user experience/usability by assisting users during search, so Usability is applicable. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display search results in descending order as a list of links.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: how search results are presented (ordering and format as a list of links). Does not specify performance, UI aesthetics, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display a No results found message when no search results are found.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (display a 'No results found' message) which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to include a link back to the home page when displaying No results found.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (display a link back to the home page when 'No results found'), so F=1. It also impacts navigation and user experience, improving usability, so US=1. No explicit non-functional attributes like availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal/visual styling requirements are stated, so those are set to 0.

RequirementText: System shall be able to locate the user through a geolocation feature.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (locating the user via geolocation), i.e., a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to utilize Geolocation scripts to determine the user's location.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functionality (use geolocation scripts to determine user location), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall be able to verify if the user is situated within a 1-mile radius of the campus.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete functional behavior: verifying whether a user is within a 1-mile radius of the campus (geolocation check). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to update the user's location if they are found to be within the 1-mile radius.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying behavior: system updates a user's location when they are within a 1-mile radius. No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: System shall be able to request permission from the user to access their location services.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (requesting user permission) — a functional behavior — and implies access control/privacy concerns (security). It does not specify availability, performance, UI look/feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to redirect the user to the home screen if they decline to grant location services permission.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a specific system behavior (redirecting the user when they decline location permission), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall be able to create the user within the system if the user grants location services permission.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing system behavior (create a user) conditional on the user granting location services permission. It does not specify availability, performance, security controls, UX, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display a failure message and return the user to the home page if it's unable to successfully update the location.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a specific system behavior (display failure message and navigate to home) -> Functional. It prescribes graceful handling of an error condition (recover/return user to a safe state) -> Fault Tolerance. It does not specify performance, security, legal, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, or explicit usability constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to update the page with links to nearby sites based on the user's location.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: updating page content with links based on user's location. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall be able to construct an Ajax Response to update the home page with links to nearby sites.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: constructing an AJAX response to update the home page with links to nearby sites. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall be able to provide a list of the 3 nearest sites, sorted alphabetically by name, with links to their respective pages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a concrete system capability: produce a list of the 3 nearest sites, sorted alphabetically, with links — this describes functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI appearance beyond functionality, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to present the sites on a map, marked with their names, descriptions, and links to their respective pages.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (display sites on a map with names, descriptions, links). It also describes presentation/layout of UI elements (markers and labels), so Look & Feel applies. No explicit performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall be able to perform distance calculations and access geolocation information for the user, sites, and nearby sites.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capabilities (perform distance calculations and access geolocation data). It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like availability, security, performance, or privacy, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display a list of all sites sorted alphabetically (A-Z) by site name when user clicks a Browse Sites link on the homepage.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (display a list of sites sorted alphabetically when user clicks Browse Sites). This is a functional requirement; it does not state availability, performance, security, portability, usability guidelines, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall be able to collect and sort a list of all sites by name.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability: collect and sort a list of sites by name. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI appearance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal constraints, or usability concerns explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall be able to build URLs for each sites page.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (building URLs for each site page), which is a functional behavior. No non-functional quality constraints (performance, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display a campus map with all historical sites marked upon clicking a Map Sites link on the homepage.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a specific system behavior (displaying a campus map with marked historical sites upon clicking a link), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to place a marker for each historical site on the map, including the site name, a short description, and a link to the sites page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (placing map markers with name, description, and link) which is functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display a list of thumbnail images for a site, sorted from oldest to newest by year, when on the sites page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: displaying a list of thumbnail images on the sites page and ordering them by year (oldest to newest). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to return a no image message if no image is available for a site.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when no image exists, the system should return a 'no image' message. This is a functional requirement rather than a quality/constraint.

RequirementText: System shall be able to replace the main site image and description with the corresponding ones from a clicked thumbnail image on the sites page.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user-triggered feature (click thumbnail to replace main image and description), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, performance, usability, or look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display an enlarged version of the main site image when the user clicks on it on the sites page.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing specific system behavior (display enlarged image on click). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or visual/maintenance constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display a walking tour page when the user clicks a Walking Tour link.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: system displays a walking tour page in response to user clicking a link. No quality/constraint (performance, availability, security, UI appearance, etc.) is implied.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display an "About" page when the user clicks an "About" link.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-triggered behavior (display About page on click), i.e., a functional requirement about system behavior; does not specify quality attributes like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall be able to operate without storing any personal user data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (must operate without storing personal user data) — a functional constraint. It also imposes a privacy/security constraint (no storage of personal data), so it maps to Security. It does not explicitly mention availability, legal compliance, portability, performance, scalability, usability, operability, fault tolerance, maintainability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: System shall be able to delete user location information nightly via a cron job.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (deleting user location information on a nightly schedule), which is a functional behavior. While it mentions scheduling via a cron job, that does not explicitly impose operability or other non-functional constraints in the text, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall require authorization for project admins before they can access the admin interface to manage project sites.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that authorization is required to access the admin interface—an access control measure addressing security (authentication/authorization). It does not specify availability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall implement standard web security measures.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates implementing standard web security measures, which directly pertains to security (authentication, encryption, protection). It does not specify availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be designed for easy extensibility, maintainability, and potential release as an open-source application.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly calls out maintainability and extensibility, so Maintainability (MN) applies. The mention of potential release as an open-source application implies considerations about licensing/compliance, so Legal (L) is applicable. No other quality attributes (performance, scalability, portability, usability, security, etc.) are explicitly referenced.

RequirementText: System shall be deployable and operational in under one minute upon USB insertion.
AI_Rationale: Requires the system to be deployable/operational via USB insertion (functional). Specifies a time bound of under one minute (performance). Implies ease of operation/administration (operability). No explicit security, availability, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed for extensibility, maintainability, and open-source release.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly calls for 'extensibility' and 'maintainability' (matches Maintainability). 'Open-source release' implies an intent to release under an open-source license, which is a legal/licensing constraint (Legal). No mention of availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, portability, operability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: Upon the USB being plugged in the system shall be able to be deployed and operational in less than 1 minute
AI_Rationale: This is an operational/installability time requirement (deployment and being operational within 1 minute upon USB plug-in). This concerns operability (ease/speed of deploying/operating), not functional features or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: Citizens can file complaints with the police.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability: allowing citizens to file complaints with the police. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The police will then investigate the complaint based on evidence and facts.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system/actor action (investigate complaint based on evidence), i.e., a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Interfacing with the courts during the prosecution of cases is an integral part of the responsibilities of police personnel.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional responsibility/behavior (interfacing with courts as part of case prosecution). It does not specify availability, performance, security, legal compliance, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to perform basic and advanced searches on cases for police personnel through the Search module.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (perform basic and advanced searches via the Search module for police personnel). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to facilitate information exchange between citizens and police units/personnel through the Citizen Interface module.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — facilitating information exchange via the Citizen Interface module. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall provide role-based landing pages to users to assist with navigating the CCTNS application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (providing role-based landing pages) and explicitly aims to assist users in navigation, which is a usability concern. It does not state availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel constraints, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall be configurable to meet specific state requirements and keep data elements and rules up-to-date.
AI_Rationale: The statement requires the system to be configurable (a functional capability) and to keep data elements and rules up-to-date, which directly implies maintainability. It also implies administrative/operational capability (configuring and updating settings/data), so Operability is marked. No explicit mention of availability, fault tolerance, performance, scalability, security, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to provide adequate response times for commonly performed functions under both standard and peak loads across all user interfaces of the application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies response time requirements under standard and peak loads (performance). Mention of peak loads across interfaces implies scalability concerns to handle increased load.

RequirementText: The system shall perform searches returning results within 5-8 seconds (simple) and 10-15 seconds (advanced) regardless of data size.
AI_Rationale: Specifies response time targets for search operations (a performance requirement). The phrase "regardless of data size" explicitly implies scalability concerns, so SC is set. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to retrieve and display a recently accessed (within the last 2 months) case within 5-8 seconds, regardless of storage capacity or the number of cases in the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (retrieve and display a case) and a quantitative response-time constraint (5-8 seconds) which is a performance requirement. The phrase 'regardless of storage capacity or the number of cases' implies scalability concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be scalable to accommodate police stations of all sizes and caseloads.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies scalability to accommodate organizations of varying sizes and caseloads, which maps directly to the Scalability non-functional concern. It does not mention performance metrics, availability, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to support a multilingual interface.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must support a multilingual interface — this is a functional capability (F) and directly impacts user-facing presentation (Look & Feel) and usability (US). No mention of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to access help content in both offline and online modes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (access help content) with modes (offline and online). This is a functional requirement describing what the system should provide; it does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like availability, performance, or security.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to provide an interface for users to log and track defects and enhancement requests for the application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability: providing an interface for users to log and track defects and enhancement requests. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to send alerts (e.g., email, SMS) to users upon their request whenever an action is taken on their defect or enhancement request.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (sending alerts/notifications to users on request when actions occur). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to allow users to track the status of their submitted defects or enhancement requests.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow users to track status of their submitted defects/enhancement requests). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to allow help-desk users to view reports on submitted defects and enhancement requests categorized by type, status, and submission time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: help-desk users viewing reports filtered/categorized by type, status, and submission time. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints, nor explicitly require usability or scalability features.

RequirementText: The system shall be accessible to users both from within the application and through a web browser interface.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access methods (within the application and via a web browser), which concerns how the system is operated and accessed (operability). It does not explicitly state availability, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: the system shall enforce role-based access control (RBAC) for its functionalities.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies enforcing role-based access control, which is a security/authentication/authorization requirement; no explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System must allow only admin-users to set up user profiles and allocate users to groups.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (allowing setup of user profiles and allocating users to groups) and explicitly restricts that capability to admin-users, which is an access-control constraint (security: authorization). No availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, or usability aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The System must allow a user to stipulate which other users or groups can access cases.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow a user to stipulate access for other users/groups) which is a functional feature, and it directly relates to access control/authorization, a security concern.

RequirementText: The System must allow changes to security attributes for groups or users (such as access rights, security level, privileges, password allocation and management) to be made only by super-user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that only a super-user may change access rights, privileges, and password management — an explicit authorization/access-control requirement, therefore a security requirement.

RequirementText: System shall restrict search results to only records the user has access rights for (both quick and advanced searches).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control on search results (restricting to records the user has rights for), which is a security authorization requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall log unauthorized access attempts to cases in the audit trail.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (logging) — functional. It specifically addresses recording unauthorized access attempts for audit purposes, which is a security-related requirement (authentication/monitoring), so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to create a complete audit trail for all case access, activities, and related documents or data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (audit trail) => Functional. Explicitly relates to compliance/record-keeping (audit trail) so Legal. Also relates to security (access/activity logging supports accountability/integrity) => Security. Other NFRs not implied.

RequirementText: All error messages produced by the System must be meaningful, so that they can be appropriately acted upon by the users who are likely to see them.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that error messages must be meaningful for users to act upon, which is a usability/UX quality requirement. It does not imply availability, security, operability, functionality, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The System must employ a single set of user interface rules, or a small number of sets to provide a familiar and common look and feel for the application.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates a consistent look and feel (LF). It also emphasizes familiarity and commonality of the UI, which directly relates to usability (US). No functional, performance, security, or other quality aspects are specified.

RequirementText: Ideally, each error message will be accompanied by explanatory text and an indication of the action(s) which the user can take in response to the error.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (produce error messages with explanatory text and suggested user actions) making it functional. Also concerns UI presentation and user guidance, so Look & Feel and Usability apply. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to customize interface elements (displayed columns, layout) and save these preferences in their profiles.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can customize and save interface preferences). It also explicitly concerns interface elements and layout, which pertains to look & feel. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The System must provide End User and Administrator functions which are easy to use and intuitive throughout.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states functions must be easy to use and intuitive for end users and administrators, which is a usability concern. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Frequently-executed System transactions must be designed so that they can be completed with a small number of interactions (e.g. mouse clicks).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies efficiency and ease-of-use for common user transactions (minimizing interactions/clicks), which is a Usability concern. It does not address availability, performance, security, maintainability, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall comply with Standard ISO 9241 for user interface design.
AI_Rationale: Specifies compliance with an international standard for user interface design (legal/standards requirement) and directly concerns UI look-and-feel. Does not mention functionality, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall provide textual descriptions or alternative functionalities for all non-text media like images and videos.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (provide textual descriptions/alternatives) — functional. It addresses accessibility/usability for non-text media, so Usability is applicable. No explicit availability, security, legal, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall provide self-descriptive navigation, allowing users to understand their location, history, and future options within the application.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a feature to provide self-descriptive navigation (functional) and focuses on user understanding and learnability (usability). No mentions of security, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to offer users alternative ways to navigate to the same content.
AI_Rationale: This requirement concerns offering multiple navigation options to reach the same content, which pertains to user interface/look-and-feel and overall usability. It does not specify availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, or maintenance aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall minimize splash screens and only display them if they provide valuable information to the user.
AI_Rationale: Requirement constrains UI presentation (minimize splash screens) and aims to improve user experience; this pertains to Look & Feel and Usability rather than functionality or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to skip the splash screen if one is present.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to skip the splash screen), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional attributes such as availability, performance, usability metrics, security, etc., so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall minimize vertical scrolling by prioritizing top placement of important information and utilize links for less crucial details, and avoid horizontal scrolling altogether.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies UI layout and presentation (minimize vertical scrolling, top placement, avoid horizontal scrolling, use links for less crucial details), which are Look & Feel concerns and directly affect usability. It does not specify functional behavior, availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall minimize user errors and make error recovery effortless.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on reducing user errors and simplifying recovery: this is primarily a usability goal (preventing errors, ease of recovery) and also implies fault-tolerance/recovery capabilities. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The user interface shall display clear error messages explaining the issue and suggesting solutions, all in the user's chosen language.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies UI behavior (display error messages) — functional. It emphasizes clarity, helpfulness, and language, which are usability concerns. No explicit non-functional categories like performance, security, or portability are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to handle user interfaces that accept and display information like currency, measurements, dates, and addresses in a way that is clear for users from various backgrounds.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies ability to accept/display locale-sensitive information (currency, measurements, dates, addresses) and clarity for diverse users — this describes functional capability and is primarily a usability (internationalization/localization) concern. No explicit availability, performance, security, etc. constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to resize text using built-in functions or appropriate methods.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to resize text) which is a functional feature. It also addresses usability/accessibility by enabling users to adjust text size, so Usability is applicable. No mention of performance, security, availability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure that textual content is free of spelling and grammatical errors for clear readability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns readability and correctness of textual content, which is a usability quality attribute. It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall present information on the screen in a user-friendly way using short sentences, clear sections, and bullet points for easy reading and understanding.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system shall present information on screen (a functional behavior) and prescribes presentation style—short sentences, clear sections, bullet points—which pertains to look-and-feel and usability. No availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure text readability considering display characteristics and follow ISO 9241-303 for screen text legibility.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates compliance with ISO 9241-303 (a standards/legal compliance aspect) and concerns screen text legibility and display characteristics, which relate to look-and-feel (visual presentation) and usability (readability/accessibility). It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall use clear and familiar labels for navigation links, considering users' general knowledge and experience with similar systems.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns using clear, familiar navigation labels to match users' knowledge and experience — a usability/UX requirement. It does not specify visual layout, legal, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to clearly mark links that open in new browser windows or pop-up windows.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying UI behavior (marking links that open new windows). It directly concerns appearance/presentation (Look & Feel) and improves user experience/usability by informing users about link behavior.

RequirementText: The System must be available to users on all weekdays/xxx days per year.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system availability (uptime) on weekdays/annual days; matches availability requirement examples.

RequirementText: The system shall have planned downtime not exceeding <xx> hours in a rolling three-month period.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a limit on planned downtime over a time window (rolling three-month period), which is an availability requirement (SLA). No other quality attributes or functional behavior are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall have unplanned downtime not exceeding a specified duration (to be determined) in a rolling three-month period.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum allowed unplanned downtime over a rolling three-month period — this is an availability requirement (uptime/reliability). It does not describe fault-handling, UI, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall experience no more than <x> unplanned outages in a rolling three-month period.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a limit on unplanned outages in a time window, which is an availability/reliability requirement. It does not describe functional behavior, fault-tolerance mechanisms, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The System must provide adequate response times for commonly performed functions under both standard and peak conditions
AI_Rationale: Specifies response time requirements for functions under standard and peak load — directly a performance requirement. Requirement also implies the need to handle peak loads, indicating scalability concerns.

RequirementText: The application must be able to link up with the INTERNAL system in order for users to properly log in and be identified.
