AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must link with an internal system to allow users to log in and be identified — this is a functional integration requirement (F) and an operability/integration concern (O). Because it concerns user login/identification (authentication/identity), it has clear security implications (SE). No explicit statements about availability, performance, portability, scalability, usability, maintainability, fault tolerance, look-and-feel, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to retrieve and display frequently accessed cases (within the last 2 months) within 5-8 seconds regardless of data volume.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (retrieve and display cases) with explicit performance requirement (5-8 seconds). The phrase "regardless of data volume" implies scalability under growing data sizes.

RequirementText: The system shall be scalable and accommodate police stations of all sizes with varying caseloads.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states scalability to accommodate police stations of all sizes and varying caseloads, which maps directly to Scalability (SC). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to support a user interface in multiple languages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (support UI in multiple languages), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state usability, portability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system will do periodic backups through a live internet connection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (periodic backups) => Functional. Describes resilience/data protection via backups over network, implying fault tolerance/recovery capability. Does not explicitly mention availability, security, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall validate credit cards against fraud.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system function (validate credit cards) — a clear functional requirement. The purpose is to detect/prevent fraud, which directly relates to security concerns, so SE is also set. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall detect consecutive failed login attempts
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (system behaviour: detect consecutive failed logins). It directly pertains to security (account attack detection / authentication monitoring), so mark SE. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be protected by open source firewall called Firestarter.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a security control (use of an open-source firewall Firestarter) so it is primarily a security requirement. It also prescribes a specific operational/deployment technology, which relates to operability/administration, so O is marked. No performance, availability, legal, usability, or other quality aspects are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall perform searches via Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system behavior (perform searches) and explicitly mandates the algorithm (Dijkstra). This is a functional requirement; it does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall utilize help bubbles to assist managers, customers, and administrators
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI help bubbles to assist users, which is primarily a usability requirement and implies UI/look-and-feel concerns. It does not state availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability requirements.

RequirementText: The system shall employ easy to locate buttons
AI_Rationale: This requirement concerns placement and visibility of UI controls, which pertains to Look & Feel and overall Usability (ease of use). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to run in debug mode.
AI_Rationale: Requiring the system to run in debug mode is an operational capability for running/administration (operability) and supports maintenance/debugging activities (maintainability). It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to process test credit card transactions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (processing test credit card transactions), which is functional behavior. No explicit quality attributes (security, performance, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to process test shipping orders.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies a capability the system must provide (processing test shipping orders), which is a functional requirement; no quality attributes like performance, security, or availability are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to create a test environment for the web order system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (create a test environment) — a functional behavior. It also relates to system administration/operability (setting up test environments), so Operability is applicable. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, portability, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system hardware shall be able to receive fixes and patches over an internet connection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capability to receive fixes/patches (maintenance/updatability). Patching over the internet also relates to security (delivering security fixes), so Maintainability and Security apply.

RequirementText: System shall allow authorized personnel within the same department to update the database directly, adhering to established access controls.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies authorization and adherence to access controls for updating the database, which is a security (access control/authorization) constraint. While it describes an action, similar examples are classified as security-only, so it is labeled SE only.

RequirementText: For interdepartmental requests, the system shall require approval from both a DA and faculty group member, unless submitted by a higher-level group.
AI_Rationale: This describes a required workflow/authorization behavior (approval by specified roles) for interdepartmental requests, which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security mechanisms, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to process inter-faculty transfer requests initiated by authorized users and approved by faculty groups or higher levels.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (processing inter-faculty transfer requests, initiation and approval workflow). Mentions 'authorized users', implying access control/authorization requirements (security). No explicit non-functional attributes like performance, availability, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall require university group approval for outgoing transfers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior/requirement (enforce university group approval workflow) => Functional. Also implies an access-control/authorization constraint for transfers, which is a security-related requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to grant edit permissions for assets to departmental administrators, inventory users, faculty users, and university users based on their department affiliation and authorization level.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability to grant edit permissions to users based on affiliation and authorization levels — this is a functional behavior (F) and describes access control/authorization, which is a security concern (SE). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to modify all fields of an edited asset except for identifier (ID) fields.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (modify asset fields) and a constraint (ID fields not modifiable), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to accept bulk entry files for data import.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability: the system must accept bulk entry files for data import. No quality attributes (performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to automatically assign ownership of any asset to the department if the asset is assigned to a DA group member or an authorized inventory group member.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (automatic assignment of asset ownership based on group membership). It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security controls, or other non-functional qualities, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to allow any faculty member to add inventory for all departments they have access to.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing the capability to add inventory. It also implies access control/authorization ('for all departments they have access to'), so security (authorization) is applicable. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall allow any authorized university group member to add assets to the inventory.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing the capability to add assets to inventory. It explicitly mentions 'authorized' users, which implies an access-control/security concern, so Security is also applicable. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to perform bulk asset entry.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (ability to perform bulk asset entry), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to handle requests for case information and actions from any authorized user.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (handling requests for case information and actions) — functional. The phrase 'authorized user' implies authentication/authorization concerns (security). No explicit availability, scalability, performance, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to manage request workflows where requests require approval by authorized administrative users.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing workflow management and approval behavior (F). It explicitly requires approvals by "authorized administrative users," which implies authorization/authentication concerns (security) rather than other quality attributes. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, usability, legal, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to perform returned asset inspection and update inventory records.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies user capabilities (perform inspections and update inventory records), which are functional requirements. It does not specify availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall allow IT group members to create new spaces and modify the floor structure upon receiving an exception request from any administrative level.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability/behavior: IT group members may create new spaces and modify floor structure upon receiving exception requests—i.e., who can do what and under which condition. It is therefore a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security controls, operability, or other quality attributes, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators and authorized inventory group members to view and approve pending requests at their level.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (view and approve pending requests) and explicitly references authorized roles, implying access control/authorization requirements (security). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to receive email notifications when their request is processed.
AI_Rationale: This describes a user-facing capability (ability to receive email notifications) — a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, security, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to add requests to a waiting queue for processing.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing system behavior: adding requests to a waiting queue for processing. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, scalability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to update inventory automatically upon user receipt of a requested asset.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (automatically update inventory when a user receives an asset), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to authenticate using a username and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication mechanism (username/password), which is a security requirement about access control. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A user with administrative privileges shall be able to delegate some or all their authorized actions to another user, granting them the inventory administrator role.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capability to delegate administrative actions and grant a role to another user—this is an authorization/role-management requirement (security). It also describes a system behavior (ability to delegate), so marked functional as well.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to generate asset reports based on location.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to generate reports filtered by location — a functional requirement. No quality/constraint (availability, security, performance, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to generate reports.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies a system capability (generation of reports), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (performance, usability, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to learn and master the system within 2 to 4 hours.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how quickly users must learn and master the system (2–4 hours), which is a usability requirement focused on learnability and learn time.

RequirementText: The system shall be highly available during working hours with all maintenance and backup activities occurring outside of these times.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates high availability during working hours (Availability). It also specifies that maintenance and backups occur outside working hours, which relates to maintainability (scheduling of maintenance) and operability/admin practices (operation/administration scheduling). No explicit mentions of performance, scalability, security, portability, look-and-feel, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The system shall be a web application deployable on Microsoft or Unix platforms and accessible through browsers like IE, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, or Safari.
AI_Rationale: Specifies target deployment platforms (Microsoft or Unix) and supported browsers (IE, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Safari). This pertains to deployment/operational environment and platform/browser compatibility (Operability) and cross-platform portability.

RequirementText: Users shall authenticate using a username and password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an authentication mechanism (username/password), which is a security requirement (authn). It does not state availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to access functionalities based on their assigned roles.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control based on assigned roles (authorization), which is a security concern. It does not describe functional behavior beyond access control nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall restrict local access and maintenance of database servers to authorized IT team members only.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies restricting access and maintenance operations to authorized IT team members, which is an access control/authorization constraint—a security requirement. It does not address availability, fault tolerance, maintainability, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall enforce a time limit on queries to prevent them from exceeding one minute in execution time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system behavior (enforce a query time limit) and a performance constraint (max execution time 1 minute). No explicit availability, security, scalability, or other concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to perform periodic backups.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (perform periodic backups) — a functional requirement. Backups directly support recovery/resilience, so fault tolerance is also implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed to facilitate future evolution and maintenance operations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns facilitating future evolution and maintenance operations, which directly maps to maintainability. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Initialization Data
AI_Rationale: The text 'Initialization Data' is too brief and ambiguous to infer any specific functional requirement or non-functional quality. It does not explicitly state behavior, constraints, security, availability, performance, usability, or other NFRs. Therefore no labels are set.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall use the information contained in the initialization data file to determine which heating and cooling units are part of the THEMAS system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: using initialization data file information to determine which heating and cooling units belong to the system. It describes functional behavior rather than a quality/constraint.

RequirementText: Each thermostat shall have a unique identifier by which that thermostat is identified in the THEMAS system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional requirement: each thermostat must have a unique identifier in the system (how the system should behave/represent devices). It does not specify availability, security, performance, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Each quadrant of each floor shall have a thermostat which is to be used to provide temperature data to the THEMAS system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a required system function/hardware: thermostats in each quadrant provide temperature data to THEMAS (functional). It also implies operational/deployment concern (availability of sensors and integration into the system), so Operability is relevant. No explicit statements about availability targets, security, performance, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, scalability, or legal requirements.

RequirementText: There shall be a maximum number of heating or cooling u nits that can be on at any given time.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a constraint on system behavior (a limit on how many heating/cooling units may be on), so it is functional. It also expresses a capacity limit (maximum concurrent units), which is a scalability/capacity concern, so SC is set. Other non-functional categories are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to use trigger values in combination with current temperature to determine heating or cooling activation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function: using trigger values and current temperature to decide heating or cooling activation. It describes behavior rather than non-functional quality constraints, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The trigger values shall reside in an initialization file.
AI_Rationale: Specifies where trigger values are stored (a functional/configuration requirement). Implies operability/manageability since using an initialization file affects administration and configuration, but does not state performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The over temperature values shall reside in an initialization file.
AI_Rationale: Specifies where configuration (over-temperature values) must be stored — a functional requirement about persistence/initialization. It also affects operability/administration because placing values in an initialization file determines how operators/admins manage configuration.

RequirementText: Upon initialization, the THEMAS system shall be able to automatically turn off all heating and cooling units.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system capability (automatically turn off heating and cooling units upon initialization), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall be able to determine the operational state of all heating and cooling units by issuing a power off command.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system shall determine operational state of heating/cooling units by issuing a power-off command. It describes behavior/feature rather than availability, security, performance, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall be able to accept temperature readings from thermostats only within a predefined valid range.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (accepting temperature readings only if within a predefined valid range), which is a functional constraint/validation. It does not address availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall be able to identify when a reported temperature or a changed setting violates user-defined temperature limits.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (detecting violations of user-defined temperature limits). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall be able to monitor temperature by comparing reported values to settings and detecting any exceeding of specified limits.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability: monitoring temperature by comparing values to settings and detecting limit exceedances. This describes functional behavior (what the system should do) rather than a non-functional quality attribute.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to output the temperature status when the measured temperature (T) is within the acceptable range defined by the lower limit (LO) and upper limit (UO).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior: output temperature status when T is within LO and UO. This is a functional requirement; no quality/constraint (availability, performance, security, etc.) is implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to activate the appropriate heating or cooling unit based on a predefined temperature differential between the current temperature and setting.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behaviour: system must activate heating or cooling based on temperature differential. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall be able to control all defined heating and cooling units.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — the system must control heating and cooling units. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, operability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The THEMAS system shall be able to generate and record an event when a heating or cooling request is denied.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (generate and record an event when a heating/cooling request is denied), which is functional. It does not explicitly state availability, security, logging/audit, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to monitor thermostat and heating/cooling data to trigger specific events.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: monitoring thermostat and HVAC data and triggering events. No QoS, security, availability, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to translate user requests to turn on/off heating or cooling units into corresponding control commands.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system capability—translating user requests into control commands for heating/cooling units—which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Once a request to turn on or off a heating or cooling unit, the THEMAS system shall provide the necessary control signal for the unit.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: upon a request to switch a unit, the system shall send the control signal. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to interpret desired heating/cooling unit and its requested ON/OFF status.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (interpreting desired heating/cooling unit and ON/OFF status), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: When an event occurs, the THEMAS system shall identify the event type and format an appropriate event message.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behavior (detect event type and format message), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to play or learn about Mahjong.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user capability (play or learn about Mahjong), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (usability, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be usable by users with basic PC, Macintosh, or Unix operating system knowledge.
AI_Rationale: Specifies expected user skill level/learnability (usable by users with basic OS knowledge), which is a usability requirement. It does not state functional behavior or platform compatibility.

RequirementText: User shall be able to play multiplayer Mahjong without requiring advanced knowledge of TCP/IP networking.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (play multiplayer Mahjong) and a usability requirement (no advanced TCP/IP knowledge required), implying ease-of-use/abstraction of networking. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to play Mahjong with no prior knowledge of the rules.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies ease of use and learnability (users can play without prior knowledge), which is a usability quality. It does not explicitly state functional internals, availability, performance, security, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The user shall be familiar with a Web Server environment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user prerequisite (familiarity with a web server environment), which relates to usability, learnability and user skill expectations rather than system functionality or technical qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to configure and operate a TCP/IP server.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (configure and operate a TCP/IP server) which is a functional requirement. It also implies administrative/operational functionality (manageability/operability), so Operability is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to understand basic networking concepts and access the hostname and IP address of the server running the MultiMahjongServer program.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability to access server hostname/IP (functional). It also requires the user be able to understand basic networking concepts, which pertains to learnability/usability. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a dialogue box explaining the nature of the error for non-fatal errors.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (display a dialog box) and implies usability concerns (providing explanatory information to users improves understandability). It does not specify availability, fault tolerance mechanisms, legal, look-and-feel specifics, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to allow continued gameplay upon encountering a non-fatal error.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies continued operation despite non-fatal errors, which is fault tolerance/resilience. It does not state functional behavior details, availability metrics, security, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to ensure a response time of 1 minute or less for Commanding Officer (CO) actions in both single and multiplayer modes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative response time requirement (1 minute) for actions, which is a performance (timing/latency) constraint. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to support concurrent multiplayer Mahjong games for up to 10 tables with a maximum of 40 players.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system must support concurrent multiplayer games up to 10 tables/40 players (a capacity/concurrency constraint). This is a functional capability and a scalability requirement; no explicit performance, security, availability, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to calculate possible Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong moves within 5 seconds of receiving the latest discard information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system capability (calculate moves) and a timing constraint of 5 seconds, indicating both functional behavior and a performance (timeliness) non-functional requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to exchange data with the MultiMahjongServer without encryption as the data is considered non-sensitive and poses no risk to system integrity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall exchange data with MultiMahjongServer (functional). Explicitly addresses encryption and sensitivity, which relates to security requirements (decision to transmit without encryption), so mark SE. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will have no graphical user interface and will be run using a command prompt.
AI_Rationale: Specifies absence of a graphical user interface (UI) and that the server is run via command prompt — this is a look-and-feel / UI constraint (LF) and explicitly describes how the system is operated (command-line), affecting operability (O). No indications of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient will have a graphical user interface that the user will be able to interact with using a mouse and a keyboard.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a graphical user interface and explicit interaction modes (mouse and keyboard), which concerns look-and-feel and usability; does not state availability, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient will have sound effects associated with the game actions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a feature (audio feedback/sound effects) to be provided by the client, which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state quality attributes like usability, performance, or security.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display its graphical user interface (GUI) within an 800 x 600 pixel resolution.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a graphical user interface display resolution (visual/layout requirement). This is a look-and-feel constraint; it does not specify platform portability, functionality, performance, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: All graphics will be in 16 bit colour.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a visual presentation constraint (graphics color depth), which is a look-and-feel/user interface appearance requirement rather than functional, performance, or security-related.

RequirementText: When a button becomes active, it will use animation to get the user's attention.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a UI presentation/behavior (use of animation when a button becomes active) which is a look-and-feel concern and also relates to usability (drawing user attention). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: When a player performs a Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong, the tiles involved will be animated.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies visual behavior of the UI (tiles will be animated) which is a Look & Feel requirement. It also relates to usability as the animation provides user feedback and affects user experience. No functional, security, performance, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The user may click in the frame that contains the remaining wall and a frame showing the discarded tiles will be shown.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user action (click) and resulting system behavior (show a frame of discarded tiles) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional concerns (usability, look & feel, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: An administrators manual, explaining how to install and operate the MultiMahjongServer, will be provided.
AI_Rationale: Specifies provision of an administrator manual for installation and operation, which supports system operability (administering/operating) and maintainability (documentation for installation/maintenance). Does not state functional behavior, performance, security, usability for end users, etc.

RequirementText: A users manual, explaining how to install and operate the MultiMahjongClient, will be provided.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies provision of a user manual for installation and operation. This primarily targets usability (help users learn and use the system) and operability (instructions for installing and operating/administering the product). It does not specify performance, security, portability, legal, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: This documentation will be available in electronic files, and, with the exception of source code, in hard copy format.
AI_Rationale: Requires that documentation be provided in electronic files and hard copy (except source code). This is not a functional feature nor performance/security requirement. It directly supports maintainability (documentation for maintenance) and operability (availability of docs for administering/using the system). No explicit statements about availability metrics, portability, usability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer shall act as a central relay for data between MultiMahjongClients.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (server acting as central relay) — functional. It also describes interfacing/operation role in the system (central relay between clients), which aligns with Operability in similar examples.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer shall automate game initialization functions including random tile order, seating positions, and storing game info.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behavior (automate initialization: randomize tiles, assign seats, store game info) — a functional requirement; no quality/constraint aspects mentioned.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient must send this join information to the MultiMahjongServer
AI_Rationale: Specifies an action the client must perform (sending join information to the server) — a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Users who create a new game will be able to change the ability level of any CO involved in the game.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (changing CO ability levels when creating a game), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Users who create a new game will be able to choose to play different variations of Mahjong rules other than those described in Section 4.3.1.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (users can choose different Mahjong rule variations) — a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient must only allow players to make moves according to the Chinese rules of Mahjong as described in the rulebook, How to Play Mah Jong.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the system must do (enforce that only moves valid under the Chinese Mahjong rulebook are allowed). It describes functional behavior/constraint on allowed actions, not availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient will inform the user whose turn it is to pick up a tile.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (notify the user whose turn it is), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or any other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient will inform the user of legal Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong options under Chinese rules and send chosen actions to the MultiMahjongServer.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: presenting legal move options and sending chosen actions to the server. It does not state quality attributes such as security, performance, usability, or others.

RequirementText: User's will be able to pick up a tile from the wall if it is their turn. If they choose to pick up, the MultiMahjongClient must send this information to the MultiMahjongServer.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user action and required system behavior (client must send info to server) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User's will be able to discard a tile if they have picked one up. When they choose to discard, the MultiMahjongClient must send this information to the MultiMahjongServer
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing user action (discard a tile) and required system behavior (client must send this information to the server). No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient shall inform the user if another player is fishing.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (notify the user when another player is fishing), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional aspects (performance, security, usability, etc.) are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient shall inform the user if another player goes Mahjong.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must perform (notify the user when another player goes Mahjong), which is functional. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient shall inform the user if the hand has ended in a draw.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the client shall inform the user when a hand ends in a draw. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient will keep the user's tiles in order.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior of the client (maintaining the user's tiles in order). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look & feel, or other non-functional aspects, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient will play sound effects associated with certain game actions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (playing sound effects for game actions). It is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional quality constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Users will be able to turn the sound on or off at any stage during the game.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (users can toggle sound at any stage), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, usability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Users will be able to view the High Scores list that is located on the MultiMahjongServer
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (viewing the High Scores list) which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Users will be able to Undo their last move if playing in single player mode.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (ability for users to undo last move in single-player mode), which is a functional requirement. It does not state quality attributes like usability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongClient will automate the picking up of a tile from the wall if the user has no other option.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (automate picking up a tile when user has no other option). This is a functional requirement; no explicit quality constraints (performance, availability, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Users will be able to Save their game if playing in single player mode.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can save their game) with a condition (only in single-player mode). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User's will be able to chat with each other in real time.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (enable users to chat). The phrase "in real time" implies a performance/latency requirement, so Performance is marked. No explicit statements about availability, scalability, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User's will be able to change their icons/pictures and names during the game.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that users can change their icons/pictures and names during the game. It does not specify availability, security, UI appearance, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The game will end when all 4 rounds have been played or if the user chooses to end the game.
AI_Rationale: Specifies game behavior (when the game ends) — a functional requirement. No quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user will be able to end the game at any stage of the game.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allowing the user to end the game at any stage). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The MultiMahjongServer will inform all MultiMahjongClients connected to the game that the game has ended
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (server informing connected clients that the game has ended), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: If a user leaves the game prematurely, a new CO is created on another user's machine to fill their place.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when a user leaves, the system creates a new CO on another user's machine to replace them. This is a functional requirement describing what the system should do; it does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance metrics, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The CO must play moves according to the Chinese rules of Mahjong.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the CO (computer opponent) must do—play moves following Chinese Mahjong rules. This is a functional requirement describing system behavior; no quality, legal, UI, performance, or other non-functional aspects are implied.

RequirementText: The CO will not have access to the data containing the faces of any tiles in the wall or any concealed tiles in any other players' hands.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an access-control restriction (who may not see certain game data) — a functional constraint describing behavior and a clear confidentiality/security requirement. No indications of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The CO will be able to pick up tiles off the wall, discard tiles, reveal Kongs, and Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies actions the system (CO) must perform (picking up tiles, discarding, revealing Kongs, performing Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong), which are functional behavior requirements. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The CO will have access to the number of tiles in the wall or in a player's hand.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (making the count of tiles available to the CO), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security/authorization, performance, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The CO will be able to read any player's exposed or revealed hands.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the CO (a role) must be able to read players' exposed/revealed hands (an action/permission). It does not explicitly state availability, security controls, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The CO will be able to determine what tiles have not been played according to the tiles that have already been discarded, exposed or revealed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (determining which tiles remain unplayed based on discarded/exposed/revealed tiles), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The CO will be able to recognise "almost finished" sets of tiles (i.e. 2 tiles in a sequence is an almost finished Chow) and will not discard tiles in such sets.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: recognizing 'almost finished' tile sets and not discarding them. No quality attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The CO will be able to play at 3 different ability levels: Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (support for three playable ability levels). No quality/constraint (performance, security, usability, etc.) is implied.

RequirementText: The CO will be able to perform look ahead algorithms to determine its best move in the Intermediate and Advanced levels.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (perform look-ahead algorithms to choose best moves) which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The CO will be able to perform calculations at any stage of the game.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability of the CO to perform calculations during any stage of the game, i.e., a functional behavior. It does not mention uptime, fault tolerance, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The CO will be able to play any version of the rules that are specified by the user who creates the game.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior (the CO must be able to play any user-specified version of the rules), which is functional. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: There will be CO's of different playing styles that the user can choose from.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a feature: providing configurable computer opponents (COs) with different playing styles that users can choose, which is functional behavior. It does not state non-functional qualities such as performance, usability metrics, security, etc.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the functionality to allow the operator to generate a UAV mission plan.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system shall provide (allow operator to generate a UAV mission plan) — a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the functionality to receive and process UAV mission plans from service specific mission planning systems.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability: the TCS must receive and process UAV mission plans from mission planning systems. That is a functional behavior (data input and processing). No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, portability, etc.) are stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the functionality to transmit UAV mission plans to service specific mission planning systems.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (to transmit UAV mission plans to other mission planning systems). This describes functional behavior/integration; it does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall facilitate automated processing of mission plan data received via C4I interfaces in order to extract the appropriate mission planning data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the system shall provide—automated processing and extraction of mission planning data received via C4I interfaces (functional). It also implies integration/operability with external C4I interfaces and automated data handling, so Operability is relevant. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the functionality to receive and process UAV mission plans from other TCSs.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (receive and process UAV mission plans) — clearly functional. It mentions interaction with other TCSs, implying interoperability/compatibility across systems (mapped to Portability). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, scalability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the functionality to transmit UAV mission plans to other TCSs.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (transmit mission plans to other TCSs), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state quality attributes like availability, security, portability, or scalability.

RequirementText: A Mission Plan shall include a Flight Route Plan for a selected AV, a Payload Plan for the selected payload, and a Communications Plan.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required contents/features of a Mission Plan (flight route, payload plan, communications), which is functional behavior. No explicit non-functional attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The TCS shall be capable of storing a minimum of 500 mission plans under unique names to allow for later retrieval.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system capability to store a minimum number of items for later retrieval (defines functional behavior) and sets a capacity/scale constraint (minimum of 500), which maps to scalability. No timing, availability, security, portability, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The TCS mission planning function shall provide a graphical user interface that gives the operator the ability to define waypoints on a map based display using a pointing device with full keyset redundancy.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement is functional (provide GUI to define waypoints). It also specifies a graphical user interface (look-and-feel / UI requirement) and input redundancy for pointing devices/keyset, which addresses usability/accessibility concerns.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to compute the range and bearing between two geographic positions on the map display.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (computing range and bearing between two geographic positions and showing it on the map). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the capability to import as well as create and modify map display overlays for fire support coordination measures [SSS547], airspace control measures [SSS548], and threat identification measures. [SSS060]
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a specific system capability: importing, creating, and modifying map display overlays (functional behavior). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall allow the operator to enter as well as review mission plan parameters, including AV flight parameters, payload control parameters, data link control parameters, AV VCR control parameters (if applicable to the selected AV), and AV loiter patterns. [SSS068]
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior: allowing operator to enter and review mission plan parameters (functional interaction). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, maintainability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the system functionality necessary to upload a flight route plan and payload plan (if applicable) to the AV via the selected system data link as well as direct ground connection.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability to upload flight route and payload plans via data link and direct ground connection — this describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: TCS shall provide the capability for the operator to retrieve a mission plan for viewing, modification, as well as deletion at the operator's discretion [SSS071], and allow the operator to save the mission plan under a different name, for future retrieval
AI_Rationale: Specifies system capabilities for retrieving, viewing, modifying, deleting, and saving mission plans — these are functional behaviors. No explicit non-functional aspects (security, availability, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The TCS shall notify the operator of all discrepancies found during the mission plan check as well as indicate successful completion of the mission plan check.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: notifying the operator of discrepancies and indicating successful completion of a check — this is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to override validation faults after the fault is acknowledged by the operator.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability: allowing the operator to override validation faults after acknowledgement. It describes functional behavior (a feature/capability). It does not explicitly state availability, security/authorization, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall allow the operator to set the LOL delay timer(s) during mission planning.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (allow operator to set LOL delay timers during mission planning), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The Flight Route Plan, as a minimum, shall include AV flight path information, Loss of Link plan, AV VCR control tasking (if applicable to the selected AV), and data link control information.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies required contents of the Flight Route Plan (what information must be included), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall allow the operator to define the desired AV route in waypoint format
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability: allowing an operator to define an AV route in waypoint format. This is a functional requirement with no explicit non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to enter waypoint data in alphanumeric format.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability (ability to enter waypoint data in alphanumeric format). It specifies what the system should do rather than availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall present to the operator the estimated time of arrival and fuel status at each programmed waypoint of the proposed mission plan.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system shall present estimated time of arrival and fuel status to the operator for each waypoint. It does not state availability, performance, UI look-and-feel, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: At every waypoint and every 5 minutes, the TCS shall compute the AV's flight range based on remaining fuel.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system action (compute flight range) so is Functional. It also includes explicit timing/frequency constraints (every waypoint and every 5 minutes), which is a performance/timing non-functional concern, so PE is set.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to modify the maximum number of threats displayed, when de-clutter is selected.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (modify maximum number of threats displayed when de-clutter is selected), which is a functional behavior. It pertains to presentation/layout of the UI (how many items are shown when decluttering), so it also maps to Look & Feel. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: A de-clutter capability shall be provided that allows the operator to display only a selected number of the most significant threats.
AI_Rationale: This is a user-facing capability to display a selected number of significant threats (a functional requirement). It also improves ease of use (decluttering) so it impacts usability. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to display waypoint data in alphanumeric format.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (display waypoint data) — a functional requirement. It also constrains the presentation format (alphanumeric), which relates to look-and-feel/presentation, so LF is set. No indications of security, performance, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the capability to load a map onto the display, to zoom in and out, to scroll, to print, and to clear a map on the map display.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities (load, zoom, scroll, print, clear) of the map display—behavioral requirements. No explicit quality constraints like availability, performance, security, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the operator with a clearly indicated map scale.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement is a functional capability (provide operator with a map scale). The phrase "clearly indicated" refers to presentation/visibility, implying UI/look-and-feel and usability concerns, so LF and US are set. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The TCS shall be able to generate payload planning information to be uplinked to the AV separate from a flight route plan
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability: generating payload planning information (functional behavior). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the system functionality necessary to generate a payload plan that, as a minimum, shall include the following information:
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall provide functionality to generate a payload plan (a functional capability). No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The TCS will have the capability to control and monitor an AV, payload, data link, and C4I interfaces during the execution of a mission.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system capability to control and monitor AV, payload, data link, and C4I interfaces during mission execution — this is primarily a functional requirement. It also implies operability/management (monitoring and control of interfaces) rather than other NFRs.

RequirementText: While flying two MAE AVs Beyond Line Of Sight (BLOS), the TCS shall provide full control functionality of each AV.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: the TCS shall provide full control functionality of each AV while two AVs are flying BLOS. It describes functional capability; it does not explicitly mandate availability, performance, security, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The TCS shall transmit command and control information to the AV via the uplink to the AV
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies a system behavior (transmit command and control information via the uplink) which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall be capable of being interoperable with Predator and Outrider UAVs across the 5 levels of UAV interaction.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability: the TCS shall be interoperable with Predator and Outrider UAVs across defined interaction levels — this describes functional behavior (F). It also implies compatibility across external platforms/environments (portability/compatibility), so PO is set. No explicit statements about availability, performance, security, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability are provided, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the capability to control and monitor multiple types of AVs.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability — controlling and monitoring multiple types of AVs — which is a functional requirement describing what the system should do. It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, portability, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: TCS shall notify the operator when AV performance parameters are out of limits.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying behavior (notify operator when AV performance parameters exceed limits). It also relates to operability/monitoring (alerts to operator), so O is set. No explicit availability, performance targets, security, or other NFRs are specified.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to pass control of an AV to another TCS
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (handover of control of an AV from one TCS to another), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, operability, or other non-functional qualities, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to control the AV flight commands as well as to release the AV to an autonomous flight control mode.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: control of AV flight commands and switching to autonomous flight mode. It does not explicitly state non-functional properties such as security, availability, performance, scalability, or usability.

RequirementText: AV telemetry data shall be available to support other TCS functions as required.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies that AV telemetry data shall be available to support other TCS functions, which describes a functional requirement to provide data to other system functions. It does not explicitly state availability metrics, fault tolerance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to control the flight of the selected AV in accordance with the specific AV's operational performance capabilities.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability — controlling the flight of a selected AV according to that AV's operational performance — which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to fully control and display the AV's Identification Friend or Foe (IFF).
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability—control and display of AV IFF—without mentioning availability, security/authorization, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to enter AV preset limits which, as a minimum, will include airspeed limits, altitude limits, and fuel limits.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (enter AV preset limits including airspeed, altitude, and fuel), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall allow the operator to control an AV using the LOS as well as SATCOM data links.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior/capability: the TCS shall allow an operator to control an AV via LOS and SATCOM data links. It describes functional capability (control via two link types) and does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the necessary system capabilities required for AV flight control BLOS via uplink command to two MAE air vehicles.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability: providing system capabilities for AV flight control BLOS via uplink to two MAE air vehicles. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The TCS shall support operation of the AV via all flight modes, to include manual controls.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the TCS must support operating the AV across all flight modes including manual controls. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the capability to implement an emergency action plan, if supported by the AV, to control the AV during equipment failures.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (functional) to implement an emergency action plan to control the AV during equipment failures, which implies handling faults/failures (fault tolerance). No explicit availability, security, usability, or other qualities are stated.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide interactive displays necessary to command the flight of an AV.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (provide interactive displays). It also implies usability concerns (interactive UI for commanding flight). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, look-and-feel, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall allow the operator to command the flight behavior characteristics inherent to the selected AV.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system functionality: allowing an operator to command flight behavior characteristics of a selected AV. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The operator shall have the capability to initiate as well as change, to include as a minimum manual override, flight behaviors by sending the proper control commands to the UAV.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (operator-initiate/change flight behaviors via control commands) — functional. It describes operator control/administration features (operability). Inclusion of a manual override implies resilience to automated behavior or faults, so fault tolerance is applicable. No explicit performance, security, availability, portability, scalability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the capability to command the AV to use the navigation methods inherent to the selected AV.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (commanding the AV to use its inherent navigation methods), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The operator shall have the capability to initiate as well as change, to include as a minimum manual override, UAV navigation methods by sending the proper control commands to the UAV.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an operator capability to initiate and change UAV navigation methods (functional). Inclusion of a manual override implies resilience to failures/need for human takeover, indicating fault-tolerance aspects.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the functionality to control, monitor, and display the operation of the Air Data Terminal (ADT).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies providing functionality to control, monitor, and display the ADT — this is a functional requirement. The monitoring/display aspects imply operability/administration support, so Operability is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the functionality to control the ADT antenna.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying that the TCS must provide functionality to control the ADT antenna. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the functionality to control the power, transmitter signal strength, and frequencies used by ADT for data link communication.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (controlling power, signal strength, and frequencies) — a functional requirement. It also implies operational/administrative control over communication hardware/settings, so Operability is applicable. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: As an objective, the TCS shall support an automatic launch and recovery system.
AI_Rationale: The statement requires the TCS to 'support an automatic launch and recovery system' which specifies a capability (functional) and explicitly concerns automatic recovery/resilience (fault tolerance). It does not explicitly state availability metrics, operability/administration, performance, scalability, security, portability, maintainability, legal, or user interface concerns.

RequirementText: As and objective, the TCS shall be interoperable with the Integrity Beacon Landing System (IBLS)
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies interoperability/interface with another system (IBLS). This is an operability/integration concern rather than availability, security, performance, etc. Example mapping treats 'shall interface' as Operability.

RequirementText: TCS shall provide the capability to monitor specific telemetry elements real-time, and record all telemetry elements for future review and processing.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability to monitor telemetry in real-time and record telemetry for future review — this is primarily a functional requirement. The explicit 'real-time' wording implies a performance (timeliness/latency) concern. Providing monitoring capabilities is commonly an operational feature, so Operability is also marked. No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or usability.

RequirementText: The TCS shall display the AV status, to include but not be limited to the AV location and flight and avionics system status.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: the TCS shall display AV status information (location, flight and avionics system status). It describes what the system must do (functional) and does not state any non-functional quality constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: When the data link is interrupted, the TCS shall present the last known AV status values and the time at which the last values were reported.
AI_Rationale: Specifies concrete system behavior when the data link is interrupted (functional). Also describes graceful degradation/recovery behavior by presenting cached last-known values and timestamp, which is a fault-tolerance requirement. No indications of availability percentages, security, UI look-and-feel, etc.

RequirementText: The TCS shall be capable of displaying fuel parameters to the operator to include as a minimum, remaining fuel, flow rate, and bingo fuel.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the TCS must display specific fuel parameters (remaining fuel, flow rate, bingo fuel) to the operator. It does not state availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The TCS shall compute the estimated position of the AV during Loss of Link (LOL) based upon the last known AV position and anticipated flight path based on current flight mode (e.g. flight route plan mode, emergency flight route plan mode, maintain current heading mode).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: computing an estimated AV position during Loss of Link using last known position and flight mode — this is a functional requirement. It also describes handling a fault condition (Loss of Link) and providing continued operation/degraded mode behavior, which indicates fault tolerance. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: TCS shall display a LOL timer to the operator initiating a LOL onset.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function: display a 'LOL timer' to the operator initiating a LOL onset. It describes a visible behavior (display) rather than quality attributes, so it is classified as Functional only.

RequirementText: The TCS shall be capable of being interoperable with the installed payloads across the 5 levels of UAV interaction.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies interoperability with installed payloads across interaction levels, which is a compatibility/portability concern. It does not state runtime availability, performance, security, usability, or maintenance aspects, nor a functional behavior beyond the interoperability quality, so only Portability is set.

RequirementText: The TCS will have the capability to control and monitor the AV payload(s).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability to control and monitor AV payloads, which describes system behavior (functional). It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the capability to receive data from and control payloads on an AV that is being controlled from another TCS.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional capability (receiving data and controlling payloads on an AV controlled by another TCS), which is a clear functional requirement. It also implies operability/interoperability (managing/control interactions between TCS instances), but does not explicitly mention security, availability, fault tolerance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide the necessary system capabilities required for payload control beyond line of sight via uplink command of two air vehicles of the same type using sequential communication techniques.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability/behavior: providing uplink payload control beyond line-of-sight for two air vehicles using sequential communication techniques. This defines what the system should do (functional). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall receive, process, and present payload data to the operator so that the status of the payload can be determined.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behaviors—receiving, processing, and presenting payload data to operators—so it is functional. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The TCS shall permit the operator to control the payload using all methods supported by the payload installed in the selected AV
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system shall permit the operator to control the payload—this is a functional capability. It also relates to the system's operational capability (allowing operator control), so Operability is applicable. No explicit non-functional qualities like security, performance, portability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide a graphical user interface display for the purpose of controlling the payload
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the TCS must provide a graphical user interface for controlling the payload. It does not specify visual design, usability, legal, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide override of payload automated as well as preprogrammed inputs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to override automated and preprogrammed payload inputs), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.
