RequirementText: TCS shall provide the capability to monitor payload adherence to the uplinked mission plan.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide ('monitor payload adherence'), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The TCS shall display the current search footprint and the search history of the payload on the map.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying current search footprint and search history on the map), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The TCS shall have the capability to simultaneously control and monitor a line-of-sight as well as a BLOS data terminal.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (capability to control/monitor LOS and BLOS terminals). The requirement implies concurrent handling/capacity to operate simultaneously, which relates to performance (concurrency/throughput) and scalability (support multiple simultaneous terminals), but does not mention availability, security, UI, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The TCS shall be capable of interfacing with the specified data terminal and issuing data link terminal commands required to establish, control, and maintain the data link with a selected AV.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies what the system shall do—interface with a data terminal and issue commands to establish, control, and maintain a data link—so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, operability, performance, scalability, usability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: Data terminal control shall include, but is not limited to, antenna pointing control, transmitter control, and receiver control.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required control capabilities (antenna pointing, transmitter, receiver control) describing what the system must do — a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The TCS shall be capable of automatically selecting the proper mode of operation for the selected data terminal.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability/behavior (automatic selection of operation mode for a data terminal), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: As a minimum the TCS LOS data terminal control modes shall include acquisition, autotrack, search,manual point, omni directional, as well as directional modes of operation, if applicable to the selected data link.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the functional modes the system must provide (acquisition, autotrack, search, manual point, omni/directional modes). It describes system behavior/capabilities rather than quality attributes like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The operator shall be able to manually override any automatic data terminal control mode selection if desired, except during Emission Control (EMCON) and Hazards ofelectromagnetic Radiation to Ordnance (HERO) conditions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability for the operator to manually override automatic mode selection (a functional behavior). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes—only an exception for specific operational conditions (EMCON/HERO), which is a constraint on the function rather than a separate NFR.

RequirementText: The TCS shall support a LOS data link and SATCOM data link capability
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system shall support specific capabilities (LOS and SATCOM data links), which describes functional behavior/capability. It does not state any non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, portability, etc.), so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: For shipboard operations, the TCS shall provide the capability to switch to a second LOS antenna, if a second antenna is available, when desired.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to switch to a second LOS antenna), so it is Functional. It describes an operational/manageability feature (ability for operators to switch antennas during shipboard operations), so Operability is also applicable. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, performance, security, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The TCS shall provide an interactive display for the purpose of controlling the data link terminal.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to provide an interactive display for controlling a terminal — describes functional behavior (UI feature). Does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as security, availability, usability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The TCS will interface with external systems to conduct mission coordination and operations.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies interfacing with external systems for operations/coordination, which concerns system operability/administration and integration. Matches provided examples that label similar interface requirements as Operability.

RequirementText: The system shall remotely monitor the status and operational changes of wind power plant and network devices.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: remote monitoring of status and operational changes for wind power plant and network devices. It describes what the system should do rather than non-functional qualities; no explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, operability, scalability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The system should be able to handle parameter changes in three ways: single parameter, subset of settings, and pre-defined parameter set switching.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies how the system should behave in handling parameter changes (modes of operation), which is a functional specification. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall manage the entire software lifecycle, including version control, download, activation, and retrieval.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a system capability (managing software lifecycle: version control, download, activation, retrieval), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as availability, security, maintainability, operability, performance, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, legal, or usability constraints, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The system shall deliver data from its originator to its destination with an acceptable residual error rate to ensure non-corruption of transferred data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies preserving data integrity during transfer (security: integrity) and resilience to errors/non-corruption (fault tolerance). No functional behavior, availability, or other qualities explicitly stated.

RequirementText: The system shall encrypt data items to prevent unauthorized access, tampering, and eavesdropping.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies encryption to prevent unauthorized access, tampering, and eavesdropping, which are security controls (confidentiality and integrity). No availability, performance, scalability, or other concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to retransmit, reconstruct, or reprocess data to ensure its reliability in case of loss or inaccessibility.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies actions (retransmit/reconstruct/reprocess) — a functional capability — aimed at ensuring reliability/continuity after data loss, which directly concerns fault tolerance and system availability.

RequirementText: The APAF system shall process all ASPERA-3 science data into IDFS data sets.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional requirement: the system shall process specific input data into specific outputs. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The APAF system shall process the engineering and ancillary information necessary for calibration and science validation into IDFS data sets.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: processing engineering and ancillary information into IDFS data sets (what the system shall do). It does not state availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set to true.

RequirementText: The ASPERA-3 and MEX OA IDFS data sets shall be stored on a local SwRI archive
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies where certain datasets shall be stored (storage location), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: ASPERA-3 and MEX OA IDFS data and any APAF-generated intermediate files of ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry shall be provided to all ASPERA-3 Co-Is.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that certain data/files shall be provided to all ASPERA-3 Co-Is — a clear functional statement about what the system must do (data delivery/provision). It does not specify availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: IDFS data access software developed by SwRI shall be made available to the ASPERA-3 Co-Is.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies that the IDFS data access software shall be made available to a specific user group (ASPERA-3 Co-Is), which is a functional requirement about providing access/delivery of the software. It does not state availability/uptime, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Science analysis software developed by SwRI to analyze IDFS-formatted data shall be made available to the ASPERA-3 Co-Is.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional requirement to provide the science analysis software to a defined user group (ASPERA-3 Co-Is). It does not state uptime, security, legal, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The APAF system web server shall be password protected where appropriate to allow only pertinent ASPERA-3 team members access.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies password protection and restricting access to appropriate team members — this is an access control/authentication security requirement. No mention of availability, performance, operability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: There shall be a UNIX-based APAF system development computer.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operating environment (UNIX-based development computer), i.e., a platform/portability constraint. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: There shall be a UNIX-based APAF system production computer with an archival system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the production computer must be UNIX-based (environment/platform constraint) => Operability and Portability. Also requires an archival system (a required capability) => Functional. No mention of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: There shall be a web server for the APAF system
AI_Rationale: Specifies deployment/operational requirement that a web server must be present for the system. This concerns system operation/hosting rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: There shall be a network connection between SwRI and NISN.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that a network connection must exist between two systems — this is a functional integration requirement and pertains to system operability/administration (interface/connectivity). No explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints are given.

RequirementText: Science analysis software shall be integrated into the NASA approved data repository.
AI_Rationale: The statement prescribes that the software must be integrated with a specific (NASA-approved) data repository — this is a functional integration requirement (F) and relates to operability/manageability (O). The reference to a NASA-approved repository implies a compliance/legal constraint (L). No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, usability, maintainability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Program will have a simple, graphically appealing interface designed for sixth graders.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the interface's simplicity and graphical appeal and targets sixth graders, which concerns look-and-feel and usability (ease of use/appropriate for target users). It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Software will run on most computers since it only requires Macromedia Flash and HTML.
AI_Rationale: Specifies supported execution environments (works on most computers requiring Flash/HTML), which is a portability/platform compatibility requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall utilize a web browser compatible with the Flash plug-in (requirements in "Playback" section).
AI_Rationale: This is an environmental/operational requirement specifying the system must run in a web browser compatible with Flash—relates to operability (deployment/usage environment), not functional behavior or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to present an introductory cinematic to establish the game's narrative and provide in-game tutorials to aid users in solving fraction problems.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies behaviors the system must perform (present an introductory cinematic and provide in-game tutorials), so it is functional. It also explicitly aims to aid users in solving problems, which addresses learnability/usability. It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints, and the cinematic wording does not strongly impose look-and-feel constraints beyond functionality.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to terminate the introductory movie and return to the main menu by clicking the mouse.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (terminating an intro movie and returning to menu via mouse click), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability constraints, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall offer a menu with in-game help, a link to play the game, and a link to the Denominators' web page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior — providing a menu with help and links — and does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to initiate the game by clicking a button or learn more by following a link to the Denominators' web page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user-facing capabilities (initiating the game via a button and following a link to learn more), which is functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as usability, security, performance, or availability.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select a button to proceed either to the game sequence component or the Denominators' web page.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action/navigation capability (select a button to proceed to specific components/pages), which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to generate a series of multiple-choice fraction questions that form a cohesive storyline to introduce a specific topic.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability—generating multiple-choice fraction questions forming a cohesive storyline—which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The user will respond to questions by clicking on the desired answer from a set of choices
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the system/user interaction should do (users respond by clicking a choice). This is a functional interaction requirement; it does not state performance, usability, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to end the game or return to the main menu by clicking with the mouse.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action the system must support (ending the game or returning to main menu via mouse click). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability quality attributes, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to choose between returning to the main menu or exiting the game.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (choosing between returning to main menu or exiting), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to see their overall score and a plot conclusion to their answers to key story questions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (displaying overall score and a plot conclusion) — a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, usability metrics, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall input new data through pulldown menus and text fields, navigating between pages with separate questions by clicking a button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (input new data and navigation) — functional. Also prescribes UI elements (pulldown menus, text fields, buttons) affecting look-and-feel and relates to ease of use/navigation, so Look & Feel and Usability are applicable. No mention of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The user will follow a number of links to World Wide Web documents.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user-facing capability (following links to web documents), which is a functional requirement. It does not state non-functional constraints such as performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: The product will be as secure as the web browser that will run the product.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states a security constraint comparing the product's security to the web browser. This is a security non-functional requirement; it does not specify availability, performance, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The product will be available over the Internet via the S2S website.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the product is accessed (via the S2S website over the Internet), which concerns operation/availability channel and administration/operation rather than functional behavior or quality metrics like uptime, security, performance, or UI appearance. Matches Operability (O).

RequirementText: Reliability will be ensured by extensive testing by the team members and mentors, if available.
AI_Rationale: The statement addresses ensuring reliability of the system via testing, which maps to availability/reliability and fault-tolerance assurance. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be maintainable through modular code structure, allowing for easy future modifications by separating functionalities into subscenes within the main Flash game.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states the system shall be maintainable via modular code structure and separation of functionalities; this directly maps to Maintainability. No other quality attributes (e.g., performance, security, portability) are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: The BE system shall be able to monitor and acknowledge receipt of all data received from the Monitor and Control System (M&C).
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: monitoring and acknowledging receipt of data (functional). Also relates to operability/admin capability (monitoring/acknowledgement for managing data flows). No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, or maintainability requirements stated.

RequirementText: The BE system shall be able to detect and report interruptions of data delivery from the Correlator to M&C.
AI_Rationale: Requirement requests a capability to detect and report interruptions (a specific functional behavior). It also implies monitoring/operational functionality (operability). It does not specify uptime targets, recovery, or performance, so availability, fault tolerance, and other NFRs are not set.

RequirementText: The BE system shall verify successful delivery of output to the e2e
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional behavior: the backend must verify successful delivery of output to the end-to-end process. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns (availability, fault tolerance, security, operability, etc.).

RequirementText: The BE system shall be able to ensure the secure delivery of all internal messages.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates secure delivery of internal messages, which is a security concern (confidentiality/integrity). It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, functional behavior beyond security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to handle lag sets up to a maximum size of 262,144 values
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity of the backend to handle a maximum data set size (262,144 values), which is a scalability requirement; it also implies performance/capacity constraints on processing/throughput.

RequirementText: The BE system shall be able to receive data packets from the Correlator on the Backend network interface.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the BE system must receive data packets from the Correlator on the Backend network interface). It also describes an interfacing/operability concern (ability to connect/receive over a specific network interface), so Operability is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The BE shall verify the successful receipt of incoming data from the Correlator.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional behavior (backend must verify successful receipt of incoming data). It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The BE shall store input data records in a memory buffer and track buffer locations of all input data until data processing is complete.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a behavior the backend must perform: storing input records in a memory buffer and tracking their buffer locations until processing completes. This is a functional requirement; it does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The BE shall respond to incoming correlator mode changes, user optional processing sequence and/or parameter changes, and other external inputs that affect the data processing pipeline.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the backend shall respond to various inputs affecting the data processing pipeline — this describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not explicitly state non-functional constraints like performance, availability, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to validate and monitor time series data for correct order, valid values, and out-of-tolerance conditions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system capability to validate and monitor time series data (correct order, valid values, out-of-tolerance conditions), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The BE shall replace all invalid data with zero values.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a specific backend behavior for handling invalid data (replacing with zeros), which is a functional behavior. It also relates to data integrity/validation, which is commonly classified under security (data integrity), so SE is marked. No mentions of availability, performance, usability, portability, scalability, etc., so those are not set.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to apply normalizations based on reported data invalid counts.
AI_Rationale: This describes a backend capability/behavior (applying normalizations based on reported invalid data counts), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to apply corrections based on state count and/or quantizer power measurement data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability of the backend to apply corrections based on input data (state count or quantizer power measurement), which defines functional behavior. No explicit non-functional quality (availability, performance, security, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to make time stamp adjustments as required by the observational mode and correlator output parameters.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the backend must provide (making timestamp adjustments based on observational mode and correlator output). This is a functional requirement; no explicit availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to perform Fourier Transform the lag set time series.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete functional capability (perform FFT on a time series). No mention of performance, availability, security, portability, scalability, or UI/maintenance constraints.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to apply user selected frequency domain processes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the backend must apply frequency-domain processes chosen by the user. It does not state any availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: The BE shall combine the finished spectra with meta and auxiliary data to form suitably formatted output data sets.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior of the backend: combining spectra with metadata and auxiliary data and producing formatted output datasets. It does not specify availability, security, performance, scalability, usability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or look-and-feel qualities.

RequirementText: The BE shall send output data to the e2e System.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the backend (BE) shall send output data to the e2e System. It does not state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The BE shall verify that all sent data was successfully received. Report all errors.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a backend function: verify that sent data was received and report errors (functional behavior). The instruction to report errors implies operational/monitoring concerns (operability). It does not explicitly require availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to monitor the overall data processing rate, compare it to tolerances, and report any deviations from those tolerances.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior (monitoring, comparing to tolerances, reporting deviations) which is functional. It also relates to operational/administrative capability (monitoring and reporting), so Operability is applicable. No explicit mentions of availability, performance constraints, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The BE shall trap, flag and repair infs, NaNs, underflows, overflows and other computation errors.
AI_Rationale: Specifies backend behavior to detect (trap/flag) and repair computation errors (infs, NaNs, under/overflow) — a functional requirement with clear fault-tolerance/self-recovery aspect. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, usability, or maintainability requirements mentioned.

RequirementText: The BE shall periodically or upon request check PIDs and assure that all started tasks are alive and running.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a backend function to monitor PIDs and ensure tasks are running (functional). It is primarily an operability/monitoring requirement (O) and contributes to fault tolerance/resilience by detecting and assuring liveness (FT). It does not explicitly state availability targets, performance, security, or other categories.

RequirementText: The BE shall periodically or upon request check Backend physical processors and assure that all needed processors are alive and responding
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (periodic or on-demand health checks) — functional. It directly concerns ensuring processors are alive/responding, which implies availability and fault-tolerance. It also implies operability/monitoring capability for administration. No explicit mention of security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, UI, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The BE shall periodically or upon request check all Backend internal networks and assure that all communication connections are intact and functioning
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (periodic/on-demand checks) — functional. It explicitly aims to ensure communication connections are intact, which pertains to availability. The monitoring/administration aspect implies operability. It does not explicitly require fault tolerance, security, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to initiate a processing task on any Backend processor.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (initiating a processing task) — a functional requirement. Stating it must work on any Backend processor implies interoperability/portability across backend environments and also relates to operability/ability to interface with/manage different backend processors.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to signal a kill for any Backend process.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capability: backend must be able to signal/kill processes (functional). Also relates to system operation/administration (operability).

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to alter the priority of any of the BE tasks
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (altering task priority), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, operability/administration, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to initiate a reboot of any Backend a physical processor.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional capability (system must initiate reboots). It also describes an operational/admin capability (operability). No explicit availability, security, fault-tolerance, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to initiate a reboot of any internal network.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (the backend must perform an action: initiate a reboot). It also relates to operability/administration (ability to manage/reboot internal network), so Operability is marked. No explicit mentions of security, availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance requirements are given.

RequirementText: The BE shall be able to redistribute internal workload among its processors.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must redistribute workload among processors — a functional capability (F) that addresses scaling and efficient use of resources (SC) and performance (PE). It does not explicitly mention fault recovery, availability targets, security, UI, portability or maintainability.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to fully reconstruct the raw, original input data from the processed output.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (ability to reconstruct original input from processed output). It does not explicitly state qualities like availability, security, performance, scalability, etc., so only Functional is set to true.

RequirementText: The system shall maintain a memory buffer to store lag frames and track the status of each record in the buffer.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to maintain a memory buffer and track record status — a functional behavior. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, fault-tolerance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall utilize a memory buffer with backup disk storage to store all processed spectra.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an implementation detail about data storage (in-memory buffer with backup disk) which relates to maintainability (storage architecture, data management) and operability (how data is stored and managed/operated). It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, performance, security, portability, scalability, usability, legal, or a distinct functional behavior beyond storage, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall manage names, positions in sequence, and adjustable parameters for all processing pipeline applications.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide — managing names, sequence positions, and adjustable parameters for processing pipeline applications — which describes functional behavior rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: The system shall generate warning reports including warning number, source, rates (if applicable), and time stamp.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement to generate warning reports and the specific contents (warning number, source, rates, timestamp). No non-functional qualities like performance, availability, security, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall produce failure reports indicating internal system component failures, including error number and time stamp.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system function (producing failure reports) so Functional=1. Generating failure reports supports system maintenance and diagnostics (Maintainability=1) and is an operational/monitoring capability for administrators (Operability=1). It does not mention availability, fault recovery, security, performance, UI, portability, scalability or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall provide status reports on the functional state of internal system components such as processes, processors, and networks.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system shall provide status reports (a functional capability). It concerns monitoring internal components and is directly related to system operation/administration, so Operability is applicable. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, maintainability, security, performance, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The Backend System shall ensure input data fidelity and dynamic range integrity across all processing, manipulation, and I/O functions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on preserving data integrity and fidelity across processing and I/O—this is primarily about integrity/security and fault tolerance (preventing corruption during faults/processing). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, availability, portability, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of flagging and marking corrupted data segments and proceeding without interruption or effect on other data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (flag/mark corrupted segments) — a functional behavior — and explicitly requires continuing operation without affecting other data, which is a fault-tolerance/resilience concern. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The BE System shall be capable of accepting an aggregate data input stream from the Correlator of a minimum of 1.6 Gbytes/sec.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a throughput capacity (minimum 1.6 Gbytes/sec), which is a performance constraint. It also implies capacity/scalability to handle that input rate, so Scalability is applicable. No indications of availability, security, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The BE System shall be capable of delivering an output data stream to the e2e System of a minimum of 25 MBytes/sec
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required data throughput (25 MBytes/sec), which is a performance requirement; also implies scalability/capacity expectations for handling that load.

RequirementText: The total processor capability of the BE System shall be sufficient to accomplish all processing tasks while avoiding loss or delay on the input and output data streams.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required processing capacity to prevent loss or delay of data streams — primarily a performance (throughput/latency) requirement; also implies scalability/capacity planning to handle load.

RequirementText: The BE System shall have sufficient (amount TBD) memory with sufficient (rate TBD) access speeds to accomplish all processing tasks while avoiding loss or delay on the input and output data streams
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies memory capacity and access speeds to avoid loss or delay of data streams — this is primarily a performance requirement (throughput/latency) and implies availability/reliability (preventing loss/delay). It does not explicitly state fault tolerance, scalability, security, or other categories.

RequirementText: All math/science application software shall take optimal advantage of all language, compiler, and system computational features and resources to reduce run times to the minimum practical level.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates minimizing run times by leveraging language, compiler, and system features—this is a performance (speed/efficiency) constraint. It does not specify availability, scalability, security, portability, or other concerns.

RequirementText: All management software functions shall take optimal advantage of all language, compiler and system features and resources to reduce overheads to the minimum practical level.
AI_Rationale: Requirement demands taking optimal advantage of language, compiler and system features to minimize overheads—this is an efficiency/performance requirement. It does not specify functionality, availability, security, scalability, portability, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: All input and output, and storage and retrieval operations shall take optimal advantage of all system resources to reduce overhead and latency to the minimal practical level.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly targets reducing overhead and latency and optimizing resource usage for I/O and storage operations, which are performance concerns. It does not mention availability, scalability, security, functionality, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: All data processing functions shall be chainable (outputs pipeable to inputs) and repeatable in the processing pipeline in cases where this makes computational sense.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies how data processing functions should behave (be chainable/pipeable and repeatable), which is functional behavior. It also implies a design-for-composability and repeatability concern that impacts maintainability (ease of reusing, modifying, and testing pipeline components). It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, scalability, legal, UI, portability, operability, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: The system shall use industry-standard, commonly available, and widely used operating system, message passing middleware, and programming languages.
AI_Rationale: Requiring industry-standard, commonly available OS, middleware, and languages primarily addresses portability (compatibility across environments) and also implies easier maintainability (common tools/skills) and operability/administrability (familiar platforms simplify operation and support). It does not explicitly reference availability, performance, security, scalability, legal, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to self-monitor and automatically take actions to address various issues including hardware failures, software crashes, performance degradation, errors, and communication disruptions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (self-monitoring and automatic corrective actions), which is a functional behavior. It explicitly describes handling hardware failures, crashes, errors and communication disruptions—this indicates fault tolerance and contributes directly to system availability. The self-monitoring/autonomic behavior also relates to operability (automated administration/management). It does not mention legal, UI, portability, scalability, security, maintainability, or explicit performance targets.

RequirementText: The software part of the system shall be able to perform without total system restart due to internal failure between array maintenance windows.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must continue operating without a full restart due to internal failure between maintenance windows — this implies resilience/graceful degradation (fault tolerance) and continuous availability between windows. It does not specify legal, UI, performance, portability, scalability, security, or maintainability aspects explicitly.

RequirementText: The hardware part of the system shall be able to perform indefinitely without complete loss of service, except in the event of total failure of primary and backup power.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies continuous operation without complete loss of service (availability) and resilience except in total power failure (fault tolerance).

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of responding in a loss-less manner to I/O and processing changes arising from Correlator mode changes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must handle I/O and processing changes without loss when Correlator mode changes—this is about resilience and graceful handling of faults/transition conditions (fault tolerance). It does not specify availability metrics, performance, functional behavior, security, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall continue to operate in a loss-less manner in the event of a temporary (time duration TBD) loss of availability of the e2e System.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must continue to operate without loss during a temporary loss of availability of the end-to-end system. This directly concerns availability and fault tolerance (resilience to temporary failures); it does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to complete processing of all onboard data, deliver the results to the End-to-End System and maintain availability for immediate resumption of operations once Correlator access is restored.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (process and deliver onboard data) and requires availability/resilience: maintain availability and immediate resumption after Correlator access is restored (fault tolerance). No explicit legal, performance, portability, usability, scalability, security, maintainability or operability requirements indicated.

RequirementText: All system processing and interconnect hardware shall be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement and/or reconfiguration
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies hardware must be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement and reconfiguration — this directly concerns maintainability and operational/administrative access. It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: All systems and application source code shall be available to or on the systems that execute it.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that source code be available on or to the systems that execute the software, which primarily affects maintainability (ease of making changes, debugging, and support) and operability (deployment/administration considerations). It does not specify performance, security, portability, scalability, legal or UI concerns, nor a functional behavior.

RequirementText: Software tools and pre-built applications that do not have source code available shall come with a complete diagnostic package and customer support.
AI_Rationale: Requires provision of diagnostics and customer support for closed-source components, which relates to maintainability (supportability, ability to diagnose/maintain) and operability (operational support and manageability). Does not specify security, performance, availability, or other categories.

RequirementText: Operating system software shall either have source code available or come with sufficient diagnostics and customer support.
AI_Rationale: Requirement addresses availability of source or diagnostics/support for the OS, which relates to operability (manageability, diagnostics, customer support) and maintainability (ability to fix/modify). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: I/O, communications, and processing hardware shall be easily expandable, reconfigureable, augmentable and replaceable to meet increasing data transfer and processing demands imposed by EVLA science, Correlator changes, and availability of new hardware.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies hardware must be easily expandable/reconfigurable/replaceable to meet increasing data transfer and processing demands — primarily addressing operability (manageability/replaceability) and scalability (ability to grow to meet increased load). No explicit availability, security, portability, or performance metrics given.

RequirementText: Above, shall be accomplished in manner that is transparent to processing, communications and I/O software functions with the possible exception of recompilation of executables.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that functionality must be implemented transparently to existing processing, communications and I/O software (only possible need to recompile executables). This implies minimal changes and compatibility concerns (portability) and ease of integration/modification (maintainability). No explicit statements about performance, availability, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to operate seamlessly at its interfaces with hardware modules and software functionality.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must operate seamlessly at interfaces with hardware modules and software functionality—this concerns interoperability/operability and ease of operating across interfaces. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, portability, security, performance, or a specific functional behavior, so only Operability is set.

RequirementText: The Backend system shall ultimately be scaleable to an extent that it will be capable of handling up to two Gbytes per second per Correlator output channel in real-time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required throughput (2 GBytes/s per channel) and real-time handling—this is a performance (throughput/latency) requirement and implies scalability to meet growing or high load, so PE and SC apply.

RequirementText: Each user shall have a set of system access properties that defines the user's privileges within the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that each user has access properties defining privileges (authorization), which is a security requirement. It also describes system behavior (assigning per-user access properties), so it is functional as well.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to create and add a new user to the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an administrator action (create/add user) which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to edit a user's system access properties.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (administrators can edit a user’s system access properties), which is a functional feature. It also describes an administrative/manageability operation (ability to administer user access), so operability is applicable. It does not explicitly state security constraints, availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to block all access to the system for all users or selectively by user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an administrative capability (ability to block access globally or per user) — a functional feature. It also describes access control behavior (restricting who can use the system), which is a security requirement. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, operability, or other non-functional aspects explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to handle non-real-time operations in a transparent fashion.
AI_Rationale: Requirement expresses a capability (system shall handle non-real-time operations) which is functional. The phrase 'in a transparent fashion' implies it should be seamless to users, i.e., a usability concern. No explicit performance, availability, scalability, security, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Modular design principles shall be employed to the maximum extent possible
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates modular design principles, which primarily impacts maintainability (ease of modification, testing, reusability). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: Complete and comprehensible hardware systems specifications and configuration information shall be readily available
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that hardware specifications and configuration information be readily available and comprehensible, which directly supports system operability (administration/operation) and maintainability (ease of maintenance, understanding, and modification). It does not specify uptime, performance, security, portability, or UI look-and-feel, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: Software system and application code shall be well documented and written in a generally familiar language or languages (preferably not more than two).
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates well-documented code and use of familiar (limited) programming languages, which primarily targets maintainability (easier understanding, modification, and documentation). It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Wherever applicable, all computers and peripherals shall be powered though UPS type devices with sufficient capacity for the computers to safely coordinate a system wide shutdown of the correlator hardware in the event of a prolonged power outage
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of UPS capacity to tolerate/protect against power outages and enable coordinated shutdown—this is a fault-tolerance/resilience requirement. It also concerns operational behavior of the system during outages (operability). No functional feature, availability metric, security, performance, or other quality is explicitly required.

RequirementText: All computers within the CMCS system shall have the ability for authorized users to directly access individual systems for maintenance and monitoring through remote logins.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (remote login access to individual systems) — a functional capability (F). It restricts access to authorized users, implying security controls (SE). It explicitly targets maintenance and monitoring operations, relating to system operability/administration (O). No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, performance, or usability are present.

RequirementText: Each computer system in the CMCS shall have a hardware based watchdog timer configured to reboot the system in the case of a system hang.
AI_Rationale: Specifies hardware watchdog to reboot on system hang — this is a fault-tolerance measure to recover from failures and directly supports availability/uptime. No other concerns (security, portability, UI, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The CMIB shall conform to both electrical and physical PC104+ standards
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates conformance to the PC104+ electrical and physical standards, which is a standards/compliance constraint (mapped to Legal). It also implies hardware compatibility/portability with PC/104+ modules, so Portability is set. No explicit indications of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The CMIB shall be able to function as a real-time computer with at least 64MB of RAM, storage, various ports, and network connectivity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies real-time operation and minimum memory/storage—a performance-related constraint (PE). Specifies required hardware interfaces, ports and network connectivity which relate to the system's ability to operate/manage and integrate—an operability concern (O). It does not state legal, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, usability, or explicit functional behavior beyond hardware capability, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall support real-time correlator operations, hardware monitoring/control, and PLD/FPGA personality updates over the network.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capabilities (real-time correlator ops, hardware monitoring/control, PLD/FPGA updates) => Functional. The term 'real-time' implies performance constraints => Performance. Remote monitoring/control and network-based updates imply manageability/operability (remote administration) => Operability. No explicit statements about availability, security, scalability, portability, etc., so those are not set.

RequirementText: The MCCC shall be a high availability type generalpurpose computer capable of supporting multiple Ethernet interfaces, COTS operating systems, and support server/host services for the CMIB operating system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the system shall provide (support server/host services) -> Functional. States 'high availability' -> Availability. Specifies support for COTS operating systems (runs on multiple OSs) -> Portability. Does not explicitly mention fault tolerance mechanisms, performance, security, scalability, operability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The MCCC shall have all required disk and file system facilities installed locally such that the system can boot and run in a stand-alone configuration.
AI_Rationale: This is a deployment/installation constraint specifying that required disk and file system facilities must be locally installed so the system can boot and run standalone, which pertains to operability/administration. It does not specify legal, security, portability to other platforms, performance, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The CPCC shall be able to function as a high availability computer for real-time correlator operations, hardware monitoring/control, and remote PLD/FPGA updates.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system functions (real-time correlator ops, hardware monitoring/control, remote PLD/FPGA updates) -> Functional. Explicitly requires high availability -> Availability. 'Real-time' implies performance (latency/timing) constraints -> Performance. Remote updates and hardware control imply operational/manageability concerns -> Operability. No explicit mention of security, scalability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or legal requirements.

RequirementText: The CPCC shall have all required disk and file system facilities installed locally such that the system can boot and run in a stand-alone configuration.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies deployment/install characteristics (local disk and file system facilities so the system can boot and run stand-alone), which pertains to system operation/administration and runtime configuration—Operability. It does not specify functional behavior, availability metrics, portability across platforms, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The CMCS processors shall be capable of responding to correlator hardware inputs (interrupts) in a deterministic fashion with sufficient performance to avoid data loss, corruption or overflows.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies deterministic, timely response to hardware interrupts with sufficient performance to avoid data loss/corruption/overflows, which is a performance (real-time/latency) requirement. It does not explicitly state scalability, fault-tolerance mechanisms, availability, security, or other categories, so only Performance is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall function as a high availability computer for real-time tasks including correlation, hardware management, and remote updates.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall function as a high-availability computer (explicitly Availability). High availability typically implies fault tolerance/resilience, so FT is marked. It also requires supporting real-time tasks, which imposes performance/timing constraints, so PE is marked. Tasks listed (correlation, hardware management, remote updates) describe functional capabilities, so F is marked. No explicit mention of scalability, security, legal, usability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or operability requirements, so those are left false.

RequirementText: All system error and debug messages shall be categorized in a logical fashion such that message traffic can be filtered as to content, detail, and message rate.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies structured categorization and ability to filter/log error and debug messages by content, detail, and rate—this is about system manageability/operability (logging, monitoring, administration) and also supports maintainability (easier debugging and maintenance). It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: All messages passed between CMCS system layers shall have both UTC and wall clock time stamp information appropriate for the message type.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional behavior of messages (they must include UTC and wall clock timestamps). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Software shall be provided that allows an authorized user full access to all messaging, monitor, and control traffic throughout the CMCS.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that authorized users shall have full access to messaging, monitoring, and control traffic — this defines a functional capability (provide access) and an authorization/security constraint. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The CMCS shall autonomously monitor and respond to hardware issues, software crashes, resource limitations, errors, and communication failures.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system behavior ('shall autonomously monitor and respond...') so it is functional (F). It clearly addresses handling faults, crashes, resource limits and communication failures, which maps to fault tolerance/resilience (FT). The monitoring and response capability pertains to system operation and administration (operability, O). It does not explicitly state availability metrics, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, usability, or maintainability requirements, so those are not set.

RequirementText: The software part of the system shall be able to perform without total system restart due to internal failure between system maintenance windows.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must continue operating without a full restart after internal failures between maintenance windows — this indicates fault tolerance/resilience and implies availability (uptime) guarantees. It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to continue processing of all correlator configuration/control events until the queues of parameters are exhausted and external communications are restored
AI_Rationale: Specifies continuing processing during loss of external communications until queues are exhausted and restoration — this is an availability/reliability and fault-tolerance requirement. It does not specify UI, security, performance metrics, or maintainability, nor is it a plain functional feature description.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to sit at idle and resume operations with minimal (amount TBD) delay.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (idle and resume) — a functional behavior — and constrains the resume latency ('minimal delay'), which is a performance (timing/latency) non-functional requirement. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, usability, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: All system processing and interconnect hardware shall be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement and/or reconfiguration.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that hardware be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement and reconfiguration—this directly concerns maintainability (ease of maintenance) and operability (ease of operating/administering and servicing physical components). It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: All systems and application source code shall be available to or on the systems that execute it.
AI_Rationale: Requiring source code to be available on the systems that execute it relates to maintainability (easier modification, debugging) and operability (administration, deployment, access). It does not specify uptime, security, portability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: All software modules shall be designed for easy debugging by allowing simulation of inputs and outputs.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates design for easy debugging and simulation of inputs/outputs, which directly targets maintainability (ease of diagnosis, testing, and modification). It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, portability, scalability, or operability explicitly.

RequirementText: All software processes shall be killable, restartable, debuggable and testable with minimal impact on normal system operations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies processes must be killable/restartable/debuggable/testable with minimal impact on normal operations. This directly concerns operability (administration/management) and maintainability (debug/test). 'Minimal impact on normal system operations' implies availability/reliability, and the ability to restart/continue with little disruption implies fault tolerance/resilience. No explicit performance, security, portability, scalability, legal or UI concerns.

RequirementText: Software tools and pre-built applications that do not have source code available shall come with a complete diagnostic package and customer support.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates delivery of diagnostic package and customer support for closed-source tools—this addresses maintainability (supportability, diagnostics for upkeep) and operability (support/operational diagnostics). No explicit security, performance, availability, portability, scalability, legal, UI, or functional behavior implied.

RequirementText: I/O, communications, and processing hardware shall be easily expandable, reconfigurable, augmentable and replaceable to meet increasing data traffic and processing demands imposed by EVLA science, Correlator changes, and availability of new hardware.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies hardware must be easily expandable/reconfigurable/replaceable to meet increasing data/processing demands—explicitly addresses scalability. The emphasis on being replaceable/augmentable implies maintainability and operability (manageability/administration). It does not explicitly state performance metrics, availability, security, portability, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: Transparency shall be accomplished in manner that is transparent to processing, communications and I/O software functions with the possible exception of recompilation of executables.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that functionality should be transparent to processing, communications and I/O software functions (no changes or recompilation except possibly), which implies compatibility/portability across environments and ease of integrating/maintaining software without modification. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, scalability, UI, or operability/ fault-tolerance.

RequirementText: Seamlessness shall be accomplished in a manner that is seamless, in that it does not affect hardware modules or software functionality that it meets at interfaces.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies non-impact across hardware modules and software at interfaces — a non‑intrusive, compatibility/integration concern. This aligns with portability (compatibility across environments/modules) and operability (ease of integrating/operating without affecting other components). It does not mention security, performance, availability, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: Each user shall have a set of system access properties that defines the users privileges within the system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that each user shall have access properties defining privileges—this is an access-control/authz requirement (security). It also specifies a system capability (what the system must provide), so it is treated as functional as well.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to create and add a new user to the system.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying an administrator action (create/add a user). No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to edit a users system access properties.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (administrator capability to edit user access). It also pertains to security (access control/permissions management), so SE is marked. Other quality attributes are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to block all access to the system for all users or selectively by user.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies an administrative capability (ability to block access) which is a functional feature (F). It also specifies access control restricting user access, which is a security concern (SE). It does not specify availability SLAs, fault tolerance, operability/management details, or other non-functional aspects, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall utilize a modular design with hot-swappable components for maximum repairability and uptime.
AI_Rationale: Specifies modular, hot-swappable components to maximize repairability (maintainability) and uptime (availability). Hot-swappability also implies resilience to component replacement without downtime, indicating fault tolerance.

RequirementText: The system shall provide complete and understandable hardware specifications and configuration details.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates providing complete and understandable hardware specs and configuration details—this is primarily about operability/administration (O). The term "understandable" implies usability (US) of the documentation. It does not specify security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or fault-tolerance aspects, nor is it a functional behavior of the application itself.

RequirementText: Software Coding Practices software system and application code shall be well documented and written in a generally familiar language or languages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates well-documented code and use of generally familiar programming languages, which directly targets ease of maintenance, comprehension, and future modification—classic maintainability concerns. It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, UI, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall allow agents to broadcast messages to all other agents on the same local network.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (agents can broadcast messages to other agents on the same local network). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, portability, scalability, operability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall allow agents to multicast messages to all other agents subscribed to the same multicast address.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (multicast messaging behavior among agents). It does not specify availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow agents to send targeted messages (unicast) to specific agents within the organization.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—allowing agents to send targeted (unicast) messages to specific agents. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The system shall allow agents to select between unicast, multicast, and broadcast communication.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (agents can select communication mode: unicast/multicast/broadcast). It does not explicitly state quality attributes like availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall support agent membership in multicast groups, allowing them to join and leave.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (supporting multicast group membership with join/leave operations), which is functional behavior. No quality constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall support secure communication through message encryption and decryption techniques.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (support message encryption/decryption) — a functional behavior — and explicitly concerns security (confidentiality/integrity of communications), so both F and SE apply. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, portability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow agents to optionally encrypt messages.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a feature (allow agents to encrypt messages) — functional. The mention of encryption implies a security requirement (confidentiality), so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, fault-tolerance, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall use a best-effort multicast/broadcast approach, where delivery of packets to all specified agents is not guaranteed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of a best-effort multicast/broadcast mechanism (a functional design decision) and explicitly indicates non-guaranteed delivery, which is a reliability/fault-tolerance characteristic. Does not mention availability, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall encrypt messages but cannot guarantee confidentiality due to potential decryption by unauthorized parties.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior (encrypt messages) and concerns security (confidentiality cannot be guaranteed). No mention of availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, usability, look-and-feel, operability, fault-tolerance, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall support multicast protocols for sending multicast messages, requiring compatible routers, network cards, and operating systems.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability ('shall support multicast protocols for sending multicast messages') and explicitly mentions required compatible platforms (routers, network cards, operating systems), which implies portability/platform compatibility. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall restrict broadcast message transmission to authorized administrators only.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies access control on broadcast message transmission (authorization), which is a security concern. It also prescribes system behavior ('shall restrict ...') so it is functional as well. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The tool shall limit general users to a specific set of functionalities.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functionality restricting which features general users may access (functional requirement). This also implies access control/authorization, which is a security concern.

RequirementText: The automated diagnostic tool shall input sensed data in real time from data acquisition devices and the HVAC unit under diagnosis as well as from data files containing previously acquired data, though not simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (inputting sensed and file data). The phrase 'in real time' implies a timing/performance constraint, so Performance is applicable. No explicit availability, security, scalability, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: The tool shall input sensed data in real time from data acquisition devices and the HVAC unit under diagnosis.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement (input sensed data). 'In real time' implies a performance/latency constraint, so PE set. No explicit availability, security, scalability, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: The tool shall permit sensed data to be input from an electronic file, though not simultaneously with sensed data from external acquisition hardware.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability: permitting sensed data input from an electronic file and a constraint about not allowing simultaneous input from external acquisition hardware. This describes functional behavior rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: The system shall qualify the certainty of each sensed data item during acquisition, flagging doubtful data due to errors or unexpected values.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (qualify and flag sensed data) — functional. It also describes data integrity/validation (detecting errors/unexpected values), which is a security-related concern (data integrity), so SE is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, usability, maintainability, portability, fault tolerance, operability, legal, or UI look-and-feel aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall identify potentially faulty sensor data based on a sensor-specific number of consecutive missed readings due to communication issues.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system function — detecting potentially faulty sensor data based on consecutive missed readings (functional). It describes fault detection behavior related to handling sensor/communication failures, which aligns with fault tolerance concerns. No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Sensed data used in or supporting diagnostic analyses shall be saved to permanent storage.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action: sensed data shall be saved to permanent storage (persistence). No explicit quality attributes like availability, performance, security, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The occurrence of missing data shall be indicated in permanent storage by a unique and obvious place holder or indicator, e.g., a null value or sequence of characters that cannot be confused with nonmissing data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies how the system must represent missing data in permanent storage (a behavior/functional constraint), and it emphasizes an obvious, unambiguous indicator to avoid confusion which affects usability for data consumers. It does not address availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, fault tolerance, or operability explicitly.

RequirementText: Sensed data input to the tool shall be stored to permanent storage with a precision of three significant figures.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that sensed data shall be stored to permanent storage (a functional behavior). The precision constraint is a data-quality attribute but does not clearly map to other listed NFR categories (performance, security, etc.), so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the capability to modify the expected range of sensed data against which the data will be validated.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (administrator can modify expected ranges) which is a functional behavior. It also describes an administrative/manageability feature (ability for operators/administrators to configure validation parameters), so Operability applies. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, portability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The tool shall associate with each continuous parameter one or more tolerances each corresponding to a different sensitivity level for the tool.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior of the system: associating tolerances with continuous parameters for different sensitivity levels (a functional mapping/configuration). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, portability, scalability, fault tolerance, maintainability, operability, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: Any and all errors associated with obtaining, validating, converting, or storing the sensed data shall be logged as described in subsequent specifications and selected errors shall be reported to the user.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (logging and reporting) -> Functional. Logging supports maintenance and operations (auditability, monitoring) -> Maintainability and Operability. Reporting selected errors to the user affects usability. No explicit security, availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance constraints mentioned.
