RequirementText: The automated diagnostic tool shall detect and identify certain performance and operational faults in chiller and cooling tower subsystems of HVAC units following specified algorithms.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior of the system (detect and identify faults) — so Functional=1. It concerns fault detection/handling capability (diagnostics for faults), which relates to Fault Tolerance, so FT=1. No explicit availability, performance, security, legal, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The tool shall be designed to permit the addition of diagnostic algorithms for other subsystems of HVAC units.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall be designed to allow addition of diagnostic algorithms (extensibility/ability to modify and extend), which is a maintainability concern. It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Any and all errors associated with failures of the diagnostic algorithms shall be logged as described in subsequent specifications and selected errors shall be reported to the user.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that errors shall be logged and that selected errors shall be reported to the user — these are functional behaviors (logging and reporting). Logging supports maintenance and diagnostics, so Maintainability is applicable. The text does not explicitly constrain availability, fault-tolerance mechanisms, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The tool shall monitor the unit under diagnosis, either in real time or batch mode, for an indefinite period of time or until input data are no longer available, and log diagnostic results as they are determined.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior: monitoring (real-time or batch) and logging diagnostic results—this is a functional description of what the tool shall do. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Diagnostic results that are saved to permanent storage shall be accompanied in storage by the absolute time of occurrence, the identity of the unit to which the diagnostic applies, and the identity of the diagnostic.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete functional behavior: what data must be saved alongside diagnostic results (time, unit identity, diagnostic identity). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The administrator user shall have the capability to adjust the sensitivity of the diagnostic analysis in order to increase or decrease the probability of fault detection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (administrator can adjust diagnostic sensitivity) which is functional. It also describes an administrative/manageability feature (ability for admin to configure system behavior), so it maps to Operability. It does not specify availability, security, performance, scalability, legality, UI look-and-feel, portability, maintainability, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: The automated diagnostic tool shall display and record diagnostic results. Diagnostic results to be displayed to the user will be done so in a simple, graphical and textual format.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (display and record diagnostic results). It also constrains presentation ('simple, graphical and textual format'), which pertains to look-and-feel and implies usability (simplicity/readability). No mention of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The administrator shall have the ability to specify which diagnostic results will not be reported in any manner, i.e., not detected.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (an administrative function to specify which diagnostic results are not reported). It describes functional behavior rather than quality attributes such as availability, security, performance, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system shall recognize user selection (by mouse) across the entire width of an item, including its diagnostic indicators, in main, systems, and condition windows.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI interaction: mouse selection across item width and indicators in specific windows—this is a look-and-feel and usability requirement. It does not address availability, security, portability, performance, scalability, maintainability, or operability; not treated as a system-level non-functional like availability. No explicit functional behavior beyond UI affordance, so functional label omitted.

RequirementText: The windows listing diagnostic results shall increase in height as needed to display entries up to a maximum of ten entries.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI behavior (window should resize to show up to ten entries) which is a functional requirement about presentation and directly concerns look-and-feel (layout). Does not mention availability, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The building, subsystems, and condition windows shall display the current time if the diagnostic tool is operating in real time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior: displaying the current time in specific UI windows when operating in real time. It describes functionality rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: If only a single building is defined, the subsystems window shall become the main window of the application and shall have all the functionality of the main window as described in these specifications.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior (UI/window behavior and functionality when a single building is defined), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, look-and-feel, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Each window of the diagnostic tool shall display an animated graphical feature indicating the status, whether active or not, of the diagnostic processing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that each window shall display an animated graphical indicator of diagnostic status — this is a functional requirement about UI behavior and also concerns look-and-feel/visual presentation (animated graphical feature). No explicit non-functional qualities like performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The subsystem window shall be modal to the building window, the condition window modal to the subsystem window, and the diagnostic history and diagnostic information windows shall be modal to the condition window.
AI_Rationale: Specifies concrete UI behavior (which windows must be modal to which) — a functional UI requirement. It concerns window interaction/layout (look-and-feel). Does not specify usability, performance, availability, security, etc.

RequirementText: Significant errors in software operation shall be logged to permanent storage with sufficient detail to guide the administrator and to assist support staff in locating and rectifying the error.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies logging behavior (functional). It supports administrators and support staff in diagnosing/rectifying errors, which relates to maintainability and operability (monitoring/administration). No mention of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: Software errors logged to permanent storage shall include the absolute time of occurrence, the name of the software module in which the error occurred, the name of the software function in which the error occurred, and a description of the error.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the system must do (log errors and the specific fields to include), i.e., a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, maintainability, security, or other NFRs, so those are not set.

RequirementText: The user interface shall consist of six windows: Main window, configuration window, subsystems window, condition window, diagnostic information window, and diagnostic history window.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user interface structure (which windows/screens exist), which pertains to look-and-feel/UI design rather than operational, performance, or security requirements.

RequirementText: The main window shall list buildings monitored and summarizing the current diagnostic status of all contained monitored units.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the main window shall display a list of monitored buildings and summary diagnostic status of their units. No explicit quality, UI appearance, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The main window shall have main menus entitled File and Status.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the user interface elements (main menus titled File and Status), which concerns look-and-feel/GUI layout rather than system availability, performance, security, etc. It does not describe functional processing or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The File menu shall offer Configure Diagnostics, Logout, and Exit in that order.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (menu shall offer items) and UI layout (order of items), so Functional and Look & Feel apply. No mention of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall offer a Status main menu with Start Diagnostics and Stop Diagnostics in that order.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (the system shall offer a Status main menu with Start/Stop Diagnostics) — therefore Functional. It also prescribes the order of menu items, which is a presentation/layout concern, so Look & Feel is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability or usability non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The menu items named Configure Diagnostics and Exit in the main menu entitled File shall be enabled at all times
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies UI behavior (these menu items shall be enabled at all times), which is a functional behavior. It also concerns user interaction and accessibility of menu items, so it relates to usability. It does not address availability, performance, security, legal, maintainability, portability, scalability, or look-and-feel aesthetics specifically.

RequirementText: The system shall only enable the Logout menu item in the File menu if the current user is authenticated as the administrator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (enable/disable menu item) => Functional. Requires authentication/role check (administrator) => Security (authorization). Does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, UI aesthetics beyond behavior, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Start Diagnostics menu item in the Status menu shall be enabled only when diagnostics aren't running, otherwise, it shall be disabled.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior of a menu item (when it should be enabled/disabled). This also impacts usability by guiding user interaction; no quality attributes like performance, security, or portability are mentioned.

RequirementText: The Stop Diagnostics menu item in the Status menu shall be enabled only when diagnostics are running and disabled otherwise.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI behavior (menu item enabled only when diagnostics running) — a functional requirement. It also affects usability by preventing inappropriate actions, so marked as Usability. No indications of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Selecting Configure Diagnostics from the File menu shall open the configuration window modally, making it the active window in front of the main window.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (user selects menu item => configuration window opens modally and becomes active), so it is functional. It also prescribes UI presentation/modal behavior (window modality and z-order), which is a look-and-feel (UI) requirement. No availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are mentioned. Usability is related but not explicitly required, so not marked.

RequirementText: The configuration window shall have a button labeled Save that when clicked will present the user with a window by which to enter a disk file or database name in which to save the modifiable data in the window.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (provide a Save button and present a dialog to enter a file/database name to save data), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel constraints, or usability non-functional properties.

RequirementText: The configuration window shall have a button labeled Close that will dismiss the configuration window and return the user to the main window.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: a Close button that dismisses the configuration window and returns the user to the main window. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The configuration window shall have a button labeled Recall that will permit the user to recall a disk file of previously saved parameters from which to populate the configuration window.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: a 'Recall' button that loads a disk file to populate the configuration window. Primarily a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The subsystems window shall list subsystems monitored for a specific building and summarizing the current diagnostic status of all monitored subsystems.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the subsystems window must list monitored subsystems for a building and summarize their diagnostic status (what the system should do). It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, legal, visual styling details, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, security, or usability constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The diagnostic information window shall have a button labeled Print that when clicked will display a window listing items to print including the diagnostic information window, the history window, and both the diagnostic and history windows.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior: a Print button in the diagnostic information window that opens a print-selection window listing specific items to print. This is a functional requirement describing UI functionality rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The diagnostic information window shall have a button labeled Close that shall dismiss the window.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete UI control and its behavior (dismiss window) — a functional requirement. Also prescribes the button label, which is a look-and-feel/UI detail.

RequirementText: The diagnostic information window shall have a button labeled History that when clicked will display the diagnostic history window and display the previous weeks diagnostic results.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-action (button) and resulting behavior (open diagnostic history window and show previous week's results) — a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The diagnostic history window shall display historical diagnostic results for a specific diagnostic.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying historical diagnostic results in a diagnostic history window), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, UI aesthetics, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The diagnostic history window shall provide user selections for start times and end times for the history interval.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (allow users to select start and end times in the diagnostic history window), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly impose availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The diagnostic history window shall display data in intervals of one week or greater.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies how the diagnostic history window should present data (a display behavior), which is functional. It also constrains the presentation/granularity (UI/display requirement), so it maps to Look & Feel. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: The diagnostic history window shall display a maximum time interval of two years.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a display behavior/constraint (the diagnostic history window shall show at most two years), which is a functional requirement about what the system should do. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The color map of the history window shall indicate confirmed faults with the color red,potential faults with the color yellow, normal conditions with the color green, and periods when diagnostic processing was not active with the color gray.
AI_Rationale: Specifies colors used in the UI (color map of history window) to represent states; this is a look-and-feel/user interface presentation requirement. No mention of availability, security, performance, legal, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The vertical axis of the color map of the history window shall indicate hour of the day and the horizontal axis shall indicate the absolute date and the day of week.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the UI must display (functional) and prescribes visual layout of axes on the color map (look & feel). Does not address other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The diagnostic history window shall have a button labeled Print that when clicked will display a window listing items to print including the diagnostic information window, the history window, and both the diagnostic and history windows.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete UI behavior (a Print button that opens a window listing printable items). This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, scalability, maintainability, portability, operability, usability, or look-and-feel beyond the literal label) are stated.

RequirementText: The diagnostic history window shall have a button labeled Close that will dismiss the window.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI control (button labeled 'Close') and its behavior (dismiss the window), which is a functional requirement. The explicit label text implies a UI/look-and-feel detail, so Look & Feel is also applicable. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The subsystems window, condition window, and diagnostic information window shall display a title that indicates its specific location or absolute path in the navigation hierarchy of windows
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies how the UI should present window titles showing location/path in the navigation hierarchy — this is a look-and-feel concern and affects usability (helping users orient themselves). It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, or maintenance, nor core backend functionality beyond presentation, so only LF and US are set.

RequirementText: The main window, subsystems window, and condition window shall have three diagnostic indicators for each item listed.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that particular windows shall include three diagnostic indicators for each listed item — this defines required system functionality (UI elements). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or usability/appearance constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: An OK indicator, appearing green, shall signify the absence of any diagnostic conditions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI indicator behavior (functional: the system shall show an OK indicator that signifies absence of diagnostics) and its visual appearance (color = green) which is a look-and-feel requirement. It also impacts usability by communicating system status to users.

RequirementText: A yellow Caution indicator will be used to signify potential diagnostic issues.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a visual UI convention (color indicator) to signal diagnostic issues, which is a look-and-feel and usability concern. It does not specify availability, security, performance, or maintenance aspects.

RequirementText: A red Not OK indicator will be active to signify a confirmed diagnostic condition.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (activate a Not OK indicator) => Functional. Also specifies visual appearance (red indicator) => Look & Feel.

RequirementText: Only one indicator shall be active at a given time for a specific diagnostic and no indicators shall flash when active.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required system behavior (only one indicator active, none flashing) — a functional constraint — and constrains visual behavior/appearance of indicators, so Look & Feel applies.

RequirementText: The diagnostic indicators on the main window and subsystems window shall summarize all diagnostic conditions associated with each entry in the window.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (displaying diagnostic indicators summarizing conditions for each entry) — functional. It also impacts user presentation/understandability, so usability is applicable. No explicit constraints about performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The tool shall keep a permanent record of any modifications made to fixed data.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the tool must record modifications (audit/history of changes). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, maintainability, or other non-functional qualities, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The log shall indicate the time and date of the change, original value of the item(s) hanged, and the new value of the item(s)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: what the log must record (time/date, original and new values). It does not explicitly impose availability, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The game shall only display the current block positions and not positions from canceled movements.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the system shall display (show current block positions and exclude canceled movement positions), which is a functional requirement about behavior/presentation of game state.

RequirementText: The system must allow a member of the network to send requests to a particular or all the other members about possible delivery of a driver's smart card to a similar person.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a capability the system must provide (sending requests between members regarding delivery), which is functional. It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow a member of the network to send a bulk request on all or a large part of its driver's smart card holders to a particular or all members of the network.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capability (sending bulk requests to network members). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, scalability, security, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall allow a member to do statistics on messages issued and received from/to his system
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (allow a member to perform statistics on messages) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall provide automatic reply to the sender of the request through the use of a standard interface to the Members systems
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement: the system must automatically reply to request senders. It also specifies use of a standard interface to Members' systems, implying interoperability/compatibility (portability). No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall track the workflow between senders and related replies.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: tracking workflow between senders and related replies. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall be able, in accordance with the rules on delays for each transaction, to automatically transmit alert messages to senders/replier/administrator when, f.i. a onstraint on delay for reply is not fulfilled.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies automated transmission of alert messages when delay constraints are violated — this is a functional feature. It also implies administrative/operational monitoring/notification capability, so Operability applies. No explicit mentions of availability, fault tolerance, security, legal, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, look & feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall allow the administrator to extract statistics of use, standard delay of reply by member/period, percentage of unsuccessful transaction.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability for the administrator to extract usage statistics and metrics (functional reporting feature). It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, maintainability, performance, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall provide the management of user rights and permissions
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (management of user rights and permissions) — a functional feature — and directly pertains to access control/authorization, which is a security concern. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to define and manage various type of messages already in the drivers smart card holder like predelivery check, stolen/lost cards, renewals, exchanges and duplicates
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability to define and manage types of messages in drivers' smart card holder — this describes functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns (availability, security, performance, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall be able to include new members in the network through simple administrative tasks.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (adding new members) — functional. Phrase 'through simple administrative tasks' indicates ease of administration/management, so operability is relevant. No explicit mentions of performance, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be highly automatic to relieve the users of as many repetitive and tedious tasks as possible.
AI_Rationale: This requirement addresses reducing user effort and automating repetitive tasks, which is a usability/UX concern (ease of use, reduced user burden). It does not explicitly state functional behavior, security, performance, availability, or other categories.

RequirementText: The system shall allow a Member State to ask for the status of card (lost, stolen) to the corresponding Card Issuing Authority of the ember State having issued the card.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow a Member State to request card status from the issuing authority). It does not explicitly state constraints about availability, security, performance, scalability, operability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall facilitate law enforcement inquiries about driver's license status with issuing authorities by driver information or card details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability—facilitating law enforcement inquiries—so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal compliance, privacy, or other quality constraints, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall guide users through an interface based on end user concepts.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system behavior of guiding users through the interface (functional) and emphasizes alignment with end-user concepts—a usability/UX concern. No indication of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be easy to learn and does not obstruct the thematic understanding of the users.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns ease of learning and not obstructing users' thematic understanding, which are usability concerns. It does not mention functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall make it easy to correct mistakes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies ease of correcting mistakes, which is a quality of the user experience (usability). It does not specify functional behavior, security, availability, or other NFRs explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall function reliably, with few or no interruptions in its first operational year and fewer still thereafter.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies reliable operation with few or no interruptions over time, which directly concerns availability and implies fault tolerance/resilience. It does not state functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall give stable and reproducible results.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies reliability/consistency of outputs (stable, reproducible), which aligns with fault tolerance/reliability concerns. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other specific qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to establish and keep the dialog with the Members systems despite the various technical environments and technologies used on their sites
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies maintaining dialogue with members' systems across diverse technical environments. This implies interoperability/portability (PO) and operability/manageability (O). The need to 'establish and keep the dialog' also implies availability/resilience (A). It does not explicitly state security, performance, scalability, or other concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall deliver rapid responses to user requests under 24/7 operation for both internal and enforcement authority use (acceptable response time < 1 minute).
AI_Rationale: Specifies 24/7 operation (availability requirement) and an explicit acceptable response time (<1 minute) — a performance requirement. No explicit mention of security, scalability, fault tolerance, usability, portability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, legal, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The client will send a GET request to the Web API with the question as a URL parameter.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional interaction/behavior (client sends a GET request with the question as a URL parameter) describing what the system should do. It does not mention availability, security, performance, portability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The client will specify the header Content-Type: application/json in their requests as convention.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a required request header/format (client behavior), which is a functional interface requirement. It does not state availability, security, performance, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: An API query shall be a single URL parameter formulated as a single, clear question in standard English.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies how the API must accept queries (input format: single URL parameter containing a single clear question) which is a functional constraint (F). It also mandates use of 'standard English' and 'clear' verbiage, which pertains to wording/ presentation and user comprehension, matching Look & Feel (LF) and Usability (US). No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal concerns are stated.

RequirementText: The client will be able to parse the JSON and determine if there was an error.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the client must perform (parse JSON and detect errors), which is functional behavior rather than a non-functional constraint.

RequirementText: The server will send all API data in JSON response documents with the header Content-Type: application/json.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior/API contract (response format and header), so it's primarily functional. Also relates to operability/interoperability (how clients interact with the server), hence O=1. No explicit availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The server will respond with a 200 OK status code if a request has the header Content-Type: application/json and is a valid API query.
AI_Rationale: Specifies concrete system behavior in response to requests (status code returned based on header and validity) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects are indicated.

RequirementText: The server will respond with a 400 Bad Request status code if request does not specify the header Content-Type: application/json OR is a malformed API query.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies concrete system behavior for handling invalid requests (respond with 400 Bad Request), so it is functional. It also specifies error-handling behavior for malformed input, which aligns with fault-tolerance/robustness, so FT is set. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns are stated.

RequirementText: This unit will receive a text string from the URL parameter.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the unit shall receive a text string from a URL parameter. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: This unit will output the sentence as a string,
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: unit will output a sentence as a string. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The information extraction unit shall populate the database before system startup to ensure immediate data accessibility.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (populate the database before startup) — functional. It explicitly aims to ensure immediate data accessibility, which refers to availability/accessibility, so Availability is applicable. No explicit mention of fault tolerance, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Text box will originally contain a suggestive text question, to guide the user to the format of an appropriate question.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI behavior (pre-filled suggestive text) — a functional requirement. It pertains to interface presentation and guiding users, implying Look & Feel and Usability concerns; no indication of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The chat window will contain all questions and answers from the current session, with a scroll bar if all messages can't fit on the screen.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (chat window must contain all session Q&A) and includes UI presentation detail (scroll bar if messages don't fit), so classify as Functional and Look & Feel. No explicit availability, performance, security, etc., requirements are stated.

RequirementText: There will be a designated phone number that users can send texts to.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (providing a designated phone number for users to send texts), which is a functional requirement. No qualities like availability, security, or usability are specified.

RequirementText: The overall accuracy of the Web API's response will be measured using a developer-made testing set.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the API's accuracy will be measured using a developer-made testing set, which pertains to testability and verification practices (a maintainability concern). It does not state functional behavior, performance, availability, security, or other specific NFRs.

RequirementText: The overall accuracy will be calculated by dividing the total number of correct answers by the number of questions asked.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system should compute a metric (overall accuracy) — a functional requirement defining required behavior (calculation).

RequirementText: Drexel staff's office locations, contact information, and positions will have accuracy greater than 70%.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a data accuracy constraint (staff office locations, contact info, positions >70% accurate). There is no functional behavior requested, nor availability/performance/portability aspects. The closest matching category in the provided taxonomy is Security (data integrity/accuracy), so SE is set. Labels are kept conservative per instructions.

RequirementText: On-campus dining locations, hours, food types, etc. will have accuracy greater than 50%.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a requirement on the accuracy of information the system provides about dining locations (locations, hours, food types). While primarily a quality constraint (data accuracy), it pertains to the system's provided functionality (information about on-campus dining), so marked as Functional. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, legal, etc., requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Official events listed on Drexel website, location and hours will have accuracy greater than 40%.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a content accuracy target for event listings (location and hours). This is a quality-of-information constraint affecting user trust and usefulness (usability). It does not describe availability, performance, security, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: The average time for the server to respond will be less than or equal to 2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a timing constraint on server response (average ≤ 2 seconds), which is a performance requirement. Does not mention availability, scalability, security, usability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The display shall have two regions, left 2/3 of the display is graphical right 1/3 of the display is a data table
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the visual layout of the display (region proportions and content types), which is a look-and-feel/user-interface presentation constraint rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The data displayed in both the nodes of the graph and the rows of the table will be MSEL Summary data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what data should be displayed in graph nodes and table rows (functional behavior). No quality attributes like performance, security, usability, or appearance are implied.

RequirementText: The application shall match the color of the schema set forth by Department of Homeland Security.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates adherence to DHS color schema (legal/compliance constraint) and concerns visual appearance (look & feel). No functional, performance, security, etc., aspects implied.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure that projected Event/Activity data is readable by 90% of viewers on a 10x10 projection screen from a 30-foot viewing distance.
AI_Rationale: Specifies visual presentation/readability on a projection screen (look & feel) and a usability accessibility metric (90% of viewers can read), not functional, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall achieve 99% availability during the first six months of operation, excluding non-business hours.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative uptime target (99% availability) for an operational period; clearly an availability requirement. No other quality or functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall present projected data on a 10x10 screen such that 90% of viewers at 100 feet can identify ongoing Events or Activities.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual presentation/readability on a projection screen and viewer identification rates — concerns look & feel (visual clarity) and usability (ability of viewers to understand/identify events). No explicit functional behavior beyond presentation nor other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The product shall implement access control to distinguish between authorized and unauthorized users in all access attempts.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies implementing access control (a functional behavior) and is explicitly a security requirement about distinguishing authorized vs unauthorized users; no other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be intuitive enough for 90% of new users to start displaying Events or Activities within 90 minutes of initial use.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an ease-of-use/intuitiveness target (90% of new users can perform a task within 90 minutes), which is a usability (US) non-functional requirement. It does not specify functional details, performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user interface shall have standard menus buttons for navigation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies appearance/layout of the UI (standard menu buttons) — a look & feel requirement. Does not explicitly state usability, functional behavior, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall have a professional appearance.
AI_Rationale: Statement concerns the visual/professional appearance of the system, which maps to Look & Feel (LF). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The product shall produce search results in an acceptable time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (produce search results) together with a performance/response-time constraint ('acceptable time'), so F and PE apply. No indication of availability, security, portability, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The search results shall be returned no later 30 seconds after the user has entered the search criteria.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement (search results returned) with a quantitative timing constraint (response time ≤ 30 seconds), indicating performance requirement.

RequirementText: The product shall be available for use 24 hours per day 365 days per year.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies continuous availability (24/7/365), which maps directly to Availability. It does not mention functionality, performance, security, or other quality attributes, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: The system will achieve a future uptime of 99.9%, meaning it will be available for 999 out of every 1,000 access attempts.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative availability/uptime requirement (99.9%). No mention of functionality, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall be able to support multiple remote users.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (support multiple remote users). It does not quantify scalability, availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes, so only the Functional label is assigned.

RequirementText: The system shall scale to accommodate the existing 1,000 users and a projected 5x growth within the next year.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns the system's capacity to handle current and projected user load (scalability). It also implies performance considerations (throughput/ability to serve more users), so SC and PE are set to true. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: 90% of untrained realtors shall be able to install the product on their device without printed instructions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that 90% of untrained users (realtors) must be able to install the product without printed instructions, which is a usability/learnability metric. It does not address functionality, performance, security, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The system shall be compatible with Windows CE and Palm operating systems.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compatibility with specific operating systems, which concerns portability across platforms. It does not state operational/administrative constraints or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall allow a real estate agent to query MLS information.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall allow a real estate agent to query MLS information; it does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to get driving directions to a selected property.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (getting driving directions), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to download appointments and contact information for clients.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (download appointments and contact information) which is a functional requirement; no quality/constraint aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall display clear property images in the search results.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior (display images in search results). While 'clear' touches visual quality, the example maps this to Functional only; no explicit non-functional quality categories are mandated.

RequirementText: The system shall update or create new property listings in the MLS.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (update or create property listings in the MLS) which is functional behavior; no quality/constraint aspects (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Realtor shall be able to generate a CMA report based on property criteria.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (generating a CMA report based on property criteria). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to call the seller or buyer to schedule an appointment.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability/behavior (making a call to schedule an appointment), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The realtor shall be notified of new client appointments after automatic synchronization with office system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a behavior: realtor must be notified after automatic synchronization with office system. This is a functional requirement describing system action (notification) and sequence (after sync); no explicit non-functional quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The realtor shall be able to retrieve a map showing property locations for a specified area.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (realtor can retrieve a map with property locations for a specified area). No quality/ non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall notify the realtor when a seller or buyer responds to an appointment request.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional behavior (notification to realtor when a buyer/seller responds). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to handle all of the user requests/usage during business hours.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system must handle all user requests during business hours — implies availability and ability to scale to load (scalability). Does not mention performance metrics, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall interface with CampusConnect’s central server.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies an interface to an external central server, which is an operability/integration concern (matches provided examples labeled O). No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be interoperable with any HTML browser.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies interoperability with any HTML browser, which pertains to operability (manageability/interaction) and portability/compatibility across client platforms. It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Only authorized users shall have access to students personal information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control constraint restricting access to authorized users, which is a security requirement (auth/authz). No indication of availability, performance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Dr Susan Poslusny and Dr Julie Donalek are the only people who shall have access to students personal information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access restriction to student personal information (access control), which is a security requirement (authorization/confidentiality). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Dr Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol are the only people who shall have access to the final class section scheduling for the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies restrictive access control (who shall have access), which is a security requirement concerning authorization/confidentiality. It does not describe functionality, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall protect private information in accordance with the organizations information policy.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates protection of private information per organization policy — implies security concerns (SE) and compliance/legal alignment with policy (L). It's a functional obligation (F) to perform protection. No explicit availability, performance, usability, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: The system shall use the organizations standard virus protection software to help monitor threats to itself.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of standard virus protection to monitor threats — a security control (anti-malware). No availability, performance, usability, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a single student to a cohort.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users shall be able to add a student to a cohort). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Students added to a cohort shall be eligible for the cohort’s Program of Study.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional rule/constraint about student eligibility when added to a cohort (what the system should enforce). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: For each class within a sequence for a cohort Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability for user roles (Program Administrators and Nursing Staff) to perform an action (assign quarter for classes) — this is a functional requirement.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes to a sequence of classes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a functional capability: specific user roles shall be able to add new classes to a sequence. No quality/constraint aspects (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (allowing Program Administrators and Nursing Staff to add clinical classes/sections to a sequence), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes for the nursing department into the system.'
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users shall be able to add new classes). It describes what the system should do and does not mention non-functional qualities such as performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (ability for Program Administrators and Nursing Staff to specify required classes for a Program of Study). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts of all programs for Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members’ planning purposes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability to display a report for program administrators/nursing staff — a clear functional behavior. It does not state non-functional concerns (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical sites which will include information on labs being held at that site for the given quarter.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: displaying a printable summary for clinical sites with lab information for a quarter. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort’s program of study and changes to a given week’s schedule.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (notification of affected parties when cohort-related changes occur). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting specific students including but not limited to changing a student’s status from full time to part time and moving a student to a different clinical section.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must notify affected parties when student-related changes occur. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure that all screens created for the Disputes application adhere to the corporate interface creation standards.
AI_Rationale: Requires compliance with corporate interface creation standards (legal/policy) and pertains to the appearance/layout of screens (look & feel). No mention of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The list of dispute cases after a search shall be able to be color-coded for easy status identification.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies color-coding of a displayed list for status identification, which is a presentation/look-and-feel concern. It does not mandate the functional provision of the list itself nor operational, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: 100% of the card member and merchant services representatives shall use the Disputes application regularly after a 2-day training course.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that 100% of specified users will use the application regularly after training—implies usability (users able to use after training) and scalability (coverage/percentage of user population). No functional, security, performance, etc., requirements are stated.

RequirementText: 100% of card member services representatives shall be able to successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that all representatives must be able to perform a task after training, which targets usability (learnability/effectiveness) and a coverage/scale metric (100% of reps) consistent with scalability in provided examples. No security, performance, availability, legal, or other qualities are implied.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall be available 24x7x365 with the exception of the following scheduled maintenance windows. Monday – Saturday 3:00am to 4:00am EST Sunday 1:00amd to 5:00am EST.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies uptime/availability (24x7x365 with defined maintenance windows), so Availability is applicable. It also refers to scheduled maintenance windows which relates to operational/admin aspects (operability). No functional behavior, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: To resolve disputes, the Disputes application will rely solely on transaction details retrieved from the Statement Database.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies an operational integration constraint (the Disputes application must rely solely on transaction details from the Statement Database). This aligns with operability/interaction concerns (like the provided similar examples labeled O). It does not state performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall retrieve all cardmember details directly from the Cardmember Information Database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the Disputes application must retrieve cardmember details from the Cardmember Information Database — an interface/operational integration constraint. This matches operability (system interfacing/interaction) rather than other qualities.

RequirementText: Disputes applications shall retrieve all merchant details directly from the Merchant Information Database for a more streamlined process.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the Disputes application must retrieve merchant details directly from the Merchant Information Database—this describes how the system should operate/which interface/source to use (operability). It does not specify performance, security, availability, legal, UI, portability, scalability, maintainability, or general functional behavior beyond the operational integration, so only Operability is marked.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall send all letter requests for dispute initiation and follow up to the Print Letter Utility via an interface with the Letters application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an operational integration: the Disputes application must send letter requests to the Print Letter Utility via an interface with the Letters application, which concerns system operability/interaction rather than functional business behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Disputes application shall integrate with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System to directly request account adjustments.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an interface/integration with another system to request account adjustments, which is an operability/interaction concern. It does not state performance, availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints, nor detailed functional behavior beyond the integration, so only O is set.

RequirementText: Users shall only be able to initiate dispute requests if they have Update access.
AI_Rationale: This requirement restricts the ability to perform a function (initiating dispute requests) to users with Update access — a functional behavior with an access-control constraint. It therefore reflects both functional and security (authorization) concerns.

RequirementText: All authenticated authorized users shall be granted access to the Disputes System.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication/authorization access control to the Disputes System (access restriction), which is a security requirement.

RequirementText: To ensure audit trails, the Disputes System shall generate reports detailing new user additions and access level changes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior to generate audit reports about user additions and access-level changes; this is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state security, availability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: All additions of new users and modifications to user’s access shall be recorded on the User Report.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: the system must record user additions and access modifications in a User Report. It describes what the system should do (generate/record entries) and does not explicitly impose availability, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: A revoked user account shall only be re-instantiated by the System Administrator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies who is authorized to re-instantiate revoked accounts, i.e., an access control/authorization requirement. No indication of other qualities (performance, availability, etc.).

RequirementText: Only the System Administrator shall be able to reset a revoked user logon account.
AI_Rationale: Specifies who is authorized to perform an operation (resetting revoked accounts), which is an access control/security requirement. No availability, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manipulate and view business data within the Disputes application.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (view and manipulate business data) within the Disputes application — a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (security, performance, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that all updates to data files or databases are initiated from the Disputes System.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system constraint that updates to data must be initiated from the Disputes System, which is a functional behavior (enforcing update source) and primarily a security/integrity control to prevent unauthorized direct access to data. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, usability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance concerns are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the Disputes System, which must conform to legal requirements specified by the Merchant Operating Regulations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement includes a functional element ('User shall be able to access the Disputes System') and explicitly states conformance to legal requirements (Merchant Operating Regulations), so label L and F apply. No other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that all business rules specified in the Disputes System comply with Merchant Operating Regulations.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly states compliance with Merchant Operating Regulations, which is a legal/regulatory requirement. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the Disputes System, which must also conform to legal requirements specified by Regulation E and Regulation Z governing credit card disputes processing.
AI_Rationale: The requirement contains a functional statement ('User shall be able to access the Disputes System') and a legal constraint (must conform to Regulation E and Regulation Z). No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that all business rules specified in the Disputes System comply with the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates compliance with Regulation E and Regulation Z, which are legal/regulatory constraints. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: User shall have access to a detailed history of every action taken on a dispute case, ensuring a complete audit trail.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability to access a detailed history (functional). Mention of a complete audit trail implies compliance/auditing concerns (legal). It does not explicitly mention security, availability, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall record all actions that modify an existing dispute case in the case history.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: recording actions that modify a dispute case in the case history (audit trail). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, legal/compliance, maintainability, security, or other quality attributes, so those are set to false.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the Disputes System, which must be accessible to both internal and external users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must be accessible to both internal and external users — implies availability requirements and access control (security/authorization). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall prevent users from accessing dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (prevent unauthorized access to dispute cases), which is a security concern (authentication/authorization). It does not specify functional behavior beyond security, nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to initiate a dispute case and perform follow-up actions in real-time via the Disputes System.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (users can initiate and follow up on disputes). The mention of 'real-time' implies a performance/latency quality constraint, so PE is marked. No explicit availability, security, scalability, usability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: System shall provide different levels of access for dispute case initiation and follow-up actions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies role-based/differentiated access for initiating and following up disputes, which is an access control/security concern (authentication/authorization). It does not state functional workflow details or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have view access capability for authorized users within the Disputes System.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control for authorized users (view access) which is a security requirement (authentication/authorization). It does not specify availability, performance, UI look-and-feel, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have update access capability for authorized users within the Disputes System.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an update-access capability (a functional behavior) restricted to authorized users, which implies access control/authorization (security). No mention of availability, performance, scalability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to select disputable transactions and initiate disputes on them based on the age of the transaction.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user capability (select disputable transactions and initiate disputes) which is functional behavior. No non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: System shall allow the user to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions belonging to a single merchant.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior (ability to initiate a single dispute for multiple transactions for one merchant), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall have the ability to create or initiate ticket retrieval requests within the Disputes System.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (creating/initiating ticket retrieval requests), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall prompt the user to enter all required information for creating a ticket retrieval request.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (prompting user to enter required information) for creating a ticket retrieval request; no non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall prevent external users from requesting original receipts, restricting this action to internal users.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (prevent external users from requesting original receipts) so it's functional. It also describes access restriction based on user type, which is an access control/security concern, so Security is applicable. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a ticket retrieval request, including the dispute case number, type of retrieval requested, and due date for the merchant response.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (providing a confirmation with specific information) which is functional. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall allow users to create chargeback requests, prompting for required information and resulting in printed notifications sent to merchants if proof of disputed transactions is not provided.
AI_Rationale: Specifies actions the system must perform (create chargeback requests, prompt for information, produce printed notifications). No availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide confirmation upon chargeback request creation, containing dispute case number, type of chargeback requested, and merchant response due date.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must provide a confirmation with specific contents upon creation of a chargeback request. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall prevent creation of duplicate dispute requests.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (prevent creation of duplicate disputes) so it is functional (F). It also has implications for maintainability (MN) since deduplication affects data integrity and system design/maintenance. It may be driven by regulatory or legal requirements to avoid duplicate records (as in similar examples), so Legal (L) is marked. No explicit mention of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, operability, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for transactions based on transaction type and merchant industry.
AI_Rationale: Primarily a functional requirement (system shall provide a list of reason codes based on transaction type and merchant industry). Labeled as Legal because the mapping to industry and reason codes often implies compliance with rules/regulations or business rules (as in the similar example). Labeled Maintainability because the requirement’s dependence on business rules and mappings implies the need to manage/update those rules/code easily (maintenance concerns). Other quality attributes are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide viewing capability for existing dispute cases.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (viewing existing dispute cases), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The Disputes System must provide Search functionality allowing search by dispute case number, merchant account number, cardmember account number, and issuer number, with filtering options by date range, dispute type, case status, and reason code.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system functionality (search by specific fields and filters), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: A list of disputes meeting search criteria must be provided, differentiating by color-coded status.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates providing a list of disputes meeting search criteria (functional behavior) and specifies differentiation by color-coded status, which is a presentation/look-and-feel requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects like performance, security, availability, or usability are stated.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall provide users with the ability to view the history of all activities on dispute cases.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (view history of activities on dispute cases). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Dispute System shall enable users to follow up on dispute cases, filtering follow-up actions by case status and user access level.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (enabling follow-up actions and filtering) — functional. It also specifies filtering based on user access level, which implies authorization control (security).

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall record user names and dates for all case-related activities, maintaining detailed audit history.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must perform (record user names/dates and maintain audit history), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal compliance, performance, or other quality constraints, so no additional NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: For any systematic action, such as disputes aging process, a case activity will be generated, and the user who initiated the dispute case must be notified upon next logon.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: generate case activity for systematic actions and notify the initiating user on next logon. This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional qualities are stated.

RequirementText: All letter requests must adhere to formatting guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates adherence to specified formatting (functional constraint) and concerns presentation/format (look & feel). Inclusion of system-specified guidelines implies a compliance/standards constraint (labeled as Legal in similar example). No indication of performance, availability, security, etc.

RequirementText: Any disputes cases closed for over 6 months must be purged from the online disputes database.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a required system action (automatic purging of records older than 6 months), i.e., functional behavior. It does not explicitly address availability, legal, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The product shall interface with the Choice Parts System, providing the feed of recycled parts data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an external system interface/integration (providing a data feed). Such statements are classified as operability/operational integration concerns in the provided examples. It does not state performance, availability, security, portability, or UI/functional behavior beyond the integration, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: The product shall run on existing hardware for all environments.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the product must run on existing hardware across environments, which maps to portability/compatibility requirements. No mention of availability, performance, security, operability, etc.

RequirementText: The product shall adhere to corporate Architecture guidelines.
AI_Rationale: Statement requires adherence to corporate Architecture guidelines, which is a compliance/legal constraint. It does not explicitly mention other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall comply with corporate User Interface Guidelines.
AI_Rationale: Refers to complying with corporate User Interface Guidelines, which is a standards/legal/compliance requirement and specifically concerns look-and-feel of the UI. No indications of functionality, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The product shall comply with corporate color scheme.
AI_Rationale: Specifies compliance with corporate color scheme—a branding/legal guideline and a UI appearance requirement, so Legal and Look & Feel apply. No functional, performance, security, or other quality aspects implied.

RequirementText: Professional appearance of the product is required.
AI_Rationale: This requirement addresses the visual/professional appearance of the product, which maps to Look & Feel. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product must be user-friendly, with 95% of Adjusters and Collision Estimators finding it easy to use.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states a usability goal (95% of users find it easy to use). This maps directly to Usability (US). It does not mention functionality, performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product should enhance the productivity of Collision Estimators, with 80% agreeing their productivity has increased within one month.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that users (Collision Estimators) perceive increased productivity (80% agreement within one month), which is a usability/user satisfaction metric rather than a functional or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: User satisfaction with the product is targeted at 85%.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a target for user satisfaction (85%), which is a usability/UX quality metric. It does not mention functionality, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The product must be easily learnable within two days of onsite training for Adjusters and Collision Estimators.
AI_Rationale: Specifies learnability target (training time for Adjusters and Collision Estimators), which is a usability quality attribute (learnability). No other quality attributes or functional behavior are implied.

RequirementText: User help resources should be accessible within 90% of the system.
