AI_Rationale: Specifies accessibility of user help across 90% of the system, which pertains to usability and look-and-feel (help placement/availability). No functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The search for recycled parts must be completed within 15 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a time bound for completing a search (<=15 seconds), which is a performance/response-time constraint. It does not specify functional behavior, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The search for the preferred repair facility should be completed within 8 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a timing constraint (search must complete within 8 seconds), which is a performance-related non-functional requirement. It does not describe functional behavior beyond the performance constraint nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The recycled parts audit report must be returned within 10 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional outcome (returning the recycled parts audit report) with a performance constraint (must be returned within 10 seconds). No indication of availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Preferred repair facility ratings should be saved within 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that preferred repair facility ratings must be saved (functional) and adds a timing constraint of 5 seconds (performance). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The average number of recycled parts records per day shall be 50,000.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an expected average daily volume of records (capacity/throughput), which is a scalability requirement rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall be able to handle 10,000 concurrent users within 2 years of the initial launch.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity for concurrent users (growth target within 2 years), which is a scalability requirement. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: For estimators, the product shall be able to be operated in a repair facility during dirty and noisy conditions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies operating conditions in a repair facility (dirty and noisy), which concerns operability/manageability of the product in that environment rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Only adjusters can request recycled parts audit reports.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that only users with the adjuster role may request recycled parts audit reports — a functional access-control requirement (what the system must enforce) and a security/authorization constraint.

RequirementText: Only adjusters with a supervisor role can update preferred repair facility ratings.
AI_Rationale: Specifies who is allowed to perform an action (update ratings) — a functional requirement with an access-control/authorization constraint, so both Functional and Security apply.

RequirementText: One insurance company shall not be able to view another insurance company's claim data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access restrictions between companies' claim data — clearly about confidentiality/authorization controls (security). It does not specify availability, performance, legal compliance, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The product shall be free of computer viruses.
AI_Rationale: Being free of computer viruses is a security requirement addressing confidentiality/integrity and protection against malware; it does not explicitly state other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall prevent malicious attacks, including denial of service.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly addresses preventing malicious attacks (including denial of service), which is a security concern. While DoS relates to availability, the statement is framed as preventing attacks—thus primarily a security requirement. No other quality attributes are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall search for the preferred repair facility using vehicle location and radius in miles.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (search for repair facility by vehicle location and radius), which is a functional requirement. No quality constraints (performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The vehicle data shall include vehicle year, make, and model.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what data the system must include (vehicle year, make, model), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The vehicle location shall include street address, city, state, and zipcode.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required data elements for vehicle location (street, city, state, zipcode), which is a functional data/content requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall resolve the zipcode for the street address, city, and state if zipcode is unknown.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must determine (resolve) a zipcode from address components when the zipcode is missing. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The search radius shall be between 1 and 30 miles.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint on the search feature (valid range for the search radius). It defines what the system should enforce, not a quality attribute like performance or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall locate the preferred repair facility with the highest ratings for the input criteria.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (locate the preferred repair facility with highest ratings for given criteria), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The adjuster shall be able to override the preferred repair facility on the estimate assignment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/behavior the system must provide (adjuster can override a field on an assignment). No quality/constraint aspects are mentioned, so only Functional.

RequirementText: The estimator shall search by zipcode with a radius of 30 miles if no parts are found for the preferred parts suppliers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior of the estimator (search by zipcode within 30 miles if no parts found from preferred suppliers). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The audit report shall include the percentage of available recycled parts used in the estimate.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a specific piece of information the audit report must contain (percentage of recycled parts), which is a functional requirement; it does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality concerns.

RequirementText: The audit report shall include the total score of the audit which sums the individual line items.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional report content (include total score summing line items). It does not state availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The user shall enter new ratings based on the audit report.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action/functional behavior (enter new ratings). No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The ratings shall be from a scale of 1-10.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional constraint on the ratings data (the scale). No availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The ratings shall include categories for attempted use of recycled parts and actual use of recycled parts.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional behavior: ratings must include specific categories (attempted and actual use of recycled parts). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The product’s Look and Feel shall be able to incorporate aspects of the customer’s organization such as logo branding and identity.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns the product's Look and Feel and incorporation of customer branding (logos, identity). This is a UI aesthetic requirement; no other quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: An employee will be able to successfully use the product within a few minutes.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies ease and speed of use (learnability/usability): users (employees) can successfully use the product within minutes. This is a usability non-functional requirement; no functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The response shall be fast enough to avoid interrupting the user’s flow of thought. 90% of tasks shall complete within 5 seconds. 98% of tasks shall complete within 8 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies quantitative response-time targets (percentiles and seconds) about task completion—this is a performance requirement.

RequirementText: Aside from server failure the software product shall achieve 99.99% up time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a target uptime/availability metric (99.99%) excluding server failure — clearly an availability requirement.

RequirementText: The product shall be capable of handling up to 1000 concurrent requests.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity for concurrent requests (ability to handle increased load), which is a scalability requirement. It does not explicitly state performance metrics like latency or throughput, nor other qualities.

RequirementText: The concurrency capacity must be able to handle peak scheduling times such as early morning and late afternoon hours.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies handling increased concurrency during peak times—concerns system scalability to support higher load. It does not explicitly mention performance metrics (latency/throughput), availability targets, or other qualities, so only SC is set.

RequirementText: The product shall be able to process 10,000 transactions per hour within two years of its launch.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a throughput requirement (10,000 transactions/hour) which is a performance metric, and a growth/capacity target within two years which implies scalability. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: When creating a new session, the session creator shall assign one or more moderators.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: during session creation the creator must assign one or more moderators. It does not state any quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.).

RequirementText: When creating a new session, the session creator shall assign the session a name.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: session creator must assign a name when creating a session. No quality/constraint attributes (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: When creating a new session, the session creator shall create a problem description.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior/workflow constraint: when creating a session, the creator must create a problem description. It does not state non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: When creating a new session, the session creator shall be able to set an open and close time and date.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the session creator must be able to set open and close date/time when creating a session. No quality, non-functional, or other constraints are implied.

RequirementText: When creating a new session, the session creator shall be able to toggle whether the session is secure or not.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the session creator must be able to toggle a session's secure/non-secure state. It does not define availability, fault tolerance, security controls, UI appearance, or other non-functional qualities explicitly, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: A moderator shall be able to edit a previously created session.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (moderator can edit a session) — a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The session shall conclude after the specified amount of time has passed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (session termination after specified time) — functional. Also implies a security control (session timeout) to limit unauthorized access, so marked as Security. No explicit availability, performance, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: The session shall conclude if a specified amount of ideas has been generated.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (ending a session when a specified number of ideas is generated), which is functional in nature. It does not address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The moderator shall be able to close a session at any time.
AI_Rationale: This is a capability requirement specifying that the moderator can perform an action (closing a session). 'At any time' here qualifies the functional permission rather than stating system availability or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The moderator shall be able to open a closed session.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/action (moderator can open a closed session), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: A moderator shall be able to assign the maximum number of participants to a session.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (a moderator can assign the maximum number of participants to a session), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly constrain availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: All sessions shall be able to have multiple moderators.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (sessions can have multiple moderators). It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Session creators and moderators shall be able to import data from previously closed sessions into a currently open session.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (session creators and moderators can import data from closed sessions into an open session), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: All sessions shall be associated with a single EDGE project.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a structural/functional constraint (each session must be linked to one EDGE project). It does not mention availability, performance, security, legal, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The moderator shall be able to specify a time warning until the current phase is completed.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability: a moderator user action to specify a time warning. It does not state non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.).

RequirementText: The moderator shall be able to view a session management screen.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that a moderator must be able to view a session management screen. It does not specify quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: The users shall be able to add/edit/remove their own ideas.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities (create, edit, delete) for users' ideas; no quality/constraint aspects like performance, security, usability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall inform the user if they have reached their limit of created nodes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (informing the user when they reach a node-creation limit), which is a functional capability. It does not explicitly specify non-functional qualities such as availability, security, usability, or performance.

RequirementText: A Moderator shall be able to limit the number of nodes that an individual user can create.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (a Moderator must be able to set limits on nodes per user) — a functional requirement. It also describes an administrative/management capability (ability for moderators to control user quotas), which relates to operability. It does not explicitly state security, performance, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A Moderator shall be able to limit the maximum number of nodes that can be created in a session.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (a Moderator shall be able to limit...) — this is a functional feature. It also implies administrative/operational control (manageability of sessions), so Operability applies. No explicit constraints about performance, availability, security, scalability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: All user created nodes shall be filtered for profanity and removed if any exists.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a processing action: filter user-created nodes for profanity and remove them if detected. This describes system behavior (functional). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: A Moderator shall be able to specify a warning for total ideas remaining.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability (a Moderator can specify a warning) which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, usability or other quality constraints are implied.

RequirementText: A Moderator shall be able to specify a warning for total time remaining.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a user capability (Moderator shall be able to specify a warning) which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Users shall be verified upon logging in LDAP.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that users must be verified using LDAP on login — this is an authentication requirement (security). It also describes a system behavior (verify users), so it's functional as well.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to select a session based on the FACET and the tool they wish to use.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability the system must provide (allow users to select a session filtered by FACET and tool)—a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The moderator shall be able to set a warning time to email users how many minutes are left in the current session.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a moderator capability (setting a warning time and emailing users). It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, security, portability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The screen shall allow the moderator to filter/sort/view/edit/close sessions.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific user-facing capabilities (filter/sort/view/edit/close sessions) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability) are stated.

RequirementText: Secure sessions will require users to have been guest members before logging in.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a login precondition (functional behavior) that enforces a security-related constraint (only users who were guest members can establish secure sessions), so it is both functional and security-related.

RequirementText: A moderator shall be able to enter in teasers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability ('moderator shall be able to enter in teasers'), i.e., a functional behavior (content-entry feature). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Teasers shall be tracked in the database the same as ideas are tracked.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior—teasers must be tracked in the database in the same manner as ideas. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Each idea shall be listed on its own line in a numbered list in the idea phase.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement to list each idea on its own line in a numbered list (what the system should do). Also prescribes presentation/formatting (numbered list, one per line), which is a look-and-feel/UI requirement. No indications of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: By default, the page shall not auto scroll when new ideas are added into the list.
AI_Rationale: Specifies default UI behavior (page scrolling) which affects look-and-feel and user experience (usability). Does not address performance, security, availability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: There shall be a setting to allow new ideas to be added to the top of the list.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional feature (a setting to control where new ideas are placed) and implies a UI/presentation concern about placement in the list (look & feel). It does not address availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or explicit usability/accessibility metrics.

RequirementText: Only a moderator shall be able to group ideas and specify a name for the group.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (group ideas and name the group) and restricts it to a role (only a moderator), which is an access-control/security requirement. No indications of availability, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to flag inappropriate content.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a capability users must have (ability to flag content). It does not specify availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Flagged ideas shall go to a separate moderator page for resolution.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional behavior: flagged ideas must be routed/displayed on a separate moderator page for resolution. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The moderator shall be able to remove/edit any ideas during the idea and grouping phases.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a moderator capability (remove/edit ideas) during specific phases — a functional requirement. No quality attributes such as availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: Voters shall not be aware of multiplicity in ideas.
AI_Rationale: The requirement constrains how information is presented to voters (hiding multiplicity of ideas), which pertains to presentation and user experience. This implies Look & Feel and Usability concerns. It does not explicitly state functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The moderator shall be able to view all grouped ideas, including duplicates.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (moderator can view grouped ideas, including duplicates) which is a functional requirement; no explicit quality attributes (security, performance, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The idea field shall be limited to a maximum of 250 characters to match the current EDGE system limitation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete behavior/constraint of the system (input field character limit), which is a functional requirement (validation/field definition). It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: Moderators shall be able to combine groups with other groups.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability (moderators can combine groups), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Moderators shall be able to remove groups.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability (moderators can remove groups), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A Moderator shall be able to assign a number of votes for participants.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability: a Moderator must be able to assign votes to participants. No quality/constraint about performance, security, availability, etc., is specified.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to vote for any individual idea or an idea group.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (users can vote for an idea or idea group). It does not specify usability, availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The displayed number of total ideas shall be updated frequently.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a timeliness/freshness constraint (how often the displayed total is updated), which is a performance-related non-functional concern rather than a functional feature or other NFR category.

RequirementText: The Moderator shall know who has not finished casting their votes.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behaviour: the system must provide moderators with information about which users have not completed voting. It does not state non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.).

RequirementText: The Moderator shall be able to send an email to warn users that the session is about to close.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (Moderator can send an email warning users), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, portability, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The Disputes System shall preserve user phases even when moderators revert to a previous phase.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior—preserving user phases despite moderators reverting to a previous phase—so it's functional. It also implies resilience to conflicting actions/changes (tolerance to such faults), so fault tolerance is applicable. No explicit availability, security, usability, or other NFRs are mentioned.

RequirementText: All Users will be able to view the next product by swiping left to right.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (describes how users can view the next product via a swipe gesture). It also implies a usability/UX concern (interaction method for users), so Usability is marked. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints are stated. Look & Feel was not marked because the statement specifies behavior/interaction rather than visual appearance.

RequirementText: All users shall be able to navigate to the Catalogue using the sub navigation icons.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that users must be able to navigate to the Catalogue via sub-navigation icons — this describes required system behavior (functional) and is primarily about ease of use / user interaction (usability). It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The ride coordination system shall prioritize a user-friendly, secure, and reliable experience.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly calls for 'user-friendly' (usability) and 'secure' (security). 'Reliable' implies system availability/reliability, so Availability is marked. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes explicitly, and does not explicitly require fault-tolerance, so FT is left false.

RequirementText: The carpool system shall allow users to define their availability and automatically assign them as drivers based on pre-determined criteria.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes system functionality: users define availability and the system automatically assigns drivers based on criteria. It specifies behavior, not quality attributes like performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall integrate with Google Maps to provide location and travel time details.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability—integrating with Google Maps to provide location and travel time details. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects such as availability, performance, security, portability, or usability.

RequirementText: The application shall maintain a list of classes for the user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (maintain a list of classes for the user). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to add a class to a list of classes in which they are enrolled.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can add a class to their enrolled classes). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to remove classes from the list of classes in which they are enrolled.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (removing classes from their enrollment list), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to completely reset their lists of classes and assignments.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability (reset lists of classes and assignments), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to authenticate to the application using their Radford University username and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication using Radford University username/password, which is an access control/security requirement. It does not state functional behavior beyond authentication implementation details, nor does it mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The application shall be able to automatically download the class schedule of authenticated users.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a system behavior (automatic download of class schedules) which is functional. It also restricts this to authenticated users, implying authentication/authorization concerns (security). No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to view their list of classes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (view their list of classes), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The app shall maintain a list of assignments associated with each class in the list of classes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the app shall maintain (store/manage) a list of assignments per class. No quality/constraint attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to add an assignment to a list of assignments.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (adding an assignment to a list), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to edit assignments in their list of assignments.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (users can edit assignments). It does not state quality attributes such as usability, performance, security, etc., so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to remove an assignment from their list of assignments.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action (removing an assignment) which is functional behavior. No quality constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to clear all assignments for a particular class.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to clear all assignments for a class), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to set the name of an assignment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (setting the name of an assignment), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to set the description of an assignment.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying a user capability (setting an assignment description). It does not imply availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to set the due date of an assignment.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (setting a due date) — a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to set the class which an assignment belongs to.
AI_Rationale: This describes a user capability (setting an assignment's class), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to set notification parameters for an assignment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (setting notification parameters), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to view their list of assignments ordered by due date.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (view list of assignments with ordering by due date), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to view their list of assignments grouped by class.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (view assignments grouped by class), which is functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to view the detailed attributes of a single assignment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (view detailed attributes of an assignment), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The application shall be able to notify the user when an assignment is close to its due date.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (notifying users when an assignment is near its due date), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A server shall host the Foodie App and provide system data processing and storage capability.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (hosting the app and providing data processing and storage), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, operability, security, scalability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: A surface app page shall provide a customer with all customer system functionality.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying that a surface app page must provide customers with all customer-system functionality (F). Because it prescribes what the page must provide (a UI/page-level requirement), it also implies a user-interface/layout concern rather than performance, security, or other qualities, so Look & Feel (LF) is marked. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: An app shall provide a User/Restaurant with all user/restaurant system functionality (according to access control).
AI_Rationale: This requirement states the system shall provide users/restaurants with all system functionality — a functional requirement. It also references "according to access control," which implies authorization/security concerns, so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: A display shall provide a Delivery Boy with all Delivery boy system functionality.
AI_Rationale: This states what the system (a display) shall provide for the Delivery Boy role—i.e., required functionality. It does not specify availability, performance, UI appearance, security, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: A app shall be capable of interfacing with a register to facilitate the accurate processing of a payment.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes a functional capability: the app must interface with a register to process payments accurately. It specifies what the system should do (functionality) and does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: When in billing mode, app shall display a representation of a cash payment for the items ordered.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (display a representation of a cash payment when in billing mode). This is a functional requirement; it does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: When in billing mode, app shall display a representation of a bankcard payment for each customer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (when in billing mode, the app shall display a bankcard payment representation for each customer), which is a functional UI/display requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, legal, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Customer shall able to order item from wallet amount
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (customer can order using wallet balance) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Customer shall able to cancel order and if cancelled money will be transferred to wallet to order food for next time(If Card Payment)
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability: customers can cancel orders and, for card payments, the money is transferred to a wallet for future use. It specifies what the system should do (behavior/transaction). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customer shall able to receive delivery boy details once order picked up
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (customers receiving delivery-person details after pickup). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Customer shall able to track the delivery boy details
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability for customers to track delivery person details. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Customer shall able to give rating for restaurant and delivery boy
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a system capability (allow customers to give ratings for restaurant and delivery person), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Customer shall able to favourite the restaurant
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (customers can favourite a restaurant), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The customer shall receive notifications upon both order acceptance and order delivery.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (sending notifications on order acceptance and delivery), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to use offers available for the restaurants they have selected.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (customers can use offers for restaurants they selected), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, usability metrics, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to start the shift.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (an actor: delivery boy, shall be able to start the shift). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive incoming request from restaurant.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a capability: the delivery person shall receive incoming requests from restaurants. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to acknowledge for the request.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an action the system must allow (delivery boy can acknowledge a request) — a functional requirement. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to acknowledge for request within 3 sec of time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the delivery person must be able to acknowledge a request (functional capability) and adds a timebound constraint of within 3 seconds (a performance/response-time requirement). No implication of availability, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to toggle Online/Offline/Break option.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability for the delivery person to toggle their status (Online/Offline/Break). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to reach the restaurant and check with order details.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability: the delivery person must be able to reach the restaurant and view order details. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive customer details from restaurant.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the delivery person must be able to receive customer details from the restaurant. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to pick up and deliver order to customer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (the delivery person must be able to pick up and deliver orders). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive rating from customers.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability: the system must allow a delivery person to receive ratings from customers. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive notification for restaurant details, payment details of customer.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability/behavior (delivery person receiving notifications about restaurant and customer payment details), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive payment if order is done with cash.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (delivery person can receive cash payments). It does not state availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to Manage users.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that an admin shall be able to manage users. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to Manage providers.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability the system must provide (administrative management of providers), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to Mange accounts.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: administrators must be able to manage accounts. It does not state any non-functional qualities (availability, security, usability, etc.), nor operational or maintainability constraints, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to CRUD items for restaurant.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability: an admin must be able to create, read, update, and delete restaurant items (CRUD). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, legal, UI look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, security, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to manage restaurant details
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (admin managing restaurant details). It does not mention availability, usability metrics, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to manage restaurant rate and reviews.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (admins managing restaurant rates and reviews), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to manage Delivery boy details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (Admin managing delivery boy details), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to display top rated restaurant.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (Admin can display top-rated restaurant), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI style, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to display offers for specific restaurant.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that an admin can display offers for a specific restaurant. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to contact between Delivery boy and restaurant to replace or cancel order if items are not available.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies a functional capability: admin ability to contact delivery person and restaurant to replace or cancel orders when items unavailable. It does not state non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.).

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to add promo code/offers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (admin ability to add promo codes/offers). No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Dispute panel shall be able to reassign order in the case, if delivery boy dint acknowledge the request.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the dispute panel must be able to reassign an order when the delivery person does not acknowledge. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: Dispute panel shall manage, if customer needs replacement of order or cancel order in case of order not available.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: the dispute panel must manage order replacement or cancellation when an order is unavailable. It describes functional behavior (what the system should do) and does not mention availability, security, performance, legal, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall log every state and state change of action, tablet and display to provision recovery from system failure.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a logging behavior to enable recovery from system failure — this is a functional requirement (system shall log...) with the primary quality concern being fault tolerance/recovery. No explicit mentions of availability, security, maintainability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall utilise periodic 120-second keep-alive messages between mobile and the server to monitor app operational status.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior (periodic 120-second keep-alive messages) — functional. The fixed timing constraint implies a performance/real-time requirement. The purpose is to monitor operational status, which relates to operability/monitoring.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to use the app in different platforms like different versions of OS mobiles.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies support across different platforms and OS versions for mobile apps, which is a portability/compatibility concern. It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to do authentication process for login and payment through bankcard.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall perform an authentication process (functional behavior) for login and bankcard payments; implies security concerns (authentication/authorization) but does not state performance, availability, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to do payment with secured bank payment mode which is given by user for login.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (user can make a payment) and requires the payment to be secured (implies security requirements such as secure payment processing/authentication). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, or other quality constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to do encryption and decryption of data for password which is given by user for login.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (encrypt/decrypt passwords) — a functional behavior — and it directly concerns protection of credentials (confidentiality/integrity), so it maps to Security. No explicit mention of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: Any element of the system will take no longer than 10-seconds to restart.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a maximum restart time (10 seconds). This is a performance/time constraint (PE) and directly concerns recovery from faults and system resilience (FT). Bounding restart time also impacts system availability (A). No functional behavior, legal, UI, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Admin must not dismiss an engaged menu unless the customer requests it.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavioral constraint on system actors (admins) and when an action (dismissing an engaged menu) is allowed, which is functional. It also restricts admin privileges/authorization, so it relates to security (access control). No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting no less than 200 concurrent connections from any combination of computers, tablets and displays.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity for concurrent connections (scalability requirement). Does not mention performance metrics like latency, availability, security, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active orders, that is, no orders shall be lost under any circumstances.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies support for an arbitrary number of active orders (scalability) and states that no orders shall be lost under any circumstances, implying durability/resilience to faults and failures (fault tolerance). It does not mention performance metrics, availability percentages, security, usability, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to store a limited number of snaps using Memories.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (store snaps) with a business constraint (limited number). This describes functional behavior rather than availability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to capture photos or videos, apply various effects, and share the resulting snap.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user-facing capabilities: capture photos/videos, apply effects, and share content — all functional behaviors. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add other Snapchatters as friends using multiple methods, with a friend request sent upon acceptance.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability: users can add friends via multiple methods and a friend request flow. This describes functional behavior, not quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create and customize a personal emoji avatar through Bitmoji integration.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user can create and customize a personal emoji avatar via Bitmoji integration). It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel constraints, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view and share friends' stories and global content, with options to take screenshots or report inappropriate content.
AI_Rationale: Describes user-capable actions (view, share, take screenshots, report content) — clear functional requirements. No explicit non-functional quality constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to apply lenses and filters to snaps before or after capture using AI technology.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (applying lenses/filters to snaps using AI), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, maintainability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to use Shazam to identify music by sensing audio and comparing it with a database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing a user to identify music by sensing audio and comparing it with a database. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view real-time location maps with friends' Bitmoji representations, accessible by swiping down on the camera screen.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (view real-time location maps with friends' Bitmoji and a specific swipe-down camera access), so it is Functional. The term "real-time" implies a timeliness/latency constraint, so Performance is relevant. The specified swipe gesture and UI access imply a usability/user interaction concern, so Usability is marked. No explicit availability, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel (visual aesthetics) requirements are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to send various forms of messages, including text, media, and calls, with recent conversations displayed.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes functional capabilities: sending various message types and displaying recent conversations. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall be able to maintain and view streaks by exchanging snaps with friends, indicated by a fire emoji and number.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional capability: users can maintain and view streaks and how they are indicated (fire emoji and number). No non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to accumulate a Snapchat score based on usage, displayed below the user's selfie.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing system behavior: tracking/accumulating a user score and displaying it beneath the user's selfie. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to generate and share a snapcode to share their profile.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a user capability (generate and share a snapcode/profile) which is functional behavior. It does not specify availability, security, usability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to store snaps, stories, and camera roll in a cloud-based platform accessible by swiping up from the camera screen.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (storing snaps/stories/camera roll in a cloud platform and accessing it via swiping up), which is functional. The specified access method (swiping gesture) implies a usability/interaction concern, so Usability is marked. No explicit non-functional constraints like availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal requirements are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to protect selected snaps with a passcode, accessible through Memories, with options to change or forget the passcode.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing a user capability (protect snaps with a passcode, change/forget flows). It also specifies a security feature (passcode protection), so mark as Security. No explicit availability, performance, portability, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for other users, location-based stories, events, and more, with matched results displayed.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user-facing capability (search and display of matched results) — a clear functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access support guidelines and contact options through the Snapchat support webpage.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (users can access support guidelines and contact options via the support webpage), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add, modify, or remove user data, with changes reflected successfully.
AI_Rationale: Specifies CRUD functionality (add/modify/remove user data) and successful reflection of changes—primarily a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional aspects stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to sign up and validate credentials, leading to access to the Snap camera screen.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (sign up, credential validation, access to camera) = Functional. Credential validation implies authentication/security requirements, so SE is also set. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create and participate in group chats, with options for various forms of communication and information exchange.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional capabilities (creating and participating in group chats and communication options). It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, usability, security, scalability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to track the status of sent snaps, displaying "delivered" or "received" as appropriate.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability to track and view the status of sent snaps (displaying 'delivered' or 'received') — primarily a functional requirement. It also affects usability because it defines user-visible status information that aids user interaction.

RequirementText: User shall be able to register for the application using a valid phone number, with a prompt upon installing the app.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (registration via phone number and install-time prompt), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Application shall detect contacts from the user's phone book and automatically add WhatsApp contacts to the user's contact list.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (detect phone-book contacts and add WhatsApp contacts to the contact list), which is functional. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, privacy, or other non-functional constraints, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to send instant messages to any contact on their WhatsApp list, with delivery notifications displayed.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: ability to send instant messages to contacts and display delivery notifications. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create groups of contacts and broadcast messages to these groups.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the system must do (allow users to create contact groups and send broadcasts). It describes functional capabilities and does not state non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: User shall be able to send audio, video, and image attachments, with supported formats and a maximum file size of 2MB per message.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (sending audio, video, image attachments) which is functional. It also includes a quantitative constraint (maximum file size 2MB per message), which is a performance/resource constraint, so Performance is marked. No explicit availability, security, portability, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, scalability, fault-tolerance, or legal aspects are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to track message status to determine if messages have been read by the recipient, indicated by tick marks.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (user can track message read status). The mention of "indicated by tick marks" specifies a visual UI presentation, so Look & Feel is also applicable. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: WhatsApp shall distinguish between Wi-Fi and mobile data networks for media download operations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (distinguish between Wi‑Fi and mobile data for media downloads), which is functional in nature. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to connect to both Wi-Fi and mobile networks for seamless connectivity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to connect to Wi‑Fi and mobile networks (functional). Implies support across different network environments/devices (portability). Does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to exchange data efficiently over the network.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability (functional) and emphasizes efficient network data exchange, which is a performance concern. No mention of availability, security, scalability, or other quality aspects.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to input using either touch screen or keypad methods.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (support input via touchscreen or keypad) — a functional requirement. It also impacts usability by offering alternative input methods, so US is set. No explicit availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: User shall operate efficiently with a minimum processor speed of 500MHz.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an environmental/hardware constraint (minimum processor speed) which is a performance/resource requirement and affects how the system/user operates. It is not a functional feature, nor about portability, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have access to continuous power to ensure uninterrupted operation.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies continuous power to ensure uninterrupted operation, which directly targets system availability. It also implies resilience against power failures (backup/power-fault tolerance), so Fault Tolerance is applicable. No security, functional, performance, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to utilize the device's camera, gallery, and microphone functionalities.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies what the system should allow the user to do (use camera, gallery, microphone)—a clear functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, portability, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall perform adequately under adverse conditions such as slow internet and low battery.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns system behavior under adverse conditions (slow internet, low battery). This implies performance-related constraints (PE) and resilience/graceful behavior under faults/poor conditions (FT). It also reflects user experience/usability (US) since it specifies that the user must be able to perform adequately. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: User shall ensure uninterrupted connections and maintain a high data transfer rate.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies uninterrupted connections (availability) and high data transfer rate (performance). Uninterrupted connections also implies resilience/fault tolerance to maintain connectivity. No mention of security, scalability, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall benefit from 256-Bit SSL encryption for secure data transmission in WhatsApp.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of 256-bit SSL encryption for secure data transmission, which is a clear security (confidentiality/integrity) requirement.

RequirementText: User shall have access to the WhatsApp internal server, which must be available 24/7.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability (access to internal server) — a functional concern — and explicitly states availability 24/7, so Availability is also applicable. It does not explicitly state authorization, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall enjoy maximal security measures implemented in the application to prevent unauthorized access.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly demands "maximal security measures... to prevent unauthorized access," which clearly corresponds to Security (authentication/authorization). No other quality attributes are explicitly referenced.

RequirementText: Only maintainers shall be granted access to internal servers for maintenance purposes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control limitation (authorization) for internal servers — a security requirement. No explicit mention of availability, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall post intelligence items with required spatial index and optional meta-data.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that a user shall post intelligence items with a required spatial index and optional metadata. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall filter and retrieve intelligence items based on various criteria.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action/feature (filter and retrieve intelligence items) — a functional capability. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: User shall link intelligence items, such as public transport messages, to crowd-sourced messages.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing users to link intelligence items (e.g., public transport messages) to crowd-sourced messages. It does not state non-functional qualities such as performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: City endpoint client shall pull and push data between endpoints and cache.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (pulling and pushing data between endpoints and cache) — a functional requirement. It also describes interfacing/operational behavior (data exchange between endpoints), which aligns with operability concerns. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: City endpoint client shall query, filter, and transform data sources.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional actions the client must perform (query, filter, transform data). No explicit non-functional requirements (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: City endpoint client shall push comments to endpoints.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional behavior: the City endpoint client shall push comments to endpoints. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Cache shall store relevant intelligence items, expiring after 12 hours or longer if liked by a traveler.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to store cache items and behavior for expiration/retention (including user-preference-based extension). This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: User database shall persist membership, trajectories, and karma.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the user database must persist certain data items (membership, trajectories, karma), which is an operational/data-storage requirement. It does not state availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, or UI concerns, nor detailed functional behavior beyond persistence.

RequirementText: Social travel application shall allow users to select, define, record, or import routes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functionality (ability to select, define, record, import routes). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Social travel application shall pull intelligence from the cache based on the current route and timespan.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior—pulling intelligence from a cache based on route and timespan—which is a functional action. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so no other NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: Social travel application shall filter intelligence client-side without additional requests.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement: the application must perform filtering of intelligence on the client side without making additional requests. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, availability, security, etc.) are stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Social travel application shall enable social actions on intelligence and export to external social networks.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional capabilities: enabling social actions and exporting to external social networks (functionality). It also implies interoperability/compatibility with external social platforms (portability/integration), but does not mention availability, security, performance, scalability, UI, maintainability, or operability concerns.

RequirementText: Social travel application shall send intelligence to the cache with location, timestamp, and metadata.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a concrete system behavior: sending intelligence to a cache with particular data (location, timestamp, metadata). This is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, operability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed to handle a load of 20,000 queries per day, particularly during peak traffic hours.
AI_Rationale: Specifies expected load handling and peak traffic—this implies scalability requirements and availability during demand. Does not explicitly mention security, performance metrics like latency, or functional behavior beyond capacity.

RequirementText: Security and privacy in the mobility domain shall be prioritized by the system, ensuring transparency and trust.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly prioritizes security and privacy (transparency and trust) in the mobility domain, which directly maps to the Security label. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, legal, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall implement anonymization and aggregation techniques to securely share route information.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates implementing anonymization and aggregation techniques to securely share route information, which describes a specific system function (functional) and addresses confidentiality/privacy measures (security). It does not explicitly state availability, legal compliance, performance, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Encryption shall be employed by the system for all privacy-sensitive data stored on the server.
AI_Rationale: Specifies encryption of privacy-sensitive data at rest, which is a security requirement (confidentiality). No other quality attributes or functional behavior are expressed.

RequirementText: The system shall disclose security policies and practices to build user trust.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns disclosure of security policies and practices to build trust, which is a security-related requirement (transparency/privacy/security). It does not specify functionality, availability, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall allow the use of unverified (anonymous) avatars or aliases.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (allowing unverified/anonymous avatars or aliases) so it is functional. It also pertains to identity/authentication policy and has direct security implications (anonymous access/identity verification), so Security is marked. No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: End-users shall be provided with control over their private data, including deletion options, by the system.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (system shall provide controls and deletion options). It primarily concerns data privacy/control, so it maps to Security (SE). It does not explicitly state availability, legal compliance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure multi-lingual support, with English, Turkish, Finnish, and Italian as supported languages due to replication partnerships.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall provide multi-lingual support (a functional capability) affecting user-facing language; this impacts usability and presentation/vernacular (look & feel). No constraints about performance, availability, security, etc.

RequirementText: User can create profiles with health worker information, attaching usernames for identification, and supporting multiple users on a single device.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes functionality: create profiles with health worker info, attach usernames, and support multiple users on a single device. It specifies what the system should do rather than quality attributes.

RequirementText: User can register working locations of healthcare workers for use in health survey forms.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (registering working locations for healthcare workers to be used in survey forms). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System downloads disease data offline to minimize typing in surveys.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (download disease data for offline use) — functional. It explicitly implies offline operation to handle lack of connectivity, matching fault-tolerance/offline behavior. It also targets reduced typing in surveys, an usability improvement. No evidence for other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System conducts health surveys to identify disease outbreaks, storing data offline if connectivity fails.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (conduct health surveys to identify outbreaks) and an explicit fault-tolerance/offline behavior (store data offline if connectivity fails). No explicit availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: System supports offline surveys for uninterrupted data collection.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (support offline surveys) which is a functional requirement. It also implies resilience to network faults/unavailability to allow uninterrupted data collection, which maps to fault tolerance. No explicit mention of availability metrics, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall access the main menu on the home screen, which includes options like "Care Give Support", "Track your Child", and "Hospital Information".
