AI_Rationale: Describes system behavior: displaying personalized information upon login and automatically adding details to booking requests. These are functional requirements; no quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The application and its options will be in US English and Unicode format for globalization support.
AI_Rationale: Specifies language/locale and character encoding (US English and Unicode) which affects displayed text and user-facing wording (Look & Feel) and usability for global users. Does not specify availability, security, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The booking process will be intuitive, with information completion in stages.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes the booking process being intuitive and staged information completion, which pertains to usability (ease of use, user experience). It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Both employees and clients will be able to update personal details anytime, with clients also able to update booking details.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capabilities: employees and clients can update personal details and clients can update bookings (functional). The phrase 'anytime' implies continuous availability (availability). No explicit security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints stated.

RequirementText: An email confirmation with original and new details will be dispatched upon confirmation of updates.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (sending an email confirmation with details upon update). No quality attributes like availability, security, or usability are mentioned.

RequirementText: Booking will be locked for editing only when an employee is assigned to serve the client.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (locking a booking for editing when an employee is assigned) — a functional constraint. It also defines an access control rule (editing permission tied to assignment), which is a security/authorization concern, so SE is marked. No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The administrator will be able to select and update the weekly roster based on employee availability.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an administrative capability (select and update weekly roster) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, UI, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The administrator will be able to print reports annually, weekly, and daily based on selected time frames.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability for the administrator to print reports for specified time frames (daily/weekly/annual). No non-functional qualities such as performance, availability, security, or usability are implied.

RequirementText: The administrator will be able to check feedback posted by clients and send newsletters regarding promotions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional capabilities for the administrator (view client feedback and send promotional newsletters). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The administrator will be able to manage user portfolio, providing access to new users and deleting inactive employees.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an administrative capability (manage user portfolio: add access for new users, delete inactive employees), which is functional behavior. It does not state quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: The administrator will be able to view system statistics and generate reports based on selected criteria.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a capability (administrator can view statistics and generate reports based on criteria), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, maintainability, operability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to perform the weekly roster of employees.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (ability to perform weekly employee roster), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to print reports annually, weekly, and daily based on selected time frames.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: generating/printing reports with selectable time frames (annual, weekly, daily). No quality/constraint attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to check feedbacks.
AI_Rationale: This is a straightforward functional requirement specifying that the user shall be able to check feedback. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to send newsletters regarding promotions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (sending promotional newsletters). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage the user portfolio, providing access to new users and deleting inactive employees.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (manage user portfolio: grant access to new users and delete inactive employees), which is a functional requirement. It describes administrative functionality (user/account management), so Operability is also applicable. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall be able to change the super password.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (ability to change the super/administrator password). It also directly concerns security (password management/authentication), so SE is marked. No explicit availability, performance, portability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: Employees shall be able to log into the system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (employees must be able to log into the system). No availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall be able to check their rosters.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing what the system must do (allow users to check rosters). It does not specify any quality attributes like performance, availability, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: Employees shall be able to maintain daily logs.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (employees can maintain daily logs), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to enable employees to select their availability.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (allow employees to select their availability), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention quality attributes like usability, performance, security, etc., so only F is set.

RequirementText: Employees shall be able to check online bookings.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (employees can check online bookings). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Clients shall be able to make a booking through the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: clients must be able to make a booking. No availability, performance, security, usability or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall be able to provide the status of their booking.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (providing the status of a booking). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Clients shall be able to calculate fare.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (clients can calculate fare), which is a functional requirement; it does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to allow clients to view driver history.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability to view driver history, which is a functional requirement. No quality constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Clients shall be able to change their password.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user capability (clients can change their password). It does not explicitly state security, usability, availability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to provide a reset option for forgotten passwords.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (password reset feature). It also implies security concerns (authentication/account recovery), so labeled SE. No explicit mentions of availability, usability, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall authenticate users based on username and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication mechanism (username/password), which is a security requirement. It describes security behavior rather than detailed functional workflow or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall track user activity sessions.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a system capability (tracking user activity sessions). No explicit quality constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall record client booking requests.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior (recording client booking requests), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall check vehicle availability for booking.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a system behavior (checking vehicle availability for booking). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall maintain a history of course bookings.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — maintaining a history of course bookings (data storage/recording). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall record and analyze feedback received from clients.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior: recording and analyzing client feedback (functional). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Temporary passwords shall be emailed to users if they forget their password.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior (sending temporary passwords by email) — functional. It also relates to authentication/password reset, which is a security concern, so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: Newsletters shall be sent to clients' email addresses.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system behavior (sending newsletters to clients' email addresses), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Clients shall be notified via email when their booking is confirmed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: sending email notifications to clients upon booking confirmation. No non-functional quality (availability, security, performance, etc.) is specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to register by providing username, surname, password, and email.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall allow user registration with specific fields (username, surname, password, email). No explicit non-functional constraints (security, performance, availability, etc.) are stated, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall allow user registration without any preconditions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the system must allow user registration (no quality or nonfunctional constraints implied).

RequirementText: User shall be redirected to the main page upon successful registration.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (automatic redirection after successful registration), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes like availability, performance, security, or usability are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: If any required field in the registration form is not properly filled, the system shall display a warning message.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (display a warning message when a required field is not filled), which is functional. It does not explicitly state usability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: If all required fields are properly filled, the user shall be redirected to the main page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (redirect user to main page when fields are filled), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in by entering username and password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a login capability (functional). It also implies authentication/security concerns (SE). No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: System shall allow user login without any preconditions.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying the system shall allow user login; it does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: If the user forgets their account information, they shall be able to retrieve it via the "forgot your password?" panel.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (retrieve account via 'forgot your password' panel), which is a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (security, performance, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: If the user enters incorrect username or password, the system shall display a warning message.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (displaying a warning message) in response to incorrect credentials — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state usability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: If the user enters correct username and password, they shall be redirected to the relevant page of the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies login behavior (functional) and implies authentication requirement (security). No mention of availability, performance, UI look, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log out by pressing the log out button.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the system must allow the user to log out via a log out button). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall not mandate logging out.
AI_Rationale: The statement constrains user interaction behavior (not forcing users to log out), which primarily affects usability/UX (convenience and user flow). It does not specify availability, security, legal, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Upon logging out, the system shall load the main page.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (system action upon logout: load main page). No quality/ non-functional attributes implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add transportation routes from the map.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (adding transportation routes via the map), which describes functional behavior. No non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall require user to sign in before adding transportation routes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional constraint (must sign in before adding routes) so it is a functional requirement. It also imposes an authentication control, which is a security requirement (authentication/authorization), therefore SE is set. No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: After adding a transportation route, the user shall be able to retrieve transportation requests from other users.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (retrieve transportation requests) following another action—functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to delete transportation routes.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user capability to delete transportation routes. No quality constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall only delete routes that they have added.
AI_Rationale: This requirement defines a deletion capability constrained by who may perform it — functional behavior (delete route) plus an access-control/authorization constraint (only the user who added the route may delete it), which is a security concern.

RequirementText: User shall be able to request transportation routes.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing what the system should do (allow users to request transportation routes); no non-functional qualities (performance, security, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for transportation routes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (search for transportation routes), which is a functional requirement; it does not mention any quality attributes such as performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to send messages through the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (ability for a user to send messages). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to reply to incoming messages through the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — allowing a user to reply to incoming messages. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to block other users through the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can block other users). It does not explicitly mention availability, security mechanisms, UI/look-and-feel, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to rate drivers through the system.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user capability (rating drivers). It does not specify quality attributes like usability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to change the language of the system.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (enables a user action: change system language). It also impacts usability (supports user preference and accessibility). No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to change the language without any preconditions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (users can change language) — a functional requirement. It also impacts usability/accessibility (ability to switch language without preconditions improves user experience), so Usability is marked. No explicit mention of performance, availability, security, portability, maintainability, scalability, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: User shall experience page loading times of less than 1 second with an 8Mbits internet connection speed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative requirement on page loading time under a given bandwidth, which is a performance (response time/latency) requirement. Does not describe functionality, availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall handle over one thousand simultaneous user requests.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity to handle >1000 simultaneous user requests, which is a scalability requirement. It does not mention availability, latency, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall store user information for more than one hundred thousand users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system shall store user information (functional behavior) and explicitly states a capacity threshold (>100,000 users), which is a scalability/capacity non-functional constraint. No indication of availability, performance metrics, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User passwords shall be encrypted in the database management system (DBMS) for security.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that passwords shall be encrypted in the DBMS to ensure security (confidentiality/integrity), which is a security non-functional requirement.

RequirementText: System shall implement a CAPTCHA module to prevent spam robots.
AI_Rationale: CAPTCHA is a security control to prevent automated/spam bots (security). It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional categories, nor core functional behavior beyond being a protective measure, so only Security is marked.

RequirementText: In the event of a system crash, it shall return to operation within one hour for maintainability.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maximum time to return to operation after a crash (recovery/MTTR). This implies availability requirements and is explicitly about maintainability; it also concerns fault tolerance (recovery behavior).

RequirementText: The system shall be compatible with all major web browsers (Chrome, Safari, Mozilla Firefox, etc.) and operating systems (Windows, Linux, Mac Mavericks, etc.).
AI_Rationale: Specifies compatibility with multiple web browsers and operating systems, which is a portability requirement (support across platforms). No availability, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The server shall host the Swiggy Clone App, providing system data processing and storage capability.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the system should do—hosting the application and providing data processing and storage—so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: A surface app page shall offer customers all system functionality.
AI_Rationale: Requires that a surface app page provide all system functionality — this is a functional requirement specifying what the system shall do. It does not explicitly state availability, UI appearance, usability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The app shall provide users/restaurants with their respective functionalities based on access control.
AI_Rationale: Specifies providing functionality (functional) and restricts access based on access control (security/authorization). No mention of other qualities.

RequirementText: A display shall offer delivery boys all system functionality.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the display must provide delivery personnel with all system functionality. No quality constraints (performance, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The app shall interface with a register for accurate payment processing.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies interfacing/integration with an external register (operational/administrative interaction). It does not state availability, performance, security, or UI qualities, so only Operability is set.

RequirementText: Customers shall log in or skip registration to access the menu dashboard.

No explicit statements about availability, performance, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, fault tolerance, operability, legal, or look-and-feel.

AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (delivery personnel can toggle status between Online/Offline/Break). It does not state availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, UI/ux details, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Delivery boys shall reach restaurants and check order details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: delivery personnel must arrive at restaurants and view order details. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Delivery boys shall receive customer details from restaurants.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies a system function/behavior: delivery personnel shall receive customer details from restaurants. No explicit quality attributes (availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Delivery boys shall pick up and deliver orders to customers.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional requirement describing actions the delivery personnel must perform (pickup and delivery). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Delivery boys shall receive ratings from customers.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional requirement: the system shall allow delivery personnel to receive ratings from customers. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Delivery boys shall receive notifications for restaurant and customer payment details.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: delivery personnel shall receive notifications about restaurant and customer payment details — this is a functional requirement. No explicit quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Delivery boys shall receive cash payments upon order completion.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a system behavior: delivery personnel shall receive cash payments upon order completion. It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Admins shall manage users, providers, and accounts.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (administrators managing users, providers, and accounts), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, security, performance, scalability, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Admins shall be able to CRUD items for restaurants.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement: administrators must be able to create, read, update, and delete restaurant items. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Admins shall manage restaurant details, ratings, and reviews.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability: admins managing restaurant details, ratings, and reviews. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Admins shall manage delivery boy details.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (admins managing delivery boy details). It does not explicitly state security/authorization constraints, availability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admins shall display top-rated restaurants and offers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a display behavior (show top-rated restaurants and offers), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, UI styling, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admins shall facilitate communication between delivery boys and restaurants for order replacements or cancellations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system/admins must provide (facilitating communication between delivery personnel and restaurants for replacements/cancellations), which is a functional behavior rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: Admins shall add promo codes/offers.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (admins must be able to add promo codes/offers). It does not mention availability, performance, security, legal, UI, maintainability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The dispute panel shall reassign orders if delivery boys fail to acknowledge requests.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (reassign orders) -> Functional. Describes handling failures when delivery personnel don't acknowledge -> implies fault tolerance/resilience.

RequirementText: The dispute panel shall manage customer requests for order replacements or cancellations if items are not available.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: the dispute panel shall manage customer requests for replacements or cancellations when items are unavailable. It describes functional behavior (what the system should do) and does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall log every state and state change of action, tablet, and display to provision recovery from system failure.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior ('shall log...') so it's functional. Its purpose is explicit: to provision recovery from system failure, indicating fault tolerance/resilience. No other quality attributes (availability, security, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of restoring itself to its previous state in the event of failure (e.g., a system crash or power loss).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system must restore itself to its previous state after failures (crash, power loss), which directly describes fault tolerance/recovery behavior. It does not specify availability metrics, security, usability, or other quality attributes, nor a functional feature, so only FT is set.

RequirementText: The system shall utilize periodic 120-second keep-alive messages between mobile and the server to monitor app operational status.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (periodic keep-alive messages) — functional. It is an operational/monitoring requirement for managing app status — operability. The explicit timing (120-second interval) imposes a performance/timing constraint, so PE is included.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to use the app on different platforms like different versions of OS/Mobiles.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies ability to use the app on different platforms/OS versions, which is a portability/compatibility concern. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall perform an authentication process for login and payment through a bank card.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required authentication process (functional behavior) and implies security concerns (authentication for login and payment). No mention of availability, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to make payments with secured bank payment mode.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (making payments) — functional. The phrase 'secured bank payment mode' explicitly implies a security requirement (secure payment handling), so Security is set. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall perform encryption and decryption of data for passwords provided by users for login.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall perform encryption/decryption of user passwords (behavioral requirement) and addresses confidentiality/security of credentials. No indication of availability, performance, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: Any element of the system will take no longer than 10 seconds to restart.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a maximum restart time (10 seconds) for any system element. That is a recovery/fault-tolerance constraint (FT) and also a performance/timeliness metric (PE). It does not explicitly address availability SLA, security, usability, or other categories.

RequirementText: Admins shall not dismiss an engaged menu unless the customer requests it.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional/business rule specifying system behavior (admins must not dismiss an engaged menu unless the customer requests it). It also imposes an authorization/policy constraint on who may perform an action (admins are prohibited), which maps to security (access control). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting no fewer than 200 concurrent connections from any combination of computers, tablets, and displays.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required concurrent connection capacity (200 concurrent connections) which is a scalability concern and also a performance requirement (throughput/concurrency). No mention of availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active orders, meaning no orders shall be lost under any circumstances.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies unbounded capacity (scalability) and that orders must never be lost (fault tolerance/durability). No mention of availability, performance metrics, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active customer payments, meaning no payments shall be lost under any circumstances.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies support for an arbitrary number of concurrent payments (scalability) and guarantees that no payments are lost under any circumstances (fault tolerance/reliability). It does not mention performance metrics, availability percentages, security, or UI, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in with a valid login ID and password.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying authentication behavior (log in with ID and password). It also implies a security concern (authentication mechanism), but does not state availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall inform the user of failed login attempts due to incorrect credentials.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (notify user of failed login) — functional. It pertains to authentication feedback for security (failed login attempts) so security label applies. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other NFR aspects stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the main form after successful login.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (access main form) contingent on authentication (after successful login), implying a security/authentication requirement.

RequirementText: User shall be able to input and store personal details of students.

RequirementText: System shall generate a unique Student ID for each student.

RequirementText: User shall be able to enroll a student's biometric data using fingerprint scanning.

RequirementText: User shall be able to update student details.

RequirementText: User shall be able to reset student details, clearing all stored information.

RequirementText: User shall be able to delete student records.

RequirementText: System shall provide attendance reports for all students in a class.

RequirementText: System shall generate attendance reports for specific courses.

RequirementText: User shall input eligibility criteria status.

RequirementText: User shall/will be able to operate the system with a Dual Core or above processor.

RequirementText: System shall be able to function with a minimum of 512MB RAM.

RequirementText: System shall require a minimum of 80GB hard disk space.

RequirementText: System shall support a monitor with a minimum size of 14 inches and VGA resolution.

RequirementText: User shall/will be able to interact with the system using a standard keyboard and mouse.

RequirementText: User shall/will be able to operate the system on Windows XP, Windows 7, or above operating systems.

RequirementText: User shall/will be able to ensure acceptable response times even during peak times.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure scalability to accommodate an increasing number of users, accounts, and transactions.

RequirementText: System shall allow for the addition of new servers or resources as the system grows.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure a high level of availability, with minimal downtime for maintenance or upgrades.

RequirementText: System shall have a mechanism to ensure uninterrupted service in case of hardware or software failures.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure robust data backup and recovery strategies to prevent data loss in case of system failures.

RequirementText: Regular backups shall be performed and tested for reliability.

It does not explicitly mention availability targets, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: A disaster recovery plan shall be in place to restore service quickly in the event of a catastrophic failure.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a disaster recovery plan to restore service quickly after catastrophic failure, which directly concerns availability and fault tolerance (recovery/resilience). No explicit legal, usability, security, or other non-functional aspects mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall adhere to relevant banking and financial industry regulations, including Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) requirements.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies conformity to banking and financial industry regulations (KYC, AML), which is a legal/regulatory compliance requirement. It does not explicitly state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall comply with data protection and privacy laws, such as GDPR or HIPAA, as applicable.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates compliance with data protection/privacy laws (legal/regulatory). Such laws strongly imply security controls for protecting data, so Security is also marked. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The user interface shall be intuitive and user-friendly, catering to users of varying technical abilities.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies that the user interface should be intuitive and user-friendly, which directly targets usability (ease of use, learnability). It does not specify visual layout details, performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be accessible to individuals with disabilities and comply with accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG).
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates compliance with accessibility standards (WCAG), which is a legal/compliance constraint. It also directly concerns usability and accessibility for users, so Usability is applicable. No explicit mentions of security, performance, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be subject to load testing to ensure it can handle expected levels of usage.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on verifying the system's capacity under load—addresses performance (throughput/response under load) and scalability (handling expected usage levels). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Continuous performance monitoring shall be in place to detect and address performance bottlenecks.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates continuous performance monitoring to detect and address performance bottlenecks, which directly concerns Performance (PE). Requiring monitoring and addressing issues is an operational/administrative capability, so Operability (O) applies. It does not explicitly state scalability targets, fault tolerance, security, legal, usability, portability, or maintainability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to navigate the web, load pages, and interact with content.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user capability to navigate, load pages, and interact with content (functional). It also pertains to ease of use/navigation, so usability is applicable. No explicit performance, look-and-feel, security, or other quality constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to save and organize favorite websites using bookmarks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (saving and organizing bookmarks), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have access to a log of previously visited websites.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (providing user access to a log of previously visited websites). It does not mention availability, security/authorization, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to open and manage multiple tabs within a single window.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to open and manage multiple tabs), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as performance, usability, security, etc.

RequirementText: User shall have customization options including homepage selection and privacy settings.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes user-facing customization options (homepage selection, privacy settings) which primarily affect usability and user experience. It does not explicitly state operational, performance, security, legal, or maintainability constraints, nor detailed UI look-and-feel requirements, so only Usability is marked.

RequirementText: System shall meet performance expectations in terms of page load times and responsiveness.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies page load times and responsiveness, which are performance concerns. It does not mention availability, scalability, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall implement security measures such as encryption protocols, sandboxing, and protection against malware.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates security measures (encryption, sandboxing, malware protection), which directly maps to the Security (SE) label. It does not specify availability, performance, or other concerns.

RequirementText: System shall maintain uptime as per defined expectations and handle errors effectively.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly refers to uptime (availability) and handling errors effectively (fault tolerance/resilience). No mention of other qualities such as security, performance, usability, or portability.

RequirementText: System shall ensure usability through intuitive navigation and accessibility features.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly targets usability—intuitive navigation and accessibility features—which are usability concerns. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other NFR categories, so only US is set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to accommodate a high number of books and users without any faults.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies handling a high number of books and users (scalability) and implies performance/throughput expectations (PE). The phrase 'without any faults' indicates resilience/fault tolerance (FT). It does not explicitly mention availability metrics, security, usability, maintainability, portability, legal, or look-and-feel aspects.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that responses to view information appear on the screen within 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a response-time constraint for viewing information (performance). It also implies the functional capability to view information, so both Functional and Performance apply.

RequirementText: System shall not cause harm to human users during its use.
AI_Rationale: This requirement is a safety constraint (preventing harm to users). Within the provided label set, the closest match is Security (SE) as it concerns protection of users from harm. It does not explicitly state operational, legal, performance, usability, or other quality attributes, so those labels are set to false.

RequirementText: System shall use a secured database for data storage.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates use of a 'secured database' which is a security-related constraint (confidentiality/integrity). It does not explicitly address availability, performance, portability, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Normal users will have read-only access to information except for their personal and some other specified information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (who may read or modify data): normal users have read-only access except for personal and some other specified information. This is a security (authorization) constraint rather than a functional or other quality requirement.

RequirementText: System shall enforce access constraints for different types of users.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies enforcing access constraints (access control) which is a functional behavior of the system and relates directly to security (authorization). No indication of availability, performance, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: LMS product shall handle both expected and unexpected errors to prevent loss of information and minimize downtime.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies handling expected/unexpected errors to prevent information loss and minimize downtime, which directly targets fault tolerance and availability (reliability). It does not specify functionality, security, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The LMS shall store all information about librarians and patrons, including their access keys and priority.
AI_Rationale: Primarily a functional requirement to store information about librarians and patrons (F). It explicitly mentions storing access keys, which is security-sensitive data; although no protection measures are specified, the inclusion of access keys strongly implies a security concern (SE). No other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The LMS shall allow searching for items by author, title, or keywords.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (searching by author, title, or keywords). It does not include availability, performance, usability, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The LMS shall support 500 patrons and handle 1000 requests per minute simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity (500 patrons) and request throughput (1000 requests/min) which are performance and scalability concerns rather than functional, security, or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: The LMS shall enable librarians to add, delete, and modify items in the database and check their availability.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies functional capabilities (CRUD operations and checking item availability) for librarians. It does not mention non-functional qualities like uptime, performance, security, UI, or maintainability, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The LMS shall generate daily reports for librarians based on requests, aiding in decision-making regarding item acquisition or retirement.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the LMS must generate daily reports for librarians to support decision-making. It does not impose constraints about availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The LMS shall automatically create notifications and send them to patrons via email when items are overdue.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: automatically create and send email notifications when items are overdue — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The LMS shall provide the capability to search, request, and renew items either through the LMS application on library computers or via the College website from outside the library, utilizing the Internet.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities (search, request, renew) — F. Specifies access from library computers and via the College website over the Internet, implying operational/distribution/remote access requirements — classified as Operability (O). No explicit mentions of availability metrics, security, portability, performance, scalability, usability, legal, maintainability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The LMS shall grant access to both the previous Access-based database and online databases.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability of the LMS (granting access to two types of databases). It does not state availability, security/authorization controls, portability, or other quality attributes explicitly, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to login to the system as an authorized administrator using a username and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the functional capability to log in (functional) and explicitly requires authentication using username/password (security). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall allow the administrator to register members by manually inputting their information into the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (administrator can register members via manual input) — a functional requirement. No quality/constraint (security, usability, performance, etc.) is implied.

RequirementText: System shall provide an Inbox feature for administrators to view all requests made by active members.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: an Inbox feature that allows administrators to view requests from active members. It describes what the system should do (viewing requests) and does not explicitly state availability, security/authorization, performance, usability, or other quality constraints, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to view pending requests, approve or reject them, and send notifications to requesters upon approval.
AI_Rationale: Specifies administrator capabilities (view/approve/reject requests and send notifications) — clearly functional behavior. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: If a request is approved, the status will be marked as "Borrow" with an end date.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional behavior: when a request is approved, the system must set the status to 'Borrow' and record an end date. No non-functional qualities are specified.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to check the status of all books, including whether they have been issued or reserved, and view their details.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement: it specifies that an administrator can check book status and view details (F). It also explicitly assigns the capability to the Administrator role, which implies an access-control concern (authorization), so Security (SE) is marked. No explicit statements about availability, performance, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or operability are present.

RequirementText: System shall provide a search facility for administrators to search for books based on title, subject, author, or publisher.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (search facility for administrators to find books by title, subject, author, or publisher), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to add new books to the library based on user requests, inputting all relevant details.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an administrator capability (adding new books and inputting details) — a clear functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Administrator shall have the capability to remove any book from the library.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (administrator can remove any book). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to login to the system as an authorized user using a username and password.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability (ability to login) — a functional behavior — and explicitly describes authentication using username and password, which is a security concern. No availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Users of the system include four categories: Student (Transaction and view), Faculty (Transaction and view), Author (view), Publisher (view).
AI_Rationale: Specifies user roles and their permitted actions (view and transact) — a functional requirement describing who can perform which operations. Also implies access control/authorization constraints, so security is applicable.

RequirementText: System shall provide a search engine allowing users to search for books by book name, subject, author, and publisher.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (search by book name, subject, author, publisher). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view the list of book details, including Book Id, Book Name, Author, Status (Reserved / Borrowed / Cancelled/ Available), Due date, Reservation date, Borrowed User (if status is "Borrowed").
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability to view a list of book details and enumerates the fields to be shown. It defines functional behavior (what the system should do) and does not impose availability, performance, security, UI styling, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall make a request to reserve a book, which shall then be sent to the administrator for approval.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user-facing capability and workflow (request to reserve a book and submission to administrator for approval), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes such as availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: System shall provide an interface for users to request non-availability of a book, which the administrator can accept or reject.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system interface and workflow (users request non-availability; administrator can accept/reject) — functional. The presence of administrator actions implies role-based control/authorization, so Security is relevant. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The reservation system shall allow users to reserve books even if they are currently borrowed by other members.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability of the reservation system (allowing reservations for currently borrowed books). It does not state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to cancel a reservation.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user capability (cancel a reservation); it does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: System shall send a notification via email after registering a book.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior: sending an email notification after a book is registered. It describes a functional action (notification via email) and does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall track due dates and send reminders at regular intervals, with a static value of 4 days set in the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a behavior: tracking due dates and sending reminders at a set interval (4 days). This is a functional requirement; it does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view the status of books based on predefined statuses such as Pending, Approved, Rejected/Canceled, Borrowed, Available, and Not Available.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action/functional behavior (viewing book status with predefined status values). It does not state availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall maintain the book status as Pending when a member requests a book.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a system behavior (maintain book status as Pending when requested), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall update the book status to Approved when the administrator approves the member request.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (update book status to Approved) triggered by an administrator event — a functional requirement. No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall maintain the book status as Rejected/Canceled if the administrator rejects the requested book.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: system must set/maintain book status to Rejected/Canceled when an administrator rejects a request. No non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall update the book status to Borrowed when the book is borrowed by another member, and the administrator changes the status from Approved.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a specific system behavior (updating a book's status when borrowed and an admin changes status). It specifies functionality only and does not state any quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: System shall set the book status to Available if the book is not currently borrowed, allowing members to reserve it.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (setting book status to Available when not borrowed to allow reservations). It does not mention availability metrics, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall mark the book status as Not Available when the book stock is unavailable.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system action/behavior (marking book status as 'Not Available' when stock is unavailable), which is a functional requirement. It does not state non-functional concerns like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall enable users to search for books based on name, subject, status, author, and publisher.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (searching for books by specific attributes). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality concerns.

RequirementText: System shall provide a book listing with all necessary columns and transaction details for both users and administrators.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement to provide a book listing. The mention of "necessary columns" implies presentation/layout concerns (look & feel). No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, or maintainability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall have access to the system at all times, ensuring 24/7 availability.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly specifies 24/7 availability/uptime requirement, which maps directly to Availability. No other quality (security, fault tolerance, etc.) is explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall secure all information in the library database and transactions, providing authentication for all users and restricting access to authenticated users only.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies securing information and providing authentication/restricting access to authenticated users, which is a security requirement (confidentiality and access control). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, scalability, operability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System shall design components with simplicity to avoid complexity, thereby enhancing overall performance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement emphasizes designing components with simplicity to avoid complexity and explicitly states this is to enhance overall performance — directly indicating a performance concern (PE). Simplicity in design also strongly implies improved maintainability (MN). It does not specify availability, security, scalability, portability, operability, look-and-feel, usability, legal, or functional behavior, so those labels are set to false.

RequirementText: User shall be able to record exercises, repetitions, and the followed diet within the application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability ('user shall be able to record...') describing what the system should do. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: System shall suggest videos, diets, and schedule them on the calendar for the user.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behaviors (suggest videos/diets and schedule them) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: The application shall track the running activity of the user and convert it into calories burnt.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (tracking running activity and computing calories burned). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The application shall score the user globally to provide motivation.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional feature (global scoring). It also implies a user-experience goal (motivation), so usability is applicable. No constraints about performance, security, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The application shall operate in offline or low data mode.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies operation under loss or limited network connectivity (offline/low data mode), which is about resilience to connectivity faults — classified as Fault Tolerance. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or UI/functional details beyond the fault-handling capability.

RequirementText: User shall experience quick and seamless authentication processes facilitated by the application.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on authentication (security) and emphasizes it should be quick (performance) and seamless (usability). It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, portability, scalability, or maintainability; functional behavior is implied but classification follows similar examples mapping authentication to security rather than labeling as functional.

RequirementText: System shall allow users to reset their passwords through a user-friendly and secure method. It should include verifying identity through security questions or sending verification codes to the registered email or phone number.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a password-reset feature (functional) and specifies secure identity verification methods (security). It also emphasizes 'user-friendly', indicating usability. No mentions of availability, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall ensure the security of user accounts, employing measures such as encryption, password complexity requirements, and protection against brute-force attacks.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly addresses security of user accounts and lists security controls (encryption, password complexity, brute-force protection), which maps directly to Security (SE). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Users shall not encounter any interruptions or issues when resetting a password.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that users shall not encounter interruptions or issues during password reset, which primarily addresses usability (smooth, error-free user experience) and implies fault tolerance/resilience of the password-reset process. It does not explicitly state availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Systems shall display password fields such that characters entered by the user are not visible.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that password characters must not be visible, which is a confidentiality/security control for input handling. It does not address availability, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal aspects, or explicitly usability/look-and-feel concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall provide uninterrupted functionality both with and without an internet connection. In offline mode, users should still be able to access certain features. In online mode, the system should operate smoothly.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies uninterrupted functionality with and without internet (availability) and resilience to loss of connectivity/offline capability (fault tolerance). The phrase 'operate smoothly' implies performance concerns. No legal, security, UI, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or explicit functional behavior beyond resilience is indicated.

RequirementText: System shall maintain consistent functionality across different devices and platforms.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies maintaining consistent functionality across different devices and platforms, which is a portability/compatibility concern. It does not state availability, security, performance, UI look-and-feel, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall secure itself by limiting access to authorized users and requiring password protection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control and password protection—authentication/authorization requirements, which are security concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall provide clear instructions and intuitive navigation for ease of use by all users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies ease of use, clear instructions and intuitive navigation—these are usability concerns. It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have access to a database in a workable state.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that users must be able to access the database (functional) and that the database must be in a 'workable state', implying availability/reliability. No mention of security, performance, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall provide secure passwords to each user or client.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall provide passwords (a functional action) and explicitly requires them to be secure, which is a security concern. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed to be user-friendly, particularly for novice users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system be user-friendly for novice users, which is a usability/UX requirement. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: There shall be proper interconnectivity between files to facilitate communication.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies that files must be interconnected to facilitate communication (a functional capability) and implies operational/integration concerns (operability). It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: Different commands for different functions shall be implemented to ensure reliability.
AI_Rationale: The statement mandates implementing different commands for different functions — a functional requirement. The stated purpose 'to ensure reliability' indicates a reliability/fault-tolerance concern, so FT is marked. No explicit mention of availability metrics, security, usability, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall access the intra mailing system concurrently with multiple users.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies that the system must allow multiple users to access the intra-mailing system concurrently — a functional capability. It does not explicitly state performance, availability, scalability, security, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall support multiple users simultaneously in the intra mailing system.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies supporting multiple simultaneous users, which is a functional requirement about system behavior. It does not specify performance, scalability targets, availability, or security aspects, so only F is set.

RequirementText: User shall not be able to view other users' details for privacy and security reasons.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access restriction for privacy/confidentiality (access control), which is a security requirement rather than functional or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System shall restrict users from viewing other users' details to ensure privacy and security.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies access restriction behavior (functional) specifically to protect privacy/security, which maps to security (access control). No mention of availability, performance, scalability, etc., so other labels not set.

RequirementText: User shall utilize the application across various sectors where file transfer is essential.
AI_Rationale: The statement indicates the application must be usable across various sectors/contexts (operability/manageability in those environments) and implies portability/compatibility across different domains. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, or other NFRs, so only O and PO are set.

RequirementText: System shall provide versatility and adaptability to be used in different sectors where file transfer is crucial.
AI_Rationale: The requirement emphasizes versatility and adaptability to operate across different sectors/environments where file transfer is crucial, which implies portability/compatibility (PO) and the ability to be operated in various contexts (operability, O). It does not specify usability, performance, security, or other specific qualities.

RequirementText: User shall authenticate themselves to access functionalities permitted to them.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies authentication/authorization to control access to functionality, which is a security requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall implement authentication checks to prevent unauthorized access to functionalities.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly specifies authentication to prevent unauthorized access, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/authentication). It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: User shall experience portability between Microsoft Windows and Linux platforms for both intranet and internet versions of the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies portability between Microsoft Windows and Linux for intranet and internet versions—this is a portability concern.

RequirementText: System shall ensure portability between Microsoft Windows and Linux platforms for both intranet and internet versions of the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates portability between Microsoft Windows and Linux for both intranet and internet versions. This is a platform compatibility concern (portability) and does not specify availability, security, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall easily maintain the system due to its modular design, especially concerning frequent changes in database contents.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly addresses ease of maintenance and modular design to accommodate frequent database content changes, which maps directly to Maintainability. It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI, scalability, portability, operability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate easy maintenance of the system with its modular design, especially regarding changes in database contents.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states facilitating easy maintenance via modular design and mentions handling changes in database contents, which is a clear maintainability concern. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: User shall have confidence in the system's performance as it supports multiple users simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on maintaining acceptable performance while supporting multiple simultaneous users, which implies performance (latency/throughput) and scalability (handling concurrent load). No mention of availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall support multiple users simultaneously, ensuring high performance of the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies supporting multiple simultaneous users (functional) and explicitly requires high performance, which implies performance constraints. Supporting simultaneous users with performance implies scalability concerns as well. No mention of availability, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall have access to various editing features including video collages, themes, music bank, and sound effects in the VivaVideo app.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies functional capabilities the user should have (access to editing features). It does not state security constraints, performance, availability, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional requirements.

RequirementText: System shall provide professional video and photo editing tools within the VivaVideo app.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system must provide professional video and photo editing tools. It does not explicitly specify availability, security, UI appearance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create slideshows with additional text art, animated texts, and Photoshop features.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (creating slideshows with text art, animated text, and Photoshop-like features), which is a functional requirement. No quality/constraint aspects (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall offer video editing tools such as trim, cut, crop, merge, copy/duplicate, collage, and looping video clips on the storyboard.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capabilities (video editing operations) the system must offer. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall have access to video editing effects including background blur, video speed adjustment, fade in and out, animated texts and fonts, GIFs, Giphy video stickers, and a music editor.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional capabilities (available video editing effects and tools). It does not impose availability, security, usability, look-and-feel, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall include a fast/slow motion editor for users to choose the best video speed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a feature the system shall include—a fast/slow motion editor allowing users to choose video speed—so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, usability, security, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall have access to a secure and reliable video/photo editor app, VivaVideo, for creating personalized videos and photos.
AI_Rationale: The requirement includes a functional statement (providing access to VivaVideo for creating personalized videos/photos) and explicitly states the app must be secure and reliable. 'Secure' implies Security; 'reliable' implies Availability. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall ensure user data and personal information are securely managed and protected within the VivaVideo app.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns secure management and protection of user personal data, which maps to security (confidentiality/integrity/privacy). It does not specify availability, legal compliance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall enjoy a versatile editing experience with various editing features including video collages, themes, music bank, and sound effects.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies user-visible editing features (video collages, themes, music bank, sound effects), which are functional requirements. It also emphasizes the user's enjoyment/experience, implying usability concerns. The mention of themes and audiovisual effects relates to look-and-feel, so LF is marked. No availability, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, or performance requirements are expressed.

RequirementText: System shall restrict access to sensitive features and functionalities to authorized users only, ensuring privacy and data security.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access restriction to authorized users and ensuring privacy/data security, which is a security requirement (access control/privacy). No other quality attributes (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall create slideshows with additional text art, animated texts, and Photoshop features.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability—creating slideshows with text art, animated text, and Photoshop-like features—which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetic constraints, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall provide a seamless experience for merging clips, cutting, cropping, and looping video clips on the storyboard.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies editing capabilities (merging, cutting, cropping, looping) — functional. The phrase 'seamless experience' implies UX/usability expectations, so marked as Usability.

RequirementText: User shall apply video editing effects such as background blur, video speed adjustment, fade in and out, and animated texts and fonts.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (applying video editing effects: background blur, speed adjustment, fades, animated text/fonts), which is functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, look-and-feel of the product UI, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall offer a fast/slow motion editor for users to choose the best video speed.
