RequirementText: Database backup and multiple admin setup with file access privileges shall be available.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies features (database backup, multiple admin setup, file access privileges) — functional. Backup implies fault-tolerance (ability to recover data) so FT=1. Multiple admin setup and file access privileges concern system administration/manageability (operability) and access control, so O=1 and SE=1. No mention of availability percentages, portability, performance, scalability, legal, UI, maintainability, or usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the control panel based on their role as administrator, employer, or job seeker.

RequirementText: User shall be able to subscribe to different membership tiers, such as Silver, Gold, and Diamond, offering varying limits on resume downloads.

RequirementText: User shall be able to respond to a limited number of profiles per day as a general job seeker.

RequirementText: User shall be able to make payments securely through integrated payment gateways like PayPal, InterSwitch, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to use the application in multiple languages, including English and French.

RequirementText: User shall receive clear validation messages on both client and server sides, with failed fields highlighted and focus directed to them.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to connect their social media accounts like Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

RequirementText: User shall be able to integrate their Strava account or Fitbit watch to view fitness-related information within the CrossFit app.

RequirementText: User shall share their progress within the app and have the ability to copy custom workout sessions.

RequirementText: User shall be alerted if they input incorrect or invalid target calories, such as values below a certain threshold or excessively high values.

RequirementText: User shall be prompted to sign in again and grant permissions if they do not provide access to their account details, ensuring the app has the necessary information.

RequirementText: User shall be alerted if they provide incomplete information regarding the mealtime cycle of the plan, indicating which form fields are incomplete for correction.

RequirementText: User will be prompted to grant permission to access the camera if they initially deny access, allowing the app to utilize camera functionality.

RequirementText: User shall expect the database to update data in less than 1 second to ensure timely information retrieval.

RequirementText: User shall experience a UI load time within 30 milliseconds for quick and responsive user interactions.

RequirementText: User shall anticipate API responses in less than 2.5 seconds to maintain seamless application functionality.

AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior (opening a new window with specific options), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: User will be able to log in to their Quora.com account.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user login). Login inherently involves authentication/authorization concerns, so security is implied. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall verify user input from the database and proceed accordingly, logging the user into the home page.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: verify user input against database and log the user into the home page (functional). Implicitly describes authentication/authorization-related behavior (security), so SE is set. No explicit non-functional attributes like availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to sign up for an account on Quora.com.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing a user capability (account sign-up). It does not specify quality attributes such as availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall display a confirmation popup after the user fills out the form and clicks the submit button, saving the information to the database for further processing.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system behavior: show a confirmation popup and save form data to the database. This is functional in nature. It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be available at all times, accessible via any web browser, even with low browsing speed.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly requires continuous availability (A), accessibility via any web browser/HTML clients (operability O per examples), and functioning under low browsing speed which is a performance/bandwidth constraint (PE). No mention of security, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be available as an application on both Android and iOS platforms.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies platform availability (Android and iOS), which is a portability concern. It also relates to how the product is made available/distributed on platforms, so operability/availability-as-distribution is applicable. No uptime, security, performance, or UI specifics are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be accessible on mobile browsers as well.
AI_Rationale: The statement is a requirement specifying that the system must be accessible via mobile browsers — this is a functional requirement (what the system should do) and concerns compatibility across platforms/environments (portability). It does not explicitly state usability, performance, security, availability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be compatible with any Windows platform with any version of a web browser.
AI_Rationale: Requires compatibility with any Windows platform and any web browser version — this is primarily a portability requirement (support across platforms/environments) and also relates to operability (system must operate/access via web browsers). No indication of performance, security, availability, maintainability, or UI look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The system shall also be accessible on mini browsers for mobile devices.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compatibility with mini/mobile browsers (portability). It also implies usability/accessibility for mobile users, so Usability is applicable. No explicit mention of performance, security, availability, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: The Android application version of the software shall require a minimum Android version of 4.2.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a minimum Android platform version (4.2) required to run the application, which is a portability/platform compatibility constraint. It does not address availability, security, performance, usability, or maintenance.

RequirementText: A commercial database shall be utilized for maintaining the website's database.
AI_Rationale: The requirement constrains the implementation to use a commercial database product—this is an operational/implementation constraint (Operability). It also affects platform/technology choice and interoperability/portability concerns (Portability). It does not specify availability, performance, security, legal compliance, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: The application server shall be responsible for maintaining the website.
AI_Rationale: Statement assigns responsibility for maintaining the website to the application server, which pertains to operation/administration. It does not specify functionality, performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The software design shall prioritize modularity to facilitate efficient maintainability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states prioritizing modularity to facilitate efficient maintainability, directly addressing maintainability (ease of modification and upkeep). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: User will choose between linking a credit or debit card.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the user shall be able to choose between linking a credit or debit card. No quality, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: System will allow the user to link their card.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allowing a user to link their card), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, security, usability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User will input their card details including card number, card type, expiration date, security code, and billing address, and then click on the link card option.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action and system functionality (input card details and click link card), so it is a Functional requirement. It does not state any security, performance, usability, availability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System will display a message indicating that the bank account has been successfully added.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying a confirmation message), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state any quality attributes such as usability, performance, security, or availability.

RequirementText: User will choose from options including searching for their issue, chatting with customer support, asking the community, emailing customer support, or calling customer support.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the system should provide (supporting multiple support/contact options), which is functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so no other NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: System will prompt the user to select their issue or write about their problem.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system behavior (prompting user to select or write their issue) — a functional requirement. It also implies an interaction design aspect affecting usability (how users provide issue information), so Usability is applicable. No indications of availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel aesthetics, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: User will submit their issue or problem.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system function (users submitting issues). It does not include availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System will display a message confirming that the problem or issue has been submitted successfully.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (displaying a confirmation message) which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: User will input the email or mobile number associated with their PayPal account.

RequirementText: System will send a one-time password to the provided email or mobile number.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (sending OTP via email or mobile). Also implies a security-related authentication mechanism (one-time password) so Security is applicable.

RequirementText: User will input the verification code received.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user action/functional behavior (inputting a verification code). It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns like security, availability, usability, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System will confirm the successful submission of the verification code.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (confirming successful submission of a verification code), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User will input a new password and confirm the password.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional behavior (ability for user to input and confirm a new password). It does not explicitly state security, usability, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System will display a message confirming that the password has been created successfully.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying a confirmation message) which is a functional UI action. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall experience a high data transfer rate.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a quality attribute about data transfer rate (performance/throughput), which maps to Performance (PE). It does not describe functional behavior or other quality aspects.

RequirementText: System shall maintain uninterrupted connections.
AI_Rationale: The phrase 'maintain uninterrupted connections' directly targets continuous availability/reachability (Availability). It also strongly implies resilience to faults and continuity under failure conditions, so Fault Tolerance is applicable. No explicit mention of other qualities (security, scalability, performance, functional behavior, etc.).

RequirementText: System must perform effectively in adverse conditions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies effective operation under adverse conditions, implying resilience and graceful handling of faults (fault tolerance) and that the system can be operated/manageable in such conditions (operability). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance metrics, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall automatically log out the user after a period of inactivity.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior (automatic logout) — functional. It is primarily a security requirement (session timeout to protect accounts), so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other qualities are stated.

RequirementText: Back-end servers shall only be accessible to authenticated users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access control requiring authentication for access to back-end servers, which is a security-related constraint (authentication/authorization). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The PayPal network must be available 24 hours a day.
AI_Rationale: Explicit availability requirement specifying 24-hour availability; no functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Only designated maintainers are allowed to connect new users to the PayPal Payment System network and maintain records of all users and transaction status.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that only designated maintainers may add/connect new users (access control) — a security requirement. Also requires maintaining records of users and transaction status — a functional requirement (record-keeping/audit). No explicit availability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, or usability aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall have the option to sign up using their Facebook account.

RequirementText: The user shall have the option to sign up using their Google account.

RequirementText: The user shall have the option to sign up using their Office 365 account.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to sign up by tapping the "Sign Up" button and using their email address.

AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior to handle highest-priority input/interrupts and resume previous state—this is a functional requirement. Also implies fault-tolerance/resilience (graceful handling and recovery), so FT is set. No explicit references to performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to navigate the app intuitively, without requiring external instructions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies intuitive navigation and no external instructions—this is primarily a usability requirement and also implies UI/look-and-feel considerations. No functional, performance, security, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall acknowledge user actions with confirmation to ensure application reliability for business purposes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior — acknowledging user actions with confirmations — which is a functional requirement. It also implies improving user feedback and trust in the system, which relates to usability. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The user shall access the application for installation, updates, and feedback via the Google Play Store.
AI_Rationale: Specifies distribution/deployment channel (Google Play Store) which is a platform/portability constraint and relates to operational/deployment aspects. Does not state functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall render its layout adaptively to different screen sizes, including automatic font size and image adjustments.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall render its layout adaptively (explicit functional behavior) and concerns UI presentation (look & feel) and ease of use across devices (usability). No indications of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall prioritize WiFi connection and automatically switch to mobile network when WiFi is unavailable.
AI_Rationale: Specifies automatic network selection and failover behavior (automatic switching when WiFi unavailable) which is functional behavior and implies fault-tolerance/resilience; does not mention availability metrics or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to serve 20,000 queries/day, with a significant portion during the 4 peak traffic hours.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies capacity/throughput (20,000 queries/day and peak-hour concentration), which directly relates to scalability and performance. It does not specify availability, security, UI, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall prioritize traveler privacy regarding location tracking within the mobility domain.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly concerns prioritizing traveler privacy for location tracking, which maps to security/privacy concerns (confidentiality, data protection). It does not explicitly mention legal compliance, functionality, performance, or other quality attributes, so only Security is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall support language agnostic operation for portability, including English, Turkish, Finnish, and Italian for the identified replication partners.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies multilingual support to enable language-agnostic operation and portability across partners (portability). It also impacts usability for speakers of specified languages, improving user experience. It does not specify functional behavior, availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to apply lenses, set a timer, enable gridlines, enable flash, and then capture a selfie or photo.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies user-facing capabilities (apply lenses, timer, gridlines, flash, capture photo), which are functional behaviors. It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall process the request to the account and upon the other user's acceptance, establish a friendship between these two users.
AI_Rationale: Describes functional behavior: processing a friend request and establishing friendship upon acceptance. No non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Snapchat shall utilize Bitmoji app to perform specified actions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that Snapchat must use the Bitmoji app to perform actions—an operational/integration constraint about how the system is to be operated/deployed. It does not state behavior details (functional) or qualities like performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to view friends' stories, browse global stories, share stories, take screenshots, and report spam content.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies concrete user-facing capabilities (view, browse, share, take screenshots, report spam), which are functional requirements. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall utilize AI to analyze surroundings and select the appropriate lens based on the analysis.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: use AI to analyze surroundings and select an appropriate lens — a functional capability. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall sense any music playing, create an audio fingerprint, and compare it against the database.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system behavior: sensing music, creating an audio fingerprint, and comparing it to a database, which are functional actions. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall display a real-time map powered by Mapbox copyrighted by OpenStreetMap and DigitalGlobe, where user's Bitmoji avatar representing them moves according to their location and even simulates driving by entering a car icon.
AI_Rationale: Specifies display of a real-time Mapbox map and avatar behavior (functional). Mentions visual elements (Bitmoji, car icon) affecting UI/look-and-feel. Includes copyright/attribution, implying legal/licensing requirement.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to send text messages, pictures, videos, audio recordings, video calls, and play multiplayer games.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes functional capabilities (sending various media types, video calls, and multiplayer games). It specifies what the system should do, with no explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall increment the streak counter for daily snapping and reset it to zero upon a break in the chain.
AI_Rationale: Describes specific system behavior (incrementing and resetting a streak counter), which is a functional requirement; no quality/constraint attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall continuously calculate statistics and update Snapchat scores.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior (continuous calculation and updating of scores). The word 'continuously' implies it must run without interruption, which suggests an availability requirement. No explicit performance, scalability, security, maintainability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Upon capturing a selfie, the system shall generate a Snapcode and offer associated actions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: generate a Snapcode after capturing a selfie and present related actions. No non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The Memories shall provide cloud-based storage for a limited number of user-uploaded snaps.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: providing cloud-based storage for user-uploaded snaps with a limit on number. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, scalability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a private section within Memories named "My Eyes Only" secured by a user-defined passcode, with the caveat that a forgotten passcode will result in permanent deletion of all data stored within.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional feature (private section 'My Eyes Only' with passcode) and security requirement (protecting data via passcode and handling of forgotten passcode). No mention of availability, fault tolerance, legal, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to search for Snapchatters, location-based stories, and events in their vicinity, along with other functionalities.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies what the system should do (allow users to search for Snapchatters, location-based stories, and nearby events). No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall attempt to match user keywords with its database, displaying related queries and offering a direct contact option for zero matches.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies system behavior: matching user keywords, displaying related queries, and offering direct contact when no matches — this is a functional feature. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, usability standards, or other non-functional constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall allow authorized users to create, update, and delete sensitive user information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies CRUD functionality (create, update, delete) so it's functional. The phrase "authorized users" explicitly implies an access-control/security requirement (authorization), so security is also applicable. No mention of availability, performance, scalability, legal, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, portability, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall validate user data, verify credentials, and assign the account to the new user with all new user information upon successful validation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (validate data, verify credentials, assign account). 'Verify credentials' also indicates a security-related concern (authentication), so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a social messaging platform where users can create and manage groups with chat functionalities.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes functional behavior (providing a social messaging platform with group creation/management and chat). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to determine if a sent snap has been received by the recipient.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a user-facing capability (ability to determine receipt of a sent snap), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Users shall customize their privacy settings to optimize their experience.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (users can customize privacy settings). Involves privacy controls, which relates to security (confidentiality/privacy). The phrase 'optimize their experience' implies usability concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall enforce strong password management, requiring users to keep passwords confidential and unique for each service.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies enforcement of strong password management, confidentiality and uniqueness across services—clearly a security (authentication/credential management) requirement rather than functional or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure high reliability for its 3 billion+ concurrent users and guarantee secure data storage with appropriate data anonymization techniques.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly demands high reliability for 3 billion+ concurrent users (implying availability and scalability) and secure data storage with anonymization (security/privacy). High reliability also implies fault tolerance/resilience. No functional behavior, performance metrics, portability, legal, usability, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel requirements are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall support Snapchat on Android devices running Android 4.4 or later and iOS devices running iOS 12.4.1 or later, including phones and tablets.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies supported platforms/OS versions and device types (Android 4.4+, iOS 12.4.1+, phones and tablets). It is primarily a portability/compatibility constraint (PO) and also relates to operability/deployment environment (O). It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, scalability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Snapchat shall prioritize continuous maintenance, utilize beta testing for new feature acceptance, and deliver frequent updates to surprise users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement emphasizes ongoing maintenance, regular updates and beta testing process—these are maintainability concerns. Beta testing and aiming to 'surprise users' imply user-facing acceptance/usability considerations rather than security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed for intuitive use by first-time users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies intuitive design for first-time users, which is a usability requirement (ease of use/learnability). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall provide comprehensive and readily accessible help documentation based on user feedback.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (provide help documentation) — functional. 'Readily accessible' and being based on user feedback target user experience and usability, so Usability applies. No mention of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, fault tolerance, legal, or look-and-feel specifics.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a backup and automatic restore facility using an online cloud database to store all user data upon permission, with the ability to restore the information on any device.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a backup and automatic restore facility (functional) and recovery capability (fault tolerance). Requirement mentions restoring on any device, implying portability across platforms. No explicit statements about availability, security, usability, scalability, or maintenance.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to report Snapchatters for irrelevant, inappropriate content, misbehavior, or anything uncomfortable and shall take strict action against reported individuals, posts, or spam.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (allow users to report and take action), which is functional. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, scalability, usability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to provide written feedback, rate the app, and share their thoughts after installation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional capabilities (collect written feedback, ratings, and sharing post-installation). It does not mention quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others, so only Functional is set to true.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to start and manage meetings through both video and audio.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability users must have (start and manage meetings via video and audio), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to send messages to each other.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (users sending messages to each other), i.e., a functional behavior. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: There shall be the ability to form groups or teams.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functionality: the system must provide the ability to form groups or teams. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to send messages to a team of people.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (ability to send messages to a team) describing system behavior—i.e., a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall support file sharing - Photos, videos, documents, etc.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (support file sharing of photos, videos, documents). It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The Teams app shall be designed to scale based on the size of the organization.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly concerns the system's ability to scale with organization size, which maps directly to scalability. It does not specify functionality, availability, performance metrics, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: There shall be clearly defined uptime targets for the Teams app, along with a documented impact of downtime on performance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates uptime targets (Availability). It also requires documentation of the impact of downtime on performance, which directly relates to Performance. No other quality attributes are clearly implied.

RequirementText: The Teams app shall be designed for high availability, ensuring minimal disruption in case of individual service outages.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly requires high availability (availability uptime/reliability). The mention of minimizing disruption in case of individual service outages implies fault tolerance/resilience (graceful degradation/recovery). No other quality attributes are indicated.

RequirementText: Updates to the Teams app shall be delivered through mechanisms that minimize or eliminate impact on ongoing meetings.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies update delivery must minimize or eliminate impact on ongoing meetings — primarily an availability requirement (maintain uptime during updates) and implies graceful degradation/recovery behavior (fault tolerance). It does not explicitly state maintainability, operability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The product shall be designed with very limited graphics usage and shall utilize a simple keypad for user input.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI characteristics: minimal graphics and simple keypad input—this relates to look-and-feel and usability (interface simplicity and user interaction). No availability, security, performance, or maintainability requirements implied.

RequirementText: There shall be no sound or animation used in the product.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI constraint forbidding sound and animation (visual/aural presentation). This is primarily a Look & Feel requirement; it also strongly impacts usability/accessibility, so US is set.

RequirementText: The hardware and operating system shall be capable of supporting a screen resolution no greater than 320 x 240 pixels due to the small form factor.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains the display resolution supported by the hardware/OS. It is primarily an operability/operational-environment constraint (O). It also directly concerns the user interface presentation size (screen resolution), so Look & Feel (LF) is applicable. No explicit statements about availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, or usability metrics are given.

RequirementText: While sound is not essential, it can be considered for future versions of the system. In these future variants, the user shall be greeted by their name upon swiping their card against the reader-writer terminal.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing behavior (greeting the user by name upon card swipe), which is a functional requirement. It also describes a user interface/interaction element (audible greeting) affecting look-and-feel and user experience, so LF and US apply. It does not state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed such that a student can view a page of information by choosing from one of the options given on the welcome screen. Selection shall be performed with a simple keypad.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional capability: students selecting options to view pages (F). Specifies use of a simple keypad for selection, implying a usability/accessibility constraint (US). No mentions of availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: A staff member shall view a page of information by selecting from the options presented on the welcome screen. Selection shall be performed using a simple keypad.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user action and system behavior (view a page by selecting options) — this is functional. It also prescribes the input method ('simple keypad'), which affects usability (interaction modality), so Usability is applicable. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: A student cum staff shall view a page of information upon selection from the welcome screen options using a simple keypad.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system behavior (a student or staff views an information page after selecting options from the welcome screen using a keypad), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The software shall be designed for the smart card reader-writer terminal and shall not run on a standalone desktop PC.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the required deployment platform (must run on a smart card reader-writer terminal and not on a desktop PC). This is a portability/target-platform constraint rather than a functional behavior or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: The software will support simultaneous user acces only if there are multiple terminals.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a conditional functional behavior (support simultaneous user access only when multiple terminals exist). It does not state availability, scalability, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: Only textual information will be handled by the software.
AI_Rationale: This statement constrains what the system will handle (data type allowed—text only), which is a functional requirement defining system behavior/capabilities rather than a quality/ non-functional attribute.

RequirementText: Under normal conditions, 95% of transactions shall be processed in less than 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a timing/response-time constraint (95% of transactions < 5s) which is a performance metric. It does not explicitly address availability, usability, scalability, or other quality aspects.

RequirementText: A server shall host the RMOS and provide system data processing and storage capability.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability: a server must host the RMOS and provide data processing and storage. It does not explicitly constrain availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, operability, scalability, or other non-functional aspects, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: A surface computer shall provide a customer with all customer system functionality.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the system shall do—provide customers with all customer system functionality. No explicit quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: A tablet shall provide a waiter/supervisor with all waiter/supervisor system functionality (according to access control).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the tablet shall provide waiter/supervisor system functionality — this is a functional requirement. It also references 'according to access control', which implies authorization/security constraints, so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: A display shall provide a chef with all chef system functionality.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the display must provide all chef system functionality (a functional capability). It also implies a usability concern—ensuring the chef can access/use all functionality via the display. No explicit statements about performance, security, availability, look-and-feel layout, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: All system functionality shall be accessible through touch sensitive surface computers, tablets and displays via simple touch gestures.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that all functionality must be accessible via touch-sensitive devices and simple touch gestures: this is a functional requirement (what the system must provide) and directly concerns usability (interaction modality, ease of use). It also implies portability/compatibility with specified device classes (surface computers, tablets, displays), so Portability is marked. Other quality attributes are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: A tablet shall be capable of interfacing with a register to facilitate the accurate processing of a payment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (tablet must interface with a register to process payments) which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to engage their menu by double tapping the activated surface computer in their table.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability (customer can engage menu via double tap) and specifies a UI interaction/behavior, implying look-and-feel and usability concerns (gesture-based interaction). No availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes are indicated.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to dismiss their menu by double tapping its dismiss option.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user interaction (dismissing a menu via double-tap). It also implies a usability concern (interaction modality/UX). It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to create an empty pending order through their engaged menu.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability/behavior (customer can create an empty pending order via their menu), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: A customer shall not be able to dismiss their engaged menu while there is a non-empty pending order associated with the engaged menu.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a specific system behavior (prevent dismissing an engaged menu when a pending order exists), which is a functional constraint. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to navigate through the available items in their engaged menu.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (customer can navigate items) and concerns user interface/navigation quality, implying usability and look-and-feel requirements. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to add an item to a pending order by dragging the item from the engaged menu onto the order.
AI_Rationale: Describes a specific user capability (customer can add an item to a pending order via drag-and-drop), which is a functional requirement. No quality/ non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to remove an item from a pending order by dragging the item off the order.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability (remove item from pending order) — functional. It prescribes a specific UI interaction (dragging the item off the order), which pertains to usability (interaction behavior). No availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal concerns are implied.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to add a special dietary requirement to an order by dragging the requirement from the engaged menu onto the order.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to add a dietary requirement). It also specifies a particular user interaction (drag-and-drop), which affects usability/UX, so US is marked. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to add a wildcard special dietary requirement to an order in the case that their requirement is not represented by the system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to add a wildcard/custom dietary requirement) — a functional behavior. It does not state non-functional aspects such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to place an order through their engaged menu if it is pending and not empty.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability/behavioral requirement: customers must be able to place an order under given conditions (pending and not empty). No quality/constraints like performance, security, usability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to cancel an order through their engaged menu if it is pending and not yet placed.
AI_Rationale: This describes a user capability/behavioral requirement (ability to cancel an order under a specific condition), which is functional. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to call for waiter assistance through their engaged menu.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action/feature: customers can call for waiter assistance via the menu. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to engage bill mode to finalise payment through their engaged menu.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability — engaging bill mode to finalise payment via the menu — which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, usability, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to disengage bill mode to cancel the billing process through their engaged menu.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (customers can cancel billing via menu) — a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: When in billing mode, a surface computer shall display a representation of a cash payment for the whole table.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: when in billing mode the surface computer shall display a representation of a cash payment for the whole table. It describes what the system must do (display specific content), so it is a functional requirement. It does not impose availability, fault tolerance, legal, look/feel (layout or aesthetics), maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, security, or usability constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: When in billing mode, a surface computer shall display a representation of a bankcard payment for each customer.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when in billing mode the surface computer shall display a bankcard payment representation. This is a functional UI requirement, not specifying quality attributes.

RequirementText: When in billing mode, a surface computer shall display a representation of every meal ordered that may each be dragged into a payment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior: in billing mode the system shall display each ordered meal and allow each to be dragged into a payment. This describes functional UI behavior (what the system must do). It does not explicitly impose availability, performance, security, portability, maintainability, scalability, legal, or look-and-feel constraints, nor does it state usability metrics, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: When in billing mode, a surface computer shall display a representation of tip denominations that may be dragged into a payment.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system behavior: in billing mode the surface computer shall display tip denominations and allow them to be dragged into a payment (UI interaction). This is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, maintainability, scalability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to drag a meal into a bankcard payment or a cash payment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (drag a meal into a bankcard or cash payment), which is a functional behavior. It also describes a user-interface interaction that affects usability (drag-and-drop), so Usability is applicable. It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel aesthetics explicitly.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to drag a meal out of a bankcard payment or a cash payment.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (dragging a meal from a bankcard or cash payment) — a functional requirement. It also implies a user interface interaction requirement affecting usability. No availability, performance, security, portability, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to drag a tip denomination into a bankcard payment or a cash payment.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user action (dragging a tip into a payment). It also implies a user interaction/usability concern (drag-and-drop behavior), but does not mention performance, availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, or legal/visual-aesthetics constraints.

RequirementText: A customer shall be able to drag a tip denomination out of a bankcard payment or a cash payment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (drag a tip denomination) — a functional requirement. Also implies a UI interaction affecting usability/UX (drag gesture), so Usability is applicable. No mention of availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A waiter shall be able to log into a tablet using their assigned username and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (waiter login) and implies authentication using username/password, which is a security requirement. No availability, performance, usability, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: A waiter shall be able to log out of a tablet.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that a waiter must be able to perform the logout action on a tablet. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or usability metrics.

RequirementText: A waiter shall be able to activate a surface computer and consequently open its associated account through a tablet.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing an action the waiter must perform (activate a surface computer and open its account via a tablet). It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: A waiter shall be able to deactivate a surface computer and consequently close its associated account through a tablet.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an action the system must allow (deactivate a surface computer and close its account via a tablet) — a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: A waiter who activates a surface computer shall be assigned to the table that contains it.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior/requirement mapping a waiter who activates a surface computer to being assigned to that table — a functional rule about system behavior. No explicit quality attributes (security, availability, UI, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: A tablet shall allow a waiter to accept an order placed by a customer through a surface computer.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: a tablet must allow a waiter to accept an order placed by a customer. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: A tablet shall allow a waiter to reject an order placed by a customer through a surface computer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (the tablet must allow a waiter to reject a customer order). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: A tablet shall allow a waiter to indicate the delivery of an item to its customer.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability: the tablet must let a waiter mark/deliver an item to a customer. No quality/constraint (availability, security, usability, etc.) is specified.

RequirementText: A tablet shall allow a waiter to process a payment using cash.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the tablet shall allow a waiter to process cash payments. No non-functional quality (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: A tablet shall allow a waiter to process a payment using a bankcard.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: a waiter using a tablet shall be able to process a bankcard payment. No non-functional constraints (security, availability, performance, usability, etc.) are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: A chef shall be able to accept a customers order item through a display.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability: the chef must be able to accept a customer's order item via a display. It specifies what the system should do rather than non-functional qualities; no explicit availability, performance, security, usability or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: A chef shall be able to reject a customers order item through a display.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability/behavior (chef can reject a customer's order item via a display). This is a functional requirement; no quality constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: A chef shall be able to indicate that a customers order item is ready to be served through a display.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability the system must provide (chef indicates an order item is ready and shown on a display), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: A supervisor shall be able to do everything a waiter can.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that a supervisor role must have the same functional capabilities as a waiter (functional requirement) and implies role-based authorization/permissions (security). No indications of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: A supervisor shall be able to do everything a chef can.
AI_Rationale: Specifies role-based capability/permission (supervisor can perform all chef actions) which is a functional requirement about what the system must allow and implicates security/authorization (access control). No indication of availability, performance, scalability, usability, etc.

RequirementText: A supervisor shall be able to abort/purge a customers meal from the active system with no expectation of payment.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (a supervisor can abort/purge a customer's meal and not expect payment). It describes functional behavior/operation. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A supervisor shall be able to abort/purge a table's account/meals from the active system with no expectation of payment.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability (supervisor can abort/purge account/meals) — a functional requirement. It also implies role-based authorization (only a supervisor can perform this administrative action), so security (access control) applies. No explicit availability, performance, usability, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, or operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: A supervisor shall be able to issue a refund for one or more items to a customer.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (a supervisor can issue refunds), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security constraints, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall log every state and state change of every surface computer, tablet and display to provision recovery from system failure.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system function to log all states and changes (functional) explicitly for enabling recovery from failures, which is a fault-tolerance requirement. It does not mention availability metrics, security, performance, portability, scalability, operability, maintainability, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The system shall be capable of restoring itself to its previous state in the event of failure (e.g. a system crash or power loss).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system must restore itself to a previous state after failures, which is a functional behavior (F) and primarily a fault-tolerance/recovery quality (FT). No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to display a menu at all times to facilitate manual order taking should the need arise.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (display a menu) and states it must be available "at all times," implying an availability requirement. No explicit mention of other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall utilise periodic 30-second keep-alive messages between tablets and the server to monitor tablet operational status.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behaviour (periodic keep-alive messages) => Functional. Specifies timing constraint (30-second interval) related to operational timing/monitoring => Performance. The purpose is monitoring tablet operational status, which pertains to operability/administration/monitoring => Operability. No explicit mentions of availability targets, security, scalability, fault tolerance, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall flag tablets that fail to send timely keep-alive messages as non-operational and disassociate the assigned waiter from the tablet.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (flag and disassociate) => Functional. It defines handling of device failures (detecting missed keep-alives and marking non-operational) => Fault Tolerance. It describes operational management actions (managing device/waiter assignments) => Operability. No explicit availability targets, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: Wireless communication throughout the system will be encrypted using SSLv3 at the application layer and WPA2-PSK at the data link layer.
AI_Rationale: Specifies encryption protocols (SSLv3 and WPA2-PSK) for wireless communication, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). No other quality attributes (availability, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The WPA2-PSK password used for wireless communication must have a bit- strength of at least 80 bits.
AI_Rationale: Specifies minimum cryptographic key strength for WPA2-PSK wireless communication, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity of communications). No functional, availability, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The WPA2-PSK password used for wireless communication must be changed every three months.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates periodic rotation of the WPA2-PSK password for wireless communication, which is a security control (password policy). It does not specify functional behavior, availability, fault tolerance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: A surface computer must not dismiss an engaged menu unless the customer requests it.
AI_Rationale: Specifies interactive behavior of the UI (menu should remain until user requests dismissal). This is a functional requirement about system behavior and directly affects usability.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting no less than 200 concurrent connections from any combination of surface computers, tablets and displays.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity for number of concurrent connections (capacity/ability to scale to a given load), which is a scalability requirement. It does not state functional behavior, performance metrics like latency, availability targets, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of surface computers, tablets and displays, that is, it shall provide no limit on how many devices are in the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies unlimited number of devices supported by the server, which is a scalability concern. It does not specify performance, availability, security, or functional behavior beyond the scalability constraint.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active meals/orders, that is, no meals/orders shall be lost under any circumstances.
AI_Rationale: Requires supporting an arbitrary (unbounded) number of active orders = scalability. "No meals/orders shall be lost under any circumstances" specifies durability/resilience to failures = fault tolerance. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other concerns mentioned.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active customer payments, that is, no payments shall be lost under any circumstances.
AI_Rationale: Specifies handling an arbitrary (unbounded) number of active payments → scalability. Requirement that no payments shall be lost under any circumstances implies fault tolerance/resilience/durability. Does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall have control over the database and manage all records of customers and employee details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users shall control the database and manage customer and employee records. It does not mention availability, security, operability, performance, or other quality attributes explicitly, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: System shall enable the administrator to manage the database and track all customer and employee records.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies an administrative capability (manage database and track records), which is a functional requirement. It also implies administrator/management features (operability). No explicit mentions of security, availability, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall contact vendors and grant permission for selling products on the site after quality testing.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action/workflow (contact vendors and grant permission after quality testing) describing system behavior; no non-functional concerns (availability, security, scalability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate communication with vendors and authorize them to sell products on the site after quality assessment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system capabilities: communicating with vendors and authorizing them after quality assessment, which are functional requirements. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, availability, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall view all employee details and oversee the entire site operation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user capabilities/functional behavior: viewing employee details and overseeing site operations. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall provide the administrator with access to view all employee details and manage the site.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement specifies functionality (admin can view employee details and manage site) -> Functional. It also implies access control for administrators (authorization) similar to examples, so Security is applicable.

RequirementText: User shall be responsible for creating advertisements for the site.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional responsibility/behavior (that users create advertisements). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall allow the administrator to create advertisements to promote the site.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: administrators can create advertisements. It does not state non-functional constraints such as performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: User must have a valid login ID to access the site.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that only users with a valid login ID may access the site, which is an authentication/access-control constraint (security). It does not specify functional behavior beyond access, nor address availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall require customers to log in with a valid ID to access the site.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an authentication constraint (customers must log in with a valid ID) which is a security concern (access control). It does not state performance, availability, UI, maintainability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: User shall sign up for a new account to gain access to the site.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional behavior: users must sign up for an account to gain access. It does not explicitly state quality attributes such as security, availability, usability, or others, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall enable new users to register for a new ID to access the site.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—user registration (creating a new ID). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall view and edit personal details, payment information, and service details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional capabilities (view and edit specific user data). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall allow customers to view and edit their personal details, payment information, and service details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional capabilities (view and edit customer personal, payment, and service details). It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, usability, performance, or others, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall browse and compare available products before making a purchase.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (system shall allow users to browse and compare products). It also has a usability aspect (supports user decision-making and ease of use), but no explicit availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall enable customers to compare and choose products from the available options.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (compare and choose products), which is a functional requirement; no quality, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to purchase products using a valid credit card.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — enabling users to purchase products via credit card. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as security, performance, availability, usability, or legal/compliance requirements, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate product purchases using valid credit card information provided by customers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability—facilitating product purchases using customers' valid credit card information—which describes functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention security, availability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall provide feedback to the 24X7 customer care service center regarding their experience with the site and services.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: users can provide feedback to the customer care service center. The phrase '24X7' explicitly implies an availability requirement for the service center, so Availability is marked. No explicit security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall allow customers to provide feedback to the customer care service center regarding their experience.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow customers to provide feedback). It does not state any quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall log out of the site after completing product purchases.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required user action/behavior (functional). Additionally enforces session termination after purchase, which primarily serves a security goal (protecting user session/confidentiality), so marked as Security.

RequirementText: System shall prompt customers to log out of the site after completing their purchases.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (system behavior: prompt users to log out). It also serves usability (helps users complete session management) and security (encourages logout to protect sessions), so US and SE are marked. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Visitors shall access the site without registration.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (allowing visitors to access site without registration) — a functional requirement; also defines an access/authorization policy (anonymous access), which falls under security concerns.

RequirementText: System shall allow visitors to browse the site without the need for registration.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow visitors to browse without registering), i.e., functional behavior. It does not explicitly address availability, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Shop owners shall obtain permission from the administrator before selling their products on the site.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an authorization workflow (shop owners must obtain administrator permission before selling), which is a functional behavior and implies an access-control/security constraint (authorization). It does not state availability, performance, usability, legal, or other quality aspects.

RequirementText: System shall require shop owners to obtain permission from the administrator before selling products.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying a workflow/authorization control (shop owners must obtain administrator permission before selling). It also implies an access-control/authorization security concern, so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Shop owners shall consult with the administrator regarding product quality and advertisements.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required behavior/interaction (shop owners must consult administrator about product quality and advertisements), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, legal compliance, UI, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate communication between shop owners and the administrator for discussing product quality and advertisements.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (facilitate communication between shop owners and the administrator), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Shop owners shall be responsible for advertising their products, and the site shall not be liable for any advertisements.
AI_Rationale: This requirement assigns legal responsibility and limits liability for advertisements—a legal/compliance statement. It does not specify system functionality, quality attributes like availability, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall allow shop owners to advertise their products, with no liability for the site regarding advertisements.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states a functional behavior ('allow shop owners to advertise their products') so F=1. The phrase 'no liability for the site regarding advertisements' imposes a legal/liability constraint, so L=1. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Sales managers shall view customer details and manage product sales and deliveries.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities: sales managers must view customer details and manage product sales and deliveries. No explicit quality, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: System shall provide sales managers with access to customer details and manage product sales and deliveries.
AI_Rationale: Describes functional capabilities: granting sales managers access to customer details and managing product sales and deliveries. No explicit non-functional requirements (security, performance, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Sales managers shall monitor product stocks and notify the administrator when stocks are low.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: sales managers shall monitor stocks and the system shall notify the administrator when stocks are low. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall enable sales managers to monitor product stocks and alert the administrator of low stock levels.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional capabilities: enabling sales managers to monitor stocks and alert administrators of low stock levels. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Purchase managers shall obtain permission from the administrator before purchasing products from vendors.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an access-control/authorization workflow (purchase managers must obtain admin permission) which is a functional behavior with a security/authorization constraint. No availability, performance, scalability, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall require purchase managers to obtain permission from the administrator before purchasing products.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a business workflow/control (functional behavior) enforcing that purchase managers must obtain administrator permission before purchases. It also implies an authorization/access-control security constraint, so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Purchase managers shall manage product stocks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior (managing product stocks by purchase managers), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall allow purchase managers to manage product stocks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow purchase managers to manage product stocks). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or look-and-feel concerns, so only the Functional label applies.

RequirementText: Accounts managers shall track payment transactions and update payment information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must provide: account managers tracking payment transactions and updating payment information. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall enable accounts managers to track payment transactions and update payment information.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability (track transactions and update payment info) for account managers, which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Accounts managers shall validate customer account numbers with banks before processing transactions.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior: account managers must validate customer account numbers with banks before processing transactions — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, legal, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate accounts managers in validating customer account numbers with banks before processing transactions.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a feature: enabling account managers to validate customer account numbers with banks before transactions. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Accounts managers shall consult with the administrator regarding payment details for updating the database.
AI_Rationale: This describes a required behavior/process (accounts managers must consult administrator before updating payment details in the database), so it is functional. It does not specify availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall allow accounts managers to consult with the administrator regarding payment details for updating the database.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability/behavior (allow account managers to consult with the administrator regarding payment details for updating the database), so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, operability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, or usability constraints.
