RequirementText: Customer care representatives shall receive and address customer complaints, queries, and feedback.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability: customer care reps must receive and handle customer complaints, queries, and feedback. It specifies what the system/organization should do, not quality attributes like availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall enable customer care representatives to receive and address customer complaints, queries, and feedback.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide to customer care representatives (receiving and addressing complaints/queries/feedback), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customer care representatives shall provide feasible solutions to customers' complaints and queries.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional obligation for customer care representatives to provide feasible solutions to complaints and queries. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall empower customer care representatives to provide feasible solutions to customers' complaints and queries.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability enabling customer care representatives to provide solutions to complaints and queries — a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities such as availability, performance, usability, security, etc., so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall be able to use the system without experiencing any faults, even with a high number of items and users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies no faults experienced (fault tolerance/availability) and explicitly mentions handling high numbers of items/users (scalability). Performance is implied but not explicitly stated, so omitted.

RequirementText: System shall accommodate a large volume of items and users without encountering faults.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies handling large volume of items and users (scalability). Phrase 'without encountering faults' indicates resilience against failures — fault tolerance. It does not explicitly state performance, availability metrics, security, portability, or other qualities, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: User shall view information with responses appearing on the screen within 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement (user views information) together with an explicit performance constraint (responses within 5 seconds). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System use shall not pose any harm to human users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement expresses a safety/regulatory constraint (system must not cause harm to humans). The closest matching label in the provided set is Legal (compliance/safety obligations). No other non-functional category (security, usability, etc.) is explicitly implied.

RequirementText: System shall prioritize the safety of human users during operation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies prioritizing human safety during operation, which implies resilience, graceful degradation, and protective behavior in fault or hazardous conditions (Fault Tolerance). It also pertains to how the system is operated and managed to avoid harm (Operability). It does not explicitly address availability, security, usability, or other listed categories.

RequirementText: System shall utilize a secured database to ensure data security.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates a 'secured database' to 'ensure data security', which is a clear security (confidentiality/integrity) requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall employ a secured database for storing information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the database must be secured (access control/encryption) which is a security requirement. No explicit availability, performance, or functional behavior beyond using a secured DB.

RequirementText: Normal users shall have read-only access to information, except for their personal and authorized data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (who can read or modify data), which is a security (SE) concern. It does not address availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall restrict normal users to read-only access, allowing modification only for personal and authorized data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access-control behavior (restricting modification rights) which is both a functional requirement (what the system should do) and a security requirement (authorization/privilege enforcement). No indication of other quality concerns.

RequirementText: System shall implement access constraints for different types of users.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies implementing access constraints (access control) which is both a functional capability (enforcing different user permissions) and a security concern (authorization). No indications of availability, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall impose access constraints based on user types.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control behavior (functional) and enforces restrictions by user type, which is a security requirement (authorization). No indication of availability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: V Mart shall handle expected and unexpected errors to prevent loss of information and minimize downtime.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on handling errors to prevent data loss and minimize downtime—i.e., fault tolerance and availability concerns. It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, or other attributes.

RequirementText: System shall manage expected and unexpected errors to prevent data loss and minimize downtime.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on managing errors to prevent data loss and minimize downtime — this addresses fault tolerance (error handling, resilience) and availability (minimizing downtime). It does not specify functional behavior, security, scalability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The website of V Mart shall be user-friendly for non-technical users, regardless of its size.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies user-friendliness for non-technical users, which is a usability (UX) concern. It does not state functional behavior, performance, availability, security, scalability, or other NFRs explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that the V Mart website is user-friendly for non-technical users, regardless of its size.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the site must be user-friendly for non-technical users — this is a usability concern (US). It also implies aspects of look-and-feel (LF) because user-friendliness for end users typically involves UI/layout. The phrase 'regardless of its size' suggests the site must remain usable as it grows, implying scalability (SC). No functional behavior, security, performance, portability, availability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view cancellation charges based on cancellation time availability and receive refunds through their payment gateway.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies user-facing capabilities (view cancellation charges and receive refunds via payment gateway), which are functional behaviors. It does not explicitly constrain availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall display cancellation charges based on cancellation time, availability, and process refunds through the user's payment gateway.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior: display cancellation charges based on cancellation time and availability, and process refunds via the user's payment gateway—these are functional actions. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to modify existing tickets, including parameters such as time, date, route, and availability.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a user capability (modify existing tickets and their parameters), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall calculate modification charges based on modifying time, date, route, availability, display new fares, and process payments through the payment gateway.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behaviors: calculating modification charges, displaying new fares, and processing payments—these are functional requirements. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, availability, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: After the journey, users shall receive a feedback form to provide feedback based on their journey experience.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (sending a feedback form after a journey), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall send a feedback form to users after the journey for them to share their feedback.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system action (sending a feedback form after a journey), which is a functional behavior. It does not state non-functional constraints such as performance, availability, security, usability metrics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admin shall log in by entering admin ID, admin password, and admin name.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying how an admin logs in (inputs required). It also implies an authentication/security concern (access control), so Security is marked. No availability, performance, usability or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: System shall display the Admin Home Page upon successful login.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior: showing the Admin Home Page after successful login, which is a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to add new routes or edit existing bus journey routes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (administrators can add or edit routes). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall display newly edited or added routes in the booking section.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the system must display newly edited or added routes in the booking section. No quality attributes (availability, performance, UI/look-and-feel, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Admin shall update the timing of bus arrival and departure, as well as its location.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an admin capability to update bus arrival/departure times and location — a functional requirement describing system behavior. No quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall display updated time, location, and bus status on the user pages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system action to display specific data (time, location, bus status) on user pages — a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, UI layout, usability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admin shall have the authority to cancel any bus route or make it unavailable for any reason.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability/behavior: administrators can cancel or make bus routes unavailable (a functional permission/operation). It does not specify availability, security mechanisms, or other non-functional qualities, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall update the cancellation status on the user page upon bus cancellation by the admin.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: updating cancellation status on the user page when admin cancels a bus. This is a functional requirement; no availability, performance, security, UI appearance, or other non-functional aspects are implied.

RequirementText: Based on user feedback, Admin shall have the ability to change or modify accessibility.
AI_Rationale: This specifies an admin capability (ability to change/modify accessibility), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional quality (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) is stated.

RequirementText: System shall send resolved feedback messages to users via email or SMS.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must perform (sending resolved feedback messages) and the delivery channels (email or SMS), so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, portability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access all features of the Online Matrimonial Portal accurately implemented as specified in the document.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that users shall be able to access all features and that features be implemented accurately as specified—this describes functional behavior/functional completeness. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that all requirements outlined for the Online Matrimonial Portal are correctly implemented and operational.
AI_Rationale: The requirement is a high-level meta-requirement about ensuring that specified requirements are implemented and the system is operational. This implies concerns about maintainability/verification (ensuring correct implementation) and operability (being operational), but it does not specify functional behavior, security, availability, performance, or other specific quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the application from any web browser and hardware platform.
AI_Rationale: Specifies platform/browser independence and ability to be accessed from any browser/hardware — indicates portability (PO) and operational access method (O). No explicit performance, security, availability, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: System shall ensure the portability of the application across various operating systems and devices.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly requires portability across operating systems and devices, which maps directly to Portability (PO). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall experience high efficiency while using the software, with tasks performed simultaneously across different modules.
AI_Rationale: The requirement emphasizes user-perceived efficiency (usability). The ability to perform tasks simultaneously across modules implies performance (concurrency/throughput) and scalability (handling concurrent operations across components). No legal, security, availability, or maintainability aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall maintain efficiency even in the event of system failure, with recovery expected within an hour or less.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies maintaining efficiency during system failure and recovery within an hour — this indicates fault tolerance/resilience and an availability/uptime/recovery-time constraint. It also refers to maintaining efficiency (performance) during failure, so performance is relevant. No legal, UI, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or usability aspects are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: User shall find the user interface of the software simple yet efficient, suitable for users with varying levels of technical expertise.
AI_Rationale: Requirement addresses the user interface's simplicity and suitability across skill levels, which targets usability. It also references the interface appearance/behavior (look and feel), so LF is applicable. No availability, security, performance, or other qualities are implied.

RequirementText: System shall ensure usability by providing an intuitive user interface for easy navigation and functionality.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly targets usability: an intuitive user interface for easy navigation and functionality. This maps directly to Usability. It does not specify legal, performance, look-and-feel specifics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall experience continuous availability of the system, accessible 24/7 via web browsers.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies continuous availability (24/7), which is an Availability concern. It also specifies access via web browsers, which describes a functional access modality, so marked as Functional. No explicit mentions of performance, security, portability, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall guarantee uninterrupted service, with downtime limited to scheduled server maintenance.
AI_Rationale: Specifies guarantee of uninterrupted service and limits downtime to scheduled maintenance—this is an availability (uptime) requirement. No mention of fault tolerance, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to rely on the system's redundancy measures, ensuring the reliability of data storage and minimizing the risk of data loss.
AI_Rationale: Requirement emphasizes system redundancy and reliability of data storage to minimize data loss, which directly relates to availability and fault tolerance. No functional action, security, scalability, or other concerns are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to provide customer details including name, address, and phone number.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to provide customer details (name, address, phone) — a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall request a deposit of Rs. 5000 upon entry of valid customer information and update it temporarily in the customer database.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (request deposit and update customer database temporarily), which is functional behavior. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall confirm deposit money receipt.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action/functional behavior (the system must require user confirmation of a deposit receipt). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: System shall generate a username and password for the customer upon confirmation and convert temporary data to permanent storage.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (generate credentials and convert temporary to permanent storage). Involves authentication/credentials generation, which implies a security concern (SE). No explicit performance, availability, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall input the date, destination, and duration for car rental.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: the system shall allow the user to input date, destination, and duration for a car rental. No explicit non-functional quality attributes (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall display all available cars with hourly and per kilometer charges.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior to display available cars and pricing information (content/functional requirement). No quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, usability, or look-and-feel are implied.

RequirementText: User shall select a specific car from the list.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action/functional behavior (selecting a car from a list). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall provide the allotted vehicle number, driver's mobile number, estimated charge, and update the car status to 'rented'.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies specific system behaviors: providing vehicle number, driver's mobile number, estimated charge, and updating car status to 'rented' — i.e., functional behavior. No non-functional qualities (security, performance, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall validate the duty slip and confirm payment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action/functional behavior (validating a duty slip and confirming payment). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System shall generate a bill, update the database upon payment confirmation, and change the car status to 'available'.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies concrete system behaviors: generating a bill, updating DB on payment confirmation, and changing car status. These are functional actions; no availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall input new car information and car statistics.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action/functional behavior (input new car information and statistics). It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall update the car information, delete irreparable car data, and adjust car rent accordingly.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behaviors: updating car info, deleting data, and adjusting rent—these are functional operations. No quality/constraint (availability, security, performance, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall input the current car status ('rented', 'gone to repair', 'available').
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional requirement specifying that the user shall input the car's current status; it does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: System shall update the car status accordingly.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system action (updating car status), which is functional. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: User shall access various car rent statistics stored in the car database.
AI_Rationale: The sentence specifies a functional capability: users shall access car rent statistics stored in the database. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall provide car-wise statistics to assist in predicting profitable new car orders.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement: the system must provide car-wise statistics to support prediction of profitable new car orders. No non-functional aspects (performance, security, availability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to interact with the registration window for entering customer details and registering new customers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to interact with a registration window to enter customer details and register new customers — describes functional behavior (what the system should do). No explicit quality, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall display a registration window containing text fields for customer information and a register button for deposit submission.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior: the system must display a registration window with text fields and a register button for deposit submission. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, or aesthetic constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the login window for entering username and password.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a functional capability (accessing the login window). It does not explicitly state security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall provide a login window with fields for username and password, along with buttons for logging in and registering.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional feature (provide a login window with username/password fields and buttons) and describes UI elements (fields and buttons), which is a Look & Feel concern. It does not specify security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view the customer homepage after logging in.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (view customer homepage after logging in), which is a functional requirement about system behavior. No explicit non-functional quality constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall display the customer homepage for online car booking, showcasing available cars and enabling selection for specific time spans.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: presenting a customer homepage, showing available cars, and enabling selection for time spans. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the employee homepage upon login.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: after login the user can access the employee homepage. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall present the employee homepage for inputting duty slip information, calculating net bills, and updating car status and customer database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior: presenting an employee homepage and enabling input of duty slip data, calculating net bills, and updating car status and customer database. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the manager homepage after login.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to access manager homepage). The 'after login' constraint implies an access control/authorization aspect, so Security is also applicable. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: System shall show the manager homepage for adding and deleting cars, displaying car statistics, and adjusting car rents.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (manager homepage and its capabilities: add/delete cars, display stats, adjust rents). It does not state non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.), so no other labels apply.

RequirementText: The software shall run on Linux or Windows OS.
AI_Rationale: Specifies target operating systems (platform support/compatibility). Matches portability requirement; does not address availability, operability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall utilize separate databases for cars and customers.
AI_Rationale: This is an architectural/operational constraint specifying use of separate databases (deployment/operability concern). It also implies improved maintainability by separating concerns/data, but does not explicitly mention performance, scalability, security, or functionality.

RequirementText: The software shall require internet access for functionality.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies an environmental/deployment requirement (software must have internet access), which aligns with Operability (environment and operational prerequisites). It does not state availability, security, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: The hardware requirements include a computer with at least 256 MB RAM and internet connection.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies deployment/hardware prerequisites (minimum RAM and network connectivity), which pertains to operability/installation readiness rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall communicate through web browser enabling and use HTTP protocol for data transfer.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system shall communicate (use a web browser and HTTP) which is a functional interface requirement; it also concerns how the system is accessed/operated (access via browser), so classified as Operability. No mention of availability, security, portability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Response time for system operations shall be less than 1 second, except for internet-dependent functions.
AI_Rationale: This is a performance requirement specifying response time (<1s) for system operations, with an exception for internet-dependent functions. It concerns speed/latency only, not availability, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The software shall offer password protection for customer bookings.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the software shall offer password protection for customer bookings — this is primarily a security requirement (authentication/authorization/confidentiality). It also describes a functional capability to provide password protection, so F is set as well. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Access to editing booking, billing, and car information shall be limited to authorized personnel.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access limited to authorized personnel (access control), which is a security constraint (authentication/authorization). No other quality attributes or functional behaviors are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to interact with the text-based command-line interface of the system, which is provided as a method of interaction for users and administrators.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system shall provide a text-based command-line interface and that users shall be able to interact with it — this defines functional behavior (an interaction method). No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, usability metrics, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall support multiple command-line interface modes such as Fastkramch, Bcturch, Muhturch, and ]madbtanam, offering different functionalities based on user requirements.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability—supporting multiple CLI modes with different functionalities—so it is a Functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, usability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a structured experience for users to navigate through commands tailored to their needs.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes the user interface/navigation experience and tailoring to users' needs, which concerns look & feel and usability. It does not specify functionality, performance, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: System shall help users quickly execute commands by providing autocomplete suggestions for keywords and command options.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional feature (autocomplete suggestions) and describes its goal to help users execute commands quickly, which is a usability concern. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall handle commands entered by users and execute them based on the specified parameters, ensuring proper feedback and response to user actions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (accepting and executing user commands) which is functional. It also requires providing proper feedback/response to user actions, which pertains to usability. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other non-functional attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall maintain a history of executed commands for users to reference and repeat or modify as needed.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (maintain a history of executed commands) — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall support a wide range of commands and command options for users to perform various tasks, such as data manipulation, configuration, Management, and troubleshooting, etc.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system shall support a wide range of commands/options to perform tasks — this describes functional capabilities. Because it includes management and troubleshooting commands (administrative operations), it also implies operability concerns. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, fault tolerance, or legal/look-and-feel aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to interact with the text-based command-line interface of the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (interact with a command-line interface) — a functional requirement defining system behavior. No quality constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: System shall provide a secure environment for user interaction with the command-line interface.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly demands a secure environment for user interaction with the command-line interface, which is a security (confidentiality/integrity) concern. No explicit availability, usability, operability, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The command-line interface shall have a response time of less than 5 seconds, ensuring efficient user interaction.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum response time for the command-line interface, which is a performance (timing/latency) requirement; no explicit availability, fault-tolerance, security, or usability constraints beyond performance are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure a high level of security in handling user inputs and commands, protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns protecting against threats and vulnerabilities in handling inputs and commands, which maps directly to security (confidentiality/integrity/validation). No mention of availability, performance, usability, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: The security requirements of the system shall adhere to industry standards and best practices.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns security and adherence to industry standards/best practices (security non-functional). It also implies compliance with external standards/policies, so labeled as Legal/Compliance. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall authenticate users and authorize their access to specific functionalities based on their role and permissions.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies authentication and authorization behavior (functional) and pertains to security controls (access control), so mark Functional and Security.

RequirementText: User inputs and commands shall be validated to prevent unauthorized access or malicious actions within the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies validation to prevent unauthorized access and malicious actions, which is a security control (input validation). No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The system shall enforce data privacy and confidentiality measures to protect sensitive information handled within the command-line interface.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system shall enforce measures (a functional obligation) to ensure data privacy and confidentiality, which is primarily a security concern. No explicit mention of legal/compliance, availability, or other quality attributes is present.

RequirementText: User shall be able to set performance expectations for the system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a user-facing capability (functional) to configure performance expectations and explicitly concerns performance-related criteria, so Performance is applicable.

RequirementText: System shall meet user-defined performance expectations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly concerns meeting performance expectations defined by users, which is a performance (non-functional) requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, scalability, security, usability, or other categories.

RequirementText: User shall be able to input data without experiencing delays.
AI_Rationale: Specifies responsiveness/no delays when entering data, which is a performance (latency) requirement. Does not explicitly address usability, functionality, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall provide timely responses to user inputs.
AI_Rationale: 'Timely responses' is a performance (latency) requirement and implies scalability to maintain responsiveness under load (matches provided example). No functional, security, or other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to report errors encountered during system use.
AI_Rationale: This describes a capability the system must provide (allow users to report errors), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, maintainability, operability, usability, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall handle errors effectively to prevent system failures.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies error handling to prevent system failures, which directly concerns fault tolerance/resilience. No explicit mention of availability, security, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to rely on the system's stability and robustness.
AI_Rationale: The requirement refers to system stability and robustness, which are reliability-related quality attributes. This implies availability (uptime/reliability) and fault tolerance/resilience. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall avoid or manage potential disasters and errors autonomously.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies autonomous handling of disasters and errors—this indicates fault tolerance/self-healing. It also implies operability benefits (reduced admin/automatic management). It does not explicitly state availability metrics, maintainability, security, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to run the system on different platforms if necessary.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system should run on different platforms, which is a portability requirement. No other quality attributes or functional behavior are implied.

RequirementText: System shall ensure compatibility and adaptability across various platforms.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states compatibility and adaptability across various platforms, which corresponds to portability. It does not mention performance, security, availability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall find the system easy to navigate and use.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies ease of navigation and use, which is a usability (UX) concern. It does not mention aesthetic look-and-feel, performance, availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall provide a user-friendly interface for seamless interaction.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies a user-friendly interface and seamless interaction, which are usability and look-and-feel concerns. It does not state functional behavior, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to ensure compliance with established standards.
AI_Rationale: The requirement expresses a capability for the user to ensure compliance (functional) and refers to compliance with established standards, which is a legal/regulatory constraint. No mention of availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall adhere to specified standards for operations and data handling.
AI_Rationale: Requirement states the system must 'adhere to specified standards'—a compliance requirement. It does not explicitly specify availability, security, operability, or other quality attributes, so only Legal (compliance) is marked.

RequirementText: User shall provide hardware specifications and limitations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies an action the system/user must perform (providing hardware specifications)—this is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall operate within the defined hardware constraints.
AI_Rationale: Specifies operational constraint about running within given hardware limits, which concerns operability/administration. Does not explicitly address performance, portability, availability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: User shall require fault-tolerant system design where necessary.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly demands fault-tolerant system design; corresponds directly to Fault Tolerance (FT). No mention of availability, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall implement fault-tolerant mechanisms to ensure system reliability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly calls for 'fault-tolerant mechanisms' to ensure system reliability, which directly corresponds to Fault Tolerance (FT). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall specify security measures and access controls.
AI_Rationale: The statement requires the system to allow the user to specify security measures and access controls (functional capability) and explicitly concerns security-related features (authentication/authorization and access control), so SE and F apply. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall enforce security protocols to safeguard data and operations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates enforcement of security protocols to safeguard data and operations, which directly maps to security concerns (authentication, authorization, confidentiality, integrity). It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, usability, legal, performance, scalability, portability, operability, maintainability, or specific functional behavior beyond security enforcement.

RequirementText: User shall specify minimum and preferred hardware requirements.
AI_Rationale: This requirement concerns specifying deployment/operational hardware constraints (minimum and preferred hardware), which is an operability/operational requirement. It does not describe system functionality, performance metrics, security, portability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall function optimally within the specified hardware configurations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must function optimally within given hardware configurations. This implies performance-related constraints (speed/efficiency) and that it must operate correctly within the specified environment (operability). It does not explicitly state portability, availability, security, scalability, or other categories.

RequirementText: User shall specify software requirements and dependencies.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (the user shall specify software requirements and dependencies), i.e., a functional behavior. It does not explicitly reference availability, security, performance, maintainability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall operate on compatible software platforms and environments.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must operate on compatible software platforms/environments — this concerns operability (running in specified environments) and portability/compatibility across platforms. It does not specify availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: User shall ensure software meets defined quality attributes.
AI_Rationale: The statement is a high-level non-functional requirement about meeting (unspecified) quality attributes. It does not specify particular qualities such as performance, security, availability, usability, etc. I marked Maintainability because ‘quality attributes’ commonly include maintainability and this requirement implies adherence to quality criteria, but other specific NFR categories are not explicitly referenced, so they were left as 0.

RequirementText: System shall adhere to specified quality attributes such as security and portability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly references the quality attributes 'security' and 'portability', so Security (SE) and Portability (PO) apply. No other quality attributes or functional/operational/legal aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall expect secure transactions with SSL encryption.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of SSL encryption for secure transactions, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). Does not describe functionality, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall automatically log out inactive users.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (automatic logout of inactive users) — functional. It also addresses security by reducing risk of unauthorized access from unattended sessions, so Security is applicable. No other quality attributes are explicitly or strongly implied.

RequirementText: User shall not have their passwords stored in cookies.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a constraint on how passwords are stored (not in cookies), which is a security-related control for confidentiality/credential protection. It does not describe functional behavior, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System's back-end servers shall only be accessible to authenticated management.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (only authenticated management may access back-end servers), which is a security constraint (authentication/authorization). It also describes required system behavior (access restriction), so marked as functional as well.

RequirementText: User shall rely on the overall project's reliability.
AI_Rationale: The requirement refers to 'reliability', which is a dependability/availability concern and implies resilience to failures. It does not specify functional behavior or other attributes, so Availability and Fault Tolerance are marked true; other labels are not supported by the text.

RequirementText: System's reliability depends on continuous backup of the database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement ties system reliability to continuous database backups, which relates to availability (uptime/reliability) and fault tolerance/recovery. It does not specify legal, security, UI, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, or operability details.

RequirementText: User shall expect continuous system availability.
AI_Rationale: Statement explicitly concerns continuous system availability (uptime/reachability). No other quality attributes or functional behavior are specified.

RequirementText: System shall ensure 24/7 availability with minimal downtime.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies 24/7 availability and minimal downtime, which directly maps to Availability (A). It does not explicitly mention fault tolerance mechanisms, performance, security, or other quality aspects, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: User shall have access to a customer-friendly system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement states users shall have access (functional behavior) to a 'customer-friendly system', which explicitly implies usability/UX concerns (customer-friendly). It does not mention availability, security, performance, scalability, legal, portability, look-and-feel specifics, or maintenance/operability, so those labels are set to false.

RequirementText: System shall provide a replacement page in case of hardware failure or database corruption.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies providing a replacement page when hardware failure or database corruption occurs, which is a fault-tolerance / graceful-degradation measure. It does not specify availability metrics, functional features, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall rely on the system's maintainability.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly addresses the system's maintainability (ease of maintenance/modification). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall use a commercial database and application server for maintenance.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the deployment/operational choice to use a commercial database and application server for maintenance, which concerns system operability and administration. It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall expect efficient re-initialization in case of failure.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies efficient re-initialization after failures, which is about fault tolerance/resilience. It does not explicitly state availability, performance metrics, security, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: System shall ensure supportability through well-documented code and modules.
AI_Rationale: Supportability via well-documented code and modules concerns ease of maintenance, modification, and support — aligns with Maintainability (MN). No explicit mentions of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have access to online user documentation and help system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement that users can access online documentation/help (F). Also relates to usability since providing documentation/help improves user experience and learnability (US). No explicit security, availability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to move an activity by selecting it on the canvas, performing a mouse down action, dragging it to the desired location, and releasing the mouse.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user interface interaction method (drag-and-drop) and expected user interaction behavior, so it's about look-and-feel and usability rather than backend functionality or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Alternatively, the user can push the up, down, right, and left keys of the keyboard to move the activity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action/interaction (keyboard arrow keys) to move the activity — this is a functional requirement describing system behavior. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to delete an activity by selecting it on the canvas and clicking the "Delete" button on the user GUI.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (deleting an activity via GUI), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability/look-and-feel, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Alternatively, the user can push the delete key of the keyboard to delete the activity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (deleting an activity via the keyboard), which is a functional requirement. It also speaks to the user interaction/shortcut (alternative input method), impacting usability, so Usability is marked. No indication of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to delete a connection by selecting it and clicking the "Delete" button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action enabling deletion of a connection (functional behavior). No non-functional attributes (availability, security, performance, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Alternatively, the user can push the delete key of the keyboard to delete the connection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (deleting a connection via keyboard), so it's Functional. It also prescribes a user interaction option (keyboard shortcut), which affects usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to select items by clicking on an empty place on the canvas and dragging the mouse to select desired items.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing a specific interaction (click-and-drag selection) and also implies a usability concern (user interaction/UX). No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: Alternatively, the user can hold the "Ctrl" key and click on desired activities and connections to select them.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user interaction (selection via Ctrl+click) — a functional requirement that specifies UI behavior; it also affects usability by defining how users perform selections.

RequirementText: User shall be able to cut items by selecting them and clicking the "Cut" button.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (cut items via selecting and clicking a button), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention any quality attributes such as performance, availability, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: Alternatively, the user can push the "Ctrl+X" key combination or right-click the mouse and select the "Cut Item" button from the context menu.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user actions (keyboard shortcut and context-menu option) to perform the 'Cut Item' operation — this is a functional requirement. Also implies usability/interaction design (alternative input methods, ease of use), so labeled as Usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to copy items by selecting them and clicking the "Copy" button.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (user can copy items via selecting and clicking a Copy button), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Alternatively, the user can push the "Ctrl+C" key combination or right-click the mouse and select the "Copy Item" button from the context menu.
AI_Rationale: Describes user actions/interaction (copy command via keyboard shortcut or context menu), which is a functional requirement. It also specifies alternative interaction methods affecting usability/UX, so labeled as Usability. No mention of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to paste items by clicking the "Paste" button.
AI_Rationale: Describes a user-facing capability (ability to paste via a Paste button), which is a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (performance, availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Alternatively, the user can push the "Ctrl+V" key combination or right-click the mouse and select the "Paste Item" button from the context menu.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (pasting via Ctrl+V or context menu) — a functional requirement. Describes interaction options (keyboard shortcut and context menu) that affect ease of use, so also classified as usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to zoom in or out by clicking the "Zoom In" or "Zoom Out" button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action/feature (zoom in/out via buttons), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (usability, performance, etc.) are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to load a document with 50 activities and 50 connections within 1 second on the client side.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action ('User shall be able to load a document') so includes functional behavior, and imposes a time constraint ('within 1 second') for loading a specified size (50 activities and 50 connections), which is a performance (latency) requirement. No indication of availability, scalability, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall be able to ensure that common operations on an equivalent document are completed within 0.2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a timing constraint (operations must complete within 0.2 seconds), which is a performance/non-functional requirement. It also implies the system must perform specific operations, so labeled as functional as well.

RequirementText: User shall be able to save a document of similar size within 0.5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to save a document (functional) and a strict time bound of 0.5 seconds (performance). No indications of availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to create a connection between activities within 0.1 second.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (creating a connection between activities) — functional. It also imposes a timing constraint (within 0.1 second), which is a performance (timing/latency) requirement.

RequirementText: System shall be able to efficiently write client-side data to the disk and retrieve database data on the server side, with a target time of approximately 0.5 seconds for each operation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system actions (write/read) => functional. Includes explicit timing target (~0.5s per operation) => performance requirement.

RequirementText: System shall use C# programming language on the server side for compatibility with WF.Net and ease of manipulation of XAML.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates the implementation technology (server-side C#) for compatibility with WF.Net/XAML, which is an operational/implementation constraint. It does not specify performance, security, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall employ HTML5, JavaScript, Processing-JS, Ext-JS, and Ajax on the client side for dynamic user interaction and server communication.
AI_Rationale: The statement prescribes client-side technologies to be used for dynamic interaction and server communication—this is a functional/implementation constraint about how the system should behave. It does not explicitly specify availability, performance, security, portability, or usability qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access and interact with the system directly through their web browser without additional tools.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that users must be able to access and interact via a web browser (a functional capability) and explicitly concerns access method/operability (compatible browser-based access). It does not mention availability, security, portability across platforms, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall adhere to usability standards outlined by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) for intuitive and user-friendly interface design.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates adherence to W3C usability standards for an intuitive, user-friendly interface — this is primarily about usability (US) and interface look-and-feel (LF). Stating adherence to standards implies compliance, so Legal (L) is also set. No mention of security, performance, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall ensure accessibility across all major web browsers available on the market without restrictions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compatibility/accessibility across major web browsers (portability). It also impacts end-user access/usability across environments, so usability is relevant. No mention of performance, security, legal, look-and-feel, or operability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access all stored data, including student details, faculty members details, student queries and solutions, and course information, from a single centralized database.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a user capability — accessing all stored data from a centralized database — which describes functional behavior. It does not state availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints, so no non-functional labels are set.

RequirementText: System shall provide electronic course study materials to students.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability—providing electronic course study materials to students. It does not mention availability, security, usability, performance, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall display course details, fee structure, and notices for students on the site.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what the system shall do (display course details, fee structure, and notices to students). It describes functional behavior and does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the site with three different interfaces based on their role: student, faculty, or administrator.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (different interfaces per role). It also implies role-based access control/authorization (security), so SE is set. No explicit mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Each user shall have a unique username and password to access their account on the site.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication requirement (unique username and password) which is a security access control requirement. Does not state availability, performance, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Students shall be able to take mock tests for their courses and evaluate their performance.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional capability: students must be able to take mock tests and have their performance evaluated. No quality/constraint aspects (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: Faculties shall be able to upload lectures to the site for students to access.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (faculty users must be able to upload lectures for student access). It does not explicitly state non-functional constraints such as availability, security, performance, or usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the application on all major web browsers without any slowdown, even during peak hours.
AI_Rationale: Requires compatibility with all major web browsers (portability). Demands no slowdown even at peak hours, which implies performance (latency/throughput) and scalability to handle peak load. No explicit availability, security, or other concerns stated.

RequirementText: System shall maintain the quality of service without any compromise on performance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates no compromise on performance and to maintain quality of service; this implies performance constraints (PE) and availability/reliability (A). Other NFRs are not explicitly referenced.

RequirementText: The server hosting the E-learning web application shall have its own security measures to prevent unauthorized write/delete access.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies security measures on the server to prevent unauthorized write/delete access, which directly concerns access control and protection of data integrity—classified as Security. No other quality (availability, performance, operability, etc.) is explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall implement advanced secure login algorithms to provide secure login to users.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies implementing secure login algorithms (a security mechanism) which is primarily a security requirement. It also describes functional behavior (login capability), so both SE and F are set. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall grant access only to authorized users to ensure security.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (granting access only to authorized users), which is a security constraint (authentication/authorization). It does not explicitly address availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User ID and password shall not be shared with anyone, including students, faculty, or any other individuals.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies confidentiality of credentials and prohibits sharing user IDs/passwords, which is a security requirement (authentication/credential handling). It does not address availability, performance, UI, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to watch videos by selecting them.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (watch videos by selecting them), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall play the selected video.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior (the system must play a selected video). No quality attributes (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for videos or channels by typing their names.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (search by name for videos or channels). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall display whether the video/channel is found or not.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying whether a video/channel is found), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to like or dislike videos using buttons.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (like/dislike videos via buttons), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability goals, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System shall update the likes/dislikes of videos in the database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (updating likes/dislikes in the database), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to share videos on other social media platforms by pressing the share button.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user capability (share videos to other social media via a share button). It does not specify non-functional qualities like availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: System shall verify the user's social media account details and share the video link.
AI_Rationale: This describes system behavior (verify user's social media account details and share a video link), i.e., functional actions. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view videos in full screen mode by pressing the full screen option button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (view videos in full screen via a button) describing system functionality. No non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, UI aesthetics beyond basic function) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall display the video in full screen resolution.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how video should be presented (display behavior) — functional — and concerns visual presentation/resolution/full-screen which is a look & feel requirement.

RequirementText: User shall be able to change the quality of the video by selecting the desired resolution.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability (ability to change video quality by selecting resolution), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns like performance, usability, or security.

RequirementText: System shall change the resolution of the video and display it accordingly.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: changing video resolution and displaying it. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, UI look-and-feel, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to upload videos to their channel.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (upload videos to a user's channel). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall display the uploaded videos on the user's channel.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: presenting/displaying uploaded videos on a user's channel. It does not mention availability, performance, UI aesthetics, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to block other users.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user capability (blocking other users). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall add the blocked user to the user's blocked list in the database.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies a concrete system action (adding a blocked user record to the database), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to comment on videos.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can comment on videos). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall store and display the user's comments.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies system behavior: storing and displaying user comments, which is functional. No quality/constraint (e.g., availability, security, performance, UI look-and-feel) is specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view their watch history.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing a user capability (view watch history). It does not specify non-functional attributes like performance, usability, security, or availability.

RequirementText: System shall scan the watch history in the database and display it to the user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: retrieving (scanning) watch history from the database and displaying it to the user. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to remove uploaded videos from their channel.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing capability (removing uploaded videos) which is a functional requirement; it does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall check the details in the database and perform the delete operation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior: checking database details and performing a delete operation, which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall receive notifications about new uploads in their channel after logging in.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (system shall notify users about new uploads after they log in). No availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall quickly identify new uploads in other channels and notify the user's channel database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (detect new uploads in other channels and notify the user's channel database). The adverb 'quickly' implies a performance/latency constraint, so Performance is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, fault tolerance, security, scalability, usability, maintainability, portability, legal, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add interests.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (ability to add interests), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall check the information and process the request, providing regular updates on those interests.
AI_Rationale: Req describes functional behavior (checking info, processing requests, providing regular updates). The updates imply a usability/UX concern (users receive regular updates), but no explicit constraints about performance, availability, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to update or edit their profile appearance.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (allows user to update/edit profile) and relates to look-and-feel (profile appearance). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or usability constraints, so those are not set.

RequirementText: System shall change the edited details in the database and reflect them on the user's profile page.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: update database and reflect changes on user profile (functional requirement). No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage settings such as alternate email address, phone number, preferred language, or password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (manage account settings including password), which is functional in nature. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: System shall check the information and apply the changes to the user's account.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system behavior: validating information and updating a user's account. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage privacy settings such as who can view their profile, connections, and sharing data with third parties.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (manage privacy settings) which is functional. It also concerns privacy controls over data visibility and third-party sharing, which is a security/privacy requirement. No explicit availability, performance, legal, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User interface should be attractive and easily understandable, requiring no assistance to use the website.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the interface should be attractive (look & feel) and easily understandable/usable without assistance (usability). No mention of performance, availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or functional behaviors.

RequirementText: System should be able to operate efficiently on slow connections, ensuring fast and steady data flow.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns system behavior under slow network conditions (efficient operation, fast and steady data flow), which is a performance-related quality attribute. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other concerns.

RequirementText: Data of the user should be regularly synchronized between their device and the database for auto save functionality.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies auto-save behavior (regular synchronization between device and database) which is a functional behavior. It also implies data consistency/integrity between client and server, which is a security-related concern (data integrity), so SE is marked. Other quality attributes (availability, fault tolerance, performance, etc.) are not explicitly stated.

RequirementText: System must ensure safety by protecting from intruders, ensuring unique IDs for each user, and requiring unique admin ID.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies protection from intruders (security) and enforces uniqueness of user/admin IDs (functional behavior constraint). No mention of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: Website should be multi-platform, capable of running on different operating systems.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the website must run on different operating systems, which is a portability requirement. It does not mention functional behavior, performance, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users are advised to change their password every 30 days, and maximum 3 login attempts should be allowed.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies password change policy and a limit on login attempts, which are security controls (authentication/authorization and account protection). It does not address availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: Website must be connected to a web server to make it available worldwide.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies deployment/operational setup (the website must be connected to a web server to be reachable worldwide), which concerns operability/management. It does not specify uptime metrics, fault tolerance, performance, security, or functional behavior beyond being hosted, so only Operability is marked.

RequirementText: User details and data should be stored securely in a database provided by the server.
AI_Rationale: The requirement emphasizes that data should be stored securely, which is a clear security (confidentiality/integrity/access control) concern. While it mentions storing data in a server database, the primary quality constraint is security; no explicit availability, performance, scalability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create a Gmail account by providing personal details like name, gender, password, mobile number, and location.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action (create an account by providing personal details). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall store the user's details in the database for account creation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: storing user details in the database for account creation. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in to Gmail using their email id and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (user login). Implies authentication via email/password, which is a security requirement (SE). No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: Upon successful login, user shall be able to send and receive emails.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing user capability to send and receive emails after login. It does not specify non-functional aspects (performance, security beyond authentication mention, availability, etc.), so only F is set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to compose emails by clicking on the compose button and entering recipient email, subject, and message.
