AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (compose email via compose button and fields), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to attach files to emails, with a file size limit of 25 MB.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to attach files to emails) and a constraint on that capability (file size limit). This is primarily a functional requirement.

RequirementText: User shall be able to send composed emails by clicking on the send button.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (sending composed emails via a send button). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall be able to archive emails to hide them from the inbox.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user capability (archive emails to remove from inbox). It specifies behavior not quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to mark suspicious emails as spam by clicking on the spam button.
AI_Rationale: This describes a specific user-facing capability (mark emails as spam via a spam button), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall automatically move some emails to the spam folder and may block the sender of spam messages.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (automatic spam detection: moving emails to spam and optionally blocking senders). No explicit quality constraints like availability, performance, security, or usability are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to differentiate between primary, social, and promotional emails based on email tabs.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (user shall be able to differentiate using email tabs). It also implies UI concerns: presentation/layout of tabs (Look & Feel) and improved ease of use (Usability). No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are stated.

RequirementText: System shall analyze emails and categorize them automatically into primary, social, or promotional categories.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: analyzing emails and automatically categorizing them into primary, social, or promotional. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to delete emails from their inbox or other folders.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (user can delete emails). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall provide an option for users to organize emails into folders or labels for better management.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a feature (organize emails into folders/labels). It also implies improved usability (better management), so Usability is applicable. No explicit non-functional concerns such as security, performance, availability, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall have the ability to search for specific emails using keywords or filters.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (search emails by keywords/filters), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall allow users to create drafts of emails that can be saved and edited later before sending.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (create, save, edit email drafts) describing system behavior—i.e., a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to forward received emails to other email addresses.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing what the system should do (allow users to forward received emails). It does not specify availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall provide an option for users to set up automatic email forwarding rules.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a feature (automatic email forwarding rules). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have the ability to mark emails as important or star them for future reference.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (marking emails as important/star) which is a functional feature. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI appearance, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: System shall provide a feature to schedule emails to be sent at a later time.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (scheduling emails to be sent later). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to set up email signatures to be automatically added to outgoing emails.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (setting up email signatures and automatic addition to outgoing emails), which is a functional feature. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall offer keyboard shortcuts for efficient navigation and operation within Gmail.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user interface interaction method (keyboard shortcuts) affecting look-and-feel and usability (efficient navigation). It does not state availability, performance, security, or maintenance constraints, nor purely functional system behavior beyond UI quality.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to customize the layout and appearance of their Gmail inbox.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user option to customize layout and appearance, which is a functional feature enabling customization (F) and directly concerns the visual/look-and-feel of the interface (LF). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, usability metrics, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System shall provide notifications for new incoming emails, calendar events, and other relevant updates.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (providing notifications for emails, calendar events, and updates), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access Gmail from multiple devices and platforms seamlessly.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the user shall be able to access Gmail from multiple devices and platforms (functional capability) and implies cross-platform compatibility/portability. The word 'seamlessly' suggests a concern for user experience/usability. No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, scalability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall ensure data security and privacy by encrypting emails and implementing robust authentication mechanisms.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates encryption and authentication, which are security controls addressing confidentiality and access control. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, legal, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to enable two-factor authentication for added security.
AI_Rationale: Specifies offering two-factor authentication—a security feature (SE). It also describes a capability the system must provide (option to enable), so marked as Functional (F). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall regularly update and maintain the Gmail platform to ensure optimal performance and security.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates regular updates and maintenance (maintainability) and ongoing operational activity (operability). It explicitly mentions ensuring optimal performance and security, so Performance and Security are applicable. No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, portability, scalability, usability, legal, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: User shall be provided with a comprehensive help and support system to address any issues or queries related to Gmail usage.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies providing a help and support system (a functional feature) aimed at addressing user issues and queries, which primarily targets usability (ease of use/support). No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall offer integration with other Google services such as Google Drive, Google Calendar, and Google Contacts for enhanced productivity.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must provide integrations with Google Drive/Calendar/Contacts. It does not specify availability, security, portability, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The product shall implement caching mechanisms to optimize load times and reduce server requests.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies implementing caching mechanisms (a functional capability) to optimize load times and reduce server requests, which directly addresses performance (latency/throughput). Reducing server requests also implies improved scalability. No explicit mention of availability, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall support content delivery networks (CDNs) to distribute content efficiently across different geographic locations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability (support CDNs) — a functional requirement. It explicitly aims to distribute content efficiently across geographic locations, implying performance (efficient delivery, latency/bandwidth concerns) and scalability (handling distribution across regions/users). No explicit mention of availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall implement secure authentication protocols such as OAuth or OpenID Connect for user authentication.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of secure authentication protocols (OAuth/OpenID Connect) which is a security requirement concerning authentication mechanisms; does not state availability, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User passwords shall be stored securely using industry-standard hashing algorithms with salt.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies secure storage of user passwords using industry-standard hashing and salt, which is a security-specific constraint (confidentiality/integrity). It does not describe functional behavior, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Access to sensitive user data, such as credit card information, shall be restricted to authorized personnel only, with proper access controls in place.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates restricting access to sensitive user data (credit card information) to authorized personnel and instituting proper access controls, which directly concerns security (authentication/authorization and confidentiality). It does not specify availability, performance, legal compliance, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The user interface shall adhere to responsive design principles to ensure optimal viewing and interaction experience across various devices and screen sizes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns the user interface's adaptive/responsive presentation across devices—primarily a look-and-feel concern (layout, visual behavior) and also impacts usability (interaction experience and accessibility across screen sizes). No explicit mentions of availability, security, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Accessibility features, such as keyboard navigation and screen reader compatibility, shall be implemented to cater to users with disabilities.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies accessibility features (keyboard navigation, screen reader compatibility) to support users with disabilities, which directly concerns usability and user experience. It does not explicitly state legal compliance, performance, availability, or other quality attributes, so only Usability is marked.

RequirementText: Automated testing procedures shall be implemented to detect and mitigate software bugs and errors before deployment.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates implementation of automated testing to detect and mitigate bugs before deployment. This is primarily a maintainability concern (improves ease of fixing/preventing defects) and also relates to fault tolerance/reliability by preventing faults reaching production. It does not specify availability, security, performance, UI, portability, scalability, or legal aspects, nor is it a user-facing functional behavior.

RequirementText: The system shall have failover mechanisms in place to switch to backup servers seamlessly in the event of hardware failures or network disruptions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies failover to backup servers for hardware/network failures—this directly addresses fault tolerance and ensures availability/up-time. No mention of security, performance, portability, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Regular maintenance and monitoring procedures shall be established to identify and address potential reliability issues proactively.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies establishing regular maintenance and monitoring procedures—this directly pertains to maintainability (MN) and operability/administration (O). It also targets identifying and addressing reliability issues proactively, which relates to fault tolerance/resilience (FT). It does not specify functional behavior, availability metrics, security, or other attributes.

RequirementText: Load balancing techniques shall be employed to distribute incoming traffic evenly across multiple servers and prevent server overload.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of load balancing to distribute traffic and prevent server overload, which directly addresses performance (throughput/latency) and scalability. Preventing overload also implies availability/reliability, so Availability is marked. No legal, security, UI, maintainability, portability, operability, or explicit fault-tolerance requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall have redundant power supplies and backup generators to ensure uninterrupted service during power outages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies redundant power supplies and backup generators to ensure uninterrupted service during outages — this directly targets availability and implies fault tolerance/resilience. It does not describe functional behavior, security, performance, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Automated backup procedures shall be implemented to create regular backups of critical data and configurations, reducing the risk of data loss in case of hardware failures or disasters.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies implementing automated backup procedures (a system capability — functional) and explicitly aims to reduce data loss in failures/disasters (fault tolerance/recovery). It does not mention availability metrics, security, operability, maintainability, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability concerns, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: These additional non-functional requirements aim to further enhance the performance, security, user experience, reliability, and availability of the system.
AI_Rationale: The sentence explicitly mentions performance, security, user experience, reliability, and availability. Availability is marked (A). Reliability implies fault tolerance/resilience (FT). Performance (PE), Security (SE), and Usability/User experience (US) are directly named. No functional behavior or other NFRs (portability, scalability, legal, look & feel beyond UX, maintainability, operability) are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create a new account by entering personal details.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user action (creating a new account by entering personal details), which is a functional capability. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so no additional NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: System shall be able to register new users and store their information securely in the database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (register new users and store information) and explicitly requires that information be stored securely, which is a security (confidentiality/integrity) concern. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, usability, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel aspects are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create an account using their Google or Facebook credentials.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (create an account using Google or Facebook credentials), i.e., a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so only F is set.

RequirementText: System shall be able to authenticate users using their Google or Facebook accounts and register them accordingly.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (authenticate/register via Google/Facebook) which is functional, and explicitly concerns authentication method (security). No mention of availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view product details upon selection.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the user can view product details upon selection. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display relevant information about selected products.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (displaying information about selected products). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view the price of selected products, including any applicable discounts.

RequirementText: System shall be able to calculate and display the cost of products along with any discounts offered by vendors.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to calculate and display product costs and discounts, which describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in with valid credentials.

RequirementText: System shall be able to authenticate user credentials and grant access to the user account.

RequirementText: User shall receive a notification if login credentials are invalid.

RequirementText: System shall alert users if login credentials are incorrect or if the account does not exist.

RequirementText: User shall be able to complete transactions, including managing the shopping cart.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate the process of adding, removing, and managing items in the shopping cart during transactions.

RequirementText: User shall be able to generate reports, including stock, order, and delivery reports.

RequirementText: System shall provide functionalities to generate comprehensive reports on stock availability, orders, and deliveries.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view order reports displaying product details and customer information.

RequirementText: System shall generate order reports containing information about ordered products and customers' details for undelivered orders.

RequirementText: User shall be able to track delivery status by providing necessary information.

RequirementText: System shall enable users to track the status of their deliveries by entering relevant details such as name, age, mobile number, and address.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log out securely.

RequirementText: System shall ensure users can log out of their accounts securely, preventing unauthorized access.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (logout) and a security constraint (secure logout to prevent unauthorized access). No mention of availability, performance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall have uninterrupted access to the system via a web browser, subject only to server downtime.
AI_Rationale: Specifies uninterrupted access (uptime) which is an Availability requirement; also constrains access method via web browser similar to example labeled as Operability (O). No security, performance, scalability, or other qualities implied.

RequirementText: System shall display a replacement page in case of hardware failure or database corruption.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a visible behavior (display replacement page) => Functional. It addresses handling hardware failure/database corruption (graceful degradation/fallback) => Fault Tolerance. No explicit availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall retrieve backups of the database from the server and save them in case of hardware failure or database corruption.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (retrieve and save database backups) — a functional statement — aimed at recovering from hardware failure or corruption, which is a fault-tolerance (recovery) concern. No explicit availability, security, operability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall use SSL (secured socket layer) in all transactions involving confidential customer information.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates use of SSL for transactions involving confidential customer information, which is a security control for confidentiality and integrity of data in transit. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: System shall automatically log out users after a period of inactivity.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies an automatic system behavior (auto-logout), so it is functional. It is primarily a security control (session timeout to prevent unauthorized access), so Security is also applicable. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall not store any cookies containing user passwords on the customer’s computer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly restricts storage of sensitive authentication data (passwords in cookies), which is a security requirement (confidentiality/privacy). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System’s back-end servers shall only be accessible to authenticated administrators.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access restricted to authenticated administrators, which is a security (access control/authentication) constraint. It does not explicitly state functional behavior beyond security, nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall store all databases on redundant computers with automatic switchover for enhanced reliability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies redundant computers and automatic switchover to enhance reliability/uptime, which addresses availability and fault tolerance. It does not specify security, performance, usability, or other concerns.

RequirementText: The overall reliability of the system depends on the reliability of individual components.
AI_Rationale: The statement concerns the system's reliability attribute (uptime/reliability depends on component reliability), which maps to Availability. It does not specify functional behavior, fault-tolerance mechanisms, security, performance, or other qualities explicitly, so only Availability is set.

RequirementText: System shall continuously maintain and update backups of the database to reflect the most recent changes.

It does not specify availability targets, security, usability, or other qualities, nor is it framed as a typical functional feature.

RequirementText: System shall utilize a commercial database for database maintenance, with the application server managing the site.
AI_Rationale: Specifies deployment/operational environment (commercial database and application server managing site). Matches operability/administration concerns rather than performance, security, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: In case of failure, the system shall undergo reinitialization.

RequirementText: System design shall prioritize modularity to facilitate efficient maintenance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates prioritizing modularity to facilitate efficient maintenance, which directly concerns maintainability. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, portability, operability, legal, or UI appearance aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in to theaa.com by providing a valid user ID and password.
