RequirementText: User shall select the mode of payment.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing user action (select payment mode). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall process the payment and save the transaction number to the database.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system function: processing a payment and persisting the transaction number to the database. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall display the transaction number for reference.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying the transaction number) which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall display the submitted application form with all entered data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the system must display the submitted application form and its data. No non-functional qualities (performance, availability, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for recent transactions using the transaction number.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (search recent transactions by transaction number), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall display the payment amount and corresponding application number on successful search.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must display payment amount and application number after a successful search. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: User shall check the current status of their application using the application number.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (checking application status by application number), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall display the status of the application on successful search.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: displaying the application's status after a successful search, which is a functional requirement. It does not mention quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: User shall be asked for re-submission of documents if necessary.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (prompting the user to re-submit documents) — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log out by clicking on the logout button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (logging out via clicking a logout button), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall destroy the browser session upon logout.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a specific system behavior (destroy browser session on logout) so it is functional. It also addresses security (session termination to prevent unauthorized reuse), so Security applies. No explicit availability, performance, portability, usability, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall display a message "Logged Out" upon successful logout.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (display a message upon logout); this is a functional requirement with no explicit non-functional quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the login screen for authorized users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that a user shall be able to access the login screen (functional) and restricts access to authorized users, implying access control/security requirements.

RequirementText: User shall input their email and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (user input of email and password). Does not explicitly state authentication, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall validate the entered credentials in the database.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (validate credentials) — functional. It also concerns authentication/authorization of credentials, which is a security requirement.

RequirementText: If the validation succeeds, user shall be redirected to the authorized-user-home page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (redirecting the user after successful validation), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, security, performance, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to choose to view "tatkaal" or "normal" applicants.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to choose between viewing 'tatkaal' or 'normal' applicants), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall select from the dropdown menu.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action (select from a dropdown), which describes functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall redirect to a page with respective selected type.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system behavior (redirecting user to a page corresponding to the selected type). This specifies functionality rather than non-functional qualities, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall display all data for pending passport approvals.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the system shall display data for pending passport approvals). It does not specify UI aesthetics, performance, security, availability, or other non-functional qualities, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to list all pending applied passports date wise.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user capability to list/filter pending passport applications by date. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall load data from the database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the system shall load data from the database). It does not state quality attributes such as performance, availability, security, etc., so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: User shall have a "check" option corresponding to every passport.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a feature/option (a 'check' option) that the user shall have for each passport—this defines functional behavior (a UI action) rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: User shall click on any particular passport for checking data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action and system behavior (clicking a passport to view/check its data), which is a functional requirement. Does not explicitly state usability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall load the data corresponding to the particular passport reference number.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional behavior: loading data for a given passport reference number. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall display all necessary data, including full name, email, mobile, etc.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (displaying specific data fields) — a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, UI look & feel, usability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall have access to an "Edit application status" page.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement that the system must provide an 'Edit application status' page and that the user shall have access to it. It does not specify authorization, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall select from a dropdown menu containing various application status options.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user action and UI control (dropdown) so it defines functional behavior. It also implies a usability concern (how the user selects options), similar to example where language selection was labeled US. No availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: System shall update the status of a particular application number with the selected status.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (updating the status of an application number), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall display a message "Status updated" upon successful update.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior to display a message on successful update, which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are implied explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to perform tasks even if thousands of applicants are applying simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must allow users to perform tasks under very high concurrent load (thousands applying simultaneously). This implies performance (throughput/response under load) and scalability (handling large number of concurrent users). It does not state functional specifics, availability targets, security, or other categories.

RequirementText: System shall ensure high data transfer rate.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quality attribute about data transfer rate (throughput/latency), which maps to Performance (PE). No functional behavior or other non-functional categories are implied.

RequirementText: System shall maintain a quick response rate.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a requirement about the system's response rate (speed/latency), which is a performance quality attribute.

RequirementText: Applicants' accessibility shall be ensured in all possible ways.
AI_Rationale: The requirement refers to ensuring applicants' accessibility, which most directly maps to usability/accessibility concerns (ease of use, access for users including those with disabilities). It does not explicitly mention uptime/availability, legal compliance, security, or other quality attributes, so only Usability is marked.

RequirementText: Applicants shall be advised to change their passwords monthly.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a security practice (password change cadence), which is a security policy/constraint. It does not describe functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall utilize SSL (Secured Socket Layer) certificate for protection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of SSL certificates for protection, which is a security control for confidentiality/integrity of communications. No indication of other qualities (availability, performance, portability, etc.).

RequirementText: System shall perform proper validation of data before sending it to the database.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying behavior (validate data before database write). It also implies security-related concerns (data integrity/input validation to prevent injection or malformed data), so Security is marked.

RequirementText: System shall prioritize security and performance as software quality attributes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states prioritizing security and performance as quality attributes, directly mapping to Security (SE) and Performance (PE). No other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The passport management website must be available 24 hours a day.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly specifies availability (24 hours a day). Does not mention functionality details, fault tolerance, performance, security, scalability, operability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The passport management website should provide maximal security.
AI_Rationale: Statement explicitly demands maximal security for the website, which is a security (non-functional) requirement. No other quality attributes or functional behaviors are specified.

RequirementText: New features can be added to the passport management system.
AI_Rationale: Statement expresses that the system should allow adding new features (extensibility/ease of modification), which aligns with maintainability. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, or UI.

RequirementText: Corrective Maintenance: Any unidentified bugs need to be fixed promptly.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies corrective maintenance—fixing unidentified bugs promptly—which directly concerns maintainability. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Adaptive Maintenance: The software should be compatible with all web-browsing capable browsers.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compatibility with all web-browsing capable browsers, which is a portability constraint across platforms/environments. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Perfective Maintenance: New features may be added post product delivery.
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly refers to perfective maintenance and the ability to add new features after delivery, which concerns maintainability/evolution. It does not specify availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, portability, operability, legal, or UI aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add new patients to the system.
AI_Rationale: This sentence specifies a functional capability (adding patients). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall allow front-desk staff to assign a unique ID to each patient and add it to the patient’s record.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing front-desk staff to assign a unique patient ID and store it in the patient record. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Administrative staff in the ward shall be able to delete the patient's ID from the system upon checkout.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (delete a patient's ID by administrative staff upon checkout), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set to true.

RequirementText: Administrative staff in the ward shall be able to update the beds-available list with recently vacated beds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (administrative staff can update beds-available list) — clearly a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: HPIMS shall generate patient reports including patient’s PHN, name, ward name, bed number, and assigned doctor’s name.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function: generating patient reports with particular fields (PHN, name, ward, bed number, assigned doctor). No quality attributes (performance, security, etc.) are mentioned, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: HPIMS shall generate bed availability reports including ward name, bed number, and status (occupied/unoccupied).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete system function — generating bed availability reports with specific data fields. It does not state non-functional constraints such as performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Each patient shall have mandatory information including first name, last name, phone number, personal health number, address, postal code, city, country, and patient identification number.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies mandatory data fields for patient records, which is a functional requirement describing what the system should store. It does not mention availability, security, privacy, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: HPIMS shall allow users to update any patient information as necessary.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow users to update patient information), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a login form for users to access the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional feature (login form) enabling user access. Implies authentication/security concerns (access control), but does not specify availability, performance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The homepage of Apollo hospitals system shall serve as the main interface for users.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional requirement about system behavior: the homepage shall act as the main interface for users. It does not specify availability, performance, usability details, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: In Patient Registration Form shall capture necessary information for registering patients.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional requirement: the Patient Registration Form must capture necessary information for registering patients. No quality/constraint (availability, security, usability, etc.) is specified.

RequirementText: User shall experience response times of 1 second or less when accessing patient information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative response-time requirement (performance). Similar examples label both Performance and Availability since guaranteed response time implies the service must be available/reachable within that bound.

RequirementText: System must support concurrent access by up to 1000 users simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: Specifies requirement for supporting concurrent access by up to 1000 users, which is a scalability requirement. It does not mention availability, performance metrics (latency/throughput), security, portability, or functional behavior beyond scalability.

RequirementText: User interface screens shall respond to user inputs within 5 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a timing responsiveness requirement for UI screens (performance). Also impacts usability as it concerns user experience and responsiveness.

RequirementText: The system must conform to Microsoft Accessibility standards for accessibility compliance.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies conformance to Microsoft Accessibility standards, a compliance/legal requirement for accessibility; similar examples (ADA/regulations) were labeled Legal. It does not explicitly state usability, UI look-and-feel, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user will select the add task option.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action (selecting the 'add task' option), which describes functional behaviour. It does not mention non-functional qualities such as usability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Add task page will be opened consisting of minimum three fields.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (opening the Add Task page with at least three fields) and implies UI/layout requirement about the page composition (look & feel). No availability, performance, security, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: First field will be add task name.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional UI element: the first field will be for entering a task name. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability metrics, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Second field will be date of task completion.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a data/functional requirement that the second field contains the task completion date. No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, UI style, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: Third field will be time of task completion.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system/data/form requirement describing that the third field should represent task completion time — a functional data/field specification. It also pertains to UI/form layout (which field is which), so Look & Feel is applicable. No quality attributes (performance, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: When the user presses add, system must check if the the name, date and time fields are completed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (input validation when user presses add). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The fields shall be typed-in or entered through voice command.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how users can enter data (typed or voice) — a functional requirement describing input methods. Also impacts usability/accessibility (voice input), so US is applicable. No mention of security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The task shall be stored in database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (persistence): tasks must be stored in the database. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall warn the user that the particular field is mandatory and allow the user to continue completing.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (displaying a mandatory-field warning and allowing the user to continue), so it is functional. It also concerns the user interaction/experience (guidance and flow), so it implicates usability. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select any task for the previously existing tasks and shall be able to edit its name, date or day.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to select and edit existing tasks (name, date, day), which describes functional behavior. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The user shall select the edit task option.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action (selecting an option) describing system functionality; no quality/constraint aspects (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Edit task page will be opened.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior (the system opens the edit task page). It does not mention availability, UI appearance, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to change name, date or day of the existing task.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (editing task attributes), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Edited task cannot be saved if the new name of it is empty.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional validation requirement specifying system behavior: it must prevent saving an edited task when the new name is empty. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall prevent saving edits to a task unless a task is selected first.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior/constraint (must prevent saving edits unless a task is selected) — this is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall select and delete a task in one action.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user-facing operation (select and delete a task in one action), i.e., functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall confirm deletion of the selected task.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a specific system behavior (confirm deletion of the selected task), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: If user answers positive then this task will be deleted else the deleted command will be cancelled.
AI_Rationale: This specifies conditional functional behavior (delete task on positive answer, cancel deletion otherwise). No quality/constraint (availability, security, performance, etc.) is implied.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to view tasks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (view tasks), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall select the option of view completed tasks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-action/feature (ability to select an option to view completed tasks), which is functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability criteria, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System must show any task that is completed in the task list.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must display completed tasks in the task list. It does not state quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: User shall not be able to choose show completed tasks, if these tasks are already shown.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user-visible system behavior (disabling or preventing an action when completed tasks are already shown), which is a functional behavior with a clear usability intent to prevent redundant actions. It does not address security, performance, scalability, availability, portability, maintainability, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to select the option of view incompleted tasks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to select/view incomplete tasks), which is functional. It does not state quality constraints (performance, availability, usability, etc.), so no non-functional labels are set.

RequirementText: Upon utilizing this feature, the system shall display all pending tasks.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior to display pending tasks — a functional requirement describing what the system should do; no quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: If all the tasks are already completed, no task will appear in the view option.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior of the system's view: when all tasks are completed, no tasks are shown. It describes what the system should do rather than a quality attribute.

RequirementText: The system shall smartly categorize tasks and group all similar ones together.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (automatic categorization and grouping of similar tasks), which is a functional capability. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The user shall choose their desired alarm tone.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (selecting an alarm tone), which is functional. It does not mention quality attributes such as performance, security, availability, UI look-and-feel, or others.

RequirementText: The system shall remind the user of the task with their chosen ringtone.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement specifies a functional behavior (remind user of task with chosen ringtone). It also implies a user-selectable preference impacting user experience, so marked as Usability.

RequirementText: The program shall be free software for maximum public benefit through unrestricted redistribution.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the software licensing and redistribution terms (free software, unrestricted redistribution) which is a legal/licensing constraint rather than a functional behavior or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: For copyright safety, all files shall include at least the copyright line.
AI_Rationale: This requirement prescribes a specific mandatory behavior of the system (all files must include a copyright line) — a functional constraint. It also explicitly references 'copyright safety', implying compliance with legal/copyright requirements, so Legal is applicable. No indication of availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The user shall be contactable by both electronic and paper mail.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement describing available contact methods (electronic and paper mail). Does not explicitly impose availability, security, legal, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Databases shall be protected by username and password authentication.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication mechanism (username/password) to protect databases — a classic security requirement (confidentiality/access control). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The program shall provide the user ease and functionality without any charge.
AI_Rationale: Requires providing functionality (functional) and ease of use (usability). 'Without any charge' implies a licensing/pricing constraint (legal/business), but no other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: This program shall be your one-stop shop for getting things done and achieving peace of mind.
AI_Rationale: The statement is high-level marketing fluff and does not specify any concrete functional behavior or quality constraints. Phrases like 'one-stop shop' and 'peace of mind' are vague and do not explicitly require availability, performance, usability, security, or other NFRs, so no labels are strongly implied.

RequirementText: software shall be eco-friendly.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies an environmental/sustainability attribute ('eco-friendly') which does not map to any of the provided PROMISE NFR labels. It does not explicitly imply availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, UI/look-and-feel, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, security, or usability, so all labels are set to false.

RequirementText: It shall be usable by professionals, the unemployed, and students.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall be usable by particular user groups (professionals, unemployed, students) — a usability/UX requirement. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall find diverse applications.
AI_Rationale: The phrase 'shall find diverse applications' is ambiguous but reads as a functional capability (the system must be able to find/discover/apply to diverse applications). It also implies portability/versatility across different application contexts, so Portability is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look & feel, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: This software shall be a great means for the ecosystem.
AI_Rationale: The statement is vague and non-specific—'a great means for the ecosystem' does not define a functional behavior or any measurable quality (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.). No clear NFR or functional requirement is explicitly implied, so all labels are set to false conservatively.

RequirementText: Developing this product native-first enables cross-platform functionality.
AI_Rationale: Statement emphasizes enabling cross-platform functionality via a native-first approach, which maps to portability. It does not explicitly mention availability, operability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Tasks shall be CRUDable (Create, Read, Update, Delete) across Windows PC, mobile apps (future implementation), and car systems (future implementation), with primary focus on the Windows PC experience.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capability (CRUD) and explicitly requires operation across multiple platforms (Windows PC, mobile apps, car systems) which implies portability. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, usability, maintainability, look-and-feel, or operability details.

RequirementText: The software shall offer an essential non-functional requirement highlighting its operation.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes the system 'shall offer' something, which indicates a functional provision. The content is vague and only references a non-functional requirement generically without specifying availability, performance, security, usability, etc., so no specific NFR labels can be confidently assigned.

RequirementText: The software will only be operational when a user is registered.
AI_Rationale: This requirement restricts operation to registered users, which is an access-control/authentication constraint and therefore a security requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Guest accounts shall not be allowed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement restricts permissible account types (access control), which is a security constraint (authentication/authorization). It does not describe availability, performance, UI, etc.

RequirementText: There shall be a feature to locate affiliated cinemas based on user's location for a chosen day.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system feature/behavior (locating affiliated cinemas by user's location and selected day), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Shall a city be selected, all theatres and movies showing on that day shall be listed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: when a city is selected, list theatres and movies for that day. No quality constraints (performance, availability, UI, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: If a movie is selected, there shall be a list of all theatres in that city where it is playing, along with show times.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: when a movie is selected, display a list of theatres in the city with show times. It describes functional output/presentation, not quality attributes like performance, security, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to book a movie through the service.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability for users to book a movie), which is a functional requirement. No quality/constraints (availability, performance, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The service shall be able to show the seating arrangement and available seats, allowing users to book the desired number of seats.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior: displaying seating arrangements, available seats, and enabling users to book seats. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to put a hold on selected seats for five minutes before finalizing and making payment.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying that users can place a temporary five-minute hold on selected seats before payment. The five-minute duration is a business rule/constraint but does not specify performance, availability, security, or usability qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: There shall be an option for users to wait if they would like to see if tickets for a particular show might become available.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing feature (an option to wait/watch for ticket availability), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, performance, security, usability, or others, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: Waiting customers shall be serviced in a fair First-Come-First-Served (FCFS) manner.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system shall service waiting customers (ordering behavior = functional requirement). The requirement also expresses a fairness/user-experience constraint (FCFS impacts usability/customer experience), so Usability is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall use SSL in all transactions that include any confidential customer information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of SSL for transactions containing confidential customer information — an encryption/security requirement addressing confidentiality and integrity.

RequirementText: The system shall not leave any cookies on the customers computer containing the users password.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly forbids storing cookies containing the user's password on the customer's computer, which is a security-related constraint (confidentiality/protection of credentials). It does not address availability, performance, usability, portability, or other categories.

RequirementText: The systems back-end servers shall only be accessible to authenticated administrators.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access restriction to authenticated administrators (authentication and access control), which is a security requirement. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, usability, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall store all databases on redundant computers with automatic switchover.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies redundant computers with automatic switchover, which addresses system availability and fault tolerance (redundancy and automatic failover). It does not specify other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The overall program shall be as reliable as its least reliable component.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns system reliability (dependence on component reliability). This maps to availability/reliability (A) and implies concerns about fault tolerance/resilience (FT). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system's reliability shall be primarily dependent on a continuously maintained and updated database backup that reflects the latest changes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on system reliability via continuously maintained backups, which addresses availability and fault tolerance (recovery). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: For the system to be stable, the container and its underlying operating system shall be stable.
AI_Rationale: This is a deployment/operational constraint about the stability of the container and underlying OS, which affects system operability and manageability. It does not specify availability metrics, fault-tolerance behaviors, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed for high availability and accessible via a web browser, with the only access interruptions occurring during scheduled server downtime.
AI_Rationale: Specifies high availability (uptime constraints) and web-browser accessibility; these map to Availability and Operability. No explicit mention of fault tolerance, performance, scalability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: In the event of hardware failure or database corruption, a replacement page shall be displayed.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior in failure conditions (display a replacement page) — this is a fault-tolerance/graceful-degradation requirement. It also prescribes a functional action to take, so mark Functional as well. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints are specified.

RequirementText: Upon hardware failure or database corruption, administrator shall retrieve and save backups, followed by service restart for 24/7 availability.
AI_Rationale: Requires administrator actions to retrieve backups and restart services (functional + operability). Specifies recovery from hardware failure/database corruption and maintaining 24/7 availability (fault tolerance and availability). No mention of security, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, maintainability, or usability.

RequirementText: A commercial database shall manage the data while the application server handles the website.
AI_Rationale: Specifies architectural deployment responsibilities (database for data, application server for website). This is about system operation/deployment rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: In case of a failure, a re-initialization of program will be done.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior upon failure (functional) and describes recovery/restart behavior, i.e., fault tolerance/recovery. No statements about availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The software shall be designed modularly to ensure efficient maintainability.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly states modular design to ensure efficient maintainability, which directly targets maintainability. No mention of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, usability, operability, fault tolerance, legal, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The system shall run on PC, Laptops, and PDA etc.
AI_Rationale: Specifies target hardware/platforms (PC, laptops, PDA), indicating portability/compatibility requirements across environments. Does not mention functionality, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall define what data can be entered, how it should be formatted, and any rules for validating the data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on input validation, data formatting rules and constraints to ensure only valid data is entered (data integrity/security) and impacts user input process/experience (usability). It does not specify availability, performance, portability, or maintenance aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall document the functionality of each screen, how users interact with it, and how the system responds.
AI_Rationale: This is a documentation requirement specifying that screen functionality and user interactions be documented. That supports maintainability (documentation for developers/maintainers) and usability (describing interactions and system responses), but does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall outline the step-by-step process for completing tasks within the system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior/feature (provide an outlined step-by-step process), which is functional. It also implies usability concerns (help users complete tasks), so Usability is marked. No explicit availability, performance, security, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall specify the content, format, and criteria for generating reports and other data outputs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a capability of the system (to specify content, format, and criteria for generating reports/data outputs), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly impose availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall document who can enter data by defining user roles and permissions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies defining user roles and permissions (access control), which is a security requirement; it also describes a system capability (who can enter data), so it is functional as well.

RequirementText: The system shall be designed and implemented to meet relevant regulations and document how it complies.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates meeting relevant regulations and documenting compliance, which is a legal/regulatory compliance requirement. No explicit mentions of other quality attributes (security, performance, maintainability, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall restrict the field to accept only numeric data entry.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (input validation) — functional. It also impacts usability by preventing invalid input and guiding user entry, so Usability is marked. It does not explicitly state security, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall restrict the entry of dates in a specific field to only those prior to the current date.
AI_Rationale: This is an explicit functional requirement specifying input validation behavior (restrict allowed dates). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a mechanism for users to print the displayed data on a selected printer.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (printing displayed data to a selected printer), which is a functional requirement. No explicit quality, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall require data entry to be completed before a request can be approved.
AI_Rationale: This specifies required system behavior/enforcement in the approval workflow (data entry must be completed before approval), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall move the request to the Approval Workflow upon clicking the Approve Button.
AI_Rationale: Describes a specific system behavior (moving a request to an approval workflow when the Approve button is clicked). No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: All personnel using the system will be trained according to internal SOP AA-101.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates personnel be trained according to an internal SOP, which is a compliance/organizational policy (Legal). It also pertains to how the system is to be operated/managed by trained staff, implying an operability/administration requirement. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The database will have a functional audit trail.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the database must maintain an audit trail (a functional capability). Audit trails are commonly required for compliance/legal accountability, so Legal is also applicable. No explicit mention of security, performance, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The system will limit access to authorized users.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access restriction to authorized users, which is an access control/security requirement. It does not explicitly state functional behavior beyond access control nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall enable securing data within spreadsheets using electronic signatures.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system feature (enabling securing data in spreadsheets using electronic signatures) — functional. It clearly concerns data protection and integrity/authentication via electronic signatures — security. No explicit mention of availability, fault tolerance, portability, legal compliance, usability, etc., so those are not set.

RequirementText: The system shall allow Data Entry group members to create requests but restrict approval and deletion permissions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functionality (create requests) and imposes permission restrictions (approval/deletion) which implies access control/authorization (security). No indications of availability, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall allow the Managers group to enter/approve requests but deny deletion privileges.
AI_Rationale: Specifies role-based permissions (Managers can enter/approve but not delete): this is a functional requirement about access control and also an authorization/security constraint.

RequirementText: The system shall allow Administrators to delete requests but not enter or approve them.
AI_Rationale: This specifies system behavior (functional) about administrators' allowed actions (delete requests) and explicitly defines role-based permissions (access control), which relates to security/authorization.

RequirementText: The system shall allow the user to change following personal contact information:
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow user to change personal contact information). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow the user to customize the following interface settings.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability to allow users to customize interface settings — this is a functional requirement. Because it pertains to interface settings (appearance/behavior), it also relates to look & feel. It does not explicitly state usability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: 1.1.1.1 The system shall allow user to specify custom meeting locations.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall allow users to specify custom meeting locations. It does not state non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: The system shall allow the user to specify an ascending or descending sorting order when viewing meetings.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to choose ascending/descending sort when viewing meetings), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall notify all involved participants if any the following information about the meeting is modified.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system shall send notifications to participants when meeting information changes. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to act on behalf of another user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users acting on behalf of another user—delegation/impersonation). It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects such as availability, security controls, usability, or scalability, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system shall restrict the user's operation within its user role.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies enforcement of access control based on user roles (security: authorization). It also describes system behavior (functional), so labeled as F and SE.

RequirementText: The system shall conform to HTML standards and therefore support different web browsers including, but not limited to Internet Explorer, Firefox, Opera and Safari.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies browser support and conformance to HTML standards, which pertains to portability/compatibility across web browsers.

RequirementText: The system shall define data for monitoring digital wellbeing metrics (e.g., app usage, sleep patterns).
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional requirement: the system shall define data for monitoring digital wellbeing metrics. It describes what the system should do (data definition for monitoring). It does not explicitly constrain non-functional aspects such as availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall provide screens to view tracked metrics, set goals, and configure monitoring settings.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional capabilities (providing screens to view metrics, set goals, and configure monitoring settings), which are functional features. It does not state availability, security, usability, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional qualities explicitly, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to track app usage, monitor sleep patterns, and manage screen time limits.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities for users (track app usage, monitor sleep, manage screen time). Does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall prompt users to take breaks based on predefined settings or usage patterns.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (prompting users to take breaks) — a functional requirement. It also addresses user experience by prompting based on settings or usage patterns, which impacts usability, so US is set. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, scalability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall generate reports and visualizations to track progress towards digital wellbeing goals.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior—generating reports and visualizations to track progress—so it is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall implement user authentication and access controls based on user roles (e.g., standard user, administrator).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies authentication and role-based access controls, which are security concerns (authentication, authorization). It does not explicitly state functional behavior beyond security controls nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall respond to user interactions with minimal latency.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies minimal latency for responses to user interactions, which is a performance (speed/latency) constraint. It does not mention functionality, availability, security, scalability, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall be highly available and minimize downtime.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly targets high availability and minimizing downtime (availability). Implies resilience/recovery measures to reduce downtime, so fault tolerance is also applicable. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be scalable to accommodate a growing user base.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states scalability to accommodate a growing user base, which maps directly to Scalability (SC). It does not mention functional behavior, performance metrics, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall protect user data with robust security measures (e.g., encryption).
AI_Rationale: Explicitly mandates protection of user data with security measures (example: encryption). This is a security (SE) requirement; no availability, legal, performance, or other quality concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall provide an intuitive and user-friendly interface.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies an 'intuitive and user-friendly interface', which is a usability quality attribute. It does not state functional behavior or other quality aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall collect and store user data in accordance with privacy regulations and user consent.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional action (collect and store user data) and mandates compliance with privacy regulations and user consent (legal). It also implies data protection/confidentiality concerns (security). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, or usability aspects are stated.

RequirementText: The system (PowerPoint) shall allow users to create and edit text content for slides.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (create and edit text content for slides). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to import and manage various data formats like images, videos, and audio files within presentations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — allowing users to import and manage multimedia data formats within presentations. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to define layouts and themes for presentations.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (the system shall allow users to perform an action). It also explicitly concerns presentation appearance (layouts and themes), so it relates to Look & Feel.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create new presentations or open existing ones.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (allow users to create or open presentations), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to insert, edit, and delete slides within a presentation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies core system behaviors (CRUD operations on presentation slides). No mention of availability, performance, security, UI style, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall provide various formatting options for text, images, and other content elements on slides.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (providing formatting options) — functional. It directly concerns the presentation/appearance of slide content, so Look & Feel applies. No indication of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to define transitions and animations for slides within a presentation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability — allowing users to define slide transitions and animations — which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI style constraints, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to insert speaker notes for slides.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (inserting speaker notes for slides), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create a presentation by adding slides, defining content, and applying formatting.
AI_Rationale: Describes a system capability (creating presentations: adding slides, defining content, applying formatting) — a functional requirement. No non-functional constraints (performance, availability, usability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to collaborate on presentations by sharing and editing them with others.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—users can share and edit presentations collaboratively. It does not explicitly state availability, concurrency, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to deliver presentations in various modes, including full-screen mode and slide sorter view.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (presentation modes and views), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly impose availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to export presentations in various file formats like PPTX, PPT, PDF, and video formats.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (export presentations to multiple file formats). It does not mention availability, UI/look-and-feel, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, or operability concerns, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to print presentations with customizable layouts and settings.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (printing presentations with customizable layouts/settings), which is functional behavior. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, look-and-feel, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be intuitive and easy to learn for users with varying levels of experience.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly addresses learnability and intuitiveness, which are usability concerns. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall operate smoothly and respond to user actions with minimal delay.
AI_Rationale: Specifies responsiveness and minimal delay (performance/latency requirement) and describes smooth interaction which pertains to usability/UX. No mention of availability, fault tolerance, security, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall protect presentations from unauthorized access and modification.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system must protect presentations from unauthorized access and modification, which is a security requirement (confidentiality and integrity). It also describes a system capability to enforce protection, so it can be interpreted as a functional security requirement; no availability, legal, performance, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be compatible with various operating systems and file formats.
AI_Rationale: Specifies compatibility with multiple operating systems and file formats, which maps to portability/interoperability. No mention of functionality, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall be available for use with minimal downtime.
AI_Rationale: Statement explicitly addresses system availability and minimal downtime, which corresponds to Availability. It does not explicitly mention fault tolerance, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system (Microsoft Excel) shall allow users to enter various data types including numbers, text, dates, and formulas.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: allowing users to enter various data types (numbers, text, dates, formulas). No non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall define data formats for cells (e.g., currency, percentages, dates) and enforce those formats.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functionality to define and enforce cell data formats (functional) and concerns presentation/formatting (look & feel). It does not explicitly address usability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall offer validation rules to ensure data entered meets specific criteria (e.g., positive numbers only).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system feature to provide validation rules (functional). Ensures data correctness/integrity (data validity), which maps to security (SE) as integrity; does not explicitly address usability or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to enter data into cells arranged in a grid (rows and columns).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow users to enter data into grid cells). It describes behavior/feature, not availability, performance, security, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to perform basic mathematical operations (+, -, *, /) on data in cells.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (perform basic mathematical operations on cell data). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall offer a wide range of functions for calculations, data analysis, and manipulation (e.g., SUM, AVERAGE, VLOOKUP).
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities (available calculation and data manipulation functions such as SUM, AVERAGE, VLOOKUP). No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create charts and graphs to visualize data.
AI_Rationale: Describes a capability the system must provide (creating charts/graphs to visualize data), which is a functional requirement. No quality, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to format cells and worksheets for presentation purposes (e.g., fonts, borders, colors).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (allow users to format cells/worksheets) which is functional. It explicitly refers to presentation aspects (fonts, borders, colors), so it also concerns look-and-feel (visual appearance). No mention of availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or usability specifics.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create new spreadsheets or open existing ones.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system capability to create or open spreadsheets — a functional requirement describing what the system should do; no non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to save spreadsheets in various file formats (e.g., XLSX, XLS).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (saving spreadsheets in specific file formats), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state quality attributes such as performance, security, portability, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to collaborate on spreadsheets with others (may require additional configurations).
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a capability (users can collaborate on spreadsheets). The parenthetical note about additional configurations does not explicitly state operational, security, scalability or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to print spreadsheets or specific ranges of data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (allow users to print spreadsheets or specific ranges), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to export data to other formats (e.g., CSV, PDF).
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (export data to formats such as CSV, PDF). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, scalability, portability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall allow for password protection of spreadsheets to restrict access.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a feature (ability to password-protect spreadsheets) which is a functional requirement and directly addresses access restriction, an aspect of security (authentication/authorization). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall operate efficiently and respond to user actions within a reasonable timeframe.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies efficiency and timely response to user actions (performance). Responsiveness also relates to usability. No mention of availability, fault tolerance, security, or other categories.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to handle large and complex spreadsheets without significant performance degradation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns handling large/complex spreadsheets without significant performance degradation, indicating performance and scalability concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall save user data frequently and offer options for automatic backups to minimize data loss.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (saving user data and offering automatic backup options) → Functional. It focuses on minimizing data loss and resilience through backups/auto-save, which is a fault-tolerance/reliability concern → Fault Tolerance. It does not explicitly state availability, security, portability, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall recover gracefully from crashes or errors, minimizing data corruption.
AI_Rationale: Specifies recovery from crashes/errors and minimizing data corruption—primarily fault tolerance (resilience). Minimizing data corruption implies preserving data integrity, which maps to security.

RequirementText: The system shall have a user-friendly interface with clear menus, buttons, and icons.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user-friendly interface, clear menus/buttons/icons—this pertains to look & feel and usability (UI/UX). No availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall offer comprehensive online help and documentation for users of all skill levels.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system shall provide online help and documentation (a functional capability) aimed at users of all skill levels, which is primarily a usability-related quality (improves learnability and ease of use). No indications of availability, security, performance, etc., are present.

RequirementText: The system shall protect user data from unauthorized access or modification.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies protecting user data from unauthorized access or modification, which directly concerns security (confidentiality and integrity). It does not mention availability, legal compliance, functionality details, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall offer options for data encryption to further enhance security.
AI_Rationale: Specifies data encryption options to enhance security, which is a security (SE) requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, fault tolerance, portability, usability, legal, or other non-functional aspects, nor a functional behavior beyond the security capability.

RequirementText: The system shall be compatible with various operating systems and hardware configurations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states compatibility with various operating systems and hardware configurations, which maps to portability. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to open and work with spreadsheets created in previous versions of Excel (with potential limitations).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required capability (open/work with spreadsheets) — functional. Also explicitly concerns compatibility with previous Excel versions, i.e., portability/compatibility across formats, so PO is applicable. No mention of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The system (MS Forms) shall define the data types allowed for each question (e.g., text, number, date).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability of the system—to define allowed data types for each question (e.g., text, number, date). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall allow for setting validation rules on data entry (e.g., required fields, format restrictions).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow setting validation rules for data entry), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects like availability, security, usability, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create new forms with various question types (e.g., multiple choice, Likert scale).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: users can create forms with various question types. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to edit and modify existing forms.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying system behavior (allow users to edit/modify forms). No non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to preview forms before publishing.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to preview forms before publishing), which is a functional behavior. It does not state non-functional attributes such as performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to publish forms and share them with specific audiences.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional capability (publishing forms and sharing with specific audiences). No quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to collect responses and view submitted data.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies system behavior (allow users to collect responses and view submitted data), i.e., a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (availability, security, usability, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to analyze responses through charts and graphs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—providing users the ability to analyze responses via charts and graphs. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, scalability, security, or usability constraints, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: The system shall guide users through the process of creating and publishing a form.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system feature: guiding users through creating and publishing a form (functional). It also implies user assistance/experience concerns (usability) since it focuses on guiding users, but does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel specifics.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a clear workflow for collecting and analyzing responses.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system shall provide a workflow (a functional capability). The qualifier 'clear' indicates focus on clarity/usability of that workflow, so Usability is applicable. No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to export collected data in various formats (e.g., Excel, CSV).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (export data in formats like Excel/CSV) — a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (performance, UI, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall provide basic data visualizations like charts and graphs for response analysis.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional feature (providing charts/graphs for analysis). No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow defining user roles and permissions for form access (e.g., create, edit, view).
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to define user roles and permissions). It also explicitly concerns access control/authorization, so Security is applicable. Other non-functional categories are not implied.

RequirementText: The system shall comply with relevant data privacy regulations based on usage (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates compliance with data privacy regulations (legal). Such regulations (GDPR, HIPAA) also imply confidentiality/security controls, so Security is marked. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall respond to user actions within a reasonable timeframe.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies response time to user actions (timeliness/latency), which maps to Performance (PE). It does not explicitly address usability, availability, scalability, or other categories.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to handle a high volume of form submissions without performance degradation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly demands handling high volume of submissions without performance degradation, which indicates both scalability (ability to handle increased load) and performance (no degradation). No mention of availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall be highly available and accessible to users most of the time.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states availability/accessibility (highly available, accessible most of the time). It does not mention fault tolerance, recovery, performance, security, or other quality attributes, so only Availability is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to scale to accommodate an increasing number of users and forms.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies the system must be able to scale to accommodate an increasing number of users and forms, which directly maps to scalability. It does not mention performance metrics, availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall implement security measures to protect user data from unauthorized access.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies implementing security measures to protect user data from unauthorized access, which maps directly to Security (confidentiality/authentication/authorization). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall employ encryption for sensitive data transmission and storage.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly mandates encryption for data transmission and storage, which is a security concern (confidentiality/integrity). No other quality attributes (availability, performance, usability, etc.) are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: The system shall be user-friendly and intuitive for users of all technical abilities.

It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, look-and-feel constraints, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, or security.

RequirementText: The system shall maintain audit logs to track user activity and data changes.

RequirementText: The system shall be highly available with minimal downtime for maintenance.

RequirementText: The system shall have a response time of less than 5 seconds for basic operations.
