It is primarily a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional qualities such as availability, security, portability, performance, or usability are stated.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to add advertisements on the website by providing necessary specifications about the property.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can add advertisements with property specifications). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the application without interruption, demonstrating scalability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies uninterrupted access (availability) and explicitly mentions scalability. It does not state functional behavior, explicit fault-tolerance mechanisms, performance metrics, security, or other qualities, so only Availability and Scalability are set.

RequirementText: Backup power supply must be available for the server to ensure continuous operation in case of power failure.
AI_Rationale: Specifies backup power to ensure continuous operation—directly addresses availability and resilience to power faults (fault tolerance). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: API keys utilized by the application shall remain confidential and not be exposed as open source.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates confidentiality of API keys and prohibits exposing them in open source — this is a security requirement addressing secrecy/confidentiality of credentials. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, legal, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: Regular backups of the code shall be taken at defined intervals to prevent data loss.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an action the system must perform (regular backups) — a functional requirement — with the primary quality goal of preventing data loss/recovery, i.e., fault tolerance.

RequirementText: User passwords shall be hashed before storage in the database to maintain security.
AI_Rationale: Specifies hashing of user passwords before storage, which is a security control to protect confidentiality/integrity of credentials.

RequirementText: Passwords must meet specific criteria, including a minimum length of 8 characters, at least one uppercase character, one digit, and one special symbol.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies password composition rules (length, uppercase, digit, special symbol), which are security-specific constraints on authentication credentials. It does not address functional behavior, availability, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The website shall utilize HTTPS protocol to enhance security during data transmission.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of HTTPS to secure data during transmission, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). No mention of availability, performance, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: POST requests shall be used for transferring sensitive information, such as authentication details and property data, through forms.
AI_Rationale: Requires use of POST for transferring sensitive data — a security requirement (protects confidentiality; also prescribes specific system behavior, so marked functional as well). No availability, performance, portability, etc., implied.

RequirementText: The user interface should prioritize simplicity and avoid cluttering with excessive information to enhance usability.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI simplicity and avoiding clutter—this is about look-and-feel and directly targets usability (ease of use). No functional, performance, security, etc., requirements are implied.

RequirementText: The system should maintain high availability, ensuring uninterrupted operation at all times.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies high availability/uninterrupted operation, which maps directly to the Availability label. It does not explicitly mention fault tolerance, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Reliability shall be ensured to prevent data loss in case of server failure during ongoing operations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies resilience to server failures to prevent data loss—this is fault tolerance (graceful degradation/recovery). It does not explicitly address availability metrics, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The codebase shall be well-maintained with clean coding practices and thorough documentation to facilitate ease of maintenance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates clean coding practices and thorough documentation to facilitate ease of maintenance, which directly targets maintainability. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Comments shall be included in the codebase to aid new programmers and developers in making modifications.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates inclusion of code comments to aid developers, which directly targets maintainability (ease of modification and understanding). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The code shall be accompanied by proper test cases to identify and address any errors during production.
AI_Rationale: Requires accompanying test cases to detect/address errors—this targets maintainability/testability of the code rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The administrator of the application shall possess full control over system management and operations.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies administrative control over system management and operations, which concerns system operability/administration. It does not specify performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes explicitly, nor a detailed functional transaction behavior.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create a profile and set credentials for authentication.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (create profile and set credentials) — a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state security, performance, availability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall authenticate user credentials to grant access to the profile.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies authenticating user credentials to control access, which is a security requirement (authentication/authorization). It does not mention availability, performance, usability, portability, or other quality attributes, nor does it include broader functional behavior beyond access control.

RequirementText: User shall be able to update profile information as needed.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (ability to update profile information), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall enter search text on the screen to find matching products based on the search.
AI_Rationale: Describes a functional behavior: user input of search text and system returning matching products. No non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are specified.

RequirementText: User shall have the option to select multiple search criteria.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement enabling a feature (select multiple search criteria). It also impacts usability as it directly affects user interaction and choice, so US is set.

RequirementText: User shall navigate between search results to view different products.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (navigating between search results to view products), which is a functional requirement; no quality constraints (performance, usability, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: System shall notify the user when no matching product is found during the search.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (notify user when no matching product is found), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System shall provide a shopping bag feature during online purchase.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (shopping bag feature) to be provided during online purchase. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall add or remove products from the shopping bag as desired.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (ability for user to add/remove products from shopping bag). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall confirm orders from the shopping bag to proceed with the purchase.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional user interaction: the system must require user confirmation of orders in the shopping bag before proceeding with purchase. No non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall display available payment methods for the user to choose from during checkout.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (display payment methods during checkout), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall select a preferred payment method, such as credit card or cash on delivery.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user action/feature (selecting a payment method). It does not specify any non-functional quality such as availability, security, performance, or usability.

RequirementText: User shall enter card details for online payment, with the system verifying their validity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: user inputs card details and system verifies them. No explicit non-functional concerns (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: If paying by cash on delivery, user shall enter address details for order confirmation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: when payment method is cash on delivery, the user must enter address details for order confirmation. No non-functional quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall allow user to track shipments by entering order information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (tracking shipments via entered order information). It does not mention quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall display current tracking information about the order, including location and delivery time estimation.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall display order tracking information (location and estimated delivery time). It does not state quality attributes like performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall notify the seller about the delivery of the product to the customer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system action (sending a notification to the seller upon product delivery), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall access the e-store in multiple languages for enhanced accessibility.
AI_Rationale: Specifies multilingual access as a feature (functional) intended to improve accessibility/usability; no mention of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: User shall have access to handicap-friendly features for improved accessibility.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates that users shall have access to handicap-friendly features — this specifies a functional capability (providing accessibility features) and is primarily a usability requirement (accessibility, ease of use for disabled users). No explicit statements about availability, security, legal compliance, performance, scalability, or other categories are present.

RequirementText: User shall interact with the e-store through icons and toolbars for a user-friendly experience.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI elements (icons and toolbars) and aims for a user-friendly experience, which relates to Look & Feel and Usability. It does not state availability, performance, security, or maintenance requirements, nor a functional feature beyond UI modality.

RequirementText: User shall experience a consistent look and feel across all web pages of the e-store.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly addresses consistent look and feel (LF). Stating 'User shall experience' implies an effect on user experience/usability, so US is also applicable. No mention of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall view pictures related to each product in the product details for better understanding.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (viewing product images) — a functional behavior. It does not specify non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The reliability of the e-store depends on the reliability of its separate components.
AI_Rationale: The statement concerns system reliability/dependability, implying availability requirements and fault-tolerance of components. It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The database backup shall be continuously maintained and updated for reliability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies continuous maintenance and updates of database backups to ensure reliability, which addresses fault tolerance. It also mandates ongoing maintenance activities, implying maintainability. It does not specify availability metrics, functional behavior, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall replicate databases to off-site storage locations for backup.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system action (replicate databases to off-site storage) — functional. Purpose is backup/off-site replication for recovery, indicating fault tolerance/resilience. No explicit statements about availability SLAs, security, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall store all databases on redundant computers with automatic switchover for reliability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies redundant computers and automatic switchover to ensure reliability/uptime—this directly targets availability and fault tolerance. No functional behavior beyond storage location nor other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall utilize RAID V Disk Stripping on all database storage disks for reliability.
AI_Rationale: Specifies RAID striping on database disks to provide reliability—this is a fault-tolerance measure and directly impacts availability/uptime. It does not specify functionality, security, performance, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall have a contractual agreement with an internet service provider for T3 access with 99.9999% availability.
AI_Rationale: Specifies an SLA with an ISP and an explicit availability target (99.9999%), which directly concerns system availability. Does not mention functionality, security, performance metrics beyond uptime, fault tolerance mechanisms, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall have a contractual agreement with an internet service provider for 99.999% availability through their network facilities.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required availability level (99.999%) and an SLA with an ISP—this is an availability requirement. No explicit mention of other qualities (fault tolerance, legal compliance beyond the SLA, performance, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: All transactions with the customer's web browser shall be confirmed by the system for secure data transfer.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (confirming transactions with the customer's web browser) and explicitly requires secure data transfer, which is a security concern. It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: System shall not store any cookies containing the user's password or confidential information on the customer's computer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a security/privacy constraint (do not store passwords or confidential information in cookies). It does not describe functionality, performance, availability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall use secure sockets for all transactions involving confidential customer information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies use of secure sockets (encryption/secure transport) for transactions involving confidential customer information, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). No other quality attributes are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall automatically log out customers after a period of inactivity for security.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (automatic logout) and is explicitly motivated by security, so it's both Functional and Security. No mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: Customer's password shall not be displayed in plain text in the web browser, only represented by special characters.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates masking passwords in the web browser (preventing plain-text display). It is primarily a security requirement (confidentiality of credentials) and also specifies how the UI should present the password (representation by special characters), so Look & Feel is applicable. Other categories are not implied.

RequirementText: Customer's credit card number shall only display the last 4 digits after retrieval from the database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies masking of sensitive payment data (only last 4 digits displayed), which is a confidentiality/privacy/security control. It does not describe availability, performance, UI look, or functional behavior beyond the security constraint.

RequirementText: System's back-end servers shall not display the customer's password, only reset it if necessary.
AI_Rationale: Requirement addresses protection of customer passwords and limits access/display behavior, which is a security/confidentiality requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, or UI/look-and-feel, so other labels are not applicable.

RequirementText: System's back-end servers shall only be accessible to authenticated administrators for security.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access control requiring only authenticated administrators can access back-end servers — a clear security requirement (authentication/authorization). It does not specify functional behavior beyond access constraint or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System's back-end databases shall be encrypted to protect customer data.
AI_Rationale: Specifies encryption of back-end databases to protect customer data, which is a security requirement regarding confidentiality and data protection. No other qualities (availability, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall sign up or sign in using their email ID and password.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying sign-up/sign-in behavior (F). It also implies authentication/security concerns (SE) since it requires user credentials (email and password). No explicit performance, availability, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: System shall create a new database and register the user upon sign up.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (creating a database and registering a user) which is a functional requirement. It does not state quality attributes like availability, security, performance, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall authenticate user credentials from the database upon sign in.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (authenticate users on sign-in) and directly concerns security (authentication of credentials against the database). It does not mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall search for videos by entering keywords.

RequirementText: System shall display videos related to the entered keywords.

RequirementText: User shall share videos with friends and family by selecting them from the friend list.

RequirementText: System shall notify the user upon successful sharing of the video.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system action/behavior (notify user when video sharing succeeds), which is functional. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall download videos by clicking on the download button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (download videos via a download button) describing system behavior—a functional requirement. No non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall display a pop-up confirming the successful download of the video.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (display a pop-up confirming download) — a functional UI requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, look-and-feel) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall upload videos by clicking on the upload button and selecting the file to upload.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing how users upload videos (actions to perform). It also specifies a user interaction flow (click upload button and select file), which implies usability concerns about the user interface, so US is marked. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall display a pop-up confirming the successful upload of the file.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a concrete system behavior (displaying a pop-up on successful file upload), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall navigate to different sections: Home, Trending, and Subscription.

RequirementText: System shall display options for Home, Trending, and Subscription upon selecting the navigation section.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-visible behavior (displaying navigation options) which is a functional requirement. It does not state any availability, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Upon selecting Home, system shall display videos based on user history, subscription, and search.

RequirementText: Upon selecting Trending, system shall display location-based most popular videos.

RequirementText: Upon selecting Subscription, system shall display videos from channels subscribed by the user.

RequirementText: User shall access the Library section containing History, Watch Later, and Liked Videos options.

RequirementText: System shall display History section showing all the videos watched by the user.

RequirementText: System shall display Watch Later section showing all the videos added by the user for later viewing.

RequirementText: User will need a device capable of playing a 144p resolution video.

RequirementText: User will require a minimum internet connection speed of 500kbps to play videos without buffering.

AI_Rationale: Specifies an admin capability to add/remove recycling facility information — a functional requirement. No explicit security, performance, usability, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to check transaction history and keep records.

RequirementText: User shall experience a great UI and UX for a pleasant navigation experience.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view the updated date and time in the header information box.

RequirementText: Tester shall have access to test features in environments other than Staging.

RequirementText: FABS user shall have submission errors accurately represent FABS errors.

RequirementText: Agency user shall be able to accurately see who created a submission.

RequirementText: Agency user shall be able to understand file-level errors better.

RequirementText: Broker user shall be able to submit records for individual recipients without receiving a DUNS error.

RequirementText: User shall receive more information about the number of rows to be published before deciding to publish.

RequirementText: User shall receive information about the number of rows to be published before deciding whether to publish for informed decision-making.

RequirementText: Developer shall prevent duplicate transactions from being published and manage the time gap between validation and publishing decision for data integrity.

No explicit mention of availability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, UI, maintainability, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: The system shall encrypt collection data and maintain checksums for verification.

RequirementText: The system shall track financial responsibility for each item.

RequirementText: The system shall record publication and unpublication events with details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (recording publication/unpublication events and their details). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall allow searching by date range for items.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a search feature (ability to search by date range) which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall display embargo status and release date for items.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a concrete system behavior: displaying embargo status and release date for items. This is a functional requirement about what the system should show; it does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall expose descriptive records for ETDs for external use.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability — exposing descriptive records for ETDs for external use — which is functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow browsing collections and viewing item metadata.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities: browsing collections and viewing item metadata. No quality/constraint attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall generate reports on storage consumption by financial contact.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall generate a specific report (storage consumption by financial contact). No non-functional constraints (performance, availability, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall display collection-level replication status on the curator dashboard.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: displaying collection-level replication status on a specific dashboard. It does not state non-functional constraints like availability, performance, security, or UI appearance.

RequirementText: The system shall track and record audit events for repository actions.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (tracking and recording audit events). It also strongly implies a security-related requirement (audit logging for accountability/compliance), so SE is set. No explicit mention of availability, fault tolerance, performance, portability, scalability, usability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall provide administrators with user activity reports.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement is functional (provide reports). Specifying recipients as "administrators" implies access control/authorization, so security is relevant (similar to examples where view/update for authorized users was labeled SE). No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall provide curators with a dashboard widget for recent submissions.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability — providing a dashboard widget for curators to view recent submissions. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as security, UI styling, usability metrics, availability, or performance.

RequirementText: The system shall allow administrators to download embargo metadata for ETDs.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (administrators can download embargo metadata for ETDs), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall integrate with Fedora 4 event auditing services (if feasible).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies interfacing/integration with an external service (Fedora 4 event auditing), which is an operability/interop concern. It describes an integration capability rather than performance, security, portability to multiple platforms, or a user-facing function.

RequirementText: The system shall integrate with Symplectic Elements for bidirectional communication (if needed).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies interfacing/integration with an external system (Symplectic Elements) for bidirectional communication, which concerns system operability/interaction. It does not explicitly state functionality details, performance, portability, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall support OAI-PMH for repository content exposure.
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for a specific protocol (OAI-PMH) to expose repository content — this is a functional requirement. It implies interoperability/compatibility with a standard, so marked as portability. No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a Linked Data interface for repository data.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability — providing a Linked Data interface for repository data (an API/feature). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow deposit of data in documented folder structures.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (allow deposit of data into documented folder structures) — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional concerns (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall respond to user actions promptly and efficiently.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies responsiveness to user actions (promptly and efficiently), which is a performance-related quality attribute (latency/response time). It does not state functional behavior or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The system shall be highly available and accessible to users with minimal downtime.
AI_Rationale: The statement explicitly requires high availability and minimal downtime, which maps directly to Availability. Requiring minimal downtime and high availability also strongly implies fault tolerance/resilience, so Fault Tolerance is marked. No other quality attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall protect user data and repository content with robust security measures.
AI_Rationale: The statement mandates protecting user data and repository content, which is a security requirement (SE). It also describes a system behavior ('shall protect'), so it can be considered functional (F). No explicit mention of legal/compliance, availability, fault tolerance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall have a user-friendly interface for various user roles.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a "user-friendly interface" which directly pertains to usability (ease of use, user experience). It does not mention appearance, performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes, so only Usability is marked.

RequirementText: The system shall provide continued access in case of server failure.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies maintaining access despite server failure—this directly concerns availability and implies fault tolerance (redundancy/failover). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: User shall include the code of a dataset type in their app artifact and create a dataset of that type when deploying the app.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: users must include dataset type code and create a dataset during app deployment. It defines what the system/user must do rather than a quality attribute.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that dataset instances of a type created during app deployment start using the new code when a new version of the dataset type is deployed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior during deployment (ensuring dataset instances created at deployment time use the new code version) — a functional behavior related to deployment. It also concerns deployment/operation processes (how the system must behave when administering/updating the application), so operability is applicable. No explicit constraints about availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, or maintainability are stated.

RequirementText: User shall deploy a new version of a dataset type as part of an app artifact without affecting other datasets of this type.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user action (deploy a new dataset version) — functional. It concerns deployment process and administrative impact/isolation, which relates to operability. The constraint that other datasets must not be affected implies resilience/isolation during changes (fault tolerance). No explicit performance, security, legal, UI, portability, scalability, or maintainability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: User shall explore a dataset instance of a type deployed as part of an app.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (a user shall be able to explore a dataset instance), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall share a dataset type across multiple applications that include the dataset type's code in their artifacts.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability to share a dataset type across multiple applications (functional). It also implies cross-application compatibility/portability of the dataset type's code, so Portability is marked. No explicit statements about other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall ensure that when deploying a new version of an app including a shared dataset type, only dataset instances created by that app start using the new code.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must enforce during deployment (functional) — limiting which dataset instances start using the new code — and embodies an authorization/control constraint (security) to prevent unauthorized use of the new version. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall ensure that when deploying a new version of an app including an older version of a dataset type deployed by another app, dataset instances created by this app use the included dataset type code.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a behavioral constraint about deployment: newly created dataset instances must use the included dataset type code (functional behavior). It relates to deployment operation/administration, so operability is also applicable. No explicit mentions of security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or maintainability.

RequirementText: User shall ensure that when deploying a new version of an app including a different version of a dataset type deployed by another app, and if this app shares a dataset instance with the other app, the deployment fails with a version conflict error.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior during deployment (must fail with version conflict) — functional. It also concerns deployment/administration behavior (operability). It does not explicitly address security, availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance.

RequirementText: User shall share a dataset type previously deployed as part of an app.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (sharing a dataset type deployed as part of an app), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall deploy a dataset type independent from any app and allow apps to create and use dataset instances of that type.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functionality to deploy dataset types and allow apps to create/use instances (functional). Requires dataset types to be independent of any app, implying platform/usage independence and system operability/manageability (operability and portability). No explicit performance, security, scalability, maintainability, or UI requirements.

RequirementText: System shall provide an archetype to help dataset developers package dataset types properly.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (providing an archetype/tool). It explicitly helps developers package dataset types, which implies improved maintainability (standardization) and improved usability for developers; it does not mention availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: System shall separate the interface from the implementation of a dataset type.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a design constraint—separating interface from implementation—which is primarily about modularity and ease of maintenance and evolution of the codebase. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, portability, usability, or functional behavior, so only Maintainability is marked.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that apps can depend on the interface of a dataset type and have the system inject the implementation at runtime.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (ensure apps can depend on an interface and have implementations injected at runtime) — a functional behavior. It implies architectural support for decoupling and runtime binding which improves maintainability (ease of modification/extension), so Maintainability is set. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, legal, fault-tolerance, operability, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall allow dataset developers to assign explicit versions to the code of a dataset type.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: enabling dataset developers to assign explicit version identifiers to dataset-type code. It does not explicitly state quality attributes such as availability, security, maintainability, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that dataset instances created by apps are available as sinks and sources for pipelines.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior — making dataset instances available as sinks and sources for pipelines — which is a functional feature. It does not mention availability metrics, security, performance, maintainability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall provide meaningful error messages when dataset creation or reconfiguration fails due to incompatible properties.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (providing error messages) => Functional. It concerns handling failures (meaningful messages on creation/reconfiguration failure) => Fault Tolerance. Meaningful errors aid maintainability/debugging => Maintainability. It also improves end-user experience by making errors understandable => Usability. No explicit references to availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that all steps required to reconfigure a dataset must be done as a single atomic action.
AI_Rationale: Requires atomic/transactional behavior for dataset reconfiguration (ensuring all steps complete as a single action). This is a fault-tolerance/consistency requirement rather than security, performance, or UI; it does not specify functional features beyond the quality constraint.

RequirementText: System shall tolerate existing datasets if their properties are different but compatible when creating a dataset as part of app deployment.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must tolerate variations in existing datasets (robustness/resilience to differing but compatible data during deployment), which is a fault-tolerance/robustness quality. It does not state availability, performance, portability, security, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall provide meaningful error messages when pipeline creation fails due to an existing dataset being incompatible with the pipeline requirements.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (providing error messages) — functional. The requirement focuses on the quality of those messages being 'meaningful', which is a usability concern. No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, security, maintenance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, performance, or operability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: System shall ensure that enabling or disabling explore for a dataset does not result in silent loss of data or data available for explore.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns preventing silent data loss and ensuring data remains available when toggling 'explore'—this implies availability (A), fault tolerance/resilience to state changes (FT), and data integrity (mapped to Security/SE). It does not specify functional behavior beyond a quality guarantee, nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall install the Neurohub node onto a virgin Ubuntu operating system using a script.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies how the system is to be installed on a specific operating system (virgin Ubuntu) using a script, which concerns operation/deployment of the system (operability). It does not state performance, security, portability, or usability metrics, nor legal or maintenance concerns.

RequirementText: User shall test the functionality of a Neurohub installation with a script.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies an action the user shall perform to test system functionality (functional requirement). It also pertains to verifying an installation using a script, which relates to operation/administration (operability). No explicit non-functional concerns like performance, security, or portability are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall execute acceptance tests against a Neurohub installation and view the results.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies actions the user shall perform (execute acceptance tests and view results), which is functional behavior. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall digitally record responses made by subjects when completing paper-based forms.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—digitally recording subjects' responses to paper-based forms. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall navigate forwards and backwards between log books and log book pages without using the browser's back button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (must provide forward/back navigation between log books/pages without relying on browser back button) — a functional requirement. Also implies usability concern (ease of navigation), so US is set. No explicit performance, security, scalability, legal, maintainability, operability, portability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel/aesthetic constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall theme the Web interface graphics/colours as a lab administrator.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability: lab administrators can theme the web interface (functional). It explicitly concerns graphics/colours, which relates to look-and-feel requirements. No mention of availability, security, performance, etc., so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: User shall install Neurohub dependencies into an Ubuntu 10.04 LTS machine using Ubuntu package management tools.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies installation on a particular platform (Ubuntu 10.04 LTS) and using the platform package manager, which constrains portability across environments (Portability). It also pertains to installation/administration procedures, which is an operability concern. It does not state functional behavior of the system itself nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall create log book pages for experiments and attach files or directories to them as a researcher.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: researchers can create log book pages and attach files/directories. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are stated or implied.

RequirementText: User shall upload files prior to attaching them to a log book page via web interface or a mapped network drive.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (ability to upload files via web interface or mapped network drive) — this is a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall attach non-attached files to a log book page and receive alerts for unattached files.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system functionality: ability for users to attach files to a log book page and to receive alerts for unattached files. This describes functional behavior rather than a non-functional quality; no explicit usability, performance, security, or other NFRs are stated.

RequirementText: User shall download attached files from experiments using a web browser or a network drive.
AI_Rationale: The statement defines a concrete system capability (users shall download attached files), so it is a functional requirement. It also specifies allowed access methods (via web browser or network drive), which relates to how the system is accessed/operated, matching Operability. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, portability, etc., so those are not set.

RequirementText: User shall create log book page templates with bespoke metadata fields as a lab administrator.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement: ability for a user (lab administrator) to create log book page templates with custom metadata fields. The explicit role restriction implies an authorization/security aspect (admin-only action), so SE is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, usability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, or operability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: User shall have a managed backup protocol for the Neurohub system as a system administrator.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a managed backup protocol administered by the system administrator, which primarily concerns fault tolerance (recovery/backups) and operability (administration/management). It also impacts maintainability (ability to recover/restore and manage system data). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: User shall specify metadata for an experiment protocol before creating a file.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional behavior: the system must require/allow the user to specify metadata for an experiment protocol prior to file creation. It does not specify non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.).

RequirementText: User shall move multiple files using the Neurohub file browser.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (ability for a user to move multiple files via the Neurohub file browser). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall search and download human-readable experimental protocols.
AI_Rationale: Specifies user-facing capabilities: ability to search and download experimental protocols (functional behavior). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.).

RequirementText: User shall modify or branch experimental protocols while retaining the original.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (modify or branch protocols while keeping original) which is a functional requirement describing system behavior. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall view events and equipment bookings within the group as a lab member.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing a user (in the role of lab member) to view events and equipment bookings within the group. It describes what the system should do and does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall have the system forward important news items to an external mailing list.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: the system must forward news items to an external mailing list. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall view and update an inventory of equipment and consumables.
AI_Rationale: Specifies actions users shall perform (view and update inventory)—a functional requirement; no quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall have a spreadsheet hosted within Neurohub for collaborative editing and cost calculation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: a hosted spreadsheet with collaborative editing and cost-calculation features. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, UI, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall create feedback forms within Neurohub for course feedback.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that users can create feedback forms within the system. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall push posted content to their Twitter feed via Neurohub.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can push content to Twitter via Neurohub). It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, security, performance, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: User shall either keep log book entries private or share them with individuals.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that users must be able to set privacy/sharing of logbook entries (a functional capability) and implies access-control/privacy requirements (security). Does not mention availability, legal compliance, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall view the workflow plan, execution history, and results recorded in Neurohub while executing a workflow.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (view workflow plan, execution history, and results) — a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall provide a seamless and reliable installation process for the Neurohub node.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall provide an installation process (functional). Descriptors 'seamless' and 'reliable' focus on ease-of-use and operability of deployment, so mark Usability and Operability. No explicit security, performance, availability, portability, scalability, legal, maintainability, or look-and-feel aspects mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall ensure the stability and accuracy of acceptance tests executed against Neurohub installations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns ensuring stability and accuracy of acceptance tests (a quality of testing and ease of maintaining reliable tests). This maps to maintainability/testability rather than functional behavior or other specific NFRs.

RequirementText: System shall generate comprehensive and easily understandable reports for acceptance test results.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system function (generate reports) and adds qualitative constraint 'comprehensive and easily understandable', which pertains to usability/readability of the reports. No mention of performance, security, availability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall ensure the security and privacy of log book entries and attached files.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly references security and privacy of log entries and attachments, which maps directly to Security (confidentiality/privacy). No mention of availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate easy customization of the Web interface graphics/colours for lab administrators.
AI_Rationale: Specifies customization of web interface graphics/colours (Look & Feel). The qualifier 'easy' implies usability for lab administrators. No mention of performance, availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: System shall maintain backward compatibility and smooth dependency installation for Ubuntu 10.04 LTS.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies maintaining backward compatibility and smooth dependency installation on a specific OS (Ubuntu 10.04 LTS). This concerns portability/compatibility across platforms/versions (PO) and ease of installation/operability (O). No functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate efficient backup and recovery of Neurohub data for system administrators.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability to perform backup and recovery (functional). It explicitly concerns recovery behavior, implying fault tolerance. It is targeted at system administrators, indicating operability (admin tasks) and usability for admins. No explicit statements about availability, security, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, or maintainability were given, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: System shall provide intuitive and user-friendly interfaces for creating log book page templates.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates providing interfaces (functional) and emphasizes they be intuitive and user-friendly (usability). It does not mention aesthetics, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall ensure data integrity and reliability during file uploads and attachments.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on ensuring data integrity and reliability during file uploads/attachments, which implies security (data integrity/confidentiality/integrity controls) and fault tolerance/reliability during transfer/storage. It does not specify functional behavior, availability metrics, maintainability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall provide robust search functionality for retrieving experimental protocols and files.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: providing search functionality to retrieve experimental protocols and files. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: System shall ensure seamless integration with external tools and services, such as Twitter and Google Calendar.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies integration/interoperability with external tools and services (e.g., Twitter, Google Calendar). This concerns operability/manageability and external system integration rather than performance, security, portability, or UI. No explicit functional details or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: System shall provide efficient storage and retrieval mechanisms for large files and datasets.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (provide storage/retrieval). The term “efficient” and focus on large files/datasets implies performance concerns (speed/resource efficiency) and scalability (handle large scale), but no explicit mention of security, availability, fault-tolerance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall enforce access controls and permissions for sharing and managing data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies enforcement of access controls and permissions (security concern) and also describes a functional capability (enforcing access) so marked as SE and F.

RequirementText: System shall support version control and revision history tracking for files and log book entries.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies a system capability (support version control and revision history) which is functional. It also directly supports maintainability by enabling tracking of changes and rollbacks, so Maintainability is marked. It does not explicitly state availability, security, scalability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall ensure high availability and reliability of remote access to the Neurohub node.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies high availability and reliability of remote access, which maps directly to Availability. Ensuring reliability/high availability implies fault tolerance/resilience, so FT is set. No explicit mention of security, functionality, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall provide comprehensive documentation and training resources for users and administrators.
AI_Rationale: Requirement requests documentation and training for users and administrators. This directly supports usability (US) for end users and operability (O) for administrators. It also aids maintainability (MN) by facilitating system maintenance and knowledge transfer. No explicit functional behavior, availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance requirements are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to know exactly what ALFRED does with their personal data and share it only with specific permission.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability (they shall be able to know and control sharing) — a functional requirement. It concerns handling of personal data and consent, implying security/privacy controls (SE) and also aligns with legal/data-protection obligations (L). Other NFRs (performance, availability, etc.) are not implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to receive information from ALFRED through speech technology.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (receiving information via speech technology), which is a functional feature. It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to use only well-visible buttons.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the visual visibility of buttons (look & feel) and relates to ease of use (usability). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to use ALFRED as much as possible with speech interaction.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that users should be able to use the system via speech interaction — this defines a functional capability (support for speech interaction) and is primarily a usability/accessibility goal (ease of use via speech). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall always keep control over the activities of ALFRED.
AI_Rationale: The requirement asserts that the user must always retain control over the system's activities—this primarily addresses usability (user control, autonomy, and interaction). It also strongly implies a security aspect (ensuring users can authorize, monitor, or stop actions), so SE is marked. It does not explicitly specify functional behavior, availability, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage privacy and data settings.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (functional). It concerns management of privacy and data settings, which directly relates to security/privacy controls, so Security is also applicable. No explicit statements about availability, performance, usability metrics, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel are given.

RequirementText: User shall have ALFRED preinstalled, eliminating the need for manual setup.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system must come with ALFRED preinstalled (a functional delivery/deployment requirement) and implies improved ease-of-use by eliminating manual setup (usability). No indication of availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: User shall have a small, wearable ALFRED device for easy portability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies physical smallness and wearability for easy portability, which maps to portability (PO). It does not explicitly address usability, performance, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have ALFRED installed on all their computers, tablets, and phones.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that ALFRED must be installed on all user devices—this is a functional deployment requirement. It also implies support across device classes (computers, tablets, phones), i.e., portability across platforms.

RequirementText: User shall have ALFRED integrated into a wearable device like a bracelet or necklace.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that ALFRED must be integrated into wearable devices (bracelet/necklace) — a deployment/compatibility/platform constraint (portability). It also states a functional capability (integration provided to the user). No explicit availability, security, UI look-and-feel, or other qualities mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall have access to clear instructions and post-sales service for using ALFRED.
AI_Rationale: The requirement states that users shall have access to clear instructions and post-sales service (a functional provision of support) and emphasizes clarity/usability of those instructions, so it implies Usability. It does not mention availability metrics, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have an ALFRED device that speaks slowly and clearly.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a device capability (speaks) — functional. The constraint that it speak slowly and clearly pertains to user experience/understandability, so it's a usability (US) quality requirement.

RequirementText: User shall have an ALFRED device that reacts only to their voice.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (device reacts only to the user's voice) and implies an access-control/security requirement (voice-based authentication/authorization). No explicit availability, performance, portability, etc., requirements.

RequirementText: User shall have an ALFRED device that listens only when prompted.
AI_Rationale: Specifies device behavior (only listens when prompted) — a functional requirement — and implies privacy/security constraint about listening/access, so Security also applies. No mention of availability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: User shall have an introductory conversation with ALFRED to learn about its functionalities.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a concrete feature (an introductory conversation with ALFRED), which is functional. It also explicitly serves learnability/usability (help users learn functionalities), so US is applicable. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to purchase ALFRED from senior shops with dedicated client support.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a user capability (purchase via senior shops with dedicated client support), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to purchase ALFRED at an affordable price.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability (being able to purchase ALFRED), which is a functional requirement. 'Affordable price' is a business/pricing constraint and does not clearly map to availability, performance, usability, security, or other listed NFR categories, so no additional labels are set.

RequirementText: User shall receive visual support, especially when viewing lists, maps, or agendas.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual support for users when viewing lists, maps, or agendas—this concerns the user interface/look-and-feel and improves usability. It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, or other listed qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to use ALFRED for small payments.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (allow users to perform small payments), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, usability metrics, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have a long-lasting battery for all-day use of ALFRED.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies battery life to allow all-day operation — this is about system availability/uptime (A) and a performance characteristic of power/battery efficiency (PE). It does not describe functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall receive alerts from ALFRED about low battery levels when leaving the house.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (sending alerts to the user about low battery levels when leaving the house), which is a functional requirement. It does not state non-functional concerns such as performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: User shall have an ALFRED device easily adaptable for users with visual or hearing impairments.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies accessibility/adaptability for users with visual or hearing impairments, which is primarily a usability concern. It also implies UI/look-and-feel adjustments to support those impairments, so LF is marked. No indication of security, performance, availability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall have an ALFRED device with options for customization.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system shall provide an ALFRED device to the user (a functional provision) and that it shall include options for customization. The customization aspect implies user-facing configurability/usability concerns rather than other quality attributes. No explicit availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to zoom into visual content.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to zoom visual content), which is a functional requirement. It also relates to user interaction/experience, so it implicates usability. No other quality attributes are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall have access to new apps in the ALFREDO platform to meet changing demands.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies that users shall have access to new apps (a functional capability). The phrase 'to meet changing demands' implies adaptability/ability to accommodate growth or evolving requirements, mapped to scalability. No explicit mentions of security, availability, performance, portability, maintainability, usability, legal, look-and-feel, fault tolerance, or operability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to use ALFRED to communicate with friends and family.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability—users can communicate with friends and family via ALFRED. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall have video conversations with others.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (video conversations) — it describes what the system should do. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have access to a videophone feature.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (providing access to a videophone feature), which is functional in nature. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall have ALFRED encourage real interaction between users and not just ICT tools.
AI_Rationale: Requirement addresses encouraging real user-to-user interaction and user experience rather than a functional action or technical constraint; this is a usability/UX quality requirement.

RequirementText: User shall receive suggestions for existing apps matching their interests.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall provide app suggestions matching user interests. No non-functional aspects (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to customize preferences in ALFRED's functionalities.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (ability to customize preferences), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, usability metrics, security, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: System shall provide a seamless and reliable installation process for ALFRED.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall provide an installation process (functional). The adjectives 'seamless and reliable' imply ease-of-use and smoothness (usability) and concern about the installation being dependable and manageable, which relates to operability. No explicit mention of availability, security, portability, scalability, fault-tolerance, legal, performance, or maintainability.

RequirementText: System shall ensure stability and accuracy in acceptance tests for ALFRED.
AI_Rationale: Requirement emphasizes "stability" (resilience/reliable behavior under test) and "accuracy" in acceptance tests. This implies fault-tolerance/reliability concerns and also relates to maintainability/testability (ensuring tests are stable and results accurate). It does not specify availability, security, performance, portability, UI, or legal aspects, nor a specific functional behavior.

RequirementText: System shall ensure security and privacy of log book entries and attached files.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies security and privacy of log entries and attachments, which maps to Security concerns (confidentiality, access controls, encryption). No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate easy customization of the Web interface graphics/colors.
AI_Rationale: Specifies customization of web interface graphics/colors = Look & Feel. The phrase 'easy customization' implies usability/learnability for users or admins, so Usability also applies. No mention of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall maintain backward compatibility and smooth dependency installation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns preserving backward compatibility (compatibility across versions/environments) and ensuring smooth dependency installation. This implies portability/compatibility (PO) and relates to maintainability (MN) since backward compatibility eases future changes/updates. Smooth dependency installation impacts operability/manageability (O). No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, legal, or UI/usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate efficient backup and recovery of ALFRED data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (backup and recovery) — functional. It also addresses resilience to data loss and restoration, which is fault tolerance. 'Efficient' is not strong enough here to mark performance.

RequirementText: System shall ensure seamless integration with external tools and services.
AI_Rationale: The requirement focuses on interfacing with external tools/services — this primarily concerns portability/interoperability (PO). 'Seamless' implies ease of operation and manageability of integrations, so Operability (O) is also applicable. It does not explicitly state functional behavior, security, performance, scalability, maintainability, legal, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: System shall support version control and revision history tracking.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system feature (version control and revision history) so is functional. It also implies improved maintainability (ability to track and manage changes), but does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, scalability, or other categories.

RequirementText: System shall ensure high availability and reliability of remote access to ALFRED.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies high availability and reliability of remote access, which maps to Availability. It does not mention fault tolerance mechanisms, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Availability is set.

RequirementText: System shall provide comprehensive documentation and training resources.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall provide documentation and training resources — this is a functional capability (F) and primarily targets usability/learnability (US). No explicit mention of security, availability, maintainability, operability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view a list of sponsors, so that they can thank all the awesome sponsors.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-visible capability (view a list of sponsors), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view a list of user profiles, so that they know who is attending the conference.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (viewing a list of user profiles). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to email all the trainers at once from the website for info and updates, so that it is easier to use.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (send email to all trainers) — functional. The phrase 'so that it is easier to use' indicates an intended usability improvement, so Usability is also applicable. No explicit availability, security, performance, etc., requirements.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view a very clear map showing the buildings and rooms, so that they can make it to class on time.
AI_Rationale: Primary requirement is a functional capability to view a map (functional). The phrase 'very clear map' expresses a quality about clarity/usability (makes it easier to find rooms and get to class), so I mark Usability. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to edit their training node themselves, including links to slides, so that training coordinators don't have to.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to edit training node and links) which is functional. It also implies self-service/usability goals (users can manage without coordinators), so Usability is applicable. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, maintainability, look-and-feel, fault-tolerance, or operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be limited to one registration per day per authenticated user, to prevent duplicate spaces.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional business rule specifying system behavior: enforce a limit of one registration per authenticated user per day to prevent duplicate spaces. It does not describe availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: User shall have an admin view to track registration status for each attendee, so that attendance status can be monitored.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a system capability: an admin view to track registration/attendance status for each attendee (a functional feature). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to be added to a training waitlist, to be considered for a class.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (ability for a user to be added to a training waitlist). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User must accept the cancellation terms with a checkbox, to be accountable.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a required system behavior (must provide a checkbox for users to accept cancellation terms) — functional. It also implies a legal/compliance concern (acceptance for accountability), so Legal is included. No explicit non-functional quality attributes (performance, availability, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall have a cancellation deadline tied to registration/cancellation workflow, to avoid financial loss.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior/feature (a cancellation deadline tied into the registration/cancellation workflow). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, legal, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add events to "my schedule" if there is a schedule feature on the site, to schedule their event experience.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (ability to add events to 'my schedule'), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to see which trainings they have signed up for, to plan their event experience.

RequirementText: User shall have a view showing all attendee information attached to their training node, so trainers can see class attendance.

RequirementText: User shall have an admin view to show all trainee information, filterable by training session, for easy management.

RequirementText: User shall have a dedicated page for each class with specific information displayed, for easy class selection.

RequirementText: User shall have training options clearly marked with all necessary information listed, for easy browsing and selection.

RequirementText: User shall have a training landing page with an intro section and a list of all training offerings, to easily shop for training.
