RequirementText: User shall have a link on the home page to a list of training options, for easy access.

RequirementText: User shall be able to find information about the coding lounge location and opening hours, for coding sessions.

RequirementText: System shall provide a user-friendly interface for updating user profiles.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate easy signup for the BADCamp newsletter.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a signup capability (functional) and emphasizes that it must be easy to use (usability). No indications of performance, security, availability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System shall ensure seamless integration with Drupal Planet for blog posts.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability to integrate with Drupal Planet for blog posts (a functional behavior). It also implies interoperability/compatibility with an external platform, so Portability is relevant. No explicit constraints about security, performance, availability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: System shall provide an intuitive blog creation interface for administrators.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an intuitive blog creation interface (quality of the UI/UX) aimed at administrators, which is a usability requirement. It does not specify functional details, security, availability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall offer easy access to the blog for user consumption.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (system shall offer access to the blog). The word 'easy' specifies a quality about how users interact, which pertains to usability. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or operability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: System shall support sponsorship opportunities matching sponsor brands.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability: supporting sponsorship opportunities that match sponsor brands — this describes functional behavior (feature). It does not mention availability, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate smooth registration for summits.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (facilitate registration) = Functional. The adjective 'smooth' refers to quality of the user experience (usability), so Usability is marked. No explicit statements about performance, availability, security, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, or maintenance.

RequirementText: System shall enable users to view their signed-up summits for confirmation.

RequirementText: System shall provide a user-friendly registration form for ease of registration.

RequirementText: User shall be able to properly record all metadata for the project.

RequirementText: System shall be able to store metadata accurately and comprehensively.

RequirementText: User shall be able to indicate where data will be stored during and after the project.

RequirementText: User shall be able to import metadata captured with a metadata tool into a Data Management Plan (DMP).

RequirementText: System shall be able to seamlessly integrate metadata from external sources into DMPs.

RequirementText: User shall be able to plan the types of data to record and store for the project.

RequirementText: User shall be able to document the security requirements of the data.

RequirementText: System shall provide information and tools for users to specify security measures for data.

RequirementText: User shall be able to describe collected datasets used or updated during the project.

RequirementText: System shall maintain updated descriptions of datasets throughout the project lifecycle.

RequirementText: User shall be able to record information about the DMP for review by an Ethics Committee.

RequirementText: System shall store and organize DMP details for ethics compliance review.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system function—storing and organizing DMP details—so Functional = true. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security controls, usability, performance, scalability, portability, or maintainability, so those remain false.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access persistent identifiers of datasets provided in the DMP.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate access to persistent identifiers for datasets referenced in the DMP.

RequirementText: User shall be able to prepopulate DMP information from other institutional systems.

RequirementText: System shall automatically populate relevant DMP fields with existing institutional data.

RequirementText: User shall be able to know when the DMP was created or last updated.

RequirementText: System shall display creation and modification timestamps for DMPs.

RequirementText: User shall be able to know who is responsible for the DMP.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access project proposal references from the DMP.

RequirementText: User shall be able to extract administrative information into the DMP for prepopulation.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate the import of administrative data to streamline DMP creation.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access reports containing details of research projects classified as sensitive or highly sensitive.

RequirementText: System shall generate reports on sensitive data classifications for access by designated personnel.

RequirementText: System shall prioritize user-friendly interfaces for easy navigation and data entry.

RequirementText: System shall ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

RequirementText: System shall support interoperability with external metadata tools and systems.

RequirementText: System shall provide robust backup and recovery mechanisms for data reliability.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate collaboration and data sharing among project stakeholders.

RequirementText: System shall maintain high availability to ensure continuous access to DMPs and associated data.

RequirementText: System shall provide documentation and support resources for users to effectively utilize DMP functionalities.

RequirementText: System shall support backend changes for managing enum lists efficiently and reliably.

RequirementText: System shall ensure data integrity and reliability during the import and export of archival data.

RequirementText: System shall support custom importer development for flexible data import options.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (support custom importer development) which is functional. It also implies extensibility/modifiability to allow developers to create custom importers, which maps to maintainability. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall prioritize performance and scalability in managing large datasets and complex record structures.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly prioritizes performance and scalability for large datasets and complex records, which directly maps to Performance (speed/throughput/latency) and Scalability. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality aspects.

RequirementText: System shall enable role-based access control to enforce appropriate permissions for different user roles.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies role-based access control and enforcing permissions, which is a security (access control/authorization) concern. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional areas.

RequirementText: System shall offer customizable configuration options to meet diverse user needs and preferences.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (system shall offer customizable configuration options). Implies improved usability/customization for diverse user needs, but does not explicitly address look-and-feel, security, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall ensure compatibility with various data formats and standards for interoperability.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies compatibility with various data formats and standards to enable interoperability — this implies portability across environments/formats and operability/integration capabilities rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall provide comprehensive documentation and support resources for users and administrators.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies provision of documentation and support resources for users and administrators, which directly relates to maintainability (ease of maintaining and supporting), operability (admin support/operations), and usability (user assistance/learnability). It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall adhere to best practices for data security and privacy protection throughout the application.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates data security and privacy protection best practices, which map directly to the Security (SE) quality. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, usability, or other non-functional categories explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to deposit and maintain datasets through a simple web interface, facilitating ease of use.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities (deposit and maintain datasets) and explicitly mentions a simple web interface and ease of use, implying Look & Feel and Usability requirements; no availability, performance, security, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects are stated.

RequirementText: System shall provide a user-friendly web interface for depositors to submit and manage datasets without requiring additional software installation.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (web interface to submit/manage datasets) => Functional. 'User-friendly' explicitly targets usability => Usability. 'Web interface without requiring additional software installation' implies access across platforms/environments (no client install), so Portability is applicable. No explicit mentions of security, performance, availability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel specifics.

RequirementText: User shall be able to deposit datasets through Pure, ensuring a centralized platform for managing research outputs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability: depositing datasets through Pure and centralizing research outputs — a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall integrate with Pure to enable dataset deposition and management within the platform.
AI_Rationale: The statement prescribes integration behavior (ability to integrate with Pure to enable dataset deposition/management) which is a functional requirement. It also implies interoperability/operability concerns (integration capability and system manageability), but does not mention availability, performance, portability, security, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to deposit datasets through Virtual Research Environments and other workflow tools.

RequirementText: System shall support dataset deposition and management through integration with Virtual Research Environments and other familiar workflow tools.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall support dataset deposition and management via integration with Virtual Research Environments and other workflow tools — this is a functional capability. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, legal, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to deposit files without extensive format conversion or version searching.

It does not explicitly state platform compatibility, availability, security, performance, scalability, or other NFRs, so those are not marked.

RequirementText: System shall accept file deposits without requiring complex format conversion and support direct submission of files.

RequirementText: User shall be able to place data under embargo to protect rights of first use and confidentiality responsibilities.

RequirementText: System shall provide functionality for depositors to apply embargoes to datasets.

RequirementText: User shall be able to apply licenses to datasets to protect intellectual property rights.

RequirementText: User shall be able to grant privileged access to collaborators for efficient collaboration.

RequirementText: System shall support privileged access management to enable efficient collaboration among depositors and collaborators.

RequirementText: User shall be able to deposit arbitrarily large files without limitations.

No explicit mention of availability, security, portability, maintainability, etc., so those are not set.

RequirementText: System shall accommodate deposits of arbitrarily large files without size restrictions.

RequirementText: User shall be able to link datasets to publications in Opus for improved discoverability.

RequirementText: System shall provide functionality to link datasets with associated publications in Opus.

RequirementText: User shall be able to mint DOIs for datasets to facilitate discoverability and citation tracking.

RequirementText: User shall have metadata automatically filled from University systems and remembered from previous deposits.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage and share live research data to maintain workflow continuity.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage multiple versions of datasets transparently to maintain research integrity.

RequirementText: User shall be able to delegate deposition tasks to others on their behalf.

RequirementText: System shall generate persistent URLs for datasets to ensure easy future access.

RequirementText: System shall integrate with Primo for unified search functionality across books, articles, and datasets.

RequirementText: System shall display different versions of datasets clearly to aid users in selecting the appropriate version.

RequirementText: System shall provide access to Bath data for external collaborators off-campus to support collaboration.

RequirementText: System shall enable direct deposition of facility data into the archive on behalf of researchers, eliminating the need for separate facility archives.

RequirementText: System shall perform checks on deposited datasets for quality, compliance, and licensing before public release.

It does not explicitly address availability, security, performance, scalability, usability, maintainability, portability, fault tolerance, look-and-feel, or operability.

RequirementText: System shall enforce a minimum set of metadata requirements to ensure consistent metadata quality.

RequirementText: System shall require approval for scheduled data disposal to prevent accidental loss of required data.

RequirementText: System shall enable querying of the entire archive for reporting and analysis purposes.

RequirementText: System shall support wholesale import of Bath data from external data centers to prevent data loss.

RequirementText: System shall promote the use of open standards for deposition to maximize data reusability.

RequirementText: System shall integrate with CRIS for impact analysis and funding linkage purposes.

RequirementText: System shall include records for externally held data to maintain a complete record of the University's data holdings.

AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (count whales in audio files). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall determine when to interrupt a volunteer and suggest intervention method (text, image, video).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: determining when to interrupt a volunteer and recommending an intervention method (text, image, video). It describes functional functionality rather than quality attributes; no explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall determine when to educate a volunteer and suggest education method (text, image, video).
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability/behavior (deciding when to educate a volunteer and recommending a format), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall recommend appropriate educational resources for volunteers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (recommending educational resources), i.e., functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall identify interesting volunteer comments on subjects.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (identifying interesting volunteer comments), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes such as performance, security, availability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall determine when Zoonibot should comment or provide explanations to volunteers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (deciding when the Zoonibot should comment or provide explanations), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a user-friendly interface for various user roles.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies providing an interface (functional) and that it be user-friendly (usability). It mentions various user roles but does not explicitly state access control or security/authorization, nor other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall perform content processing tasks efficiently.
AI_Rationale: Statement specifies efficiency of processing tasks, which is a performance-related non-functional requirement. No explicit availability, scalability, security, or functional specifics provided.

RequirementText: User shall be able to register complaints with the police.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (register complaints) which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate interaction and information exchange between police and complainants.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional capability — facilitating interaction and information exchange between police and complainants (functional). It also implies concern for ease of interaction/communication (usability). No explicit availability, security, performance, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall store complaint details, evidence, and facts.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior—storing complaint details, evidence, and facts. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall generate a unique identifier for each registered complaint.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional action (the system shall generate a unique identifier for each registered complaint). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to initiate the investigation process for registered complaints.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing an action the user must be able to perform (initiate investigation for registered complaints). It does not specify security, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall automate tasks related to investigation after initial entries are made during registration.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: automation of investigation-related tasks triggered after registration entries. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall track progress and updates of ongoing investigations.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability (tracking progress and updates) rather than a quality attribute. No explicit availability, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints are stated.

RequirementText: System shall generate reports on the status of investigations.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability — generating reports — which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to record entries of court interactions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to record court interaction entries — a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate the interface between police personnel and the courts.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional capability: the system must provide/facilitate an interface between police personnel and the courts. It does not state availability, security, performance, usability, legal, or other non-functional constraints, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall maintain a record of court proceedings related to cases.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: maintaining records of court proceedings. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to execute basic or advanced searches on cases.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (perform basic or advanced searches on cases), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System shall provide search functionality based on criteria such as person, type of crime, modus operandi, etc.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a system capability (search functionality and searchable criteria), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall customize search results by criminal/accused or by cases.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: the system must customize/search results by criminal/accused or by cases. No non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: System shall execute different types of queries for reporting purposes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (execute different types of queries for reporting) — a functional requirement. No explicit quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to exchange information with police units/personnel.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (communication with police units), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (security, availability, interoperability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall facilitate information exchange between citizens and police.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability the system must provide (facilitate information exchange) — a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, operability, or other quality attributes, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: System shall respond to citizen inquiries with minimal turnaround time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall respond to citizen inquiries (functional) with minimal turnaround time — a performance/latency requirement. No explicit availability, scalability, security, usability, or other qualities are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to navigate through the CCTNS application.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (navigating the application), which is a functional requirement. It does not state usability, performance, or UI/look-and-feel constraints explicitly, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: System shall provide role-based landing pages showing relevant information such as assigned cases, alerts, and pending tasks.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (provide role-based landing pages with assigned cases, alerts, pending tasks), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall help police personnel in planning and executing tasks efficiently.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional goal (the system shall help police personnel plan and execute tasks) and emphasizes efficiency for users, which is a usability concern. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance metrics, security, scalability, portability, fault tolerance, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to configure application settings according to state requirements.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (configure application settings) — a functional requirement. The phrase 'according to state requirements' indicates compliance/regulatory constraints, so Legal is applicable. No explicit mention of availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall maintain data elements and rules up to date.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system capability (to maintain data elements and rules up to date), which is a functional requirement about behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, maintainability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall allow creation, updating, and deletion of state-specific data elements such as acts, sections, castes, tribes, etc.
AI_Rationale: Specifies CRUD functionality for state-specific data elements (creation, updating, deletion), which is a functional requirement. No explicit quality attributes (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access detailed context-sensitive help material for all actions and scenarios.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (users can access context-sensitive help). Also implies a usability requirement (help improves learnability and ease of use). No explicit security, performance, availability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall provide help material accessible in both offline and online modes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement to provide help material (F). Requiring access in both offline and online modes impacts usability (US) by ensuring users can access help regardless of connectivity. Does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log defects or enhancement requests and track them.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (log and track defects/enhancement requests), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall send alerts (e.g., email, SMS) to users regarding actions taken on alerts upon user request.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior — sending alerts (email/SMS) to users upon request — which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns like availability, security, operability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: System shall enable users to track submitted defect or enhancement requests.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function: enabling users to track submitted defect or enhancement requests. It describes functional behavior rather than availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall allow help-desk users to view reports on submitted defects or enhancement requests category-wise, status-wise, and age-wise.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (help-desk users viewing reports filtered by category, status, and age), which is a functional behavior (reporting feature). No non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Support solution shall be accessible both within and outside the application through a browser interface.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies access both internally and externally via a browser—this concerns availability/accessibility and implies security controls for external access (similar to provided example). No explicit performance, scalability, portability, or UI/look-and-feel requirements stated.

RequirementText: System shall maintain an unalterable audit trail capturing actions taken on critical entities, users initiating actions, and date/time of events.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability to maintain an unalterable audit trail (functional) and implies security concerns (integrity, non-repudiation, protection of audit records). It does not explicitly state availability, legal/compliance, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, look-and-feel, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Audit trail functionality must be activated without manual intervention.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that audit-trail functionality must be activated automatically (a functional requirement). The phrase ‘without manual intervention’ concerns automation of administration/operation, implying an operability requirement. No explicit mention of security, legal, performance, etc.

RequirementText: System must maintain audit trail for at least the life of associated cases and make it accessible on request.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (maintain audit trail and provide access) and implies retention/compliance constraints (life of associated cases), which maps to Legal. It does not explicitly state availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Audit trail data must be available for inspection and export for specified cases.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must provide the capability to inspect and export audit trail data (functional behavior). It also implies operational/manageability concern (availability of data for administrators/operators), but does not mention security, uptime, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System must capture and store violations and attempted violations of access control mechanisms.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies capturing and storing violations and attempted violations of access control mechanisms, which is an audit/logging security control. It directly concerns security (monitoring access control breaches). No other quality attributes (availability, performance, portability, etc.) are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: System must provide reports for actions on cases organized by case, user, and in chronological sequence.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional requirement to provide reporting features (reports organized by case, user, and chronological order). It does not explicitly state non-functional qualities like availability, performance, security, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall allow users to limit access to cases to specified users or user groups.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability to restrict access to cases to certain users/groups (functional behavior) and explicitly concerns access control, which is a security requirement (authorization). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall provide role-based control for functionalities within the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall provide role-based control (a functionality) and implies access control/authorization, which is a security requirement. No indication of availability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall allow a user to be a member of more than one group.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (functional behavior) to allow users to belong to multiple groups. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Only admin-users shall set up user profiles and allocate users to groups.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (only admin-users may perform user management tasks), which is an authorization/security constraint rather than a functional feature or other NFR category.

RequirementText: System shall allow changes to security attributes for groups or users by super-users only.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (allow changes to security attributes) — functional. It also enforces an authorization constraint ('by super-users only'), which is a security (access control) requirement. No other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: When users lack access to a case, system shall provide appropriate responses selectable at configuration time.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns access control behavior when users lack access (security-related) and specifies that responses are selectable at configuration time (administrative/configurability concern => operability). It does not state performance, portability, scalability, legal, UI look-and-feel, maintainability, or functional business behaviors beyond access handling.

RequirementText: System shall never include unauthorized records in search results.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control for search results (prevent unauthorized records from being returned), which is a security/authorization concern. It does not describe availability, performance, UI, maintainability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: Unauthorized attempts to access cases must be logged in the audit trail.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (logging unauthorized access attempts) — functional. It explicitly concerns security (recording unauthorized access in an audit trail) — security. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, legal/compliance, maintainability, operability, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: All access to cases and related activities must be stored in the audit trail for legal admissibility and data recovery.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates that all access and activities be recorded in an audit trail (a system behavior -> Functional). It explicitly cites legal admissibility (Legal) and data recovery (implies recovery/resilience -> Fault Tolerance). Audit trails are also a security/control measure for accountability and forensic purposes (Security). Other quality attributes (performance, usability, scalability, etc.) are not explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: All error messages must be meaningful and accompanied by explanatory text.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that error messages be meaningful and include explanatory text, which directly concerns usability (helpfulness, understandability) rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System must employ a consistent user interface look and feel.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly addresses 'look and feel' of the user interface, which maps directly to the LF (Look & Feel) label. It does not state functional behavior, availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or explicitly require usability improvements, so other labels are set to false.

RequirementText: System must display multiple entities simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability of the system (ability to display multiple entities simultaneously), which is functional. It also implies a layout/display concern relevant to look-and-feel. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, scalability, security, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: Interfaces must be customizable and user-configurable, saving configurations in user profiles.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (customizable, user-configurable interfaces with saving to user profiles) and concerns the look-and-feel of the interface. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System interface must be compatible with specialist software and suitable for users with special needs.
AI_Rationale: Requires compatibility with specialist software implies interoperability/portability across environments (PO). Requirement that interface be suitable for users with special needs refers to accessibility/usability concerns (US). No mention of availability, security, performance, maintainability, etc.

RequirementText: System must provide easy-to-use End User and Administrator functions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly expresses that functions for end users and administrators should be "easy-to-use", which clearly targets usability (ease of use). It does not specify functional behavior details or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Defaults for data entry must be persistent and include user-definable, previous, and context-derived values.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: defaults must be persistent and include user-definable, previous, and context-derived values (functional requirement). Also targets user experience by allowing user-definable and context-sensitive defaults, improving usability. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, maintainability, or operability concerns stated.

RequirementText: Frequently-executed transactions must be completed with minimal interactions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains the user interaction for frequently executed transactions—minimizing user interactions—which is a usability (UX) concern (efficiency and ease of use). It does not specify availability, performance metrics, security, scalability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System interfaces must allow customization, including menu contents, screen layout, function keys, colors, and fonts.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that system interfaces must provide the capability to customize menus, layout, keys, colors, and fonts (a functional capability) and directly concerns the user interface appearance (Look & Feel). It also affects usability/personalization, so Usability is applicable. No mention of availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create accounts to store profiles, contact info, purchase history, and confirm orders.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability to create accounts and store data and confirm orders — a clear functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall ensure security of customer accounts and resist tampering.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies protection of customer accounts and resistance to tampering, which are security concerns (confidentiality/integrity). No explicit functional behavior or other NFRs are mentioned.

RequirementText: Customer accounts will include customer profiles, contact info, purchase history, and order confirmation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what customer accounts must contain (data fields/features) — a functional requirement. Does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Customers can register, log in, and log out of their accounts.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies account management operations (register, log in, log out), which are functional requirements. It also implies authentication/authorization behavior (access control), so a security label is appropriate. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Customer profiles shall include payment and address information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies what data the system must store (payment and address info in customer profiles), which is a functional data requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Products will be organized into multi-tiered categories in inventory management.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability/feature (organizing products into multi-tiered categories in inventory management), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state any quality attributes (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: Administrators can update categories, products, and product details.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (administrators updating categories/products) which is functional, and implicitly describes a role-based permission (authorization) concern, so security applies. No availability, performance, usability, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: Customers shall add products to the shopping cart.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing what the system should do (allow customers to add products to the shopping cart). No non-functional qualities are specified.

RequirementText: Shopping cart will display item count and total cost.
AI_Rationale: Specifies specific behavior: shopping cart must display item count and total cost — this is a functional requirement about system behavior (what it should do). No non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: Customers can add or remove products from the shopping cart before checkout.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (customers can add/remove products from cart). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Customers can review and confirm orders before checkout.
AI_Rationale: This describes a system capability (allow customers to review and confirm orders prior to checkout), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, security, performance, usability metrics or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Customers can revise and update orders if incorrect.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability for customers to revise and update orders), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customers shall receive a confirmation email with order details.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying that the system must send confirmation emails containing order details to customers. No quality attributes (availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Interface will be presented in a web browser.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the interface is delivered/operated (presented in a web browser), which concerns operability/access method rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Interface must be consistent and intuitive across different web browsers.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies UI consistency and intuitiveness (Look & Feel, Usability) and demands behavior across different web browsers (cross-browser compatibility → Portability). No mention of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: Customers shall browse categories and products easily.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability (browse categories and products) — functional. The term 'easily' expresses a usability/UX quality requirement. It does not mention availability, performance metrics, security, look-and-feel specifics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Interface will be compatible with major web browsers.
AI_Rationale: Stating compatibility with major web browsers is about supporting multiple client environments — a portability concern — and relates to the system's ability to interface/operate across browsers (operability). It does not specify UI aesthetics, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall feature an API for customers to build custom plug-ins.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: exposing an API so customers can build custom plug-ins. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, portability, or usability.

RequirementText: Plug-ins can interact with the system via the plug-in API.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system capability to allow plug-ins to interact via an API—an integration/operability requirement (how the system is operated/extended), matching example that labeled API interfacing as Operability.

RequirementText: Plug-in API will be well-documented for plug-in developers.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the plug-in API will be well-documented for plug-in developers. This is a documentation/quality-of-code requirement aimed at easing development, maintenance and understanding of the API, which maps to Maintainability. It does not specify availability, security, performance, portability, UI look-and-feel, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: User shall be able to deploy the system within 1 minute upon USB connection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability ('User shall be able to deploy the system') — functional. Also imposes a strict time constraint ('within 1 minute upon USB connection'), which is a performance requirement (response/deployment time). No explicit availability, security, scalability, portability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall handle 1000 concurrent logged-in customers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required capacity to handle 1000 concurrent users, which is a scalability requirement. Does not describe functionality, performance metrics like latency, availability targets, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall retrieve 200 products per second.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior (retrieving products) together with a quantitative throughput constraint (200 products per second), i.e., a performance requirement. No indication of availability, scalability, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall add products to the shopping cart within 2ms.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional action (adding products to cart) with an explicit timing constraint (within 2ms), indicating a performance requirement. No indication of availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall search for specified products within 1 second.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a search function (functional) with an explicit timing constraint of 1 second (performance requirement). No other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall email customers and vendors within 1 second.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior (send emails to customers and vendors) with an explicit timing constraint of within 1 second, indicating a performance requirement.

RequirementText: System shall validate credit cards within 2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional action (validate credit cards) with a quantitative timing constraint ('within 2 seconds'), indicating a performance requirement. No availability, security, scalability, or other NFRs are implied.

RequirementText: System shall acquire shipping charges within 2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional action (acquire shipping charges) with an explicit timing constraint (within 2 seconds), indicating a performance requirement. No indication of availability, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall restore 1000 records per second.
AI_Rationale: This is a quantitative throughput requirement for the restore operation (performance). It also implies a functional behavior (restore), so both Functional and Performance labels apply.

RequirementText: System shall perform periodic backups via live internet connection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (perform periodic backups) → Functional. Backups imply resilience/recovery capability → Fault Tolerance. No explicit statements about availability, operability, security, scalability, etc., so other labels are 0.

RequirementText: System shall validate credit cards against fraud.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a system capability (validating credit cards against fraud), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state security, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall encrypt all sensitive information via HTTPS.
AI_Rationale: Specifies encryption of sensitive information via HTTPS, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). Does not state functional behavior, legal compliance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall encrypt all customer data in the database.
AI_Rationale: Specifies encryption of customer data in the database, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). No mention of availability, performance, portability, functionality, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall auto-detect and block IP DOS attacks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (auto-detect and block) — a functional behavior — and it specifically addresses protection against denial-of-service attacks, which is a security concern. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, scalability, etc.) are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall detect consecutive failed login attempts.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (detecting failed login attempts) which is a functional behavior and is intended to support security (authentication/attack detection). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall be protected by Firestarter open source firewall.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that the system must be protected by a firewall (security control) — clear security requirement. Also prescribes a specific operational/deployment technology (use of Firestarter open-source firewall), which affects operability/administration, so O is set. No indications of availability, performance, portability, usability, legal, maintainability, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: System shall have an availability of 99.99%.
AI_Rationale: Specifies uptime percentage (99.99%), which is an availability/ reliability requirement. No other concerns (security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall perform searches using Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what the system shall do (perform searches using a specific algorithm). No explicit non-functional constraints such as performance, availability, security, scalability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: System shall validate existing credit cards for returning customers after each login.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (validate existing credit cards for returning customers after each login), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall automatically compress large image files.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a system behavior (automatic compression of large image files). It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall employ on-demand asynchronous loading for faster page execution.
AI_Rationale: Specifies using on-demand asynchronous loading (a functional behavior) explicitly to achieve faster page execution, which is a performance requirement.

RequirementText: System shall validate email address existence.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system must verify (validate) that an email address exists. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall be easy to use.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly states an ease-of-use goal, which maps directly to Usability. It contains no functional behavior or other quality attributes (e.g., performance, security, availability, look-and-feel specifics), so only US is set to true.

RequirementText: System shall be easy to learn.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly states 'easy to learn', which is a usability requirement (learnability). No implication of other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall utilize help bubbles for assistance.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a UI feature (help bubbles) intended to assist users — relates to look-and-feel and usability (help/learnability). No availability, security, performance, or other qualities implied.

RequirementText: System shall employ easy-to-locate buttons.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that buttons be easy to locate, which directly concerns usability (US) and the user interface's look-and-feel/layout (LF). It does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall prompt customers with clear error messages.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system behavior (prompt customers with error messages) — functional. It also concerns the clarity/readability of messages, which affects usability, so US is included. It does not specify availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints; look-and-feel (visual design) is not explicitly required.

RequirementText: System shall utilize consistent symbols and colors for notifications.
AI_Rationale: Specifies visual consistency (symbols and colors) for notifications, which is a look-and-feel requirement and also impacts usability/readability; no mention of functionality, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall utilize interchangeable plugins.
AI_Rationale: Requiring interchangeable plugins is an architectural/quality constraint emphasizing modularity and ease of modification/extension, which maps to maintainability. It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, portability, security, usability, performance, scalability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel concerns, nor a discrete functional behavior.

RequirementText: System shall be easily updatable for fixes and patches.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must be easily updatable for fixes and patches, which directly concerns maintainability (ease of making changes) and operability/administration (ability to apply updates/manage patches). It does not specify availability, security, performance, scalability, UI, portability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: System shall create logs of all changes, updates, or fixes.
AI_Rationale: Requiring creation of logs for all changes is primarily a maintainability concern (supporting diagnosis, traceability) and an operability/administration concern (system operation and monitoring). It also implies an audit/logging requirement relevant to security (accountability/integrity of changes), but does not specify availability, performance, portability, scalability, UI, legal, or fault-tolerance.

RequirementText: System shall be easy to upgrade.
AI_Rationale: ‘Easy to upgrade’ primarily concerns the ease of performing upgrades and changes to the system, which maps to maintainability. It also implies operational/admin concerns (upgrading procedures/tools), so operability is marked. No explicit mention of availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, usability, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be extremely portable via USB drive.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the system must be portable via a USB drive, which directly concerns portability across environments. No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: System shall be easy to migrate or backup via another USB drive.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns ease of migrating/backing up the system via USB drive. This implies operability (admin tasks) and portability (supporting migration via removable media). It also impacts maintainability (ease of backup/migration). No explicit performance, security, availability, or UI concerns.

RequirementText: System shall be able to run under debug mode.
AI_Rationale: Requiring the system to run in debug mode is related to operability (provides operational/admin capability) and maintainability (supports debugging/diagnosis). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall be able to run test credit card transactions.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability to run test credit card transactions) which is a functional feature. It also implies an operational/testing capability (support for running test transactions), so Operability is marked. No explicit security, performance, scalability, legal, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: System shall be able to run test shipping orders.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability — the system must be able to run test shipping orders. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall be able to create a test environment of the web order system.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (creating a test environment) — a functional behavior. It also implies an operational/administrative feature (setup/management of environments), so Operability applies. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look & feel, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to transfer assets within the same department without requiring any request.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (transfer assets within same department) and a constraint on workflow (no request required). This is functional behavior; no explicit non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to transfer assets between departments with approval from a DA group member and a faculty group member, unless initiated by a higher-level group.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement describing the ability to transfer assets with specific approval workflow (functional). It also defines an authorization constraint (approvals by specific groups and an exception for higher-level group initiation), which relates to security/access control, so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, UI, maintainability, portability, fault tolerance, operability, or usability aspects are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to transfer assets between faculties with approval from a faculty group or higher-level group, with requests initiated by any authorized user.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional capability (asset transfer with approval workflow and who may initiate requests). It also implies security-related constraints (authorization/approval by faculty or higher-level group), so SE is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI, maintainability, operability, or fault-tolerance requirements are stated.

RequirementText: User shall require approval from the university group for asset transfers outside the university.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a controlled action (asset transfers require approval), which is a functional/workflow constraint the system must enforce (F). It also reflects a governance/compliance policy about transfers outside the university, implying a legal/regulatory or institutional policy constraint (L). It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security mechanisms, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to edit assets belonging to their department if authorized, at administrative, faculty, or university levels.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying that users can edit department assets. It explicitly mentions authorization and different administrative levels, which implies access control (security). No other quality attributes like availability, performance, usability, etc., are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to modify all fields of an asset except IDs, and bulk entry files can be used for modifications.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a user capability (modify asset fields except IDs and support for bulk entry files), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add inventory assets, with DA group members or authorized inventory group members adding assets owned by the department.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability (adding inventory assets) and role-based authorization (DA group or authorized inventory group members) — primary functional requirement with an explicit security/authorization constraint.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add inventory assets related to all departments if a faculty member, or all assets if a university group member, with bulk entry options available.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (adding inventory assets with role-based scope and bulk entry). It describes functional behavior rather than availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create requests to borrow assets or reserve locations, with requests made by any authorized user and pending approval from an administrative level user.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (users can create borrow/reservation requests and admin approval workflow), so Functional applies. It also explicitly restricts request creation to authorized users and involves administrative approval, implying access control/authorization concerns, so Security applies. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall check returned assets and update the inventory if an inventory user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user action to check returned assets and update inventory—describes system functionality/behavior. No explicit availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: IT group members can create new spaces and modify floor structures upon exception request from any administrative level.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability/permission (IT group can create/modify spaces upon exception request) — this is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional aspects (security, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Any administrative level or authorized inventory group member can view and approve pending requests, with users notified by email upon request treatment and updates made to the waiting for execution list.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior: viewing/approving requests, notifying users by email, and updating a waiting-for-execution list — these are functional. It also explicitly restricts actions to administrative or authorized group members, implying authorization/security concerns, so SE is set. No explicit availability, performance, portability, scalability, operability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Authentication shall be done by username and password for all users, with administrative levels accessing administration computers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication method (username/password) and administrative access levels — this is an access control/security requirement rather than availability, performance, or UI; no maintenance/portability/etc. concerns are implied.

RequirementText: Any administrative level user can delegate actions to another user, acquiring the role of inventory administrator.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability/action the system must provide (administrative users can delegate actions and assign the inventory administrator role) — functional. It also concerns user roles/permissions and delegation which has direct security/authorization implications, so Security is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, portability, scalability, legal, usability, maintainability, fault-tolerance, look-and-feel, or operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Output reports include asset reports by location, request reports, and user permission reports.
AI_Rationale: Specifies what reports the system should output (asset by location, request, user permission). This is a functional requirement; no availability, security, performance, or usability constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall ensure that the learning time for the application is between 2 to 4 hours, catering to working students.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a target learning time (2–4 hours) aimed at working students, which relates to usability/learnability rather than functionality or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: Web interface shall use clear and consistent terminology for ease of use by users with basic internet and office experience.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the interface should use clear and consistent terminology to make it easy to use for users with basic internet/office experience. This addresses UI look-and-feel (terminology/labels) and overall usability; it does not specify functional behavior or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The application should be available at all working hours, with maintenance or backup operations conducted outside of working hours.
AI_Rationale: This explicitly specifies required availability during working hours (Availability). It also explicitly states that maintenance/backup operations must be conducted outside working hours, which pertains to maintenance practices (Maintainability). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The application should be installable on Microsoft or Unix platforms and compatible with browsers such as IE, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, or Safari.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies supported platforms and browsers, which concerns operability (deployment/operational environment) and portability (compatibility across platforms/browsers). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: User authentication shall be done via username and password, with permissions assigned according to user roles.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies authentication method (username/password) and role-based permissions, which are security-related controls (authentication and authorization). It does not specify availability, performance, UI look-and-feel, maintainability, or other NFR categories, nor is it purely functional beyond security, so only SE is set.

RequirementText: Only IT team members can access and maintain database servers locally.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an access restriction—only IT team members may access and maintain database servers locally—i.e., an authorization/access-control constraint, which is a security (SE) concern. It does not specify availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: Queries exceeding 1 minute should be terminated.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum allowed query execution time (timeout) — a performance/latency constraint (PE). Also implies handling of long-running queries by terminating them, which is a fault-tolerance/robustness measure to prevent hangs or resource exhaustion (FT). No functional behavior, security, availability, or other quality attributes are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: Backup operations should be executed periodically to ensure data safety.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (perform periodic backups) — a functional requirement — aimed at ensuring data safety/resilience, which maps to fault tolerance. No explicit availability, security, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: The system should be designed to facilitate future evolution and maintenance operations.
AI_Rationale: Statement explicitly concerns designing system to facilitate future evolution and maintenance, which maps directly to maintainability (MN). No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: User shall control heating and cooling units defined in the THEMAS system.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system capability (users shall control heating and cooling units), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall read initialization data to derive definitions of heating and cooling units.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional behavior: reading initialization data and deriving definitions of units. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall use initialization data to determine heating and cooling units in the system.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior (use initialization data to determine heating/cooling units), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall load thermostat definitions from initialization data.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall load thermostat definitions from initialization data. It describes required system behavior; it does not mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall identify each thermostat using unique identifiers.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior: the system must identify each thermostat with unique identifiers. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall load maximum number of concurrently running heating or cooling units from initialization data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: loading the maximum number of concurrently running heating/cooling units from initialization data, which is a functional specification of what the system must do. It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, performance, scalability, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: System shall set trigger values for turning heating or cooling units on or off based on initialization data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (setting trigger values for heating/cooling based on initialization data), which is a functional specification. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall set overtemperature values to prevent temperature deviations beyond 3 degrees Fahrenheit.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must perform (setting overtemperature values to prevent temperature deviations beyond 3°F), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly address availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System shall establish valid temperature range based on initialization data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function: establishing a valid temperature range derived from initialization data. It describes functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.).

RequirementText: Upon initialization, system shall turn off all heating and cooling units and check thermostat settings.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior on initialization (turn off HVAC units and check thermostat settings), which is functional. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall process current temperature values and thermostat settings to determine if heating or cooling units need to be turned on.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes functional behavior: processing inputs (temperature and thermostat settings) to decide whether to activate heating/cooling. It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall validate temperature data from thermostats to ensure it is within specified range.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system behavior (validate thermostat temperature data) so functional. It also enforces data integrity/validation which aligns with security-related requirements to prevent invalid/malicious data, so SE is marked. No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, or other quality concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall recognize and process both current temperature and temperature setting data from thermostats.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must recognize and process two types of thermostat data (current temperature and temperature setting). It does not state non-functional qualities such as availability, performance, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall output invalid temperature status if temperature data is outside valid range.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior (output an 'invalid temperature' status when data is out of range), so it is functional. It also implies user feedback/interaction (informing users of invalid input), which relates to usability. It does not explicitly address availability, security, fault tolerance, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall output valid temperature status if temperature data is within valid range.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior: produce a valid temperature status when input is within valid range — this is a functional requirement about processing/output. No explicit availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: System shall determine when reported temperature exceeds specified limits and generate appropriate alarms.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: detecting when temperature exceeds limits and generating alarms. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, look-and-feel, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: System shall compare reported temperature to temperature setting to detect temperature limit exceedance.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function (comparing reported temperature to a setting to detect exceedance). It describes functional behavior rather than quality attributes such as availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: System shall output temperature trigger exceeded status if temperature limit is exceeded.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (output a status when a temperature limit is exceeded), which is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall output temperature limit exceeded status if temperature limit is exceeded.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior: output a 'temperature limit exceeded' status when the temperature limit is exceeded. It describes functional behavior (what the system should do) and does not mention availability, fault tolerance, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall activate heating or cooling units based on temperature trigger exceedance.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (activate heating/cooling) triggered by temperature threshold — a functional behavior. No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall process temperature data to determine if heating or cooling unit activation is necessary.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: processing temperature data to decide whether to activate heating or cooling units. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall output request to turn on or off heating or cooling unit based on temperature data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: generating control requests (turn on/off) based on temperature data. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, maintainability, scalability, portability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall provide necessary control signals to heating or cooling units upon request.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying system behavior: providing control signals to heating/cooling units upon request. No explicit non-functional qualities (security, performance, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall generate event data for changes in heating or cooling unit status.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system must generate event data when heating or cooling unit status changes. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall generate alarm data for invalid temperature values or temperature limit exceedance.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: generating alarm data when temperature values are invalid or exceed limits. It describes a functional action (detection and alarm generation) and does not explicitly impose availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: System shall output alarm data and record alarm events for system monitoring.

It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall identify and generate appropriate event data for each event occurrence.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (identify and generate event data for each occurrence). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall record event descriptions and timestamps in a database for future reference.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (recording event descriptions and timestamps in a database for future reference). It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.
