RequirementText: System shall provide supervisor interface to change thermostat settings.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying the system shall provide a supervisor interface to change thermostat settings. It does not explicitly state availability, security/authorization, UI look-and-feel, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Supervisor shall select thermostat and desired temperature setting from available options.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (supervisor selects thermostat and temperature from available options). It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall generate reports on operational history and statistical summaries.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying report generation (operational history and statistical summaries). No explicit quality attributes (performance, usability, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Supervisor shall select type of report and specify file location.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an action the system must support (supervisor selecting report type and specifying file location), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state non-functional concerns such as availability, security, usability, or performance.

RequirementText: System shall generate reports based on selected parameters.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability to generate reports based on selected parameters — a clear functional requirement. No quality attributes (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to create a new account by entering basic details like address and phone numbers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: users must be able to create a new account by entering basic details. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall be able to contact the server to create and add a new user, updating necessary details in the database.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (create/add a new user and update the database via contacting the server). No explicit non-functional constraints (security, performance, availability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to autofill details using accounts from Google, LinkedIn, Facebook, or Yahoo.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall provide an autofill capability using external accounts (Google, LinkedIn, Facebook, Yahoo). No explicit non-functional qualities (security, availability, portability, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall direct the user to respective account pages for login and terms acceptance.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (directing users to account pages for login and terms acceptance), i.e., functional navigation flow. It does not state availability, security, usability, or other quality constraints explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to check the validity of their Freecharge and bank accounts.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can check validity of Freecharge and bank accounts). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: System shall verify account authorization and initiate transaction dialog upon acceptance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement describes functional behavior (verify account authorization and initiate a transaction dialog) so F=1. The mention of verifying account authorization explicitly implies security (authentication/authorization) concerns, so SE=1. No other quality attributes are clearly implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to check their bank account balance before making a transaction.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user capability (checking account balance). No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall display an error message and return the cash card if the account has insufficient funds.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior (display error message and return card) in a specific condition (insufficient funds). This is a functional requirement; no explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to validate their cash card for transactions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability (validating cash card) — functional. Card validation for transactions implies authentication/authorization and protection of transaction integrity/confidentiality, so security is also applicable.

RequirementText: System shall check the validity of the entered bank account, displaying error messages if invalid.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior (validate entered bank account) and user-facing error messages (usability). It also implies input validation which relates to security (preventing invalid/possibly malicious input). No indications of performance, availability, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to perform transactions with Freecharge.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users must be able to perform transactions using Freecharge. It does not mention availability, performance, security, scalability, or any other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall log transaction IDs securely and update log files accordingly.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system shall log transaction IDs and update log files (functional). The word 'securely' explicitly indicates security concerns for the logging (confidentiality/integrity), so Security is included. No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, performance, maintainability, usability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access their bank account through Freecharge.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users must be able to access their bank account via Freecharge. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall verify user credentials with the bank databases and accept or reject authorization.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (verify credentials, accept/reject authorization). It also concerns security (authentication/authorization). It explicitly specifies interaction with external bank databases, which implies an operational/interface concern (operability). No indication of performance, availability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to participate in the cashback system by making transactions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (participate in cashback by making transactions), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: System shall provide limited-time cashback offers valid during specific intervals.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system feature/behavior (providing limited-time cashback offers valid during specific intervals), which is functional. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, scalability, legal, UI, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to provide feedback through the feedback option.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (the user can provide feedback via a feedback option). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: System shall save user feedback into the database and display a confirmation message.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior: storing user feedback in the database and showing a confirmation message. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability quality constraints, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to recover their password using the forgot password function.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing feature (password recovery) so it is functional. It also relates to authentication/account management, implying security concerns (handling credentials, verification), so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall send an email to the registered email-id for password reset upon request.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system action (sending a password-reset email on request), which is functional behavior. It does not mention availability, security controls, performance, usability, or other non-functional properties.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access FAQs through the help function.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (access FAQs via the help function), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly address availability, performance, usability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall search for and display related FAQs based on user-entered keywords.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: searching for and displaying related FAQs based on user-entered keywords. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to request refunds for products.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user capability (request refunds). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall store and process refund requests in the database, providing status updates to users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies concrete system behavior: storing and processing refund requests and providing status updates to users. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, performance, availability, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to access the system using a web browser without restrictions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies access via a web browser and lack of restrictions—this is a deployment/operational access constraint (operability). It does not state functional behavior details, performance, security, or portability explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall be available at all times, with downtime limited to server maintenance.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system availability and acceptable downtime (maintenance). This is an availability requirement; it does not explicitly address fault tolerance, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: In case of hardware failure or database corruption, a replacement page will be displayed, and backups will be retrieved and saved by the administrator.
AI_Rationale: Specifies behavior during hardware/database failures (display replacement page, retrieve backups) — this is functional behavior and relates to fault tolerance. Involves administrative retrieval/saving of backups, implying operability. No explicit availability metrics, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to transact securely with confidential customer information.
AI_Rationale: The phrase 'User shall be able to transact' specifies a functional capability (F). The words 'securely' and 'confidential customer information' explicitly indicate security requirements (SE). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, usability, or other quality concerns are stated.

RequirementText: System shall use SSL for all transactions involving confidential data.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates use of SSL for confidentiality of transactions, which is a security constraint (encryption, confidentiality/integrity). It does not specify availability, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall automatically log out customers after a period of inactivity.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (automatic logout after inactivity) — a functional requirement. It also addresses session management to protect accounts and confidentiality, so it implicates security (session timeout) rather than other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall not store user passwords in cookies on the customer’s computer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement explicitly mandates a security-related constraint on handling user credentials (prohibits storing passwords in cookies), so it is a security requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Access to the system's back-end servers shall be restricted to authenticated administrators.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an access-control behavior (restrict access to back-end servers) which is both a functional behavior and a security constraint (authentication/authorization). No indications of availability, performance, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall experience reliable data storage and automatic switchover in case of redundant computer failure.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies reliable data storage and automatic switchover (failover) on redundant computer failure, which directly concerns availability and fault tolerance. It does not specify functional behavior beyond quality attributes nor other NFRs.

RequirementText: System reliability hinges on continuous backup maintenance and updates to reflect recent changes.
AI_Rationale: The statement emphasizes system reliability via continuous backup maintenance and keeping backups updated to reflect recent changes, which directly implies fault tolerance (backup/recovery) and contributes to availability/reliability. The mention of continuous maintenance also implies maintainability. No explicit functional behavior, security, performance, scalability, portability, legal, look-and-feel, operability, or usability concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Commercial databases and application servers shall maintain the system's database, with efficient reinitialization in case of failure.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that databases/app servers shall maintain the system database (functional) and requires efficient reinitialization in case of failure (fault tolerance). The recovery wording also implies availability requirements. No mention of security, performance, portability, scalability, UI, or maintainability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log into the system with username and password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (user authentication via username and password). It does not state availability, performance, security mechanisms, usability, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall authenticate users based on username and password.
AI_Rationale: Specifies authentication behavior (functional) and addresses security concern (user authentication via credentials). No mention of performance, availability, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to check their rosters (administrator and employee).
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (ability to check rosters for administrators and employees), which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall generate weekly rosters for employees (administrator function).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior: generating weekly employee rosters (an administrator function). No quality constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to maintain daily logs (employee function).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (maintain daily logs) — a functional requirement. No qualities like availability, performance, security, or usability are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to select their availability (employee function).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (select availability) which is a functional requirement; no quality attributes or non-functional constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to make a booking (client function).
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (making a booking), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to check their booking status (client function).
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement specifying a user capability (checking booking status). No quality attributes (performance, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall calculate fares (client function).
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall perform fare calculation on the client. It does not specify any quality attributes such as performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view driver history (client function).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (view driver history), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to change their password (client function).
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user capability (change password). No explicit non-functional aspects such as security, availability, or usability are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall send a temporary password to the user's email for password reset (client function).
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional behavior (password reset email with temporary password). It does not mention availability, security controls, performance, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to print reports (annually, weekly, daily).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (administrator can print reports at specified frequencies). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to check feedbacks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (administrator can check feedbacks). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to send newsletters to clients.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (ability to send newsletters). The phrase 'Administrator shall be able' implies role-based access control, so a security (authorization) concern is also indicated.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to manage user accounts.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (administrator capability to manage user accounts). It also implies authorization/role-based access control (security) by specifying an Administrator role, so SE is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, maintainability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to change the super password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (an action the system must provide) — making it functional. It also concerns credentials and administrator permissions to change a 'super password', which is a security control, so Security applies. No explicit availability, performance, usability, maintainability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall keep track of user activity through sessions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system function — tracking user activity via sessions (logging/audit/session management). It does not explicitly state quality attributes like availability, security, performance, or usability, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall record client booking requests.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system must record client booking requests; it does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: System shall check vehicle availability for booking.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing a system behavior (checking vehicle availability for booking). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall maintain a history of bookings.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (maintain a history of bookings). It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall record client feedback.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior (to record client feedback), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall send a notification email to the client upon booking confirmation.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional behavior: sending a notification email upon booking confirmation. It does not mention availability, fault tolerance, security, interoperability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: Database shall accommodate at least 10,000 client records.
AI_Rationale: This is a capacity/size requirement (must accommodate at least 10,000 records), which maps to scalability (ability to handle data growth). It does not specify functional behavior, performance metrics (latency/throughput), availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall support concurrent users.
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for concurrent users, which directly concerns the system's ability to scale with user load. No specific performance metrics, availability, security, or UI concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall utilize cryptographic techniques for user authentication (future version).
AI_Rationale: Specifies using cryptographic techniques for user authentication — this is a security requirement. It also prescribes how authentication should be implemented, so it includes a functional aspect.

RequirementText: System shall keep error tracking logs to aid users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a feature (keeping error tracking logs) — hence Functional. Keeping logs aids maintenance and debugging, so Maintainability. It explicitly states aiding users, which implies usability benefits. No explicit availability, fault-tolerance, security, scalability, portability, operability, legal, performance, or look-and-feel requirements are stated.

RequirementText: System shall restrict communication during user/license validation (use https).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a behavior (restrict communication during user/license validation) — functional — and mandates use of HTTPS, which is a security control (confidentiality/integrity). No explicit availability, performance, usability, portability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: System shall be easy to port to other environments (developed with Apache).
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns ease of porting to other environments and mentions being developed with Apache—this is a portability constraint.

RequirementText: User shall be able to reset all options and user variables to defaults.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (reset options/variables to defaults), which is a functional requirement. No mentions of availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall commit all user variable data to the database upon entry.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional behavior (persist user-variable data to the database upon entry). It also implies data integrity/durability (ensuring committed data matches user input), which maps to security (integrity), but does not explicitly address availability, performance, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall prevent data corruption through backup procedures.
AI_Rationale: Specifies preventing data corruption via backup procedures, which implies the system must provide backup/restore functionality (functional) and addresses resilience/recovery from faults (fault tolerance). Security is not explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall have a logical interface for ease of use and common tasks.
AI_Rationale: 'Logical interface' refers to the user interface's organization/appearance (Look & Feel) and 'ease of use and common tasks' directly addresses usability (learnability and efficiency). No indications of functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall employ error prevention through sanity checks and limited free-text input.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (it shall employ sanity checks and limit free-text input) so it is a functional requirement. The intent is to prevent bad/malicious or erroneous input, which aligns with security (input validation, data integrity), so SE is applicable. It does not explicitly address availability, fault recovery, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall rebuild cached data on every startup.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying system behavior (rebuild cache at startup). It also implies recovery behavior after restarts, so it relates to fault tolerance. No explicit indications of performance, availability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall assign default system data values when necessary.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a functional behavior: the system will assign default data values automatically. It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, performance, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall allow input of numbers, operands, special symbols, and letters.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must provide (accept input of numbers, operands, special symbols, and letters), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view information about various subjects offered.
AI_Rationale: States a user capability to view information about subjects — a functional requirement describing system behavior. No availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: System shall be able to maintain and display subject details including code, name, type, semester, and credits.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system functionality to maintain and display subject details (data fields). No quality attributes like performance, security, or usability are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage student information.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user-facing capability (managing student information), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability metrics, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall allow creation, modification, and deletion of student records, including enrollment number, name, and year of enrollment.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies CRUD operations (creation, modification, deletion) for student records and lists data fields—this is a clear functional requirement with no non-functional quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to list all students enrolled in a specific year.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (listing students by year), i.e., a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: System shall provide functionality to list all students enrolled in a particular year.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (listing students by year). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view student subject choice information.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to view student subject choice information—describes functional behavior (what the system should do). No non-functional qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall maintain and display elective subject choices made by students for different semesters.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functionality: maintaining and displaying students' elective subject choices across semesters. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage marks information.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users managing marks information). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, scalability, or other non-functional aspects, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: System shall maintain and display marks obtained by students in different semesters, including internal and external marks, total marks, and credits.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system behavior: maintaining and displaying student marks (internal/external, totals, credits) which is a functional specification. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to generate mark sheets for students.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (ability for user to generate student mark sheets), which is a functional requirement. No quality/constraint aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall automatically generate mark sheets for students in different semesters.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (automatically generate mark sheets for students across semesters), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to generate various reports.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user capability (generate reports). No non-functional qualities (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall generate reports including student lists for each year, student subject choice lists for each batch year, semester-wise mark lists, and rank-wise lists.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: generating various reports (student lists, subject choices, marks, ranks). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be user-friendly and easy to navigate.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies usability-related qualities: 'user-friendly' maps to Usability (US). 'Easy to navigate' also implies aspects of interface layout/flow (Look & Feel, LF). No functional, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall be highly available and reliable with minimal downtime.
AI_Rationale: Statement explicitly requires high availability and reliability with minimal downtime, which maps to Availability. The reliability/minimal downtime implication also points to Fault Tolerance (resilience/recovery). No other quality attributes (security, performance, scalability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall have procedures for data backup and disaster recovery.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies procedures for data backup and disaster recovery, which directly concerns fault tolerance/resilience. It also implies operational practices/administration (operability). It does not state functional behavior, availability metrics, security, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall ensure data privacy and security.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly concerns data privacy and security, which maps directly to the Security (SE) label. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, legal compliance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be accessible to users with disabilities.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies accessibility for users with disabilities, which is a usability/accessibility concern. It does not explicitly reference legal compliance, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be extensible to accommodate future features and customizations.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies extensibility to accommodate future features and customizations, which maps to maintainability/modifiability. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, portability, scalability, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall perform well under expected load conditions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies performance under expected load, which directly concerns Performance (speed/throughput/latency) and Scalability (ability to handle load). It does not mention functional behavior, availability, fault tolerance, security, portability, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall be compatible with specified platforms.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly states compatibility with specified platforms, which maps to portability. No other quality attributes (availability, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System components shall be reusable in other applications.
AI_Rationale: Requirement states components should be reusable in other applications—this implies portability across contexts and also relates to maintainability/modularity to enable reuse. No indications of other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall be easy to operate and manage.
AI_Rationale: Statement explicitly targets ease of operating and managing the system (operability/manageability). It does not specify user-facing usability metrics, maintenance, performance, security, availability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Student and instructor shall be able to login with ID and password. (Level 0)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (authentication: login with ID and password), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, security controls, performance, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall identify user and grant permission based on user type (instructor/student). (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional behavior (identify user and grant permissions) and relates to security (authentication/authorization based on user type). No mention of availability, performance, usability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall verify user eligibility to access functions based on permission. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system shall verify user eligibility to access functions based on permissions—this is an authorization behavior (security). It is also a functional behavior describing what the system must do.

RequirementText: User shall be able to register with ID, password, PIN, email, and ticket number. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that a user must be able to register with certain fields (ID, password, PIN, email, ticket number). It does not state availability, security constraints, performance, usability, or other non-functional qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall check course prerequisites upon student registration. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (checking course prerequisites during student registration), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall notify user via email. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: Specifies an action the system must perform (notify users via email). This describes functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Instructor shall be able to edit class attributes. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (an instructor can edit class attributes). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects, so only the Functional label is set.

RequirementText: System shall retrieve current class attributes and allow edits. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional capabilities: retrieving current class attributes and allowing edits. No quality/constraint (availability, performance, security, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall store new class attributes. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must store new class attributes. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to generate reports on student course information. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to generate reports (functional requirement). No non-functional qualities (performance, usability, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall retrieve student information, email address, class attributes, and scores. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall retrieve specific student data (student information, email, class attributes, scores). No non-functional qualities (performance, security, availability, etc.) are stated or strongly implied.

RequirementText: System shall generate student class information reports. (Level 1)
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (generation of student class information reports). It does not mention performance, availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to handle and support the total number of students enrolled in CSUN.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies capacity to support the total enrolled student population—this implies performance (throughput/capacity) and scalability (ability to handle load). It does not state functional behavior, availability, security, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: A server shall host the Swiggy App and provide system data processing and storage capability.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a system function: hosting the app and providing data processing and storage (functional). It also specifies deployment/operational environment responsibility (server hosting), which aligns with operability. No explicit availability, security, performance, scalability or other qualities are stated.

RequirementText: An app shall provide a User/Restaurant with all user/restaurant system functionality (according to access control).
AI_Rationale: Specifies system shall provide functionality for Users/Restaurants — a functional requirement. Phrase 'according to access control' implies authorization/security constraint, so include Security. No explicit mention of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customer Shall be able to login or skip from registration to enter the menu dashboard.
AI_Rationale: This describes a functional capability (user can login or skip registration to access the dashboard). It does not specify availability, security, usability metrics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to view nearby restaurants(Specified Distance).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (customer shall be able to view nearby restaurants within a specified distance), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly address performance, usability, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Customers shall be able to choose their favourite restaurant or restaurant they wish to order food.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (customers can choose a restaurant), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes such as performance, usability, security, availability, etc., are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to view menu and categories and subcategories involved.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (view menu, categories, subcategories), which is a functional requirement. It does not state any quality attributes such as performance, usability, security, availability, etc., so no non-functional labels are set.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to order foods and add to cart.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying user capabilities (ordering food and adding to cart). No explicit quality constraints (performance, usability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to remove orders from cart.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-visible capability (remove orders from cart), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to navigate between menu and can add items to cart.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies functional capabilities (navigation and adding items to cart). No quality constraints (performance, usability, UI look, security, etc.) are stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to engage bill mode to finalize payment through their chosen menu by cash.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability: engaging bill mode and finalizing payment by cash via menu — this is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to disengage bill mode to cancel the billing process through their chosen menu by card.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (ability to disengage/cancel billing via menu/card) — a functional requirement. No explicit quality constraints (performance, security, availability, usability) are stated, so other labels not set.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to cancel the order.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (customers can cancel orders). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: When in billing mode, app shall display a representation of a cash payment for the item ordered.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system behavior (displaying a representation of a cash payment in billing mode), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: When in billing mode, app shall display a representation of a bank card payment for each customer.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a visible behavior the system must perform (display a bank card payment representation in billing mode) which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, legal, aesthetic details, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to order items from wallet amount.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: customers can place orders using their wallet balance. It does not state non-functional constraints (availability, security, performance, usability, etc.), so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to cancel an order and if canceled, money will be transferred to wallet to order food for next time (If Card Payment).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-visible capability (cancel order) and resulting behavior (refund to wallet for card payments) — purely functional requirement; no non-functional quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to receive delivery boy details once the order is picked up.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the customer shall receive delivery person details when the order is picked up. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to track the delivery boy details.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that customers can track delivery-person details. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to give ratings for the restaurant and delivery boy.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (customers can give ratings), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to favorite the restaurant.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a user capability (favoriting a restaurant). No quality attributes such as performance, usability, security, etc., are mentioned or implied.

RequirementText: Customer receives notifications for order accepted, once order is picked up, and delivered.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior (sending notifications at specific order states), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Customer shall be able to use offers for restaurants they have chosen.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — customers must be able to use offers for restaurants they selected. It does not state usability metrics, availability, security, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to CRUD items from its menu.
AI_Rationale: Specifies CRUD operations on menu items — a clear functional requirement describing system behavior; no non-functional qualities implied.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to receive orders from customers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (receiving orders from customers), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to view the orders which have been ordered by customers.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability: restaurants must be able to view customer orders. No quality constraints (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to accept or cancel orders depending on the order received and availability of items.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: the system must accept or cancel orders based on order details and item availability. No non-functional quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to assign a delivery boy to deliver an order.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system action (assigning a delivery person to an order), i.e., a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to receive acknowledgment from the Delivery Boy.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior (receiving an acknowledgment from the delivery person), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to view the payment.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (ability for the restaurant to view payment). It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to receive notifications once an order is delivered.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (receiving notifications when orders are delivered). No quality constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: Restaurant shall be able to give offers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability (the restaurant can give offers), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive incoming requests from restaurants.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (delivery boy can receive incoming requests). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to acknowledge the request.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying an actor (delivery boy) shall be able to perform an action (acknowledge the request). It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to acknowledge the request within 3 seconds of time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (delivery boy can acknowledge requests) combined with a strict timing constraint (within 3 seconds), indicating a performance (timeliness/latency) requirement. No implications of availability, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to reach the restaurant and check order details.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies actions the system must allow (delivery boy reaching the restaurant and checking order details) — functional. It also implies user interface/navigation concerns (how the delivery person reaches the restaurant page/section) and ease of performing the task, so Look & Feel and Usability are relevant. No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault tolerance, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive customer details from the restaurant.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the delivery person must be able to receive customer details from the restaurant. It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to pick up and deliver the order to the customer.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a concrete capability/action (delivery person picking up and delivering orders), which is a functional requirement. It does not state quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, or others.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive ratings from customers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (delivery person can receive ratings). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive notifications for restaurant details and customer payment details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (delivery person receiving notifications about restaurant and customer payment details), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, privacy, performance, or other non-functional constraints, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: Delivery boy shall be able to receive payment if the order is done with cash.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the delivery person must be able to receive cash payments. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to manage accounts.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a capability the system must provide (administrators managing accounts), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, security controls, usability, scalability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to CRUD items for restaurants.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (admin CRUD operations on restaurant items). No non-functional qualities like availability, security, performance, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to manage restaurant details.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional capability (administrative management of restaurant details) without any quality, performance, security, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to manage restaurant ratings and reviews.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an administrative capability (manage ratings and reviews), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability metrics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to display top-rated restaurants.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide (Admin can display top-rated restaurants). No non-functional constraints (performance, security, availability, UI look-and-feel, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to display offers for specific restaurants.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (Admin can display offers for specific restaurants). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to facilitate contact between delivery boys and restaurants to replace or cancel orders if items are unavailable.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (admin can facilitate contact between delivery personnel and restaurants to replace/cancel orders) — a functional requirement. No explicit quality/non‑functional constraints (security, availability, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: Admin shall be able to add promo codes and offers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (admin can add promo codes and offers). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Dispute panel shall be able to reassign the order in the case, if the delivery boy dint acknowledge the request.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (reassigning an order when delivery person does not acknowledge), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Dispute panel shall manage, if the customer needs replacement of the order or cancellation of the order in case of order not available.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior of the Dispute panel to manage replacement or cancellation when an order is unavailable. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to use the app in different platforms like different versions of OS/Mobiles.
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for different platforms/OS/mobile versions, which corresponds to portability/compatibility requirements.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to do the authentication process for login and payment through bankcard.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall perform authentication for login and bankcard payment (functional) and implies security concerns (authentication/authorization/confidentiality). No mention of availability, performance, scalability, UX, portability, legal, or fault-tolerance.

RequirementText: The user shall be able to do payment with a secured bank payment mode.
AI_Rationale: Primarily a functional requirement (user can make a payment). The phrase 'secured bank payment mode' explicitly imposes a security constraint, so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, usability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to do encryption and decryption of data for the password which is given by the user for login.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies the system must perform encryption and decryption of user login passwords (a security mechanism) — this is a functional capability described as a security requirement. No other quality attributes (availability, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting no less than 200 concurrent connections from any combination of computers, tablets, and displays.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity to support a given number of concurrent connections, which is a scalability requirement. Does not mention availability, performance metrics beyond capacity, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The server shall be capable of supporting an arbitrary number of active customer payments, that is, no payments shall be lost under any circumstances.
AI_Rationale: Requires supporting an arbitrary number of concurrent payments → scalability (SC). "No payments shall be lost under any circumstances" implies resilience/fault-tolerance and reliability → fault tolerance (FT). No explicit availability/ performance/functional/UI/security/legal/maintainability/portability/usability requirements stated.

RequirementText: The server shall have at least 4 vCPUs, either x86_64 or arm64 architecture.
AI_Rationale: Specifies minimum hardware resources (>=4 vCPUs) which is a performance/resource requirement (PE) and constrains supported CPU architectures (x86_64 or arm64), a platform/compatibility constraint (Portability). No functional, security, availability, or other concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The server shall have a supported version of a common Linux distribution (Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, Ubuntu 22.10, CentOS, Debian, or RHEL).
AI_Rationale: Specifies required supported operating system distributions for the server—this is a platform/compatibility (portability) requirement. It does not mention availability, security, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The user connecting to the server shall have a supported shell (bash, dash, fish, csh, tcsh, ksh, or zsh).
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains the supported user environment (which shells are supported). That is a portability/compatibility constraint rather than a functional behavior or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: The following utilities shall be available on the server: tar, wget (or curl), dd, chmod, test, mkdir, echo, mv, uname, command, and gzip.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required server utilities to be present for administration/operation, which is an operability/administration environment requirement rather than functional behavior or other NFRs.

RequirementText: The $HOME environment variable shall be set correctly on the server.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a server configuration/administrative setting (environment variable) and concerns correct operation and manageability of the system, so it is an operability requirement.

RequirementText: The $HOME/.cache folder shall be writable by the user connecting to the server.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required file-system permissions for users connecting to the server. This is primarily a security requirement (access control/permissions) and also relates to operability/administration (system must be configured to allow writes). It is not a functional behavior or other NFR types.

RequirementText: The IDE and the project shall be located on a local file system (network block storage like EBS is acceptable, network file systems like NFS or SMB are not).
AI_Rationale: Specifies deployment/storage location requirements for the IDE/project (local filesystem allowed, network block storage allowed, network file systems disallowed). This is an operability constraint about how the system must be hosted and also constrains portability/compatibility with storage types, so O and PO apply.

RequirementText: OpenSSH server version 7.9p1 or later shall be installed on the server (other SSH servers fully implementing RFC 4254 may work but are not supported).
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates a specific SSH server (OpenSSH >=7.9p1) to be installed on the server. This is an operational/administrative deployment constraint (Operability). It also has clear security implications by specifying a secure SSH implementation/version, so Security is applicable. It does not describe functionality, availability, scalability, portability, performance, legal, UI, maintainability, or usability.

RequirementText: SSH port forwarding shall be enabled in the server configuration.
AI_Rationale: Specifying that SSH port forwarding must be enabled is a server configuration/administrative requirement (operability). It also directly concerns secure access/tunneling behavior of SSH, so it has security implications and is classified as Security.

RequirementText: The server shall have at least 8 GB RAM.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a hardware resource capacity (minimum RAM), which is a performance/resource requirement rather than a functional, scalability, or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: The server shall have at least 500MB of free disk space even if the IDE is already installed.
AI_Rationale: This is a deployment/operational hardware requirement specifying minimum free disk space on the server, which relates to operability (ensuring the system can be operated/deployed). No functional behavior, performance, security, scalability, portability, etc. are explicitly required.

RequirementText: The server shall have a higher clock frequency than core count (preferred).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a hardware performance characteristic (clock frequency relative to core count), which affects processing speed and performance. It does not describe functionality, availability, security, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The internet connection on the server shall have at least 50 Mbps downstream capacity.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required network bandwidth (50 Mbps downstream) which is a performance/throughput constraint; does not address availability, fault tolerance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The connection between the client and server shall have at least 20 Mbps bandwidth.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a minimum network bandwidth (20 Mbps) between client and server, which is a performance/throughput requirement.

RequirementText: The connection between the client and server shall have no more than 200ms latency.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a quantitative latency limit (200ms) for client-server connection, which is a performance requirement (response/latency). It does not state availability, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The server environment shall be single-tenant (no other applications running on the same server or container).
AI_Rationale: This is a deployment/operational constraint specifying the server environment configuration (single-tenant, no other apps/containers). It concerns how the system is operated/administered (manageability/operability). It does not explicitly state security, performance, portability, or other qualities, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: VS Code shall be downloadable as a file smaller than 200 MB.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a constraint on the distributable file size for download (distribution/operability concern). Similar example ('available for distribution via the Internet') was labeled Operability. No explicit performance, portability, security, or functional behavior is required.

RequirementText: VS Code shall require less than 500 MB of disk space after installation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an installation footprint (disk space) constraint, which relates to system operability/installation requirements. It does not address availability, security, portability, or usability explicitly.

RequirementText: VS Code shall be lightweight and run easily on most modern hardware.
AI_Rationale: Specifies low resource usage ('lightweight') -> performance (resource/efficiency). Requires operation on most modern hardware -> portability across target hardware/platforms.

RequirementText: VS Code shall not support application virtualization solutions (Microsoft App-V, MSIX for Windows, or third-party alternatives).
AI_Rationale: This requirement constrains supported deployment/compatibility options (application virtualization), which relates to portability. It is also an operational constraint about what environments/solutions the product will not support, so operability is applicable. No performance, security, legal, or UI aspects are implied.

RequirementText: VS Code shall require a full operating system when running in a virtual machine environment.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operating environment when running in a VM (platform/operability constraint). Also implies portability/compatibility constraint across environments, so Portability is applicable. No security, performance, or functional behavior specified.

RequirementText: VS Code shall not support multiple simultaneous users on the same machine, including shared virtual desktops or pooled Windows/Linux Virtual Desktop host pools.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavioral constraint (the product shall not support multiple simultaneous users) so it is functional. It also concerns deployment/operation environments (shared virtual desktops, pooled host pools), implying operability and platform/compatibility considerations (portability). No explicit mentions of availability, performance, security, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability.

RequirementText: Running the full VS Code in Windows/Linux containers is not supported. However, using the Dev Containers extension with the VS Code server running in the container and the client on the desktop is supported.
AI_Rationale: This requirement states which deployment/operation modes are supported or not (supported configuration for running VS Code server/client), which is an operability constraint. It also describes supported platforms/environments (container vs desktop), so it impacts portability. No performance, security, legal, or functional behaviour is specified.

RequirementText: VS Code shall require GLIBCXX version 3.4.25 or later.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required runtime/library version (GLIBCXX 3.4.25+), which is a platform/compatibility constraint—portability. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: VS Code shall require GLIBC version 2.28 or later.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system library version (GLIBC 2.28+), which is a portability/compatibility constraint about the execution environment. Does not describe functionality, security, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to access OneDrive using a Microsoft personal account or a work/school account.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability (allow users to access OneDrive with personal or work/school Microsoft accounts). It also implies authentication/authorization constraints (which fall under security), so SE is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, usability, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, or look-and-feel requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to have multiple work/school accounts with OneDrive.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (support for multiple work/school OneDrive accounts per user). It does not state availability, performance, security, scalability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall only allow one personal account per user.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional/business rule (system behavior) specifying account-creation uniqueness. It also has a security/administrative implication (controls account management/access), so SE is marked. No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The OneDrive website shall be accessible using the latest version of Microsoft Edge, Chrome, Firefox, or Safari.
AI_Rationale: Specifies supported client environments/browsers (compatibility requirement). This is about platform/browser compatibility (portability). It does not state availability, performance, security, UI look-and-feel, or maintenance concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall support the following operating systems - Windows 10/11 (32-bit or 64-bit) and Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2016, or Windows Server 2012 (including R2)
AI_Rationale: Specifies which operating systems the system must run on (platform compatibility). This is a portability requirement; it does not address availability, performance, security, or operability details.

RequirementText: The system shall be accessible through a compatible web browser on a computer or mobile device.
AI_Rationale: Specifies how the system must be accessed (via compatible web browsers on computers or mobile devices). This concerns operability (access method) and cross-platform compatibility (portability). It does not specify availability, security, performance, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The system shall offer a mobile app for computers and mobile devices for accessing OneDrive.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (offer a mobile app to access OneDrive). It also implies support for multiple platforms (computers and mobile devices), which relates to portability/compatibility, but no other quality attributes (performance, security, availability, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The OneDrive mobile app shall be compatible with phones and tablets running Android 6.0 or later versions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies supported platforms/OS versions (compatibility), which is portability; also relates to deployment/operation environment, so operability is applicable.

RequirementText: The system shall function on a processor with a minimum clock speed of 1.6 GHz.
AI_Rationale: This is a hardware/environment requirement specifying minimum processor speed, which concerns the operational environment/operability of the system (ensuring it can run on specified hardware). It does not specify functionality, portability across platforms, or performance metrics like latency.

RequirementText: The system shall be compatible with Intel-based Mac computers and Windows 10/11 ARM-based PCs.
AI_Rationale: Specifies compatibility with particular hardware/OS platforms (Intel-based Macs and Windows ARM PCs), which is a portability requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall have a minimum of 1 GB of RAM available.
AI_Rationale: This is a resource/technical constraint specifying minimum memory, which is a performance/resource requirement rather than functional, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system display shall support a minimum resolution of 1024 x 576 pixels.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a display property (minimum screen resolution), which pertains to the look and presentation of the user interface rather than functionality, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: An internet connection is recommended for the system. (Note: This is a recommendation, not a requirement, so it's not converted to "shall".)
AI_Rationale: This sentence concerns network connectivity (recommendation for an internet connection), which relates to availability/connectivity rather than functionality or other NFR categories. It is a recommendation, not a mandatory requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall support file systems with case-insensitive behavior, including NTFS (Windows), HFS+ (Mac), and APFS (Mac).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capability the system must provide ('shall support') — functional. It also explicitly requires compatibility with specific file systems/platforms (Windows/Mac), which is a portability/compatibility concern.

RequirementText: User shall be able to perform validity checks on inputs.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a user capability (perform validity checks on inputs), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall validate inputs and provide error messages for invalid data.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (input validation and error messaging). Input validation relates to data integrity/security (prevents invalid/malicious input), and providing error messages supports usability by helping users correct invalid data.

RequirementText: User shall follow exact sequencing of operations for system tasks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a mandatory sequencing of user operations (a behavioral/functional constraint on how tasks are performed), so it is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall enforce proper sequencing and provide guidance for users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (enforce sequencing, provide guidance) so functional. 'Provide guidance for users' implies usability/UX concerns, so Usability. No explicit security, performance, availability, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to observe system responses to abnormal situations.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user capability ('User shall be able to observe...'), which is a functional need. It also concerns monitoring/operability—allowing users to observe system behavior in abnormal situations—so Operability is applicable. It does not explicitly require fault-tolerance, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or usability constraints.

RequirementText: System shall handle abnormal situations by providing error handling and recovery.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies handling abnormal situations via error handling and recovery, which maps to fault tolerance/resilience. No explicit functional behavior or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall understand the effects of parameters on system operations.
AI_Rationale: This requirement addresses user understanding and learnability of the system (how parameters affect operations), which is a usability concern. It does not specify functionality, performance, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall manage and adjust operations based on given parameters.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the system must manage and adjust operations based on parameters. No availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be aware of relationships between inputs and outputs.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system should make the user aware (a behavior) and concerns user understanding/feedback—primarily a usability requirement. It implies a functional behavior to present relationships, but does not indicate security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall establish relationships between inputs and outputs, including sequences and formulas.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/behavior—establishing relationships between inputs and outputs, including sequences and formulas—so it is functional. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to perform data conversion as needed.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (perform data conversion) which is a functional requirement; no quality attributes (performance, security, availability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall provide data conversion functionality for various formats.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system must provide data conversion functionality for various formats. It does not explicitly state non-functional aspects such as security, performance, portability, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall support a maximum of 1000 terminals simultaneously.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a capacity limit on the number of simultaneous terminals, which is a scalability requirement (system sizing/maximum concurrent users). Does not mention availability, performance metrics, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall handle up to 500 simultaneous users without performance degradation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies capacity for concurrent users (scalability) and explicitly requires no performance degradation, so it's a performance constraint as well.

RequirementText: System shall manage up to 10 terabytes of information in various formats.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system must manage up to 10 TB (capacity/scale) and handle various formats (functional capability to manage different data formats). This implies scalability and a functional capability, but does not explicitly state performance, availability, security, portability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall process up to 10,000 transactions per minute during normal workload conditions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a throughput requirement (transactions per minute) indicating both performance (PE) and capacity/ability to handle load (scalability - SC). No functional behavior, availability, security, or other concerns are stated.

RequirementText: System shall handle up to 20,000 transactions per minute during peak workload conditions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies throughput capacity during peak workload (transactions per minute), which relates to performance (throughput/latency) and scalability (ability to handle load). No mention of availability, security, or other attributes.

RequirementText: System shall process up to 50 tasks per second to maintain operational efficiency.
AI_Rationale: Specifies processing rate (throughput) per second — a performance requirement. Also implies capacity to handle load, so scalability is relevant. No mention of other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall complete data processing tasks within 2 seconds under normal workload conditions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a timing constraint for completing data processing tasks (performance). It also implies a functional action (processing tasks), so both Functional and Performance labels apply.

RequirementText: System shall complete data processing tasks within 5 seconds under peak workload conditions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a timing/response constraint (complete within 5 seconds under peak workload), which is a performance characteristic. It does not explicitly require functional behavior, scalability features, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall maintain response time under 100 milliseconds for normal workload conditions.
