AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a response time limit (under 100 ms) under normal workload, which is a performance (timing/latency) constraint. It does not mention availability, scalability, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall maintain response time under 200 milliseconds for peak workload conditions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a response-time bound under peak workload, which is a classic performance (timing/latency) non-functional requirement. It does not specify availability, scalability, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: All numerical requirements stated above are subject to measurable performance monitoring and evaluation.
AI_Rationale: Statement mandates measurable performance monitoring and evaluation of numerical requirements — this directly concerns performance (measurable performance metrics) and implies operational concerns (monitoring/evaluation capabilities for administrators/operations). No legal, security, scalability, portability, usability, or maintainability aspects are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to use a user-friendly interface with optional interactive help for each service.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-friendly interface and optional interactive help, which are usability concerns; also implies look-and-feel aspects (interface design). No mention of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: System shall provide a menu-driven interface with screens including login, language selection, and options for users and administrators.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a menu-driven interface and particular screens (login, language selection, user/admin options), which pertains to the system's look-and-feel and user interaction. It emphasizes UI structure and usability aspects (navigation and accessibility of functions), so LF and US are set. It does not state availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, operability, maintainability, fault tolerance, or legal concerns explicitly, nor is it solely a functional integration requirement.

RequirementText: User shall have a login screen to enter username, pin, and account number.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional requirement to provide a login screen and input fields (username, PIN, account number). Does not state non-functional qualities (security, availability, usability, look-and-feel, etc.), so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall allow up to three reattempts for unsuccessful login and display supported languages for successful login.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behaviors: limiting login retry attempts and displaying supported languages (F). Limiting retries is a security control to prevent brute-force attacks (SE). Displaying languages impacts user interaction and visibility of language options, implying usability concerns (US). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, fault-tolerance, legal, or look-and-feel requirements.

RequirementText: User shall have administrator options to reboot, shut down, block, or disable services.
AI_Rationale: Specifies administrative capabilities (reboot, shut down, block, disable services) which are functional requirements. Also relates to system operability/administration (management options). No explicit security, performance, availability, or other quality constraints mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall confirm reboot or shut down and allow user to take backups if needed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing behavior: the system must confirm reboot/shutdown and provide the option to take backups. It describes functional behavior (what the system should do). It does not explicitly state availability, fault-tolerance, security, usability standards, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to block system access for a user by entering their card number.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to block a user by card number). It also relates to security (managing access/control of user accounts). No explicit availability, performance, usability, operability, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: System shall allow administrator to block any service by entering the name or selecting from a list.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (administrator can block a service by name or selecting from a list), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, fault tolerance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall see a screen with options and brief descriptions for easy selection.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the visual presentation of a screen with options and brief descriptions (look & feel). Also emphasizes making selection easy, which pertains to usability. Does not specify availability, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: User shall have a screen to check account balance.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (a screen for checking account balance). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, look-and-feel, or other quality attributes explicitly, so only Functional is set.

RequirementText: User shall have a screen to view the location of all ATMs of the same bank.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (a screen to view ATM locations), which is a functional behavior. It does not state quality attributes such as performance, availability, security, usability guidelines, or others.

RequirementText: User shall have a screen for performing various account transactions.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a required system capability (a screen for performing account transactions), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, usability, look-and-feel, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall generate reports for login and logout times, user pin and account number, ATM branch ID, and user account changes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability: generating reports containing login/logout times, PIN, account number, ATM branch ID, and account changes. No explicit non-functional constraints (security, availability, performance, etc.) are stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall provide printed statements for user transactions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: system must provide printed statements for user transactions. No quality attributes (security, performance, availability, usability, etc.) are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: User interface shall include a 10-inch VGA color display with 256 color resolution and touch screen support.
AI_Rationale: Specifies UI hardware and visual/input characteristics (display size, color resolution, touch support), which maps to Look & Feel requirements. No availability, security, performance, legal, or maintainability aspects are implied.

RequirementText: Speakers shall support Yamaha codecs.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability of the speakers—supporting Yamaha codecs—so it is a functional requirement. It also implies compatibility/interoperability with Yamaha codec formats, which maps to portability/compatibility concerns. No explicit availability, performance, security, scalability, or other quality constraints are stated.

RequirementText: Keypad shall have 16 tactile keys and 8 tactile function keys.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete hardware/functional requirement (key counts and tactile type). 'Tactile' refers to the physical 'feel' of the interface, which relates to look & feel, so LF set to true. No explicit availability, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: Keyboard shall be weather resistant.
AI_Rationale: This is a non-functional durability/resilience requirement specifying the keyboard must withstand weather conditions. It concerns robustness/fault tolerance to environmental conditions rather than functionality, performance, security, etc.

RequirementText: Transaction receipt shall be 3.1 by 6 inches, while statement receipt shall be 4.2 by 12 inches.
AI_Rationale: Specifies exact physical dimensions and layout of receipts — a presentation/look-and-feel requirement for printed output. It does not state availability, performance, security, functionality beyond formatting, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Deposit envelopes shall be 9 inches long and 4 inches wide.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a concrete product/property requirement (physical dimensions) — a functional specification of what the system/product shall provide. It does not address availability, performance, security, usability, or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: System shall interact with hardware components including power supply, card reader, receipt printer, statement printer, receipt dispenser, and envelope depository.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies interfacing/interaction with hardware components, which is primarily an operability/integration concern. It does not state functional user-facing behavior beyond interfacing, nor does it mention availability, security, portability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: ATM power supply shall have a 10/220 V AC manual switch.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a hardware feature (manual 10/220V AC switch) — a functional requirement. It also concerns how the system is operated/controlled (operability).

RequirementText: Card reader shall be a magnetic stripe reader with Smart card option and include an extra indentation for card polarization.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required card reader functionality (magstripe plus smart-card option and a physical indentation). The indentation is a usability/affordance requirement to help users orient the card.

RequirementText: Receipt and statement printers shall be 40 column dot matrix.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required printer type and print width (40-column dot-matrix). This constrains output/layout (look & feel) and hardware/platform compatibility (portability).

RequirementText: Receipt and statement dispensers shall have specified maximum dimensions.
AI_Rationale: Specifies physical size constraints for receipt/statement dispensers, which primarily affect installation and operational compatibility (operability) and physical compatibility/portability across environments (portability). No functional behavior, performance, security, or UI aspects are stated.

RequirementText: Envelope depository shall meet specified dimensions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the envelope depository must conform to specified physical dimensions—an operational/installation constraint (fit, deployment/operability). It does not address availability, security, performance, portability, or legal concerns.

RequirementText: Screen resolution shall be at least 800x600 for complete viewing.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies the screen resolution for complete viewing, which is a look-and-feel / user interface layout constraint. It does not explicitly state platform compatibility, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall use transaction management software (BMS version 2.0), card management software (CMS version 3.0), and Yamaha codecs.
AI_Rationale: The sentence specifies what the system shall do (use specific transaction/card management software and codecs) — a functional requirement. It also mandates specific third-party components/versions, implying compatibility/portability constraints. No explicit availability, security, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, performance, look-and-feel, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Database used for record-keeping shall be Oracle version 7.0.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete DBMS (Oracle v7.0) to be used — an operational/implementation constraint (Operability). It also constrains target platform/compatibility (Portability). No explicit maintainability, performance, security, or legal requirements are stated.

RequirementText: System shall employ dial-up POS with central server using TCP/IP communication protocol.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior/interface: use dial-up POS with central server over TCP/IP (functional). It describes interfacing/communication with central server, matching Operability (integration/administration) rather than other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Data transfer protocol shall be File Transfer Protocol (FTP).
AI_Rationale: Specifying the data transfer protocol (FTP) is an operational/deployment constraint about how the system communicates and is typically classified as operability. It does not state functional behavior beyond the operational method, nor does it explicitly mention security, portability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The ATM shall provide customers with 24-hour service for consistent availability.
AI_Rationale: Specifies 24-hour service and consistent availability, which is an availability (uptime/reliability) requirement. Does not specify functional behavior, performance metrics, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Card verification time must not exceed 0.8 seconds under normal server workload and 1 second under peak workload.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear performance requirement specifying maximum response times for card verification under normal and peak workloads. It does not specify functionality, availability targets, security, scalability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: PIN verification time must not exceed 0.3 seconds under normal workload and 0.5 seconds under peak workload.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies explicit time-based response constraints for PIN verification under normal and peak workload, which is a performance (timing/latency) requirement. It does not describe functional behavior beyond timing, nor does it explicitly address availability, security, usability, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Account balance display time must not exceed 2 seconds under normal workload and 3 seconds under peak workload.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies maximum response/display times under normal and peak workloads, which is a performance (PE) constraint. It does not address functionality, availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Account balance transfer time must not exceed 3 seconds under normal workload and 4 seconds under peak workload.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies maximum response/processing times for the account balance transfer operation under normal and peak loads, which is a performance (timing/latency) constraint. It does not specify functionality details beyond timing, nor availability, security, scalability, or usability requirements.

RequirementText: Cash withdrawal transaction time must not exceed 4 seconds under normal workload and 5 seconds under peak workload.
AI_Rationale: Specifies maximum transaction response times under normal and peak workloads — a clear performance requirement (latency). No mention of availability, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Deposit transaction time after envelope insertion must not exceed 5 seconds under normal workload and 6 seconds under peak workload.
AI_Rationale: Specifies explicit maximum response/processing times for a deposit transaction under normal and peak workloads — a performance requirement. No availability, security, usability, or functional behavior beyond timing is specified.

RequirementText: Receipt printing time must not exceed 3 seconds under both normal and peak workloads.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a timing constraint (printing time <= 3 seconds) including behavior under normal and peak workloads, which is a performance requirement (PE). Mention of peak workloads also implies scalability concerns (SC) — the system must maintain performance under increased load. No functional behavior, availability, security, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: Touch screen and button response time must not exceed 5000 milliseconds.
AI_Rationale: This is a quantitative response-time constraint (<=5000 ms) which is a performance requirement. It also directly affects perceived responsiveness of the user interface, so it reasonably implies a usability concern.

RequirementText: Credit card advance time must not exceed 6 seconds under both normal and peak workloads.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a maximum response time (6 seconds) for credit card advance requests under normal and peak workloads, which is a performance requirement. Mentioning behavior under peak workloads implies scalability (ability to maintain response time under load). No uptime, security, or other qualities are specified.

RequirementText: All code must be consistent with respect to style.
AI_Rationale: This requirement concerns coding style consistency, which primarily impacts maintainability (readability, ease of modification). It does not specify functional behavior or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: All functionality must be thoroughly tested through comprehensive test cases.
AI_Rationale: This requirement mandates thorough testing via comprehensive test cases, which is about ensuring maintainability, testability and verification of functionality. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Data communication protocol shall ensure reliability and quality of data and voice transmission, such as CDMA.
AI_Rationale: Specifies reliability and quality of data/voice transmission (e.g., CDMA). This is a non-functional requirement about fault tolerance/reliability and quality-of-service (performance). It does not address legal, security, usability, portability, scalability, or functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: Memory system shall be non-volatile to maintain data reliability.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that memory must be non-volatile to preserve data across failures/power loss, which is a fault-tolerance/durability requirement. It does not describe availability, security, functional behavior, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall have a backup power supply for power failures.
AI_Rationale: Specifies hardware to maintain operation during power failures—addresses fault tolerance (resilience/recovery) and improves availability/uptime. No UI, legal, performance, portability, etc. implied.

RequirementText: Abnormal operations shall cause system shutdown.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior in response to abnormal operations (explicit functional behavior) and describes a fault-handling strategy (shutdown) indicating fault tolerance requirements.

RequirementText: ATM shall be manually restarted by maintenance personnel after an abnormal shutdown.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that maintenance personnel must manually restart the ATM after an abnormal shutdown, which describes an operational procedure (operability) and a maintenance activity/policy. It does not specify availability metrics, fault-tolerance mechanisms, security, or functional behavior beyond the maintenance action.

RequirementText: No inconsistency shall be introduced in the account during transactions affected by abnormal shutdowns.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies preservation of account consistency in presence of abnormal shutdowns (resilience to faults/recovery), which maps to fault tolerance. It does not mention uptime, performance, security, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: System shall be compatible with AIMS security standards.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates compatibility with AIMS security standards, which explicitly concerns security controls (SE). Because it requires compliance with an external standard, it also implies a legal/regulatory or standards-compliance aspect (L). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall use two levels of security: ATM card and PIN verification authenticated by CMS software.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies authentication mechanism (ATM card + PIN verified by CMS). This describes a security constraint (authentication) and also defines a required system function (perform two-level authentication), so labeled SE and F.

RequirementText: Encryption standard during PIN transmission shall be triple DES.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the encryption algorithm to be used for PIN transmission, which is a security requirement (confidentiality/integrity). No other quality attributes (availability, performance, UI, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Passwords shall be 6-14 characters long and not contain the user's name.
AI_Rationale: Specifies password composition and restrictions (length and prohibition of containing user's name), which are security/authentication requirements governing confidentiality and account protection.

RequirementText: Passwords can include digits, hyphens, and underscores.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies allowed characters for passwords, which is a security/authentication policy (password composition). It does not describe functionality, performance, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be allowed up to three login attempts before the card is blocked.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a security control (account/card lockout after three failed login attempts), which is primarily a security requirement. It also describes a system behavior (enforcing login attempts and blocking), so it is functional as well.

RequirementText: Security camera shall be installed near the ATM.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates installing a security camera near the ATM, which is a security control (SE). It also specifies an installation/deployment action/location, which relates to operability/operation (O). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Cash vault shall be secured with a combination lock.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a security control for protecting a cash vault (physical access control). This is a security requirement rather than availability, performance, or usability.

RequirementText: ATM cabinet cover shall be made of fiberglass for security purposes.
AI_Rationale: Specifies material of ATM cabinet cover explicitly for security purposes, which is a security-related (physical security) requirement rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System components such as modem, memory, disk, and drives shall be easily serviceable without vault access.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that hardware components be easily serviceable without vault access, which directly relates to maintainability (serviceability) and operability (ease of administration/servicing). It does not specify performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: System shall have self-monitoring to detect faults periodically.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies built-in monitoring to detect faults periodically, which directly supports operability (monitoring/administration) and fault tolerance (fault detection). It does not mention availability, recovery, security, usability, or other qualities explicitly.

RequirementText: System shall automatically inform the main branch of detected errors, including fault type and problem.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior — automatic informing/notification of the main branch about detected errors (including fault type and problem), which is a functional capability. It also concerns system operation/administration (error reporting to main branch) and thus maps to Operability. It does not specify recovery, uptime, performance, security, UI, portability, scalability, or legal aspects, so other labels are not set.

RequirementText: Administrator shall have authority to set rules, regulations, and policies.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a capability: administrators must be able to set rules/policies (functional). It also implies an authorization/permission constraint (only administrators have that authority), so it relates to security (access control). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Bank staff shall make entries regarding user bank account details.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional action (bank staff shall make entries about user bank account details). It does not mention availability, security, legal, performance, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: Staff shall keep user bank accounts updated and consistent.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying that staff must keep user bank accounts updated and consistent (a required system operation/behavior). It also implies an operational/administrative responsibility (operability). It does not explicitly state availability, fault tolerance, security, maintainability, performance, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or usability concerns.

RequirementText: Staff shall block accounts with illegal transactions or lost/stolen ATM cards upon proper verification.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system behavior (staff shall block accounts) — functional. The purpose is to prevent misuse of accounts/cards, a security control (blocking upon verification), so Security is also applicable. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: Staff shall unblock ATM cards blocked after three failed login attempts.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system function: staff must unblock ATM cards blocked after three failed logins (functional). Describes an administrative/unblocking operation (operability). Relates to account lockout policy and control over access, implying a security requirement.

RequirementText: Staff shall monitor all city ATMs for faults and correct any issues immediately.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required system activity (monitoring and correcting ATM faults) — functional. It explicitly describes operational/admin tasks (monitoring, correcting) — operability. It also relates to maintenance activities (correcting issues immediately) — maintainability. Does not mention availability metrics, fault-tolerance mechanisms, security, scalability, performance, portability, look-and-feel, or legal aspects.

RequirementText: Staff shall maintain account backups for reliability and rollback changes during abnormal shutdowns.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies maintaining account backups to ensure reliability and enable rollback after abnormal shutdowns. This directly concerns fault tolerance (recovery/resilience) and availability/reliability. It also implies an operational/admin task (staff maintaining backups), so operability is marked. No explicit functional behavior, security, legal, performance, scalability, portability, look-and-feel, maintainability, or usability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: User must file a First Information Report (FIR) and present a copy for card blocking in case of lost ATM card.
AI_Rationale: The requirement mandates filing a legal police report (FIR) and presenting it to block an ATM card, which is a legal/compliance-related obligation (L). It also specifies a security control/process to prevent misuse and authorize card blocking, so it pertains to security (SE). It does not describe functional system behavior, performance, availability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall generate logs of user bank account details, account updates with date, time, and changes, and fixed asset schedules.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall generate specific logs/reports (user bank account details, account updates with date/time, fixed asset schedules). It does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to enter URL to access the homepage.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (enter URL to access homepage), which is a functional requirement. No quality attributes such as availability, security, performance, or UI appearance are implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to receive an error message if the server is busy or under maintenance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user-visible behavior (display an error message) — functional. It also concerns user experience (informing users when server is busy/under maintenance), so it maps to usability. It does not mandate uptime, fault recovery, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: User shall be able to sign up by entering their name, email, contact number, and password, receiving a confirmation code on their contact number.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing a user sign-up feature (fields to enter and receiving confirmation code). No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, security, usability metrics, availability, etc.) are stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log in with their email and password and receive a message indicating successful sign-in.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the ability to log in (functional behavior) and explicitly requires feedback of a successful sign-in message (usability/feedback). It does not state availability, performance, security constraints, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for categories by video name or type.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (search functionality: search categories by video name or type), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to click on subcategories and videos to view all videos related to a specific category.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user action and system behavior (clicking subcategories/videos to view related videos), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability goals, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to download videos by clicking the download button and view them afterward.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (download and view videos) describing system behavior; no non-functional constraints (availability, performance, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to add videos to their list by clicking "Add to Mylist" and view them on the Mylist page.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies user actions and system behavior (adding videos via 'Add to Mylist' and viewing them), which is a functional feature. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to subscribe by entering bank name, card number, and one-time password, and receive confirmation of successful subscription.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a specific user-facing capability (subscribe by entering payment details and OTP and receive confirmation), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view video details such as video length and size by entering the video name.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing a user to view video details by entering the video name. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to search for job opportunities in Netflix.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the user can perform a search for job opportunities. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to submit feedback by entering their name, address, contact number, and feedback, and receive confirmation of successful submission.
AI_Rationale: Requirement describes a user capability (submit feedback and receive confirmation) which is functional. The explicit confirmation element implies a usability concern (user feedback/confirmation), so US is set. No explicit non-functional constraints on performance, security, availability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to choose video quality by entering the desired quality level, such as 320p, 480p, 720p, or 1080p, and view the video in that quality.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user action and system behavior (selecting and viewing video quality), which is a functional requirement. No explicit quality, performance, security, or UI aesthetic constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to save videos offline in the mobile app by clicking "Save Offline" and receive confirmation that the video was saved.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (save videos offline and provide confirmation). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to mark videos as favorite and view them on the favorites page.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users can mark videos as favorites and view them on a favorites page. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view the latest movies and television shows by clicking "Latest."
AI_Rationale: Describes a user capability (view latest movies/TV by clicking 'Latest'), which is a functional requirement. No quality, performance, security, or UI aesthetic constraints are specified.

RequirementText: User shall be able to view trailers of upcoming shows and movies by clicking "Upcoming."
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (view trailers by clicking 'Upcoming'), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI aesthetics, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to select a channel and view content from that channel.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability (select a channel and view its content), which is functional. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to provide ratings for videos by clicking on ratings and receive confirmation that the rating was submitted.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user action (provide ratings) and system response (confirmation) — functional. The confirmation/feedback aspect relates to usability.

RequirementText: User shall be able to receive help with queries by clicking "Help" and receive assistance.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a functional capability (users can click 'Help' to receive assistance), so Functional = true. It also implies usability (easy access to help via a Help control), so Usability = true. No explicit constraints about availability, security, performance, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to reset their password if they forgot it by following the password reset process.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (ability to reset forgotten password). It also implicates security concerns (password management/reset procedure), so Security is marked. No explicit mentions of availability, performance, usability, legal, etc.

RequirementText: User shall be able to connect their account to Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can connect their account to social platforms). It does not explicitly mention availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to add or upload videos and receive confirmation of successful upload.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (administrator can add/upload videos) and requires user feedback (confirmation of successful upload), which is a usability/feedback concern. No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or look-and-feel are stated.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to remove videos by entering the video name and receive confirmation of successful removal.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a capability (administrator can remove videos and receive confirmation) which is functional. The explicit request for confirmation implies user feedback, i.e. usability. No availability, performance, security (no exclusive access or constraints), or other quality concerns are stated.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to manage queries regarding videos and respond to user queries.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (administrators managing and responding to video-related queries), which is a functional behavior. It does not state constraints about availability, security (no access restriction or authorization requirement is explicitly imposed), performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects, so those labels are not set.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to save contact details such as number, address, and pin code and display a "Contact Us" button.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functionality: administrator can save contact details and display a Contact Us button. No quality attributes (security, performance, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to handle complaints regarding content by providing solutions or forwarding the issue to the related department and communicating the solution to the user.
AI_Rationale: This describes a capability the system/administrator must provide (handling complaints, forwarding, communicating)—a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, security, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to cancel subscriptions and receive confirmation of successful cancellation.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (administrator can cancel subscriptions and receive confirmation), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security restrictions (e.g., 'only'), usability standards, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Administrator shall be able to arrange videos in their respective categories in the database.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (administrator arranging videos into categories), which is functional. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The subscription will end if the user does not respond to the subscription package within the allotted time frame.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a conditional system behavior (ending a subscription if the user fails to respond within a time frame), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall display "video not found" if the requested video is not available.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (displaying a specific message when a video is not available), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: New videos shall be uploaded daily.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that new videos must be uploaded on a daily schedule. It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Subscription packages shall have a duration of one month.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a concrete system behavior/constraint about subscription package duration (one month), which is a functional requirement. No availability, performance, security, usability, legal, or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Netflix shall be available 24 hours a day.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly states the system must be available 24 hours a day, which is an availability (uptime) requirement. It does not describe functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User accessibility shall be censured in all ways.
AI_Rationale: Wording is ambiguous, but the phrase ‘User accessibility shall be censured in all ways’ appears to require restricting or controlling user access (access control), which maps to security (SE). It also specifies a system behavior (censoring access), so it is treated as a functional requirement (F). No explicit mention of availability, performance, legal, usability, etc., so other labels set to false.

RequirementText: Users are advised to change their passwords regularly and not share their user ID and password with anyone.
AI_Rationale: This requirement is a security-related guideline about password management and not sharing credentials, which pertains to authentication and confidentiality practices. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Users shall be limited to three attempts to enter their password.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an authentication control (limit password entry attempts), which is a security-related constraint (account lockout/attack mitigation). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The website shall focus on software quality attributes such as security and performance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly calls out security and performance as focused software quality attributes, so map to Security (SE) and Performance (PE). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Only maintainers are allowed to add new videos to the website.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an access-control constraint (only maintainers may add videos), which is an authorization/security concern. It does not describe availability, performance, UI, or other non-functional aspects, nor does it explicitly require the add-video functionality beyond the access restriction.

RequirementText: The website must be capable of storing all data formats and should frequently connect to the database or be database sensitive.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (storing all data formats) so F=1. It implies the system must be compatible/interoperable with multiple data formats/databases (mapped to portability/compatibility) so PO=1. The statement about frequent connections to the database or being 'database sensitive' concerns how the system is operated and its dependency on the database (manageability/operability), so O=1. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, scalability, maintainability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault-tolerance concerns, so those labels are 0.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to view the profiles of doctors within the PRACTO network and fetch their complete profiles in a single request, returning multiple results for convenient search.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (view/fetch doctor profiles, return multiple results). The phrasing about 'convenient search' implies usability concerns. No explicit availability, performance, security, or other NFR metrics are stated.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to search for PRACTO services in a particular city or their current location, as well as find doctors by name, specialization, and locality, as well as search for nearby clinics, gyms, spas, salons, and healthcare centers.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies functional capabilities for searching services and providers by location, name, specialization and categories. It does not state any quality attributes such as performance, security, availability, or UI/look-and-feel.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to consult with doctors remotely by asking queries online, which can be answered by doctors or assured anonymous users, with the ability to choose the best solution from multiple answers.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability/feature (remote consultation, asking queries, answers from doctors or anonymous users, choosing best solution), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state constraints about availability, security, usability, performance, scalability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to register with PRACTO using valid information and log in using their credentials to access PRACTO services.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies user registration and login (functional). Login with credentials implies authentication/security concerns (SE). No other quality attributes are explicitly mentioned.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to find and book appointments with doctors for checkups or treatments.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: users must be able to find and book doctor appointments. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Doctors shall be able to log in to check patient information, answer patient queries, perform daily activities, set reminders, and communicate with their staff.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies actions doctors must be able to perform (login, check information, answer queries, set reminders, communicate) which are functional requirements. It does not specify quality attributes like security, performance, usability, availability, or others, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Users shall be able to contact doctors through email, phone calls, or SMS, providing accurate information for their queries.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that users can contact doctors via email, phone, or SMS. It does not specify non-functional qualities (availability, security, usability, etc.).

RequirementText: Performance requirements The capability of the computer depends on the performance of the software. The software can take any number of inputs provided the database size is larger enough. This would depend on the available memory space.
AI_Rationale: Text discusses software performance and ability to handle any number of inputs depending on database size and memory—this is a performance requirement and implies scalability constraints. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create accounts and log in to the server.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies functional behavior (account creation and login). It does not mention availability, security measures, performance, usability, or other non-functional qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create new scores.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow users to create new scores). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to delete scores they own.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement specifying delete capability. The phrase 'they own' implies an authorization constraint (access control), so a security label is also applicable. No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to rename scores they own.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying an action (rename scores). The phrase 'they own' implies an authorization/access-control constraint, which is a security aspect, so SE is marked. No other non-functional qualities are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to grant other users permission to modify scores they own.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (users can grant other users permission to modify scores), so it is Functional. It also describes access control/permissions, which is a Security concern (authorization), so Security is set. No other quality attributes are explicitly implied.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to add musical notes and rests to a score using the mouse.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow users to add musical notes and rests via the mouse), which is a functional behavior. It does not state non-functional concerns such as performance, availability, security, usability guidelines, or legal/maintenance constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to add sharps and flats to music using the mouse.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a concrete system capability—allowing users to add sharps and flats via mouse—so it is a functional requirement. It does not state non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, usability metrics, or security.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to add multiple lines of music to a score.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (adding multiple lines of music to a score), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall support the use of key signatures in scores.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: the system must support using key signatures in musical scores. It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to edit scores using the keyboard.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability — allowing users to edit scores via the keyboard. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow multiple users to edit a score simultaneously and gracefully handle any conflicts.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a functional capability (multiple users editing) and implies handling concurrent-edit conflicts (fault tolerance/consistency). It also implies supporting simultaneous users which relates to scalability.

RequirementText: The system shall automatically delineate measures within a score.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a system behavior ('shall automatically delineate measures within a score'), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (availability, performance, security, etc.) are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to chat with other users who are collaborating on a score.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (chat between collaborating users). This is a functional requirement describing what the system should provide; it does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to change the tempo of the music within a score.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to change music tempo), which is a functional behavior rather than a non-functional quality.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to select different clefs for a score.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability — enabling users to select different clefs — which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, performance, usability, security, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: The system shall support the addition of chords to a score.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functionality (ability to add chords to a score). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall include "legality" checks to ensure user-placed notes adhere to musical rules.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability — performing 'legality' checks to ensure notes adhere to musical rules — which is a functional behavior (validation/enforcement). It does not describe availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall include "grammar" checks to ensure proper placement of slurs and ties.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a functional capability the system must provide (grammar checks for placement of musical slurs and ties). It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to convert a score to a playable format.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (allow users to convert a score to a playable format), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall highlight the currently playing notes during playback.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior during playback (functional). It also describes a visual presentation (highlighting), which pertains to look-and-feel/UI appearance. No mention of availability, performance, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall provide temporary color-coded highlighting to show edits and changes made by other users.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (provide highlighting) -> Functional. It explicitly describes a UI presentation mechanism (temporary color-coded highlighting) -> Look & Feel. It also implies improved user interaction/visibility of edits -> Usability.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to import MIDI files.
AI_Rationale: This is a clear functional requirement describing a capability (importing MIDI files). It does not specify availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to export scores to a visual format.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying that the system shall provide the capability for users to export scores to a visual format. It does not explicitly specify UI aesthetics, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to print musical scores.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (allow users to print musical scores). It does not state any non-functional constraints such as availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to create scores with multiple sheets for different instruments.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: users can create scores with multiple sheets for different instruments. No quality/constraint (availability, performance, security, etc.) is implied.

RequirementText: The system shall allow users to compare two versions of a score side-by-side, differentiated by measure.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (allows users to compare two versions). It also specifies a UI layout/visual presentation ('side-by-side, differentiated by measure'), which implies a look-and-feel/display requirement, so LF is marked. No explicit non-functional aspects like performance, security, scalability, etc., are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system should be secure to protect user data and prevent unauthorized access.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly concerns protecting user data and preventing unauthorized access, which is a security requirement (authentication, authorization, confidentiality/integrity). No mention of availability, performance, legal compliance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system should be responsive and handle edits and playback smoothly.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies responsiveness and smooth handling of edits/playback which are performance and usability concerns rather than functional, security, or other aspects.

RequirementText: The system should be able to handle a growing number of users and scores.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the system must handle a growing number of users and scores, which is a scalability concern. It does not explicitly mention performance metrics, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system should be easy to learn and use for users with varying levels of musical experience.
AI_Rationale: Specifies ease of learning and use for users with varying musical experience — a usability requirement.

RequirementText: The system shall be compatible with a supported operating system (Windows or macOS) and meet the minimum hardware specifications for Adobe Illustrator to function properly.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operating systems and hardware compatibility for running Adobe Illustrator, which concerns system operability/administration and platform compatibility (portability). No functional, security, performance, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall meet the minimum requirements to allow for successful activation of Adobe Illustrator and access to all features.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system must meet minimum (hardware/software) prerequisites to enable activation and feature access of a third-party application, which aligns with operability/deployment environment constraints (similar to provided examples labeled O). It does not state legal/licensing obligations or performance/security/functional behavior explicitly.

RequirementText: The system shall have sufficient hardware resources to support all functionalities of Adobe Illustrator without limitations due to insufficient hardware.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies sufficient hardware resources to fully support Adobe Illustrator functionality, which concerns operability/manageability of the deployment environment (O), compatibility with required hardware/platform (portability, PO), and implies performance capacity to avoid limitations due to insufficient hardware (PE). It does not mention availability, security, scalability, or UI/maintenance explicitly.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall support both Intel and AMD processors.
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for specific processor architectures (Intel and AMD), which is a portability/compatibility requirement across hardware platforms. No timing, availability, security, or UI concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall be compatible with a minimum processor of Intel Pentium 4 or AMD Athlon 64.
AI_Rationale: Specifies minimum hardware compatibility (processor requirement), which is an operational/installation constraint rather than a functional behavior or other quality attribute.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall require a 64-bit version of the operating system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required operating environment (OS must be 64-bit). This is an operability constraint and also a portability/platform compatibility requirement.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall function with a minimum of 8 GB of RAM.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a minimum hardware/platform requirement (minimum RAM) needed for the product to run, which is a portability/platform compatibility constraint rather than a functional behavior or performance metric.

RequirementText: The system shall have at least 2 GB of available hard-disk space to install Adobe Illustrator.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a minimum hardware/install requirement (available disk space) for the system to operate/install Adobe Illustrator; it pertains to operability/operational environment rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The graphics card shall support OpenGL version 4.x.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a required functional capability/compatibility of the graphics card (support for a specific OpenGL version). This is primarily a functional requirement and implies portability/compatibility with that API version.

RequirementText: The computer shall have a processor that supports 64-bit architecture (multicore Intel or AMD Athlon 64).
AI_Rationale: Specifies required hardware platform/architecture (64-bit multicore Intel/AMD), a portability/compatibility constraint. Does not state functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The software shall support touch interaction with the interface using fingers or a stylus for actions like drawing, manipulating objects, and adjusting tools.
AI_Rationale: Specifies interaction capability (functional) and concerns the user interface interaction modality affecting usability and look-and-feel.

RequirementText: The software shall utilize pressure applied on the touch-screen to vary line weight during drawing.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-visible capability/behavior (use pressure on touchscreen to vary line weight) so it is functional. It also pertains to interaction and user experience (how drawing behaves), so usability is applicable. No explicit availability, performance, security, portability, maintainability, operability, scalability, legal, or look-and-feel constraints are stated.

RequirementText: The software shall allow users to adjust the size and angle of brushes on the touch-screen.
AI_Rationale: This states a specific system capability (allow users to adjust brush size and angle on a touch-screen), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify non-functional qualities such as performance, availability, security, usability standards, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The software shall recognize gestures like pinch-to-zoom for manipulating objects on the canvas.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (gesture recognition for manipulating canvas objects). This also impacts usability (touch interaction / user experience), but does not imply other qualities like performance, portability, or security.

RequirementText: The graphics card shall support OpenGL version 4.0 or higher (minimum requirement).
AI_Rationale: This is a hardware/software compatibility requirement specifying the graphics card must support OpenGL 4.0+. This implies portability/compatibility across graphics platforms (PO) and is also an operational hardware requirement (O) for the system environment. No performance, security, or other qualities are mentioned.

RequirementText: The graphics card shall support features utilizing GPU Performance (optional).
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a capability the graphics card should support (features utilizing GPU performance), which is a functional requirement. It mentions performance conceptually but does not set measurable performance, availability, security, scalability, or other quality constraints, so other NFR labels are not strongly implied.

RequirementText: The software activation process shall allow users to access and use their licensed copy of Adobe Illustrator CC with all its features and functionalities.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (activation process enabling access to licensed software and its features). It does not explicitly state availability, security, legal compliance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Adobe Creative Cloud shall provide access to Adobe Illustrator CC during the activation process.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a functional behavior: the system shall provide access to Adobe Illustrator CC during the activation process. It does not state availability metrics, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall respond to user input from drawing tools with high speed and responsiveness.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly specifies 'high speed and responsiveness' to user input, which concerns latency/performance characteristics. It does not state availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Performance is set.

RequirementText: The system shall handle complex projects and large files without lag or slowdown.
AI_Rationale: Specifies performance goal (no lag/slowdown) and ability to handle large/complex workload, implying scalability. No legal, security, usability, or functional details.

RequirementText: The system shall render complex graphics and enable smooth on-screen navigation.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies functional capabilities (render graphics, provide on-screen navigation). "Smooth on-screen navigation" implies performance/responsiveness (PE) and better usability (US). Rendering complex graphics also relates to visual presentation/look-and-feel (LF). No indication of availability, security, scalability, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The application shall perform smoothly with minimal lag or crashes during regular usage.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies smooth performance with minimal lag (performance/latency) and minimal crashes (system availability/reliability). It does not explicitly mention fault-tolerance mechanisms, usability, scalability, or other categories.

RequirementText: The application shall render images and effects efficiently to maintain a productive workflow.
AI_Rationale: Specifies efficient rendering (performance: speed/resource use) to support productive workflow (usability/productivity). No availability, security, scalability, or other concerns mentioned.

RequirementText: The application shall operate without unexpected crashes or errors during use.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the application must not crash or produce unexpected errors during use, which directly relates to system reliability/availability and fault tolerance (resilience to failures). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, or other qualities.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall achieve smooth operation and optimal performance.
AI_Rationale: The phrase 'optimal performance' explicitly refers to performance characteristics (speed/efficiency). 'Smooth operation' implies a user-experience quality (usability/responsiveness) rather than availability, fault-tolerance, or other categories.

RequirementText: The minimum processor clock speed shall be 2 GHz.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a minimum hardware requirement (processor clock speed), which relates to the operating environment/operability of the system rather than functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall support Apple Silicon (M1 and M2) processors starting from Datylon for Illustrator R46 onwards.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies support for Apple Silicon (M1/M2) processors starting from a specific release—this is a platform/compatibility (portability) requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, UI, maintainability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Apple Silicon processors shall offer enhanced performance and power efficiency.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies enhanced performance and power efficiency, which are performance-related quality attributes. No functional behavior or other non-functional aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: For optimal performance, Adobe Illustrator shall recommend a minimum of 16 GB of RAM.
AI_Rationale: Specifies recommended minimum RAM for optimal performance, which is a performance/resource requirement. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: Increased RAM shall improve the software's ability to handle complex projects, multiple layers, and large file sizes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement concerns improving capacity via increased RAM to handle complex projects, multiple layers, and large files—this relates to performance (resource-based throughput/processing) and scalability (ability to handle larger workloads). No functional behavior, availability, security, or other concerns are specified.

RequirementText: Adequate RAM shall enable faster rendering, smoother zooming, and an overall improved user experience.
AI_Rationale: Specifies hardware resource (RAM) to achieve faster rendering and smoother interactions — a performance requirement. It also explicitly ties to improved user experience, so usability is applicable. No legal, security, availability, or other quality aspects are mentioned.

RequirementText: More RAM shall allow Illustrator to handle extensive use of drawing tools, complex vector illustrations, and advanced effects without significant lag or slowdown.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns system responsiveness under heavier resource demands (less lag/slowdown) — primarily a performance concern. It also implies scaling to handle larger/complex workloads (more RAM enabling handling of increased load), so scalability applies. No legal, security, availability, or functional behavior specified.

RequirementText: During installation, the system shall have additional free space available beyond the minimum requirement.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an operational/deployment constraint (disk free space during installation), similar to hardware/environment requirements. It concerns operability (installation/manageability) rather than functionality or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall not be installed on a volume with a case-sensitive file system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement restricts supported installation environments (prohibits case-sensitive file systems), which is a portability constraint (supported platforms/filesystems) and relates to installation/operability. It does not specify functional behavior, security, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The graphics card should have at least 1 GB of VRAM and support OpenGL version 4.0 for enabling GPU Performance (optional feature for enhanced performance with graphic-intensive tasks).
AI_Rationale: Specifies hardware/API requirements to enable enhanced GPU performance (a performance-related constraint). Also constrains supported graphics API (OpenGL 4.0), i.e., compatibility/portability requirement for target environments.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a smooth user experience, which can be improved by a compatible graphics card.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly targets a "smooth user experience," which maps to Usability. The mention that a "compatible graphics card" can improve the experience indicates a performance/graphics capability dependency, so Performance is also applicable. It does not state functional behavior, availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal concerns, and does not explicitly describe visual layout details, so other labels are set to false.

RequirementText: The system shall render complex projects faster with a compatible graphics card.
AI_Rationale: Specifies faster rendering (performance requirement). Mentions requirement of a compatible graphics card implying hardware/platform compatibility (portability). No availability, security, or other concerns explicitly stated.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall run smoothly and efficiently on a system that meets the 64-bit requirements.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that the application shall run smoothly and efficiently (performance concern) on a system meeting 64-bit requirements (platform/compatibility concern -> portability). No indications of availability, security, scalability, etc.

RequirementText: The user experience with Adobe Illustrator shall be enhanced by meeting the 64-bit requirements.
AI_Rationale: Specifying '64-bit requirements' indicates compatibility/portability to 64-bit platforms (Portability). Stating 'user experience... shall be enhanced' implies an intended usability improvement (Usability). No explicit mention of performance, availability, security, scalability, or functional behavior.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall handle more complex projects when 64-bit support is implemented.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies that with 64-bit support the product can handle more complex (larger) projects—implying improved performance (memory/processing) and scalability. Mention of 64-bit support also implies portability/architecture support. No indications of security, availability, UI, maintainability, or operability.

RequirementText: Adobe Illustrator shall provide access to advanced features and functionality with 64-bit support.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the product shall provide access to advanced features and functionality (a functional capability) and explicitly requires 64-bit support, which is a platform/architecture compatibility concern (portability). No other quality attributes such as performance, security, availability, or usability are mentioned.

RequirementText: The software interface shall be designed to provide a more intuitive and natural drawing experience for users with a touch-screen enabled tablet/monitor.
AI_Rationale: Requirement focuses on the interface design to provide an intuitive, natural drawing experience (usability). It also implies visual/interaction design aspects of the UI (look & feel). No mention of performance, security, availability, etc.

RequirementText: The software shall allow users to create precise and intricate designs more easily with a touch-screen enabled tablet/monitor.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (allow users to create designs) and targets touch-screen tablets/monitors (platform support -> portability). Emphasizes ease of creating precise designs, which is a usability requirement. No mention of availability, performance, security, scalability, maintainability, operability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: The graphics card may improve overall performance and user experience.
AI_Rationale: Statement suggests improvement to system performance and user experience due to a graphics card. This implies performance (speed/graphics rendering) and usability (user experience) concerns. No explicit functional behavior, availability, security, scalability, portability, etc., are specified.

RequirementText: The graphics card should have at least 1 GB of VRAM for optimal performance (optional).
AI_Rationale: Specifies a hardware resource (≥1 GB VRAM) to achieve optimal performance; this is a performance-related non-functional requirement. No indication of availability, security, portability, etc.

RequirementText: The graphics card should ensure smoother and faster operation for graphic rendering and complex vector calculations (benefit).
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies smoother and faster operation for rendering and complex calculations, which is a performance-related quality. It does not state functional behavior, availability, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The graphics card compatibility with minimum requirements shall allow full utilization of Adobe Illustrator's capabilities (benefit).
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies hardware compatibility/minimum requirements (graphics card) to ensure the system can fully utilize Adobe Illustrator—a constraint about the operational environment and readiness of the system rather than a functional feature, security, performance metric, or portability. It aligns with operability (manageability/deployment compatibility).

RequirementText: Adobe Creative Cloud shall offer seamless updates for Adobe Illustrator CC, ensuring users automatically receive the latest versions with new features and bug fixes.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies an automatic update capability (functional). Providing seamless, automatic distribution of new versions implies concerns about maintainability (mechanism for delivering updates/patches). The term 'seamless' indicates a user experience aspect, so usability is also implicated. No explicit statements about availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, portability, scalability, operability, or legal constraints.

RequirementText: Adobe Creative Cloud shall provide users with access to other Adobe creative applications (e.g., Photoshop, Premiere) to enhance their creative workflow by enabling seamless integration.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: providing users access to other Adobe applications and enabling integration (F). The phrase 'seamless integration' implies an aspect of usability—improving workflow and ease of use (US). No explicit mentions of availability, security, performance, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, fault tolerance, or look-and-feel constraints.

RequirementText: The system shall utilize a high-performance CPU to improve the speed and responsiveness of drawing tools.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies using a high-performance CPU to improve speed and responsiveness, which is a performance-related quality attribute. It does not describe functional behavior or other NFR categories.

RequirementText: The system shall have adequate RAM to handle complex projects and large files without lag or slowdown.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies sufficient RAM to avoid lag/slowdown when handling complex projects and large files, which is a performance (speed/latency/resource) concern. It does not explicitly address availability, scalability, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall support a dedicated graphics card (GPU) for rendering complex graphics and smooth on-screen navigation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies support for a dedicated GPU—this is a functional capability (F). It explicitly targets rendering performance and smooth navigation, so performance (PE) is relevant. The phrase ‘smooth on-screen navigation’ also implies usability (US). Other non-functional categories (security, scalability, portability, etc.) are not implied.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a high-quality display with accurate color reproduction and high resolution.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies visual quality attributes (accurate color reproduction, high resolution) which correspond to Look & Feel. No explicit availability, performance, security, or functional behavior beyond display quality is stated.

RequirementText: The system may support a touch-screen-enabled tablet or monitor for a more intuitive and natural drawing experience.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies the system may support touch-screen tablets/monitors (a functional capability). It explicitly aims to provide a more intuitive and natural drawing experience, which is a usability concern. No explicit mentions of performance, availability, security, portability, scalability, maintainability, operability, legal, or look-and-feel requirements.

RequirementText: User shall be able to efficiently store and retrieve data in MySQL databases.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies the user shall be able to store and retrieve data (functional). The word 'efficiently' indicates a performance/quality constraint, so Performance is applicable. No explicit mentions of availability, security, scalability, portability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: System shall support SQL for querying and manipulating data.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional capability (support SQL for querying/manipulating data). It does not mention availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, or other non-functional attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to manage transactions in MySQL to ensure data integrity.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user capability (manage transactions) so is functional.
