AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior (allow instructor to enter roll later) and explicitly describes handling of a network failure scenario (graceful handling/resilience), which maps to fault tolerance. It does not set availability targets, security, usability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: If a network connection is lost during roll, the program shall allow the instructor to transmit roll information at a later time.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functionality to allow delayed transmission of roll information (functional) and describes behavior when network is lost—supporting offline or deferred transmit, which is fault-tolerance for network loss.

RequirementText: The system shall allow for addition or deletion of instructors, students, and classes while incorporating new semesters.
AI_Rationale: Describes functional capabilities (adding/deleting instructors, students, classes and handling new semesters). No explicit non-functional quality (availability, performance, security, etc.) is specified.

RequirementText: Usability of the system shall be achieved through online help pages and an introductory training session for all instructors upon installation.
AI_Rationale: Specifies measures (online help and training) to achieve usability; this is a usability (UX/training) requirement rather than functional or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall allow for user ID and password input.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (accepting user ID and password input). It does not explicitly state security, usability, availability, or other quality constraints, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: Upon login, the system shall direct users to either the manager or worker portion of the program.
AI_Rationale: This specifies system behavior (routing users after login to manager or worker sections), a functional requirement. It does not explicitly state security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Managers shall be able to add new tasks.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability (managers can add new tasks), which is a functional requirement. No quality/constraint (availability, performance, security, usability, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: Managers shall be able to edit existing tasks.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability (managers can edit existing tasks). It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Managers shall be able to delete tasks from the system.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (managers can delete tasks). No quality constraints (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Managers shall be able to confirm when tasks have been completed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a capability the system must provide (managers can confirm task completion), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention quality attributes like availability, performance, security, usability, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall provide limited but necessary operations for workers.
AI_Rationale: Specifies the system shall provide operations (functional). The phrase 'limited' for 'workers' implies role-based access/authorization constraints, so security is relevant. No explicit performance, availability, usability, or other quality attributes mentioned.

RequirementText: Workers shall be able to mark tasks as completed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (workers can mark tasks completed), which is a functional behavior. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: Workers shall be able to view rewards.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a system capability (workers can view rewards), which is a functional requirement. No non-functional qualities (security, performance, usability, etc.) are explicitly stated.

RequirementText: Workers shall be able to search for tasks.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability (workers can search for tasks). No quality constraints (performance, security, usability, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: Workers shall be able to change their passwords.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user-facing capability (functional). It directly concerns password management, which is a security-related requirement (authentication/credential handling). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall provide a basic help guide to aid in usability.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies that the system shall provide a help guide (a functional behavior) and explicitly states its purpose is to aid usability. It does not mention availability, security, performance, scalability, portability, maintainability, operability, legal, look-and-feel, or fault tolerance.

RequirementText: Managers shall have the ability to reset passwords.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a capability (managers can reset passwords) so it's a functional requirement. It also pertains to authentication/authorization operations (who may reset passwords), which is a security-related constraint, so SE is set. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, portability, legal, UI, maintainability, or operability requirements are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall perform basic operations in less than 2 seconds.
AI_Rationale: This is a timing/performance constraint on response time (performance). It does not mention availability, usability, scalability, or other qualities.

RequirementText: It shall be compatible with Windows 8 and Mac X operating systems.
AI_Rationale: Specifies required compatibility with specific operating systems, which is a portability requirement. Does not mention availability, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Communication between the Java application and the SQL database shall be established.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies required functionality—establishing communication between a Java application and an SQL database. It does not specify availability, security, performance, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The SQL database must have scalable capacity.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates scalable capacity for the SQL database, which is a scalability concern. It does not specify functional behavior or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User account names shall be associated with passwords chosen by the user.
AI_Rationale: Specifies that user account names must be associated with user-chosen passwords (functional behavior) and implies an authentication/security requirement regarding credentials, so both Functional and Security apply.

RequirementText: Manager passwords shall be linked to a secret question for password reset.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system behavior (link manager passwords to a secret question) and concerns authentication/password reset security; primarily a security requirement.

RequirementText: Worker password reset shall be managed by the manager.
AI_Rationale: Specifies who is authorized to perform password resets — an access control/security requirement. Does not state availability, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: Lockout mechanisms shall be implemented for repeated incorrect password entries (3 times).
AI_Rationale: Specifies implementing a lockout mechanism after three incorrect password attempts — this is a security control (SE) and also describes a functional behavior (F). No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other NFRs mentioned.

RequirementText: The system interfaces will be user-friendly, requiring no training for operation.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly concerns user-friendliness and requirement of no training, which is a usability requirement. No mention of other quality attributes.

RequirementText: Interfaces shall be easily navigable, clearly labeled, and accompanied by a help menu.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies navigability, clear labels, and a help menu—these are concerns of user interface appearance and usability. Thus Look & Feel and Usability apply. No availability, security, performance, etc., are implied.

RequirementText: The system code shall be written for future upgrades, documented, and fully commented.
AI_Rationale: Requirement concerns writing code for future upgrades, documenting, and commenting — practices aimed at ease of maintenance and future modification (maintainability). No explicit operational, performance, security, or UI constraints are mentioned.

RequirementText: Each method shall include a description of its function and additional information for future use.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates documentation for methods to aid future use, which directly relates to maintainability (ease of modification and understanding). It does not specify functional behavior, performance, security, availability, usability, or other non-functional categories.

RequirementText: The system shall be portable and operable on Windows 8 and Mac X operating systems.
AI_Rationale: Specifies supported operating systems (portability across platforms) and that the system must be operable on those OSs (operability). No other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: Compatibility with previous Windows versions will require further testing.
AI_Rationale: The statement refers to ensuring compatibility with previous Windows versions, which is a portability/compatibility concern across platforms/OS versions. It does not state functional behavior, performance, security, or other quality attributes explicitly.

RequirementText: User shall be able to initialize system parameters.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (initialize system parameters), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, operability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to store the initialized parameters.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a system capability (storing initialized parameters), which is functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, security, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to see the initial interface if no user is detected.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior: the system shall display the initial interface when no user is detected. It does not state availability, performance, security, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display the initial interface.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (the system shall display the initial interface). It does not mention availability, performance, look-and-feel details, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall be able to see an error message if the system is low on resources.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a user-visible capability (display an error message) which is a functional behavior. It also relates to usability since it concerns the user's ability to see/understand system state. It does not specify availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to check if system resources are below a threshold and display an error message if so.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies a system capability (check resource levels and display an error) — functional. It also describes an operational/monitoring behavior (detecting resource thresholds and notifying), which relates to operability. It does not specify performance, fault‑tolerance, security, usability, or other NFRs.

RequirementText: User shall be able to validate user credentials.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement (user action to validate credentials) and directly pertains to authentication, which is a security concern. No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: System shall be able to check if user credentials are valid and display an error message if invalid.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies an authentication behavior (checking credentials) which is functional (F) and directly relates to security (SE). It also specifies displaying an error message on invalid credentials, which concerns user feedback/usability (US). No explicit availability, performance, scalability, legal, portability, fault tolerance, look-and-feel, maintainability, or operability constraints are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to read serial number and device information.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (ability to read serial number and device information), which is a functional requirement. It does not specify availability, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to read device information and initiate the authorization process.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior: reading device information and initiating an authorization process (functional). Mention of authorization strongly implies a security concern (authentication/authorization), so Security is marked. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, usability, legal, or other non-functional aspects are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to log the serial number.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (ability to log the serial number), which is a functional behavior. It does not mention availability, performance, security, UI/look-and-feel, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to log the serial number and update the log file.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying system behavior (logging serial numbers and updating a log file). No explicit non-functional constraints such as performance, security, availability, etc., are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to initiate user password verification.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (functional). Involves password verification, which pertains to authentication/security concerns, so labeled as Security as well.

RequirementText: System shall be able to verify the password with the central system and accept or reject authorization.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (verify password and accept/reject authorization) and involves authentication, which is a security concern. It also implies interfacing with a central system (operability/interop). No explicit performance, availability, or other qualities are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to handle different negative responses from the central system.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies handling of negative responses (error conditions) from a central system, which pertains to fault tolerance/resilience and graceful error handling. It does not specify availability, performance, security, usability, or other non-functional categories, nor a functional feature beyond error handling, so only FT is marked.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display relevant error messages and take corrective action.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies concrete system behaviors: displaying error messages and taking corrective action (functional). The corrective action implies resilience/recovery behavior, matching fault tolerance. Other quality aspects (usability, operability) are not explicitly required.

RequirementText: User shall be able to finish the authorization process if successful.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user capability (to complete the authorization process) which is a functional behavior. It does not state non-functional qualities such as performance, security, availability, or usability.

RequirementText: System shall be able to complete the authorization process and start the transaction dialog.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies that the system must complete authorization and initiate a transaction dialog, which is functional behavior (F). Because it explicitly refers to authorization (an access control/security activity), it also implies a security concern (SE). It does not state availability, performance, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to keep the device if multiple incorrect attempts are made.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a behavior the system must provide (user can keep the device despite multiple incorrect attempts) — functional. It also concerns handling of incorrect attempts which relates to security policy (e.g., lockout/wipe behavior), so Security is applicable. Other quality attributes are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display an error message and take corrective action if multiple incorrect attempts are made.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies system behavior (display error message and take corrective action) — functional. It also implies a security control (handling multiple incorrect attempts, e.g., lockout or throttling) — security. No explicit availability, performance, usability, or other quality concerns mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to offer withdrawal transactions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (ability to offer withdrawal transactions), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to check if the withdrawal amount is within transaction limits and display the amount to be dispensed.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies system behavior (checking withdrawal limits and displaying amount), which is a functional requirement. It does not state availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to handle the initial withdrawal sequence.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (ability to handle the initial withdrawal sequence), which describes system behavior/functionality. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to check if the withdrawal amount is within predefined policy and start or re-initiate the transaction dialog.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a functional behavior: validating a withdrawal amount against a policy and initiating/re-initiating a transaction dialog. It does not specify quality attributes such as performance, security, availability, usability, or others, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall be able to perform the transaction.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional capability: allowing a user to perform a transaction. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to send a request to the central system, wait for a response, and perform the transaction accordingly.
AI_Rationale: Describes functional behavior: sending a request, waiting for a response, and performing a transaction. No explicit quality attributes (availability, fault tolerance, security, performance, etc.) are stated, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: User shall be able to dispense money if the transaction is successful.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a user-facing capability (dispense money upon successful transaction), which is a functional behaviour. No non-functional constraints (security, availability, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall be able to print a receipt, update system parameters, and dispense money upon a successful transaction.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes specific system behaviors (print receipt, update parameters, dispense money) which are functional requirements. It does not mention availability, security, performance, usability, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: User shall be able to collect and log the dispensed amount.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability to collect and log dispensed amount, which is a functional requirement describing system behavior (no quality attributes or constraints mentioned).

RequirementText: System shall be able to log the dispensed amount against device information and send a response to the central system.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies functional behavior: logging dispensed amount with device info and sending a response to a central system (functional requirement). It also implies operational capability to communicate with the central system (operability). No explicit constraints about availability, performance, security, portability, scalability, look-and-feel, or maintainability are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to display an error message if the transaction is unsuccessful.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a functional behavior (display an error message on unsuccessful transaction). It does not specify quality attributes such as availability, security, usability, or look-and-feel.

RequirementText: System shall be able to display an error message and eject the device if the transaction is unsuccessful.
AI_Rationale: Specifies system behavior on unsuccessful transactions (display error and eject device) — primarily a functional requirement. The eject-on-failure behavior implies a fault-handling/recovery mechanism, so Fault Tolerance is also marked. Other quality attributes are not explicitly implied.

RequirementText: User shall be able to verify the validity of the user account.
AI_Rationale: The statement describes a user-facing capability (ability to verify an account), which is a functional requirement. It does not explicitly specify security controls, availability, usability, or other quality attributes, so only Functional is marked.

RequirementText: System shall be able to check if the user account is valid.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement specifying a capability (checking whether a user account is valid). It does not explicitly state security, performance, availability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to handle invalid user accounts.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies a user-facing capability ('User shall be able to handle invalid user accounts'), which describes a functional behavior. It does not explicitly mention availability, security, performance, operability, or other quality attributes, so no additional NFR labels are set.

RequirementText: System shall be able to send a message "invalid user account" to the central system for an invalid user account.
AI_Rationale: The statement specifies a functional behavior (the system shall send a specific message to the central system). It does not mention availability, security, operability, portability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to validate the user password.
AI_Rationale: This is a functional requirement describing an action the system must perform (validate user password). It also directly relates to authentication/security, so Security is applicable. No other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: System shall be able to check the entered password and send a message indicating its validity.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (password validation and messaging). It also implies user feedback (usability). It does not explicitly state security, performance, availability, or other quality constraints.

RequirementText: User shall be able to handle invalid passwords.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies behavior for handling invalid passwords, which describes a system function (how authentication errors are managed) and pertains to security (authentication/error handling related to passwords). It does not explicitly mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to send a message "invalid password" to the central system for an invalid password and update the count for invalid password attempts.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies concrete system behavior (send 'invalid password' message and update invalid-attempt count). This is a functional requirement; it does not explicitly state availability, security, performance, or other non-functional concerns.

RequirementText: User shall be able to check for account-related issues.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a user capability (ability to check account-related issues), which is functional. No explicit quality/constraint (performance, security, usability, etc.) is mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall be able to process account-related issues and send a message "account issues" to the central system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability (processing account-related issues and sending a specific message to a central system), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state qualities such as availability, performance, security, operability, or others, so no other non-functional labels are set.

RequirementText: User shall be able to confirm successful user authorization.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a user-facing capability (the system shall allow the user to confirm successful authorization), which is a functional behavior. It does not specify availability, security controls, usability metrics, or other non-functional aspects.

RequirementText: System shall be able to process the authorization message and send "authorization successful" to the central system.
AI_Rationale: This requirement describes a specific system behavior: processing an authorization message and sending an "authorization successful" response to the central system. It specifies functional behavior rather than non-functional qualities (no availability, performance, security, scalability, etc. constraints are stated).

RequirementText: User shall be able to process transaction requests.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a functional capability: the user can process transaction requests. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, scalability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: System shall be able to process transaction requests on a device and send a message indicating the success or failure of the transaction.
AI_Rationale: Specifies functional behavior: processing transaction requests and sending success/failure messages. No explicit non-functional constraints (performance, availability, security, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: User shall be able to update the device status after action completion.
AI_Rationale: This statement specifies a user capability (updating device status after completing an action), which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: System shall be able to update the device status in the central system after action completion.
AI_Rationale: This is primarily a functional requirement (system must update device status). It also implies operability/integration with a central system (similar to example labeled O). No explicit constraints about performance, availability, security, or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: User shall be able to enforce transaction limits.
AI_Rationale: This specifies a user capability (enforce transaction limits), which is a functional requirement. No explicit non-functional qualities (availability, security, performance, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: System shall be able to check if the transaction amount adheres to predefined limits and fail the transaction if the amount exceeds the limit.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system behavior: validating transaction amounts against predefined limits and failing transactions that exceed them, which is a functional requirement. It does not mention availability, performance, security, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: User shall be able to ensure security for the central system and its software.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns security of the central system/software (security non-functional). It also states a user capability ('shall be able to ensure') which is a functional requirement for providing that security-related functionality.

RequirementText: System shall be able to implement robust security measures for the central system and associated software to ensure security.
AI_Rationale: Explicitly concerns implementing robust security measures for system and software, which maps directly to Security (SE). No other quality attributes or functional behavior are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall be able to function in extreme temperatures to ensure reliability in adverse environmental conditions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies environmental robustness and continued operation in extreme temperatures—this is about operational capability (operability) and resilience to adverse conditions (fault tolerance). It does not specify availability metrics, performance, or other qualities.

RequirementText: The system shall provide uninterrupted and stable connections between devices for consistent performance.
AI_Rationale: Requirement emphasizes uninterrupted, stable connections (availability) and resilience to disruptions (fault tolerance); it also ties to consistent performance (performance/throughput/latency). No functional behavior, security, usability, or other concerns are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall support a high data transfer rate to facilitate real-time communication and quick response to user commands.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies high data transfer rate, real-time communication and quick responses — these are performance concerns (throughput/latency). It also implies the system must handle increased load to maintain high transfer rates, so scalability is relevant. No functional behavior or other quality attributes are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure physically secure storage by placing it in a locked cabinet to prevent unauthorized access.
AI_Rationale: Specifies prevention of unauthorized access via physical security (locked cabinet). This is a security requirement (physical access control); no functional behavior or other quality attributes are explicitly required.

RequirementText: The system shall implement anti-theft measures, such as bolting it to the floor, to prevent unauthorized removal.
AI_Rationale: Specifies physical anti-theft measures to prevent unauthorized removal; this is a security requirement (physical security). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall provide emergency communication options, including an emergency phone inside and outside the cabin.
AI_Rationale: Specifies a system capability (providing emergency communication options/phones). No explicit non-functional constraints (availability, security, usability, etc.) are stated.

RequirementText: The system shall implement access control measures, such as secure validation methods on the cabin door.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly specifies access control and secure validation methods for the cabin door, which are security-related concerns (authentication/authorization). No other quality attributes (availability, performance, UI, etc.) are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure user authentication, allowing access only through valid and secure validation processes.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies enforcing user authentication and secure validation processes, which is a security constraint (authentication/authorization). It does not state functional behavior beyond access control details nor mention availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure secure placement to prevent unauthorized access.
AI_Rationale: Requirement mandates preventing unauthorized access (security control). It describes a protection constraint rather than operational qualities; similar examples combine functional access control with security, so F is included as it specifies a system behavior to enforce access restrictions.

RequirementText: The system shall implement measures to prevent unauthorized physical or digital access.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly concerns preventing unauthorized physical or digital access, which maps directly to security (confidentiality/integrity/access control). No other quality attributes are implied.

RequirementText: The system shall provide emergency communication options for residents both inside and outside the home.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies a system capability: providing emergency communication options for residents in different locations (inside and outside the home), which is a functional behavior. It does not explicitly state availability, security, usability, scalability, or other quality attributes, so no other labels are set.

RequirementText: The system shall implement stringent access controls, possibly using biometric authentication or secure access codes.
AI_Rationale: The requirement specifies access controls and authentication mechanisms (biometric, secure codes), which are clearly security concerns (authentication/authorization). No availability, performance, usability, or other quality attributes are mentioned.

RequirementText: The system shall enforce robust user authentication, allowing access only through verified and authorized methods.
AI_Rationale: Requirement specifies enforcement behavior (authentication/access control) — a functional behavior — and explicitly concerns security (authentication/authorization). No mention of availability, performance, etc.

RequirementText: The system shall ensure continuous availability, allowing users to control and monitor devices 24/7 without interruptions.
AI_Rationale: Requirement explicitly mandates continuous 24/7 availability (A). The phrase 'without interruptions' and continuous control/monitoring strongly implies resilience and mechanisms to tolerate faults to maintain availability, so FT is also marked. No functional details or other quality attributes are specified.

RequirementText: The system shall maximize security measures to prevent unauthorized network access and ensure the integrity and privacy of user data.
AI_Rationale: The requirement explicitly focuses on preventing unauthorized network access and ensuring integrity and privacy of user data, which are classic security concerns (authentication, authorization, confidentiality, integrity). It does not specify functional behavior, availability, performance, or other quality attributes.

RequirementText: The system shall restrict access to maintainers only for connecting new devices to the network, ensuring controlled and authorized system expansions.
AI_Rationale: This requirement specifies access control (only maintainers may connect new devices), which is both a security requirement (authorization) and a functional behavior the system must enforce. No explicit availability, performance, scalability, or other qualities are stated.
